Souvla has basically one of the best salads around. Sandwiches and sides are good, too, but the salad is noteworthy for its ability to fill you up and not make you feel like you are just trying to eat healthy.

The worst lamb in the Bay Area.  The lamb is not flavored properly and cooked poorly.  This is a shame for a signature protein in the Mediterranean diet.  For those that think otherwise, continue to patronize an overpriced, cafeteria style establishment that prides itself on long lines for no reason.

I like the pork salad a lot. If I get it for lunch, I usually have enough to eat some of the leftovers in the late afternoon. I just wish it weren't so expensive, about $15 w/ tax, before tip. The frozen yogurt is very good.

Chicken Sandwich, Greek Style (fries inside)  I was very underwhelmed. It just seemed lacking in flavor.  It was 85% shredded mushy chicken, 15% garnish.  If they cut a third of the meat back and added more pickled onion and greens, and some sort of sauce, maybe with some feta,  it would make a big impact.  The chicken sandwich is just too much bland mushy white meat chicken.  I regret not getting hot sauce, it would have helped, but I wanted to try the sandwich the way it was designed before making my own additions.

Fries and chicken salad were okay. I expected crispy rotisserie chicken but it was shredded. Good flavorful shredded chicken but I prefer crispy rotisserie chicken. The Greek yogurt tastes like the tart yogurt from those frozen yogurt places.

Love their veggie salad and Greek yogurt! Extremely filling and tasty, even if shared amongst two people. The tartness of the Greek yogurt really gets your appetite going. I call their fries, salad, and frozen yogurt combo the holy trinity for good reason.
The food is just average! Not worth the trip. Price wise it is on the high end! I can get better food with this kind of price at other places. Do not recommend unless you want to waste your money.
Salted Greek yogurt with honey, I could eat a ton!!! Sinfully delightful. I think Souvla sprinkles some kind of magic flavor in their yogurt. Seriously. Thumbs up!
My kinda set up. Fast, fresh, gourmet, casual, consistent....BOMB FOOD and lovely atmosphere

I got the chicken wrap and my friend got the pork salad. The food quality is great but my wrap had too much meat and not a lot of anything else - therefore, the flavor profile isn't great. Their greek fries with the garlic dip was amazing, however. Their baklava soft serve was also a very delicious treat.

I used to love love souvla but just ordered some take out from here yesterday- fries and the pork sandwich and it was very disappointing. The pork was all fatty and had no flavor and this made the entire sandwich tasteless and I lost my appetite. I hope this was a one off experience because I have been a fan of Souvla ever since I moved to SF..
literally the best place in the mission for a quick salad. also, tell them you want it Greek style. ;) you can order it online, and pickup in like 10 mins. great prices, great food.

This restaurant is OK but they just lost our future business. We took our salads out to eat outside. I felt that the salad was underdressed so I asked my 18 year old daughter to go back and ask for extra dressing. The woman who worked there said "normally we charge for this... So just remember for next time." It's a little absurd and I feel that she was abusing the fact that my daughter looks young and is not an adult. I don't know why they would charge for their salad to have enough salad dressing on it.

Everything in the chicken salad was good except the chicken. The chicken was really dry. The contents of the pork sandwich was good except the pita was dry and fell apart after one bit. Greek pita should be fluffy and hold together.
I had chicken salad-simply delicious! It will make you just happy! I had frozen yogurt with baklava crumbs -love it! I like their simple menu and service too!
Excellent, simple menu and fast service. Chicken salad and frozen yogurt is my go to!

Everything about the lamb sandwich I got was bad; so bad that after the first bit I considered throwing away a 15$ sandwich and buying food somewhere else. I didn't so I can now tell you exactly why not to eat there. The lamb was super salty, the pitta bread was dry and the veggies did not go well with the meet so every bite felt dry and bland. I have been to Greece a couple of times and this tasted nothing like the great food there

Meh. I had heard great things, but wasn't impressed. Pork sandwich was dry as a bone and extra sauce is $1. Fries were crispy, but again, not enough seasoning. Could barely taste the harissa in the harissa dip. Ingredients all sounded good, but flavors weren't developed enough. Frozen yogurt with baklava was good. Staff was unwelcoming and gruff. Don't think I'll make a trip back.

The food is great. The serving ware is cute and the atmosphere is nice and light. The Greeks sodas are pretty fun too. Sometimes it's a little hard to eat the sandwich like a sandwich but the flavors are worth it.

While I love the food, the dining experience has been very poor. We arrived at 11:30 for lunch on a Monday and waited 40 mins for our food. They were so backed up with massive online orders that everyone in the restaurant had to wait forever. The staff seemed much more concerned about the 10 caviar drivers in the front. When our food finally Arrived it was luke warm. Very disappointed!
BIG fan. LOVE this place. Chicken salad junkie. Fries are delicious and Yogurt with olive oil and salt is the best.

Got the veg salad. Loved the sweet potatoes in it! The other ingredients were also really yummy and fresh. The actual restaurant is really cute and bright; I love the interior! The staff is also friendly. Only 4 stars because I haven't had enough on the menu to be a good enough judge of the place. I definitely see myself coming back though. Wholesome, healthy, great!!
We visited Souvla in San Francisco for take out. The food is excellent, fresh and fast! A great way to enjoy delicious, healthy Mediterranean food.

Food is extremely bland. With all the ingredients they add you'd think it'd be more flavorful. We had the lamb sandwich and chicken salad and both were disappointing. It's really sad too because this place has a lot of potential. Oh well, I guess I'll just wait until this one runs out of business and the next spot opens up...shouldn't be long.

I've eaten at Souvla's other locations many times, and love every single thing on the menu, so I was excited when they opened a location in the Mission since I'm in the area often. I finally tried the Valencia location last week, and was very disappointed. I ordered the pork salad and chicken sandwich for pickup through Souvla's website. I arrived before my order was ready, and actually saw my food coming out of the kitchen, so I was expecting a delicious fresh dinner. However, both items were cold. The sandwich didn't have that warm melt-in-your-mouth feeling that I love about their chicken sandwich, and the bread was not soft. The food wasn't *bad* but it just wasn't the high quality I'm used to from Souvla. I usually believe that Souvla's prices are justified, but with my experience at the Valencia location, my food definitely wasn't worth the price I paid. I was expecting to become a regular at this location, but I don't think I'll be coming back.
Greek fries? Taste like regular fries with some cheese to garnish. The lamb wasn't good. Dry taste boring. If your gonna charge 20 bucks for a sandwich and fries make the shit good

After reading the other Yelp reviews, I decided to try Souvla's frozen yogurt for dessert, and it was worth the hype, in my opinion. I had the frozen yogurt with baklava. The baklava itself was not very good--it just tasting very sweet and syrupy. However, the tartness of the yogurt was absolutely perfect, and I think it worked with the baklava's sweetness. If I visit the area again, I would probably go back and try the other frozen yogurt flavors!
solid food. came during lunch on a sunday and it was pretty busy. modern decor. good staff. would definitely come back. the veggie sandwich was really good

Tried a the lamb on a salad and the garlic french fries - both yummy! Also shared a half pitcher of the rose with a friend, which we enjoyed. This is a casual and busy dinner spot. The fro yo is plain flavor and then you can choose one of the toppings. I enjoyed the wildflower honey and my friend liked the olive oil sea salt. Will be back!
They charged us for fries on our takeout order and didn't include them. Also, lamb wasn't seasoned at all. Don't go here!

Souvla is awesome! I just enjoyed a fabulous lunch with a friend. The chicken salad is so fresh and delicious. The lamb sandwich was awesome - the meat is super tender. Definitely get the fries with the dipping sauces. Also the potatoes in rotisserie juices were super tasty. Totally stuffed, but still had to try the frozen Greek yogurt. Best I've had - very thick and creamy, loved the one topped with baklava and honey. Delish! Highly recommend Souvla!!!

delicious + fresh + huge portions = bang for your buck. the froyo is one of a kind. For the complainers out there, they take any and all modifications, so tell them to hold the mandarin oranges or order the lamb salad "set up" with chicken instead of lamb. i cannot recommend this place highly enough.

Excellent service and one of the best salads I've had in a long time. The turnaround was super fast too- I ordered and my salad appeared less than 5 minutes later. I had the chicken salad and it was excellent. I'd highly recommend this place! Eager to return and try their whole menu.

The food here is amazing. You can't go wrong with the chicken salad or sandwich. Both are surprisingly filling. The fries are also really good. The staff is very nice and make sure you try the dessert.

Nice clean environment. The menu is quite straight forward with options easily laid out. Tried salad and roasted potato in meat dripping. Salad came in a bowl with substantial portion. Flavorful and really enjoyable until the last bite. The roasted potato were alright, but I did not felt the meat dripping made significant impact to the taste.(it also cost quite bit) Will probably suggest to stay with just the salad. Worth trying the place out if you are still thinking about it.

明亮的地中海风格，清新的食物，冰凉的座椅，组合成一种奇妙的体验。进店先点单，选择猪/鸡/羊其中之一，搭配墨西哥卷饼/沙拉，简单方便。

- Superior Farms Lamb Leg Salad $15
羊奶酪，黄瓜，樱桃萝卜，豆苗，罗马生菜这几样常见配料口感脆爽，融合巧妙。但是有一个不知名的深绿色菜叶实在可怕，又老又硬，还占据了大部分地盘... 羊肉粒很柴，分量还大，瞬间拉低了对整份沙拉的印象。

- Frozen Greek Yogurt (Greek Sour Cherry Syrup) $5
超赞的酸奶，细腻浓稠。稍微点缀一些樱桃糖浆，清爽不甜腻。量大实惠，别错过~

If you're ever in San Fransisco, then you have to try this place!

I ordered the lamb salad which was filled with flavor. It was greaat!! 

Definitely coming back here next time!

Honestly I was pretty excited to try Souvla, but I was pretty disappointed. We ordered take out and they charge $0.25 per cutlery set so I would not recommend doing that. 

What we ordered:
- Frozen Greek Yogurt (Baklava Crumbles and Honey) [4/5] - $8 this was by far the best thing that we tried! The frozen greek yogurt was delicious, tart and a little sour. The baklava crumbles were really just a large piece at the top. I didn't really taste the honey but it was great none the less. 
- Lamb Salad [2/5] - $17 This was very disappointing. There was large amounts of kale, lettuce and very little dressing. What dressing was present, had no flavor and it was barely enough to coat the leaves. The lamb chunks were dry and a little unpleasant. It was entirely underwhelming.
- Greek Fries [2/5] $5 - The greek fries did not carry any special flavor like described in the menu and were essentially plain fries with no sauce. 

I am glad that I got the chance to try Souvla, however I would only return for the frozen greek yogurt.

Plant-based or oil-based?
I tried the plant-based lamb sandwich. Since I'm vegan I didn't get the harissa sauce or feta. I don't know if they made up for that by drenching the sandwich in oil or if they are generally heavy handed with the oil.
The plant-based lamb on the sandwich was pretty good though.

It was worth the hype for me! 

I've been wanting to try their frozen Greek yogurt, which was great, but I'd be back for the salad and wraps instead. I really enjoyed the lamb salad, it was perfectly balanced with different greens, radish, red onion, feta, and lamb and tasted very fresh. 

The frozen Green yogurt is like a tart soft serve. It's definitely a nice, light to end the meal. I really liked the baklava crumble and honey topping!

Service was also super quick! They have both indoor and outdoor dining options.

Somewhere on the 4/5 border since I love their yogurts and wine but I'm iffy on the sandwiches/salads as they're small and sometimes a bit overly oily though generally well-balanced.

Souvla is a must-visit spot in Hayes Valley, with amazing food and drinks that won't disappoint. The Greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles and syrup is a must-try! The baklava is super sweet with honey, and the yogurt is velvety, creamy, and unsweetened. The sweetness from the honey and baklava perfectly supplements the tanginess of the yogurt. It's big enough to share with a friend, and definitely worth the price.

The service is quick and attentive, and the staff is very nice and friendly. The Retsina is also great, though it's more of an acquired taste. This is the only place I can find it, so that's also fun. However, while the salads are fresh and packed with flavor, the sandwiches are a bit small and expensive, so I would suggest definitely eating in and getting the yogurt. The fun industrial aesthetic and outdoor seating area also make for a great ambiance.

The Greek frozen yogurt is SO REFRESHING, TARTY, AND DELICIOUS! Big enough to share with a friend :) the baklava crumbles are super sweet with honey! 

French fries with the Greek ranch "granch" was crispy and well seasoned. Must get the granch sauce! The soup was lemony and comforting - with chicken and rice. 
 
Such a fun location in Hayes - we sat outside and enjoyed the views! Servers were very attentive and quick.

Quick service, solid flavors.

Grabbed late lunch on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Ordered at the bar and then took our number outside. Barely waited 2 minutes before  we had our lamb salad, Greek fries and spicy harissa sauce. Also ordered a frozen Greek yogurt with baklava; it was a solid order.

The salad is large, fresh and well-dressed without being "soggy." The Greek fries were fresh and crisp and were complimented by the spicy harissa dip. The frozen yogurt was the perfect finish - sharp Greek yogurt topped with sweet baklava and a drizzle of honey!

Would definitely recommend.

Souvla will always hold a special place in my heart because this is where I met my partner for our first meal together 

However nostalgia can only get you so far 

I've had the pork salad before so I wanted to try the lamb wrap this time to switch it up and the results were less than desirable. The lamb was dry and stringy, with less filling than I had hoped, the salad would've been a better option so that was disappointing. My partner got the vegetable salad which was good, but the side of Greek fries really threw me off, they taste like bland fries you reheat in the freezer, there was no flavor. Plus it's an +1 up charge for ketchup, aioli, or whatever sauces you want, as if the small cone of $6 fries wasn't enough? Plus on a cold night they don't even offer hot water, just room temp water that you pour out of a spigot? 

This used to be a nice fun spot with affordable yummy Mediterranean food, but I think I'll have to pass in the meantime

The menu is simple yet delicious. The lamb and chicken are both great options to add to your salad or sandwich/ wrap. The salads are fresh, creative, and packed with flavor. The chicken salad with romaine, kale, and pickled red onions is my favorite, but the Veg Salad is also a must-try. It's roasted to perfection with a sweet and tangy dressing. I always get the fries as well. 

Souvla's Greek yogurt and honey soft serve is a real treat. It's rich and creamy with a subtle sweetness that perfectly balances the tanginess of the yogurt. It's the perfect way to end a meal.

Service is quick and efficient, and I like the convienience of ordering first then sitting down. Price is a little high for salads but is reasonable for the amazing quality of the food.

Highly recommend giving it a try!

Had a chance to try the famous Souvla and so glad I did! We ended up dropping by here for a late lunch, and after hearing that it was a nice healthy spot yet yummy we were more than happy to do so. This place you end up ordering, getting a number and then someone giving the food which is awesome. We ended up getting:

* chicken wrap - this was delicious and had chicken, feta and these yummy tangerine things which was awesome. At first it was a little dry but as I kept eating the tangerine and sauce in it made it really juicy

* fries with a side of harissa sauce - this was delicious and crispy, I loved every bite fully

Overall the food is reasonable, good portions and for a healthy yummy meal this is a good spot to go to.

I was a bit underwhelmed with the lamb wrap, the portion was decent but there wasn't much flavor besides the lamb. The fries however were amazing and fluffy on the inside while being crisp on the outside, totally worth a side order.

Came to Souvla for a quick dessert fix! I've been dying to try their frozen yogurt for such a long time, and it absolutely met my expectations!! When you order at the counter, they make the yogurt right in front of you so you don't have to wait for it at all. 

Ordered the baklava crumbles and honey syrup frozen yogurt. It's a perfect size to share between two people! It was really creamy and was perfectly tart and not too sweet. The baklava with the syrup added the perfect amount of sweetness to counter the tartness from the yogurt. It was such a refreshing treat after having lunch, highly recommend stopping by just for the yogurt!

There's plenty of seating indoors, but there's also a little area to sit outside! Parking can be tough in the neighborhood, but don't let it stop you from getting a quick treat!

Chunks of lamb in the wrap sandwich ($16) are all i needed, then you add slices of radish, which don't taste like radish, but it added the crunch.  The sauce makes everything go down.  Thick pita bread that doesn't get incinerated or get mushy.  The wrap was expertly done, so nothing fell, and no mess was created while eating.  My order was fast (like 5 min) despite the long line.  Hunger pain is gone.  Even though i got it to go, i was given a number.  I ate at the nearby park even though plenty of sidewalk seats in front. They have a lemon chicken rice soup $7, got to try that next time.

I got the lamb wrap and it was just the thing before going out for a night of drinking. The lamb didn't have any gamey-ness to it. Paired with some fries it was perfect! Service was a bit slow and you had to ask for water because the station where you would normally grab water from was out. It's kind of crowded around dinner time so it's quite packed. Expect to wait for seats or take your order to go.

Fast casual healthy Greek spot. Came here for a late lunch after Muir Woods and we all got salads (living our best healthy lives). I got the chicken which came with some citrus, but I think for a heartier meal, you can opt for the pork salad. They have Greek yogurt as dessert (the syrup with sour cherry was a good one). They have self-service water at a table by the counter. 

Credit cards accepted. Indoor and outdoor dining available. It's good for big groups. You pay first at the counter and then receive a number. Casual ambulance.

I've been wanting to try this spot for a while but the location in Mission is always slammed when I see them and I'm never in the mood to wait for food... 

This is by far one of the best fast? Or quick dine in and take out restaurants I've been to! They specialize in pork surprisingly, which I wish I got with the salad but will get next time. 

The salad was a real show stopper. The vegetables are obviously so fresh, the radish and cucumber was so crispy, and the pickled onions were absolutely delicious. It's by far my new favorite restaurant salad. We got a side of fries because I love salad paired with fries = balance! And it did not disappoint. 

I need to go back to try their honey yogurt!!!

Perfect for order ahead and pick up, or order in - seating inside can be packed but if it's a beautiful day, they've got some great seating outside where you can enjoy something and read, watch, or just hang. Park one block away if you prefer!

Love their salads and French fries, and while you naysayers out there might think that a strange combination - do dis it till you try it!  YUM YUM YUM! Lots of veggies, some delightfully perfectly fried French fries when they are fresh (I order these upon arrival), and you can dine in style without cramping the wallet too badly!

I'm addicted to the Baklava Crumbles and Syrup Yogurt dessert! I keep wanting to come back just to get it! The only thing that hurts is how expensive it is.  I wish it wasn't so pricey! 

The first time I came, I tried one of the wraps. I thought it was really yummy and I'm really glad I tried it but I don't think I'd ever get it again because of the price.

I've had their Greek fries, chicken salad, and various frozen green yogurt. The fries were nice and hot and the granch had a good tanginess to it. I like a stronger flavor so I mix in their house hot sauce too. I also appreciated the mild spice and sour taste within the hot sauce. The salad was healthy and the best part were they added orange slices. The plain Greek yogurt is great on its own because it's just sweet enough. Any topping adds a lot more sweetness to it, so if you have a sweet tooth I would recommend the baklava flavor. But I do appreciate the sour notes that have been in everything I've tried here.

Had high expectations for Souvla as I've only heard good things about it, but mainly from my techie friends - as it turns out, there's kind of a souvla-cult among techies (just like the techie-cult for sweetgreen.) 

I ordered the chicken salad with a side of pita, totaling 20$. The veggies in the salad were fine but the chicken but was dry and overlap bland and not very enjoyable to eat. I tried stuffing it in the pita but even the pita was dry and bland - maybe I should've ordered a sauce to make it better? There's a decent amount of seating inside and in their parklets and the food does come out quick, but I can't justify the price for what it is.

The soup was alright but the chicken salad and greek fries were so good! Service wad nice and the ambiance was great. We to go our food and eat at the beach. Well packed and we saw most of Californians bring souvla bag with them haha

This is "Greek" food for Americans. 

I have been here a number if times and each time i regret it; then i dont come back for a long time and then somehow it sounds appealing and i order it again and i feel the same way. Vicious cycle.

Im vegetarian so my review could affect my score. On the other hand there are plenty of non vegetarian places that i love to eat at, so you decide. 

I like the salad - veggie version - but its sooooo salty. Its the olives. I love olives but this is intense salt. For many years I realized that the way i ordered the salad, affected the price - i always thought that was weird. Actually its one of their members that gVe me the secret on how to order it to save a couple bucks. Then i stopped going and i forgot the secret.

I have had the veggie lamb and I almost got sick. I think i have been vegetarian too long for it to pass but this is not the restaurants fault.

Recently, i had a veggie kebab thing and I remembered why its hard for vegetarian. Basically the sweet potato is thick and chuncky and DRY and they dont add enough sauce.. so i ordered two sides of sauces to be able to add to the sandwich. The sandwich has a good taste but the sweet potato makes it extra "much" to eat. I wish they could substitute it with something else like roasted eggplant which might be less dry. I think whoever made this sandwich up did not try it.  

Anyway i think everything is overpriced for what it is.. and the fries are not even good fries. It was toughly $20 for a veggie sandwich and side of fries.  

I used to like their yogurt/honey. I dont think that had changed. There is nothing about this place though that makes me super excited.

Disappointed since I saw so many good reviews but my food did not match the hype. Seeing how good the rotisserie chicken was cooking in the back, I decided to get the chicken salad... but wow the chicken was so dry. The salad was also dry and lacked dressing. The kale was too bitter, they probably did not prep it enough. The orange in the salad was also bitter and not fresh. So disappointed because it looked so good when they served it to me. Kind of a waste of my $17. 

Leaving 3 stars in because the servers were nice and welcoming, and the interior design was nice. I probably won't come back since I can get a better salad somewhere else.

Order at counter but still great service.   This was recommended by a Bay area resident and I would concur.   The interior is cozy and modern.

I had the chicken salad bowl.  Delicious with oranges, kale, radicchio and other greens.  

We split a side of fries with the harissa dipping sauce.  The sauce is not too spicy but I highly recommend this combo.

We also got frozen Greek yogurt with honey to go.  I would definitely recommend a honey drizzle as the frozen yogurt is authentic (so it's a bit tangy).

Definitely should go if you're in San Fran!

This Greekish restaurant has a very limited menu, particularly for vegetarians, but what we had was good. Our salad was huge--big enough for two if you are planning on having pita and/or fries and/or frozen Greek yogurt. 

The salad had a good balance of textures with salty olives, soft sweet potatoes, crunchy kale. Definitely order dipping sauce with the fries. The honey on the Greek yogurt was runny and just kinda pooled along the edge of the cup and dripped all over the place--probably could skip that or get another topping next time.

The inside ambiance was vibrant and bustling. There is also outdoor seating along a counter in a parklet where you can watch Uber drivers stop and go along Hayes.

The people working there were very busy and still kind and helpful.

Stopped here for a light dinner and was very pleasantly surprised w the quality and flavor of the salads. Typically not much of a salad person but heard a lot abt Souvla's food. We got the vegetarian salad w white sweet potato and the lamb salad. 

The sweet potato salad was delicious and the potato was soft and well cooked. There were a biiiit too many olives for my taste which made it a bit salty but I found the dressing and other toppings to be delicious. 

The lamb salad was also delicious and the harissa spiked yogurt dressing for the lamb was tasty. It was well cooked and flavorful! 

We also got our food really quickly which was nice! A good spot for Greek inspired food!

Love. We come to the city for haircuts and always try to eat something new to us. Souvla has been on the list for a while. We had the chicken salad, soup, and fries. The salad was SO good! Perfect amount of chicken and toppings. The shaved fennel and pickled onions made it even better. 

Can't wait to come back!

This is the salad I received today.
Clearly all vegetables color have changed
Not fresh at all
Not sure if it's even safe to eat..

Casual spot for greek food! We stopped for late lunch on a Saturday. You need to order at the cashier. They will give you a number and bring the food to you. The service was fast and friendly. Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seatings. 

We tried the pork salad and the fries. Both were fresh and delicious. A huge shoutout to the frozen greek yogurt! I loved it! I see many people come in just for the yogurt. So stop by for at least the yogurt if you are in the area!

I was expecting a lot more honestly, especially since the chicken on the rotisserie looked really good and the pictures on yelp looked great. 

Here's what could've been improved:
- Allow for half n half meat; like its technically not impossible yall. Just charge more for it. 
- Leave the chicken skin on. Idk why ordering rotierrie chicken meant not having the best part which is the skin. Thats where most of the flavor comes from. What are yall doing with the leftover skin? Throwing it in the trash? Cause I did not see it on the menu. 
- The hot sauce is not hot at all. It was very very mild. I really wanted to kick it up a notch but nothing was happening. 
- Go lighter on the dressing. Way too much dressing on the salad, no kale was left undressed. 
- Add some tomatoes and/or olives to balance out the salad. 

Maybe if the price wasn't so high, I'd go easier but it honestly tasted like a chicken salad I could get from trader joes or something (and I love TJ but they don't charge $18 for a salad yaknow?). For the price point, there's so much better places to spend money. I really wanted to like this place and was looking forward to some healthy affair but I don't get the hype.

Recommended by a friend, I tried their frozen greek yogurt with greek olive oil and flaky sea salt & I LOVED it! But I have to say, it's not for everyone because my friend who was with me tried it too and hated it because it's not the usual greek yogurt she expects. 

The texture is thick, creamy and rich which is very satisfying as a mid day snack or as a refreshing dessert. The yogurt itself is not too sweet, tart and with the olive oil, it's something new to my palette but I like this combo a lot! Definitely a new and unique experience! I recommend trying a bite as is first with the olive oil drizzled on top of the yogurt, and then mix it and try another bite! 

If you are more of a sweet tooth and want something more sweet and "safe", then definitely get the yogurt with Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup which is equally delicious :)

A great stop before or after Alma Square, I've subtracted one star because of the value aspect given the price.

Don't sleep on the Greek yogurt soft serve!

Taste: 5/5
Touch: 4/5
Smell: 5/5
Sound: ?/?
Sight: 5/5

Very easy to order on their website and pick up. 

4.5/5 food experience 
Lamb sandwich was flavorful and well balanced with the cucumber and radish. The meat was somewhat dry but the red spicy sauce was nice and helped. Soft pita was great

Roasted potato sandwich was also flavorful and satiating. Potato was filling but could have had some more sauce as well 

A few short steps to Patricia's green park to sit and enjoy the outdoors!

I've been a fan of Souvla's frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles since I tried it months ago. 

Docking a star since I went back recently and discovered Souvla has raised the price of their dessert by 33%! It's a bit hard to justify buying this treat at $8 + tax when Salt and Straw is just around the corner.

I've honestly never dined in at a Souvla, after all these years and multiple locations. I always get it delivered or to go. I will say that the Lamb pita is my favorite with the juicy potatoes (dip them in Granch). 
The Avgolemono soup is to die for and a great soup on chillier days (today happens to be a scorcher in the city so no soup for me ). 
Today was the first time I've ever seen a whole Rotisserie Chicken on the menu so I of course had to order it. Oh. My.God. It's amazing! So juicy and flavorful and maybe just became my number one rotisserie chicken beating out RT Rotisserie. Apparently they only have them until they sell out, but if you see them- don't hesitate and just get one! 
Highly recommend if you are near one of their many locations. 

Oh and the baklava frozen yogurt is a must,too!

This is one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite or takeaway in the area when I'm too lazy to cook. Famous chain that's present in many SF districts, but this is the one I've been to the most since I live nearby. Great options for pita sandwiches or salad bowls, and the ability to make minor adjustments to your liking - I always get the sweet potato or plant-based Black Forest lamb salad bowl with olive oil dressing! You can either order in person at the counter or online through all the various food delivery service apps, and food will be prepared very quickly. This can be a disadvantage though, if you're pre-ordering and picking it up because food can get cold and if you order the fries, which I also recommend, they can get pretty soggy. 

They have a few tables indoors and outdoors. For sure, get the fries to share if you eat there and you can make it a cute date by getting some Greek wine. I've had their frozen yogurt in the past, which I loved, but haven't had recently to avoid dairy. If you like the taste of Greek yogurt, definitely get that for dessert - I loved their olive oil and sea salt flavors but you really can't go wrong with any of them! I just wish they had some more dairy free options throughout the menu, I feel like i always make a lot of modifications to avoid (most of) it and think I'm missing out on some key flavor.

Came here for the yogurt and it is good!

Ordered apple crumble yogurt
- very good flavor
- light and fresh

Would want to come back and try their actual food menu

A ton of people recommended Souvla to me, and I was really excited because one of the best things to ever grace my tastebuds was a Greek yogurt I tried in Corfu.

While the actual yogurt at Souvla tastes pretty good, the sea salt wasn't distributed well at all, so some bites were super salty. The olive oil had a similar issue, so by my last few spoonfuls, it felt a bit like I was enduring a simultaneously salty and bitter dessert? I definitely wish I'd tried a different flavor instead.

Dined: August 5, 2022

Been here twice for lunch and ordered their black sheep lamb (plant based) gyro and lamb salad. 

The plant based lamb tastes just like real lamb. So tender and flavorful. I'm not vegetarian by any means but I could totally eat this everyday. 

Ambiance is modern and hip. I can totally see why this is a popular lunch spot. Definitely need to come back and try their frozen Greek yogurt.

Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup - $8
* yogurt is velvety, creamy, and unsweetened 
* sweetness from honey and baklava supplements the tanginess of the yogurt perfectly 

9.5/10

How'd I end up here?
Truth be told, I walked in as a non-dining patron who needed to use a restroom. I asked the pizza place next door first and they were rude and denied me. So took the test next door and it was Souvla for the Good Samaritan award!

Beneath the need for a restroom lay an appetite that had been deprived by back to back morning meetings. So after a trip to the Gender Neutral restroom which was so fresh and so clean a la OutKast, I proceeded to the register to place my take out order.

What Did I Eat?
The Lamb Leg Sandwich aka gyro 5/5 
With everything on it, Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onion, Feta Cheese. 

I had another meeting coming up so without time at my leisure I had to take it to go, but upon opening this box I couldn't help but scarf down one half right away. It looks good, tastes even better!

Shout out to the good folks at Souvla! Great service, and great food. The menu is focused and well executed.

From what I could tell, they stay pretty busy during the afternoon but there is a decent amount of outdoor seating as well as some indoor. I observed that a salad and a side of fries was a common order amongst patrons and a good number of folks ordering just the frozen yogurt. I plan on coming back to try desert just that because honest look on folks faces after they took their first spoon full of it said it all. Gotta try it!

Thanks again Souvla, I don't rate 5 stars often, but you all are well deserved in my book!

Did you know you can customize a salad?  Got the "chicken salad" but with the roast pork and also sub'd out for olive oil dressing.  And the Greek fries!  You can order a full side order or get the salad "Greek Style" with fries on top.  Souvla has been consistent all these years.  Please open in the South Bay!

Finally tried souvla after years of being in the city - this place is worth every penny. I got the sweet potato vegetable salad and it was super yummy - I crave it often. We also ordered fries and they were very crispy, the flavor was okay but the texture was great. I was delighted by the service, they have a branch in dogpatch too which is very spacious and welcoming.
reviews.reviewerLocation: South of Market, San Francisco, CA

reviews.text:
I love Greek food and after seeing the good reviews for souvla I had to stop by and try it. 
I ordered the chicken sandwich (more of a wrap). It was really juicy oozing with olive oil and I love that they add orange slices to add some citrus freshness.
Overall all tho it was nothing to special. It was good but I expected more from seeing the chicken on the rotisserie.. 
I however will be returning and trying out their other food items (:

We came here for lunch recently, and the place is quite busy. We didn't have to wait for a table, but right after us, a line of about 10 parties built up. Just a heads up!

I got the chicken salad and honestly it was average. The dressing was a little too tart, with not enough creaminess in the salad itself to balance. The chicken was a tad dry and not super flavorful. The pickled veggies were very very strong, which again didn't balance well with the overall salad.

I also got pita on the side, and I would STRONGLY recommend to not. It came out soggy and wet, which was honestly kind of gross. 

My friend got the pork pita sandwich which was quite delicious! The flavors are much better balanced, and if I were to come back I would definitely get the sandwich.

We also got a wildflower honey frozen yogurt, and this was the winner. Rich and creamy, but with a nice tartness to balance the yogurt out. The honey solidified almost instantly so I don't think it added much. Will definitely be back for just a cup of the plain yogurt!

Came here with after yoga to grab a quick dinner. There was a line out the door but it moved quickly. 

I ordered a chicken salad, yogurt and a side of fries and it was ready in less than 10 minutes. 

Everything was good, I wish the chicken in the salad is less dry, I think it was a bit over cooked but overall I'd come back if I'm ever in the area!

I've come to terms that despite how much everyone else seems to love Souvla, to me, it's only okay.

Of the protein options, the chicken is my favorite, followed by pork, with the lamb being my least favorite. I just don't love the cubes of lamb - I wish the lamb was more like pulled lamb. 

The chicken salad is okay but I don't really like the combo of lettuce and kale as the base, and I always get the dressing on the side so I can douse parts of the salad with the yogurt to make it less dry. 

The pork sandwich was fine but nothing mindblowing, seems similar to other gyros I've had before. 

The avgolemono soup was surprisingly tasty, although I found it a bit oily.

The fries might be my favorite thing, nice and crispy on the outside.

Frozen yogurt isn't really my jam, it's very tart which I guess makes sense given it's greek yogurt but I'm not a fan of that tartness in froyo.

This place is as good and as popular as we remembered. Love souvla in the Hayes valley neighborhood. It's particularly amazing. Got here for a late night mid week drink/ froyo even other bars are closed. The pink green sparkling with olive oil sea salt combo is fantastic. And a love simple date place. Staff was super nice let us stay 5 minutes extra after closing (pre warned up too). Love it

What used to be the humble Greek hole-in-the-wall nestled in Hayes Valley is now a San Francisco titan, expanding into districts like Dogpatch and amassing long lines every lunch hour. Ask any San Franciscan what Souvla is, and they'll instantly salivate while telling you it might just be the best Greek fast food that ever existed.

I've ordered pretty much everything on the menu, and I can confirm that all the sandwiches are winners. Despite being a meatatarian through and through, I can attest that the veg option -a sandwich chock full of sweet potatoes, olives, and walnuts- is delightful and filling for a sandwich that's mostly carb. However, if you have no dietary restrictions, I'd definitely go with the lamb. Unlike typical lamb dishes, it lacks gaminess, but the smoky flavor is prominent and the meat is incredibly tender. Upon entry, your eyes feast on the sight of glowing rotisseries rotating colossal hunks of chicken, pork, and lamb. Truly, these rotisseries work like it's their 9 to 5 and rent is DUE, so it's no wonder why the meat comes out as succulent and mouthwatering as it does. 

While Souvla's meat dishes are their bread and butter, don't make the rookie mistake of missing out on dessert. My friends and I tried all of their frozen yogurt flavors, and I fell in love with each and every one of them - the yogurts that is. The yogurts are incredibly light, reminiscent of slightly sour Cool Whip. But, if you're not into tangy flavors in general, this might not be your thing. My friends found it too tart, but I thought it was the perfectly decadent way to end the meal. If you're in between flavors, cherry is definitely the way to go. 

One visit to Souvla and you'll understand their cult following. This place is worth every Lactaid in the world. It's been 10 hours, and I'm STILL thinking about that yogurt.

Average food in my opinion. Could have been because I ordered takeout and should've had my first time
experience in the restaurant. 

Got the pork "sandwich" which is really a wrap. It was quite dry and honestly did not have too much flavor. I ordered fries along with it expecting them to compliment well but they were soggy and cold.
Again, my opinion would've been changed perhaps if I ate in person - but most restaurants don't have such a drastic change between dine-in and take-out.

Woman working the counter was also rude. Shocked as she seemed nice, but I guess not! I asked if I could eat
my takeout inside when there were many empty tables and she rolled her eyes LOL. Not sure if I'd be back, kind of disappointing. The cooks were nice though! Had a small interaction with them :)

It was such a great idea to have lunch at Souvla on such a great day outside. When the weather is just right like this in Hayes street, Souvla's yummy and straight forward lunch menu and outdoor seating is a good option! Walk inside to order from the counter and you can get your choice of a protein as a sandwich, bowl, or salad. I got the chicken sandwich. What added to the refreshing flavor was I think an orange? It went really well with their Greek ice tea, which was sweetened with Yuzu. Yum! Definitely coming back for lunch more often.

I UNDERSTAND THE HYPE!!

At first glance, Souvla doesn't look like much so I was confused where all the hype comes from but it is soo good. I got the wrap with pork. The pork was tender and flavorful and the wrap was so balanced. It was simple but had layers of flavor.

The Greek yogurt with honey and baklava crumbles is a game changer! The yogurt was refreshing and tangy, which balanced out the sweet honey and the baklava crumbles added another texture. I've been dreaming about this since I've had it. 1000/10.

Pretty good casual spot for Greek food! 

Lamb sandwich (3.5/5): Thought it was pretty good - definitely not the best lamb sandwich ever, but gets the job done when you pair it with their hot sauce. I would still prefer a greasy lamb gyro at 2 in the morning over this, but Soulva is definitely a healthier alternative. 

Frozen Greek yogurt (5/5): SO yummy!! Got 2 frozen yogurts in the span of 4 hours - that's how much I loved it! Would 100% recommend coming here just for the frozen yogurt. I've tried the Baklava Cumbles & Honey Syrup and the Plain frozen greek yogurts and they're both bangers! 

All in all, Soulva is great spot for consistent Greek food & amazing frozen yogurt!

I was in the area and a few friends had recommended this place so my friend and I decided to stop by for dinner! We were here on a Wednesday early evening and there was a line, but it moved quickly and we were able to find seating indoors (they have indoor and outdoor seating). Menu is pretty straightforward, and our food came out pretty quickly. 

I ordered a chicken salad, my friend ordered the vegetarian sandwich, and we got a Greek fries to share. I was a little hesitant about eating salad for dinner especially since it was cold outside, but the salad was delightful and filling. The dressing was really nicely balanced, the chicken was flavorful and not dry, and the salad overall was not cold - it was room temperature, which sounds not fun to eat but it worked out better than I thought it would. 

The only downside is that I live SO FAR from Souvla!! Otherwise I'd come here more often. Highly recommend!!!

Now I don't usually eat healthy, but Souvla you are a masterpiece. The chicken wrap has so much flavors to excite your palate, from citrus to acidity everything was on point! I ordered a side of the fries with their garlic sauce and I loved the Mediterranean flavors from my meal. 

The one thing I was most excited for was the baklava dessert but was disappointed by the taste. The frozen yogurt is very very tart, and it does not pair too well with the baklava crumbs as it is super sweet. Some vanilla frozen yogurt would have been soooooo good with it. Nevertheless I'm so glad I got to experience this food here.

One of my go-to spots for a quick meal whenever I'm hanging out in Hayes Valley! I always say I'm not much of a salad girl because they never fill me up (hungry girl probs), but the salads here are always a decent portion. My usual order is the Lamb Salad and the Juicy Potatoes. The salad is nicely balanced with the pickled red onions and crunchy veggies along with chunks of lamb, and the potatoes (with rotisserie drippings!) always hit the spot. 

It's also worth stopping by just for the frozen Greek yogurt--it's delicious! Tart and tangy with several toppings options that nicely complement the yogurt. I've tried the baklava crumbles & honey syrup, Greek sour cherry syrup, and the Cretan wildflower honey. Cherry is my favorite! It's nice, light, and tart whereas the baklava one is a little too sweet for me and the honey tends to harden on the yogurt and get stuck in your teeth lol. 

I would order the salads more often if they weren't almost $20, but I'll always make a pit stop for the frozen Greek yogurt!

I LOVE SOUVLA! I wish I lived closer because I would go all the time. Stopped in and was finally able to see the back patio which is very cute. 

Had the fries with harissa side and also tried the frozen yogurt with olive oil and set salt for the first time. I'll definitely be coming back for the frozen yogurt (I already love the fries).
froyo lived up to the hype! it's a bit more tart than normal froyo and definitely does taste more like yogurt than ice cream. the baklava with the yogurt is a great combo so would recommend trying.

Got the lamb sandwich and I was surprised by the amount of meat they put in there, it was a good amount for the price, especially being in SF. Although the lamb was good, it does taste a bit bland  and lacking some spice/salt. Overall, I do wish for the sandwich to have more dressings. Will come back again to try their Greek yogurt next!

not bad for a healthy, light meal. was a little disappointed, the chicken wrap was kind of dry and the lamb in the salad was rather large bites. the mix of flavors was really unique and i liked that, but unfortunately the meat didn't live up to what i had expected. i got the baklava froyo & at first was surprised at how strong the greek yogurt is (almost kind of sour) but it grew on me. the froyo itself slightly reminded me of the plain tart flavor from yogurtland, it was pretty light & refreshing. the baklava topping was super good, perfect level of sweetness

Souvla is consistent, healthy and delicious. I've been obsessed with the chicken salad (Greek style) for nearly a year now and have to order it once a week at least. 

I love how all the ingredients are fresh and high quality and most important- it's actually filling and tasty! The chicken is also always tender and juicy, and if you've tried other salad spots you'll know this isn't always the case. 

The frozen yogurt is also so so tasty.. highly recommend the baklava frozen yogurt or honey.

Coming from a person that doesn't have the acquired taste for Greek food, this place is putting Greek food back on my radar. I've heard people rave about this place being a classic spot in Hayes valley so I had to try it. I came in on a slow day and feel like that gave me a better experience with the food quality! I ordered the Chicken Wrap and each ingredient I could taste tasted very fresh and homemade. The chicken itself was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right. I was a big fan of the mandarin orange inside although some reviews find that unconventional. The orange was very creative and brought all the flavors together to make the wrap taste more fresh. The pita bread was also a great addition Because it was still warm and moist. Each ingredient in this wrap did not go unnoticed and I enjoyed every component. The only disappointment was the price point. The wrap was 17 dollars which I think was steep because of the portion. Usually I'm left with leftovers from places with that price point but not a deal breaker because the food was delicious. I will be coming back to try that yogurt that everyone keeps talking about!!

Love this spot every time I come into Hayes Valley to check out the stores such as undefeated, souvla, or get a nice chicken Caesar from Paxtis.

Souvla is the way to go they make green Mediterranean food which is really awesome and healthy.

We order the chicken salad which came with navel oranges, dressing, kale, and onions I believe.

My girlfriend ordered the chicken wrap which comes with a pita bread wrap same ingredients in the chicken salad and also garlic fries

I stopped by Souvla, a stylish Greek-California fast casual restaurant. I had the lamb sandwich with Greek fries and yogurt sauce. The lamb sandwich was delicious, with tender meat and lots of fresh vegetables and flavorful sauces. 

My fries were fresh and delicious, and came topped with plenty of feta cheese. 

I finished with the honey baklava Greek frozen yogurt and it was delicious. The baklava was flaky and added a welcome contrast to the mild frozen yogurt. 

Seating at Souvla was comfortable and service was fast.

My first time trying this place! I ordered the lamb sandwich and lamb salad - while I thought the meat was good, I didn't find the meal particularly special. I preferred the salad over the sandwich (I liked how it was drenched in dressing lol) but the sandwich felt a little bland to me and needed a ton of hot sauce but even that was not very spicy haha.

 My favorite part of the order was definitely the frozen yogurt with baklava crumbs and honey. The yogurt was super tart (which I like) and it reminded me a lot of tart plain yogurt I get at a Vietnamese spot?? The baklava and honey were a nice sweet touch to balance out the flavors. Aside from trying out greek fries, I would probably only return for the yogurt

My boyfriend and I went for the first time for dinner on a weeknight just before a show. There was a line, but it moved fast and we were able to grab an indoor table no problem. Food came out fairly quickly considering the crowd, and service was standard I'd say (neither outstanding nor atrocious). Interior including the bathroom were clean. They also had a huge park-let outside with a ton of seating. 

I got the chicken salad which was honestly one of the best tasting salads I've ever had. Whatever they use for their dressing is bomb, and the quality of their ingredients is amazing. I would definitely order that salad again. My boyfriend ordered the pork sandwich, which I tried. Unfortunately, both of us found the pita to be chewy and tough, which was a major disappointment because I feel the pita can make or break the wrap/sandwich. If we hadn't been in a rush to get to our show, we definitely would have requested another pita because for the price point of the sandwich, the pita hands down should've been fresh and not over toasted. Again, really disappointed about the pita so one big star off for that. Despite the chewiness of the pita, the sandwich was flavorful though and the quality of the ingredients again very fresh. We also tried the fries with garlic sauce and would recommend. 

Overall, delicious, clean, and decent service. Willing to give them another shot with the pita, and next time definitely want to try their infamous frozen yogurt as well as other sauces/seasonings for their fries.

I'm very surprised that I never wrote a review for Souvla since this is my go-to healthy spot ! I'm a picky salad eater and the chicken salad here always makes me feel rejuvenated. The tangerine in the chicken salad refreshes the savoryness of the cheese and onions. The best part about finishing your salad is ordering their frozen yogurt for dessert. I recommend the wild honeycomb froyo if you're a honey fan. The fries are also great to eat as a side or a topping to your salad.

Heard a lot about this place especially since it's a SF staple, but Souvla was a bit underwhelming to me. I ordered the pork salad, which came out to almost $20 after tax and tip. The salad was fresh but tasted pretty unspectacular/standard. Not sure if I'd come again, especially considering the price :/

If you're ever in San Fransisco, then you have to try this place!

I ordered the chicken salad which was filled with flavor. They gave a generous portion of chicken and there were so many refreshing tastes in this one bowl. My favorite ingredient was the segmented oranges that added a kick of sweetness to the dish. 

After my meal, I wanted something sweet so I ordered their frozen greek yogurt and got the baklava crumbles & honey syrup flavor. It was so YUMMY. That sweetness coming from the baklava and honey really balanced out with the tartness of the greek yogurt. Highly recommend finishing your meal with this treat. Definitely coming back here next time!

Plain Frozen Yogurt $4 USD
Baklava Crumbles & honey syrup $6 USD
Cretan Wildflower Honey $5 USD

Souvla has the BEST frozen yogurt I have ever had in my life. The yogurt here was very creamy, smooth, refreshing and not too sweet.  My personal favorite was the plain one.  The baklava was their most popular flavor, the baklava topping was very generous.  The portion was quite big and was enough for two people ;). Highly recommended .

Souvla is a go to lunch place for me whenever I'm in a rush and need quick takeout for lunch. The chicken salad never disappoints me, coming from a person who isnt a huge fan of Mediterranean food nor salads. They areee pretty pricey for the portions it comes with though but with the restaurant being situated in hayes valley this wasnt surprising. Something that did surprise me was they charge 25 cents for utensils for togo orders. This seems a little unnecessary for an already marked up salad.

This is my go-to place for frozen yogurt in the city. I've only tried the baklava flavor, but it hits the spot every time. The yogurt is creamy and slightly tart, with a generous topping of baklava.  

I've also tried their chicken salad, which I found to be good but slightly overpriced. The fries are actually pretty good, especially when paired with the mint yogurt sauce. All in all, Souvla is a solid fast casual spot when you're looking for a quick but satisfying bite.

Super popular place to grab a salad, and I understand why. I got the chicken salad and it was delicious. Generous portion of chicken and there were many flavors in the salad. Opted for outdoor seating which was the move since it was a beautiful day in the city and was the perfect temperature. When walking past it a little while later there was a line out the door! Completely recommend, especially if people in your party are vegetation. :)

Was really craving Greek food today and Souvla hit the spot. The interior is cool and casual with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I was so surprised how fast the food came out. We ordered at the counter, grabbed a seat inside, and a couple minutes later we had our food. 

I went for the chicken sandwich and it was sooo filling. Chicken was tender, toppings were refreshing, and the "granch" dressing tasted great. Although the oranges in the sandwich were a little off for me. Could have gone without the side of fries for how big the wrap was but it was worth it. Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and went great with the harissa-spiked sauce. 

Of course I had to the try baklava and honey Greek yogurt since that's what everyone is talking about now. As with everything else, the yogurt was huuuge. Loved the crushed baklava topping with the honey syrup. The yogurt tasted exactly like traditional greek yogurt, and the baklava brought the needed sweetness. Next time I'll ask them to put on a little extra honey syrup on top. 

Could tell all their food was super fresh too. They started cooking their pork shoulder in the rotisserie in the restaurant. 

Only downside was the prices were a little steep. Spent upwards of $40 on the whole meal for myself. But I did leave stuffed and food tasted delicious. I'll stop by Souvla again some time soon. Eyeing the pork sandwich for next time.

Absolutely brutal prices for assembly-line food.

Fries, two beers, a salad and a sandwich came out to $63 including tax and tip. The salad was good but had pretty sparse bits of lamb, which is pretty insulting for the price. The fries were cold and soggy. 

Given that this restaurant's whole deal is the restricted menu, I find it bizarre that the food would come out cold.
When I passed this road, people were standing in line so finally I tried. Sandwiches are light and simple. My boy friend said it was just fine but personally, I like fresh and simple taste.
Amazing lamb, sandwich and fries. 2nd time back it's consistently fresh and tasty! Fast service, very clean.

I really really wanted to looove this place since it seems that everyone from my office does but it just didn't seem anything special to me. I got the chicken salad the first time and it was pretty difficult to finish, even as someone who usually loves salad. It honestly made my mouth hurt since the chicken was dry. I got the pork sandwich the second time and it was a pretty large portion and tasted pretty decent. The sandwich was packed with pork cubes and veggies. Maybe I just had higher expectations coming in but Souvla just did not hit the spot for my personally.

Chicken salad was not fresh at all... super sloppy with browning lettuce. They charge $1 for a TINY container of sauce for their fries, who serves fries without some sort of sauce? And the cashiers are usually grumpy. Oh, and they don't take large bank notes because they don't want to use their small change. I'm never going back. So done with this overrated shack

I only came here for the Greek frozen yogurt, but it was amazing. I had the plain yogurt with honey, and it was the perfect treat for a hot day. The shop is located next to the Hayes valley park so there's a lot of nice outdoor park benches/picnic tables, as well as plenty of indoor seating and patio seating. The yogurt itself is quite tart and is drizzled with honey, so it's so good for if you don't like your desserts overly sweet. If you like very sweet, you are probably better off with the baklava honey flavor! Street parking is quite difficult, but it's a nice neighborhood to walk around since there are many shops and cafes. I'll definitely return to try their other frozen yogurt flavors!!

Order your salad greek style (fries on top). You won't hear this in the history books but the salad + fries combination actually ended 7 wars and brought us into the Industrial Revolution because of how delicious it is.

I visited on a Saturday for lunch with a group of 6 and was lucky enough to get seating for all of us. It's self-seating. Every time I've visited here I've had to hover around to wait for table seats to open up. If you come by yourself or with one other then it's usually easy, anything more it's tougher.

I am into their salads and fries.
Unfortunately I'm not a fan of their meats though, and I say this after I tried almost everything on their menu.  Their yogurt is also super yummy, but I'm not into too much sweets these days. 

I am giving 4 stars because I feel that their food is very healthy.
Went here for lunch and had a great time! I got the veg salad and it was huge! It had a great dressing and seems like a great lunch option! Will be coming back here to try the frozen yogurts as well.
I loved how easy the website was to order my lunch! Food was great.

I just came to try their frozen greek yogurt and I was not disappointed. It's such an addicting dessert and it made me keep going back for more. It was a simple but delicious dessert, and I would definitely go back for it!

Especially surprised that I have yet to review Soulva! I now live in Hayes Valley pretty much down the street so it feels fitting to review it now. 

Been getting Soulva for years now. My sister first introduced me, her and her husband absolutely love it. 

Pretty much anything you get here is good. I particularly like the lamb (either salad or sandwich) but the pork is also good. Chicken can sometimes be dry. Never had the soft serve but it looks delicious. Think the only thing these folks are missing is some greek style meat fries -- basically what they have just served with a little extra dressing and meat on top. I've asked if they could serve the fries with meat before and they wouldn't, but can get a side of meat and fries separately. Only real reason I've thought about this is because Nick's in Redwood City where I used to live had some absolutely bangin' fully loaded Greek fries!

Try it if you haven't already!
came here for a greek yogurt and enjoyed it on the pRatio in the back :) perfect for the warm weather
Disappointed. Happy to see Souvla in Hayes, and dropped in for lunch. Bread came out cold and meat was barely heated through = soggy sad lunch.

Souvla is an SF-based chain offering Greek-inspired salads and pita sandwiches with a distinctively Californian spin. The newest addition to the short menu was the Black Sheep Plant-Based Lamb, made of soft, savory cubes of "lamb" with a distinctly gamey flavor. The salad was built on a base of Tuscan kale and romaine lettuce tossed in a harissa-spiked yogurt dressing along with cucumbers, radishes, pickled red onions, pea shoots, and crumbled feta cheese. Every bite of this salad was crunchy and flavorful, and the best part was definitely the chunks of lamb. I also tried the Mary's Free Range Chicken Salad, built on the same base of kale and romaine lettuce, but accompanied with Granch (Greek ranch) dressing and topped with fennel, orange wedges, pickled red onion, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese, along with shredded rotisserie chicken. Overall, everything here was fresh and delicious, and made for a healthy, casual meal.

I came here for dinner on a weekday around 6pm and it was pretty busy, but we managed to grab seats at the longer table in the center of the restaurant. We ordered a lamb salad for my fiancé, chicken on the side for me (it was really cool that they offered this since I don't really like salad or wraps), and a greek yogurt with baklava crumble. The chicken on the side was a much smaller portion than I was hoping, but I was surprised that it held so much flavor! I also wished the baklava crumble wasn't just sitting directly on top in a scoop because as I ate downwards, there wasn't any baklava towards the bottom half of the cup to complement the sourness of the greek yogurt. It was still my favorite part of our order though and I would still order it again!
Cute spot that had great Greek food. I ordered the chicken sandwich and got fries. I had also ordered garlic on the side, which never came. The food was overall delicious, however, pretty pricy.

Came by for a late lunch with my mom. There was a line but we were able to find seating. I ordered the pork sandwich and my mom the chicken salad. They are really great portions. We split the fries which weee very good. I wish the pork had had more seasoning, but the fresh ingredients in the wrap made up for it. My mom loved her salad. 

BUT THE MAIN EVENT WAS THE FROZEN GREEK YOGURT. I got the one with baklava and honey. Creamy and good and I can't even describe it. I'd come back for the yogurt alone.

Stopped in for a quick snack and tried their Greek fries. I like how simple and tasty the fries were. They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. We requested the fries in a takeout box for here and the cashier said it was okay. We tipped because we were eating at the restaurant. However, when the server brought us the fries, he said we couldn't eat them there since it's takeout. We told him we asked the cashier who said it was okay and he told us it's not allowed. It wasn't even a busy night because there were so many empty tables.

Got takeout on a Saturday night around 6pm. Ordered a lamb wrap with cheese on the side, Greek fries without cheese, and a frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup.

The lamb wrap was okay. I didn't think it was too special. The lamb was seasoned and tender. Veggies were fresh, but I wish they were more evenly dispersed. The sauce could have been more spread out too and had more or it because there were portions of the wrap that were a bit drier.

Fries kind of just tasted like garlic fries. They got a bit soggy on the ride home, but the fries were still pretty good. 

The frozen Greek yogurt was the best. I'm not typically a fan of Greek yogurt, but it was delicious. The baklava was really sweet, but it paired nicely with the tart yogurt. The baklava itself had a lot of spices, but it was on the soggy side, maybe because of the honey.

I would go straight for the frozen Greek yogurt the next time.

Mehhhh...

I went to the Souvla location on Valencia and absolutely loved it so decided to go to their Hayes location - not what I expected and not in a good way either. We got the lamb salad, lamb wrap, and soup. The soup was easily the best thing. Our lamb was extremely dry to a point where we couldn't even chew...it was like rubber for real. The salad had no flavor, the dressing was entirely bland. We had to drench the not so-hot sauce on the wrap to add some type of flavor. We definitely did get the scrapped ends of the dried lamb and left a foul taste in our mouth. I couldn't even finish my salad and left. Good food presentation though.

I'm always in the mood for Souvla! I often crave the baklava & honey froyo. If you haven't tried it, you need to!! Sometimes I get the froyo on its own if I'm near the area, but often times, I also get one of the salads. 

This time, I chose the pork salad. The portions are great and I can eat the salad for 1 1/2 meals. The salad has so much goodness and flavor in it. Definitely a must try in Sf!

Stunning. Perfect. Never misses from the food to the service to the vibe. 10,000/10.

Chicken sandwich can't be beat. Lamb and pork are great, too - they also have Black Sheep lamb substitute now that's really good!

Don't forget fries with garlic yogurt!

I came here just for the frozen yogurt and was not disappointed. The tart frozen yogurt goes great with the baklava and honey. I highly recommend their froyo, and if you want to share you can get half portions in two cups!

Healthy, aesthetic, high-quality food, and interesting fast-fine dining concept.

Yummy greek yogurt and wonderful salads! It is my newly favorite mediterranean food spot.

Nice little cafe with flawless visual concept and menu that fits in it. High level Greek fast food with vine section. I had there very tasty lamb sandwich, juicy and flavorful thanks to really fresh veggies and harissa yogurt. There was enough meat so I'd say that the price is reasonable. My husband tried veg sandwich and also was satisfied. 
I really like the atmosphere of this place. Coming there in Sunday night we had enough places to choose from. The music, light and audience everything was very pleasant. I think Souvla is good as for couples as for bigger groups of friends

Loved it! Obviously a popular locals spot. It was out of our neighborhood but we went specifically for Mediterranean. Got lucky and the line was short. Everyone was nice, clean and bright interior and cool counter seating outside. The food was delicious! One pork gyro, one pork salad. Went back to get a frozen yogurt with baklava. Will definitely return and bring friends! Also a great street for shops and walking around.

It's the simple things, but I don't care if this place is crossover Greek/American nonsense: this place gets salad righter than right. Generous portion of chopped kalamata olives with mizithra cheese and toasted walnut and pea shoots and pickled onions on lettuce - absolutely divine, a paean to all that is great in salad-making, and I don't care about anything else, they hit one dish out of the park, and that's enough.

I was recommended here by a friend who is a local and swears by this place. Honestly, this did not disappoint. You order your food at the counter and they bring it to you wherever you decide to sit. 

If you have an appetite, definitely recommend getting a sandwich/salad, with a side of fries and the Greek yogurt with baklava to top things off. Everything was great! Definitely recommend, it's also a convenient take out food as well

Please go try this if you want a (healthy feeling) bowl that has Greek/med twist to it. I got the veg salad and loved it. All the veggies had a great hint of flavor and were perfectly sautéed/roasted. The Greek fries were also delicious and I highly recommend getting them if you go. The real star of the show was the side sauces. For me, I do like my salads to have a saucer-ness to it so it was exactly what I needed to keep it from getting to dry. The yogurt also tasted delicious with the fries. 

Overall, it is a little expensive but you get a decent/good amount of food. I was able to save some food for later (but deff not enough for a WHOLE second meal), so it was worth it.

Came here for a quick dinner before attending the SF Ballet. They have tables inside and outside the restaurant. You do order first and then sit yourself. I ordered the chicken salad instead of the sandwich/wrap with a side of the fries with garlic ranch. The bowl was flavorful and a medium to large portion. I had to ask for a to-go box! Their fries were well seasoned and they gave you a perfect serving. The side dressing for the ranch was good too, it is an extra dollar tho if it is not ketchup. But definitely worth it and not the end of the world. 

Place is clean, bathroom is well kept but too close to the kitchen for my taste, the staff are friendly, and there is a good ambient to the place. Overall, the size of the menu is small but honestly I think that makes for a great restaurant because they are able to perfect the meals. Definitely coming here again.

TLDR: Stick to the yogurt. Terrible 'Sandwich' (Pita Wrap)

Scoring Weight: 100% Food, 0% Other, 8/1/21 ~5:00pm
Worth a visit? No. Not for the non-yogurt.
Worth the price ($16+)? No. Terrible value even if it tasted good. 

Food - Free range Chicken (Pita) "Sandwich" $16+

Terrible price point. Objectively terrible chicken wrap. An attempted take on a modern chicken pita/gryo. Complete failure. 

Pita: Average. Warmed on a grill. Nothing special. No flame char/additional flavor added.

Fillings: ~1/2 an orange worth of orange slices... Makes the entire wrap taste odd. Wasn't terrible, but didn't elevate any other part of the wrap. Such a strange choice with no benefit other than trying to be hipstery/elevated/weird. Literally tasted like you dropped some oranges on an already sub-par pita wrap.

'Free Range Chicken' was shredded, dry, and lacked any real flavor. Canned Costco chicken would have been an improvement. Rotisserie Costco chicken would have been a home run.

Veggies, picked onions, and yogurt sauce were present texture-wise, but were absent in the flavor department.

The fact that this was $16+ for a regular size pita wrap is the nail in the coffin. Imagine paying $10+ for a normally-sized street taco. Mediterranean food is almost always tasty AND a great value proposition. If this same wrap was $8 (1/2 price) it may have reached 2 stars. Ouch.

Other:
* Bathroom: Single, gender neutral, clean.
* Parking: Standard tough SF street parking.
* Inside: Clean, modern design. Nice.
* Service: Fast casual. Nothing to complain about.

I love spots with small but good menus. I had heard of Souvla before for their greek frozen yogurt, but didn't realize they had good food too! The workers said their chicken was their most popular, but I ended up getting the pork wrap. My only complaint is that the pork was kind of dry, and the salad seem more portion-wise than the wraps. The fries and froyo were really good! Kind of pricey but quality seems nice.

this review is solely for the frozen green yogurt with honey! okay honestly, I absolutely loved the concept. it felt like a healthier dessert alternative and honestly tastes exactly how you would expect and maybe even better. I think if you're a fan of greek yogurt, you'll be a fan of this item. i am already naturally borderline about greek yogurt so I wasn't obsessed with it but it was still a refreshing and unique treat. I would definitely recommend at least adding honey or some sort of topping to sweeten it up! it's a great gluten free dessert but if you don't have an allergy, i've also heard great things about the baklava topping.

Although I've yet to have a proper meal here, Souvla's smaller menu items, like the frozen Greek yogurt and fries, have become a repeat snack for me whenever I find myself on Hayes St. I'd also definitely recommend adding a side of garlic sauce to your order of fries

They've gotten so stingy on the amount of fries when you order greek style. Price is the same but they clearly told staff to put in 1/4 of the amount of before. Frustrating to pay $18 for a salad and have them short you on an ingredient that costs so little.
Man I used to love this place. Unfortunately prices went up and portions went down. It is now $23 for a small gyro and even smaller fries. I'd rather have two chipotle bowls instead.

Cute location in Hayes Valley with both a takeout window in the outside and a counter to order from in the inside. Customer service is very fast and friendly. They made a slight and very understandable mistake with my order and fixed it very quickly without question. There is self-serve seating inside and outside. 

I came specifically for the vege lamb gyro. I was so impressed with the vege lamb, tender, moist and so well seasoned. I love that they but thinly sliced radish, cucumber, pickled onion inside with feta. The combo of ingredients is incredible. The Greek fries are also delicious. 

I can't wait to bring my vegetarian family back here to try! I know my son will love the salad option which is packed with tons of romaine and kale. He and I had previously tried their baklava and honey frozen yogurt and it was so yum!

A casual lunch spot amid a bunch of other restaurants/bars in Hayes Valley. Even though we had a late lunch (~1:30), the restaurant stayed busy throughout the afternoon, which speaks to how good it was! The food came really fast (5 mins) and we loved the aesthetic decor inside. 

Fries (5/5): So good! Fresh and crispy and hot. We got the Granch sauce and definitely recommend -- as the name suggests, it's like a cross between ranch and Greek yogurt. 

Pork wrap (4/5): Could have used a bit more flavor but the pork was super tender!

Veg salad (3.5/5): A hearty portion of salad with lots of good mix-ins (olives, walnuts, mizithra). The white sweet potato was a bit bland, but the dressing helped tie all the flavors together. Overall not super special but the only veggie option, so I'd get it again if I were here!

I love Soulva! They have the best frozen Greek yogurt. I like the one that is drenched in fresh honey. The honey is sooo sweet and is perfectly  juxtaposed with the tartness of the creamy Greek yogurt.  Even writing this review is making me crave one right now. They also have other great food options. I love starting with somethong healthy and fresh (like their chicken Greek salad) and pairing it with their Greek fries and finally ending it with their Greek yogurt. They also provide great service in a busy pedestrian friendly neighborhood. Enjoy!

I'm obsessed with the pork salad. I like to come to the restaurant instead of doordashing because the place is so cute but it's always just hard to find parking. I thought it was gonna be different in Hayes valley location but no. The frozen Greek yogurts are good, fries, even the soup.

FYI: They don't have any trash cans laying out and about (at least when we went) so if you want to throw away your finished yogurt cup, ask the staff member behind the counter

WHAT WE GOT: Frozen greek yogurt (baklava crumbles & honey syrup)

PROS: This dessert gets the highest of all Asian dessert compliments ("It's not too sweet!"). With the perfect mix of tang, a hint of sourness, and the sweetness from the baklava crumbles and honey, this froyo is super refreshing and a great way to end a night of heavier, richer eating. It feels so light that it's almost guilt free! They also give you a decent amount of froyo and toppings so it's definitely worth it.

CONS: So this is where I docked 2 stars. Not necessarily because of the food we got (which was good and honestly 4-star worthy), but because of my experience here. First of all, there aren't too many indoor seating options and they only have 1 bathroom (that doesn't really look like it's cleaned too too often). If you do choose to seat yourself outside and not just do take out, just be careful of your surroundings (like with most city outdoor seating). We had an unfortunate run in with a homeless guy who harassed and threatened our group as he passed. It started off with him just asking for money, but he apparently hovered behind me and made aggressive advancing movements towards my back (according to my husband). He came back around and started threatening us, adding a few racist comments in his rambling before he walked off. This was also after I saw him walk up to one of the outdoor bench tables and drink water straight out of what looked like an old glass bottle acting as either a vase or just decor. He literally just grabbed it off the table while someone was eating their meal right next to it and took a big swing out of before putting it back on said table. I'm sorry but this whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth. I do plan on coming back eventually but maybe not for a while just to distance myself from that night a bit.
