Souvla was such a good introduction to the Hayes Valley neighborhood! :-) My close friends suggested this spot for a quick catch-up lunch and I couldn't have asked for better. Enjoying a hearty salad while people-watching in this lively little street made for a relaxing afternoon. 

I love that the menu is simple & efficient. Have your choice of protein (pork, chicken, lamb, or veggie) in one of two variations (salad or wrap). 

This location drew me back for a second visit, where I shamelessly indulged in their frozen Greek yogurt w/ baklava crumbles. True to its origin, this soft serve has a tartness that balances perfectly with drizzled honey and chewy baklava.

I'm a big fan of their salads-- convinced me that the "health" factor outweighs the yogurt I'm washing it down with. I'd say that Souvla is a solid lunch/dinner spot no matter what the occasion.

I always get this when Im feeling like I need a healthy meal!! The chicken salad is my favorite! I usually get this as togo and sit outdoors! 

Ive tried both the chicken salad and pork salad. Both really tasty! Also, don't forget to balance out your meal with a baklava frozen yogurt for dessert, so good (forgot to take a picture, was too excited)!

Horrible food ... not fresh, not tasty and not clean. 
Fast food joint at its worst. Not Greek. Hate that it will be taking up space at the Marin Country Mart.  Why is a fast food joint coming to the mart? Ugh.

If you are in the mood to eat healthy and clean, Souvla is the perfect place to visit! The restaurant has plenty of both indoor and outdoor seating and you order as soon as you enter.  I had the Chicken Salad and the greek twist to it made the salad very tasty. I felt full after my meal, but not to the point where I felt that I was over-eating. Rather, the quantity is perfect and salads are made very fresh. There is also the option to convert the salad into a wrap or to also buy additional pita bread, appetizers, or desserts.

I never really ate at Souvla until they added the black sheep plant based lamb to their menu! This is so tasty and works well in both the salad or sandwich. It is pricey though, and ends up costing more than the meat version. Also love their frozen yogurt with olive oil.

Changing to three stars for staff being unfriendly. 

Asked for a cup of ice to go and the guy said no without even giving a reasonable answer.

Asked If he can just give it in the frozen yogurt cup and he said no it's restaurant policy. 

Went next door to Patxi's and the guy was happy enough to give it to me.

Get it together Souvla...

I have heard people talk about this restaurant since I moved to the city. I can definitely see why! I had the pork shoulder salad, and the portion was huge and the meat was delicious. I had the sour cherry frozen Greek yogurt, and it is one of my new favorite desserts. The staff were very nice and enthusiastic. I will definitely come back.
Generally the salads are pretty good, but I ordered from this location and found a bug in my salad! I tried calling them about it but no one picked up, so customer service could be improved too.

The plant based lamb is delicious and they customized to make sure the gyro we got was fully vegan. Would love if they had a vegan yogurt sauce for the gyro but this place is fire overall! Really great food and terrific service.

This is for the Lululemon people :).

They succeeded in putting together awesome salads. Perfect for the health conscious San Francisco crowds. Not a salad guy here but their salads are better than their pita sandwiches.

This place is worth the hype- though I would recommend getting a salad since the portion is a lot more satisfying than the wrap!

Order at one window and pick up at another, and they have a handful of outdoor dining seats! The service was fast and the food was fresh, savory, and filling.

Lamb salad- I love lamb, and the meat here is great in that it's not too gamey/chewy! The salad is a mix of kale, cucumber, cilantro, radish slices, and a feta/greek yogurt dressing. The creaminess from the cheese and dressing really goes well with the umami flavor of the lamb, and there's a good ratio of meat to salad- I was pleasantly surprised at how much lamb I had!

Chicken salad- a lot of flavor in the shredded chicken, I'm always a little hesitant to get shredded chicken anything because it's usually dry but this one was soaked in juices so it wasn't bad. The rest of the salad is similar to the lamb salad, except this one hd  mandarin slices mixed in which gives it a nice sweet citrus-y addition.

Juicy potatoes- very soft and fatty, though not a lot of flavor like I was expecting. I'd recommend getting the Greek fries for your potato fix!

Note: As of 4/6/21, their Greek fro yo machine was down and pending fix :(
Souvla is always my go-to. The food is delish and filling without leaving you heavy. My friends are all envious we have this great restaurant in our area.

Souvla has been a super popular spot forever, but I'm sad to say I'm not a huge fan :( I remember eating here during college and loving the light yet filling wraps and the famous frozen yogurt! Unfortunately the last few times I've eaten here the meat is dry and the prices are very high for what you get. The yogurt is still yummy but there are better spots for your money if you're looking for a quick and healthy meal.

This review is just for the frozen Greek yogurt. It's amazing. The first few bites are kinda odd since you're expecting the traditional vanilla soft serve but it's definitely different and leaves you wanting more.

Souvla is a SF standard. To be perfectly honestly - the first few times I had it, I really didn't get the hype. That may have to do with the fact that the vegetarian offering is a bit sub-par compared to the non-vegetarian foods. The sweet potato based dishes are definitely a bit of an acquired taste, but they've grown on me as an alternative to the perpetual Sweetgreen / Blue Barn healthy enough but has some taste genre...

The real kicker though at Souvla that has made me a fan, and entices me over and over again to fork over $14 for a sweet potato wrap is that it's an excuse to eat their delicious frozen Greek yogurt. If you like tart foods, this is the ideal dessert. I cannot tell you how many containers of Souvla frozen Greek yogurt I've hoarded in my freezer for Friday nights where you want to convince yourself that you're eating healthy, but need something indulgent (please spare me, and don't count)

The toppings that the frozen Greek yogurt comes with are all good - the sour cherry and Cretan wildflower honey are both incredible. If you're feeling really adventurous - try both on top. Best dessert in Hayes Valley imo (sorry Salt & Straw)
I always want to go back for the frozen yogurt, fries, soup, and veggie wrap. I find the food to be fresh and of good quality. Please expand locations to SoCal!

One of my favorite spots in SF! Although their menu is not as extensive, their main items are SO good. I love their chicken or pork salad as well as their frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles & honey syrup. I highly recommend their salad because it's not just another healthy option but actually so yummy that I sometimes get cravings for it. 

I think I slightly prefer the chicken salad to pork salad even though both are really good just because I like the citrusy taste of the navel orange in the chicken salad that adds a refreshing taste to it. On the other hand, I thought the pork salad and lamb salad were pretty similar except for (obviously) the taste of the meat itself. But you cannot go wrong with any of their salad options! 

Their frozen greek yogurt is also a MUST, especially the one with baklava. It adds a nice sweetness and texture to the dense and creamy frozen yogurt!

what to get:
lamb wrap (both the real lamb and the plant-based "lamb" are well-cooked)

the fries - solid quantity, easy shareable, and the seasoning on the fries tastes so good!

what to avoid:
the salad with chicken - the chicken had a slimy and stringy texture to it and was also not very well-seasoned. the salad was decent, with oranges, lettuce, kale, and dressing and the quantity was large, but i'd get it with something other than the chicken.

I give this place 3.5 stars. It definitely was good, but it was not amazing. I really enjoyed the baklava ice cream, but I was sort of expecting a normal soft serve. Their soft serve is like the plain flavor at Yogurtland. I also did like my pita wrap, but my friends did not love their salads. My favorite thing here is their fries and dipping sauces. Try the garlic one!

Most authentic Greek food in SF and to finish your great meal with life changing sweet salty treat! Ready it's the GREEK&OLIVE OIL W/SEA SALT FLAKES 10/10 MUST TRY! You may think no that doesn't go together but it just does!

I am not convinced Souvla is worth the hype. I got a lamb salad to go, and upon first inspection it is a beautifully composed salad for takeout standards. However, the lamb was stringy and dry - it is begging for it to either be crisped up or soaked in some sort of sauce. I got a side of pita, which was dense and chewy - skip this. I think next time I'll go for the chicken and fried. Some highlights: The salad itself was refreshing and not overdressed. All the fixings were crisp and fresh. You can order online and pick up food pretty quickly. 

Is this Greek food? I don't think so. Are my standards way too high after having Greek food in Greece? Perhaps. But, the food was overpriced for what it is - it's a salad with maybe 3 oz of tiny cubes of overcooked lamb for $16! Although, being overpriced is maybe just because this is the reality of SF. If you are hankering for solid, authentic Greek fares, I'd say start your search elsewhere.

They were really nice and helpful! I came here after a morning workout because I wanted something that felt healthier. I was sweating buckets and didn't have enough water, so I asked for some. The cashier said they didn't have any reuseable cups to give out water in since they don't have outdoors seating, but then he went out of his way to fill out a couple sauce containers with water when he saw how exhausted we looked! 

The food itself was not bad, but not mind blowing either. I really liked the freshness and the sweetness of the citrus in it! It was a little more sour than I thought though, presumably because of the pickled onions. It was also a little oily on the bottom.

I love fast casual, and Souvla is absolutely fast casual. Order at the counter, grab a table, food comes out in less than 10 minutes. My friend and I stopped by Saturday while shopping in Hayes Valley, and it wasn't too crowded. We were able to find seating immediately. Both ordered a pita sandwich and a side of fries to share. The fries were really good! Perfectly seasoned and had a bit of garlic on top too. Paired very well with the yogurt dipping sauce they provided. The sandwiches however, not a huge fan. The bread was a bit tough, and my lamb tasted like carnitas. My friend got the chicken sandwich and she was not a fan of the orange slices they include in the sandwich either. Overall, a great place when you're looking for a quick bite, but maybe stick to yogurt or salad and avoid the sandwich.

I've had Souvla a few times for work lunches, and ordered delivery through Caviar. Very happy with the food. A simple menu, done really well. The flavors are always good, and the ingredients fresh! 

Greek Fries - so crispy and well seasoned! Eat quickly while it's hot before it gets soggy
Lamb salad - the lamb was delicious but rather heavy. The salad leaves were crispy even through delivery, which was a pleasant surprise
Chicken sandwich - reason for four instead of five stars. The chicken was rather dry, and the "Granch" dressing was too heavy. That said, the fresh navel oranges were a really nice, light counterbalance  
Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt Frozen Yogurt - first time getting the frozen yogurt, and wow it lives up to the craze! So soft and creamy and not too sweet. The olive oil is drizzled on top, so mix it in before taking your first bite. I didn't realize and got a huge bite of olive oil ha

Their pork and chicken salads are both SO good and incredibly filling! I got the chicken and my partner got the pork. Both had the perfect amount of dressing, cheese, meat and lettuce. I added some hot sauce to mine as I like a bit or kick (wasn't that hot at all). Price is a bit steep at over $15, but I enjoyed lunch here.

The frozen greek yogurt tho - out of this world. 10/10. Trust me.

Highly reviewed on Yelp for good reason. Michelle Obama loves it. All my coworkers love it. I love it. It's delicious. 

Wraps and salads are all very satisfying and consistently good. If you like high contrast flavors (like clementine slices with your chicken), you'll probably like Souvla's menu offerings. Greek fries are fabulous. Prices are on the higher end, but not out of range of typical SF. 

Pre-COVID I would order ahead to pick-up, as the line can sometimes be quite long. Inside has some seating, but Souvla has always been busy and packed each time I visited. Outside seating available.

*pre-covid review*

When I worked in the city, I loved ordering Souvla for lunch or post-work dinner! I always ordered the lamb gyro/sandwich and ended the meal with their famous frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey.

Lamb Gyro/Sandwich - I like how their ingredients were simple, fresh, and tasty. I find that a lot of gyros tend be a bit heavy or oily but this one isn't. As you can see from the pictures, there are not that many ingredients but the ingredients they do include all compliment each other and are high quality. They are also very generous with their meat portions.

Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles + Honey - This is such a great dessert! The frozen greek yogurt has a nice tang to it that surprised me at first, but perfectly balances the very sweet baklava and honey. They don't skimp on the baklava either! There is more than enough to have a little baklava with each bite you eat. Again, I like how this dessert doesn't feel too heavy since the greek yogurt is light refreshing and not overly sweet.

I can't say too much about the inside or the staff since I've only ordered through Caviar but I've had no complaints about my food or orders!

AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING 
One of the best lamb wraps/Mediterranean food I've ever tasted
My sister had a salad and loved it too!
+let's not forget about the baklava Greek yogurt... A MUST

I had the veggie wrap and it was tasty. Could have been bigger or maybe it's just bc I was super hungry -_-
Recommend it! Time to cross the street for some ice cream, you scream, we all scream, for ICE CREAM!

Souvla is the ONE restaurant in SF that I will always be down to order from again and again. 

I gotta say, the first few times I tried Souvla, I thought it was just okay, given the huge hype around it. But all it took was one time to get me absolutely HOOKED and now I just can't stop eating it.

I always order the chicken sandwich/salad. The sandwich is basically the salad wrapped in pita, they just give you less salad. I use to worry that just getting the salad wouldn't be filling enough, but boy was I wrong. They give you a huge portion of salad and it's definitely super filling, and you can also add pita. 

The chicken is the best part of the salad by far. It is just SO tender and flavorful. I seriously crave it all the time. The Greek Yogurt dressing and vinaigrette make the salad incredibly savory. I also love the addition of the pickled onions.

Their Greek yogurt is also bomb! It's the perfect creaminess and tartness. I'll get either the sour cherry (if I want something lighter), or baklava + honey syrup (which can be really filling).

Yes, the prices are super high, but still end up giving in every time!
Horrible customer service . When my order was wrong they got upset and brought this out. Inedible! Refuse to get money back !!!

The HV location always seems to have a long line. I get that this fare is tasty and wholesome. But 45 minutes just to take away? 
Yikes!
Apparently the yogurt is to die for. I was able to order that separately after we had lunch as there was no line. I Added the baklava and honey. 
First bite- the best apple pie alamode you've ever had.
Then that pungent sour yogurt taste kicks in. Not overpowering but subtle more acidic than sour. 
Smooth and silky, very refreshing. Definitely worth a return visit.
Earlier my son ordered us the salads with lamb. 
It was very rich and filling while being healthy too. 
Winston insisted we share a bit of lamb with him. The smell being fragrant and all. 

I surmise that the combination of healthy, fresh, flavorful and not expensive are what draws the long lines, rave reviews and popularity. 
But definitely come back for the frozen yogurt!
Cute location for anyone looking for some delicious mediterranean food! We got the frozen greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbles and it was so creamy and not overly rich.

Excellent service and food. You must try the lemon chicken soup and the chicken salad is excellent.  The young man you place your order with was working smartly and made one feel appreciated. First visit but definitely not my last

Well my friend told me to get the juicy potatoes, Greek yogurt, and baklava ice cream. But I forgot and got the lamb gyro and Greek fries. Stilll delicious now I just have to come back for seconds! We sat on the patio and enjoyed our lunch with others.

I've come several times to this Souvla location and ordered a couple different things. Here are my reviews on certain dishes:

Veg sandwich: I'm a big fan of this type of sweet potato so I really enjoyed this! My vegetarian friend got the same thing but he didn't like sweet potatoes so it wasn't great for him. I asked for no olives because I don't enjoy them so that's why the sandwich in the picture doesn't have olives.

Chicken sandwich: the chicken was pretty dry when I got the wrap. My friend got the salad different time we went and the the chicken was also dry that time. I would recommend the veg sandwich over this due to this. 

Greek fries: nice and crispy. Dipping sauce that came with it was also good. 

Overall, the portion sizes weren't very big and the flavors were not bad, but I probably won't come again.

I saw someone on TikTok talk about this and it looked so good! AND IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  So glad I tried this place while in SF for a few days.  I got the chicken sandwich and the frozen yogurt with baklava bits.  The service is also great and quick!  If I lived in SF, I would come here so often.  Recommend to anyone walking around Hayes Valley!

Not really understanding the hype around this place. My chicken wrap was extremely dry and the Greek fries were raw in the middle. Took forever for the food to come out. $20 for this underwhelming meal?! It's honestly not worth it.
 
Popped in here one evening pre-coronavirus for a quick dinner. I was looking for something fast casual and from the looks of it, this place seemed to fit the bill. Soulva is small fast casual Greek food chain that has a simple-ish menu consisting of rotisserie cooked natural meats. The interior space is really inviting and comfortable. This is a total hipster joint by definition. Not normally my scene, but the vibes were super mellow. This seems like a popular hangout spot for the young folk in Hayes Valley.
 
Prices are really high. It costed me $20 for a chicken wrap and Greek fries (no drink included). Uuumm... WHAAAT?! Just way to expensive for this type of meal. To top it off, it wasn't very good at all. The chicken in my wrap was dry AF!!! It was like they overcooked it or something. Just super dry and flavorless. There wasn't enough sauce in the wrap, and the sauce that was there didn't have much flavor either. The fries tasted okay, but they were clearly undercooked. They were definitely raw in the middle.
 
Normally, I would have probably asked them for fries that were cooked all the way through. The reason why I didn't was because I was pressed for time and it had already taken a long time for me to get my food in the first place. For my first experience at Soulva, I was left a bit disappointed. I'm not saying that I'd never come back here again. But what I will say is that I won't be in a rush to come back anytime soon.

got the pork wrap and chicken salad through doordash. the pita in the wrap was quite hard - not sure if this was due to the delay in consumption from using a delivery service (vs eating on the spot), but i was quite unimpressed. chicken salad was fresh and well flavored though!

Fast food at it's finest. (Lamb sandy, Greek fries, Baklava crumbs greek yogurt)

Although it is a bit expensive, this "fast food" sits near the of the fast food chain. We sat for 3 minutes before receiving our order of the lamb sandwich and greek fries. The lamb sandwich is around 16-17 bucks and greek fries are around 7 bucks.

The lamb sandwich is decent but the meat was a bit dry, possibly add a side of sauce.The greek fries with garlic on side is pretty good, would recommend.

The best part about this place is the frozen greek yogurt. I would eat this yogurt over ice cream shops any day, perfect for folks who don't want the sugar rush of icecream but want the cold substance. 

+2 for the fine ass greek yogurt
x1 for their choice in ice tea, get this for any ice tea lover.
+2 for okay greek food that will fill ya up but possibly leave you asking for a bit more....

Fresh but definitely needs a sauce for the wraps. Dry and needed more flavor. Salads needed more dressing and flavor as well. Pita was ... pita.  Dog friendly and fast service and quick for work pick up lunch.

Souvla has been in SF for many years and has quickly expanded. It's definitely good food, but not Greek! 

I most recently had dinner at Souvla last night (Tuesday). It was busy as usual but there was enough indoor seating and we did not have to wait long for our food.

Ordered: lamb wrap and lamb salad, with Greek fries and Greek beer. 

The beer, a lager, is delicious. The fries are large, crispy, and topped with feta, lemon, and parsley.

The salad is mostly just kale and romaine with a few radishes. Nothing special. The lamb was for the most part very tender, though about 25% of the pieces were tough, and was good. Lamb wrap is always delicious.

The customer service was excellent and the space clean. Staff was diligently checking for vaccination cards, which I greatly appreciated.

This is the place where I started my love for salad!!
Highly recommend the Pork Salad. Their portions is very big, 2 people can share. Their pork is marinated and cook so they are super tender and juicy. The feta cheese in the salad really help kicking the sour favor balance with the fatty from olive oil and pork.
Healthier choice: Chicken Salad. Very juicy and tender but without the fatty and more hint of sweetness and refreshing of tangerines.
MUST ORDER: Their yogurt is addictive!! I love to order the baklava on weekend for a healthy yet sweet treat however, for daily choice (yes I'm addicted to their yogurt) just order plain yogurt!

A healthy and fast causal spot! Coming in I knew the place was pretty good for healthy food and more famous for its frozen Greek yogurt. I definitely have to say it's a good spot if you want something fast and casual but not anything mind-blowing. The frozen Greek yogurt was pretty good -- would come back again and try others to-go. Overall, would just think of this place as something healthy and fast.

Souvla has been on my Yelp bookmarks for a while now but was kind of underwhelmed. Pretty pricey and the food was alright. I enjoyed the Baklava Yogurt, but the Chicken Salad was pretty average. The dressing is pretty oily, and it definitely showed when I just finishing up and saw the bottom of the box. Even though the dressing softened up the kale a lot, there was just an overwhelming proportion of kale that made the whole bowl really bitter (since kale is naturally bitter). I stopped wanting to eat it halfway but didn't want it to go to waste so just pushed through. Could definitely give more chicken as well. I'll probably go with the wrap next time instead.

So everyone loves Souvla! Nothing wrong with it but let's be honest, there's better Mediterranean food out there. I will say Souvla is really clean and consistent and has a great ambiance so there is a lot of like. But I just like more flavor to my Mediterranean food. I found Souvla to be a bit bland. Their Greek fries are dank though! 

My favs:
- Chicken salad
- Greek fries
- Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup Yogurt

Loved the takeout window with quick and attentive service. Their salads were delicious, and I appreciated that modifications were meticulously followed. A great place to grab a quick salad in the city.

This is fast slow Greek food. You order at the front and they bring you your order on these white/ceramic  trays to match the theme they have throughout the spot.

I got the Avgolemono  (sp!) soup which is a creamy, lemony soup with chicken and rice. So delicious. My other was the lamb sandwich which was filling and i saved half for a later snack.

I give this spot 4 stars because it was quite expensive considering the amount. I wouldn't have thought I'd have to pay $20+ for a soup and sandwich but I guess that's SF prices?! (I've lived in NYC for 7 years and that doesn't even compare...)

If you're looking for something filling but also fairly healthy, Souvla has some great options. The chicken sandwich was so filling that I was unable to finish the entire thing. The sandwich even had oranges in it which I was pleasantly surprised by- I generally don't prefer sweet fruit in savory meals but this did work well. The Greek fries are a must try if you're going to order here!

I'd heard so many great things about this place, but after finally trying it I definitely found it just alright. 

I got the veg salad, and it felt a lot like a basic salad you could get at the store. 

Their frozen yogurt on the other hand was fantastic, I'd probably come back just for this. It wasn't too sweet -- it honestly reminded me of the "tart" flavor you can get at many froyo places, just creamier in texture -- and the honey on top adds just the right amount of sweetness and flavor. Definitely a fantastic guilt-free dessert! 

If I was just rating my salad here, I'd probably give this place 3 stars, but the frozen yogurt was truly fantastic so I'll give it 4 stars :)

Ok, frozen yogurt with olive oil & flaky sea salt? "Ew, What the heck is that?" I said to my daughter who introduced it to me for the first time. We ordered one yogurt to share, but I ended up inhaling it all so we had to order another one! Now I know that I always have to order my own. 

Since then, I became so addicted to that it's a must have whenever I visit SF!!!  Wish they would open a Souvla in Monterey so I can preach about it to my local people!!!!   

Their salads are also phenomenal! I always usually get the chicken salad with French fries and it's such a filling and delicious meal. The salads are huge so they can easily feed two people. The workers are also nice enough to split one order into two to go if you ask. 

Goodbye till next time Souvla! I will miss you more than I miss my daughters living in San Francisco!

Really delicious food! We got the chicken salad, soup, and fries. I have a strict gluten restriction due to health problems and food was up to standard with no cross contamination. The workers were not very knowledgeable about gluten and service was not too friendly. This is why I took off a star.

We were passing by and saw the little line out front of people order frozen yogurt . It was an extra warm day in sf . Covid-19 times , so take out only . The menu was conveniently posted at the front door, at which we also placed our order . They serve food  as well as yogurt . So only one flavor yogurt with four different topping options . The olive oil and sea salt was so delicious!!! The baklava and honey was ok .. it was a huge piece of baklava with the honey already in it. It was fine but the baklava tasted more like a chewy oatmeal cookie then traditional baklava to me .  
  

I would definitely return for some more frozen yogurt here and perhaps some food as well. No bathrooms were open due to covid-19 changes to business .

I dream of that frozen greek yogurt with baklava -- I wanted to savor every bite and cried when I finished. My fingers were frozen and I was shivering from the inside out and I count it all worth it. Got the lamb salad with fries and wonderful all around but the greek yogurt, that just about changed my life.

I ordered the chicken sandwich (more like a pita wrap) and it was delicious. Every bite was full of flavor and the clementine/orange bits were a nice touch! The Greek fries were also delicious and complemented the sandwich perfectly!

I also tried the yogurt with sour cherry and it was decent. I don't think I'd order it again (I definitely want to try the baklava one) because the cherry syrup was a bit too sour for my liking. I know it says "sour" right in the name, but I absolutely love cherry flavor, so I had to at least try it. The yogurt itself was also a bit lacking in flavor, it basically tasted like "plain" frozen yogurt (as opposed to vanilla), though I suppose that might have been what it was. 

Overall, a great restaurant with great service. There are some public tables right in front of the restaurant which were available when I went, so you can eat it there or take it to-go.

TryCaviar order. I asked for "light" on the kale in my salad. What did I get? 100% undigestible kale. Thanks guys.
Salad also comes pre-dressed, so anything you don't eat immediately is compost.
Chicken was good; potatoes good, although *very* salty.

obviously there isn't much to be said about souvla that hasn't already been said, but this review will focus on their vegan lamb gyro. i had been here quite a few times before and always found it fine but insanely overpriced, though i do LOVE the baklava frozen yogurt.

however, i knew i had to return to try the vegan lamb gyro (note that the gyro itself isn't vegan as it has feta and yogurt sauce in it). i was super excited to try vegan lamb, but felt like it didn't really have a distinct taste and was pretty dry on it's own. it was also pretty pricey, at $17 for the gyro. really cool that they had the option, but would have probably preferred a different plant based protein option. wouldn't necessarily recommend it, except for the novelty of vegan lamb. i will ofc be back for the baklava frozen greek yogurt though!

It's not a sandwich malakas. Asked you if it was a gyro you replied sandwich. I asked again, with pita, like a gyro. You said yes. And continued to passively aggressively say pork sandwich. Imagine if I went to a Mexican place and they called it a pork sandwich for any of their wrap based dishes. 

Idc of you call it a sandwich, I want to know what I'm buying. Prick.

It would have been a better experience if they put more meat inside.
I wouldn't go back.
I felt cheated.
Especially after such glowing reviews.
Pretty tasty soft serve. $6. I enjoyed the tartness of the yogurt. The baklava chunks were very soggy though. I wouldn't recommend this flavor combo.

2.5 stars.  Came here for early dinner prior to an exhibit   Both the proteins for the salad and sandwich were very dry and hard; not sure if it was off hours or what but very disappointed. Only redeeming item was the tasty fries which were nicely fried with great crunchy ends.
Meh! Decent food nothing was amazing. Just okay. I'll never go back. However the service was great.

This place had amazing reviews, and hence we decided to try it out on a beautiful Saturday afternoon in the city. We went here for an early dinner, ordered the lamb sandwich, pork sandwich, greek fries, chicken salad and baklava yogurt crumble. The lamb and pork sandwiches were good, however, the chicken salad was bland and under-seasoned, granted the ingredients were fresh, but the lack of seasoning made the salad underwhelming. The fries were some of the best we've ever had, and it was hard to stop eating them. The baklava yogurt crumble was good. Overall, not worth the prices they charge.

We were really pleased with our food and experience. The menu is small, we ordered at the counter and our food was brought to us shortly. I ordered a salad with lamb. It was fresh with romain lettuce, kale, pickled red onions, feta cheese, coated in a vinaigrette. The lamb was plentiful, tender and tasty. It was a large, satisfying salad. For dessert I had the Greek yogurt soft serve with sour cherry sauce. The soft serve was tangy and cheesy in flavor with just a hint of sweetness. My dinner cost $23 plus tax a tip, a good deal by SF standards. Looking forward to eating there again.

Overall a bright, refreshing lunch for a San Francisco day. Would have this over Costco rotisserie chicken in a heartbeat.  

The Avgolemono, a Greek egg-lemon soup is a creamy delight. Might be the best thing on their menu.

Hate the customer service here, I'm a regular and I order my pick up order here and tip. The one time I ask for utensils for the salads or/and extra cup for my yogurts and I offered to pay them, the older Latin guy says no, how the hell am I supposed to eat my food. I'm working and I don't have utensils on the go. WTF I OFFERED TO PAY for it!! As dramatic as this sounds I won't be ordering from them again. We have to eat like caveman's now.

Also he Cross contaminated he was helping me with my order someone asked to toss their things touch their cup and then touch my items I felt grossed out because he touched someone else's trash

I have been meaning to try Souvla for the longest time and I finally had my chance! 

The process is super simple and fast and service was very nice and helpful. We chose to get Pork and Lamb Sandwiches, pita, and an extra garlic yogurt sauce to-go.

Between the sandwiches, I preferred the lamb over the pork only because it seemed to offer more flavor (I guess the gaminess) and less oil. The pork sandwich was laying in a puddle of its own grease. 

The sandwiches overall were both super stuffed, almost too much to the point of being difficult to eat. I'm glad that it's plentiful! 

I didn't think much of the pita side, but I loved the garlic yogurt sauce. Extremely garlicky, almost hot! So perfect as a dipping sauce, I thoroughly enjoyed it with my sandwich. 

Overall a good experience. I would love to go back to try their salads and their green yogurt, it seemed like more people opted for those vs what I ordered!

This place is the perfect quick option for lunch or dinner. They're usually pretty busy so I recommend ordering online - it's usually ready in 15 mins or less. However that speed can also have a downside - sometimes the food is prepared right away even when I schedule the order for later, which is a bit frustrating as the pita gets tough and fries get soggy while it's sitting there. 

I've tried pork, chicken, and lamb in both sandwich and salad form, and I think my favorite is the pork sandwich. Chicken sandwich/salad is a close second, but when I had the lamb it was super dry and not too flavorful. Maybe it was just a bad batch? The fries are also awesome, although as mentioned above they have a tendency to get a little soggy for delivery/pickup orders. I recommend trying those fresh if you can.

Maybe not as great for delivery as the wrap for the sandwich arrived hard. It has a good amount of filling but due to the hardening of the bread, it was harder to chew and I couldn't really enjoy it. I've never had it freshly made and I would bet it would have tasted better. I had lamb in the wrap and it might be a bit gamey for some but it was ok for me. Also tried the pork shoulder salad. It had big cubes of pork meat, I thought it was just alright.

My friends raved about Souvla. Its a fast casge place in SF and we arrived at this once. We ordered online and when we arrive (like 4 mins after) our order was ready. I ordered the lamb Salad Greek style. The mix was a combo of what I could notice as kale and other vege. Tons of bites of lamb and topped with fries. I wasn't overly impressed but it was...fine. The salad was just a salad and even with the dressing, it was still a salad that didn't have that POW! The lamb was a bit dry and although flavorful, it wasn't very impressive. The fries obvi were easy to scarf down but as a whole, it's meh. I think if I were to come back, I'd do the pork or vege options and choose a sandwich instead. I hear the baklava yogurt dessert is bomb so maybe I just need to come here for that.
I've been ordering pickup here for years and love their food. The staff at the pickup window are always respectful and friendly and orders are prepared quickly.

Fresh but bland.

Our party of two ordered a lamb salad and chicken sandwich. Both were bland, entirely devoid of any zing. 

Ingredients were fresh, and the interior is pleasant. Prices are a bit more than other Mediterranean sandwich places nearby, which is why I hoped for something more than just OK.
I'm always in this area and order Togo.  I always order the salad, they have a few choices, lamb, chicken, pork and white potato.  All of them are very delicious and service is very fast.

Every time we're in the city visiting my daughter who attends college, we go to Souvia if we have a taste for Mediterranean food. The chicken salad and wrap is amazing. Love the Greek fries and yogurt with baklava crumbs.

Just tried Souvla's black sheep "lamb" gyro. Was DELICIOUS!!! So tender and filled with flavor. Could not tell it was vegan meat. I had stopped eating at Souvla when I went vegetarian (didn't love the sweet potato option) and am so glad to be able to come back.
Very oily and not tasty. Oil was dripping and we couldn't even finish it. Do not recommend

This place is super good! I got a veggie sandwich, fries, and the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey. I loved the flavors and they all balanced nicely. I would definitely recommend it!

Came here solely for the frozen Greek yogurt. I got it once a long time ago at another location and have been craving it ever since. Today, I tried the Greek Sour Cherry Syrup. I also took a few scoops of my friend's baklava and honey flavor. For some reason, it just didn't hit the same as when I initially got it. I think they were skimping on the toppings and the baklava was kind of mushy. Sour cherry syrup was interesting and tasty but I felt like it was missing another texture component like how the baklava acts as a granola.

I've been wanting to try this place in Hayes Valley  for quite some time now. Finally got the chance this past weekend. You have to order at the counter and then you will get a number. Seating is first come, first serve. Then the food will be delivered to your table. The restaurant isn't too big so it may be hard to find seating at peak hours. 

I ordered the Salad with Mary's Free-Range Chicken to share with a friend since we both weren't too hungry. The salad was very fresh and definitely not boring at all! The chicken was perfect. I enjoyed the navel oranges, fennel, and pickled red onions in the salad. Everything went so well together. It was probably one of the best salads that I have ever had. I thought the portion was definitely enough for two people. We also ordered a side of the Greek Fries. The toppings on the Greek Fries were amazing and the fries were cooked perfectly. 

But my favorite thing about this place was the Frozen Greek Yogurt!!! I did notice a lot of people ordering at the counter was just getting the Frozen Greek Yogurt to go. We ordered the Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup one because that was what the staff recommended. The Baklava was a little too sweet for me though. The frozen Greek yogurt was yummy. It was not too sweet and just perfect. I do want to try the Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt next time. If you're in the city, you should stop by and check out this place, or at least grab a frozen Greek yogurt to go!

It's been a long time coming but after many, many more trips (50+) to Souvla, I've found the quality of the chicken salad just can't be beat. Back when I left my first review, it was during their early days of opening. Even though my criticism was harsh, I'm glad they've improved in all the areas that I mentioned. From the tenderness of the meat, to the portions, to the service. I am so impressed by how far they've come too, opening other locations and sharing their delicious rotisserie chicken. I can now say, it's one of my favorite things to get when I'm craving Mediterranean food.

This is my favorite salad spot in the city but I only give 4 stars just because with the price being so high, you'd think they'd give you a side of hot sauce and utensils for free (I'm paying $17 for a salad and I can't get a free fork?) Their frozen yogurt is also super delicious too! 
My favorite is the chicken salad Greek style but I recommend picking it up right when you order it because the fries and chicken get cold pretty quickly if not picked up right when it's made. The olive oil froyo and baklava froyo are really really good too

Souvla is a clearly crowd favorite and I can see why.

Their Greek Yogurt and Greek Fries are phenomenal and, in my opinion, the stars of the show (there have been times when I ordered those two in lieu of a real meal). Their chicken salad is also excellent - fresh, great contrast of flavors and textures, and healthy. Prices are reasonable for the quality of their ingredients and portion sizes are reasonable as well. 

If they were closer to my house, I'd go more often.

They are literally my go to place for salad. I always order the lamb salad and a glass of their rose. And if im feeling bad, i'll order some garlic fries on the side. Their greek yogurt is also really good too. They do get a little crowded tho, but you can always order for takeout.

I ordered via doordash and as expected the fries came soggy but nothing a toaster oven can't fix! 
I got the pork shoulder salad as well and I've never seen so much protein included in a salad which was a pleasant surprise. The portions were hearty but wish there was a different kind of dressing than just olive oil. Luckily I ordered the extra yogurt sauce to contribute.
Next time, I'll visit in person so I can try it fresh :)

Humm....when I think of "Greek" or "Mediterranean" fare I usually think of something kinda.."Festive". I'm not a connoisseur of this type of cusine, but I know when it's supposed to be good. I like eating cultural foods when you can taste not only the authenticity of the food. But you can taste the effort and the love that is put into the food to make it an experience. I didn't get that here, if anything I left feeling unsatisfied. IDK, this place missed the mark for me in a lot of areas, and now I will proceed to tell you why "Souvla" isn't memorable..

"Souvla"
Location - San Francisco, Ca (Hayes Valley)
Food - Mary's Free Range Chicken (Sandwich), Greek Fries
Price - $20.50 (Before Tax), $22.27 (After Tax)

Souvla:
This establishment is a little greek/mediterranean styled eaterie in the "Hayes Valley" area of San Francisco. Being the size that it is and of course the times we're living in at the moment. The have limited indoor seating with avaliable "Parklet" seating outside for those that want to dine right away. Sitting on a popular street with small tapas eatablishments and little bars. The area "Souvla" definately seems to be hip and kinda trendy. Having never been to this area much on my SF excursions (don't judge me) I was at first delighted to take the road less traveled for me and to try something completely new for me as well. I went with a friend of mine and he suggested "Souvla" because he said the food was light and healther than my usual choices. I decided to take him up on his word and pay this place a visit, of course after looking at the rest of the "Yelpire" had to say about this establishment. Let me tell you what I thought of what I ordered..

Mary's Free Range Chicken (Sandwich) $15.50 - This was more of a pita wrap than a typical sandwich. They offer pretty much the filling of this wrap in a salad form as well for $1 more. This sandwich wrap consisted of  Granch (Greek Yogert/Ranch) dressing, Fennel, Navel Orange, Pickled Red Onion, Pea Shoots and Mizithra Cheese (Almost like Feta) and I have to say this was a lackluster sandwich. Very bland, but also light....considering the ingredients of course. Like everything would of meshed so much better if everything paired up and had come flavors. The price of this sandwich may seem steep, but everything they serve here is for the most part locally sorced and or from substanable sources in the Bay Area. The size was nice, but it felt like I wasn't eating anything with flavor. The sometimes bold in your face flavors that Greek/Mediterranean food tend to have was missing here....like the deserts miss the rain. Kinda a letdown.

Greek Fries - $5.00 - Well for being fries, I have to say they were pretty good, like they weren't anything too special be any means, but they were simple and..good. Fries, not too many people I know that don't like them in some way shape of form. These were tossed in some olive oil, parsley, and mizithra cheese crumbles. Just enough to coat them and this was more flavorful than the sandwich in my opinion, it was an okay amount for the price. I wasn't upset by these or the "Granch" dressing they gave you on the side for dipping. 

Overall:
The shortcommings of "Souvla" really came in form of the service for me, especially the woman that was working the front, IDK if she was a manager or just an unpleasant person, but she was pretty rude and blunt. I will note my visit was slightly before reopening, but SF being in the Yellow Tier at the time and the more foot traffic must have been annoying for her. If she huffed and puffed anymore than what she was doing, should of would blown the house down. Not a good look, bad first impression and a lasting one that makes me say I will not visit "Souvla" again. Bland Food and Bad Service is a No from me Dawg!!

It's been a while and I've been to Souvla several times now, and it's only fair to update my review. They've handled the transitions with Covid-19 well, they have a very efficient contactless ordering system. I've had the Lamb wrap, chicken wrap and chicken salad with fries several times now and cannot recommend them enough. Well seasoned, pillowy chewy wrap, crispy well seasoned fries and the garlic aioli?? Yes. Do it. They've been consistent over the last 2 years and I appreciate that. Even when they're not that busy or there's a group of 8 ppl waiting, food has been good. And you MUST MUST have their frozen yogurt. Tangy, lightly sweet and creamy. I am team baklava :)  nice time to go because there's actually parking these days! My friend and I ate our food in the car since there's no outdoor dining and then ordered the frozen yogurt. Best meal in my car hands down!

FDA Review;

Food;
1. Straight forward simple menu focusing on Greek staples (Pitta's and salads)
2. We went for a chicken pitta and salad, definitely fresh and good quality but not amazingly flavorful
3. Recommend salad over the pitta in terms of portion/value 

Drinks:
1. Limited drink options, leaning towards a grab and go spot

Ambience;
1. Cute, well decorated, modern but still in that Mediterranean/Greek vibe 
2. Super clean 

FDA Score
Food: 1.5/2
Drinks: 1/2
Ambience: 1/1 
Total: 3.5/5 (not worthy of the 4, so we stick with 3)

Souvla definitely has flavor, but it's honestly much too pricey for what you get. I went to Souvla for the first time with 5 friends wanting to try the "hype" that this place has. The atmosphere was lively, and the ambience was peaceful. It set me up for a good dinner. 

Regarding food, I ordered the Lamb Sandwich and got the food very quickly! The price was $14, which may seem quite reasonable. However, the thing is, the PORTION SIZE IS SMALL. I finished the sandwich quickly and found myself still hungry after dinner. The salad was $15, and the portion size was similarly much too small for the price. For a fast food-like restaurant, Souvla's prices should definitely be reduced by a few dollars. There is nothing wrong with the taste--it actually tastes very flavorful. However, it's the price that breaks it for me, and I most likely will not be returning.
Forgettable food, but phenomenal greek yogurt. Just go to Truly Mediterranean in the Mission then come to Souvla for dessert.

So good. Repeat customer. Raving review! Salads + wraps, as well as the soft serve greek yogurts are outstanding! Bring your friend or visiting relatives from out of town here! Or just be a frequent, regular customer! Highly recommend!

I really loved the salad I had. It had really generous delicious lamb and a variety of greens. I feel the salad was more on the acidic size, but I believe that was intentional for the meal. Not a chef, but if you need to stay away from acidic food maybe get another salad? I always love to see colorful salads because it is a visual representation of nutrients to me. And Souvla def felt like health when we went. Price is middle of the road. More than I'd like to pay but also it SF.

I got a whole feta-brined chicken for Christmas Eve dinner (the day before) and it was absolutely insanely delicious for the next few days! It's expensive, but it was absolutely worth how tender, flavorful, and juicy it was! 

I also like their chicken salad. A bit expensive, but not really compared to other salad places here and it usually lasts me two meals.

FroYo is fun, but I come for the savory delights!

Delicious chicken wrap in Pita bread!!!! Love the orange slices.
Quick service, friendly staff.

We started off with the Greek frozen yogurt for five dollars a cup. There's four choices (sour cherry, honey, baklava and olive oil with flaky salt).  We tried the baklava and olive oil with flaky salt.  Ask them to omit the salt, it was incredibly salty and tasted like I was licking a giant rock of salt.  Otherwise, the olive oil went well with it and was quite pretty to look at.  The baklava tasted like an oatmeal cookie and was the most substantial one so if you're hungry, this is the one for you.

The pita on the wrap was too chewy and hard for me.  Otherwise, there was tons of pork and veggies.  We asked for the tomatoes and pickled onions to be put on the side and we got two full cups of veggies.  The fries were excellent, very light and crispy and full of flavor but so rich and thick that after a couple of fries, I had to take the rest home.  Come here for fries and frozen yogurt but I've had better wraps.  Still, not a bad place for a cold day especially if you sit next to the chicken rotisserie machine which was really like sitting next to a cozy fire.

It's been awhile since I came to Souvla and it's as delicious as ever. I was in the area and stopped in right before closing time to pick up some Greek yogurt with baklava & honey and a couple bottles of retsina to go. This is still one of my favorite spots for quick food and dessert and their wine is convenient to go and perfectly chilled. 

I'll have to make it a point to eat next time as their salads and wraps are solid and mouthwatering. 

Pros: Delicious food, wine and dessert 
Cons: Can get really busy during peak hours

We went to Souvla several times and had takeout as well. The meats in sandwiches are in cube form instead of fresh shaved meat in most Mediterranean restaurants. Lately these cubes taste very dry especially lamb. I wish they would use freshly shaved meat in their sandwiches. They are juicy.

During this past holiday weekend, my boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted to try somewhere unique to the city but also pretty affordable. After looking up several curated lists, we landed on this place. 

Street parking wasn't too bad on this rainy Sunday, we just walked around the corner. We went in and placed our order with the cashier - he wasn't particularly welcoming or friendly. I guess it's to be expected with a fast casual place. We ordered the pork shoulder sandwich, juicy potatoes,  avgolemono soup, and frozen yogurt with baklava crumble. 

The savory parts of our meal were pretty underwhelming. The pork shoulder was pretty tasty, but super salty, and I thought the flavors kind of clashed with the sandwich toppings. The juicy potatoes were fine, a little soft and bland. The soup was too lemony and I couldn't taste the chicken - I've had that soup elsewhere before and it wasn't so strongly lemon flavored before. The frozen yogurt was definitely the highlight. I loved the tartness of the yogurt with the sweetness of the baklava and honey.

This spot was one of the most highly anticipated reopenings since SIP.  I mean...when they finally announced opening their doors (more like windows), peeps were waiting hours prior to get their hands on some good ole salads and froyo.  

I waited a bit though as I heard some people's food took hours!  I've been twice in the past week, ordered ahead, and only waited a handful of minutes.  They're back and still delicious as ever.

I've tried pretty much everything on the menu but the chicken salad has always been my fave.  Throw in a side of fries and some froyo with baklava and call it a day!
Just get the chicken salad and ice tea. It's amazing like 1000's have mentioned. Gotta love the Olive oil!
Tasty, healthy, good value, good portions of salad with their grilled chicken, great fries to balance it.

Love love love the veggie sandwich. The sweet potato makes it so filling and delicious. The olives also add such a tasty complement to the sweet, starchy flavor. Best wrap I've had in the city, would highly recommend!!

I'll admit, I jumped into the Souvla party somewhat late.  I wish I had jumped in earlier!

Souvla is well executed.  Having a small menu with awesome ingredients is a winning formula.  The star of the show is spit-toasted meat.  Souvla does Pork Shoulder, Mary's Chicken and Lamb.  Plus a great Veggie option.  Entrees come in two forms:  Salad or tradition Wrap Sandwich.

All of the wraps have been terrific.  The stand-out was the Mary's Chicken - the navel orange and mizithra cheese go great with the flavorful chicken.  For the folks craving a non-meat option, the White Sweet Potato with Olives is packed with nice flavors and textures.  I was really pleased with the Fries, but I strongly recommend the Juicy Potatoes which come swimming in the drippings from the spit.  I could have these a lot!  Overall, very happy with the food!  (See Photos!)

Food aside, the ambiance is great.  The space is modern and open, plus the smell of the spit...  Mmm!   Love the outdoor seating right on Hayes and it's a great spot on a sunny afternoon.  They built what is essentially a parklet in lieu of the street parking.  I wish more places would do this!

I've never tried the Greek Frozen Yogurt, but everyone I know swears by it.  It's hard to walk far in Hayes Valley without seeing the little blue cups.  It's on my list, and the people sitting next to be right now are raving about it!

Lastly - They do delivery through Grubhub.  My friend gets their salads all the time and loves them.

Glad I finally got to try this place after seeing so many rave reviews. I went with a girlfriend before the craft fair. We grabbed some seats outside after ordering (and beating the lunchcrowd). I did the lamb bowl and of course also had to try the frozen yogurt as well!

The bowl was so good and pretty large portion. I like that it still felt like it was healthyish even though there was generous amount of toppings and meat. The yogurt was the bomb! It definitely helped tie the meal together.

Love this place for offering plant-based lamb as a substitute (with an up charge), but I wish they would also offer plant-based feta, yogurt, tzatziki, etc. Makes little sense to only go part way. There are so many great dairy-free options out there these days!
Good food and beer. Liked the fries too. You don't see many Greek restaurants in town but this is still legit

All I read is that Michelle Obama loved it, and I had to try it. It's in a charming part of Hayes Valley, and we stumbled upon it while walking in the area. It's a great spot if you wish to have a healthier option. Also, I liked the simplicity of the menu.

I tried the Chicken Salad (over the sandwich - tough choice). Ultimately, the pictures were so convincing! I loved that the greens consisted of the dark leafy kale and lettuce, along with other vegetables + fruits. It's truly a colorful salad. The dressing is simple, made w olive oil. It had a bit too much chicken for me, which made it quite filling (I guess that's good news).

I shared an order of the Greek fries. Not part of the healthy menu, but it's hard to resist and worth trying.

It's a bit pricy for lunch type foods, but the quality of the ingredients seem to justify the price. Also, it's in the city.

Do get the pork or lamb. Don't get the chicken. 

Wowee I decided to stray from my normal protein anD tried the Mary's free range chicken today in a sandwich. Bad mistake. The chicken was incredibly dry and flavorless, I tried dousing it in  hot sauce but their hot sauce was bland and not spicy. I didn't want to waste a $14 sandwich so I drank a lot of water and powered through the dryness. The darker meats like lamb and pork are much more flavorful and  juicy.

Do yourself another favor and order the juicy potatoes that have the drippings! Soft tender and so yuMmy. To top it off I highly suggest their frozen yogurt at $5 a pop with the elderflower honey. Yes it's pricy but it's very fragrant and not too sweet. I like the honey the best as the oTher toppings can be overly sweet. 

Sandwiches are tasty in a pita and you can also get it in a  salad but I like the juicyness of all the ingredients together in a little pocket.

Never got a chance to come pre-covid, but we stopped by about a week ago because we really wanted to try the greek yogurt. Also got a lamb gyro to split since I was hungry. We were almost deterred by the line at 2pm and they didn't offer online ordering, but we stuck it out and it moved pretty fast. 

The gyro was pretty big, too big for one meal, but not quite enough for left overs. Pretty good flavor and of course I made a mess dripping sauce and veggies everywhere. My only complaint as that the pita wasn't as soft as I liked (felt a little dry). 
The baklava greek yogurt was amazing. Tart with enough sweet from the honey and a bit of texture. There were other greek yogurt options on the menu and I can't wait to try those.

Would definitely come back to try other items on the menu.
This place was packed when we went! It was delicious. The fries were nice and crispy and the salad was super fresh. Next time I'll try a wrap.

5 stars to the best froyo I've had! Not going to lie when my friends told me Souvla had the best froyo I was hesitant, but hesitant no more! The froyo I had was MIND BLOWINGLY delicious! The baklava was super tasty and it paired well with the flavor of the froyo. As I type this review I am craving this froyo and hoping to get it again this weekend! I also tried Souvla's salads which were very delicious, extremely healthy, and full of nutritious greens! But seriously, THE FROYO THOUGH IS FIRE!!! BAKLAVA CRUMBLES AND SYRUP FROYO!! NEVER FORGET!

Similar to most people, I have only been able to try Greek/Mediterranean food on a limited basis. When I was fortunate enough to have it, it was either from culinary students learning the ropes, or small chain restaurants like Souvla. 

And like most of those experiences, I have not been disappointed. I know it isn't authentic and I wish that we had a greater Greek interest because the culture and especially the food is amazing. The hospitality may seem cold at first BUT trust me (you've seen the, "My Big Fat Greek" movies right?), but hear me out, the love is there and it is especially felt the moment your tastebuds touch any one of their delicious and refreshing plates. 

You don't believe me? Try it for yourself. & while you are at it, buy a meal for someone hanging outside. Let all the things you do be done in love and do good. Be kind, always.

The famous pics of olive oil based yogurt is what brought me here on my 48 hour trip in SF. Limited indoor and outdoor seating but I would say tables flip quickly. On a Saturday night I waited about 10 mins in line, and was able to snag a high top seat right away. 

Not quite used to SF sporadic weather, I was freezing after a brisk walk so soup sounded lovely. Lemons, shredded chicken, olive oil? Count me in! I ordered a soup, lamb gyro wrap and an olive oil yogurt. Food was QUICK (less than 5 mins) and no wait for ice cream if you're dining in and would like it after you're done eating the main meal. 

|| Lemon chicken soup (can't remember the name): 5+ stars. This was the best part of the meal, and I it's extremely underrated here. I ordered a large bowl size, and it comes with a good amount, not tiny at all. The broth itself was delicious, it's like a cross between a standard American chicken noodle mixed with lemons and rice. The lemons were not overpowering. Loved this soup, and can't wait to try and replicate at home 

|| Lamb pita: 4.5 stars. I debated for a while between a salad or the pita but I've heard how incredibly soft and chewy the pita was and couldn't resist. The pita itself was very fluffy and a great size. Toppings were standard but nothing too overpowering to the lamb which again was salty and fatty and everything you want in gyro. It was a tad on the salty side but otherwise  I would order this again 

|| Olive oil yogurt: 3 stars. I think this was a bit of a disappointment and I think it was personal preference. The yogurt itself was great - it's similar to a tart flavored yogurt you'd find at your favorite yogurt place (but better). I wasn't a fan of the olive oil and sea salt. It just didn't work for me on a yogurt, but I would say give it a try. The actual olive oil was golden yellow and of very high quality 

Overall, between how fast service was to ambiance and quality of food Souvla is a 5. Def recommend trying the soup, I think it's the best on the menu!

Chicken Salad! Get itttt! Healthy, and delicious!
(This is the only place in the city where $14/salad is totally worth it)

Also always a plus is the Greek Yogurt with cherry syrup!! love the tartness of the cherry and of course amazingly they have wine bottles to go. Everything all at one place. 
+add fries to the salad or on the side. Can't go wrong with friesssss ever. 

Pro tip (non-pandemic times) order online for pick up and skip the waiting line at Hayes. (;

I love the salads here. Pre and post COVID one of the best spots to get a quick bite to eat. My friends and I joke about how their salads are so loaded that it's only a salad by name but in the best way--it's filled with the most delicious toppings and is such a flavorful dish you can't go wrong. I always add in the sweet potatoes because I think it's so good.

Outdoor seating is available but this location is also situated close to a cute park area so I've taken it to-go and eaten it there. It's a little pricey for a salad but not unusual for SF and the portions are good!

The long bookmarked Souvla was finally crossed off my list this weekend and I am SO satisfied. If you're in the Hayes you might as well add this as one of your stops in the area. 

While the line may seem long when you walk up to the restaurant, it does go by fairly quickly. They have two registers but they break it out by placing your order for your yogurt before you get to the main register to order your entrees. 

Located in the Hayes you can opt to grab a seat inside, but they do have a communal sitting area outdoors  

| WHAT WE GOT | 

+ Lamb Sandwich - Not your typical gyro! I loved that the lamb slices were nice chunks instead of the standard strips of meat. The lamb was tender and paired well with the feta and thinly cut slices of cucumber. The red onions were a nice flavor change to what I'm used to. 

+ Chicken Salad - If you're not feeling the lamb this is a great alternative to go with. The portion size is huge and enough to share. The chicken here was tender and fennel and pea shoots were tasty combos. I'm not a huge fan of fruits in my salads but it did add a nice citrus flavor to the salad. 

+ Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Crumble & Honey Syrup - I'm typically skeptical since I'm not the biggest fan of greek yogurt, but the froyo here was not too tart which I liked. The baklava crumble was savory but I with that it was a little more toasted. Can't go wrong with their honey syrup. YUM.

+ Greek Fries - A must get with your order if you don't add it to your salad. The fries are crisped to perfection and had nice flavor with the lemon/parsley without it being soggy. 

Did I mention that all of the above got to our table is less than 10 mins!? SUPER QUICK service. Staff here is super friendly as well.

Years later, Souvla still remains one of the things I crave whenever I make a trip into SF. All of their salads and wraps are delicious, but I especially love their lamb salad. Their fries are amazing as well! Of course, don't forget to get the baklava greek yogurt soft serve. Tip: Ask them to layer half the baklava in the middle then half on top, otherwise the default is just a huge glob of baklava on top at the very end.

*** In Short ***

Incredibly disappointing Greek.

*** In Depth ***

Wow. Despite all the hype I've heard about Souvla in the past, this was hands-down the worst meal I've had in my days on Yelp, earning the questionable honor of being the first restaurant to ever get one star from me.

And why, you ask? Well, in search of something savory after my sweets binge across the street at Salt & Straw, I finally decided to knock Souvla off my bookmarks, opting to try their lamb pita. And instead of whatever praise that everyone's given it, I was met with dry, overcooked lamb, served in hard, dense, pita bread that I had to gnaw on in order to break off. This was so much work that I gave up towards the end, just opting to eat the filling, because even as difficult as that was, the Asian in me couldn't let (paid) food go to waste like that. At least the flavors were okay?

I can't see myself ever coming here again for their food, but I might still take a chance on their frozen yogurt.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The seating here is mixed, with a variety of high top counter seating and low top chairs, but you can definitely find accessible seats.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out.
I'll give you guys 4 stars only because salad was delicious and Greek beer was on point - BUT the lamb sandwich was dry and little flavorless. I will be back so you guys can redeem yourself :-)

Souvla is my go to when I'm looking for something on the healthy side. I typically order on Caviar! I have gotten the same order for years: vegetable salad + chicken. So, so yummy. 

I recommend getting the dressing on the side as I typically only eat half in one seating. If you're a dressing fan, get an extra garlic yogurt dressing on the side

If you're feeling dessert, I love the yogurt w/ olive oil and sea salt!
reviews.reviewerLocation: South of Market, San Francisco, CA

reviews.text:
The food here is GREAT. The review is about a staff member that doesn't have manners.

Today I was trying to order pickup through DoorDash/Caviar and I kept on getting errors as I was driving to Souvla from work. I tried for about 20 min. 

When I arrived at the Hayes location, I told the person taking my order that the DoorDash/Caviar apps were not working. She relayed the message to a guy with glasses (I think it was Miguel) and he immediately waved his hand in front of the pickup orders on the shelves and said it's working fine in a dismissive tone.

All I was trying to point out was that there was an error from DoorDash/Caviar in processing orders on my phone. Instead, I got a defensive reply like I'm the one who doesn't know how to order and it's my fault for having to order in person.

I work hard helping people every day at my job. Having to deal with someone who is rude for no reason is just a waste of my time and money

My friend has been raving about this place for a while and I finally got the chance to go try it! My group ordered pork, lamb and veg sandwiches, juicy potatoes, greek fries, and greek olive oil and flaky sea salt frozen greek yogurt. All their sandwiches were delicious and the greek fries were well seasoned. The potatoes were small in portion and just okay, not worth it for the price. The frozen greek yogurt was unique and delightful and refreshing but definitely to be shared with at least 2 people. It was sweet, salty, and tart all at the same time. However, the staff was rude and unfriendly. Customer service can be improved.
Best chicken soup ever. Casual dining with a great staff! The best shield to any kind of pandemic is souvla chicken soup!
Incredibly disappointing. Got more attention from the flies than the staff. Went with an open mind and left feeling like I'd been duped.

I work often in Hayes Valley, and Soul has been my go to restaurant for years.
I used to love the lamb there, either in a wrap, or on a salad.
But, lately the lamb has been on the dry side. This has been the case on repeated visits, and also experienced by some friends as well. Not sure what is going on there, and I will be back to try it again!

I came here to pick up some food before a picnic. I got the veg salad. It was good but it was a bit too acidic for my liking. It had quite a bit of cheese on top so if you're not a fan of cheese I recommend letting them know. I wasn't impressed by their veg option because it tasted okay, nothing really stood out. But my friends enjoyed the meat option which I didn't try. The fries were good. Also they do not give utensils unless you ask for them so be sure to ask if you plan on enjoying this on a picnic.
I ordered the lamb sandwich and it was so dry. The meat was not juicy at all. Very disappointed for a Greek...Lamb Gyro

Holy moly the salad here is A M A Z I N G. I took an order of their Mary's Free Range Chicken Salad to go and the smell was doing all sorts of magic to my nose I couldn't wait to dig in. It was 110% worth the wait. All these different flavors blending together: sweet oranges, tart Greek yogurt, juicy chicken, bitter greens to make a party in your mouth. For a salad, the price is definitely on the pricier side but I honestly got full after only eating half of a portion so it's a hefty amount of food. 

The wait was nonexistent as the to go order came out instantly. The ambiance is great for a date with lit candles or you can take it to go and eat it with the view of the Painted Ladies in the back ( which is what I did). Can't wait to go back and try their different meats and wraps!!
I just love their frozen yogurt with crumbled baklava and honey! Soury sweet deliciousness!

I love Souvla for so many reasons. This location is like the others I've visited...busy, minimal, clean, great food. The guy behind the counter gave great customer service and answered my questions regarding gluten and dairy free options. I really love their salad and have tried the pork and chicken (I think I prefer the chicken slightly more). Take my advice and order either the potatoes or the fries with your meal. They know how to do taters! Also : granch. That's all I have to say.

Seriously, the salads are so good.

Overhyped and a bit pricey - the sandwich I tried here was just "pretty ok" (2.5/5). However, the convenience and speed/efficiency are major pluses, so I'm rounding up for that, the great service I received here, and their delicious Greek yogurt froyo.

Recommended:
-Frozen Greek yogurt ($5) - I've tried this with both the Cretan wildflower honey and the olive oil and sea salt toppings, and I recommend the latter if you like more adventurous flavor combinations. The honey sounded good in theory but solidified on the frozen yogurt very quickly, so eating it wasn't that enjoyable. The froyo itself is creamy, not overly sweet, and slightly tangy - I really like it.

OK:
-Greek fries ($5) - nothing too remarkable but they're good fries! Topped with olive oil, mizithra cheese, parsley, and lemon.
-Breakfast sandwich ($13) - pita with scrambled eggs, rice, feta, avgolemono, and meat of your choice - I got this with Mary's free-range chicken. It was mostly good (and mostly rice/pita/egg) but the chicken was dry, and the pita felt very thick and dry. I would probably order a bowl instead of a sandwich on future visits since I don't think their pita quality is that great.

Souvla I'm giving you 5 stars because I love your food prior to covid, but I will not be returning until I know I won't have to wait in an hour long line to pickup my order. Your system is extremely inefficient to say the least.

I saw the woman at the window take minutes to find my name on the bag because it wasn't organized whatsoever. There must have been 100 people in that line waiting for their orders. I spent $30 on cold food. Threw my fries in trash though my froyo was perfect.

Please get consultants to figure out a better way!!! Will check back on yelp page to hopefully see you fix things in near future.

I came here with a friend in the afternoon. This Souvla is a lot smaller than the one I've been to on Divisadero. However, this location has a nice patio out front, strongly recommend on a nice, sunny day. 

I ordered the chicken salad, while my friend ordered the pork sandwich. We also got a side of the Greek fries. The total came out to be around $40. 

My salad was just okay, nothing really extraordinary. The chicken was slightly dry and it lacked flavor. My friend's pork sandwich was pretty big, she only finished about half and asked for a to go box. As for the fries, we only ate about 8-10 pieces and just left the rest there. The Greek fries were a bit soggy and plain even with the dipping sauce. 

Factoring in the price and tastiness, I probably won't be coming back unless I'm getting their frozen yogurt with baklava.

Another day. Another Yelp adventure. This one was an after 5pm adventure. The point of going out tonight was to visit the San Francisco Zen Center for the first time. The Zen Center is near Hayes Valley, so I found myself wanting to have a fun meal in Hayes Valley at the Mediterranean restaurant Souvla...

Souvla has a limited menu and it's fast casual food. I decided on the pork shoulder wrap, which is like a gyro, but not exactly a gyro. The pork shoulder wrap was $12 and cheaper than the chicken wrap by $1. The pork shoulder was like a shredded carnitas. It had feta, tomato, and some cucumber. It was pretty good...I was worried I would find this spot overpriced. 

And to top this meal off, I had the baklava crumbles frozen yogurt for $5. It was pretty good. It could have had more baklava crumbles. The vanilla froyo itself was average. I didn't order a drink here.

The seating is limited and for people to have a quick bite. Souvla is popular in Hayes Valley and I believe they have other locations, but it's a treat...and an experience.

Been to Souvla two times now and I've had a good experience so far. The service is nice and I like that they have decent amount of seating both indoors and outdoors. The line gets long during lunch time, so make sure you plan accordingly.

I grabbed a pork wrap and baklava Greek yogurt. 
The pork wrap was nice and juicy. It was seasoned well, which made it pair great with the pickled onions and feta. It was a bit messy because the juice from the meat dripped, but other than that, it was solid! 

The Greek yogurt was huge. I grabbed the baklava one because I'm a pretty big fan of the pastry, but I think their version was okay. It was more doughy than anything. It resembled dough and honey and was a bit underwhelming. The yogurt itself was nice, the perfect tartness and perfect consistency. I don't think I would grab this again, but I would consider getting the yogurt itself!

I love this place. Casual place with consistently good food.

I've gotten their salads and their wraps with chicken or lamb. I've even gotten their frozen yogurt desserts (the baklava crumble and sea salt with olive oil). All amazing.

This particular visit, we went with my parents for a last minute dinner. Since it was a holiday weekend (and most people tend to leave town), we figured it would be the best time to take them to Souvla since you can't exactly make reservations here.

We lucked out and found a table for four outside in the parklet area. My dad and bf ordered inside and then we picked the food up when it was ready! The staff still services the parklet area by clearing dishes and cleaning tables, but since it is outside, unfortunately you cannot drink any alcoholic beverages out there.

We all ordered the Mary's chicken salad and it was delicious as usual. We also split a couple of frozen yogurts and were stuffed by the time we left our table.

Thanks again for another delicious meal!

Their frozen yogurts are the best!! I personally like the plain version since it is the perfect blend of sweet and tarry ness. If you do like your desserts extra sweet, wildflower honey is quite nice and many friends love the extra add-one. You can't really go wrong with any flavor

aside from sugar, I highly recommend the chicken salad - the yogurt dressing is very addicting as is the hot sauce. They go very well together. Even without dressing, the salad is plenty flavorful. 

I recently tried the lemon drop soup which is quite large and heavy. Could stand alone as a meal on its own.

Contracted food poisoning from their chicken salad - I even took out the chicken and feta/mizithra cheese since it tasted funny but still got hit   8c

I'd steer clear of this location and trek over to Divisadero instead.

The food at Souvla is actually amazing. The big problem is the customer service. Not friendly, you are lucky to eat our food attitude lol. Then I ordered to go. They forgot to include the Greek fries. Always check your order because they will not do it for you. ;)
Tasty Mediterranean food and fairly priced. I liked the falafel the most in my wrap but the fries were probably the best part - def need to buy them

In all honesty, does a salad ever get you excited?  Ever since I saw all the pics and heard all the hype over Souvla's chicken salad, I've been wanting to try them out. Let's face it, the cheese may not make it healthy.  But it's a big, quality salad.

I was afraid of a wait when I got there even though it was before 4:30.  But I placed my order and sat down by the rotisserie spit and within several minutes was presented with my takeout orders of one chicken wrap and one pork wrap.  However when we were ready to indulge, we noticed on his pork wrap box it stated lamb.  I couldn't tell if was lamb and taste wise it didn't taste gamey like lamb can be.  This was disappointing how they likely got the order wrong.  We don't eat lamb, but I guess on the flip side it didn't taste like lamb from what I remember (it's been at least 10-15 years for me).  Wraps and salads have the same contents aside from the pita wrap, and salads tend to be $1 more. 

Hubs and I usually go with the chicken salad anytime we go.  The salad consists of romaine (pre Romaine E.
