We got the pork wrap and a lamb salad, one honey yogurt, one baklava yogurt, french fries and juicy potatoes. I was slightly disappointed with my lamb as it was dry and tough. The pork was good. The french fries were phenomenal. We got the garlic sauce to go with it. The juicy potatoes were good. But the fries were the bomb. Go with that if you have to choose. The yogurts were really good too. I guess I'd have to come back and try the lamb again.

Looking for a lunch place near Symphony Hall, we decided to give Souvlaki a try. It was bookmarked after turning up near the top of a year end list of the most requested restaurant destinations by Uber and Lyft riders.

Seating is communal with long shared tables. Don't come here to discuss trade secrets or your sex life.

The menu is remarkably simple:
1 - pick one of chicken, pork, lamb or vegetable. 
2 - salad or rolled sandwich?
3 - beverage
4 - artisan frozen yogurt (this is SF)

We had two vegetable salads. No complaints there.
Good mix of fresh ingredients, with marinated roast potato slices giving something to chew on.

Haute, it's not. But a good healthy lunch for less than $12.

Be not discouraged, the line goes by fast.

Game plan:
- Order the sweet potato salad (maybe with a side of chicken or lamb). The sandwich version is phenom as well. 
- Baklava crumbles Greek yogurt (hold for pick-up post salad).
- Scope seating area and snag a spot, pronto. 
- Savor the meal with gusto. 

Conclusion:
- Happy belly, happy heart.

Farmhouse farmfresh fabulous. 

Wandered in for lunch and had an excellent experience. This is the place to go for that perfect combo of great fresh food, ease and comfort, and a great place for a conversation. 

Fresh salads and salady flatbread sandwiches with rotisserie chicken, lamb, pork shoulder or sweet potatoes. Dressed and garnished beautifully. 

Community tables as well as stool height tables for two. The place is buzzing but not hectic feeling. 

Order at counter and sit for five mins until your food arrives. 

PS-- I saw someone with a bottle of rosé and don't know if they BYO'd or bought at Souvla, but THAT would make this six stars for sure.

I hadn't been to Souvla in a year and a half, and was super excited to go back for a recent lunch meeting. I'm a huge fan of the quality of their products and it's simple, yet efficient concept. 

This time around I was introduced to lovely off menu salad combo which I didn't know was possible. It was half chicken and half lamb, then added the "Greek Style" which is a pile of fries on top. Yum! After all, everything is better with french fries, right? The salad was amazingly tasty and I wolfed the whole thing down in about 15 minutes. Whoops :)

Try this combo if you haven't already. Solid 5 stars.

Very cute lunch spot. My honey and I shared the Mary's chicken salad, seasoned potatoes and the greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. The salad was a really nice proportion and great chicken. The potatoes were salty and delish, we topped it with the housemade hot sauce. The yogurt was so flipping good! Sometimes you get hit with a little too much salt but the yogurt itself was 10/10.

3.5 stars. 
Breakfast pita sandwich- mostly egg and rice. Too much carb-on-carb. There was also shredded chicken, but it tasted kind of dry and didn't taste much like rotisserie chicken.

Lamb salad- lots of fresh veggies, good amount of lamb. 

Baklava crumble frozen yogurt- yum! A cup of perfectly tart frozen yogurt topped with baklava crumbles and honey.
Love the baklava soft serve. This place is great to eat a meal that's not too heavy but delicious

It's very good Chicken Gyro Sandwich and the lemon soda also was pretty good but I wish they would sell chicken plates only for those that don't care for carbs.   Price is on the high side for a sandwich and soda ($17) but you can taste the quality rotisserie chicken in the wrappers.

Souvla offers food that doesn't make me feel guilty when I eat it.

Opa +'s!
+ Options are simple and so is the food. The wraps and salads come with different meat choices.
+ Taste. Overall it feels healthy and light which is sometimes the better way to go when you are shopping in Hayes.
+ Speed. They move fast. Be ready with your order and be on the lookout for a place to sit.
+ Greek fries. I have to call it out because they are really good. Not quite like the potatoes I had in Greece but on par.
+ Fro-yo with baklava. Really a nice ending to already a fairly healthy meal.

Ooph -'s!
- Long lines. Unfortunately this plan attracts a crowd even at odd hours. Who eats lunch at 2pm on a Saturday? Apparently everyone.

Souvla serves simple and quality food. It's a nice stop if you don't mind the wait and need to recharge for more shopping on Hayes.

Highly overrated in my opinion. 
I got the greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles and the veg sandwich. The sandwich was so dry and bland. The filling is basically just a sweet potato and some olives. There was no flavor whatsoever. The frozen yogurt was decent. I didn't like it at first, but it grew on me. It is very tart and the only sweetness comes from the topping. I would go back to try the olive oil option. I tried one of my friends' greek fries and that was the clear winner of the meal. There is only 1 bathroom so be prepared for a 20 minute wait if you need to go. There wasn't any open seating at about 5pm on a Saturday so we ate at the park area outside the restaurant.

I thought the food here  was great! Both my friend and I got the vegetarian salads and they were super filling! Of course, I had to try the fries and those also didn't disappoint. 

This is a great spot to Come if you want a relatively short meal and something on the healthier side to fill you up. 

I also recommend trying their Greek yogurt with baklava!

My friend and I had such a good time here for lunch! It was our first time trying it, but the person working there was so kind and patient with us. We ended up ordering the chicken sandwich, fries, and a frozen yogurt (which he offered to split the flavor so we could try more than one! I don't think this is a menu option so we really appreciated it)! Everything was flavorful and very refreshing, but I most highly recommend the baklava froyo. Food was delicious and I'm still glowing from the wonderful service. I'll definitely be back!

I ordered the chicken wrap and it was really good. The ingredients seemed super fresh! I was hoping to try the Greek yogurt ice cream but didn't have any room left in my stomach. Maybe next time!

My only complaint is that seating is hard to find

Shout out to my CA friend, Hayley B., for introducing me to this place while we were in SF for job training! Disclaimer: I've only tried their frozen greek yogurt for dessert after lunch but it was REALLY GOOD frozen greek yogurt.

The frozen greek yogurt comes in 4 different topping variations: 1) Sour cherry, 2) Olive Oil, 3) Baklava & 4) Honey. I got their frozen greek yogurt with baklava and it's probably one of my top favorite frozen treats I've had yet. The yogurt was more on the rich and creamy side with the perfect amount of sweetness and tartness. The baklava had a nice flaky and buttery texture to it. But what impressed me the most was the baklava's flavor. The combination of spices (it reminded me of cinnamon, cardamom and maybe nutmeg) that they used shocked my tastebuds and was an excellent addition to my frozen greek yogurt.

The place itself is pretty casual and gets packed real fast. Can't wait to come back to try out their food though because their gyros and fries looked super good that I regret not making lunch plans here in the first place.

Food here is awesome and the frozen greek yogurt, YUMMMMMM! I got the lamb sandwich and it was a great choice. Great flavor and just the right amount to be full, but not overly so. Still had enough room for some dessert! 

Honestly, the downside to this place is the size. It was super chaotic trying to find a place to sit. There was kind of a line, but then people came out of nowhere and swiped a table. If you're there at peak time, be prepared. Also, because of the size, coming with a big group could be a challenge. 

Food was good, staff was nice, next time I'd just get my meal to go from the start and avoid the stress of finding a place to sit.

As a vegetarian, I look forward to trying different foods that may be tasty and healthy! This veg sweet potato sandwich was definitely healthy but I'm not sure if it was the tastiest. I wish it had more flavor, sauce or a kick to it! Overall the sandwich was bland and felt dry. The fries (not featured) were pretty good, but the baklava frozen yogurt was the best!! I asked for more baklava on top and the individual graciously gave me more without charge which was super nice of them! The vibe is also fun, especially since this location is in hayes valley, you can chill outside and enjoy your meal and company!

Souvla's been on my radar forever, but the long lines scared me away. What if it wasn't as delicious as the hype made it to be?! Given the amount of praise Souvla gets, it definitely wouldn't have been difficult for it to be over-talked. However, I'm happy to report that Souvla did not disappoint.

Given the lines, get here early if you want to eat here, as it definitely fills up. I came at around 530 pm on a Monday because I was super hungry! There was only one table free, so I quickly ordered and snagged it. There weren't too many people in line, so my chicken salad and fries came quickly.

This salad. is. the. bomb. It tastes amazing and is super refreshing. Your taste buds and body will thank you for giving it yummy nutrients. No lie. And, if you thought it couldn't get any better, it's also super filling! I devoured my meal like a savage.

While my experience was pretty great, I gotta emphasize again that it's all a matter of timing! Fast forward 30 minutes and there was a line out the door. It stayed that way for the next hour, when we finally vacated. There was never an empty table, and in fact, there were people waiting around for tables for at least 20 minutes. Luckily, it seems like with long lines it takes longer for the food to come out, allowing people enough time to hope for an empty table before their food is served.

I'm on a 4 star rating binge... this place is a solid spot for someone who doesn't get this type of food very often, read: a Midwesterner who eats the same stuff over and over again.  

The fries come out piping hot, be ware or happy, your choice.  

I had the lamb... good flavor, great toppings and a few dip and sauce options. 

I had the beer, which i hadn't had before.  Pretty good, nothing amazing or standout, but it wasn't bad.  

Clean interior and friendly service.  Need a quick, safe place to eat at a reasonable SF price?   Here is the spot.

I came here because I heard the hype about Souvla in San Francisco. We came after seeing a show at the Orpheum theater and it was about a 10-minute drive from there. There was only street parking in the area so that made it hard to park there but that is to be expected in San Francisco. I got the free-range chicken wrap with a side of the garlic greek fries. The good was good don't get me wrong, but I don't think it lived up to the hype for me. The chicken wrap was slightly dry and I think it would be better with some more of the sauce in there. The hot sauce that came at the table was not hot at all. And the garlic fries were not garlicky at all. That being said the chicken was fresh and the fries were perfectly crispy. I would come back but I do not think that this place is as good as everyone says it is. Perhaps they were having an off day.

A cute, very Bay Area - esque Mediterranean restaurant. I came to the Hayes Valley location, since I was meeting some college friends here, but I believe there are other locations throughout SF. 

Here's what we ordered: 

Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup - the tanginess and creaminess of the greek yogurt goes so well with the crispy filo layers of the baklava crumbles and the sweet and sticky honey syrup. I can see why people would come for this dessert alone, esp on a relatively warm SF afternoon like when I was there. 

Greek Fries - salty, crunchy, fried potato deliciousness - what more could you honestly ask for? They top theirs with some olive oil, lemon juice, and cheese that makes for an extra salty and acidic punch that helps to make it an interesting french fry to snack on. 

Roasted White Sweet Potato - this is a great vegetarian dish that has all your classic Mediterranean flavors in a light, refreshing summer-y dish. 

There was a little bit of a wait at this location, mainly because this location doesn't have much seating. They do have some indoor and outdoor seating, but as with most downtown restaurants, there just isn't a lot of chairs, so if you want to - take it to go and enjoy it while sitting in the lawn/park area right across the street.

Wanted to continue to give support to one of my favorite restaurants in the city during this crazy time! Everything on the menu is super tasty, but
my favorite thing to order is the chicken salad and Greek yogurt drizzled with honey. (Tip: My boyfriend loves adding the fries into his salad) The hot sauce is also divine...I probably dump way too much into my salad but it is just that good! Line goes by fast and interior is tasteful. I've taken friends here when they visit me and they always say Souvla was one of their faves.

This is the BEST Mediterranean food I've had in the US period. Beats even the most authentic home cooked meals! My brother said it was the closest food he's tasted that compared to overseas.

Atmosphere: crowded! Sunday at 3:30 there's a line out the door! The line takes a while, but once you order it only takes 5-10 minutes for the food to come out. Tip: order a Greek yogurt with baklava while you wait! You won't regret it! 

Greek yogurt with baklava: absolutely the creamiest tart ice cream I've ever had. It's tartness is perfectly balanced by the sweet crispy baklava. It's a match made by heaven. We loved it so much, we came back an hour later for a second one!

Pork shoulder sandwich: extremely juicy! A little greasy for my taste, but never the less delicious! It comes packed with so much meat! It's a big portion and depending on how hungry you are can be shared between two people.

Lamb sandwich: also juicy and delicious! Comes with chunky meat instead of thing strips like many other Mediterranean places. Less greasy in my opinion too!

Fries: even their fries are delicious! Every bite is perfectly crisp on the outside but still soft on the inside. I can't quite explain it but they were the best fries I've ever had.

Overall:
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 5
Taste: 5

Definitely worth the wait! Had to give five stars for the food experience on its own!

Overrated chain, IMO. Salad dressing is SO HEAVY and the food is actually pretty expensive for being not that great and it being a seat-yourself establishment. 

I think the best part about Souvla is their frozen Greek yogurt -- would recommend if you decide to go to a Souvla location. It is like the tart original flavor of froyo but thicker and more delicious. I got the one with crushed baklava on top with honey drizzle. YUMMY!!

Came here for take out after having awful sushi around the corner. I got the chicken salad and my sister got the lamb sandwich. Both really yummy (well she said it was).

My only qualm is I found huge chicken bones in my salad... I didn't notice til biting down into one super hard which sucked. I'm glad the food is fresh but you guys need to be careful!!! If I would have swallowed it there'd be serious problems. 

But the food was good and fast and did the job.

You know when you're thinking about a really specific food, make a friend date to go check it out, and they're closed. Then you stand outside dreaming about what could have been...Well this ALMOST happened to me during my recent visit to Souvla. I drove into SF from Oakland (HEY SOUVLA...OPEN A LOCATION IN OAKLAND PLEASE!), after hyping it up a ton. I know the spot isn't huge and I'm used to seeing a line out the door, but they were under construction for three weeks. 

Luckily, we got food at their pop up food truck around the corner! 

I forgot to take photos because I gobbled down my juicy roasted chicken with pickled red onions, fresh greens, mizithra cheese, and sweet peeled mandarin oranges too soon. My friend wasn't super into Mediterranean food, but she was sold on the lamb wrap too. Really generous portions. 

The fries are the greatest. They have Greek soda, we got the cherry flavor, and the fries are delicious. Have I mentioned the fries yet in this review? They come with some grated cheese and fresh parsley (i think) on top, plus you get a choice of dipping sauces.

Went to pick up my order when it was ready after having placed it (and paid) online on their specific app when they told me it was ready. I arrived only to find a line around the corner!!! For pick up!!!! 
Of course the order was ready but it would take 30 min just to get to the window! 
Why don't they just grab 6 bags and start calling our their names rather than go 1 by 1 by 1 and make everyone stand outside. Ridiculous.

This is the best Greek "fast food" spot in the city!  I got the Mary's Free Range Chicken and my husband opted for the Superior Farms Lamb Leg--we both got the "sandwich" (which is more like a wrap). Both sandwiches were SO GOOD! Chicken was full of flavor and not at all dry. Lamb was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. We also shared the Greek Fries, which was flavorful and crispy. 

We went to the Hayes St. location, which gets crazy busy during lunch time. Service is wonderful--friendly staff and food comes out quickly. The restaurant is small with a few tall tables and a communal table. We noticed that most people take their food to go and head over to the nearby park. To avoid a long wait, it's best to arrive as soon as they open. Definitely worth the wait though!

I over-order every time I come here and don't regret it. 

MUST TRY:
lamb/pork sandwich
lamb/pork salad
veggie salad (the sweet potatoes complement so well with the olive pieces)
bottle of rosé (very affordable & delicious)
Greek fries 
frozen yogurt (I like mine plain because it's sweet as is. I feel like the cherry sauce, baklava, and/or honey makes it too sweet).

I do not enjoy their chicken here. It's a bit too dry. I do like coming to this location but the one on Divisadero is bit more spacious.

April 2018 Update: 
One staff member was mean last time. He chastised me for ordering my lamb salad in a to-go container if I was going to sit and eat. I am only able to eat 1/2 a salad each time and always always always take home the 2nd half. I told him this, and he responded saying the containers are part of a program where they don't want the containers to be left in the streets, and then walked off (what?!). The frustrating part was that he disregarded my reason. Not to mention, they had plenty of seating when I was there so it wasn't a space issue. So disappointed as I've been a loyal customer. Still a big fan of the food.

Old Review:
Just adore this restaurant. Food is filling, fresh, and healthy. Quality and service are consistently great. Atmosphere is bright, chic, and super clean.

My favorites are the lamb salad, all the Greek yogurts, and the Greek sodas.

Perfect for lunch or a quick dinner. You order at the counter, grab your own seat, they bring the food out to you. 

During lunch and dinner, seats fill up very quickly and there may be a wait to sit (5-20 min).

So good! Came on a Saturday night and was able to get a table because service is quick! Order at the counter and take a seat! I got the chicken salad and it was so good! Filled with kale, mitzithra cheese, chicken, and mandarin slices. Filling and satisfying. My bf got the lamb gyro and it was delish! The bread was insane and the lamb was phenomenal. Get a side of fries with harissa spiked yogurt dipping sauce...you'll thank me later! You have to end the night with some Frozen Greek yogurt! I got the baklava one and it was supreme! I would definitely visit again!

My favorite place all I have to say is go there once and u will keep returning. Olive oil and salt Greek yogurt and the veg salad are my favorites. I literally crave this place. If ur in the city divisidero and hays in San Fran

I love love love souvla.

I wish I could eat this for three square meals

It is always so fresh and crunchy and fragrant. Whether you get the pork shoulder, lamb, or chicken, you will be happy.

Make sure to always add fries and if you have room after their hefty entree helping, get the baklava for dessert.

Ever looking for a good refreshing salad that is healthy + flavorful, SOUVLA is definitely the way to go. This is my go to spot for salads when i'm craving for something "healthy" and tasty. The portion is huge and they put ample amounts of meat into the salad. You will feel stuffed when you come out- in a good way.  I like to usually get the salad with pork shoulder.

Their menu is quite simple, they have 3 types of main meat that can be made to a wrap or salad.  If you come with a friend, you may want to get a wrap cut in half and a salad split in half. Don't be shy because they are very nice with their service. They will help you split it into 2 bowls and plates.

They have cheap Rose with generous pouring for those who may want to grab a drink while enjoying their meal. Even though the price is cheap, it don't mean that it tastes bad. It's actually quite refreshing and tasty!

Best salad to ever exist. I always get the chicken salad with light dressing and always leave a happy customer :)

PLEASE OPEN A LOCATION DOWNTOWN!!!! This would shine amidst the average salad options we have over here

YES to everything about Souvla! Love that they also have their spitfire roasting their meat. I have yet to try their other menu options - especially the lamb - but I am in love with their chicken salad. The chicken tastes super fresh, and it's well-spiced without being too salty. I love that the salad incorporates fresh orange slices and pickled onions, both of which pair nicely with the yogurt dressing.

Came here on a Sunday evening. Lot's of people mingling, talking, and eating. Wonderful atmosphere, but hard to talk with your companion among all the other chatter. 

I tried the fries, which were excellent. Definitely choose a dipping sauce, as it adds to the flavor. As I only wanted a little something, this was more than enough. Wish I had tried the yogurt. I did have a bite of the pork sandwich. My friend hated it, but the bite I had was fine. 

Definitely will be going back. And wonderful that there is the park nearby to take food to once the weather begins heating up.
Salads, wraps, fries and yogurt. The chicken lemon rice soup is good too! You can order online and pick up through the window. The line moves quickly too.

Me sitting in front of the window:
Lady who works there trying to figure out how to close window:
Me: I like it open!
Lady: We don't.

Okay... You don't need to be so rude about it. What is this customer service? No apology or explanation? Wouldn't a quick "Sorry!" be so much easier? 

Best $15 chicken salad money can buy.

I've been dreaming of Souvla ever since I went while visiting San Fran last month. After a recommendation from a close friend who lives in the Bay area, my sister and I ended up at this location at primo time on a Friday evening and still had the best time. 

Seating/space is limited in this small shop but the line moves quickly and if you can't find a seat, take it to go and hit the park nearby!

I like the concept here of a super simple menu starting you with four options (pork, chicken, lamb or veggie) and the choice of on pita or on salad. Sides are a la carte and wine is just red, rose, white, or bubbles. They also featured a greek beer and a few sodas. I love not having to stand there and act like I know the wines on the list while ultimately choosing the second least expensive option. So rose it was!  

Both my sister and I got salads so I can't speak for the pita but they looked awesome. I think the salads are the way to go though. This bowl was jam packed with kale, veggies, pork for me, pickled onion, feta, cucumber and so much yummy yogurt sauce. Piled on the kale, it didn't feel too guilty! 

I was so full after this meal that I couldn't quite swing the frozen greek yogurt but after seeing people with cups of this the rest of the weekend, I really wish I had made room. 

We lucked out and scored a bar spot right in front of the rotating poultry. The noise level was really manageable for how packed they were! I highly suggest a visit here and am already ready to return.

I got a chicken "sandwich" I thought the concept of ingredients was very good. Not like I have had in a pita before. Fennel and mandarins was a nice touch, they were definitely needed to add an element of flavor because the chicken was juicy but lacked flavor. On the other hand, It was huge so it's understandable why it was $14 but I do wish that it came fries or something, because when I'm trying to eat lunch I'm not trying to break the bank. However it was a great portion size, i was able to save half for later and I feel like the flavors got even better as time went on. All in all I would go again I'm curious to try other things on the menu.

Hands down, the BOMB DIGGITY! 
First time here and I was not disappointed in the least. 
The staff here goes above and beyond ! And the food .... THE FOOD IS AMAZINGGGGGGGG! 
We got the pork shoulder and free range chicken sandwiches and a side of Greek fries. Everything Was made to order and sooooo tasty. Will absolutely be back. This place is a gem for sure

We came here for lunch one weekend and it was packed.  We were lucky enough to grab a table before it was taken, but it's really hard.  I saw some people still waiting for a table even after their food was ready.

I had the chicken sandwich while my friend had the salad.  The sandwich itself comes in a large pita with lots of chicken pieces, cheese, lettuce, and a few pieces of tangerines.  At $13 it's pretty expensive, but it was stuffed with chicken.  Not a bad thing, except it was way too dry.  The tangerines helped, but since there were so few pieces of those, it wasn't that much of a help.  A little bit more sauce would be good too, cause it was a bit too bland as well.

I wonder if all the high ratings are for the baklava, cause I've had better gyros elsewhere.

idk what to say really other than I just love this place so much. I wish there was one in Marin so I could go all the time. I'd eat here way too much if it was in Marin. 
I've only ever had the wrap, but want to try the salad... and the yogurt. I highly highly recommend. AND you can order online which makes for easy pick up... but they're so quick it's not really a problem.

Especially in the beginning of the year, I have a special craving for SALADS! Might as well start the year off healthy, RIGHT? I recently discovered Souvla and have been wondering where it has been all my life! There is a choice of pork, chicken, lamb, and sweet potato (vegetarian) protein with a different assortment of greens with each protein. My favorite combination is the chicken salad with fennel, naval orange, pickled red onion dressed with a delectable and light dressing. If you don't want to be as healthy, you can get your salad in sandwich form or add fries, soup, roasted potatoes, and treat yourself with one of their specialty frozen yogurts! This is a perfect place for a quick bite or takeout meal. The only slight problem is that the space can get very packed and it might be harder to grab seating especially on weekends and lunch hour. Additionally, it can get very pricey if you do more add ons and adding drinks. Other than this, Souvla is a very reliable establishment.

Souvla. For someone who has not been, how can I explain it? Uhmm... what to expect: constant lines, $15 salads, amazing frozen Greek yogurt, solid interior design. 

I've been to several of the locations across SF and they really don't vary much. While each layout is different, they are very clearly a chain with their recipes and layouts down to a science. The Hayes location has the counter right at the front so the line always spills out onto the street and the rotisserie is visible on the back wall. There's limited seating and a lot of it is semi-communal so it's not a place I'd suggest going to for an early date. Sadly, many new Tinder couples don't agree. 

Anyway, the food: the salads are great. The frozen Greek yogurt is to die for. The wraps are meh, and as for the sides, I've only had the juicy potatoes but they are quite good.

I was dying to try this place when I first found it on Yelp. It's only a few blocks down from my apartment which is really great. I got the chicken gyro sandwich and my boyfriend, the lamb. Both sandwiches were very delicious. We also got a side of Greek fries. Honestly, we could've shared one sandwich because the sandwiches were so large!

I really like the idea that you can get any of the sandwich options but turn it into a salad. Of course on my first go, I HAD to get the sandwich but next time I will try the salad. I also love that they service beer and wine.

The place is really small and always has a ton of people so it was great to go for lunch. They also sell frozen Greek yogurt with a few different toppings. The topping options are: Baklava pieces, tart cherries or olive oil with salt. I was way too full the first time but one night we stopped by after dinner for dessert. I got the Froyo with baklava and my boyfriend the olive oil w/salt. Mine was definitely the winning choice. I don't even normally like baklava but this dessert was SO satisfying. The olive oil and salt wasn't layered so all the salt was all on top which kind of blew your palette away. I've had ice cream with olive oil and salt before and it was damn delicious so  I think with a little tweaking it could be really good.

Definitely recommend!

After waiting 115 days souvla couldn't take the time to get their crap together, have a properly working app, or have systems in place to deal with the orders. Complete FAIL over the last 2 days. If you still want to waste your money there ( which dont - you can get better froyo other places) .. wait at least a week for them to figure their lives out.
I Have been here many times, great food, good prices and the staff are friendly.  The service is great, but when busy it tends to not be as promped

I've been looking forward to going here after reading about it in the paper (yes, an actual old school newspaper).  I had bookmarked it so when we were in the city it was easy to find.  The food is good.   Limited menu of pork, chicken, lamb, or veggie in a sandwich or a salad.  I noticed that most people were having the salad, so I went with it.  Lots of kale, with pea sprouts, radishes, and of course the lamb.  Tasted really fresh.  Meat wasn't as full of flavor as more authentic Mediterranean places.  Ambience is loud.  Not a lot of places to sit so a lot of take outs.  Good if you're in the area but so many other places to try.

Small seating space, but bless we grabbed a table (4 people) around 1. First off, it's in a nice, hipster looking area. Lots of nice shops to look at and explore.

I've been meaning to try this place ever since my friends continued to rave about it...then I heard Michelle Obama had this catered on her flight? Sold. 

The simple menu makes everything easier. Easier to order everything at least! Ok, we just got 3 wraps (veg-white sweet potato, pork shoulder, and chicken), 2 salads (chicken and lamb), Greek fries, and sparkling water. All that plus tip just under $100. Yeah, this place is on the pricier side; would recommend getting the wrap over the salad ($1 cheaper), it's a better deal and probably more satisfying.

The chicken was forgettable. Loved the white sweet potato but I'm not an olive person so it only slightly ruined the taste. The lamb and pork shoulder were so good. Would r command the pork shoulder wrap!! Fries were just slightly better than your average garlic fries. Decent lunch spot for the wraps.

I live in SF & 1st time here. They have 3 locations. 
I was excited to try it. It was so delicious and staff is so friendly and efficient. Open seating. Lunch time rush but  I still got  a seat right away. My food came fast. I ordered pork sandwich $12, Greek fries $4. and Greek beer. $6. If you want extra sauces for fries they are available for $1. Extra. 
I would definitely recommend this place.

Full review (finally got here for a meal)

The sandwich is the way to go..ask for it "Greek stylel" and they ad French fries to the sandwich "WHAT!!"

We spilt a lamb sandwich - Greek style, a pork salad (the pork was a bit on the dry side - but the salad was really yummy), some Greek fries, and OF COURSE that froyo with the baklava - my FAV.

Oh and we got a couple glasses of a sparking red wine that was perfect. 

You really need to have a friend with you to help scout out a spot to sit while the other person orders. Service is pretty fast.

Great place for "booze sponge" eating. YUM and done.

The food at Souvla is pretty good but the greek frozen yogurt is even better. Most of their bowls have some yogurt in it along with lots of veggies and your choice of meat. It's a very nice blend of the different food groups. 

The frozen yogurt though is on another level. The texture, flavor, and sweetness-level is much better than other froyo places (maybe because this is made with Greek yogurt?). They have a variety of toppings and I can't wait to try all of them. I got the sea salt and olive oil, which added a nice flavor to the yogurt. Be sure to spread out the sea salt though! When they add it on top, it's pretty concentrated, so my first bite was quite salty. 

The only downside about this place is the size. I came here on a Wednesday evening and it was packed! The line moved pretty quickly but we had to wait quite a bit for a table and it was very crammed. The employees constantly had to tell me to move my chair so they can carry ingredients from the back.

4 stars just for the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup!!!! I also tried the sour cherry one, which would be good if you're thirsty, but if you want something that leans more towards sweet dessert.....the baklava one is the best!!!!

I thought the food was whatever. If I had to rate the food only, I would say 2.5-3 stars. The portions are large and the ingredients are fresh, but the protein was dry. We had lamb, pork and chicken and I felt the same for all 3 proteins. The fries were good though!!!!!

It does get crowded and if you get a table, then be prepared for people just watching you like hawks to steal your table next.

I think the other location is a bit more spacious. The taste and quality is equally excellent. The food comes out fairly quickly and portions are more than sufficient for a meal.

Definitely recommend.

Every once in a while, I try a place everyone else is raving about and find myself shrugging my shoulders in a state of meh-ness. Oh who am I kidding? It happens all the time, and then I get all snarky when people hate on something that they have deemed less than satisfactory. Well, I've now tried Souvla, and I must say I don't really get the hype. It's a shame because I like the bare-bones, In-n-Out concept used - focus on three meats, add a veggie option (sweet potato, not tofu, in this case) and throw in some froyo to get more walk-by traffic. I think a lot of my meh reaction came from the poor way they handled the crowds there. Which basically means not at all.

The compact place crowds quickly, and the overflow is left to the busy sidewalk where the variety of Hayes Valley life forms gets all in your face. From the shrieking loon smelling of urine to the smug, entitled bitch tapping her iPhone expecting me to get out of her way. It takes all kinds to gorge a gyros, doesn't it? Jamie W. and I decided to order our food to go, though he ended up going on a scavenger hunt for a couple of Diet Cokes since Souvla refuses to sell them. He decided to try the Superior Farms Lamb Leg in a Salad ($14), the priciest option on the menu, with chunks of lamb marinated in harissa-spiked yogurt and mixed with cucumber, radish, pickled red onion and feta cheese (photo: bit.ly/1ve0YsT).

It was pretty good since they mixed in kale with the lettuce, but it needed a bit more kick. Since we already secured our bench on Patricia's Green, it was too bad nobody told us to stock up on hot sauce. Mine was marginally disappointing, the $11 American Homestead Pork Shoulder in a Wrap. The fancy meat was rather sparse compared to the breadiness of the pita almost to the point that it tasted near-vegetarian with cherry tomato, cucumber, pickled red onion and feta cheese. The sweetness of the minted Greek yogurt wasn't helping matters much either (photo:  bit.ly/1y4XdXA). Honestly, the $4 side of Greek Fries was the most satisfying part of my meal as they were doused with lemon juice, olive oil, and mizitrha cheese (photo: bit.ly/1zfasmS). Perhaps I'll go back for take two when it's slow...whenever that is.

FOOD - 3 stars...upscale Greek fast food priced for Hayes Valley with the salad more satisfying than the wrap
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...too crowded to notice really
SERVICE - 2 stars...chaos control needed
TOTAL - 3 stars...kinda like a Spice Kit for the ooom-pah crowd

This is a fav spot that friends and I like to go to after service with it being only a 5 min walk from our church. The location is great as it's located along Hayes Valley, and so there's plenty of other options of food and shopping as well. And if Souvla is crowded, there's an outdoor hangout area in Hayes where you can take your food..hopefully with good weather :) If you're looking for a fine-fast Greek restaurant, this is your place! The Hayes Valley location is always pretty crowded, but this Sunday we went wasn't too bad. 

I usually order the chicken or lamb salad, but decided to try the vegetarian salad this time around as I wasn't in a meaty mood that day. The vegetarian salad was really good! It comes with roasted sweet potato, garlic yogurt, chopped kalamata olives, toasted walnuts, pickled red onions, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese. The seasoning was fanastic as usual.. And if you're not a salad person, you can have it sandwich style. I would also suggest ordering their greek fries which is seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, and mizithra cheese. Their fries are delicious, seasoned so well, and also goes really well with sprinking the fries on the salad ;D

We tried Souvla last night and had two excellent bowls of salad and meat. We'll definitely return the next time we come to that part of San Francisco.

We knew Souvla was an informal place where you order your food at the counter and then find a place to sit, but we were a little surprised at how long the line was. Still, we figured it must move quickly for all these veterans to be willing to wait, and it did. While in line, we received helpful advice about what and how to order (e.g. order the frozen Greek yogurt when you order your meal, and you'll get a ticket to pick it up when you're ready).

The main menu is limited: four protein options (one vegetarian) with matched toppings and the choice of a wrap or a salad. We opted for the lamb salad and the braised pork salad. Both salads were big and delicious. I slightly preferred the pork meat, but both were excellent. A tip that's not on the menu: if you want a layer of fries on top of your salad, order it "Greek Style." (If you want more fries, you can order a side of them.)

Souvla gets four stars from me instead of five only because of the limited seating, both indoors and outdoors. Had there been any open space inside, we would have chosen that, but there wasn't. Even for the outdoor seating, we had to circulate and pounce when a table opened up.

The best thing about that place is the baklava yogurt! 
The food itself is casual and nice.

Wife couldn't stop bragging about how good the salads are so I had to see for myself, drove 1hr plus for this and I must say I will do it again. Waited in line for about 15 mins, couldn't find seating I knew then that it would be good food. The menu is so simple yet so good! You can have your order in salad form or sandwich. I believe you get more food in salad form. I had the pork shoulder salad, my wife had the chicken sandwich and we shared some tasty fries with granch everything was delicious! We wanted to try their dessert since it looked so yummy but the line was so long we didn't have a lot of time left, so we made our way to salt & straw for dessert (was also very tasty)

Souvla is my favorite place in SF. I am obsessed with the chicken salad (greek style). The chicken is SO good and flavorful, and not dry at all. All the other toppings in the salad go so well together. And I LOVE the dressing. It's all perfect and delicious. I could eat it all the time.

One time I got the veggie salad, added chicken, and I did NOT like it. The sweet potato pieces were HUGE, and then there were olives in it which was such a random combination.

I've also tried the lamb salad, and it's delicious. I love their lamb. 

Souvla is life.

I was excited to check out Souvla since I love Mediterranean food, but it wasn't the food that knocked my socks off - it was the wine! The Greek white they have is so delicious, I asked about purchasing a bottle at the counter. Not only was this possible, but they also sold me a bottle at cost. Amazing. I can't wait to crack that baby open. 

I had a chicken gyro in a lamb set-up - that is, everything in the lamb gyro except for lamb, sub-in chicken. It was okay but I honestly wasn't wowed. The fries, on the other hand, were fantastic. And I would love to try that frozen Greek yogurt with baklava. 

I'd like to check this place out again on a future trip to SF. The salads looked delish and I think that might be my order next time. And that wine. Obviously.

Sad to say, I didn't get to try to food here BUT OMG their frozen Greek Yogurt is AMAZING.

Seriously, skill the long line at smitten ice cream and come here for a delightful, not too sweet, packed full of protein, semi good for you treat! 

Okay, I lied, the line here was pretty long on a Saturday afternoon, but worth it!

The Greek Froyo was creamy and thick in consistency. It also wasn't too tart which is the case with a lot of greek yogurt. I went with the simple topping of just honey and I couldn't have been happier. Definitely recommending coming for an afternoon or post dinner treat. I can't wait to try the food.

Quick background: 
The chef and founder used to work at the upscale Greek restaurant, Kokkari, and you can definitely taste echoes of the finer fare at Soulva.

Best items:
Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. Do yourself a favor and get two if you're with a date. Splitting it will only make you sad when the experience is over.

Fries: get the granch sauce. The fries are doubled fried, thick, and awesome.

The gyros were okay. Meat was really soft and well marinated. The overall composition was a touch dry. Pour some granch on it and you'll be good to go.
I tried the greek yogurt olive oil and flaky sea salt. The yogurt was great - thick and slightly sour but I wasn't a huge fan of the olive oil and sea salt combo. Will try the honey flavor next time!

First time I visited was with friends. It was on a Saturday evening and it was a bit busy, but we still were able to find seating easily. We all had the Lamb salad and it was amazing. It is a big portion salad with a good amount of the choice of protein. I also had the Greek yogurt with ho eye and baklava. 

Second time I went was on a Sunday it was very easy to find seating and not busy at all. I got the Lamb salad and my boyfriend got the rotisserie chicken salad, both were delicious. This time we had the Greek yogurt with honey and baklava & the olive and salt, both yogurts were delicious but my favorite is the honey and baklava! 

Great place for a casual lunch/ dinner.

Greek Me Good!

Ordered:
Pork Sandwich $11.00
Lamb Salad $12.00
Greek Fries $4.00

Tina's Thoughts and Triggers
- Line out the door, but it goes real fast! We came around dinner time and it was still rapid
- Parking might be a little difficult seeing that Hayes street is dine central! 
- I wish I got the worker's name, but he was amazingly awesome! He gave my friend and I suggestions on what to get and got the food experts to cut it in half for us! He was super friendly and accommodating.
- Greek fries, or yet any fries, but these fries were addicting-ly yums (Yeah, I know that's not a word)
- Friend and I wanted to get pork and lamb, but didn't know which one we wanted. We decided to do the lamb salad and the pork sandwich. This was the best choice to get the best of both worlds. 
- They are known for their frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and syrup. And olive oil and flaky sea salt, wildflower honey, sour cherry, and other flavors are other options. I didn't get it since I don't like how sticky the baklava gets stuck on my teeth, but friend got it and it was really good - and for the most part, what people wait for as dessert for their meal! Suggestion is to order it while you're already in line or you'll have to go back in line. Hahaha, obvious, but it'll melt fast.  
- Friend saved half of her wrap for later because they are huge, but ended up eating it right when she got home. 
- I would come back for the wrap/sandwich! Can't wait!

One of my favorite Greek places to get my lamb wrap! Everything from the atmosphere, decor, service & food is perfecto. Located in the cutest area in Hayes Valley. Totally recommended to go to this area for a date night *wink wink* or a nice dinner night with a group of friends! 

My favorite thing to get here is the Superior Farms Lamb Leg Wrap which consists of Harissa spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, feta, and pickled red onions. Doesn't that sound amazing? It tastes as good as it sounds! The lamb meat is made to perfection with tenderness & juiciness. Nothing about it was overwhelming and it was very flavorful. This itself is $13 which is a bit pricey but I felt like it definitely was worth it. My tummy was happy. 

I've also tried the Greek fries ($4) which was crunchy but not something I would get regularly. It was well seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, and cheese! Everything with cheese is good to me. For an extra $0.50, you can add this deliciousness inside your wrap! 

The frozen Greek yogurt ($5) is one of the most popular items here! I got mine with honey with baklava crumbles it was so good! It has a tart & creaminess to it which makes it well worth! 

Overall, great food & ambiance. Only docked a star off for the wraps being on the pricier side. Definitely one of my favorite places to go to in the area. 

Tip: try the hot sauce with everything! What doesn't taste good with a little spice?

What a cute, trendy, and tasty Greek gem in Hayes Valley!  

Don't be fooled by the small menu (mainly consists of wraps or salads, froyo, and drinks)- these dishes pack a lot of flavors.  

The chicken salad option (with granch dressing, fennel, pickled red onion, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese) was very tasty- there was a good balance between the amount of chicken and greens.  Granch dressing was a bit rich for me, but the salad was very filling and satisfying.  We've also ordered the fries on the side- very flavorful (especially with the cheese sprinkled on top) and we were looking at the bottom of the cone getting the scraps by the end; it was that good.  My friend had ordered the lamb bowl, which was also tasty though the lamb was a bit chewy.

If you can only get one thing from Souvla, it is the baklava frozen yogurt-  this is one of the best froyos I've had in the city so far.  Love the contrast of the tart froyo with the super sweet baklava and honey topping- the baklava is rather sweet on its own.  My friend and I shared this after our salads- it might be a bit much to each alone after a meal.

FYI, being a smaller restaurant, most likely you will have to wait for a table and there will be times where you might have to share your table with someone else.  Service otherwise was super quick, in fact so quick that our food was prepared before we got a table!  Luckily, they held on to it and gave us a hot fresh batch of fries when we were finally able to sit down (we waited 10 min on a Thursday night at 8pm).  

If you are looking for a quick, trendy, Greek place to eat, I highly recommend trying out Souvla!

I've had my fair share of salads and Souvla's chicken salad is BY FAR my favorite!

Their chicken is always flavorful and juicy and they add in some fennel, pickled onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese, and the best part - mandarins. I'm usually not a huge fan of fruit in my salad, but this was amazing. It's also a plus that they never skimp out on the meat. I always leave feeling happy and full!

There's always lines outside Souvla but there were still spots available at the communal tables and benches during dinner time. The prices are a little high for a casual restaurant but well worth it for the good quality meats. The decoration inside is cute and the service is really nice.

I got the lamb salad ($14) since the lamb here is my favorite meat but the chicken is really great too! The salad is served in a huge bowl with cucumber, radish, onion, and cheese. I didn't even finish it because they gave so much. 

We also got a side of the juicy potatoes ($4) which has this amazing soft texture because it's been soaked in rotisserie drippings. The frozen greek yogurt here is addicting! Perfectly creamy and not too heavy. I got the baklava crumbles and honey syrup ($5) which was very sweet so wouldn't recommend this if you don't want something overly rich.

Overall this is one of my favorite places to have for lunch or dinner! Definitely try the lamb and frozen yogurt!

Very good fast casual eating experience. Enjoyed my French fries. Maybe the best French fries I've had in a while. The sandwich was ok. A little in the dry side, but the bread was delicious and I liked the inclusion of what I think was orange or some other citrus. 

Place looked very clean and well maintained. Staff was knowledgeable and able to answer my questions without hesitation. 

1 star off for using premade harissa and having harissa blend hot sauce that tastes like tapatio. Besides that, would eat here again.

I'd hear this place was popular and I'm glad that I came at a time when there wasn't a crazy line since we were able to find a table immediately.

This place is definitely pricey, as far as a place with a simple menu of "sandwiches" and salads.  I opted for the salad, which was good.  It was definitely satisfying and tasted very fresh.  I think next time I go, I'd definitely go for the gyro.  I'd also be interested in trying the frozen Greek yogurt - that seems very unique and something that would end the meal on a satisfying note.

This place is very popular and doesn't have enough seating to accommodate everyone so be prepared to wait or take your meal elsewhere.

Overall, I liked it, but I don't think I understand the high pricing...it's fine as long as you can easily walk in because the salad was not worth a long wait in line.

Come for the Greek Yogurt! So what if it comes from a soft serve machine? So does Yogurtland yogurt and I love Yogurtland. But anyway, it tastes divine, exactly as you (or actually I) can imagine-- thick and tart frozen Greek yogurt. Higher in protein, so it must be good for you? Yeah, exactly! Now, it can be enjoyed alone but why not add the bells and whistles? Don't bother asking if you want the baklava crumbles because duh, yes you want the good stuff. Keep in mind, it's sweeet.

I was wrong in ordering the chicken sandwich the first time as all I can remember was waiting in a long ass line and being disappointed by a mediocre tasting wrap, that was also falling apart, a sad wrap really. Free range in this case meant too healthy and a bit tasteless. So lesson learned, note to self, stick with the yogurt and you won't be disappointed.

Love this place. It's always crowded, even at 2:30 on a Monday. The menu is customizable (I had lamb over a chicken salad setup), and service is friendly and fast. If you eat in, you'll likely need to make friends and sit with some strangers, as there is limited seating inside. Build in some time to walk around the lovely Hayes Valley shopping area after your meal!

Whoever wrote that this is a Greek place is mistaken. It's not Greek food. It may have a Greek name, it's not Greek.  

Having just holidayed in the Greek isles, I wanted a redo.  I was thoroughly seduced by the beauty of Santorini and the beaches of Mykonos, not to mention the millions of great meals I had day in and day out, I read somewhere this is a phenomenal Greek place and rushed over. 

It is not. it's San Francisco Greek, just like Dosa is San Francisco Indian and not real Southern Indian food. A real Southern Indian place ought to have upma, and a real Souvlaki ought to have the right type of texture with the best crunchy cucumbers. I have lost counts on how man souvlakies I had after drinking and partying all day (while on holiday, not on a regular basis), I can assure you this is not it. But.. San Francisco Greek is quite good, and in some cases, perhaps better, certainly healthier, tastier and more innovative. A real Greek salad will not be caught dead with lettuce. I learned that on my trip with my Greek friends. Their salad is super delicious but it has more than the usual Greek ingredients. The lamb souvlaki is way more tenderer than what I had gotten in Greece. 

The ambience though, reminds me of the trendier bars you'd see in Athens late at night. 

A winner. But like many great world cuisines, once it's in San Francisco, it takes on a new life, a face lift, and in the process, an ancient cuisine is reinvented to feed (and to fit) the tech workers of a city in transition.

Definitely a repeat on my list of places to go to at lunch! Hearty tasty salad and a satisfying fries to unhealthy it up and to pack on more calories you can indulge on their baklava frozen yogurt. I'm definitely going back to try other food, but it's definitely a nice refreshing taste - portions are very filling and but not overwhelmingly too much. My only downside is the wait, the line and small space and sometimes it can get too cold to enjoy... But other than that, food is great. Can't say much for service since it's paid at order and just a quick hand of your food once ready... But it wasn't bad service either, so the one star less is just for the length of time in line/getting food and lack of seating. Food only critique is an "A+"

I was very looking forward to trying their Greek yogurt soft serve with baklava pieces but found it to be just ok. The soft serve itself didn't taste too much like Greek yogurt because it was lacking some tanginess. The baklava pieces/toppings were not crunchy at all which was disappointing. Moreover, some of the walnuts tasted rancid - a huge letdown.

Had the veg salad the potatoes are amazing but the dressing is like a lemony yogurt sauce and is a bit bitter for me. Wish I knew going into it. Really want to try their froyo and the chicken salad to see if it is a milder flavored dressing. Great quick place

Not bad! If you're in the neighborhood and looking for a quick dinner, then this is the place! 

I met a friend for dinner last night, and I arrived a bit early so I had a glass of rosè. Their house rosè was good, not the best, but still good. It comes with a wine glass and a copper mug, and for about $10 a glass, you certainly get what you pay for in terms of quantity! I had about two full glasses with a single purchase, and it made waiting for my friend all the more bearable. 

This restaurant is self-seating & self-ordering, so I waited in line and snagged a table outside as soon as I could. One of my qualms about this restaurant is that there aren't enough tables. I'd say the restaurant could seat about 40 people comfortably, and after that it would get very cramped. I was lucky enough to get a table when I did, otherwise I dunno what I would've done! 

When my friend came she and I took turns to stand in line and order, for fear of losing our table. She had the vegetarian salad and I had the pork sandwich with a side of fries that came with garlic yogurt. We dug into our food, and finished most of it. I wasn't too impressed with my sandwich. My friend said her salad was fine, but I think it's hard to judge a restaurants quality of food simply by their salads. The fries along with the garlic yogurt sauce were amazing! We both finished the order, and raved about it afterwards. The fries were slightly greasy and crunchy and hot, and paired with the sauce it was soooo good. 

To sum up, if you're in the neighborhood give this place a try. It's alright, I've had better Greek food over at Bursa in West Portal-best sandwiches ever. However, this place is still good and has a nice vibe. Staff were very nice and accommodating, and the long lines were always nice to see. Takeout seems to be the better option here, as the majority of people I saw in the restaurant would come in and leave with their bags of food. I don't think I'll be back, but it's nice to have in the back of my mind in case I want something different while in that area.

3.5 stars.  While planning my trip to San Francisco, I definitely wanted to try this place since there are no locations in my area.  I knew exactly what I wanted to try...the lamb salad, juicy potatoes, and black cherry Greek soda.  All were pretty delicious!  They give a great amount of lamb!

It was very busy when I went on a weekday at lunch time, but I was able to grab the best seat in the house...the small, front corner nook!  No other restarant I've been to has a little area like that.  If there was a location close to me, I'd like to try a few other items.

Never would have imagined liking a kale salad!  Great job, Souvla! 

And when the spouse is not looking, I order the greek yogurt ice cream with cherry sauce.  Yummy, too!

Get the fries on top of the salad. Just do it. Don't double think it!!!! 

But seriously, this place is delicious! The lamb salad is bomb diggity. The frozen yogurt is a treat. Their pickup window is super efficient. When I order my salad on their website it's ready in about 5 minutes... max! And don't be dissuaded by a line outside. They move quickly here. 

The inside is small, but tidy. It gets a bit loud - probably from people raving about their delicious food. On warm days the outside seating is really nice. It's in front of the store, but still feels welcoming & feels like it shares space with the pizza joint next door.

I love this place. I've been on multiple occassions - on a weekday for lunch, on a weekend for dinner, just dessert - through busy crowds and less busy times, and this place is consistently delicious and filling. 

Things I've tried before:
MAINS:
- Pork salad ($12) - The pork salad has your traditional greek flavors- the tomato, onion, and feta are rich and flavorful - making this a hearty salad guaranteed to fill you up. 5/5
- Chicken salad ($13)- The chicken salad is a little bit lighter flavor wise- probably because the dressing and cheese are less intense and the citrus helps cut some of the richness- but still filling for sure! 5/5
- Lamb salad- I don't even like lamb much, but I've tried it before, and the meat is good quality.

Have yet to try a sandwich here, but heard that they are really delicious and filling.Portions are generous here, and they do not skimp on the meat- the $ you're paying is worth it. Getting it in a to-go box is a good move though salads can get kind of soggy after so don't wait too long to finish it later. 

--
DESSERT: I LOVE THEIR FROYO (and it's so reasonably priced!) 

Olive oil +salt ($4) - I had it here the first time I came to Souvla, and it's hard for me to order anything else - it's my absolute favorite. It's a sort of savory sweetness- the salt actually brings out the natural sweetness of the oil and yogurt. 5/5 - would recommend you try it once even if you think it sounds weird. 

The baklava one and sour cherry ones are good too - I actually didn't love the baklava as much as I thought I would - overpowers the yogurt itself a little bit in my opinion. Sour cherry is solid, but not super memorable compared to the Olive oil haha.

Also if you're getting froyo in addition to your dinner, you can ask them to make it on the spot after so your froyo doesn't melt while you are waiting around.

At last! I have finally tried Soulva !!! It's been listed on Eater's cheap eats for quite some time and it definitely is reasonably priced and one of the more healthier options in the city! We opted to split the sweet potato salad and it was quite good!!! I'll have to return for the baklava frozen dessert everyone keeps raving about !
Really great food as always however I did find a penny in my takeout this time around... solid food but makes me wonder a bit about what's going on in the kitchen.

I've been wanting to try Souvla since I moved to SF 6 months ago, and I was honestly disappointed. I think the recurring theme here was not enough flavor - the yogurt dipping sauces for the fries (harissa-spices and granch) tasted like plain Greek yogurt, the veg sandwich mostly consisted of thick slices of unspiced potato. 

I really loved the atmosphere of Souvla - they've really nailed the fast casual concept and their ingredients are incredibly fresh. I hope they make some updates to their recipes in the future because I really want to go back and try the frozen Greek yogurt (baklava crumbles and honey, I'm looking at you).

this is really close to my home.
5 minutes walking and $15.00 is all I need.

I had the lamb leg sandwich / gyro and a small bottle of Greek soda.
the pita was kinda dry but the meat was tender and flavorful.
it's a definitely neighborhood favorite.
you'll feel comfortable being here and saying hi to everybody.
cozy & homey.

I've been to Souvla a couple of times.  Recommend sitting in front of the fire and watching the meat get roasted.  Somewhat Americanized Mediterranean food but it was tasty.  Recommend the olive oil frozen yogurt.

It hurts me to give this place one star because I truly enjoy their food and drinks a lot and I've always recommended it to family and friends--it's in a good area, fantastic food, and I never had an issue with their service...until today.

I was a group of three and first to finish ordering so I looked for a place to comfortable seat our group. There weren't any four-tops available--not a problem as this happens at a lot of places in SF. The communal table had space so I had a seat. By the time our third person finished ordering a four-top opened up and she invited us to move. I grabbed our numbers first since they were the closest thing in my reach and put them on the new table. But then a female customer that was STILL IN LINE steps up to us and said that was her table when there was no evidence it had been saved. Not a purse. Not a coat. No number. NOTHING to indicate it had been taken and I already put our number stands down. 

We didn't want to argue so we let it go and were going back to our spots at the communal table. It wasn't that big of a deal. Sure we were a little miffed that someone could act that way, but you have to pick your battles. Mind you, I've been to Souvla a dozen times and I get how their process works. Order first, sit after. Not everyone abides by that but I always do. That's the fair and right way to do things. 

But then as we were moving back, the cashier (With a very distinct hairstyle. Not to name names.) purposely came over to the communal table to reprimand us in front of everyone at the restaurant. She antagonized us saying that if we were going to sit at the communal table we have to keep our numbers with us and we can't keep them at a separate table. She was completely did not even know the truth of the situation and judged us for what happened, then blasted us in front of all the other diners, especially the other diners at the communal table. Talk about awkward!!! I had to correct her and tell her that we were trying to move tables; it honestly wasn't even an issue as it was solved between us and the other customer.

Except now some small incident that should've been harmless between some diners has completely soured my experience at the establishment. I felt insulted and looked down upon by the employee and preemptively judged by our race and assuming we were trying to cause problems with the operation when it was sincerely not the case. She didn't even apologize for the miscommunication. During the rest of our meal I felt SO UNCOMFORTABLE around the other communal table diners and the atmosphere was incredibly uninviting. 

At first I thought I was just sensitive to the situation, but talking to my friends afterward, they also felt the same uncomfortable hostility. I work at a 5-star hotel--I know when service is poor and this was it. I definitely regret spending $40 of my hard earned money there and I feel even more sorry to my friend who had never been to Souvla and was excited to try it on her first visit to SF because of my recommendation. I regrettably won't be back and I certainly won't be recommending this place to anyone anymore.

EDIT: Looking at the other reviews I see that another Asian customer felt antagonized as well. Sad to hear Souvla is racist.

Food 5/5. Service 5/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 4/5.

Always busy, always good. Souvla is a small shop in the city that has a small menu of pita wraps, salads, soups, and yogurt. They focus on a few items, and perfect them. 

The minute you enter the restaurant, your immediate attention is the rotisserie chicken display in the back. Their chicken is roasted fresh each day continuously throughout the day. Their other meats aren't on display but I would assume it's just the same. I always go for the chicken wrap or salad which are both filling. The chicken salad is a dollar more but has more meat and lies on a big bed of kale salad. 

The main attraction though has to be the baklava frozen yogurt. The yogurt comes with a huge amount of baklava on perfectly tart Greek yogurt ice cream. The mixture between the two is perfect with the overall dessert the perfect amount of sweetness. 

Overall, Souvla is an amazing place for lunch or dinner even though it's always so packed. 

Tips - get your wraps and yogurt to go and seat in the benches in the park to eat.

A quick bite to eat before the Symphony.  

A line out the door, but we were served Quickly- within 10 minutes after placing our orders.  

We ordered all Pitas with the Pork, Chicken , and Lamb. We wanted to sample the fries and the juicy potatoes.  

All orders were quite generous portions of meat.  Meats were tasty with great flavors of the other condiments.   

Potatoes were good flavored, but if you're looking to count calories,  make the cuts here.   The wraps were filling and leave a good flavor. 

Satisfying.  

Yes, I would come again.

Love this place. Simple, good food--my favorite is their harissa-spiked yogurt that they serve as a dressing on their salads. They don't skimp on the meat either. The first time I ordered a lamb salad from them, I ordered it with extra meat because I was afraid they would be like most places and give you a measly 1.5-ounce serving. Well...I wound up with what looked like a meat salad on my plate--as in, meat, and the kale, romaine, cucumbers, and radishes looked like they were just garnishes hahaha...lesson learned. 

Next time, I ordered the lamb salad, I didn't get extra meat. Still a decent serving. 

One of my go-to places for sure.

Been back a few times and always get he salad. Delicious and filling. Still think they're greasy but it's gotten better.. The rotisserie chicken dripping potatoes are great and you can explore some interesting froyo options. One of the most casual spots in the area.

The stars are for the service and how quickly I was able to get my food. This was my first time and I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was very dry and lacked flavor. My friend goes here often and usually gets the chicken salad and she said that it's the chicken is usually good but it was also dry for her today. Sounds like maybe it was a bad batch? Besides being dry, it also lacked flavor and the pita wasn't very soft. I'm willing to go back and try something else and will adjust my rating accordingly.

Update: after putting three separate charges on my credit card for two transactions Souvla finally contacted me. The response: they were having problems with their phone system; they could only find two charges to my credit card. Amex and I both saw three charges and we both saw them on multiple occasions. Apparently Souvla's accounting/record keeping is as poor as their customer service.

I ordered the breakfast sandwich (pita w/egg, tomato, onion, garlic yogurt, avgolemono sauce) w/lamb (chicken and pork also available). The pita was fluffy and thick, and the lamb was juicy and flavorful w/o much of the stink of lamb meat that many do not like.

Moreover, the breakfast sandwich has two distinct flavor profiles that mix well. The first flavor profile resembles that of a breakfast burrito; the egg, lamb, tomato, and onion taste savory balanced by a touch of tartness and acidity. The garlic yogurt, lamb, tomato, and onion taste like a normal pita. Different bites of the sandwich gave different ratios of those profiles, which I enjoyed.

I also ordered fries w/harissa spiked yogurt. The fries tasted like standard (for restaurants) fries w/fragrant oil and crumbled cheese, and the harissa gave a contrasting hint of sharp spice.

The service was quite fast; I received my order in 5 minutes.

Excellent location for a quick lunch during the week, with dine in, carry out, and order online options. Come around 11:30am to beat the lunch rush if planning to dine in. Service is quick, efficient, and friendly. The food is delicious, with salad versions of the traditional Greek dishes for those who are gluten intolerant or looking to cut out a few calories. Note that sauces are a small additional charge, so be sure to order them at the register. I recommend the vegetable souvlaki and garlic fries.

I'm going to give this joint a generous 3 stars.  We came here on a friend's glowing recommendation, and were pretty disappointed.

For starters, I'm not a fan of the wait-in-line-and-maybe-you'll-get-a-table-by-the-time-your-food-arrives concept.  But I'm willing to overlook that - that's how they chose to set up shop, and I willingly partook.

We waited in the long line, then jockeyed for and finally got a table.  Yay!  The food arrived not too long thereafter.  Between the four of us, we got two different wraps and two different salads.  I thought my chicken salad was pretty good - the veggies were fresh, and the chicken was tasty.  My three companions weren't quite as thrilled with their food (lamb wrap, chicken wrap, lamb salad).  The lamb in particular lacked the flavor that we were expecting.

The saddest part was the wine selection (all Greek wines, I believe).  When I visited Greece a few years ago, I was consistently unimpressed with the local wine, but I assumed I just didn't know what to order.  At Souvla, we tried two of the wines on the menu.  Both were incredibly sweet, even though we'd asked for the least sweet options, and just not good.  The wine also wasn't very cold (in fact, the metal cup that the wine came in was colder than the wine itself).  We actually left most of the wine on the table, which *never* happens.

Overall, a disappointing experience.

Love Souvla! Delicious, healthy Greek food and casual but cute ambiance. Tried it for the first time tonight and I already know it's going to become one of my go-to places. It reminds me of the Greek version of Spinnerie, also one of my go-to dinner spots. You order before seating yourself - there's plenty of seating that's first come, first serve. There's a large communal table as well as a lot of bar seating inside. There's both indoor and outdoor seating. Entrees will run you between $10-$14 and sides are $4-$6. Pricing depends on the meat you choose( lamb, pork, chicken, veg) and whether you choose a sandwich (gyro) or salad. 

I had the chicken kale salad, which was delicious. Fresh rotisserie style chicken, great mix of lacinato kale and greens, grated cheese, greek dressing and onions. Huge portions. I also ordered a lemon chicken rice soup which was delicious, but definitely not necessary given how large the salad was. 

Last but not least, they have an amazing Greek frozen yogurt with different toppings. I tried the cinnamon crumble today but will definitely be back to try the sour cherry!

Roasted white sweet potato, garlic yogurt, chopped Kalamata olive, toasted walnut, pickled red onion, toasted pea shoots, Mizithra cheese wrap+Greek fries with olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, Mizithra cheese.

Gwow. Mind blown. Broke my mauf.

My dish was bursting with flavor, tasted so fresh, and was super original. I mean, come on, white sweet potato? Help me, I'm hooked.

The Greek Frozen Yogurt was addicting and amazing! As someone who is a hardcore greek yogurt fan (literally I eat it everyday), greek yogurt in froyo form? What could be better?!...well the toppings on it. I got the one with Bakalava Crumbles & Honey syrup, and it was a great $5 that I have no regrets at all of spending. The greek froyo part itself, is plain, but delicious as is already. The frozen yogurt is tart and creamy and literally tastes like my favorite type of thick, creamy, Greek yogurt (think of brands like Fage, Siggi's, etc). The baklava oozed of cinnamon, pistachios, and honey and went perfectly with the slightly tart yogurt. They have other flavors such as Olive oil & flaky sea salt, Cherry, etc. 

Souvla also has salads, sandwiches, fries, drinks, and other goodies. If I hadn't already eaten when I came I would've definitely dined here! I definitely am planning to come back again soon!

Always delicious, super healthy and clean.
 All the Staff are nice and always helpful. Delivery is fast and high quality. I always order the whole chicken for my parties. Just remember for whole chicken you need to order it around noon and pick it up around 6. Again high quality, super healthy.and good price. I hope they don't raise the price. There is always a line but it goes fast. Also it definitely worth the wait. I eat Souvla once a week and I love it.
Highly recommended.

Today I had the lamb sandwich and the roasted potatoes. The food was fantastic, well presented, and came in a timely manner.

However, the service left something to be desired. I heard that someone cancelled their order and a different staff member was swearing right in front of the register, which was a little uncomfortable. I'm not sure if that event effected the mood the cashier, but that's not my problem. The cashier didn't seem like she wanted to answer my questions about the menu, and I felt like I was rushed through the ordering process. I get that it's busy, but it's not like I'm ordering fast food and the amount that I'm paying is (or should have been) reflective of that. The cashier starts unnecessarily explaining to my friends and I that our numbers have to be at the table we're sitting at (even though we were all still standing and haven't settled down yet). Definitely felt like she was acting like we didn't understand simple seating or dining etiquette  (maybe because we're Asian), which is pretty insulting. Don't think I will be coming back, there are other Mediterranean options that have better service.

I could go here every week.  My goto dish is the lamb salad.  The service is quick and the line usually isn't too long. 

Only thing I wish is the price was about 10% lower and there was about 10% more lamb on each portioning.  But we live in SF and I know that's probably unreasonable!

Parking here is hit or miss, so I recommend walking or taking the bus.  Souvla sits in the heart of the busy Hayes neighborhood, which is metered, but I've always had to drive around the block a few times anytime I drove. 

Great gluten-free and paleo lunch spot!

Such a big fan of Souvla! The perfect place to stop by for a quick lunch break or during a weekend stroll around Hayes. Their menu is simple, yet I always have a hard time choosing what to order because everything is so yummy. Prices are relatively cheap too, especially for SF. 

I usually switch between the Pork Shoulder and Mary's Free-Range Chicken. I've found that the pork shoulder pairs better with the pita and the chicken as a salad, but both are delicious either way. The pork shoulder is saltier and fattier, so if you're looking for a healthier option, I'd go with the chicken. 

If you're in the mood for something sweet after, I highly recommend their Baklava & Honey frozen greek yogurt. The tartness of the yogurt goes perfectly with the sugar from the baklava and honey. A must try!

I was so excited about some authentic Greek food. I thought since you go and pick it up and order ahead of time it will be super easy. Everything looks cute though not as good as my grandmother would make it but the problem is they put my meal in a paper bag but they didn't seal the soup correctly so when I put it in my own backpack everything was covered in soup. My wallet, my phone, my T-shirt. This means that I paid for a meal and only got half of it because it leaked everywhere. Major bummer.

We got the lamb and veggie sandwiches with the drippings potatoes. 

The lamb and pita were incredibly dry and the veggies were nothing to write home about. They clearly use quality ingredients, but for the price it's pretty inexcusable. 

To be fair, the drippings potatoes were quite tasty if expectedly greasy and decadent.

I will not be back. This is mediterranean food for people who don't like mediterranean food.

When I was in college in Virginia a couple years back, we used to have a place called Berry Berry that served real Greek froyo. I was obsessed! I got into froyo toward the end of college and when I moved away I continued to get froyo a couple times a week. I had a seperate budget just for froyo. Ish was real....Then one day I realized that all the froyo (even the original tart) was not the same. It could never be as good as the greek froyo at Berry Berry. I stopped getting froyo and turned to boba to fill the void in my heart (read: stomach). 

After discovering Souvla I've found love again. Best Greek froyo hands-down! The froyo here blew my mind. I never though that olive oil would go well with sweets! And sea salt?? What's up with that? But, it was recommended, so I had to put my reluctance to the side. I tried the first spoon. AMAZING!! The olive oil was so fresh and the sea salt added a little munch that was much needed. Wowowowow, I will never leave froyo again. The void has now been filled! Thanks, Souvla!

Oh, also the food was scruptious too. You can't go wrong with anything you order at this place! Highly recommended!
