With the ongoing NBA finals and the special start times to capture the largest possible viewing audience, eating before attending a Warriors' game can prove tricky.  A generous (monetary and time wise) friend, picked up meals here for our party of four.  Knowing my palate taste, she ordered the Mary's free range chicken salad (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) for me.  
Due to traffic conditions and the 6 pm start time, I held off on eating this salad until after the game.  Our kind host and my other friend had the vegetarian salad which one touted as one of the best she's ever had.  Our host's dad enjoyed his healthy chicken salad too.
When I got home, I dug in with raised expectations.  The good news, the salad lived up to the hype.  The greens probably lacked the crunch due to the four hour delay from pre game to returning home but the flavors were still good.  The citrus added a kick to the protein, greens, and the even yet not overly savory dressing; there was something pickled in the salad which made.  
Probably didn't hurt that the Warriors won game one of the Finals in making that salad that much sweeeeter.  
Would have this salad again, but not sure whether I'll actually visit the restaurant given the neighborhood parking difficulties.  Nice addition to the neighborhood that's home for two of my favorite restaurants for burgers, French onion soup, and simple meals (Absinthe and Chez Papa).

There was a review in the chronicle (I think?) about how the cost effectiveness of going to an actual restaurant could outweigh a place like Souvla: a place where you have to order yourself, pay and tip before getting your food, seat yourself, and eat quickly and quietly lest you inconvenience someone behind you in line. I hate this place!!!

Should you choose to "dine in" there's an excellent hot sauce on the table, free to shake over your food as you'd like (the food absolutely needs the seasoning). But if you decide the cramped and stressful dining atmosphere is not for you, you must ask (and PAY FOR) a shitty ramekin to go. So yes, you can enjoy your inconsistent, overpriced sandwich in the comfort of your own home, but you must pay even more money to remove yourself from the hellish landscape of dining in. Oh and often there's bone and cartilage in the meat. I hate this place! Let's collectively stop going here

I ordered a greek chicken salad for a lunch meeting through Caviar and was able to customize it to my whole30 needs without being a pain! 

Whole30 Order: Chicken Salad - fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots over kale and romaine lettuce. Plus I added white sweet potato and it was delicious. I ordered the olive dressing on the side. 

I normally eat salad once in a while since it can get boring, but I would definitely each this salad every week! It had great flavors and juicy chicken. I would be interested in trying the pork next time.
An incredible addition to the neighborhood. Love their lamb salad and the baklava froyo.

Best way I can describe this place: Quality, hipster Mediterranean food.

For your meal, you pick a protein, and then choose whether you want it in a pita sandwich or a salad. They have a vegetarian option too! 

We ordered a chicken sandwich and a lamb salad, with a side of fries. Both proteins were great, but I LOVED the lamb. It was so tender and flavorful, and looking at the dripping meat in the rotisserie in the back of the restaurant, I can see why. I even liked the salad alone a lot more than I thought I would. It was well dressed with kale, romaine, fennel, pickled onions, and feta cheese, and it didn't taste plain or boring at all. The pita for the sandwich was soft and a good size, and the fries were perfectly crispy and seasoned.

I ended up coming back a few days later to try the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey, and my boyfriend and I both loved it! I was a little worried that it would be overwhelmingly sweet especially with the addition of the baklava and honey, but it was perfect. The frozen Greek yogurt itself was tart and tangy/cheesy (not very sweet at all, which I liked), and it went perfectly with the baklava crumbles (I don't taste much of the honey).

What a Hayes Valley gem. I'll be back!

Souvla was one of my first and also favorite meal delivery ever while I worked at 101.  

Souvla has a super simple salad. Personally, I thought the chicken salad is one of the BEST I've ever had. The chicken is perfectly cooked, with a lot of flavor and juice inside, and nicely trimmed in thin slices to complement the salad. 

With the juicy potatoes as a side, it easily makes a satisfying work dinner meal. I wouldn't say Soulva is on the range of top healthiest salad since there is a lot of oil in the meat, but it definitely serves the purpose when you try to be "healthy" but still has a craving for something good. 

They also have greek yogurt in store. I heard that's pretty bomb.

Yummy! I was introduced to Souvla through a friend that used to live in the area and I'm so happy she told me about this place.  I've gone to a couple of their locations but this location is my normal go to.  

I normally order online for pickup so I can't really speak to the dining experience at the restaurant but I do notice that it's always packed for dinner which is a good sign.  The food is prepared quickly so it shouldn't be that long of a wait for dinner. 

I'm also happy that they installed a pickup window at the front of the restaurant pretty recently.  You used to have to go into the restaurant and wait at the side of the counter to tell them you were picking up.  It's better now with the window.  The staff is quick about helping people that are picking up so it makes it super convenient. 

My go to is the pork salad which is delicious.  The pork is very flavorful and the combination of the kale, pickled onions, and other ingredients is perfect. I usually get the yogurt and oil dressing on the side and use only the yogurt dressing but the salad doesn't really need it in my opinion.  The salad is very flavorful all on its own.  

Would definitely recommend.

I got food poisoning today.  Had the chicken, sweet potato, and Greek salad.   This really sucks.   Just had surgery and was looking for stabile nutritious food for recovery, now trying not to vomit and it's really painful.   I don't know if this was a bad batch or a cleanliness issue, but putting this here as a warning in case others have a similar problem.

BEST GYRO I have ever eaten in my life. Oh myyyy sweet skittlez!!! That lamb gyro, with the thinly sliced radishes & cucumbers.  Really heavenly.  And that adorably delicious greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbs & honey. Oooooooh E!! Those 2 items are perfection and 5 stars.  
However, there is something very annoying about the place.  The highly sleek, systematic, soulless hipster vibe is not my thing.  And come on I gotta have an option to have a diet coke!! 
Take out is probably a good idea, as well as going very early to avoid crowds.

I had a wonderful meal here on a breezy evening. I ordered the lamb salad and I felt like alone it was a bit lacking, but try the Souvla hot sauce for a kick! The flavors are so fresh and the radish and cheese accompany the meat beautifully. We finished our meal with the Baklava Greek yogurt and it is my FAVORITE. I came back the next day to get another one!!! Absolute must try.

all of a sudden transformed from good vibe to stuck up. the staff is not friendly and show no love or interest in customer service. we understand they have a female staff who treats asians poorly but now all of them are no different. 

my 9 year old wanted to order his own yogurt and they would not even take his order. all they wanted was to skipping him and went with other customer in their stuck up faces. and no they saw my kid , he is not that much shorter than the female staff at the cashier.

I cannot say we will stop coming here because we come here at least 3 times a week for dinner. 

but if you want to enjoy and have a good time here , especially if you are asian, watch out !

At the time of me writing this review (Aug 2019) Souvla has 4 locations in San Francisco. The one on Hayes being the most popular one. All locations serve the same dishes and the quality is consistent throughout all their locations.

I highly recommend:

- Mary's free-range chicken salad ($13) = fresh fennel, pea shoots, navel orange, pickled onions

- Great salad to share or eat it as a lunch meal;

- Lamb Sandwich ($10) = I like gyro and this was satisfying and filling;

- Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava = drizzle with honey was quite a happy ending to my meal.

Souvla is equally busy during lunch and dinner and sometimes you may encounter a short line. It's DEFINITELY worth the wait!

I really like the idea of this place. Quick and easy. Sometimes I just want a fast but tasty meal. I don't need eating to be a whole affair all the time. After a couple hours at the MOMA, the bestie and I came here for a delicious but light lunch as we were going to get boba afterwards. We got a chicken salad to share which they split for us! How nice. They gave a good amount of toppings so it didn't feel like it was just salad. I noticed how some reviews said the dressing was too heavy or how the salad is bland. I thought it was really tasty and yes they do drench on the dressing but just ask for it on the side. 

We got a greek yogurt and it was freaking delicious. What I liked was that they gave us the receipt and had us pick up the yogurt after we ate our salad so the yogurt wouldn't melt.  I went through a fro-yo crave and generally got the regular fro-yo. This greek yogurt gave all those pink berry and pink berry wannabes a run for their money. We got the honey one which I would suggest you avoid as the honey doesn't go well with a cold item. The seating can be a bit tight but I feel like if you wait a bit something will free up.

This place is fantastic, I would eat here every week if I could and it's one of the better places to eat in Hayes Valley.

You basically pick your choice of protein (chicken, lamb, pork, or roasted sweet potato) and get it as a wrap or a salad - it's a slightly small menu but it's relatively healthy and the options are all good, so you can't really go wrong. The salads are a bit on the pricey side, and it's usually around $14 for the chicken, but for the quality and quantity of salad, I find it's worth it. 

The Mary's Free Range chicken salad is one of my top 3 salads in San Francisco (up there with the Plant Organic kale salad and the OMG Omega salad from Sweetgreen). It has their "Granch" dressing which is made with Greek yogurt, fennel. pickled red onion, and cheese over a mix of kale & romaine. The chicken is fresh rotisserie chicken so no cold, bland chicken here. The whole salad comes together wonderfully with a lot of textures and flavor and they are pretty generous with the chicken. I normally ask for dressing on the side since a lot of salads tend to be overdressed, but I don't normally find the salads here overdressed.

The frozen Green Yogurt froyo is also amazing - it's tangy and sweet at the same time and pairs perfect with the toppings. My favorite topping is the baklava crumble and honey syrup. It's worth the $4-5 splurge for this treat.

The lines around peak lunch and dinner hours can be quite long, and there isn't a ton of seating inside, so be prepared to wait and to also take your food outside to Patricia's Green to eat. You'll have to exercise patience to get your food and maybe a table, but it's worth it for the salads. I always crave salads from this place - it's one of my favorites!

YOU WILL NOT FIND BASIC TASTING MEDITERRANEAN FOOD HERE - Wow, full of flavors, textures and spices.
I had the Veg sandwich and I was thoroughly surprised with how much different it was, delicious sweet potato paired well with fresh olives, cheese, onions and other veggies. 
Highly recommend!

I tried the lamb wrap and it was just okay. The meat was on the drier side and the wrap is overall just bland; barely any yogurt sauce or feta cheese. I was dousing it with hot sauce to make up for lack of flavor, but even the hot sauce was underwhelming. I expected more, considering the raving reviews and the quality of the ingredients they use (locally sourced). The fries are pretty good though! They've got more flavor than the sandwiches!

Amazing food but the service is going downhill so much that it's a dealbreaker. 

Souvla is one of a growing breed of restaurants that's trying to tackle the difficulty of hiring for the service industry (due to the high living costs in SF) by having an order at the counter and self service concept. They have runners but no servers. 

They'll bring your food out to you but you'll figure out things like water on your own. 

Which should make it great for delivery and I must go here at least a couple of times a week. 

The food is always really fresh and high quality. I love the chicken salad. The portion sizes always seem to vary a little bit, more meat in the evenings, but I love the speed of take out. 

Most recent experience was just rudeness. I normally check if my order is ready before I get the notification on my phone because they sometimes take a while to put it into Square. The woman looked at me when I asked if my order was ready and said you ordered 4 minutes ago like cmon. Definitely true but Souvla has been known to get orders ready in minutes during peak periods and hey, it was just a question.  

Waited a while longer and my order came out but they didn't record it in square and there was no one handling deliveries so I looked over to see if that order was mine or if I should walk around and come back, the guy manning the counter came over immediately and gave me a hard time saying dude you don't do that. What? Order here every week, expecting to pick up my order while it's still fresh? Or hope that the fact it's actually ready will be recorded in Square properly so I don't have to check at the counter when I come in if it is. 

Souvla I love your 5 star food but your 0 star service means it's not going to work out. See ya

I think for all the clamoring outside the storefront on any given day, Souvla is not necessarily the first place I'd think of when I have some disposable income to spare for a nice meal out. It's definitely worth to try it out, but for the amount of waiting during peak and non-peak hours for the price point, it may not be worth it for some people. I've enjoyed it but do see it being no more special than some of the other hole-in-the-walls I've been to for authentic Mediterranean. Still though, delicious food, just wish it wasn't so packed because it can seem a bit overhyped for the Souvla virgin

I've only had the "chicken sandwich," it's basically a wrap. So tasty! The slices of mandarin and yogurt sauce really make it. Forewarning, they go heavy on olive oil. They drizzle oil on all of the fillings and sometimes it is quite a heavy drizzle (as you can sort of see in the pic). It's very convenient to order online, directly from their website, and pick up at the window!

What has happened to Souvla??  We have frequented it many times for lamb and/or pork wraps.  A few days ago the meat was dry and over done.  Very little yoghurt sauce smeared on the bread wrap and it was tasteless.  Bread was dry and stale.  Please pay more attention and don't coast on your pastt success

Souvla is fast becoming my post Sunday morning yoga/Pilates/Bootcamp meal of choice. The sandwich is meaty and bready and oily enough to quench that post-workout thirst, and its proximity to coffee (Ritual) and juice (Juice Shop) does not hurt.

Tip: get your own order of the garlic sauce.

Five Stars!

First time review, been many times. 
~Food~  
Chicken Salad: Chicken was moist and flavorful. You can tell they put thought into the salad itself because it has such a great combo of ingredients including mandarin oranges, sprouts, crumbly cheese. You're not just tasting chicken and leafs. It's a whole flavor dance on your tongue. 
Fries: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Even cuts (aka no over-fried tiny pieces at the bottom of the cup) and didn't even need a dipping sauce. 
Wildflower Honey Greek Froyo: If you like tangy and tart true-froyo like me, this is your jam. There are not many places that do true froyo with the yogurt taste anymore and I will come here just for this. The honey adds a touch of sweetness and doesn't distract too much from the tart flavor. 
Baklava Greek Froyo: Similar to the honey one but with added texture of the bakalva (which is like honey soaked granola) If you like your froyo with more texture, flavor, sweetness, this is your cup. 

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
$14 Chicken Salad: If you're going to get the salad with sides/desserts, definitely share or you won't have room after the salad! A good tasting and filing portion.
$5 Fries: Don't let the small cup fool you, there are a lot of fries for one order.
$5 Greek Froyo: Tasty and worth it. 

~Atmosphere/Service~
There's not a lot of seating but the space is bright and airy. People tend to filter through the seating pretty quickly. If weather permits, I recommend sitting on the green right across street. The staff was amazing and very accommodating. If you order froyo, they'll bring it to you after your food.
Don't get scared by the line, it moves relatively quickly.

Souvla is one of my favorite fast casual restaurants in San Francisco, and they have multiple locations around the city which is great and makes it accessible. It's the type of place where you order at the counter, take a number, and your food is brought out to you when ready. It can get pretty busy around peak times and I've had to stand up for a little after ordering my food, but I've always found a spot before my food arrives. They have a pretty simple menu where you choose a protein (there's a vegetarian option too), and then decide if you it in a salad or wrap, which each comes with unique ingredients that combined are phenomenal. They also offer sides like fries with various dipping sauces, and Greek frozen yogurt. The frozen yogurt is worth a trip here alone. They have some unusual but delicious toppings like olive oil and sea salt, but my personal favorite is the baklava!

Food is good but nothing outta this world. Waited in line to order and the bottleneck is mostly people who order wine/bubbly because the cashier will pour it into a chilled pitcher before pouring it into your glass and then you finally get out of the queue. I think they do this because seating is limited.

Ordered the lamb and pork shoulder salad. Both were good but I wouldn't wait in line just for it, especially during lunch hour.
This place is temporarily CLOSED. Would have been good to know before trekking there.

Tried out Souvla for lunch Wed 4/16/14.  It took over that Sebo spot on Hayes next to Patxi Pizza.  It's more bright with some two-tops and a communal table.  

You order at the back register, pay, get a number, sit down, and someone brings you your food.

I got the Pork Shoulder Wrap for $10.  Extra yogurt sauce is $1.  Got my food pretty quick.  Wrap is average size, good amount of meat, tiny amount of yogurt, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese.  I thought the meat was a bit chunky and kinda dry, but not too bad.  The extra yogurt sauce I think is skimpy, can't even tell it's in there.  Guy said it's in there, right.

Asked for hot sauce got Cholula hot sauce - nothing special.

Then I got the Greek Frozen Yogurt w/ sour Greek cherry preserve $4, with tax $4.35.  Paid at the front register where the yogurt machine is.  Thought it was just ok, small cup, kinda tangy, melts fast, preserve was pretty runny - sweet and a bit sour.

You can charge your food.

Simple menu, simple concept, delicious food. 

Souvla puts a nice modern spin on Mediterranean food. Flavors were light and bright, much like being on the beach on the Mediterranean. 

We tried the chicken salad, potatoes and chicken sandwich. The chicken is tender and seasoned just enough. The salad also included kale, romaine, shaved fennel, sliced oranges and pickled onions. The colors were beautiful and every ingredient had a purpose and made sense. The balance was perfect.

The sandwich was pretty much the salad inside of a piece of pita bread. Can't go wrong, especially with a fluffy cloud wrapped around your sandwich! 

The winning dish: the juicy potatoes. Considering the potatoes are dressed in chicken drippings, the flavors are surprisingly light and bright. Absolutely delicious. 

Finished off with the cherry frozen Greek yogurt. I won't even talk about it, just get it. 

Great sunlight. Nice amount of seating. And a bevy of cute young people to look at. My kind of place.

Will definitely be coming back to try other proteins. And the French fries are calling my name!
Not a vegetarian myself but this is my favorite salad in town! The pork salad and baklava yoghurt are my fave!

Souvla makes the best salad I've ever reluctantly put into my mouth.

Probably because it's covered in a generous amount of yummy roasted lamb bits and yogurt sauce.

If you're in the area, Souvla's a great option if you feel like grabbing a healthy (or at least healthy-feeling) soup, salad, or sandwich.  Not anything super revolutionary, but fresh solid Mediterranean flavors.  I had the lamb, but the chicken fire-roasting in the back looked very tempting.  Each choice of protein comes with its own combination of salad toppings, but they'll switch out the proteins at your request.

Frozen yogurt is also really good and relatively guilt free (again, can't speak for it actually being healthy, but "yogurt" sounds good for you right?).  The baklava topping was a bit pasty for my taste, I was expecting some of the flakiness of the puff pastry to be preserved.  Will try the olive oil and sea salt next time.

Tips and Tricks
-If you eat outside, be prepared for random people coming up to you asking what you're eating or if it's good.  Real live yelp reviews required
-Always get dessert!
-Actually gets really packed at dinner after 6

food tastes really good but this is for bad customer service at the Hayes location. I got salads for takeout today and not only the cashier was rude to me and rolled his eyes at me multiple times and started talking to the next customer in line when i was not even done he did not asked whether I want my dressing on the salad or on side and when I got home the salad was dry. Honestly the salads here are good for dressing but who wants to pay 13 dollars for a dry salad? I had bought two too. 
second complain: the lady who was preparing my froyos asked me something and since the restaurant was so loud I did not her therefore I just guessed and said what toppings I want and she just yelled at me "do you want lids?"
it wasn't a pleasant experience tbh. I don't understand why they were not nice.

The wait was about 5 minutes to order on a Saturday afternoon. The place was packed. 

Order at the counter, get a number, and then find a table.  When you walk in, you can see the chickens on the rotisserie in the back. 

The menu is straight forward for the main items: pork shoulder, Mary's free range chicken, lamb, or a sweet potato vegetarian option. You can get it in a pita or as a salad.  I got the salad with chicken - I asked for dressing on the side, but the leaves were already well wilted by the warm chicken fat. There was a good amount of oil/fat at the bottom of the salad, but it was a solid salad between the warm chicken, pickled onions, shaved fennel, cheese, and kale.

They do have beer and wine (limited, but it's all Greek!) They also have frozen Greek yogurt and some other things like Greek fries and avgolemono (it's been a while since I've seen that on a menu).

Food came out pretty quickly.

This new spot is really nice - I like their energetic staff, bright colors, and good quality greek food!

* American Homestead Pork Shoulder, Yogurt, Cherry Tomato, Red Onion, Cucumber, Feta ($10) - 4 stars
pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…
This had really great pork - it was rich and hearty and had a good flavor. It was all in a very thick soft wrap.

* Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles & Syrup ($5) - 4.5 stars
pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…
I loved this! The flavor had a slight hint of something cheese-y, the texture was thicker and more grainy than traditional froyo's. Just be aware it melts really quickly (and comes out just on the verge of starting to melt to begin with - so when they ask if you want your froyo right away with your food, maybe ask to pick it up afterwards. The baklava crumbles were amazing, covered in honey, delicious.

Menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…

I got the vegetarian salad bowl which was really filling since it was loaded with roasted sweet potatoes.  It was filling. Taste is okay.  My hubby got the lamb salad bowl which he loved.  We also got fries and the avgolemono soup which is good.  For dessert, we got the frozen yogurt soft serve with honey and baklava, sooo good and a nice way to end a meal.  Good service.  There's always a long line so better go during off peak hours or early dinner.

I have been to Souvla a couple of times now and it is definitely delicious food. They also have Greek wine and beer!

I ordered the Greek white wine to have with my lunch which was the lamb sandwich. I have had the salad before and it is really very good as well, not just a crappy salad, this is one salad I have actually enjoyed. The lamb was really tender and very flavorful, the sandwiches are a decent size, I couldn't finish it. The hot sauce is really good also, in case you are into spicy like I am. 

One of my friends that I was with ordered the Greek yogurt with the baklava pieces on top and omg, it was so good. The sweet baklava pairs so well with the tangy Greek yogurt, definitely not to miss if you can fit it into your meal.

Was absolutely blown away by this little spot. I have a soft spot for all food Mediterranean and the flavors here had that solid Mediterranean food taste but with a modern twist to it. 

Came here on a weekday night for take-out and you just choose your meat, and then whether you want it in sandwich or salad form. I got the sandwich although I've heard the salad is just as good. I got Mary's Free-Range Chicken with "granch" dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese. I am usually not a fan of putting citruses into my savory entrees but the blend of everything here with the super juicy chicken was AH-MAZING! Also got their Greek Fries and mmm...you definitely do not want to miss these. 

They also have frozen greek yogurt here with the most delicious sounding toppings (baklava crumbles, wildflower honey?!) but I just came from Loving Cup but next time!

The food has nothing to do with Greek food.
The service is really bad. Young, drunk, obnoxious patrons. No respect for others, extremely loud. 
Like everybody else the fries are the only thing that resembles tasteful food, limited menu and extremely extremely expensive for the quality of food. 
I am not sure how anyone could give good reviews to a place like this!!!
What can I say - an SF icon! When they first reopened the line was four hours long. Love the wraps here.

You can never go wrong with any of the Salads or Gyros here. The staff here is attentive, service is quick, and the food is healthy and delicious!

My favorite food items are the Chicken Salad and Pork Shoulder Gyro. Both dishes come with plenty of food and the salads usually last me about 2 meals. Very filling indeed!

I also recently discovered the Olive Oil Greek Yogurt and oh my goodness, it is absolutely AMAZING! It's the perfect balance of savory and sweet, yet so refreshing for a warm summer day. I literally have to order it every time I visit Soulva now. It's so addicting and great for sharing with another person!

Finally we've been able to make it here!!!
I've been trying to cross this place off my list for a long time.  Once I got her the line was out the door, keep in mind the place is relatively small.  Operationally everything runs so smooth here, this place is a well oiled machine.

We ordered a lamb sandwich, greek fries, and 2 frozen yogurts ( baklava, and cherry).  Initially I thought $13 for a gyro was ridiculous, however, they use big chunks of lamb here, rather than the compressed lamb/meat slab.  The sandwich was made with fresh ingredients and was delicious, the fries and yogurt was just as good.  Definitely a bit of a hipster twist here from traditional gyro sandwiches, but in the right direction.

I will more than likely be back to try more of their sandwiches!

Came here with friends and it was packed on a Thursday night. Very small restaurant. You order and find a table. It was my first time and I got the chicken gyro but on the lamb gyro. The gyro was very filling and big. My friend kept raving about the Greek yogurt with baklava so I tried it and it was very good. The baklava was too sweet though. I would come back for the gyro or the salads.

What Yougurt!!! Incredible I had the one with bakhlava and honey syrup, and I just couldn't stop eating. Do try some. The ambiance is a bit dark during the night but the servers are very hospitable.They bring the food to you and clean up the table afterwards. I also tried their garlic fries and want disappointed. A good place to go post dinner

The pork salad and sandwich here were just alright. All I really tasted from the salad bowl was the feta cheese, and I think they could've done a looot more with the pork to make it more juicy, tender, and flavorful. On the bright side, however, the veggies were fresh and the portions were generous. Service was also pretty quick and restaurant atmosphere was pleasant, albeit a bit cramped.

Meh. There are not a lot of menu options and what we ordered wasn't spectacular. If I am in Hayes Valley I would go to Papito's before coming back here. I had the salad with pork which was great, but it was just wayyy too oily. And the fries with cheese were good but there was hardly any cheese on it.

I'm glad I tried it but am not dying to come back. Their yogurts look good.

The place is small so get there early or be prepared to wait. It's also first come-first serve. Order at the counter and find a spot wherever you can. Fortunately, there is a lot of turnover so you can find a spot before your food comes. There is also family style in the middle. It's small, packed, cramped, and crowded.

I was introduced to Souvla five years ago, and it is still one of my all-time favorite restaurants.  I'm glad they're open for takeout now! My favorite orders include the chicken salad (ask for it greek style, and you get a hearty serving of their delicious greek fries on top of the salad), the pork salad (when I was 14, it turned me from a kale hater to a kale lover)! I almost always get the frozen greek yogurt--I usually ask for it plain because I personally prefer to enjoy the subtly tanginess, creaminess, and lightness of the yogurt without any of the toppings. That being said, you can't go wrong with the toppings either: if you have more of a sweet tooth than I do, try the honey, or the baklava. They're all amazing.

You choose a protein (or veggie) then a preparation of salad or sandwich.

FYI, it's not a typical gyro.  Meats are slow roasted, but not carved off a loaf on a vertical rotisserie.
 
In my pita sandwich, chunks of lamb were falling-off-the bone soft, with delicious braised flavor - perfectly tender and juicy!  So good, I'd eat just the meat and the bread, forgoing the harissa-yogurt sauce, feta, pickled onions, radishes and cucumbers.

I would like to try the fries served with meat drippings.  Sounds fantastic!

I had been meaning to try Souvla for a while, as I am a big fan of greek food. Since I was in the area and in need of lunch, I decided today was the day that I give it a try.

The location here is great, just a few shops down from Patricia's Green and situated among a number of other great restaurants, shops and dessert places. The presentation is great as well, everything from the trendy menu to the plating of the items served to you.

I have a few problems with Souvla though. For one, if I am going to be paying $12 for lamb at a place where you order at the counter, I expect to be getting a good amount of meat. As evidenced by my pictures, this is definitely not the case. This is further troubling as it is obviously intentionally hidden by placing a pile of radish and cucumber on top of everything else. 

Secondly, there are basically three options on the entire menu for entrees. You basically get to choose from chicken, lamb or pork and that's it. If you are going to so drastically limit my options, I am going to place a much higher level of expectation on the quality than normal. Although the food was maybe slightly above average, these higher expectations were not met.

Lastly, I was rather disappointed with the greek yogurt with baklava crumbles on it. Quite frankly there were no crumbles. As this item was prepared before me, I saw the server literally pour frozen yogurt in a cup and then attempt to smash a piece of baklava on top against the side of the cup. This is simply unacceptable. It would be trivial to actually have crumbled baklava ready to at the very least sprinkle on top, or even better, actually mix it in to the yogurt like the professionals over at loving cup do.

I doubt I will be inclined to give this place a second chance. I think Souvla needs to spend less effort trying to be trendy and more effort into increasing both the quality and quantity of their food.
My favorite place to have a relaxing dinner after work. Delicious food. Rooting for you to make it through Covid!

Came here for a quick late-night take-out dinner. This place definitely gets points for their hours, as finding a place to eat in SF after 9 P.M. is very challenging.

I like that the menu is super simple. You choose your ideal meat and you choose whether you want a salad or sandwich. There are a few other menu choices and some sides; however, it's very simple over all.

I ordered the pork sandwich and a side of fries. I have no regrets about the sandwich, even after bringing it home and eating it 15 minutes later.

The pork sandwich (basically a pork gyro) was flavorful, juicy, and well seasoned with all the right trimmings and the bread that held it together was hearty and tasted fresh.

The fries I would probably go without next time. They were fresh and hot but lacked the crunch I like. The parmesan cheese and parsley sprinkled on top was a nice touch but I wish the cheese would've melted on the fries.

*so good*

We ordered a pork sandwich, a veg salad, and a frozen Greek yogurt with baklava.

The pork sandwich was okay, pretty good but not *wow*

The veg salad was amaaaaaazing! Love the white sweet potatoes and how well all of the ingredients work together. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon and getting this again.

The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was perfect; not too tart, a good amount of sweet, and a nice portion of baklava on top to even it out. The one with just honey looked great too!

Greek fries were good but not mind blowing.
Yogurt with baklava was stupid good
Yogurt with honey was damn good but not as good as the baklava...

Would def have again

The pork sandwich was surprisingly delicious! I generally expect greek sandwiches to all taste the same but this one was very flavorful and the pork was well cooked and  tender. Would definitely recommend this.

The line gets long and its hard to find a seat but its easy to do take-out and eat on a bench at the park nearby.

Huge fan of this place. great atmosphere! I love how it's casual in the way that you order food at the counter but the restaurant itself doesn't feel too casual. the cashier was so friendly and helpful.

I ordered the lamb sandwich, greek fries, and bubbly wine. A++++ My friend ordered the lamb salad and said it was amazing. The food came out so quickly too!

Highly recommend this place. It's on the smaller side and tends to get pretty packed but don't fret! There's a park down the block where you can also eat if you so choose (I've done this before and it is lovely). 

Oh and I also ordered the Baklava fro yo... unreal. order it.

Simple menus are the best! Souvla is on the main strip in Hayes valley offering fast and fresh food. They have a few protein options which you can get in either a sandwich or salad. I went with chicken salad and it was scrumptious! Portions are generous so it is pretty filling. I also tried the Greek chicken soup which was great.

I am one of the few people in San Francisco that is not about the Souvla hype. I hate fennel so their salad is not my jam. The shredded chicken is dry and the pork is too fatty. I just can't win here...

But you know what wins here? Their fat, crispy fries. If I didn't mind waiting in the (ridiculous) long line and turning into a mochi ball, I'd eat the fries from here all day, err day.

Fortunately, that mochi ball look is not for me.

Very cute, small but service is very efficient and quick!

My best friend and I stopped by for lunch around 12pm and we missed the lunch traffic. You order at the counter, a number is given and waiter will bring your food to you. You can order the yogurt with baklava first and get it after your meal without waiting in line.

There are limited seating but we didn't have a problem finding two open seats at a table. 

I ordered:

Fries 
Lamb sandwich 
Greek brunch punch $6
Yogurt 

Total with tax $35

Overall- 

fries were awesome. So crispy and salty!

Greek brunch punch - refreshing but so small for a cocktail :(

Lamb sandwich - maybe I should have gotten the salad like everyone did but I had to try the sandwich since it was my first time and assume that's what souvla is known for? The cucumber and feta cheese was a great flavor combination but I thought the lamb was kinda dry. I actually wished the lamb was in stripes rather than chunks of meat? It was kinda hard to eat. Regardless the sandwich was flavorful and satisfying

Baklava yogurt- refreshing! I'm not a frozen yogurt fan but I can tell why everyone likes it! Great happy ending to the meal :)

Overall, friendly and quick service with great food makes me want to come back again! Especially for the fries and I want to try the salads!

Yummy!

Highlights
- Frozen greek yogurt with baklava and sour cherry syrup: Order it! Thank goodness this place is not close to me otherwise, I'll be here every day for this addicting treat. The perfect amount of tart, sweet, and crunch. It's SO good, just do it and thank me later. 
- Greek fries w/ Garlic yogurt: I don't even think it needs any type of dipping sauce, because it tasted delicious by itself. Thick cut fries with the right amount of seasoning and salt. 

Improvements
- Chicken salad: I ordered with pita on the side, thanks yelper for the recommendation. Ingredients were fresh, but everything tasted oily and bland. The garlic yogurt dip for my fries made this salad a lot more tastier. 
- Seating was limited during dinner time on the Saturday evening that I came. Consider take out if you are pressed for time and don't want to wait for a seat. 
- The cashier was not friendly nor helpful when I asked for recommendations and the other employee that brought my to go order out to me totally redeemed everything by simply saying a "Thank you and have a nice evening."

Tip
- Don't even try to drive here on a weekend evening especially when there are also events going on around the vicinity. Parking is ridiculous especially during peak dinner hours. Uber, Lyft, Sidecar, carpool, etc...you get the deal, trust me!

I was expecting a lot more from the souvla place. Our first time here.
We ordered 2 pork gyro sandwiches, one chicken ($13 each), which were quite dry and the pita bread wasn't the traditional greek pitta. 
We also ordered one greek salad (far from the traditional greek salad) which besides few olives, some crumbled feta cheese and not much olive oil was poor and dry with lots of greens that didn't  belong there!!
The greek yogurt was good (visino) with real greek yogurt taste!
All these with one beer and a portion of fries $63 total.

I've been meaning to try this place since I moved to San Fran. It's been on my bookmark lists for quite a while now I finally decided to give it a try a few days ago! And I must say it's quite good nothing too spectacular or anything. I really miss Zoe's Kitchen (East coast thing) but they had really good Mediterranean food ugh, bomb! 

Food was meh, just meh for me. I tried the lamb in a wrap. And it was decent I would say just alright. The meat was cooked prefect though! But this place food wise didn't quite hit the spot for me. The menu is very limited as well. You have options between 4-5 different meats and can have either a salad or wrap. I gave this place three stars because their frozen Greek yogurt!!! That's where it's at. The Greek fro yo with baklava is so DANK. I would definitely just come back here just for that whenever I crave. And a good price too, about $5.

One star down because of the awkward method of picking up online orders. During dinner rush, people picking up food are crowding near the register and yogurt machine, and when you're hangry, then it's really an annoying experience. You're trying to get the attention of a few of people behind the counter, but doesn't seem like there's a dedicated online order go-to person. 

The pork sandwich is delish, and baklava yogurt dessert is amazing. Pls improve the online pickup system!

Souvla is a great place for modern Greek food. The place is quite busy but worth it. I like that i can order my food (including a ticket for my greek yogurt) and eat comfortably, then pick up my fresh frozen yogurt afterwards. I got the pork salad which was good and generous amount. However I recommend the sandwhich since it was hot and more gyro like than a salad is. Both were great. The best was the frozen greek yogurt with baklava!! Great baklava and delicious sour greek yogurt. I will definitely go back and try their other greek yogurts!

DON'T ORDER DELIVERY FROM SOUVLA HAYES VALLEY !!!!!!!!!

I miss Greek food from living in England (kebabs after a few pints?). It's just not a thing here in SF but happy to see it here!!. There are a few places that have filled that need but this place, it's overpriced for what you get. The best thing is the pitta bread, and that's it, in my opinion.  Nevertheless, we ordered this evening through Caviar (the delivery service that they use). The food turned up on time at 720 PM  YAY !!  Unfortunately, we were missing an item. I called Souvla at 730 PM and that's where the shit the fan for me.  I found out that you cant talk to a person real-time. I was forced to leave a VOICE MAIL MESSAGE: really, IT'S A RESTAURANT!!!   

Pablo from the Hayes Valley site eventually called me back at 930PM, 2 HOURS LATER!! THIS IS PITIFUL!!  YOU ARE IN THE RESTAURANT BUSINESS!!   Who wants a response about their food this late? Pablo appeared to be a be nice guy but who directly blamed the lack of the missing item on Caviar and suggested I call them.  As I said on the phone NO SIR, IF YOU FILL THE BAG THEN THEY WILL DELIVER IT,  YOU CANNOT BLAME THE LACK OF AN ITEM ON THE DELIVERY SERVICE. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO THAT POINT OUT! Request for supervisor contact information not fulfilled; therefore Souvla sucks!

Food is always great and solid!!

Not "authentic" necessarily but delicious. Love the big salads and their frozen yogurt is SO GOOD. 

Be prepared for long lines unless you go at off times though.

Everything taste just so right and I loved loved loved loved the juicy potatoes 
I defiantly come back again when I come to city

My go-to spot when I come to Hayes. Literally everything is delicious, but you can't go wrong with a gyro and the baklava yogurt. Best thing ever!!

-B

Good spot for a quick lunch or dinner. Very lean menu with prom, chicken and vegetarian options.
I wasn't crazy about the potato option and that's the only vegetarian thing in the menu so not the biggest fan...

For vegetarian/vegan friends - based on the available options:

Vegetarian friendliness - 3
Vegan friendliness - 2

Souvla is a restaurant that I wish was a staple: the food is very solid, and prices aren't too high. (Note: they're supposedly opening one in the Alamo square park area on divisadero sometime this year!)

I've had the pork salad two times and have enjoyed it both times--it is very flavorful with a nice sweet component from the pork and a saltiness from the cheese. It also feels like you get quite a bit for your money, as the portion is pretty big. Haven't had the froyo yet but hope to try it sometimes.

There isn't much seating, so be ready to prowl for a seat or take it to go. I've been lucky enough to get a seat both inside and outside (very limited outdoor seating). The line ideas usually pretty long, but service is pretty fast. Great option if your in the area and looking for a fresh meal.

Time: Lunch
Ordering: did online ordering while walking 10mins to get there. 3 wraps were ready upon arrival. 
Food:  review only for lamb Gyro.
 quality pita, quality veggies and great hot sauce
3 stars because the meat was not organic and overpriced. Another overhyped restaurant on Yelp.

Souvla is a perfect definition of a hip restaurant in San Francisco. They have simple menu, service is quick, and food is AMAZING. 
To be fair, it is not authentic Greek food however you still get the craving fixed with a twist. 

Salad portion is huuuuge, and you get more dressing than a sandwich does. If you are a Foodie that likes extra sauces, I highly recommend for a salad bowl rather than a sandwich.

I tried Souvla for my first time last summer and was not very impressed with the food. I got the lamb sandwich and dined-in. The lamb from the sandwich wasn't for me - I don't know if they were having an off day, as the lamb is quite frequently raved about, but for me it was dry and almost too gamey for me to enjoy. I gave leftovers to a friend.

However, I recently ordered Souvla via Caviar for dinner because I was craving a salad. I can't tell you how many times I've walked by and seen people devouring such yummy looking salads, so I figured I'd give it another shot. I'm really glad I did. 

I ordered the chicken salad in addition to a cup of the frozen yogurt drizzled with sour cherry topping (had trouble deciding between that and baklava crumble). It was the perfect meal and I ate all of it. Like, every single morsel. 

The salad was super fresh, the pieces of chicken were plentiful and moist, the orange in the salad was such a complementary flavor to the savory chicken and tangy feta. I really enjoyed it. Then, I ate my frozen yogurt, which I had stored in the freezer while I was eating my salad. For me, I know a food is either really good or really bad when I put it in my mouth and squeal. Thank goodness it was the former. The yogurt is so light and the consistency is perfect - soft and creamy without being runny at all. The sour cherry topping is something that I will definitely get again - perfect amount of sweetness and tartness when paired with the yogurt. 

Now I crave this meal on the regular. Will be back soon. Thank you, Souvla!

This has become my new favorite Greek fast-casual restaurant! There was a huge line when we arrived, but it moved fast and our food arrived even faster! 

My friends and I shared a bottle of rosé (so awesome that they serve wine by the way)! We also shared a side of fries which were perfectly salty and crunchy!

I got the sandwich with chicken. It was so big that I couldn't finish it all but WOW it was tasty and you could tell all of the ingredients are fresh. The chicken was tender and shredded. With their "Granch" dressing which was creamy and delicious. As well as navel orange, red onion, and pea shoots. They place their hot sauce on all of their tables which I put on my sandwich and it escalated the taste! Their hot sauce is so so good! I put it on every bite!

Last, you must try their frozen greek yogurt! It's tangy and creamy the perfect dessert if you love greek yogurt. I topped mine with olive oil and sea salt which was addicting! Some people feel weird about the olive oil taste, but the combination is outstanding in my opinion. Highly recommend trying it if you're the type of person that likes to drizzle olive oil on your food.

Not a bad spot! I liked that the restaurant is located in a prime area of Hayes Valley. At first, the restaurant was pretty crowded (there was a line out the door) but the crowd thinned our pretty quickly. I also really liked the wine here. Would definitely come back.

I'm so obsessed with the "we are happy to serve you" design that I own a ceramic version of the ubiquitous in New York paper coffee cup. Souvla's greek fro yo creations (four in total) are served in these blue & white storied cups, with the olive oil & sea salt-topped one being pretty good. 

I appreciate Souvla's condensed menu. I've been experiencing decision fatigue when it comes to SF's restaurant scene; I'm relieved to have only one option that I'll eat here. Lamb, pork, chicken, & roasted white sweet potato can be made into a sandwich or salad (I chose the white sweet potato salad -- kalamata olives, toasted walnuts, pea shoots, pickled red onion, mizithra cheese, garlic yogurt dressing & added chicken -- which a staff member called "the best thing on the menu!") Rounding out the menu are four sides (Greek fries are super crisp.) 

Despite how uncomfortably warm the small space became as more patrons piled in, I'll return for the same salad & a different  Greek fro yo topping (sour cherry syrup calls my name.)

Here is a haiku for Souvla:

It's a gassy mess
Feel the Souvla aftermath 
Open the window

Go to favorite in SF for a quick bite - reasonably priced. Order ahead of time to beat the line. The vegetable salad is ! Packed with different veggies. It's consistently great. Food comes out quick. Limited seating but you can go to the Valencia st location and take your food to Dolores park or the the Hayes valley location and eat in the park. The fries are perfectly golden every time and seasoned well. If you're just looking for a quick dessert, they have awesome frozen yogurt. Very tart and refreshing. I'm partial to the olive oil and sea salt but my boyfriend likes the blueberry cobbler.

This restaurant is the best thing that has happened to SF's fast casual scene in the last decade. Before I moved to Portland, I was dining here once a week. 

Order at the counter, get your number + your bevvy, and grab a seat.

Dine-In
All locations are clean and modern and open and bright. I absolutely love that vibe when eating this kind of food.

Take-Out
I've gotten Souvla delivered more times than I can count and every single time it was almost as good as dining in. It's the perfect kind of food you want delivered when you are trying to stay healthy(ish) but you're too lazy to leave the house and you need something filling and delicious. 

Menu
Honestly, there isn't a single item I've had that I didn't love. 

My go-to is the lamb sandwich. I'm not one to get lamb over pork, BUT at Souvla IT ME. All meats are delicious, but their lamb is superior indeed. The sandwich is perfectly-sized to fill my tummy, but I don't feel over-stuffed if I eat the whole thing in one sitting. Impressive portioning IMO.

The salads are SUBSTANTIAL and I can never finish mine when I go that route, which I appreciate because it's not bad leftover either.

The greek fries are really just YUM. Add a side of Granch (Greek Ranch) and you will have yourself a perfect little side. 

The wine options are delish, but I usually go for the Greek cherry soda because it's a sugar bomb that I can't resist - like a Greek Jarritos if you will.

The BEST thing Souvla has to offer is their greek froyo. 
__
Pro Tip: Get the froyo with Baklava crumbs on top AND olive oil + flaky sea salt and don't look back.

My go to spot when I want a healthy, fast meal. My favorite is the chicken salad, but the lamb salad is very good as well. Their fries and soup are also very good. The real star of the menu is the baklava froyo though - greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles on top. I always take visitors to get this. The portions of the food are very generous. 

The vibe of the restaurant is fast casual - order at the counter then find a seat or get takeout. They have table seating, counter seating, and outdoor seating. It gets pretty crowded for dinner but you can also order ahead online. The staff is very friendly. Highly recommend!

The line moves fast so hang tight. The food is def worth the wait. Went on Saturday night at 7:30 pm and waited maybe 25 mins. All the food was delicious and the frozen Greek yogurt is worth all the calories!!!

I'm personally not the biggest fan of Greek food but had to give this place a try because so many fellow yelpers raved about it. At 6:30PM on a weekday, the line was already out the door. 

Chicken Salad (13) - STRAIGHT FUEGO! Highly recommend! Next time I'm definitely getting dressing on the side because it is a bit oily. The "granch" dressing is basically greek yogurt and ranch, which is as delicious as it sounds. Defeats the purpose of eating a salad if you're gonna drench it though. If you choose to live your life on the edge, by all means, go ham.

Lamb Sandwich (13) - Lots of meat so you're definitely getting what you paid for. However, the lamb was a tad dry. I felt like it could've used more yogurt. The cucumber gave it a nice crunch and was refreshing too! 

Frozen Greek Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles (5) - ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Not too sweet, even with the syrup. Perfect way to end the meal.

I would make my way over here for the dessert alone. This is an excellent spot for a solid post-gym meal. Will be back!

I'm a big fan of Greek food and I was a little hesitant about this place because it seemed too "healthy" and "hipster" to have good flavor, but I was wrong! This place is so charming. Loved the décor. My friend and I stopped by for a quick bite before heading to a yoga event at Fort Mason.

We shared the Mary's Free Range-Chicken salad and Superior Farms Lamb Leg sandwich. Both were AMAZING. I don't know what they do with the kale-- but it's probably the best kale I've ever had. You know, now that I think about it... I'm not even sure it was kale. Whatever it was, it was bomb.

I did notice that it seemed like everyone around us ordered the Greek fries-- there must be something special about them. I'll have to try them next time I'm here. I also JUST noticed that they have Frozen Greek yogurt on the menu-- definitely will try that next time too!

Tip: You order first and then find open seating. It can be a little crowded, but you should share tables and meet some friends. :)

I came to Souvla on two separate occasions. 

The first time a friend introduced me here for weekday lunch. There was a line but wait was less than 10 minutes. 

I had the rotisserie chicken salad and I have to say, it's one of my favorite salads of all times! I never had fruit in my salad that I actually liked, but this was different. Orange slices paired with chicken created a nice acidity with some sweetness. The salad comprised of kale, pickles, and feta cheese (I think?). Seating was hard to find, so we ate at a nearby park. A little pricey for a salad though. 

The second time I came with 5 other friends. My boyfriend and I tried the pork shoulder wrap and fries with garlic greek yogurt. The pork wrap was meh as it was wrapped in a really dry pita. Even the veggies and sauce couldn't make up for it :P

The fries on the other hand were marvelous but the star was that garlic dip! It was so rich and creamy it felt like I was heavy cream + sour cream. Dip your hot fries in it and you won't regret it ;) 

I sampled the baklava and honey frozen greek yogurt from friends and it was delicious as well! The greek yogurt was different than what I expected as it was tart and mildly salty. The baklava and honey complemented it really well though. 

In summary, the chicken salad, baklava/honey greek yogurt, and the fries WITH garlic yogurt dip is the way to go.

Greek fries are a MUST! Fries are crispy brown on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside. Very flavorful from the garlic and feta cheese. Pork shoulder sandwich was juicy and moist. There was a lot of meat packed in that wrap. Vegetable salad had massive sweet potato slices. Never had a sweet potato in my salad, but paired well with the kale. It was a lot of food but at least it was healthy. Next time I will come back for the greek yogurt.

Incredible service, good food, and just a relaxed ambiance. 

I've been to this place a few times, because I love walking up and down Hayes Valley. No matter how long the line is, they bring out food so quick and their staff is so kind! Their lamb and pork dishes are really good, but I really come here for their greek yogurt. A++ to the ones with Baklava as well as the olive oil and sea salt. Their fries are amazing too!! I recommend the garlic sauce. 

I'll be back soon to have a nice dinner with some wine to accompany. Love ya, Souvla!

I love this food however I am EXTREMELY disappointed in the woman working at the counter today. She was extremely rude, I ordered an online order. She helped out four different people in the line, no issues. And then I politely say " excuse me can I please get help". She goes "there's a line". Finally I get my food, and I say thank you she says nothing in return and gives me a nasty look. The point of online orders is to get it quickly. Not to wait for her to check out the whole line serving wine and soft serve which takes a while. She took seven minutes of my lunch break. I would've been better off hopping in line and ordering food. No waitress should be rude to her customers when they are simply waiting for an order that is ready and takes two seconds to pass out. Again the food here is amazing and all the men that work here are fabulous. Extremely disappointed in this woman and her inappropriate behavior.

It is all about the salads. Don't let anyone else tell you otherwise.

Another tip - the Souvla hot sauce is great. Add fries to your salad also.

Not at all a fan of the wraps. Granted, I had just come back from Greece and was craving Greek food. I came here when they opened in 2014 and  was very disappointed in the wraps. They were dry and bland. I did try the frozen greek yogurt with sea salt which I enjoyed at the time. Since then, I haven't liked the yogurt, maybe because they put too much sea salt. I also found the baklava overwhelmingly sweet.

Back to the salads, they are special. Obviously salads are best fresh, but Souvla salads are one of the few that travel well and is good the next day. I've ordered Souvla through Caviar for work lunches and dinners, because really, there aren't many salad options when you're ordering for dinner. I typically get the chicken or pork salad and add fries. Occasionally, I'll ask for the lamb salad and sub out the lamb for chicken or pork.

My new favorite! Great healthy salads and sumptuous meats. 

I now understand why the line is so long!

One of my fave go to fast casual spots in sf. They make healthy taste good. 

Chicken sandwich or salad is amazing with the Greek fries. Order at the counter and sit in the park nearby or get delivery as it's a bit small and usually busy.

Everybody needs to get their frozen yogurt with baklava crumble!! I love a good tart cup of froyo and they did not disappoint. The baklava sweetness complements really well with the yogurt tartness. 

We also ordered the chicken sandwich which was as good as the reviews made them out to be! I do wish they had a little more of the salad part (my last few bites we're just chicken and some dressing) but otherwise, would definitely come again!

I dream of the veggie salad. 

Yep, it's that good! A big ol' bowl of kale, pea sprouts, walnuts, olives, pickled red onion, and sweet potato. If you're a veg-head order this and thank me later. I got it without cheese/dressing on the side, and it was perfect. If you're vegan or dairy free they automatically give you oil on the side. For everyone else, a dollop of the garlic greek yogurt dressing is delicious. My friend ordered the chicken salad and loved every bite. Keep in mind the salads are big enough to share, so if you order your own you may end up with leftovers. Dessert also looked delicious, but we were too stuffed to try anything. What a perfect excuse to return!

See ya soon, Souvla!

Frozen Greek Yogurt?!? I never knew that existed!! It's like froyo, but more tart and greek yogurt tasting. Be sure to get the one topped with baklava and honey -- your taste buds will be in heaven! I was secretly annoyed that my friend kept stealing huge bites of my yogurt....

The salad is also amazing! The chicken is so flavorful and tender and I was surprisingly very full after eating about half the sandwich. Of course, to counterbalance the healthy salad, I ordered a side of fries. They're seasoned deliciously as well!

I can't wait to come back and eat more frozen greek yogurt!

Omg I love this place! Delicious salads, reasonably priced. I loved doing pick up here. So easy to order online and they have so many custom options for your salad. It was ready so quickly! I got the chicken salad with fries on top, which was an excellent decision. It was like having delicious croutons - they were even good when they got cold and soggy after a while. Generous portion, I didn't even snack the rest of the night and I wasn't hungry when I woke up. 
I did order the $4 iced tea and I didn't like it. Overpriced and too sweet for me. It's bottled so maybe it would be better poured into a glass with ice. 
Definitely will be returning for the convenience and taste and I'm already worried I'm going to spend too much money here.

My husband and I heard about this place. We were in the area over the weekend and tried its salad. There was a line but it was very fast. I ordered chicken salad and my husband got lamb salad. To our surprise they were not as good as we expected. The salad size was reasonable with a variety of vegetables. The downside was the dressing. It was too greasy and unhealthy for us. We preferred that the dressing was not mixed and came aside the salad. The chicken was greasy too and didn't taste good. Overall, the food was not very special and still expensive.

Absolutely scrumptious fries! A must get. The chicken salad was delicious as well, and so  was the vegetarian salad with sweet  potatoes -  fresh and high quality ingredients with flavorful garnish to create a beautiful salad. The food truck area is a very nice area to meet up with friends - wish there were more tables and chairs to accommodate more guests since it is soo popular on the weekend. Down the street are many nice coffee shops and dessert shops for an after lunch stroll. Beautiful way to spend the weekend with  friends and loved ones  in SF!
I love this little spot. Amazing dessert, good sized food. Tasty and definitely worth the drop in.

This place usually has long lines, but tends to move fast. I tried the Greek rose wine which was on point. I also tried the baklava greek yogurt which had an unexpected tartness mixed with the rich baklava. A delicious combo that it took a few bites in to really appreciate. Wouldn't think it, but it paired well with the rose. Very eclectic decor, worth another treat if only just for the baklava yogurt. A+ for originality.

4.5 stars

I'm shocked I've never been to Souvla. Finally had the opportunity one late Sat afternoon. We stopped by around 4:30 pm and there was still a line albeit very short. We ordered the lamb salad, chicken salad, Greek beer, white wine and yogurt with sea salt and olive oil. I love that you can pay for the yogurt ahead of time and get it after you finish your meal. It was a bit pricey for lunch but after i took a bite of my salad, I understood why. The ingredients are really fresh and they provide a generous portion of salad and the meat. Everything tasted very fresh and overall the meal was filling. I was surprised by the quality of the white wine - it was very fragrant and perfect for a summer day in SF. We were able to snag seats outside and people watch - lots of fun watching all walks of life enjoy Souvla. Lastly, the Greek yogurt is to die for!!! It is the perfect combination of sea salt and olive oil, down to the last bite. Can't wait to come back and try the fries as well as other flavors for the yogurt.

Best frozen Greek yogurt I've ever tasted in my life!!! Okay maybe one day I'll go to Greece and have some yogurt but right now this place takes the cake. The salads were pretty good too. I liked my bf's pork salad better than my chicken one though. The meat was so tender. I also liked the creamy dressing and the salad that came with it. We ordered a side of fries but it was just okay, nothing special. I just know that I'll be back for the Greek yogurt because it was amazing.

Not the worst - Not the best either ... 
The lamb sandwich has a good amount of lamb and the fries are pretty tasty ... Could have gone for a little tomato and extra yogurt sauce on my sandwich ... The $1 I spent on the garlic yogurt dip for my fries was sans garlic as far as we could tell ... The best part ? The Greek Cherry Soda ... From a bottle ... They didn't make it or anything ... IF - If I ever do go back it'll be to try the frozen yogurt ...

I was helping a friend move into his new apartment in SF and as a mid-move snack, we came here. All I can say is that he's pretty lucky to live across this place!!! I would come here all the time.

+ Pork salad: the pork was really good, not dry or flavorless. And they pack in a LOT of meat which is nice; I hate when salads are literally 98% lettuce. My only gripe is that because it was a salad, the yogurt sauce was spread pretty thin. I noticed the sandwiches were packed with so much more flavor. 
+ Lamb sandwich: I really really liked the ingredients that came with the lamb option, and the meat itself was pretty good, if not a bit dry. The real winner was the pita bread that the "sandwich" was wrapped in - soooo fluffy, not dry or stale by any means!
+ Greek fries: really crispy but a bit plain. It doesn't have very much flavor to it.

Wish I had gotten to try the frozen Greek yogurt, but I had to save room for Smitten ice cream! The decor is awesome and the space is really pretty, though a tad bit small. I wouldn't recommend bringing larger parties here. The order system was pretty quick, too. I could imagine myself coming here quite often for a fast meal. Too bad it's on the other end of the state..

Excellent and innovative Greek-style cuisine, great service, awesome location and reasonable prices. The chef here, Tony, did eight years as chef de cuisine at Kokkari and it shows.

The chefs here are talented at being both inventive / experimental and delivering high quality, excellent tasting dishes. For example, multiple rotisserie meats, including lamb, pork and chicken hand encrusted with cheese grinds giving the meats a flavorful boost. We had the chicken and actually ended up taking an additional entire rotisserie chicken home with us. Another example is the Frozen GREEK yogurt - my favorite was the baklava flavor, but the olive oil and salt flavor was yummy and new. The salad was refreshing and well made. 

So, carryout is an option, but I still recommend dining in. The decor is pretty cool. There are both tables and bars to enjoy your meal. It's a small restaurant and popular so seating may be limited. It has a clean / hip vibe. 

The surrounding neighborhood is very cool too and worth walking around just to check out.

I highly recommend Souvla. Looking forward to returning.

Just tried Souvla for the first time last week (upon recommendation by a Warby Parker employee) and I'll definitely be back many, many times! It was super quick and delicious - I ordered the lamb as a salad bowl and my friend ordered the lamb gryo. Both were great, but I was a little disappointed that the salad was more expensive than the gyro, since it's less bulky, but I'd order it again in a heartbeat. The fries and garlic sauce (an extra $1!) were also too good to pass up!

Pricey? Heck yes. Worth it? Definitely.

Solid, reliable food. Casual Greek food, pretty much everything is good. 

I usually go with the chicken or lamb salad or wrap -- have never had anything here I didn't like.

The fries were very good! I ate them all which is a rarity. The lamb sandwich was okay, nothing to write home about. I'm a big fan of lamb but the sandwich could have used more flavor.

I liked the casual ambiance and would go back but get a my meal on a salad instead. The lamb was cubed and fell out of my sandwich and on my dress. I'm also a clutz!

Tough decision between sandwich and salad but went with salad since I was dining alone and wanted room for dessert (hello baklava crumbles on greek frozen yogurt!!!). 

The warm chicken on the cold salad was divine. Followed up with the perfectly sweet yogurt & chewy baklava crumbles, my heart and belly were so pleased. Walk it off strolling nearby shops. Great area and I will certainly return to Souvla!!

First time here this past Sunday! Ordered the lamb sandwich, chicken sandwich, pork salad, lemon chicken soup and fries. Best item was the pork salad. Great taste and fresh ingredients. Soup was good and also the fries. I wish the fries had just a little more cheese though. Unfortunately, both sandwiches were very dry. I took one bite of the lamb sandwich and completely lost interest 
:( The bread AND meat were D.R.Y.
Best Greek yogurt I have ever had. Baklava crumbles were delicious. They were also discounted for pride.

I can't get enough Souvla! I've tried all of their salad options and like that they all are slightly different - the pork and chicken are probably my favorites. The juicy potatoes are crazy good, as is the frozen yogurt - baklava for a classic Greek flavor, olive oil and salt for something slightly different.

Yes, this location is on the smaller side and I've often had to wait for a table, but I've never been stranded long and always have been able to find something before my food arrives. 

Plus they are on Caviar! Perfect meal for when you have a crazy day and need something yummy delivered.

So I've always wanted to go to Souvla but being a pescatarian there isn't great options here. I finally went with a friend couple nights ago who convinced me the vegetarian option was good too. I ordered the vegetarian salad which was kale, roasted sweet potatoes, pea sprouts, mizithra cheese, kalamata olives. It wasn't bad for a salad, and the sweet potatoes (aka the veg equivalent of a protein) was a generous helping. But for as much as people love Souvla's meat options, I am disappointed that the veg option is pretty basic, nothing special. Especially in a city like SF where vegetarian food standards are so high. Maybe some protein - like chickpeas would be good - it is a Greek spot after all.
We also split the Greek frozen yogurt with the baklava topping - really good froyo (not too sour or sweet) and the baklava was decent considering it is Greek ;)

Really irked by how an employee treated us when we came to eat. Brought a friend from LA because I love Souvla and knew she would too. 

We ordered to-go because all the seats were jam packed and couldn't find a spot. After we ordered, spots outside opened up and we sat outside. The employee who came outside gave us our food and glared at us "didn't you guys take this to go??" Like he didn't want us eating outside or eating here at all because we ordered to go. I quickly said, "oh we are going to eat a little and leave." Then he doesn't say anything and stormily cleans up the dishes beside us. 

I'm bothered by this because we felt uncomfortable and uneasy like we weren't allowed to dine on premise. We would have said "dining here" if there had been spots open. We sat for two minutes and left to eat in the park. 

I LOVE the food don't get me wrong, but it's Friday and I just wanted to enjoy a day with my friend. His unwelcoming attitude bothered us for the rest of the day.

Whenever someone asks me for a restaurant recommendation  I ALWAYS recommend Souvla. They're salads and sandwiches are delicious and filling. I probably eat Souvla 2-3 times a month. 

Souvla is the perfect ambiance for a date (casual yet romantic lighting) or to meet up with friends. The food is beyond delicious and they offer alcohol and amazing frozen greek yogurt.

The pricing is pretty decent (typical SF pricing) and the food is VERY filling. When looking at the menu, you pick your protein (chicken, lamb, veggie, etc) then you decide if you want it as a salad or sandwich. The sandwich is wrapped in a yummy warm pita bread and the salad serving is large enough to save some for lunch the next day or if you're very hungry it is super filling. 

They pair chicken with yummy fresh oranges and lamb with crips radishes. My favorite is the chicken salad and the lamb sandwich. The chicken is moist and juicy and you can even buy a full chicken when there. There is typically a line outside of the door but it moves quick, the Hayes location is somewhat small and can be hard to find seating but the park is nearby.

I'm also a huge fan of the fries and typically get my salad or sandwich "greek style"--- which means they stuff a handful of fries onto my salad or into my sandwich for a small fee more. 

Don't forget to try the Baklava frozen greek yogurt!

Try Souvla, you won't regret it.

This place came highly recommended, so my expectations were set a bit high.  When I got here with my +1 for dinner, it was super small and crowded. I don't mind waiting for food and the wait wasn't too long (10 mins or so).  I ordered a salad, he ordered a sandwich.  The salad was ok, and my friend couldn't finish the sandwich- it just wasn't enjoyable, food or atmosphere. We couldn't wait to leave and get an evening drink elsewhere, and left us wishing we ate somewhere else.

Checked this place the other weekend for a nice casual lunch date with a girlfriend. 

We got the lamb and chicken salad over the pita wrap in effort to save some calories. My friend preferred the chicken over the lamb because she found it was a bit more tender and juicy. I agreed and felt the lamb was a bit dry but may be because the meat isn't served as warm,
causing the muscles and such to tighten. 

Again due to the poor timing with the diet I'm on, we passed on the frozen Greek yogurt but when I come back I will totally get that bad boy and even opt for the pita. (They looked gigantic btw!)

Favorite fast-casual place for salads. I only get their chicken salad (didn't love the lamb and used to get the pork, but recently discovered their chicken salad is way, way better because the pork is usually kind of dry). Find the sandwiches to also be on the drier side (have only tried the pork). Their froyo is pretty good and servings are large. Will usually get the sea salt & olive oil combo as the other combos are too sweet for me. 

Lines can get pretty long during lunch hour. Have definitely ordered online, while waiting in person on a long ass line, and ended up cutting my wait time in half
This place is great. The lamb, chicken and pork salad are all good and so are the wraps. Fries are crispy and go well on top of the salad. The lines are annoying but the outside seating is helpful.

Was in Hayes Valley when I remembered a friend recommended Souvla a while ago. The restaurant was pretty small, but really clean and well-decorated. Eucalyptus branches on the table and white tiling just make you want to stay there for hours and hours. 

In terms of food, I wasn't too hungry so all I had were Greek fries. They were good but still a bit pricey all things considered. I'd come back to try the frozen Greek yogurt and the main dishes though!

Amazing, every time!
Always busy, always fast!
Friendly staff!
Delicious food plentiful portions my favorite is veg salad, add chicken, dairy free!!!

This place is awesome. We got there during a mad rush for a late lunch but the line moved quickly and the turnover to sit and eat is quick so easily got a seat. I was a bit skeptical because I hate atmospheres where you feel like you are fighting for a seat and made to wait for ever but it seems to be a form of controlled chaos that seemed to work.

Anyhow, the food is awesome. The Chicken salad was one of the better salads I have had...it is a very filling meal. The veggie sando was mediocre, and we should have ordered chicken or pork. The french fries are perfectly thick and crispy. And that greek yougurt with honey...wow seriously delicious. Big fan and can't wait for their new location! Will definitely be back to try some other items on menu.
Super delicious vegetarian options- I got the salad and the yogurt with baklava crumbles. Ordered on their website and it was ready under 10 minutes. Great experience end to end.

The food at this price point is about as good as you can find anywhere. It is seriously good. 
My gripe with this location is simply the availability of seating...as in there isn't much. The new parklet has helped a bit, but this isn't a place to get a bottle of wine and relax.

Quick service. Solid, hearty, authentic enough Greek wraps. Cool artwork and vibes. No complaints here! The lamb and chicken were both tasty, and the friend Greek yogurts with baklava, honey syrup, cherry, and sea salt were all scrumptious!

After our training, we were leaving and our awesome driver coworker was telling us about the food places in Hayes area and he was telling us about this joint. 

There wasn't a line until we were in line and the line went out the door. When the line is out the door... it means it's good. You can have a salad or sandwich, with lamb, beef, chicken, or vegetarian. They have Greek fries and potatoes and other delicious sides. Let me just tell you, the fries never made it back to the office. 

Me and another coworker got a lamb sandwich to share, my half tasted a little dry but my coworker loved it. I loved the greens and the sauce inside the sandwich. 

Oh right, the bathroom is nice and clean. When the bathroom is clean, it means the restaurant is clean too. There are seating outside and some seats inside. 

I recommend it if you like Greek food!

Is it weird that I sometimes only come here for the frozen yogurt? I wonder if anyone else does that too... But yes, Souvla's frozen greek yogurt is just that good - especially the one with the baklava crumble and honey drizzle! I've been meaning to try the other flavors (olive oil drizzle or cherry syrup drizzle), but that baklava crumble and honey drizzle combo is keeping me from doing so. This place is a fast casual restaurant where you order up at the register, you're given a number, and they bring out the food to you. This location in particular is on the smaller side compared to the other ones around SF. There's a decent amount of seating inside, but during lunch hours, good luck finding a spot! Luckily they have additional outdoor seating, as well as a park a few steps away where you can sit and enjoy your food. Now for the food (besides the frozen yogurt) - I've only tried the chicken pita sandwich and the greek fries so far.
