The chicken pita sandwich was pretty good overall; the chicken had a well-balanced flavor and moisture and the veggie mixture inside of it was a nice balance, especially the oranges that added a great contrast. The pita bread was nice and fluffy, but I felt like the pita bread was disproportionate to the amount of chicken and veggies inside. The greek fries are just okay by themselves, but if you really want to elevate them and make them even better, get it with the harissa spiked greek yogurt sauce! It had a nice little kick and spice to it, but still had that slight greek yogurt acidity. Overall, Souvla is a great little spot for a quick lunch, but probably not something I would get on a weekly basis (except for the frozen yogurt) as the food is pretty pricey ($13 for the chicken pita sandwich and $6 for the fries w/ dipping sauce).

Great food for a decent price - as a vegetarian I wish there were a few more options for food. I I usually grab the Sweet Potato salad with a side a fries if I'm really hungry...but it's still pretty delish. 

Still waiting on trying the Frozen Yog.

Eat here all the time and love it every time. Prices are getting a bit high though. 

The chicken salad is my favorite, but they are all good. Just tried the soup, and it was amazing. The fries are some of my favorite in the whole world. The hot sauce is so perfect, I can drink it by itself. The froyo is delish. Service is consistently good. Ingredients seem top-notch. 

If Michelle Obama orders this when she's in town, then it's got to be good.

But I don't have Michelle's book money, and as the price increases, will I keep coming to Souvla so much?

If you're a gyro fanatic, then you need to give Souvla a try. This is definitely my favorite gyro spot. I ordered the lamb gyro with fries. The lamb is slow roasted in house and is amazingly tender. I love the pita here as well. Just a heads up, this place is typically busy so it may be difficult to find a table, especially if you're with a larger group. The food comes out fairly fast as well!

The Souvla food truck opens at 10 am and sits in the Hayes Valley park on a sunny piece of concrete scattered with bistro tables and chairs. The menu offers a thoughtful variety of both meat and vegetables, each of which can be made into a sandwich or salad. My lamb wrap came with pickled red onions, feta, and garlicy yogurt sauce, the meat for which wasn't gamey or tough at all. The cubes of lamb could have stood up to a more piquant marinade, perhaps a combo of red wine or red wine vinegar, lemon, and evoo, and the sandwich was calling for some dressed spicy greens to gussy up the textured flavors. I ordered a Greek iced tea, which wasn't too sweet, making that a complementary choice for the assertive flavors of the sandwich.

Every time I pass by this place, there's a line out the door. Being the impatient, hangry woman I am, I don't like waiting in lines for food. So here I go, dragging my mom to come have an early dinner with me on a late Tuesday afternoon, and lo and behold! No line! 
Our two chicken gyro-type "sandwiches" and Greek fries came out in less than 5 minutes. The chicken sandwich tasted like a gyro from a more American perspective. If you're looking for the typical chicken kabob-type gyro that has tomatoes, lettuce, and lots of yogurt sauce, it's not what you'll get from Souvla. But despite that, I really enjoyed this unexpected gyro, with its oranges and radishes and all. The pita bread used was also great.
We ordered Greek Fries as well and I don't know about y'all, but for some reason, Mediterranean places make the best fries, and this is no exception. Just get them; they will complete your meal.
And of course we had to try the frozen Greek yogurt! I love baklava, so I could've used some more baklava in it, but that's just me being greedy. The yogurt itself was refreshing, tangy like your favorite 2% original Fage yogurt cup, and after having it, you will never wanna go back to that self-serve froyo again. 

Souvla is wonderful spot in beautiful Hayes Valley if you want a quick, quality bite!

Came here for lunch with my cousin this afternoon. There was no outdoor seating available (it was a rare 71 degrees) so we took our food to go and walked to a table in the park area down the block. I had the Greek fries and a side salad. Everything was fresh and the fries had the perfect amount of crisp. I also thought they made our order fairly quickly considering the line. Will be back to try other dishes.
The lamb sandwich is soooo good. The salad with lamb is also amazing. There's not much more to say. Love it!!!

Souvla is my go-to for casual weeknight dinners with a friend or three when I'm trying to eat good food without blowing my entire budget on a single meal.

The menu is fairly basic: your choice of pork, chicken, lamb, or sweet potato in your choice of salad or sandwich. Both are excellent. I usually order chicken, largely because of the aesthetic window of rotisserie chickens spinning on the back wall (also because it is usually tender and delicious) but the pork and lamb options are also solid. You can't go wrong with any of the meats. I typically order salad so that I can feel healthy enough to follow it with frozen Greek yogurt. The baklava crumble & honey topping is a delightful conglomeration of textures and flavors. I would also recommend the olive oil and sea salt.

Be prepared to wait, or plan to arrive a bit earlier or later than the standard lunch or dinner rush. You order at the cash register and they give you a number, which you can take to a table to wait (if you are lucky enough to find an empty one or stealthy enough to snag a seat as the previous patrons finish). After many visits, I've observed that the line typically gets longer on the hour, especially if you are going at a peak time (e.g. Friday or Saturday dinner).

Finally got to try this place.
The 4 stars is really on the decor, fries, and the frozen yogurt. I wasn't overly impressed with the pork sandwich (in a pita). Thought it was on the dry side and after a few bites, I didn't really want to finish it. 

Best friend got the fries and they were really crispy! May have to get those again!

Definately going back for the yogurt! Super refreshing, sweet but not overly sweet, and very flavorful. Yum!

We got there at 11am on a Saturday and there was a line of 2 people. Around noon, the line was about 15 people plus so the tip is to go earlier.

Omg, the frozen yogurt is freaking amazing. We literally drove from Cupertino two days in a row to eat this yogurt (and to go to the Away store down the street). I like every single flavor they have! Super tart and milky, good large portion size, overall just an amazing dessert. 

We also ordered fries and a lamb pita wrap. The meat was well seasoned and not dry, fries were well seasoned as well and piping hot! 

My only complaint is that parking is super difficult in this area and that this restaurant was packed on both Saturday and Sunday. 

So much love for this restaurant!

Didn't get to try the food here, but I did get to try the frozen yogurt! OMG, YES. The most popular flavor is baklava crumble with honey syrup. AND dang, it's just as good as it sounds. There's just enough baklava bits to give it some texture. Both the baklava and honey was a nice contrast to the tartness (not super, super tart) of the frozen yogurt. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this. 

TIP: it's a pretty small space. You order and then seat yourself. It's first come, first serve. So,  be patient or be ready to take it to go.

Definitely will be coming back here to try their savory dishes!

This place is really great! I got a lamb salad, potatoes, and Greek fries and I was blown away. The food was fresh, well prepared, and genuinely delicious. The Greek fries were a cant miss, will definitely be coming back!

Hmm...so Michelle Obama orders food from here and carries it with her on the plane?  Really?  I have news for her, the food served on the plane might be better than this overpriced bowl of salad!  But then, this is SF, how will you pay your employees and still stay in business if you don't bilk your customer?

I'm not going back!  Even Daphne's is better(tastier).

Who says good food needs to be authentic! This place kills it when it comes to meat on a Spit (Rotisserie)! I got the chicken pita and my wife got the chicken salad. Amazing juicy chicken with the perfect amount of seasoning. 

Another thing we liked was there unique offering of beverages. Casual but still a nice enough date place.

Delicious and well priced. I usually go for any of the wraps. Meats are juicy, well spiced and accompanied by a nice variety of veggies. The wraps are all tasty and filling. To be gluttonous I go for the feta fries on the side. 

Sometimes I get a craving for their lemon soup. It's simple and warms my soul.

I also like that they have froyo. I go for the honey and sea salt topping. That said it's not my favorite froyo but it hits the spot. 

Great for lunch. Go treat yo taste buds.

Great place for a quick (if not too busy), informal Greek bite. Salad with the roasted chicken was addicting. The lamb gyro was filled with cucumber, pickled onion, and feta goodness. The frozen yogurt with the baklava crumbles was amazing. 

Whenever we're in the area we try to come by. Highly recommend.

Best salad I've had in years...no joke. Had the chicken bowl and loved every piece of it. Large portion and got fries on the side which were also amazing with their signature dip "Granch". Always crowded and line so be prepared but worth it for a daily cheap and quick lunch. They need to expand.

Food: good looking and good tasting
Mary's Free-Range Chicken sandwich was very pretty (so this is why Souvla is popular on Instagram!). I'd eagerly go back, as the sandwich was unexpectedly delicious. The orange and cheese toppings complemented each other well and tasted really fresh/healthy with the chicken. Get the sandwich to fill you up, unless you feel like paying $1 extra for the salad.

Atmosphere: Greek and Chic
A restaurant you'd stumble into while walking around Greece. It's very charming with open windows, fresh air, and blue walls. You can see the rotisserie in the back, so it feels like you're in a kitchen. We took our food to-go (it was wrapped very cleanly in a white box) because we couldn't find seating, but I would've gladly eaten here. Service was fast.
My chicken wrap was so bland, I needed to add hot sauce to it to add some taste. The lamb and pork one were just ok. Will skip this one next time.

My roommate mentioned Souvla a few times, saying the salads are huge and delicious, and it was one of his favorite things to eat. So I went a few days ago, but they were closed for a family thing, and I ended up eating Oreos for dinner instead. It was a little bit tragic after my roommate got me so hyped. Anyhow, I finally went tonight. I got the veg salad and it was AMAZING!!!! I had just the salad for dinner, and I feel like I had a fabulous dinner.

The yogurt dressing, the mizithra cheese, the super fresh and crunchy kale, the delicious sweet potatoes, the sweet sauteed onions, and the kalamata olives combined into a perfect flavor combo. It seems so simple, but just tastes so good. This is one of my new favorite things to eat.

What I like the most about here is that the menu isn't all over the place. They do a few things and they do it well. 
You can choose from pork, chicken, lamb, and veggies and have it as either a wrap or a salad. The salad usually costs a dollar more than the wrap.  My facorite is the chicken salad which comes on a huge bed of kale. It's surprising how large and filling the salad is, especially for the price. I would say the salad is tastier and a better value than what you would find at more salad-specific stores. The chicken wrap is good as well. It is more filling because of the pita, but also a bit greasy. 
The fries here are AMAZING. Perfectly crunchy and seasoned and there are a lot of them too. For another dollar you can ask for a dipping sauce. Harissa mayo is very good. 
Drink-wise they have a large selection of beer, wine, and nonalcoholic drinks. I wanted something and the cashier told me that the cherry soda is quite sweet so I went with the Greek iced tea which came out of a bottle (they don't brew it themselves). It tasted like an herbal Arnold Palmer kinda. Not bad but nothing to write home about. 
The only gripe I have about this place is how long the line can get on weekends, but I guess that's a testament to how good this place is.  All in all Silva has great food at a great value in a great location. What more can you ask for?

All I can say is WOW!!
I am really surprised that I didn't hear of this place before. If i knew a place like this existed, much earlier, they would be seeing me very often.
The most simple yogurt, yet it is so delicious. To make it even more spectacular they add baklava with honey on top and the taste of the two together is just AMAZING!!

Absolutely my favorite yogurt so far. The crazy thing is that there is nothing special to it because its just regular yogurt. I think the secret is the baklava :) I know I will be back here for more very soon. Also I am really interested in trying the schwarma. I can only imagine how good it tastes!!

Sigh. I really wanted to like Souvla. I wanted to like it so much I went twice and braved the line each time. Usually if I'm neutral to negative about a restaurant, I'd rather try somewhere new than try the same spot again. Buuuuut I thought I'd give Souvla a second chance. Womp. 

The first time I went I had the lamb salad. The salad was bland, lamb was gamey (also bland), and I didn't enjoy my meal at all. My brother gave me some of his lamb sandwich which was better, but not thaaaat great.

I went last night with a friend for the second time. We both got the chicken sandwich. The chicken was gamey, dry, and extremely salty. The hot sauce on the counter didn't even help! #icanteven

The ratio of ingredients were pretty poor: two teeny tiny orange slices, a slither of greens and enough Mizratha cheese for one bite, all on an extra large doughy pita bigger than the size of my face. The pita didn't have any flavor either. Not sure what this mysterious "granch" dressing is, I didn't see a lick of it. 

I thought the entire meal could benefit from acid such as lemon, garlic, and a ton of sumac (being Mediterranean and all...), perhaps hummus, an herb such as dill, and cucumber. Tzatziki would be nice, too (yes, I know how to make Mediterranean and Greek food). 

Wah wah.

The ambiance is cute and the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is fine.

My hands still smell like lamb and I'm really not upset about it. Got the lamb sandwich which is basically like a souvlaki (souvla...souvlaki...connecting the dots....). It was $14 which I guess is okay. Very quick service even though the line was out the door. Very tasty delicious tender meat. Next time I go I must get the fries which look thick cut, seasoned and divine. Happy to sit in the window and people watch.

This place is super cute and I think the two stars is only accurate if you order the vegetarian sandwich- it's basically just a big sweet potato wrapped in bread. Other than that, they have a super cute hip Greek vibe. All my meat eating friends chowed down and loved their sandwich! Also they have v good fries and looks like some goooood frozen Greek yogurt.

I love Hayes Valley as much as I love finding new spots to eat. I was drawn to Souvla because I love BAKLAVA. So imagine combing frozen greek yogurt + baklava = genius!

So I payed a visit one Wednesday night and found Souvla to be very dark inside and somewhat cramped. The roasting meats on the rotisserie looked inviting but I wasn't too fond of the place. 

But I wasn't there to eat dinner. I came there for the yogurt with baklava. The verdict? Well it had a nice tart flavor that complimented the sweet baklava. But it wasn't really the best baklava I've had. Also the yogurt wasn't too frozen and melted easily.

Idk I wouldn't mind trying again IF I had a craving but I'm not in a hurry to rush back. I'd rather go to Baskin and Robbins lol.

I just instantly love this restaurant after I walk into this place. The staffs are super nice and helpful. I have tried the chicken salad and the lamb sandwich, and the Greek olive olive and sea salt yogurt. Personally, I love the chicken salad more than the lamb sandwich, and the yogurt is amazing!!!!
Definitely would come back again!

Since there's so much love heaped on this place, thought I'd share a slightly dissenting opinion while still respecting that it is a quality place to get some greek meat-based salads. 

That said, it's slightly overrated in my book -- would give it a 3.75 out of 5. 

Here's why: 

- Lines are long
- Salads are not bad by any means, but the quality varies by night, and how much I enjoy the salad is directly correlated to how much feta they drop in
- Salads are expensive - $14 for the lamb (seriously, if I'm paying $14 for a salad, it better be slightly life-changing) 
- The lamb isn't great, especially compared to mediterranean and persian restaurants from LA, or just compared to Souvla's chicken 
- The fries are average 
- Everything is too pricey, considering it's set up mostly as a fast food place (order at the front)

The Greek yogurt is amazing! Had the baklava with honey and salt (because I like my sweets salted) and the flavored blend so well! My sister usually gets olive oil and salt, which actually contrasts great with the sweet tart yogurt that you don't even need a sweetener. 
We always get their veg salad which is also really good with huge chunks of sweet potato contrasting with the salty olives for a satisfying meal. Its such a signature taste that after I visited for the first time I realized I had tried their salad before from my sister's leftovers. It was the aha moment where I finally reunited with that salad. Great service too! The man at the cashier taking orders and preparing the yogurt is so friendly and understanding! Looking forward to trying their other dishes. But definitely the yogurt!

Rotating meat goodness on flat bread.  Anything else you want to know?  OK

The food is good.  It comes out quick.  They load everything coming out of the kitchen with punches of flavors, but nothing overwhelming.  I liked my wrap with lamb.  

You can order online and skip any line.

The Souvla restaurants are great. Their food is fresh and healthy. The have pretty good portions so a chicken salad is pretty filling or easily shareable if you get a cup of their lemon soup. But the real star of Souvla in my opinion is their frozen Greek yogurt. Yup, it's frozen. They have different toppings available, but the Baklava and honey option is beyond amazing! I don't even like Greek yogurt, but this is so good. I'm only in SF to visit but I always have to go to Souvla. I was only in SF for two days and I had to have it each day. They need this in SoCal.

Cute little place. 

I walked by it and there was just so many people inside and outside waiting for the food. I'd definitely have to try some of the sandwiches next time I'm in the area. 

I ended up just getting the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey. It was really delicious actually. The greek yogurt was nice and sour as expected. the baklava crumbles were this great sweet addition to the yogurt that was slightly crunchy, but still really sweet. The honey added this great sweetness, but not overly so. 

Protip: get the frozen greek yogurt. Really delicious.

Mediterranean food is my favorite and unfortunately for me, this cuisine is generally a sore subject in San Francisco. I lived in Chicago for 6 years: home to a vibrant Greektown, real deal Lebanese shawarma, and more falafel than you can shake an olive stick at. So yeah - I miss it immensely!

Anyway, after much trial and error, I've finally found really, REALLY great spit-fired meats (and being of Croatian heritage, I grew up on backyard spit-roasted lambs and pigs so I know my stuff). Souvla, you are the new 'it' kid in the Mediterranean (Greek to be more specific) category! Yes, it's pricey but I don't mind paying for a menu based on natural, vegetarian-fed meats from animals raised in a sustainable environment. 

I had a salad topped with pork that blew my mind... a bed of Romaine and kale topped with a very generous amount of American Homestead pork shoulder, cherry tomatoes, pickled red onion, thinly-sliced cucumber, and feta cheese all tossed with a minted Greek yogurt dressing. The portion was large and could easily serve as two meals if you start with the Avgolemono soup.

And this sensational soup deserves its own paragraph: the classic Greek recipe is elevated with white mean chicken, buttery rice, and the perfect egg-lemon broth. This rendition is overwhelmingly crave-worthy... on the small side, but I'll definitely get it again. 

Souvla, you really hit it out of the park! I'll look forward to trying the olive oil yogurt next time. And a note to the owner: please open a location in SOMA or the FiDi!

The froyo with rich, syrupy olive oil and sea salt is like a dense cloud drizzled in unicorn juice. You should get this.

I live a stone's throw away from Souvla and it is incredibly dangerous. I contemplate getting it at least 4 times a week and act on those impulses at least twice a week. I tried the vegetarian sandwich a while ago and was underwhelmed; it was too starchy for my taste and I wished there was another protein option. 

Fast forward a few months, and I finally decided to try the increasingly popular froyo. Fast forward a few weeks from that point, and I'm sure I've single handedly helped pay a small operating expense for Souvla with my froyo purchases.

Froyo is $4.35 after tax.

The food is amazing! Very fresh. It's also nice to not be overwhelmed by options. I got the vegetarian salad, which tasted delicious! My friend got the steak wrap which she loved. She said the bread was really good. 

I highly recommend getting your order to go, as the line gets really long around meal times. They make ordering online really easy, and you can pay online as well. This allows you to skip the line when you show up. They prepare the food really quickly, so if you order online make sure that you aren't too far away. 

There is some seating in the restaurant, but it fills up really quickly. It's nice to order the food to go and then take it to the park that's nearby.

Love this place. Friend recommended thank goodness otherwise it probably wouldve taken toooo long to stumble into this place!

I feel GOOOD eating here, quality, healthy food. Plus it tastes amazing. You can choose your protein (chicken, lamb, pork, sweet potato/veg) then decide whether you want salad or sandwich version. 

The salads for one...creative ingredients that really complement each other. The sweet potato salad is the veg option that I tried today. Sweet potato in a salad is a great idea. So yummy, add some kale, walnut pieces, diced kalamata olives, mozzarella, pickled onions. It's going to be my go-to salad. 

Also dont forget to order the frozen greek yogurt. With baklava. Yeah, it's genius. And DELECTABLE.
Casual Greek spot with yummy food! There is usually a line out the door, but it moves pretty quickly. Love their avgolemono soup and chicken salad! Greek fries are pretty basic, but also good.

(Insert heart eyes emoji) - literally my face when I took my first bite of the frozen Greek yogurt. Olive oil adds the perfect touch. Asked for light on the salt. The interior is very cute and has plenty of seating (came during lunch hours).

5 stars for the greek frozen yogurt alone - please do yourself a favor by doing so! Healthy and delicious, you can't go wrong. 

Like all locations, Souvla is consistently good but never blows me away with the food itself. I've had the wraps and salads and while everything is very fresh and the meat is tasty, it isn't super inspiring. However, it is consistent, healthy and clean so I find myself coming back from time to time. 

For food, I prefer any of the salads to the wraps. The wraps are relatively small with not too many ingredients.
The food here is pretty good i have to admit. It is more on the pricey side but the portions make up for it. Gyros i would say its pretty good. Ill most likely go back and try more items on the menu.
I wish this place were in MY home town! Greek style salads or sandwiches with lamb, frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherries or baklava crumbles, etc. wines. Charming, simple & delicious!

There have only been a few times in my life where I've walked into a fast-casual food spot and thought "My God... this could be big not only in this city but nationwide." The first? When I first strolled into what was a local Denver spot called Chipotle Mexican Grill years ago in Denver. The second? A dumpling mecca in Shanghai called Din Tai Fung. The third? A revolutionary salad spot in Dallas called Bread Zeppelin, and most recently, a Greek spot in San Francisco called Souvia. This is going to be big. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

In my mind there's a difference between "gah look at that line what an inconvenience" and "wow look at that line that place must be LEGIT". With Souvia it's very much the latter, but know that the layout is such that lines can easily pour into the street and even once you're inside you'll have people circling your table like a batch of vultures. 

Even so, the service at Souvia is fast and friendly, and that's largely thanks to what is a brilliantly simple menu. Pick your protein and how you want it and BAM. There is is. Dessert? Go for it, and you can expect it all in relatively short order. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

I'll get right to it - my $12.00 chicken sandwich was huge, and I made a huge mistake by ordering some frozen greek yogurt to go with it. Now, $12.00 isn't exactly cheap (we're talking more expensive than a Chipotle burrito with double meat here), but as you can see in the picture this was a quality dish. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

This was an excellent coming together of ingredients here: chicken, yogurt sauce of some sort, tangerines, clover, onions, and cheese. While I think the menu could be mixed up just a bit more with bowls and other offerings and the like, these sandwiches alone are enough to carry Souvla into franchise or multi-location greatness. Star Granted.  

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

With a slightly more varied menu this is an easy yes, but even with the existing offerings I'll highly recommend Souvla to anyone who will listen. Star Granted.

Great casual counter lunch/dinner spot. I love the clean,  modern, chic decor with a large communal table but it can certainly get claustrophobic. The word has gotten out about this place and its safe to say there is always a line and a fight for the first come first serve seating. This bit, and the noise, makes for the experience to be a little less pleasant. 

That being said, the food is outstanding. I love the minimalist approach to the menu; they offer 4 options to be served as a gyro or salad. All the gyros i've had taste fresh but with warmth of home-made / authentic greek food aspect. The restaurant also offers beer + wine and most notably a unique, frozen greek yogurt served with unique flavor options. Definitely worth sampling them all.

A friend and I stopped by for dinner on Wednesday night at 7PM and were able to find a seat pretty quickly. We both ordered the Lamb Salads, shared an order of the Greek Fries and had some greek wine, it was all delicious! The Salad was really fresh tasting and a filling size and had a lot of really juicy lamb meat. The fries were cooked well and with some hot sauce hit the spot. To top it off we got one greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and one with olive oil, sea salt and honey. The greek yogurt is tasty and the baklava crumbles are the way to go, we found the olive oil + sea salt + honey to be a little odd (mainly because of the olive oil).

I would definitely go back again but would make sure to get there on the earlier end of dinner time because by 7:30PM it was packed with people waiting for a seat!!!!!

Wow super delicious! Cute little place in Hayes Valley next to the Proxy. Really delicious Greek-style wraps and amazing fries with cheese and olive oil.

You can pick 4 proteins- pork shoulder, chicken, lamb, and vegetarian and go for a wrap or salad option. I got the lamb gyro with pickled veggies and yogurt sauce in an awesome fluffy pita bread. SO GOOD. Protip: get it "Greek style" for 50c more and you get Greek fries in your wrap!

The salads are huge and looked delicious, so I'll be sure to try it next time. I got the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava and syrup for dessert. YUM. Perfect, tart yogurt, and delicious baklava crumbles. 

One star less for the price - it can run a little high. My wrap was $14- it will make you full and they're generous with the meat portions. They also serve beer and wine.

Ok, let's get one thing out of the way first, this place is really expensive. $13 for a seat-yourself, Fast Casual Mediterranean wrap is a lot of money, even in this prime Hayes Valley location (the interior is also really nice/clean/modern and trendy).

That said, the food is REALLY good! The lamb wrap was likely one of the best I've ever eaten. Juicy and succulent and delicious. The pork wrap was almost as good as well. I'm also a sucker for Avgolemono soup. The lemony flavor is just so good, I can't stop eating it.

Anyway I've been craving the lamb wrap and the lemon soup ever since the last time I ate here (which was a while ago!) so I would almost give this place 5 star if it wasn't for the price. Go try it! Just don't make it so busy that there's a big line next time I want to go!

Overall a great place to eat. The salads are superb, the gyros well balanced. 
Cons: the lamb could be juicier and they could take better care removing the bones and the cartilage from the chicken.
Olive oil and sea salt. Could eat 365 days a year.

This was the perfect meal to have after a wine happy hour. The place was absolutely packed at 930pm on a Thursday night. I got the Veg sandwich, my friend got the chicken sandwich, and we split Greek fries. The sandwiches were awesome, especially the chicken one. The fries were addictive too. I expected them to be overloaded with toppings but they were not at all. 

Don't expect to get seated here. We were lucky to find a little seat outside right before we got our food but a lot of people were eating standing up or took away elsewhere. Highly recommend!

I love love this place!!! It took me half an hour walk just to find it. It's the best salad I have ever tasted here in San Francisco - super fresh, delicious Mediterranean  salad. The combination of all the veggies  + the salad dressing is very satisfying !!! Great place to hang out with friends . I will definitely go back soon and try their dessert.
Chicken salad deserves the hype! The fries with the garlic dipping sauce was unforgettable. I'd like to come back to try the frozen yogurt next time..

I was excited to go to this place. I placed two orders of lamb sandwich and two orders of Greek fries. It was a disappointing experience, unfortunately. The quality of the meat was bad. The pita and the fries were not toasted properly. They were cold.

I ordered the chicken sandwich. It was a tad dry but gets a pass because of the nice clean chicken flavor. I would get it again. The potatoes were soaked in chicken drippings. They didn't look like much but I kept coming back for them. My friends were all about the yogurt.

Never thought I would enjoy ALL the ingredients in a pre-determined salad as I do with Souvla's chicken salad. The entire thing is a perfect combination of flavor burst in your mouth: 
* Sweet from the oranges
* Savory from the wonderfully seasoned chicken
* Sour kick from the pickled onions 
* Fresh from the kale and other salad mix
* Creamy from the dressing 

The entire thing is delectable and fresh. The oranges have never been sour, always sweet. The kale is never too tough or chewy. The chicken is out of this world. Always so hearty and generous. I love slathering it on a bed of greens. 

Love getting their fries as well. All about balance right? 

Top it off with any of their Greek yogurts. My favorites are the honey and the baklava.

The line is always long, so think about getting it delivered. Still tastes great!

LOVED Souvla!

From the decor, to ambiance - beautiful white tile, a giant rotisserie, high ceilings, and communal tables - to the food, everything was great. 

I had the veg salad, which came with (and I think the menu often changes) white sweet potato, pickled onions, walnuts, cheese (manchego?), and garlic yogurt atop a bed of kale and romaine. It was PERFECT! they also serve their white wine in an adorable little tin mug - 8 oz - with the glass. So you're really getting two glasses for the price of one!

I also liked being able to order at the counter, so once you're done eating you can quickly skedaddle.

Frozen yogurt w/ olive and sea salt. Get it. With extra olive oil. Actually just ask for a cup of olive oil....or maybe that's just me. 

Be prepared to wait, or head in a little earlier than the normal lunch/dinner rush and you should be okay. It's not big, and you order at the counter and then take a number to a table so you're SOL if you can't find a place to sit. That being said, this restaurant model is my favorite. It's casual without being thoughtless, the menu is well edited, and they serve wine and beer to pair with the deliiiiicious food. It's the neighborhood standby you crave. 

I ordered the chicken wrap which I actually did think was somewhat dry, but I like to drench my food in all provided condiments and hot sauces available to me. The chicken was plentiful and fresh however, no skimpy portions here. The ingredients are fresh, salads inventive, you can't go wrong.

This place is fabulous. Food is amazing and customer service is excellent. If you want to stop by for lunch during the week give yourself extra time since it's always busiest during lunch hour. Even if you have to wait it's totally worth it. I recommend adding the chicken to the vegetarian salad. And, don't leave without trying the dessert.

The hype here is heavy, the reality is good but nothing spectacular. Got the popular chicken salad and fries, was into it but left kinda disappointed with how highly I have heard of it. I've had similar plates that were less expensive but better tasting. I'd come back with a friend but wouldn't hand-pick this place.

One word for this place: NOM. 

Need I say more? ...Okay, okay, if I must. Souvla is a tiny little gem of Hayes Valley with a pretty simple menu done extremely well. 

Nomming tips: Any sandwich you can order as a salad instead. The froyo is BOMB --nice and tart with unique topping combos. If you're like me, don't miss out on the side of fries, you won't regret it...well maybe a little, but they're so good so who cares.

When to go: Great for lunch especially on a nice day. IT'S A SMALL PLACE so it gets loud and crowded during peak dinner hours, but it's also order at the counter style so people flow through fairly quickly! 

Heavenly noms await you!!

Here's a novel idea! When a customer comes to your counter and tries to order food for 4 people and your phone is low on battery so using the app is unavailable, Take the orders and make a sale don't ask your customers to leave ......

This is my favorite place in the area. I've been multiple times and have tried most of the salads and sandwiches and here are my top 3 recommended things:

1) The lamb sandwich. It's sooo good. If you're trying to be healthy, the lamb salad is a good alternative. 
2) The Greek fries with harissa-spiced yogurt. The fries are really good and the sauce pairs incredibly well. 
3) Any of the frozen greek yogurts. All. So. Good.

Combine all three above, and you'll be extremely full and happy for less than $25.

On the place itself, expect a line, though service is quick, and unless it's a weekend night you should be able to find a seat within 10-15 minutes.

I have mixed feelings about the food here. I absolutely love their Greek lemon chicken soup, I order mass quantities whenever I'm sick. It usually accompanied by  an order of fries and a Greek frozen yogurt. Those items are amazing, but I feel the rest of the menu is lack luster and just average. That being said I havve co workers who love their salads so maybe my taste buds are the ones that are off. It's worth a try and usually very quick.
Lamb salad was the bomb! At first I was like ehh, didn't expect it to be that good, I'll definitely come back!

I hate to give bad reviews but let's be honest here, the food was bland and overpriced. The lamb leg salad and lamb gyro, the meat was flavorless, overcooked and hard to chew. The avoglemono soup was ok, nothing special. The greek fries were most enjoyable but even then they were a bit on the greasy side.

The decor is nice. I like the simplicity of the restaurant which was modern and very clean.

Well, I'm not sure if it was just a bad day for lamb, but reading other reviews, doesn't look like we were the only ones to have this problem here. 

Don't think i'll be coming back until they are consistent with serving tender lamb. 

And for $45 for two meals and two sides, not including tip and we had no drinks was pretty expensive to me for lunch. I don't mind paying if the meal was worth it. This definitely wasn't worth it. It's too bad, really wanted to like it.

I come here for lunch when visiting the city. This place has the best roasted chicken salad in my opinion. And a great accompaniment to this is the garlic fries and pink sauce. The staff always greets with a smile and the food is on point. To tell you the truth I have not ventured far from the roasted chicken because it is THAT good!  In the back of the restaurant you will see the chicken slowly roasting on spics with the juices dripping down. If this doesn't get your salivary glands excited then maybe the smell will. The restaurant is small and always packed no matter what time you go. If there are no tables available take your food to go and sit in the park steps away. Souvla has salads at their perfection and hopefully one day will open another location closer to San Jose.

If the line that is constantly out the door doesn't tell you how good this place is then idk what will. Food is pretty good chicken and lamb were a little dry but  not to the point it wasn't edible. If you're trying to choose between the fries and oven roasted potatoes go fries!! The fries with the garlic dipping sauce are  Also I like that they have hot sauce at the table already it was so good I even put it on my salad haha.

Refusing to give me a cup of water when I order a full meal? While I appreciate that covid affects us all, if you are able to serve me frozen yogurt in an open cup, you can also pour me a glass of water.  I used to enjoy coming here, but I have no interest in wasting resources by buying bottled water.

I am not entirely sure I understand the hype or the long lines, but the salads are on the unique side--more of a place to have a quick catch up with a friend or for when you want to go for a healthier option.

I absolutely love this place. My staples are the "sandwiches" (gyros) and the frozen yogurt.

The chicken gyros and lamb gyros both have a great mix of vegetables, sauce, but the real star is the meat - it's consistently tender and flavorful, and the portion is generous. When I'm in the mood for frozen yogurt, I get the yogurt with Cretan honey. It's absolutely incredible and I've never had a froyo quite like it.

HUGE fan of Souvla and their items they carry on their menu. I usually only go to the location on Divisidero as its near my home, but today, I was in the Hayes Valley neighborhood with friends so we decided to pit stop in for lunch.
As always, there's a line, but it moves fairly quick! Service is good and food is prepared/delivered to table promptly. A little disappointed in my meal today though. I ordered the chicken salad, greek style (with french fries on top). All was good until about 10 bites in. A large horse fly, dead, crunched into my kale leaf with his eyes staring at me stopped me dead in my tracks. I was disgusted. 
I walk up with the item to the counter wondering what can be done to accommodate me. The server was busy taking everybody else's order so he told me the manager would come to find me shortly and prompted me to take a seat and wait. Well 15 minutes go by, still no salad, all my friends are still eating, and nobody has came to my table to discuss the matter, let alone provide me with another salad/meal.
I walk up again to the front cashier to show face and to indicate I was not helped yet; and he said his manager was in a meeting but he would refund me anyway. I wait patiently for another few minutes until she finally walked out to greet me. She asked me what happened and she was nice, and apologetic right away. 

They ended up refunding me my meal and making me a fresh new salad quickly. The second round was much better and all was good, but something tells me that kitchen ain't clean. Giving this Souvla 3/5 stars just for the lack of cleanliness in the back where everybody's food is prepared. Gross feeling to think about. 

Overall, still a great place to dine and I love their food, but I likely won't return to this location.

We ordered online for takeout, and was a bit disappointed.  Our order had to be recreated several times, and in the end... the chicken was severely overcooked.  All in all, it's a pretty basic meal with tough bits of kale.

fast service, and reasonable prices. their frozen yogurt was sooo good, highly recommend. however, their lamb pita was not that great--the pita and lamb were tough and there wasn't too much flavor from the sauces. their pita was reminiscent of Greek gyro, but had California flavors

My ultimate favorite dessert - the greek yogurt w/ Baklava. Its sweet, but not too sweet, cold, crispy and refreshing. Its so delicious. Originally, I didnt want to try it because I'm not a big fan of Baklava in general. My bf got one for us to share, but he ended up needing to get his own that day. Its so good, that at times I get two of them! One to eat there, let my tummy settle and  one for the road! I'm a pig, especially when it comes to something I love. 

Must try (but I'm a sucker for soft serve).

Very trendy little place in the city, tucked away on a side street with cute shops.  There was a bit of a line, but it moved fairly quickly.  Like most places in SF, this place was small, but they had a nice seating area outside, and a few tables indoors. 

I did the lamb gyro, which was great, but not the best I've ever had.  The staff was friendly, but I couldn't help but feel rushed with the line behind me. Luckily I had plenty of time to read over the menu while in line.  The frozen greek yogurt with honey was unexpectedly good, and the best thing that we had there - get that!!

Great portions. DELICIOUS food. AMAZING Wraps and Fries. I definitely have to come back here for some Greek Frozen Yogurt. It is a tiny bit pricy, but what isn't in San Francisco? Their sauces are also delicious. We got to try them all and they were all on point, though I do favor the Garlic one quite a bit. Definitely come here if you are in the area!

This review is only for their greek frozen yogurt! It's so good--so creamy and not overly sweet. I love how you can just walk up to the counter and get it to go. Make sure to ask for extra honey syrup! Baklava adds a nice texture to it.

I really enjoy this place. The food is delicious and comes out super fast though it is quite inconsistent. Sometimes my salad is swimming in oil. My biggest complaint though is that they do not attempt to regulate seating. It would be nice if there were a sign asking patrons to wait until they've placed their order before taking a seat. As it stands now, I wait in line as the parties behind me in line take the tables. This leaves me standing with food in my hand while they have a table and are still waiting for their friends to get to the front of the line and order.  I find it so frustrating that I just don't eat here very often. Please fix this oversight.

We were on a day date & I ordered the frozen Greek yogurt topped with baklava & drizzled honey; and now I find myself day dreaming of this frozen treat. It may just have to be a regular thing when we come back to the city.

Great salad spot in the heart of Hayes Valley. I had the pork salad ($12) which was excellent. There was plenty of meat in the salad and other sides that made for a hearty meal. You can also choose from 2 other meats (chicken and lamb) and 1 veggy option. Salads can also be made a sandwich, which is really pita bread. The menu only has 4 items otherwise I would rate 5 stars.

Went for lunch at 11:30 and there was plenty of room. By noon, a pretty long line had formed. OUTSTANDING food. I sat next to a huge spit of lamb, cooking in splendor. I ordered a lamb salad ($14) and it was fragrant, delicious greens, fresh, chunks of tender lamb aplenty. Enough for two light eaters or one big eater. You can get it on pita bread as another option. My pal got the chicken salad with Mandarin oranges and pickled onions. We were both delighted. The frozen Greek (not sweet) yogurt with a smashed baklava on the top with honey was stupendous! Go eat here, you won't wonder why they have many locations.
Overpriced gyros but the frozen yogurt is on point and tastes very much like what you'd get at a good yogurt stand in the Greek islands.

This place is great! The food is simple and delicious with large portions. I got the chicken salad and everything in it (citrus, kale, cheese, yogurt-based dressing) paired really well together. The pork shoulder was also cooked well and tasted great with the ingredients in the salad. We also got the Greek fries which came topped with cheese and herbs and were perfectly cooked -- crispy yet soft and cooked through on the inside. And did I mention the portions?! I'm definitely not a light eater and I took home leftovers. 

It's on a busy street in Hayes Valley and there's most often a line out the door, but it moves quickly. It's not a huge place inside, but there is enough seating that you won't have to lurk and wait for a place to sit. The service is generally pleasant, but can be a bit brisk if you don't know the drill of what to do already. I will be back!!

Omgsh...this was INCREDIBLE!!! My friend and I split the free range chicken wrap and the vegetarian wrap. The flavors were INSANE!!! I would fly back to SF just to eat one of their wraps again. Please consider opening a shop in Los Angeles, Souvla!!!  Only negative is that there was no outdoor seating available.

The food is good and the Greek sour cherry yogurt is amazing!  

The male server today was awful and so aloof. We asked for ketchup and forks, and were met with an aloof, cold attitude.  Never a smile or you're welcome after we said thank you each time.  That is why I'm giving 2 stars.   Probably won't go back to that location even though I love Hayes Valley.
Love it here! I've only tried their frozen yoghurt and fries and adore their frozen yogurt. The baklava one can be a bit heavy so I now get the sour cherry . It isn't too tart, it's perfect.

The chicken salad is easily my favorite salad of all time. And the Greek yogurt with either baklava or olive oil and sea salt is the stuff of dreams. 

Order via Caviar if you're worried about time. You can still dine in the restaurant.

I really wanted to like Souvla more - especially since I just moved next to them and there's so much hype surrounding this place all the time. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed with the pork sandwich that I got. While the veggies and sauces were excellent, the pork itself was extremely dry and lacked any kind of flavor whatsoever.

Best mediterranean food in the city hands down. Most staff were pretty amazing- great customer service. Food makes you want to come back for more. They are so generous on portion sizes this place is better than hayes loc for sure. Not as crowded and more generous on portions. 
However, I wasn't always satisifed when I ordered online. They forgot my dressings on the side and it was clearly stated in the order. But food is very good and always satisfying- can't rate them below 5 stars

This is my favourite salad bar and everything other thbic outlet can learn how to keep your cuisine cultural yet healthy and popular.
The yoghurts make great dessert options.

Souvla is hands down one of the best restaurants in the Bay Area. They staff is great, the food is amazing, and the menu is actual perfection. I love this place so much and I legit go here 3-4 times a week.

This place actually surprised me. I was expecting plain ol' salads with whatevers meats, but the flavor is actually very nice and the ratio of toppings to greens is right on point. My rotisserie chicken was flavorful and tender, and my friend's pork shoulder sandwich had delicious, tender chunk of pork all throughout. Absolutely flavorful, and more than I expected! This is a great spot if you're craving something fresh and light!

Souvla is one of my go-to spots for salad. I went to this location once for a dinner and my health conscious side fell in love with the food. The biggest issue I had was the lack of seating since the restaurant is small, but now that my lazy self can just get the food delivered on Caviar that's not an issue anymore!

My regular order on Caviar is the date-night meal. You get a choice of two meals, plus an order of fries, and a bottle of wine. Side note - I did the math, you don't get anything cheaper by ordering this package it's just an easy order for those lazy nights you don't want to cook and need a glass (or bottle) of wine. 

My usual order:
- Chicken Salad - love the fresh oranges
- Lamb Salad 
(you can make any of these into a gyro wrap - it's the same toppings)
- Greek Fries are delish
- Bottle of Rose

I also highly recommend their frozen greek yogurt..SO good! Ordered by preference:
- Wildflower honey
- Baklava crumble (it's a bit sweet)
- Olive oil and sea salt

Very simple menu of 4 items available in sandwich or salad form. I ordered the chicken salad to go. The mix of ingredients was just amazing and added lots of flavour...from the chicken and the dressing to the vegetables and the pieces of orange. Although I would say it was a bit too oily for my taste.

If it's your first time, the greek yogurt and baklava is a must try!
Absolutely love this place! Great soup, salad, chicken and yogurt.  What more could you want?

Mmm yum yum! My friends and I decided to stop by this place on our way home from brunch mostly because my roommates love this place and I was just infatuated by the NY style coffee cups.

I got the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. It really is froyo textured greek yogurt but with the same greek yogurt flavors. The baklava was good but I actually found that it made the froyo a little too sweet for my liking because they sprinkle it on top as opposed to spreading it throughout the yogurt. If it was interspersed better, it might work better. I liked it enough though! It's basically an even healthier version of froyo right? frozen greek yogurt and all. It literally just tastes like froyo ... but less flavorful which I kinda liked on a hot Saturday afternoon.

tldr; they have the cool new york style coffee cups !!! but otherwise, the frozen greek yogurt is pretty good!

I love me some tender, Greek lamb on a pita with heavy tzatziki. Like, I really like it. It's not even 10am yet, and just writing this review has me planning on eating Greek for lunch or dinner... or both. 

Souvla is the best Mediterranean anything I've had in SF, and I thoroughly enjoyed my lamb pita. I also loved how it feels like a little take out spot, but you can totally saddle up and wash your flavourful goodness down with rosé. 

The only reason I'm not giving this place five stars, is because of the lines. SF loves to line up for things, but when you're hangry, this place has the potential to really get your goat.

Hipster, please:

I got the chicken sandwich. Seriously let down, cause I know it could be so much better. What's the point of sourcing high quality local meats when the staff just kills it? Chicken was so dry and overcooked it could have been canned tuna. The veggies were nice and crispy and seemed fresh, but the pita was a sorry excuse for a Greek wrap; this was on par with Safeway pitas.  Not even grilled or warmed up. 

At least the wine was a large pour.  But there is no way this food is worth the wait. 

If their corporate chef could please pay a little more attention then I'd be a happy repeat customer.

Update:  as I was waiting in line to use the restroom, I saw one of their kitchen prep employees blowing his nose, then he did not change gloves or wash hands before going back to picking chicken.  Yuck.

I crave this place's fries almost everyday. Although it get extremely crowded and the line tends to get really long its worth the try. I would order to go the next time I go because i really liked the taste and uniqueness of the food. Although I tried a veggie option this time, all the ingredients mixed perfectly and gave it the Mediterranean flavor that makes it special.

The food was good, not great. Portions left me hungry, maybe it was because I got a wrap/sandwich at lunch? A $14+ after tip sandwich/wrap shouldn't literally leave me with hunger pains tho, really hayes-valley'd me!!

Their frozen yogurt is tasty, I'll stick to that when coming by here.

Came just for the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup and was not disappointed! The tartness of the Greek yogurt balances perfectly with the baklava and honey, so it wasn't overly sweet for my palate. If you want something more on the savory side, try their frozen Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. Even though there was a line, service was quick and friendly. Overall a great experience at the Hayes Valley location!

I'm addicted to the salad with chicken. I have it once a week and keep thinking I'll get sick of it but I don't. Sometimes I even wake up in the morning thinking about it. I may have a problem, but I'm okay with it. Also, I'm usually a super annoying dressing on-the-side, can I delete this or add that person and this salad...what can I say...it's  just perfect the way it is. It is the Goldilocks of salads. I've also had the potatoes and on occasion a glass of wine which pretty much turns the whole experience into a fairy tale come true, or sadly, as close as I've gotten to a fairy tale coming true on my lunch hour.

We will return and next time I will ask for extra sauce on the side. I wouldn't expect to say this of a Greek restaurant but I wanted more garlic! Treat yourself to the frozen yogurt after dinner- it's delicious

The food at Souvla is so consistently delicious that they really can do no wrong. Anytime I'm in the area, we eat there because it's so good - if I lived closer, it would become a bad habit. The menu is simple, but there is no such thing as a bad order. 

My favorite item on the menu by far would be the roasted white sweet potato salad. I don't know WHAT's in their dressing but it's super addicting. It's probably the most filling and satisfying salad you'll ever eat. Another great item is the lamb gyro; the meat is beautifully cooked and not super greasy. Greek fries are always a must no matter what entree you're ordering. Dessert is also a must: I highly recommend the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup. The sweet and sour flavor profiles are out of this world. In terms of their beverage selection, I've only ever had their Greek beer and it goes really well with the food (it's a refreshing lager). 

Everything else about Souvla is a slam dunk: their marketing/branding is on point and memorable; the space is clean and simple; the giant wall of rotisserie chicken is a sight to see; and ordering is quick and easy (unless there's a huge line). The one downside when it's really busy is the seating. It's pretty much communal seating but it does get super tight in the space when all of the seats are occupied. Food comes out super fast and you pick up the dessert separately (once you've finished your meal) so that it doesn't melt. 

Definitely a more casual, quick spot, but the food is high class all the way.

Heard great things about Souvla, so when my friend suggested going here for lunch I was excited. We went at noon so I was afraid of how busy it might get. Parking was a little difficult but that was already expected. It was a nice day so even if we had parked far it was a nice walk to the restaurant. 

The restaurant was small but very warm and welcoming. We sat close to the front with a counter and open window frame. Next time, I'll try going to the back patio. 

Cleanliness (5/5): The restaurant was busy but everything was clean and ready for customers. Nothing else to comment! 

Connection (5/5): I like the simplicity of the menu. Makes reading the menu and ordering very easy. We didn't know what to order because it all sounded good so the cashier helped us navigate the menu. Throughout the meal, employees did ask us if we were okay or if we needed anything. The atmosphere is very casual and the attentive of the employees was excellent. 

Product/Service Provided (4/5): I ordered the "American Homestyle Pork Shoulder" as a salad (you can order you dish as a salad or sandwich). The dish was very good and balanced. I usually dislike feta cheese but I wanted to try the dish as is. I think it converted me to eat feta cheese - it wasn't overwhelming and the size and amount of cheese complemented the dish. The only note I would make is there were a couple chucks of pork fat (which I would've been fine with if it were crunchier). Some of the pork was also a little dry - so there was some inconsistency in the various pieces of pork.
Love the salad! Greek yogurt is a must order!!!!! In here, you can have not only healthy but also yummy food!

The food and frozen yogurt are delicious, the service is fast, wine pours are generous, and the ambiance is nice. I had an easy and pleasant experience dining here late on a Saturday night with friends.  I ordered the chicken salad, which was packed full of fresh lettuce, kale, and shredded chicken and topped with a refreshing "granch" dressing (made with greek yogurt). I don't even like ranch dressing, but I loved this "granch" -- it was healthy, flavorful, and a perfect pair to the salad.

I also had the greek yogurt with sour cherry. It was super delicious, although I'd recommend trying something else if you prefer your fro-gryo sweeter. The sour cherry, true to its name, is definitely for lovers of all things tart.

I didn't have wine, but my friends who did received very generous pours (an initial one, plus additional wine in a tiny carafe). No paying $12 for a thimble sized pour of wine here. I'm sold!

Came here for dessert on a Friday night around 9pm. There was a relatively long line out the door, but it moved very fast. We got the Baklava Crumble & Honey Greek Yogurt, which was fantastic! I had tried something similar at another Mediterranean restaurant in the South Bay, and this was definitely comparable, perhaps even better. The baklava was soft but still chewy, with the perfect balance of nuts and honey. The greek yogurt was not too flavorful either, and was a great complement to the baklava. I would definitely come back for lunch/dinner, and of course, for the dessert again!

Read a lot about this place so came here on a Sunday afternoon. The line extended put the door but moved very fast so don't let that deter you. 

Had a lamb pita wrap and a chicken salad. While the salad was good, I think the pita on the sandwich was too thick for a place ranked this high, so knocking a star off.

Simple menu. Always fresh. Go-to lunch spot. 
Don't leave without the Greek frozen yogurt! I love it with the sour cherry syrup but topped with baklava is a close second...currently wondering if they'd do both. And salivating. Eat here! If I had only had more than 2 thumbs to put up...

This is how my favorit place became my worst experience . Food poisoning. Went there and got a chicken salad and a lamb wrap. And had stomach pain for 3 days until it got worse... wont be back to souvla anymore even if the food is tasty it doesnt worth the pain.

Love love love this place! It's become a bit too crowded but the vegetarian Greek salad with white sweet potato is still one of my all time fave salads. Tangy and light but still satisfying. The new-ish parklet outside is charming and helps relieve the seating crunch.

Dropped in here a few months ago when they first opened.
Probably wasn't a good idea to eat here smack dab in the middle of a 90 degree heatwave in San Francisco but what the heck... They don't happen often. 
It was HAWT outside and SO HUMID inside the restaurant. I felt so sorry for the girl at the register standing in front of the oven. She was a trooper. 

My friend had the American homestead pork shoulder ($10) w/ minted Greek yogurt, cherry tomato, pickled red onion, cucumber and feta cheese. It was ehhh okaaaay  but a tad on the dry side. 

I had the Superior Farms lamb leg ($12) w/ Harissa spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onions and feta cheese in a sandwich. THIS IS THE MONEY MAKER Y'ALL! That lamb leg was extremely tender and I loved the pickled red onions. I would be even happier if there were MORE pickled red onions. This thing was so damn juicy I was dripping all over the place. 

We also split an order of the Greek Fries ($4) , which you should totally skip and not bother with. They weren't all that special although they were pretty crispy the way I like 'em. If you want yogurt, that's an extra $1. 

We saw bowls and bowls of salad going out TOPPED with fries. A salad with fries!? I must go back for this...

Souvla can be semi pricey for a quick lunch but it's Hayes Valley and they don't exactly have much competition. The place across the street sucks so don't even bring that up.

With Souvla you get the best ingredients, the best service and the most tastiest food. We go at least once a week! Our regulars are the chicken wrap, chicken salad and the greek fries, of course! Highly recommend. They have a decent wine selection as well and we like the outdoor seating. Go as many times as you can. You won't be disappointed.

My favorite restaurant in all of SF. Amazing quality food, always delicious,  such unique flavor combinations, fresh CA twist on greek food. Plus great location, fun spot, kind staff

Favorite items
-veggie salad (the sweet potato with all those yummy ingredients!)
-greek fries + greek ranch -(i dream about these)
-frozen green yogurt + baklava topping
I absolutely love this retaurant! It's a bit on the pricey side ( from a student perspective) but it's completely worth it! The fresh rotisserie chicken in the salad is my favorite.

Had yianni's loukaniko for brunch here. It was pretty good! The yogurt on top was smooth, and not too sour cream tasting. The cheese, onions and bell peppers were a good combination, and the sausage was fragrant, just strangely kind of tough to eat.

I've tried their sea salt and olive oil Greek yogurt. The yogurt itself is amazing, the oil is the most fragrant, pleasantly surprising part of this item, but I think the sea salt is pretty overwhelming. If you're looking for something sweet, go for the baklava frozen yogurt. The baklava is rich and delicious, and complements the cool, sweetness of the yogurt well. 

I usually, 100% will never order salad, but I make an exception at Souvla. Their pork shoulder salad is delicious, and it will last you 2 meals. The cheese on top is not too strong, and everything is a blend of incredibly healthy kale and other good greens. I have no idea what the dressing consists of, but it's light tasting and really enhances the salad in the right way. I'm willing to come back and try the chicken one (the pork in this salad tastes faintly like pulled pork without BBQ sauce)

Delicious & authentic Greek food! My lunch there made my day! The salads are fresh and flavorful, the chicken was so well cooked that it was melting in my mouth! I would definitely go back for the Greek yogurt and Frenchfries

About a week after dining here, my friend sent me a link stating that this is one of THE places to go to for frozen yogurt. Unfortunately, we didn't try any. D'oh! Next time, I guess?

We had the feta fries, but the container they came in stopped us from actually eating all the components together. All the cheese and garlic fell to the bottom of the funnel. 

I had the pork salad. The first bites were amazing -- salty, savory, delicious. It was a rather large meal, however, and by the end it felt way too oily.

I think it's all about the grogs of wine here..or the Greek lager. Too bad we didn't try either.  Many of the people who dined there were ballers and got glasses of wine plus a salad or sandwich, which would run you about $25, just for lunch! 

The salads were pretty ginormous, and so were the pita sandwiches. I noticed that the pita bread was a bit inconsistent though -- some were fluffier than others.

I liked that the menu was very well laid out and simple to understand. It almost read like an infographic! Also really liked the skylight inside. That really added to the atmosphere.

Seating is first come, first served during lunch, which means it can get pretty hectic with people hovering over you for a seat.

If you have room (and money) left, try out the greek yogurt too!

I met up with an old friend for lunch here on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty empty when I arrived, but then a line was out the door by the time I left. You order up at the counter and then have your food brought out to your table. I ordered the Lamb Sandwich ($13) and Baklava Greek Ice Cream ($5). First of all, the sandwich had great presentation --very hipster. Unfortunately, it was so tough to eat that I ended up throwing away all of the lamb. It was so hard and flavorless. Somehow, I'm hoping I had a bad piece, but I couldn't even eat it. Instead, I opened up my pita sandwich and just forked out the radish, cucumbers, onions and cheese to eat. I never felt like I wasted my money so much. On the other hand, the greek yogurt is what kind of saved this place. I loved the touch of sour taste in the greek yogurt paired with their various toppings. Although the baklava was something new for me, it was a great option. I tried some of the Olive Oil and Sea Salt flavor from my friend and loved that one too, except I took a spoonful of too much salt. I'd be back for the dessert, but not so much the food.

I had heard great things about this place and it lived up to the hype. I had the lamb sandwich - the meat was tender and flavorful, the radishes, cucumbers, and pickled onions added the perfect contrast, and the pita wrap was fluffy yet formidable (i.e. didn't disintegrate with juicy oils). Service was excellent. Definitely going back to Souvla soon.

We snagged a table pretty quick on this Wednesday evening but the place was full. Big fan of the fast casual concept of grabbing a seat and placing and paying for your order at the counter. 

Friendly staff and simple modern and rustic decor give this place a clean and cozy vibe. We shared the lamb salad, fries with harissa spiced yogurt, and frozen yogurt with baklava topping to finish off. Perfect amount for 2 and I left feeling pretty stuffed. Not bad for around $27. Everything tasted great and I honestly have no complaints!

I always get the sandwich (wrap) and I love all 3 types (chicken, lamb, and pork). The soda is a bit pricey and tiny! I still need to try their soup and frozen Greek yogurt.

The woman working the pick up area during lunch today was rude and grumpy!

Excellent food. Ordered the pork shoulder salad while my girlfriend ordered the chicken salad. The salad was surprisingly filling with dinosaur kale and a number of different picked vegetables with greek yogurt dressing. They did NOT skimp on the meat. There was literally a piece of pork in every bite, which is pretty impressive. I also ordered the olive oil and sea salt frozen greek yogurt, which was surprisingly good. It tasted similar to the brittle caramel/butterscotch that covers kettle corn.

Two stars for the service, fries and baklava frozen yogurt. I was expecting a lot when I saw a huge line on a Wednesday night but sadly my meal was disappointing. It was just an overpriced sub-par chicken salad with no Mediterranean influence. The fries though were excellent and the Greek ranch dipping sauce was delicious. The salad could have benefited from a dipping sauce like dressing.  

The service was excellent and I would only come back for the yogurt topped with baklava.

Great casual eatery with great Greek food. Ample serving sizes. The baklava yoghurt was great. Greek beers and wines. Crazy busy atmosphere, but they get the orders out quickly so you're never waiting too long.

I ordered takeout before they closed on a Thursday night expecting them to be annoyed because they close in 5 minutes, but instead I was surprised by the long line that went outside the door. Apparently they have this amazing frozen yogurt. By the way, it was the first day again where it is sprinkling in San Francisco and people were still waiting so I think I need to go back and try it.

I ordered the "Superior Farms Lamb Leg" Sandwich ($13) It was good. I wouldn't say the most amazing mostly because the lamb was much chewier than other places I have gone to with falafel type sandwiches. This could have also been because it wasn't fresh. The sauce was amazing, and combined with their hot sauce it was way better.

My boyfriend ordered the "Mary's Free-Range Chicken Sandwich" ($12) I took a bite and thought it was verrryyy good. The chicken was somewhat shredded, and it was soft, and combined with the sauce.. yum! Also his sandwich came with fries inside of them, and that definitely added to the goodness of it. (I also just love fries sooo)

We also ordered a side of Greek fries with their sauce ($4 + $1). Pretty solid. Again, they weren't fresh so I'm sure they're better than what I experienced.

This is definitely a place I would go to again. I would love to explore their menu a little more too!

i've been to souvla before, devoured (and loved and had my sweet potato world rocked) by the sweet potato salad, but i didn't have the stomach space for frozen yogurt during that first visit. so the opportunity popped up for dessert again (when doesn't it?), and i had the frozen yogurt with baklava.
 
the yogurt is very similar to the plain tart flavors at frozen yogurt shops. it's creamy and tangy and not too sweet, which pairs perfectly with the honey drizzled on top and the soft, sticky baklava smacked on the side of the yogurt. it feels worth, since i've easily paid this amount ($5) for a much smaller amount of specialty ice cream.

This place can be quite crowded like most places at peak dinner time. One has to queue up to order and then find a seat. I ordered some fries, some salad and a greek beer. The portion size for salad was really good.  The greek beer was quite interesting. Not being a yogurt lover personally, my options were somewhat limited. They did subtract the yogurt in my salad upon request.

Chicken and lamb wraps were sadly disappointing. Dry and lacked flavor.

The only thing saving this place is the nice interior, amazing fries, and great location.

Hope they can turn it around...

"Wow" is the word I would use to describe this place. One of the best Mediterranean places in San Francisco. As the main course they have two options a sandwich or salad and 3-4 different types of meat. It is an even tie between the sandwiches and salads if you are going with atleast 1 other person I would highly recommend splitting a sandwich and salad and getting the chance to try both.

The lamb sandwich is very different from most places it has very fresh ingredients, great sauce added to it and overall a great find.

To top off the meal a must try is the olive oil and salt greek yogurt. It sounds like a unusual combination but the different textures go very well together.

I would def recommend trying this place.

This is a clean and modern "Greek" restaurant located on possibly my favorite street in Hayes Valley. The menu is basically pork, chicken, lamb or veg sandwich or salad and some sides. There is also some good looking ice cream served at the counter as well. 

When I came here, it was at 3 pm on a Friday on though there was not a line, there were still a fair number of people dining in. My friend and I decided to split a chicken sandwich and an order of fries. The chicken sandwich is supposed to come with ""granch" dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots, mizithra cheese." I did not taste any navel orange or fennel, and there was only the slightest sprinkling of cheese. The sauce was not distributed evenly through the sandwich either. Not to mention, the chicken was dry and salty. The fries are supposed to come with cheese, oregano, and olive oil as well, but again, there was only the slightest sprinkling of cheese with no olive oil or oregano flavor either. What a disappointment. At least the price wasn't exhorbitant.

Service was fine and the other diners seemed happy, so maybe we should have just avoided the chicken.
First time trying it, it was pretty good I got the Pork bowl and got sick that night...threw it all up. Next time I'll just get the frozen yogurt.

$11 salads of $10 pita wraps. Only 4 options (lamb, chicken, pork or veg). I had the veg salad and my husband had the pork salad. Both salads were good, fresh, and a nice size. I wish there were more options, especially for vegetarians.

Two words- feta. brine.

This place is truly a gem! pork & lamb sandwiches are great; chicken was phenomenal.

Baklava frozen Greek yogurt is intuitive but genius.

Price is right too, this is going to be on the regular.

Souvla is a tad overpriced in my opinion, but I keep coming back whenever I crave good/clean Mediterranean flavors. They could give more meat in the salad in my opinion. The yogurts are a must! I would recommend non-locals to give it a try at least once.
The juicy potatoes are excellent!  My Lamb grap was a little dry and they charge extra for the sauce.

Not only is the food here DELICIOUS, healthy and decadent, but on my latest visit the staff really went above and beyond in terms of service. I left my invisalign retainer in my napkin, and my husband allowed the staff to clear the napkin while I was in the bathroom. When I realized what had happened, the staff sifted through their compost bin, unfolding napkins one a time and carefully looking through everything in the bin until they reached the bottom. This took 2-3 bussers a good 20 minutes. Unfortunately they couldn't find my retainers, but talk about amazing service! They did everything they could to put my stupid mistake right. I SO appreciate it.

This place is really good and I would recommend it if youre trying to get a quick bite that is more on the expensive side. The Hayes location has the counter right at the front so the line always spills out onto the street and the rotisserie is visible on the back wall. I would recommend getting the salads in any case, as I think they're definitely more filling. Incredible service, good food, and just a relaxed ambiance. Chicken sandwich or salad is amazing with the Greek fries.

The Ceo, Charles S Billies,  sent a letter to city officials threatening to use "considerable national media connections and social media reach to get sf officials to raze a "downright scary homeless encampment" during a pandemic. They have deleted all comments on their posts asking for accountability and action, demonstrating that they have no interest in responding to the communities concerns. if you care about gentrification or sf's unhoused community, boycott this overpriced and callous restaurant until they issue a public and unequivocal apology and take material and financial steps towards atoning for this action.
Great salad! Always refreshing!!! Loving it!!!!!!!! Probably my fav salad in sf!!! Uhhyeahhhh

Where has Souvla been all my life?

You can't go wrong with the chicken or the lamb or the frozen Greek yogurt! The rotisserie chicken as a salad is my love. For a carnivore who hates veggies, kale never tasted so delicious. The combination of dressing and chicken flavor masks the fact that I'm eating greens. So not only did I eat healthy, it was tasty!

Ok, I forgot about the garlic fries. I usually prefer skinny fries but the quality of fries is amazing. Super crispy and not too garlicky and yum to the tum.

Cleanse the palate with some yogurt, of course. I had with baklava crumbles and I'm addicted. It's crack.

I love you, Souvla!

Decided to try this place since it was close to a piano bar that my girls and I were headed to later. 

Service: You order up front and you get a number and they bring your food out to you. Friendly staff, recommended a couple of items from the salad and sandwich menu.

Food: Ordered the lamb sandwich, and my friend ordered the chicken salad with a side of fries. The lamb sandwich was very Bland and tasteless. The chicken salad was much better but nothing to Rave about. The fries were great the fries were great!

So many better options in San Francisco, this is definitely not a place I will come back to.
I think this gyro is the best one in SF especially lamb meats!! And their frozen Greek yogurt with crunchy baklava is yummy!!

Yes. Hell yes.

I could have easily split a gyro and fries with someone. I should have. I didn't. I rolled out of here after lunch super happy and needing a walk. Making a mental note to split my meal or take half to go next time.

My pals got salads and were able to leave room for frozen yogurt. I tried to not hate them for this. The froyo looked hella good. They rolled their eyes while they ate. I took it as a good sign.

Order at the counter, find a place to sit, or take your stuff to go. There's a neat little spot nearby to eat outside but we sat inside. Pounce on a seat as soon as you see one open up. It's a good exercise in reflexes.

3.5 -- The flatbread was disappointing...it didn't have the right texture for me (not soft enough); chicken salad was fresh and good -- loved the slices of orange which brightened the dish. However, I realized I don't enjoy having rotisserie chicken on a salad...the mix of warm and cold doesn't do it for me somehow. Happy to have tried it though. Service was great and line moved fast.

GET THE BAKLAVA FROYO! Yum! 

Ordered: 
Chicken salad - A little too much dressing for my taste, but the ingredients were fresh and went together very well. Chicken breast was tender and moist and went perfectly with the veggies. Next time I'd order dressing on the side. 

Baklava Greek Yogurt - This thing will keep me coming back! The yogurt itself has a little bit of tartness, but goes amazingly well with the sweet syrup and baklava. I'm still dreaming about this dessert! 

A good healthy alternative. I'd be back to check out other items on the menu.
