Cute, greek place.  Lots of natural light, counter service, and surprisingly expensive.  Guest check for two modest eaters:  $38.07.  Order wisely.  And also, caveat emptor, there is a general sense of upsell pressure from staff there.  "If you're dining in, why not a glass of greek wine?  Why not a side order of greek dressing for $2 more?"

As for what we ordered:

The chicken bowl comes with kale and delicious greens.  I'd say that is a 4 star item.  My friend loved it, period.  I thought it was a tiny bit small for what I paid ($12) and a tiny bit overdressed with olive oil, but still really was the highlight of our food.

The lamb sandwich wrap--I love pillowy wrap bread, so I almost always prefer the sandwich over any platter.  The ingredients individually were all very well done and delicious, but they didn't work together as a whole.  And this lack of balance can easily be fixed. Specifically, here are the elements:
* meaty (a little too much and also not cut in a sandwich friendly way), 
* sour (not enough yogurt sauce, so be prepared to shell out an extra $2)
* comfy carb (pretty good, pillowy wrap bread), 
* fresh (way not enough vegetables), and 
* unctuous (olive oil literally dripping all over my hand and plate).  

What most people may expect from the gyro memories of their past is a mystery loaf of lamb/beef on a spit, thinly sliced to be easy to eat.  This wrap is not that--it's 100% genuine lamb.  Suggested improvements:  I'd actually use about 3 less chunks and shred the lamb a little bit more.  Also, please pick through and remove the excess connective tissues.  On at least three pieces I ate, I was stuck with lamb gum.  I've uploaded a pic to get a sense of the inside of the wrap.

FRIES:  excellent.  I happily ate them all, along with the rest of my $2 granch sauce.

Greek yogurt dessert:  as the restaurant was starting out (day 6), many guests who talked up the owners got the dessert for free.  Alas, we paid for ours.  At $5 it seems pricey, but I would say it was really worth it.  One of the owners went through the trouble to get those once ubiquitous NY coffee cups (a very nice touch).  The yogurt itself had a beautiful sourness and tang and the toppings and sauces were unusual and just worked.  Chopped baklava?  Really worked!  Although it's more expensive than some places, it's one of the two places I will now eat frozen yogurt (the other being Fraiche).

The people working there were nice and knowledgeable.  But the suggestive sell element was less focused on my personal well being, and more on upping the already hefty guest check I felt.  So that put me in a guarded mood rather than a happy, neighborly one.  If you want me to buy a glass of wine, offer me a little sip at my table perhaps?  If you were expecting a $20 meal for two, this isn't it.  The guest check for the meal (wrap, bowl, fries, extra side of greek ranch, and yogurt) will set you back a whopping $38.07 + any tip you might offer.  And this is for counter service, not table.  Three stars for the sandwich not living up to its potential, quite yet.  If the sandwich improves, I'd give this place four stars. And a definite 4+ stars for the yogurt.

The food is good, but overpriced.  I don't know why I expect anything in Hayes Valley not to be overpriced, but I do, so I'll repeat:  The food is good, but overpriced.

I'm still sad that Herbivore is gone, so I'm doubly sad that Souvla will be bringing the Opa! to NOPA.  (Seriously, Souvla, the same restaurant in Hayes Valley and on Divis?  What are you, Boulange de Pretentious and Overrated and Over-saturated?)

The ordering system is ridiculous.  The people who work here are nice and efficient as can be, but the ordering system is set up to confuse and annoy people, and confused and annoyed people are more likely to leave sooner, thus freeing up the few available tables and long line for more soon-to-be-confused-and-annoyed people.

The sparse menu pages are precious and a total waste of paper.

Wow, this is sounding like a two-star review, isn't it?  But the food is good, but overpriced.  Oh well.

This place is pretty dank. Although I eschew the trendiest, most popular places because of the frequent overhype, I was recommended this place by the person who I came to visit in SF. 

Walked right in and ordered the chicken salad. The technology here is advanced compared to Maryland, and you pay for the tip on a tablet. I can't imagine Joginder ever having this at Metro Dhaba. 

I like the ceiling window that allows natural light to shine on my tanned arms. It's in an upscale neighborhood and the people around here are slightly boring. 

The salad was very good. 5/5. Comes with free range Sonoma County chicken, tangerines, onion, cheese, some tasty dressing. They've got a common table in the middle where everyone can sit and talk about how ole Peggy Sue down the block didn't show up for her class. No but I saw most people playing with their iPhones. 

I enjoyed kind of blending into anonymity here.

Okay the line at lunch can be long (?), but anyways the food here is fresh and on point. Am I going to force a friend out of town here, god no, but I will force my local friends to meet me here for lunch. 

Additionally love the fact you can order them off some of the delivery services.

Oh always get Greek style, gosh that sounds wrong.

Oh My Freakin' Goodness!

My tastebuds and mind has been blown away! Not only is the food amazing, but the speed in which they get the food out to you is amazing! Ever since I moved up to SF from SJ, this place has been on my list of "To-Try" for some time now. One day I visited Hayes Valley for my casual city exploration adventure, and there I happened to stumble upon this huge line. And knowing me, I was so curious as to what the heck was going on! I later found out that the huge line was for this amazing beauty! 

I ordered the lamb sandwich for $13 and the frozen greek yogurt with honey & baklava for $5. Definitely the best combo I have ever had! I would totally recommend 100% of the time!

I wish I lived closer to Souvla so I could take more advantage of it. It's a great grab-and-go Mediterranean place, where you can get a fantastic chicken salad in less than 10 minutes. The chicken salad, which I've had twice, features juicy rotisserie chicken, onions, feta cheese, and tangerines. It may be a salad, but it's just big enough to be filling without making you feel overly full -- the perfect size!

There's a decent amount of seating inside, as well as a few tables outside. It's always pretty packed but you can usually grab a seat if you hang around for a little while. Ambience is very casual (you order and pay at a counter), which is great for a low-key hangout with a friend or if you're looking to grab something quick on the way home.

Great for those nights when you're just looking for something fast, fresh, and delicious without too much effort or fuss.

I had heard a lot about this place before going. I tried the sweet potato vegetarian wrap and it was honestly disappointing but I'm still giving them three stars because the service was decently fast and the ingredients were fresh and well cooked. It's just that the sweet potato was overpowering and I just couldn't taste anything else. I'm gonna try something else (non-vegetarian) next time and report back!

This was an unexpected find while strolling around Hayes valley. We just had brunch but their yogurt looked too good to pass. So glad we decided to pig out because they were amazing!! 

The line was out the door but moved fast. The décor was bright, airy. Space is small but you can take it out and eat at the park which I prefer.

We had the yogurt with wildflower honey and with baklava crumbles. Both were refreshing and delicious. Texture was softer than the typical creamy Greek yogurt but still good nonetheless. 

Perfect treat for a sunny spring afternoon!
The salads are delicious! My favorite is the lamb or chicken. Sometimes I have to have the frozen yogurt with cherry sauce. Yum.

So of course there are a few Souvla's around the city and honestly my experience has been the same across the board. 

I crave Souvla for the following occasions: 
1. Lunch while at work 
2. Dinner to go if I am alone 
3. When I am with one friend and we cannot figure out where to go and are in a rush. (Yes I know that is oddly specific). 

The various meat options are all great and whoever I go with from work never really has a big complaint. Definitely would go for a sandwich over a salad. 

Now although the food is pretty good my favorite thing here is the frozen yogurt with the baklava crumbles and honey. The one near my house is my go to place to get something cool on a hot day. A friend of mine got the one with olive oil and said it was different but also good.
Good food for a good price. Very casual. I liked it. I would say it is a fast food, super high quality fast friendly (:
This place lives up to the hype and the long lines you see out front. The food is delicious and healthful. Very lucky to have such a great option for casual or to-go dining in SF.

Cute place, good food, pretty decent prices. I would really love more options on the menu since it's pretty small (preferably more veg options) but still good. The veggie sandwich was pretty good, it wasn't incredible but I still really enjoyed it. Greek fries were delicious and so was the baklava Greek yogurt. Would come back & if you can sit outside and enjoy the cute little street it's on that's a plus :)

Unfortunately i only got to stop in for a togo order. However the place was packed so im not sure we 'd have sat in time for our need to go to a show anyways. Got the lamb sandwich. Well cooked lamb, onions and other goodness packed into a soft warm pita. Super tasty even on the run. I like the communal area up front then flanked by the high seats on the far wall. The extension to the outside of the space is clever too. Definitely a far cry from the old Sebo space. Will definitely have to dine in one of these days and sample all the other goods in a more leisurely manner. 4.3 stars

I ordered the Homestead Pork Shoulder sandwich wrap, which was really good, and moist and lots of flavor.  My wife ordered the lamb sandwich on pita, but she thought it was too drippy. The juice just poured out the end while she held it up to eat it! So it was a bit messy to consume.  The green side salad was fantastic.  Just very fresh ingredients and just perfect!  The fries were fine too.  The place is small and cozy but friendly.  The service was very good.  We sat in the corner inset next to the window so we had a nice view of Hayes St.  Very nice trees on this street!  

We did not have time to try any dessert.  The prices were a bit high but not too bad. My wife gave it a three star but I say it is a four star experience.  I just love Greek food!
We may try again when back in SF and Hayes St.

With a few changes, this could be a spectacular lunch spot. The number one thing that needs improvement is portion size, or something to change the value equation. There are two counters, the one at the front is for yogurt and the one towards the back of the space is for ordering food. 

*FOOD:

Lamb Sandwich: The meat was cut into uneven cubes, making it unfriendly for sandwich consumption and there were a few sinewy pieces that should have been removed. There was way too much meat and not enough of the pickled veggies or yogurt sauce to balance this sandwich out. If you want more sauce they charge you extra, which just seems unfair. This had mizithra cheese on it, which doesn't really melt and just acts as a conduit for salt. 

Greek Fries: Nicely crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. These came with mizithra cheese on top as well.

Granch Yogurt Sauce: A nice take on ranch dressing, but it was $2 for this small portion. I know Chipotle charges the same for a side of guacamole, but unless they're using grass fed milk, it seems too expensive for a side of sauce. 

Chicken Bowl: This was their rotisserie chicken with sprouts, on a bed of kale with orange segments and yogurt dressing. The portion on this guy was a bit small and I could have used a bit more roughage to round the dish out. Everything tasted great and I didn't think there was too much dressing (something I am sensitive to in general), but again, the portion was a bit measly. 

Frozen Yogurt w/ Baklava Crumbles: This was a very yummy way to finish our meal. The yogurt was creamy and fresh and the sweetness of the baklava balanced out the tartness of the yogurt. 

*VALUE: 

$12 for a lamb sandwich seems a bit steep, when all you're getting is the wrap by itself. The quality is great, but unless something changes value-wise, it's unlikely I'll be back. Also, charging $2 for extra yogurt sauce is just too much, especially since they wouldn't give me half portions of 2 different flavors of yogurt sauce to try when I asked. 

*ATMOSPHERE: 

It was nicer inside than I thought it was going to be. Very minimal with some nice accents of foliage.

I was in Sf with my gf over the weekend and we decided to get some food from the Hayes district. This place is really good and I would recommend it if youre trying to get a quick bite that is more on the expensive side. I got the Lamb gyro and i wish it was better. The sandwich needed a sauce because the lamb was a tad bit dry. Perhaps some hummus would been perfect. Dicing the cucumber into small pieces then mixing it with some yogurt wouldve also done the job by adding some moisture to the sandwich. But overall good!
Smells heavenly, love their chicken but find the lamb to be a little gamy the past few times I've gone.

The nice staff and the Greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup are Souvla's saving graces.

Everything else falls way, way short of (admittedly high) expectations. 

Prices are slightly higher than you're prepared for, especially in a deceptively casual looking joint -- tack on fries and a dipping sauce to your wrap or salad and your meal runs almost $20. And that's before dessert (which, I can't repeat enough, is their saving grace). Most importantly, the flavors are muted, despite their vibrant, Instagram/Pinterest-worthy colorful presentations. The kale in the salad is tough, the meats are dry and lack flavor, and the portions are oddly small, especially for coming either with a pita or in a massive salad bowl.

The space is bright, airy, and warm, though, and if you want a sweet treat after your meal, get the yogurt.
I am a tough customer...and all my experiences with Souvla have been overwhelmingly positive. What a scrumptious, healthy, place with with fantastic service. Thank you, Souvla!

Salads are pretty good. A little pricey. It's all good though. What isn't good is this big piece of plastic that I found in my food. Their workers might be on auto-pilot HOWEVER, please pay attention to what you're doing. How could you miss this plastic wrapping in my food???

The food is great- tasty, good quality, and pretty healthy. The frozen yogurt is special- I don't usually like frozen yogurt but this stuff is good.

The reason I'm giving 3 stars is I feel strongly that their seating policy (or lack thereof) greatly decreases the enjoyment of the dining experience.  Yes, it's busy San Francisco, so hard to get a table at popular places, but the fact that you're totally on your own to find a table regardless of ordering sequence, set in stressful competition with fellow diners with whom you may end up sharing a communal table, hovering like hawks over those fortunate folks who are already eating, really creates a sour vibe.  I like sourness in my greek yogurt, not in my atmosphere.

Why wait in a crazy line for brunch when you can get a delicious lunch almost immediately? I find lunch places to be underrated on weekends and almost always undersubscribed. 

Enter Souvla - fast, yummy and what seems to be pretty healthy. The pork salad is both hearty and yet not overfilling - and the roast chicken one is also quite good. If your heart is set on starches I recommend the fries; the sandwich is decidedly less good than the salad. (Not typically my approach)

Add a bottle of their $27 Greek rose and a baklava and honey topped frozen yogurt and you've got yourself one hell of a meal. If it's a nice day outside Patricia's green and the ample seating in Hayes Valley is a great place to enjoy your meal. Otherwise swoop in on any open seat in the restaurant itself; the skylights give the space a super nice ambience during the day.

I really wanted to like this place - I swear. Especially after all those times driving by and peaking into the crowded interiors. I mean I definitely have a strong liking for the interior decor... Reminds me of a lush lounge thanks to dim lit intimate setting and plants hung about. The people who eat here look pretty good too, as expected from Hayes Valley.

But thats where the spectacular ends... Because when I tried my salad with chicken, the flavor fell short. Given the hype, it came out pretty average. Ingredients are fresh and seemed to be sourced with conscience! But I just didn't think the actual food matched the expectations.

Cool chairs though.

So happy to have this new addition is Hayes valley! Full stars across the board. Trendy, healthy, delicious, affordable. Spit meat meets frozen Greek yogurt. I'm in love. 

We had the lamb sandwich, the roast chicken salad, honey frozen yogurt and baklava frozen yogurt. Inhaled it all!
Food is great,  but really isn't enough for the price charged frankly. Loved how they reopened, but the lamb sandwich was not worth the 15 dollar price point.

Ordered take out for a big group. Flavor wise, I can't complain; however, I felt like the portion sizes were just too small for the price. I would recommend getting the salads in any case, as I think they're definitely more filling. The pita wraps were small and expensive!

Souvla has never disappointed! Their wraps are delicious (pork is less dry than lamb). I usually order in but went to the Hayes location recently and was pleased. Plenty of seats and really clean. Our food came out quick and was exactly like how I've ordered it before. Haven't tried the frozen yoghurt yet.

Novel concept for a Greek casual spot.  I ordered the lamb wrap with fries.  Server came and brought my food without fries.  I informed her that I also had fries, and she wouldn't bring out my fries without getting my credit card because she claimed I didn't order them.  I definitely ordered them... Most places would have just given me the fries and apologized but her attitude was out of this world.  Very bitter.  The other cashier folks were very nice but this person's attitude just ruined all.  

Also why is the wine that overpriced? I understand mark-up, but this place takes it to a new extreme.  

And wrap was underwhelming, pita bread sucked.  Come on, Greek pita is the best pita (thick and beautiful) but this pita was probably the worst pita i've had from a Greek restaurant.

Souvla is a solid quick eat in Hayes Valley for a weeknight dinner or a casual weekend dinner. It gets crowded sometimes, but you can order ahead through Caviar and pick up.
I always opt for the chicken salad (add fries on top!) it's steep for a salad, but a perfect two mealer if you have a smaller appetite.
The baklava frozen yogurt is one of my favorite desserts in the city. The frozen yogurt is creamy and delicious, and the crumbled baklava provides a hit a sweetness that's not too overwhelming.
I've tried the sea salt and olive oil option too, and once you get past the first few super olive-oily bites it's quite delicious.

Food is great (maybe even more fantastic than when I first tried it) but staff needs to know the policy on patrons bringing in their pets. 

During my lunch, I saw two different people bring in their dogs INSIDE the restaurant. Not okay. Sure your dog is cute but be considerate enough for the people who have allergies. Pets are not allowed inside an establishment that serves food. Save that ish for outside.

Get it together, Souvla.
I've been to the one on Divisidero and Hayes. Both are good. It's easier to get into the Divisidero one. Last time I was on Hayes before the ballet, they were slammed. Delicious food!

I live in the area and every time I pass Souvla, it's jam packed full of people. One night I decide to give the restaurant a try. I ordered up the pork sandwich and a side order of their fries. I was pretty excited as I hadn't had Greek food in quite sometime and I love that combo of tender salty meat with that cooling yogurt effect. 

Foods up!  I dig in. The salad of tomato, cucumber, and greens inside the sandwich wasn't bad, but definitely needed some seasoning. Maybe the vinaigrette bottle wasn't shaken well enough before it was put in the salad bowl. The pork, although tender, was lacking seasoning as well and had a pretty mild taste unfortunately. The fries were soggy and pretty average as well. 

Overall the quality of food vs. the price point isn't worth it. I really wanted to like this place and find a quick casual eatery in my hood.

Great restaurant. Prices are in line with similar lunch spots in the city. Typically I avoid Greek restaurants because the meat is low quality and poorly prepared, but this was a welcome exception.

I had the lamb and Greek fries. Definitely recommend hot sauce on the meat.

Also, I was expecting a long line, but we were able to order and sit quickly. Pleasantly surprised to see how efficiently things were moving. Will be back

Souvla is a great Greek option in Hayes Valley. They have fantastic salads as well as gyros/wraps. I usually get the lamb gyro and the lady likes the chicken salad. They also have a pork and sweet potato option in addition to lamb/chicken. 

Their ingredients are very fresh and high quality. 

Eating there is fun because they are very generous with their wine pours and have some tasty Greek wines. 

There's often a line but it moves fast so don't let that discourage you.

What a great find. We have been there twice, sandwiches, bowls, ice cream.
5 stars of Yum.
Very informal. Great vibe. 
Some people stay awhile and sip wine.

Felt like I was in Greece!
Except in Greece they put fries in the gyros..I miss that! Anyways absolutely amazing lamb "sandwich". I did get the fries as well which were perfectly seasoned, and put them in the gyro myself YUM! I cannot wait to go there in person (vs postmates) and try the frozen Greek yogurt!!! 
I don't think I'll order the soup again as it was way to salty compared to others.

Another overpriced mediocre spot!
Service: Hipster rude, half a star
Food: Maybe one start at best
Decor: that's the only thing they have going for them, 4.5 stars

Not sure what's the hype about, but I am glad I tried it and most likely not going to miss it.

Had the Lamb Sandwich and Honey Greek Yogurt today.  Both dee-lish!  Fast friendly service, too!

I'm not usually a fan of lamb, but decided to try it given all the rave reviews.  The lamb was well-seasoned, tender, and juicy.  I loved the pickled onions, cucumbers, feta cheese, and sauce.  I practically inhaled the sandwich lol.  The greek yogurt dessert has a nice tangy flavor and it goes great with the honey, which becomes kind of hardened due to the cold yogurt.  So yummy!

This casual, clean and small Greek place has delicious shwarmas and salads but the best part is the Greek frozen yogurt.

The lamb is soft and delicious.

The place was very popular but I was able to get a seat right away.

Has their expansion been too fast?  Yesterday we ordered lunch for two, for pickup from Chestnut Street.  I had to spit out three chunks of lamb gristle/fat. Turned off, I threw out half the sandwich. Plus the meat (both chicken and lamb) was cold. Finally, both of us we're unnaturally thirsty after -- clearly, our "fast/ healthy" option was a salt bomb.  We're done with Souvla, and saying that brings me no pleasure -- I was a big fan.  But gristle and fat, cold meat and salt will do that to you.

I love all of the salads here, the wraps and of course the Greek frozen yogurt with the baklava bits drizzled with honey. The meats sometimes can be a little inconsistent, sometimes the lamb can be amazing.. And sometimes it can be dry, the chicken is for most always dry so I always avoid ordering that. I finally tried their pork shoulder.. And it is amazing!! But I would have to go back to order it a few times to see the consistency. It is really flavorful and you get bits of the crunchy fat? You can order the dressing on the side because sometimes it does get a little oily. Seating is limited here, so be sure to have one person to find a table while another goes and order if it you see that it is a little busy. Btw sitting by the rotating oven does get a little warm. The food also comes out really fast!

Best greek salads and frozen yougourt in town.

This casual spot is great for take away or a casual dinner or lunch, don't be discouraged by their line, it moves fast and is worth the wait. 

Their menu is simple and short, you can choose between chicken, veg, lamb or pork options and choose it in a salad or a sandwich. Always get the chicken salad, too good...
They have some other snacks too but the best thing on their menu and one of the reasons their becoming so popular is their baklava greek yougourt icecream. And you can ask for a sample too! 

Can't not love this place

Went back with my family, and finally got the frozen Greek yogurt with the baklava and honey--Souvla has solidified the fifth star for me.
Got the lamb sandwich again and there's really not too much more to say as all the other reviews cover how amazingly good it is.
Still true that the amazing bread can tire your mouth out a bit, but I love bread so whatever.

COME HERE.
(or don't, because the lines are getting a little long.)

Everything I know about the Greek culture, I learned from My Big Fat Greek Wedding: Windex solves all problems. Greeks are basically Trinidadians, except one of us is on steroids. If I knew anything about my own culture I'd give you a final verdict, but I don't, so you have to figure it out yourself. 

My friends parents, who are the loveliest parentals, treated us to a concert at the Nourse Theater and we wanted to meet up for dinner before. This spot seemed to be the best option health wise and I'm so glad we picked it. 

The lines get long very fast, but it moves at a good clip. The one con is really limited seating: about four 4-tops, a community table that seats about 8, and bar style seating. I think there's a 2-top right outside. 

I had the Chicken salad and have yet to regret that choice. It comes with a nicely chopped kale/romaine mix, granch dressing, fennel, navel orange chunks, pickled red onions, and feta cheese. Oh man, I'm still salivating thinking about this. Their chicken is the best roasted chicken I've had in SF. The only competitor in my humble opinion is Bell Street Farm in Los Alamos. I believe you can order a whole chicken to go too, but if I'm not mistaken it's $20 and that's overpriced. 

We also tried the Greek fries, and the juicy potatoes. The latter was OMG GET IN MAH BELLY. I might have said this out loud. Drink wise we popped a bottle of Greek Bubbles which was really nice, not too dry and really refreshing. Another table had the rose and hated it. We also had the floral & spicy red, which was as described.
Not bad, not good. It was ok... I had the lamb gyro and the meat was un-flavorful. The fresh cucumbers and cheese were good, but for $15 just not worth it, probably won't go back again.
Best recommendation ever!! I've been long overdue for Greek food and this sandwich spot fits the bill!!

We've tried the wraps and salads here but the frozen Greek-Yo with olive oil and flake sea salt stole the show.  The slightly tart, lightly sweetened base offset by the salt highlights the fragrance of the olive oil.  It's an incredible combination.  The olive oil also adds a silkiness to the Greek-yo.  Hard to describe.  You must check it out!

They put something magical in their salad dressing (I believe it's Greek yogurt) which makes this one of the most unique salads I've had. Their portions are large and satisfying, their ingredients are fresh and flavorful, and their lamb is super on point. They have a huge thing of lamb on a rotisserie for everyone to see, which is a nice characteristic element of the place that's hard to uncouple from my memories of the place.

Their Greek yogurt with baklava bits is life-changing. And you can ask for extra baklava. And you get it within 30 seconds of asking for it and you watch them fill a cup with swirls of the yogurt and it always feels like they're giving you extra. It's hard to walk past this place without instinctively walking in and ordering a yogurt.
Take out is still good. My favorite is Greek salad with lamb. Also, frozen yogurt with olive oil and sea salt.

First of all, why don't we have more Greek restos in SF? Souvla is so popular, and obviously we could have more of these more casual Greek eateries as well as fancier places. 

On Monday of this week, Souvla was packed by 6pm, and looked to be in for a super busy night. I had a glass of rose, a super generous pour for $10, and my food came to $10 also - for a bowl of ye olde traditional chicken egg lemon soup and an order of fries. The fries are WORLD CLASS and the soup delicious. Plenty of food for $10!

Will visit again for sure.

I had high hopes for this restaurant. I love Greek food, have been to Greece, and have read the owner here is from The French Laundry! It's super cute inside and the entire menu sounded delicious. The problem was execution. My sandwich was so stuffed full of meat and not enough of anything else. The chicken was much too dry as well. There needs to be less meat, more sauce, more veggies, and better bread. I left the majority of my sandwich on the plate. 
Greek fries were very tasty even though they were served kind of cold and the cheese was all on the bottom of the cup. 

Baklava crumbles and Greek yogurt was pretty good. That was my favorite thing and I give it a solid 4 stars. 

I wouldn't come back. I spent $23 for average food when I could have had a schwarma elsewhere for $8 and been much happier.

If you want to learn how to create/run a California-Greek franchise restaurant with integrity and skill, eat here and observe.

The concept: strip down a Greek restaurant to its essentials, and broaden the appeal by offering gyros as bowls. Elevate the ingredients. Make sure items can be assembled quickly, so turn around is quick. Apply these same concepts (simplicity, quality, authenticity, broad appeal) to the physical location. Charge a hefty premium. Execute the concept flawlessly. Rinse and repeat.

When I got to Souvla with my wife, there was a line of about half a dozen people. It moved quickly. While I waited, I observed with growing admiration. The space looked modern (track lighting, copper tables) but was rooted in Greek culture (white brick and walls, wood floors, a blown-up old photo of a Greek man swigging ouzo and holding a chair in one hand, outdoor seating with hanging light bulbs) and had music calculated to appeal to the young tech crowd. Silverware and napkins were housed in attractive white ramekins, on the tables.

We ordered two bowls, one lamb and one sweet potato, a Greek fries, and a frozen yogurt with honey. The food was brought to us within minutes. The bowls, while very much in the California style, had authentic Greek flavors. The fries were tasty and maintained their crunch until they grew lukewarm. (Unfortunately, they also made my wife swell up like a balloon since she's gluten intolerant. I found out later from Souvla's website that the fries contained soy. I appreciate that the website has an Allergen page, but it might be a good idea -- and a smart sales move -- to mark the gluten free items with a gf on the restaurant menus.) The frozen yogurt finished off the meal in fine style.

To sum up, Souvla offers tasty food with broad appeal, very quickly, in pleasant, bright surroundings. I have no doubt the owners are making bank.

I love this place, they have great tasting and good quality food. They tend to be very busy, so I'm glad that they recently added a pick up window. 

If the weather is good, just pick up your food and eat outside or in the park next door. 

Great fries and gyros. They always have good vegetarian and meat options. It's a simple menu, but its all fantastic.

A great place for some wraps in Hayes Valley. We just randomly happened upon this place after walking around the area and working up a good appetite. They serve amazing Greek wraps (or salads if that's your thing) and really great fries. I tried out the lamb but was really curious about the pork...maybe next time. 

The line moved quickly, and despite looking crowded we found a seat and ate comfortably. The Greek wine was perfect and really refreshing; the whole place made for a great experience and very good food to grab while in the area. Since I like going to Hayes so often I'll definitely be coming back here!
Place gets really hot inside since tables are right next to kitchen . Other than that,  Best gyro ever!

I've been to Souvla a few months ago and their lamb gyro was delicious! So i decided to go there again and introduce it to my sister. We went there last night and got a lamb sandwich/gyro, and salad to go. The person taking our order was very friendly and welcoming, as she gave us free fro yo samples. 
However, the food was very subpar this time. My lamb gyro was very dry and tasted really bland for some reason. I could taste the pickled vegetables and the garnishes but zero lamb flavor. It was very sad :(

My sister didn't really like her salad since the lamb was also dry and there was too much dressing.
great to stop in again when it wasn't too busy. this time we found a great spot to keep us and the food warm while watching people running from the rain.

Chill little Greek sandwich joint w a small wine selection. Weird thing is though, we came here for their frozen Greek yogurt. Located in a hip little section of Hayes Valley, the spot is real unassuming and has a nice vibe to it. I've been told the food is pretty good, but didn't give it a shot as we ate prior to stopping by. 

- Baklava Crumbles w Honey  - GOOD

The spot is a little pricey, but would make for a good place to grab lunch. Parking isn't too hard to come by, but can see it being a hassle during busier hours. Would recommend for sure...

Souvla is pretty close to perfect. There's a reason why it's always buzzing with people. Their lamb leg sandwich is phenomenal, even though it's on the pricier side ($13) for a gyro/sandwich. It's filled with fresh ingredients and will keep you full for hours. The juicy potatoes are cooked in rotisserie drippings, which means you'll probably not want to share.

It's easily a $20+ meal, or more if you order their frozen Greek yogurt. While I loved the consistency of the fro-yo, I wouldn't order honey as a topping again...it hardened quickly and I was basically scooping chunks of honey into my mouth. The sour cherry is calling my name!

One drawback is its popularity. Fighting for a table is never fun, but you may need to do some shameless hovering to grab a seat. It's a cramped restaurant and lines are often out the door.

Thoughtfully done, quickly served, full of flavor Greek food! The staff here was working really hard together (always a welcome sight) and the vibe was super fun. Wasn't sure how the kids would do, but they were welcomed right in and given special attention during our meal. Thanks, Souvla, Yiayia was impressed!!

I got the pork shoulder salad and the baklava frozen yogurt. I was really looking forward to the frozen yogurt and wanted to skip dinner for that! It was delicious tart yogurt that taste like yogurt not super sweet. The baklava on top was perfect!! The salad I don't think is too healthy, but real tasty! It had a puddle of oil on the bottom of my bowl after

After a late night of bar hopping and fun having we were very hungry. Thank goodness we stopped at Souvla. The food was sooooo good. The lamb sandwich was beyond delicious! Prior to this I had only had lamb in indian food. But man oh man this made me want to eat this all the time! So so good. Flavors were on point! We also had a pork salad and it was just as delicious. Souvla definitely knows how to get the flavors just right and make Greek food a favorite. The outdoor dining was so enjoyable and the ordering process was super easy. Overall, Souvla is a must stop for a wonderful meal!

Stopped in here a while ago for the first time and was blown away with how good the lamb sandwich here is. The Valencia Street location is a hard pass, but the Hayes Valley location is great. Food is fresh, the sandwiches filling and very satisfying for the price. Very good, will definitely be back.
Absolutely delicious!!! Great location. Very fast and friendly service. Most tables seemed to accommodate 2-4 people but they do have a communal table and stool seating.

When you walk in it's easy to tell: it's all about the rotisserie chicken! I got the chicken salad, which comes on a bed of kale and romaine, "granch" (Greek Ranch), clementines, and some onion. The contrast of the warm chicken breast pieces and cool kale, etc. simply worked. 

Friends got the french fries (cooked just right), and the lemon/egg/chicken soup which was described as  being "surprisingly good," and "cozy."

For dessert you can feel good about yourself with a cup of high protein greek froyo. I got the baklava kind, and yes, it was yumE. Everyone else got the olive oil and sea salt, and while too savory for me at dessert time, it tasted pretty good when I dipped a stray fry inside. 

You'll probably have to wait to sit, or settle for bar seating, it's first-come-first-serve seating.
Shouldn't be too difficult if you come with one other person though. It's one of those places I find myself referring friends to who want something of quality that isn't going to break the bank.

Really enjoyed this place. Got the chicken sandwich and it was quick to order at the counter and delicious. There was an orange in there that have an extra flavor boost. 

Will definitely be interested in going back if I am in the neighborhood. Not cheap at $11-12 a sandwich but this is San Francisco

This place is pretty awesome. We got take out here on a Thursday night and the wait in line was longer than the wait for our food. Had the pork sandwich and the lamb salad, got a side of the Greek fries and the baklava fro-yo for dessert. The pork sandwich was stuffed with meat and tasted like Mexican carnitas, it was pretty greasy. The lamb salad was good, also a lot of meat.

The show stopper was the dessert. I will bring people here just for the dessert! Tart and sweet, oddly tasted like apple pie ala mode, which I'm totally happy with. Great place, if it comes down to it, pass on the fries and put that money towards more dessert!

Fresh, juicy, tasty and overall fantastic Greek food, people! 

FOOD: Everything was cooked just right. I ordered lamb Wrap (also available as a salad, which I'm going to try next time), and my taste buds were truly happy. The meat was very tender, juicy but not fatty, and it had just the right amount of seasoning/flavor. The wrap included thinly sliced cucumbers, radish, and pickled red onions. The bread was also delicious. Though the price of similar items is typically lower in the area, Souvla has all the rights to charge the amount they do, thanks to their food quality. And, the size was also very satisfying for a lunch option (perhaps, a hungry 200+ lbs man would want 2 of these though). 

SIDES: Souvla offers all their wraps in a form of a salad as well, plus they have Greek fries, salad, and couple other items on their menu. The Greek fries were wonderful! Lightly seasoned, perfectly cooked, golden and crispy with a touch of cheese. The fries complimented the wrap very nicely.

SWEETS: The menu of this place is a minimalist's dream: everything is organized neatly, and, although there are only several options to choose from, all of them are very decent. As for desserts, Souvla offers their famous frozen yogurt. Of course, I had to go with the Baklava crumbles for the topping. It was great! The yogurt was not really frozen, it was just perfectly chilled, so you could taste the tart, sweet, creamy but light deliciousness under a layer of decadent, honey-crusted baklava! It was such a pleasant finishing touch to my meal. 

DESIGN: A very modern and elegant interior with a dash of ethnic beauty.

SERVICE: 5++! Everyone at Souvla was super nice, the person at the front desk was very efficient and, despite the long line during lunch rush, our wait wasn't that long at all! We got our food ready in about 10 minutes. Plus, when we wanted to share 1 frozen yogurt in the end (couldn't go for a full cup after all the good food),  the front desk person served it in 2 cups with no problem at all. That kind of service does deserve 5 + stars!

This review is for the salad bowls we had a few weeks ago and today's frozen greek yogurt. 

What a Souvla filled day today, went to the Souvla for lunch on Divisadero and on my attempt to walk off the lunch, I was lured into Souvla on Hayes for a frozen greek yogurt topped with baklava and honey. For $5 this fro greyo is the bomb. I had the intent to eat half and save the other half for my boyfriend. Oh how that intention got derailed during my 5 min walk home. It was melting so fast that I had to eat it all... I mean what is a girl suppose to do when you have a delicious melting frozen greek yogurt? Eat it faster right? Needless to say, this was awesome and guilt free so I'll be back for more, next time with the boyfriend in attendance. 

On a Thursday night a few weeks ago, we came and ordered one superior farms lamb leg salad and one Mary's free range salad. I've always loved the vibe and the colorful salad bowls, but when we got ours we were highly disappointed with the meat quality in the salad. Maybe it was late at night and only end meat shaving were left. Also they were short on ingredients, cucumbers were out for the night. Not a bad thing to experience as this shows that ingredients are fresh. However, I would have loved to have a substitution for the missing cucumbers seeing that I removed the cheese as well due to lactose intolerance. So my salad was looking a little sad. 

Likely will go back to the Divisadero location for a meal but will continue to come back to Hayes for dessert. 

Overall: 
Food/ drinks: 2/5 for salad bowls; 5/5 for greek frozen yogurt 
Service: 1/5 - felt rushed through the ordering process and throughout the entire meal as a waiter came to take our bowls away about 3 times during our dine in while there was vivd amounts of food still in the bowls. 
Environment:  2/5- great decor, free wifi and self seating, self water service, clean the tables yourself, music is way too loud for conversations
The chicken salad is a good mix of hearty meat and citrus fresh. It's also a good evening vibe for a fast casual spot- fresh with candles and floral decor. Would highly recommend!
Not impressed with their lamb sandwich which I have now tried twice. I find it to be dry and a bit bland. Don't think I will be back.

This place is "backwards" - but AWESOME - in that the salad is much much better than the gyro where usually it's the other way around at most places. Everything is pretty pricey but I can't recommend the salad enough. I got it with lamb and it was extremely hearty, flavorful, CHEESY, and filling. The lamb gyro was just okay - the wrap itself was underwhelming. 
The greek fries were also amazing, especially with the greek yogurt ranch sauce. It has a lemony and tart flavor that's a little unusual at first to dip your fries into but I became instantly addicted.

My experience at this establishment was horrible. We were moved from a table I had cleaned myself to a table that was dirty, even after they supposedly wiped it down (food was left on the table for us to clean). The actual food wasn't any better. The lamb was ok, the pita bread was stale and hard to eat. I also got the yogurt to go. Something I ate at this place made me sick, because I threw up by the time I got home. You can get better quality food at better prices without getting sick at almost any other Mediterranean place.
I literally come here every time I get a craving for frozen yogurt!!! The baklava and honey drizzled frozen yogurt is THE BEST! Never fails and fills you up!
Baklava Greek yogurt was heavenly .. I love froyo so this was great especially with the baklava crumbles on top. I also had this pork sandwich looking thing. Cute spot, clean and friendly staff!
Greek froyo with baklava crumble and sour cherry syrup.  Sounds amazing?  It is.  And it's one of the top 100 things to eat in SF.  Go try it.
If you haven't had Souvla's chicken salad, you have. not. lived. So good. Add Greek fries and a side of Granch to get super rowdy, you won't regret.

So I was actually really impressed with Souvla. I walked in with my friend on a Saturday night and it was packed. We were able to find seats after we ordered luckily. After I ordered the gyro I immediately noticed that almost everyone in the restaurant had ordered the salad haha. Retrospect is 20/20. The gyro was great though. I loved that it had fresh sprouts and mandarin oranges in it. I ended up just opening it to eat it with a fork to avoid the heaviness of the pita bread. We also had the garlic fries which were great crispy fries. For dessert we had the Greek yogurt. The yogurt itself was great, but the toppings kinda messed it up. It had A LOT of sea salt on it. Like way too much. And it was topped with olive oil which seemed bizarre. When I first saw it I thought it was honey but nope.. olive oil . My friend and I basically didn't eat any of it soooo yah. Sometimes less is more. Overall it was a great spot I would come back to and recommend.

While visiting the city we stayed in the Hayes Valley neighborhood. This shop was continuously busy, always a good sign. We ordered the veggie sandwich, the veggie salad and the potatoes.
Cost is reasonable, portions are good, especially the salad, and service is fast. We will return here in the future. FYI, the salad contains lots of kale, and the side of potatoes is quite rich!

I just realized I've never reviewed Souvla - which is damn right blasphemous.

I live in the neighborhood and have eaten Souvla at least once (if not multiple times) per week for over a year. Feeling lazy but don't want to eat crappy take out? Get Souvla delivered (I use Caviar).

My go to is always the same:
Chicken salad with extra meat - the greens itself are sturdy, tasty, well balanced with a bright flavor that leaves you full without being bogged down. The chicken is also usually on point, but can occasionally be a little dry or fatty. The orange and fennel are HUGE bonuses.

Greek fries + Garlic yogurt
These are just addicting, although delivery can leave them soggy. I don't blame Souvla though, that's the price for my laziness. I could eat the greek yogurt side with a spoon. The mizratha cheese they use is super sharp and salty, which I love. 

Bonuses when I eat in:
Greek yogurt with sour cherry (add sea salt!)

Greek beverages (the iced tea and lemon drink are BALLER)

I've had the chicken sandwich but the wrap they use is too thick for me, it dries it out. The salad is always the move. I've had the vegetarian salad, while the flavors were good, the sweet potato was a little dry for my taste. I dislike lamb and have been meaning to try the pork.

Price is a little steep, but it's Hayes Valley and the portions are big. 

Basically, I'm obsessed.

I loved Souvla! This hidden gem is a fantastic place to get your Greek food fix! They offer wrap and salad options, as well as their famous frozen Greek yogurt. 
During my visit, I enjoyed a lamb wrap which was DIVINE! The meat was perfectly cooked and the entire wrap had a unique and wonderful pattern of taste. Savory, yet with some sweet notes too. The yogurt was a great way to top everything off. I had the famous Baklava flavor. 

I definitely look forward to stopping by again!

We were extremely disappointed with the service and attitude at Souvla this week.  Our office had ordered take-out from Souvla before for meetings in the office.  This week, one of our secretaries mistakenly ordered food on Souvla's website for about 10 people on Wednesday and charged the order to her credit card.  She shortly thereafter realized that the lunch meeting was scheduled for Thursday and tried to cancel the order.  It took her several phone calls before she even reached a live person at Souvla.  When she finally reached someone, Souvla refused to cancel the order and our secretary had to pick up the food, even though no one on our team was there to eat it. She felt terrible but wouldn't let us reimburse her for the unwanted food.  She then had to reorder the food for our meeting on Thursday. 

Souvla's "policy" in this regard was heartless and reprehensible.  You can be sure we will not be ordering from Souvla again.
Seeing the lamb roasting in the big oven was super appetizing, but the experience didn't match. I had it in a salad and it was ok but while priced as a meal, it was far from being a fulfilling meal.

Walked here for lunch, and it was great.  I had the lamb gyro and it was tasty and filling.  I got the fries as well, but couldn't eat them all as the gyro filled me up.  But, the fries were crispy and golden and perfectly salted.  

The tables are either a four top, or a large communal table inside, some bar style seating and a seats outside.  I felt perfectly comfortable as a woman alone here sitting at the communal table A+.

Delicious and filling. I can usually get two meals out of their salads. They have veggie, rotisserie chicken, pork, and lamb options that you can have wrapped or in a salad. All the fixings pair with the meats well. They have perfectly seasoned fries with dipping sauces, Greek wine, and my favorite avgolemono soup. Save room for their frozen Greek yogurt. I love it with baklava crumbles and honey. It gets pretty busy so that seating is scarce during peak meal hours in which case we'd take our food to go and eat out in the pavilion.
Chicken salad with olive oil dressing + white sweet potato might be the best salad in the city.

I've given Souvla several attempts but have yet to find anything that's tasty. It's the kind of menu that would be a go-to favorite of mine if it was better.

They do not cater well to a diary-free crowd; they use a lot of yogurt and cheese, rather than herbs and quality cooking. 

I decided on this third or fourth (and last) order to pop a Lactaid, cross my fingers, and order dishes with all the dairy to see if I really can't find anything that I like there. My husband and I shared two chicken salads (no changes) and a lamb sandwich (no changes). Neither of us cared for our food. The chicken isn't very good, the oranges on the salad weren't ripe, tons of cheese, yogurt dressing - really nothing interesting in the salad. Only positive was that the serving of meat was quite large. The lamb in the sandwich wasn't flavorful either; sandwich was pretty dry. Pita wasn't anything special. 

Was really rooting for this place, but can't get behind it.
Everything is ah-mazing!! The only thing is the space, it get very crowded and you have to wait to find a place to sit.
This place is the business. The lamb is actual lamb, and the baklava yogurt is to die for. 10/10 would recommend, especially on a budget.

Favorite place for a healthy meal, especially after attending class at YogaTree, which happens to be right next door. They've got great salads and their Greek frozen yogurt is a nice little cheat (why not, if eating salad for dinner!).

Beautiful space and delicious, fresh food.  We wanted to try everything on the menu.  Highly recommend the salad with pork, as well as any of the wraps.  The fries looked amazing - we went with the potatoes, which were great.  Gorgeous outdoor seating as well.

This place was delicious. The top 4 options on the menu are salads -- I didn't know that, but I love salad so I was content. Not really sure what I thought I was getting. The veggie salad was delicious & amazing. It's always so crowded in there so you know it's a good place. They noticed I kept going up for water (there's a spigot in the corner by the register) & they brought me a jar which was very nice. The people are friendly, but I think they need a better system of filtering people through the shop. The registers are in the front of the store, and after you order, you're stuck kind of standing there until you can either get your food or find a place to sit. I also had the frozen Greek yogurt (the honey flower one), and that was good. Keep in mind it'll be kind of sour because it's Greek yogurt. It was good -- not sure if I'd get it again, but it's worth trying for sure. If you like baklava get that one!

Phenomenal. 

As someone who lived in Greece for several years, Souvla is the perfect blend of a Souvlaki stand and California Quick Service salad joint. 

I had the lamb salad and it really was perfect. With a side of Greek fries.  That I of course put INSIDE the salad. 

The flavors brought my tongue back to Greece, and the simple design brought me to Mykonos. I will be back. And I will eat everything on the menu.

Exquisite salad or sandwich and meat combos make this place the ideal spot for a scrumptious Greek meal with the icing on top being the frozen Greek yoghurt and wine offerings.

We had the pleasure of dining at this spot on a Tuesday evening which we stumbled upon whilst walking along Hayes Street one warm evening in SF.

What topped off my giving this a 5* review was the friendly accommodation of our 'last minute' ordering just before 10pm. Whereby the service staff kindly let us stay past the 10pm kitchen-close time without a hint of apprehension!

Thank you SouvlaSF we'll be dining with you again soon.

Great food and casual dining.  A little dark and could use additional lighting, but otherwise delicious food served quickly and efficiently.  Must try the lamb, fries and Greek yogurt!  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Next time will try the chicken and sal
Always amazing!  The food is fantastic every time - either takeout or eat in, so delicious.  Highly recommend the lamb & the baklava frozen yogurt.

Love this place! Nothing fancy, very down to earth and cozy. Food is delicious, service is very friendly. Great spot to catch up with a friend. The outside is heated which is nice. Vegetable wrap is my favorite!

I've been coming here since they opened and have always left with my taste buds and tummy very satisfied. I happen to work for the company who supplies their plates, so I have a special place in my heart for a business that buys local as much as possible. Charles and his team are ultimate professionals, and this little restaurant in the heart of Hayes Valley garners all kinds of (well-deserved) attention from the media. I love the concept, the simple menu, and sticking to the things that you can do better than anyone else around. The flavors here are off the chain, and you cannot go wrong with either the pita or salad. Also, the hype you're reading in all the other reviews about the frozen greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt? It's not just hype, my friends. You really must save room for this treat when you come here. 

Also, I just want to mention that while Souvla does Greek food extremely well, they don't take themselves too seriously. We came here with some friends for my husband's birthday, April 1, and they had completely transformed it into a taqueria for April Fools. They even hired a Mariachi band. So fun!
The salads are very big and usually last me two meals. Next time I go back I plan on trying the Greek yogurt it looked so good!
Delicious!! The lamb is better than the chicken but they are both great!! The Greek fries were not as "Greek" as they should have been. Needed more of the toppings. Overall, it was delicious.

Absolutely obsessed with this place.

I finally understand the hype. It's one of those places that just does everything right; their fries are well seasoned and crispy, their salads are flavorful and meats are juicy, the frozen greek yogurt is the perfect consistency and level of sweetness. I just cant get over how good this place is; would eat here everyday.

Everything here is great.

The chicken, lamb and pork shoulder are all amazing.

The chicken is moist and tender.
The lamb and pork are perfectly seasoned.

Wrap or salad - you can't go wrong either way.

The tangy/sour Greek yogurt with baklava is to die for.

This place is fantastic but recently their frozen yogurt has gone south. It tastes processed, overly sweet and bland. It used to have this rich, tangy flavor that no one else had. Now it tastes kind of like Tasty D-light. I really hope they fix this problem!!!

Great place for lunch even with the huge crowd. They have a really simple menu which leads to delicious food and quick service. Our group showed up around 11:45 on a weekday. While the line was out the door, we ordered and sat down within 15 minutes. I ordered the lamb wrap which was delicious and flavorful. My coworker ordered the fries which were pretty meh for the price.
Eh. Overprice hipster salad place. Just another regular Hayes valley restaurant with ok food. Their chicken salad is better than other menus.

Came here after an intense yoga class at Ritual and gotta say, it was the perfect meal to end the night. 

Lamb salad: light but hardy. Lamb is cut up into bite sized squares and there's plenty of it. I only managed to finish half and I was starving when I started the meal. 

Frozen yogurt: my friend and I concluded that this choice was healthy. It's frozen Greek yogurt after all. I had the wildflower honey and he had the cherry. Both super light and super "healthy" tasting.  ;)

Vibe: at close to 9pm, the place was packed. But I found it to be cozy and the decor very inviting. 

Can't wait to try the other stuff on the menu!

Hip, trendy, young, Greek place in Hayes Valley.  I always get the chicken salad.  Love it!  The meat is so flavorful and tender.  The Greek fries with the harissa sauce is not to be missed. The Greek frozen yogurt is so tangy.  I can't describe the oil and salt on the yogurt, I said I didn't care for it, yet I ate it all, and still crave it.

Souvla offered some fantastic Greek food! We arrived at 6:40 on Wednesday night and it was starting to get busy. The two tables outside were open but none of the tables inside had seats available. We grabbed three seats along the wall and ended up moving to a table as soon as some people got up. They have hooks under the wall tables surrounding the place which is a super plus. The communal table in the middle was great. It was roomy enough to share. Steve held down the fort while we ordered. My friend had the  Lamb Sandwich, I had the Chicken Sandwich and Steve had the Pork Salad. We also got the Egg and Lemon soup. The soup was delicious and hot. It had really good seasoning with bits of chicken but none of flavors were overpowering. The Greek sparkling mineral water and beer were both refreshing. You order efficiently and grab a number. The food is brought to you, served in white tin bowls in little trays. We loved our food. The bread they used to wrap the sandwich is chewy and held together well. I almost always have issues eating wrapped food but none of the stuff fell out. The paper and bread held everything together. I loved the pickled veggies and tangerine oranges with the meat. Everything tasted fresh and light. The salad was too hearty for me but my husband loved it. I don't like a mouth workout so the pieces of kale and stuff were too big for my liking. Steve very much enjoyed the salad just the way it was. We ended the night with Baklava Yogurt and French Fries. Both "desserts" were great. The Fries were cooked nicely and had yummy lemon seasoning. The Baklava Yogurt had the perfect tanginess and sweetness because the flavors complemented each other. The service was great and the place was clean. Even the restroom was tidy. You can see into the kitchen while you wait for the restroom and the kitchen looked clean and well organized. A HUGE line formed while we were eating and many people had to wait for a table. The line was steady even after we were all done eating. It's a very popular place and worth it.

Souvla has become really popular on Instagram lately; I can't seem to go on my feed without seeing either the racks of meat sweating or the adorable froyo cups in someone's hand.

You get a choice of meat to go into your sandwich, but I would advise against the pork; it was a little too hard, and the lamb was much better tasting. The greek frozen yogurt with baklava and honey is the perfect treat to take to go for a quick stroll around Hayes Valley afterwards.

Service is insanely quick, and seating is extremely limited. Come, especially if you need a new Instagram.

Be prepared for the long line! Stopped by around 8pm on a Tuesday night and the line was out the door. It's a small place completely packed for both indoor and outdoor seatings. I ordered a lamb sandwich and a side of Greek fries and it actually didn't take that long to get my food. The food however was ok, definitely as not great as it's hyped up to be.

My friend and I were walking around Hayes Valley deciding what to eat. As we were walking, we saw this little white restaurant with people eat big bowls of salad. For a sunny and hot day, it was the perfect thing!

When we walked in, we went to the register to order. Their menu is pretty simple, you choose your protein and you can get it in a wrap or salad. We both got rotisserie chicken salad and shared fries. We got our number and found a spot at the bar. Our order came very quickly! 

Chicken salad: I was expecting mixed greens or iceberg but the salad was filled with kale with sprinkles of romaine! There were a ton of ingredients in there. It had pickled onions, pea shoots, chicken, nuts, and I can't remember what else! It was delicious and so filling! 

Fries: so good! Crispy and perfectly seasoned. You don't even need to dip it in anything. 

On our way out, we noticed a frozen yogurt bar on the left side. We got samples .. walked out .. then walked right back in to each order our own. We both got plain greek frozen yogurt. It was so good .. creamy yet light! I noticed they had frozen yogurt with baklava crumble .. I have to try that next time! 

This place looks like it can get pretty busy during lunch hours and might be hard to find a seat! But definitely worth a try!

I have never experienced something so amazing before in my life. I ordered the pork sandwich and after taking my first bite I teared up a little. I had mouthgasms running through every tastebud in my mouth. The tears rolled down my face. My girlfriend looked at me like I was crazy but I didn't care. This sandwich has forever changed my life. 11/10 would eat again.

I'm actually not all that impressed. I love greek food dearly but I didn't find the pork or lamb wrap to be all that excellent and the condiments, while tasty (I tried all four with the admittedly excellent fries) used too sparingly on the wraps. The pita was also a bit too tough. The avgolemono was also a bit thinner than I prefer. The price is also a bit high. My friend and I split the two wraps, fries, and soup and spent $40 ($48 after tip).

4 stars overall, but I think Souvla had the potential to be a 4.5 or 5 star place. I had the pork wrap and was very impressed at the tenderness and rich pork-y flavor. Yes, the wrap is huge and unwieldy and drips all over, but recognize that that grease dripping out of your wrap is melted animal fat, i.e., liquid deliciousness! So I say keep your head down, enjoy that luscious animal fat, and file Souvla away in your head as not a good first date place.

The wrap wasn't perfect, though. Ours came out slightly warmer than room temp and I can only imagine how much more amazing it would be if it had been hot. Same with the pita - it was on the hard end and lacked fluffiness. Again, the whole wrap would have been elevated with those small details.

Still, all the ingredients were fresh and tasty. It's not the cheapest fare ($11/wrap), but you get what you pay for at Souvla.

Also: note that it gets incredibly busy around dinner time, so scout out tables after you place your order!

Not impressed at all after seeing good reviews. Bummer of a lunch. The lamb was dry and I thought it was just mine, but my husband ordered the chicken and it was very dry as well. The sandwiches had no flavor or sauce, very dry and boring. The fries were crisp but also very tasteless and didn't match their exciting "Greek" description.

Souvla is a hipster greek place in Hayes Valley. To go straight to the point, the staff is super kind and friendly. There's not much to choose, you either go for a salad or a gyro (sandwich). Pick a meat: beef, lamb, chicken, or pork.

The chicken is cooked in front of you (rotisserie chicken). It's a bit pricy but then again what's not pricy in this city. I had an extra order of fries with the garlic sauce, and it was extremely delicious!
For the price, some of the worst food I've ever had. The food is bland and the wine tastes like it came from a box. I can't fathom how this place is busy.

1. I was hungry AF when I got here and my food came out in less than 3 minutes
Amazing prices, amazing service, amazing food(.)

One of my favorite spots in the city for a quick yummy lunch or dinner 
(they recently open some new locations, too!)

- Always go LAMB, or go home. JK, but it really is the best.
- Good in salad, great in a (soft, perfect) pita. 

Haven't tried their frozen yogurt but saw some chick get it with baklava and it looked amazing.
This is quite possibly the best sandwich I've ever had. The pork just melts in your mouth and the pita tastes like they just pulled it out of the oven. This is well worth $14. YUM

Overrated. Overpriced. Long lines. Limited seating. Food isn't bad but you'll end up spending as much as a regular restaurant. We accidentally forgot to tell them no cheese and they wanted to charged us for another salad because they already prepared it. Why can't they give that one to someone else? If you really want to eat here order online ahead of time and pick it up
My first time eating here and it was DELICIOUS. Get the fries with greek/ranch sauce. So good. Definitely coming back here.

Love Souvla! One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Minus a start because I have had some rude service before :( for example, one time I was hesitating on what topping I wanted on my frozen yogurt and the lady was super rude to me. Otherwise, food is excellent!
Pork shoulder sandwich was delicious!! Nice little place for eating alone or with friends, service was really fast

I visited this restaurant this weekend on a trip to San Fran. I was very disappointed to find that my company and I was racial profiled. We paid using a $100 bill then we told the cashier we would be back for the food. She accepted our money and told us the food would be ready when we got back but when we reappear, I notice my food was not ready after 15mins. That's when the manager, Levi, came up to us and told us that our money was fake. He would not believe it was a real bill because he used a test from 1990s that he swore was not broken. We told Levi to come with us to the Bank located a few blocks away and there they confirmed the bill was REAL. Levi apology for the inconvenience because he felt like a fool for racially profiling us. He only checked the $100 that we paid with because we were black, made us walk to the bank with him because we were black, and then tried to make us walk in the private door when we got back to the store because we was black and he was wrong. I have a video but was not able to upload it so I attached photos of this. Needless to say I never tried the fool because they tried my soul. Seem like the food would be good but with racially driven staff I doubt it. We went to Tacolicious instead- got great food and service.

I have been to this place two times, on a weekend and on a weekday. The first time that I went there, I ordered a lamb salad. It was so good that I ordered a lamb salad again when I went there for the second time! I will definitely come back.
Nice healthy Mediterranean food. Not salty or fatty. Portions are pretty big. They have a nice patio in the back.
What a great find. Tasty, quick, wholesome real food at great prices in a terrific location. I would recommend going out of one's way for this fully satisfying food.

Souvla is a great place for Greek food. The line is long -- as if everyone was waiting for their turn at a Bank of Greece ATM -- but it doesn't take long for a delicious wrap with high quality meat and what's probably the Greek Heineken in a beautiful blue bottle. 

Seating is bar / communal table with a few tables along the side -- even when it's busy I've never had to wait to get a place to sit.

This place is terrific.  I went for the chicken sandwich (really a wrap), which was fabulous.  I also tried my friend's Greek fries, also excellent.  Really would like to come back and try the other sandwiches, as well as the desserts.  We ordered our food to go and it came out within 5-10 minutes, though this was not at a peak hour (around 2:15pm).
5 stars without a doubt. Best meal I have ever eaten in my life!  Soulva Chicken salad was beyond belief

This place is very small, loud, packed with people, and extremely busy for dinner. However, the line moved quickly and the service was fast. I ordered the salad and a chicken wrap. The pita bread was a bit sweet and the pieces of mandarin oranges were an interesting twist to your traditional greek wrap. The chicken actually tasted a lot like tuna.

Great food! Came here after a suggestion from the company I was interviewing with in San Francisco and the food did not disappoint! The chicken salad was composed of great ingredients which all came together to create a nice taste. The Greek fries were excellent, and my favorite would have to be the tart frozen Greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbles. Had a friend tell me to order this and it lived up to its hype. Would recommend anyone in the SF area to check this out!

Greek food with a twist. Good for lunch. 

I thought the food was good and pretty healthy, but not something I'd come back again for. 

You chose a meat and it comes in either a salad or a wrap. I chose FREE RANGE CHICKEN in a SALAD, and it was a filling potion.  My friend ordered LAMB and I thought that was tastier.  They also have a lemony rice soup, wine, beer, frozen Greek yogurt. 

Seats are FIRST COME FIRST SERVED so you have to awkwardly hover around tables that look like are finishing up. There aren't that many seats and I noticed a lot of people order to-go. 

You order and pay first at the front. 

Parking - street meter or residential nearby but it's usually pretty busy

I've been meaning to check out this place for some time now, and so glad I did a few weeks ago for dinner. It's super casual, yet there's still some ambiance as they dim the lighting and they offer wine. (It's a seat-yourself type of deal.) Be prepared to get a bit cozy with your company and neighbors, as it's a very small restaurant with limited seating. You won't have to wait for long though, as it's a place to just sit down for a quick meal (eat and get up within an hour). Perfect if you're already dressed down, and suitable for a quick bite before heading out somewhere. Salad was very fresh and well-portioned, though the pork was a little fatty. Next time, I'll have to go for the chicken or steak!

I get their Chicken Kale Salad for lunch all the time. It is consistently yummy. 

I'm not a fan of yogurt so the sandwiches always seem a bit dry to me. But the chicken salad is so good.

Also, the staff is super friendly and ordering takeout from their website is really easy.

First time was awesome. Second time definitely not, food lacked flavor, meats were dry and tasted re heated. Will return if desperate and starving. Such a shame. Always packed full of people and a line to order. Difficult to get a table once ordered to eat at.

I ordered to go, paid and... Somebody else got my order!!

Thanks for messing up with my order. 
Now I hate this place with all my heart. 

I told them that it's not my mistake so somebody else took y order but people don't care. 
Wait in line again and order again and PAY again!!

This food is not worth double waiting and double price

Got the lamb sandwich with Greek fries for lunch. It tasted decent even though the meat was extremely dry. Seemed like the meat was from yesterday and they fried it up. Fries itself were pretty good. They're crispy and thick. About 1 cm diagonal. The toppings on the fries did not add much.
Would best describe this as the perfect fast-casual dining. Fresh take on Mediterranean

Great place! This isn't authentic but still good. Had the sweet potato sandwich and it was delicious! It definitely needed some hot sauce but I would go back for it again. The fries were decent, but not memorable. 

The frozen yogurt is always good here!

Husband got the chicken wrap
I got the chicken salad
Both shared Greek fries

Perfect date spot. Gets busy but it's fast to have a seat once you order.

We ended it with baklava crumbles Greek yogurt ice cream

I've been to Souvla a couple times. The first time was for a mid-day meeting with colleagues. At my initial visit, it wasn't very busy since it was around 4 in the afternoon. We were able to grab a couple seats to enjoy their frozen Greek yogurt which was creamy, rich, and slightly tart. I had one with sour cherry syrup and my colleagues had the more popular one with baklava crumbs. I was impressed and vowed to return for an actual meal.

Last night, I went in for dinner with two friends around 7:30 PM. Fearing this was prime dinner hour on a Friday and that there would be hoards of eager San Francisco yuppies, we were prepared for the worst. Thankfully, the line wasn't too bad and we were able to find seating thanks to a family of three that was on their way out. (Seating is first come, first serve.) Every seat was taken and just like the city itself, all space is valuable real estate in a small space like Souvla! 

So how does Souvla work? You take a quick look at the paper menu at the door, and if you're like me you let your happy hour buzz dictate your ordering. That said, with gentle prodding from my oh-so-convincing buddy, I succumbed to wine temptation by ordering a pretty pricy glass of sparkling Greek wine. It was solid, but for a glass that rang up $12, I was hoping for more memorable vino. It was bright with notes of citrus (I'm being partly serious and partly facetious since I don't have the most sophisticated wine connoisseur palate.), but again, I didn't particularly feel that was a good value. Speaking of things not being of good value: the lamb sandwich ($13). Now, I know we live in San Francisco and with Hayes Valley being one of the hubs of bourgeois taste, I still have sticker shock for food that would otherwise be several bucks less elsewhere. The lamb sandwich comprised of chunks of spit-fired lamb leg, harissa-infused yogurt, red onion, cucumber, radish, and feta cheese tucked inside pita. The lamb was prepared well though it could've used more seasoning and wasn't as tender as you'd expect for its cooking method. The accompanying veggies and especially the feta cheese were nicely toothsome. However, I remember the sandwich served at room temperature which was disappointing when I was hoping for some hot meat in a warm pita to go with the chilled sparkling wine. 

The dining room is rather loud so expect to talk very audibly... or go right ahead and do a little shouting if necessary because it's a packed house if last night is like every other night. Again, seating is tricky here. We were eating for about 20ish minutes and 15 of those minutes, there were people literally standing next to our table peering over to see how fast we could eat and how quickly we could drink -- which made eating, at times, a bit stressful. When you can feel the weight of multiple eyes on your table, one cannot help but feel pressured. 

In all, Souvla serves up terrific frozen Greek yogurt but, for me, dinner and the ambiance were middle-of-the-road at best. Thankfully, with wonderful company and lovely friends with you, you're more forgiving of these things as you dine. Souvla is, in the words of Yelp, a solid "3-star, A-OK" joint: good, but not enticing enough for me to return.

I checked out Souvla for the highly talked about frozen Greek yogurt with baklava and honey crumble on top the other day after getting a luxurious mani/pedi at my main spot LuxSF across the street.  I definitely enjoyed my little treat, especially the yogurt part of it!  The crumble was OK, and for next time, I'd definitely want to check out some of the other toppings.  There's only one size option for the frozen yogurt as well as it's served in an 8oz cup. I definitely love the idea of frozen Greek yogurt, especially since there are so many dessert options in the area, having a healthier one is very welcome! I'll definitely be back to check out more of their food items too since that chicken looked delicious on the plates I was seeing come out the kitchen.

Good food generally but very sloppy operation for takeout. It's a shame because it could be great if they cared a little more.

Repeatedly messes up orders, don't count on receiving exactly what you want. 

Also sloppy on food.
-Meat often has bone/cartilage/tendon/excessive fat. -Salad often has the inedible base rib of the greens. 
-Dressing is basically 90% oil and they put too much - stick with the yogurt sauces (which are delicious)

The atmosphere was so nice there and the staff were really nice too. Most importantly, the food is decent! Love both the salad and the sandwich. However, the Greek yogurt ice-cream with olive oil and sea salt was a bit too interesting to try haha.
Thinking about making a weekend trip to SF just for the greek yogurt soft serve topped with olive oil + flaky sea salt

The smells draw you into this place. I did not have the opportunity to try any of their main items just got their Feta Fries. OMG it was so delicious! I was craving more after I finished it off. I am looking forward to my next visit so I can try another thing on the menu.

My mom got chicken salad + pork shoulder as take out, so I do not know anything about the service, but the chicken salad...
... IT CAME WITH THE SHARP BONE !! 
WHAT IF I SWALLOWED IT ?? GAHHHHHHHHH SO GROSSS 
I dont think I could ever go back to this place .. so disappointed ...

If I don't order Souvla at least once a week, I am not a happy girl. Souvla has the best Mediterranean food  in the city, hands down and there isn't a dish here that I don't like. 

I typically order the chicken sandwich, made with chicken, tangerine, kale and the most delicious pita you ever did taste. Just add in Greek fries and you're set for one tasty meal.

Ambiance: Cute little place with long sharing tables and some seating along the side wall. Gets really busy here, so give yourself time to wait in line and find a table.
