Service: You order at the counter then seat yourself. The cashier was friendly.

Food:
We had the free-range chicken, pork shoulder, lamb, and juicy potatoes. Loved them all! The potatoes could have used some more seasoning but they were yummy and there was plenty for the 3 of us.

10/10 modern take on a Greek classic. Roast potatoes served in the dripping from the spit with oregano, Avgolemono and the lamb souvlaki were all great. 

The ambience of the joint is nice, dimly lit, the decor very minimalist, modern and swish.  Staff are all happy and friendly. 

Only thing is it's kind of hard to see where it is from the street and it doesn't stand out at all with little exterior branding.

Okay. Listen. This place is perfection across all 5 senses. I got the lamb salad, so delish and plentiful. Everything is so adorable, from the coffee cups, to the serving bowls, to the aprons they wear, to the damn mirrors in the bathroom. They music they play in the bathroom is even too legit to quit! 

This is a place that I will forever swoon over.
Soooo good. Tried several items and loved every one of them. Seating is limited but don't let that stop you it's worth the wait

I love Souvla. The staff is really friendly and calm even when there is a line out the door. I had to get my most recent meal to go because it was noisy and packed in the restaurant. The vegetarian salad with white sweet potatoes, walnuts, pickled onions, yogurt sauce, and kalmata olives on a bed of romaine and kale is fresh. The sweet and salty combo from the cheese and the sweet potatoes is a nice twist. 

The food itself is excellent. They make the food how you want it and prepare everything fresh with beautiful presentation. I am obsessed with the Baklava Greek Frozen Yogurt. The gooey glaze that they place on the tangy yogurt plus the crispy shaved baklava pieces are divine.

Came here twice on a weekend! There wasn't much of a line and even if there is, it goes by quickly! However, parking is frikkin terrible around here! 

The first time I came here, I got the Chicken Salad which was scrumptious! I thought I'd let myself go a little bit and ordered the Baklava Green Yogurt for dessert :P That was sort of a guilt free type of dessert! I'd like to try their other flavors!

The second time I went back, I thought I should try something new.. so I ordered the the Lamb Salad which was not as good. The meat just seemed little dry so I'd stick with the chicken around here! 

I won't lie, their sambos and fries look deadly!

They did a super job with the little space they have. The restaurant is decorated clean with a modern Mediterranean feel.  It  has a pleasant atmosphere despite the tight seating. I thought I'd be wowed by the food but honestly it was just ok. The gyro sandwiches are wrapped in what seems to be a  home made thick pita bread . That sounds like it should be super good but the bread was too thick and had no flavor to it so it only added bulk and unfortunately added to the  dryness of the sandwich . We got one of each the chicken and the lamb sandwich . Both were super dry, begging for moisture which was not achieved from the scant sauce which was added in the middle of the gyro.  There just wasn't much flavor going on in the chicken gyro so I felt like I had to douse it with salt and pepper. They add orange slices to it which Also doesn't do much . The potatoes and the fries were excellent. It was a bummer we could not find any ketchup for the fries anywhere . There was only hot sauce on the tables which did not  complement anything .  The yogurt dessert was good but did not wow us. Overall it was just ok and pretty pricy -$58 for 2 sandwiches, 1 fry, 1 order potatoes, 2 yogurts, 1 ice tea and 1 bottled water . That's a bit steep for a seat yourself quick eat.  If you're ever in the South Bay, hit up "Nick the Greek" for a great tasting gyro meal - it is still my go to for tasty quick Greek food.

Pros: fast service, friendly people working there, tasty fairly healthy food. 

Cons: small space, limited menu - especially if you're vegetarian  

My wife had the salad with pork and enjoyed it. I didn't feel like the only vegetarian entree they had - grilled sweet potatoes and some other stuff as a sandwich. I opted for a small side salad and fries. They were both good though I'm probably not the only person who will be glad to see the fad of kale in salads pass. There was regular lettuce too but lots of chopped Dino kale. And I adore it cooked - probably have it twice/week. A guy working there popped by a tiny portion of their yogurt ranch sauce for the fries saying it was left over and he didn't want to waste it. It usually costs $1 extra. It was good, especially as a freebie. 

My favorite part of the meal was the frozen Greek yogurt. The yogurt itself was rich and a bit tart. Very delicious. We got one with olive oil and a little too much salt and another with honey. The olive oil and salt was amazing with the yogurt but it was over salted. The honey tasted good but was hard to eat when the honey got cold.

The salads here are the bomb! Food here is very fairly priced for the quantity and quality that you get. The salad is extremely filling and they are pretty generous with the amount of meat. You can't go wrong with the lamb or chicken salads!

The desserts here are also amazing - I think the baklava greek yogurt is also on the 7x7 top 100 things to eat if you want to knock something off that list. 

Expect a long line for dinners on almost any day. If you can get food to go that is even better, since there is not much seating inside.

In general, I'm not a huge fan of Mediterranean and Greek food and I don't necessarily love the idea of gyros. However, several of my coworkers had raved so much about Souvla that I finally decided to give it a try... and boy am I glad I did! 

I ordered the pork shoulder sandwich ($11) with a glass of the sparkling greek rose ($12) and man, was it one satisfying lunch! The meat is so tender and bursting with flavor and the creaminess of the minted greek yogurt and feta cheese coupled with the extremely soft pita bread was to die for! Also, the sparkling rose was perfect to unwind over on the hot afternoon. Perfectly paired. 

I highly recommend trying Souvla for a transformational gyro experience! It's a cute and small restaurant tucked into the heart of Hayes Valley - definite must-try. 

Happy Eating Yelpers!

Checked out one of the newer additions to Hayes Valley last night and really enjoyed it! Loved the casual welcoming atmosphere. I had the "veg" in salad form and it was so Delish! The combo of the sweet potato, cheese, and olives was really nice! My dad had the chicken wrap and also enjoyed it. We shared the juicy potatoes...these were amazing! So much flavor! 

I would definitely come back for a casual meal and would absolutely recommend it for the same. Fresh and flavorful - what more can you ask for?

This is our go-to for almost any kind of craving...casual mid-afternoon bite, drop-by dessert... Found the sandwiches to be tastier than the salads, and we always get the fries and a sampling of the frozen yogurt (the cherry rules but the baklava is a close second).
Never get tired of this place.

Ordered takeout dinner from here, so can't comment on the ambiance. The food was quickly made and fresh.

Roasted chicken salad - Salad had a good amount of free range pulled rotisserie chicken dusted with a mild cheese, mizithra (kind of like cotija meets feta) With the combination of ingredients, it was texturally too rough with the kale and fennel. Kale salads can be on the bitter side, but the orange slices and fennel didn't quite balance it in sweetness but stood out on their own. Chicken was pretty good and moist. I'd say it's on par with a Split Bread quality salad.

Frozen greek yogurt (olive oil and sea salt) - Yogurt is a soft serve froyo consistency watery and icy but still rich in flavor. Sweet, but not overbearingly so like Pinkberry or anything. The combination of sweet, salty, tangy and savory was highly addictive.

Healthy and clearly high quality eats, but kind of on the pricey side.

Was walking around SF on a hot day after a night out, and I think this greek frozen yogurt saved my life. It's thick and cold with a not-too-sweet taste (still enough to replenish your blood sugar ), so you can actually eat the whole cup without feeling weighed down. The baklava crumbles on top were just enough for some added authentic flare. Can't go wrong here- so refreshing.

The lamb wrap here was disappointing. The lamb was super gamey and some were really dry and almost chalky texture while some other fattier pieces were less dry. I also tried the pork wrap and that was much better. The pork was tender and the addition of the crunchy cucumbers was great. 

The highlight of the meal was the fries. They must triple fry them or something because the outside is so crispy and the since is soft. The fries saved the place from being 2 stars.

Where have these desserts been all my life? It was first time here a week ago and I'm still happily thinking about their desserts! The place was pretty full on a late Sunday afternoon, but the line moves quickly. I had to order the frozen Greek yogurt with the Baklava and it did not disappoint! The flavors were great and the texture of the Baklava was excellent. Albeit, a little pricy for frozen yogurt, but I really can't wait until my next visit for this lovely dessert.
I'm in love with their chicken salad. It is so amazing. They serve their Greek yogurt on a take out container that looks like the coffee cup you get in New York City. Very cute.

If you are in the neighborhood and don't make this a stop, you are cheating yourself! 

Probably the most delicious lamb gyro I've ever had...homemade pita and tender lamb.

They also have fun fro-yo flavors, which I didn't get around to - but really wish I had.

xoxo
lcf

I love souvla because it's always consistently delicious, the food is fresh, and the order is dependable. This location is incredibly busy, so I recommend ordering online and sitting in the park. But if you're lucky enough to snag a table, enjoy it because this adorable spot has an amazing ambiance that can't be beat! I always get the chicken salad and add sometimes add sweet potatoes or juicy potatoes if I've been especially active that day. The fries and froyo are also delicious! 

Salad hack: I sometimes order two side salads and a side chicken to go - thats 2 days of lunch if I'm not feeling like meal prepping.
Solid fresh cheap eats in SF which is a rarity. The line moves quickly and the wait is well worth the investment. Love that they understand their niche and don't have waiter service.

Came here with a friend on a Tuesday night. Got crowded/busy really fast, so seats were a bit hard to get. The frozen Greek yogurt was super delicious and the highlight of the Restaurant! Would definitely go back for just that.

Amazing food for an affordable price point. I wanted a quick meal before a workout down the street and popped in her. Got the veggie sweet potato bowl (full of kale and other yummy items) . It was flavorful, light, and less than $14!

Had the pork sandwich, was nicely balanced and tasty. Pita bread was good, and the pickled onions were quite nice. The pork was a bit dry on some pieces, but the fatty sections were extremely delicious, the Greek yogurt on it was quite tasty as well.

Holy smokes! The froyo is so so so good. Baklava was meant to go on froyo apparently. The salad was delicious, but I got mine to go and by the time I ate it there was quite a bit of grease on the bottom. Maybe it was because I got the lamb.
Great lamb souvlakia but the really big winner was the baklava ice cream and sour cherry ice cream. Great service and fast too.
We grabbed takeout for four and ate in the small park beside the restaurant. It was lunch on a weekday so it was very busy but our order was well handled. Tasty if expensive for lunch.

I have only eaten here once, but I was pleasantly surprised by the lamb sandwich (gyro). It was really good, maybe the best I've ever had. The ingredients tasted fresh. The price was a little higher than I expected, but considering the quality of the ingredients it seemed reasonable. A gem for the neighborhood and I look forward to coming back.

As other reviews mention, seating is limited so it will be hard for groups larger than 2-4 people.

Wish I had taken a photo of my food! Met up with a mentor here for lunch. We both had the pork shoulder salad (super delicious!) while chatting about business. Great service, casual atmosphere, clean and nice decor, quick to get a table, reasonable price in the area. There are hooks under the tables for umbrellas and bags! What's there not to love? Can't wait to go back!

Really solid faster food Greek place! I ordered the lamb salad since I heard it was amazing, which it was!! I little pricey for a salad but the meat was so good that I was okay with it. If you easy there, the do try to kind of rush you out since there is very limited seating and the place is usually packed around lunchtime so just be warned. If it's a nice day, I'd recommend getting it to go and having a seat outside in Hayes instead of in the cramped area.
Cashier girl is horrendous bad attitude and bad service please hire people who want to work

so far my favorite greek place in the city. 

you really cannot go wrong with what they have. it's simply amazing. i especially love their lamb salad. it's that kind of meal that you can't stop eating. you eat a huge portion. but you don't feel guilty about it! 

i definitely would recommend this place. and don't get me started and their yogurt. everything yes!! i could shed a tear for that creamy, richness.

Wowowowowowow Souvla has done it! AMAZING gyros AMAZING frozen yogurt. I have eaten my fair share of gyros, and Souvla serves one of the best chicken gyros I've ever had. Their fries are really good too. And to top it off, make sure you get some frozen greek yogurt with baklava. It is such a good dessert, my friends and I made sure to come back again for more while we were in the SF area. Great atmosphere in a great location.

In some cases the hype is for real - this is one of those cases...

The gyros (or 'sandwiches' as they call them) are not-your-typical gyros; the lamb was tender, had great flavor, and whatever it is they do to the red onions is a nice touch. The Greek Fries are a treat as well, of course Mizithra makes almost anything better...

It is a little pricey but worth the extra money. The interior is cool, staff is friendly - a great place to spend a little time in Hayes Valley...

I go here before/after yoga every week.  The salads and wraps are DE-LIC-IOUS!  The yogurt and greek wine are something you should consider too.  Everyone work works here is friendly and accommodating.  The only thing I would complain about is the cold metal stools...because after an hour and a half of yoga, no one wants to sit on a cold stool in thin wet yoga pants ;)  Other than that...THIS PLACE ROCKS!  I've eaten all over Hayes and this place is the fastest (sit-down) restaurant and the food is yummy every time!

I love eating at Souvla whether I'm eating solo or with a friend. The ambience is always warm and inviting with a clean, minimalist decor. The staff are always extremely friendly, and you will often find the owner (Charles, maybe?) working behind the counter or on the floor interacting with guests. I always applaud an owner who takes a hands-on approach.

The food... I really enjoy the simplicity of their menu. There are three meat options and one veggie option. They all come either in a wrap or as a salad. The salads are particularly amazing. The meat portion is very generous and the meat itself always juicy with great flavor. The chicken salad has mizithra cheese, pickled red onions, kale, and orange segments which create a great complement to the rotisserie chicken and an awesome balance of flavors.

While I've been less impressed with the greek yogurt, it still satisfies my sweet tooth fix. However, I come here for the entrees, the service, and the dining ambience. 

It does get crowded, and seating is very limited. There's always the option of eating down the block in Patricia's Green. 

Thanks, Souvla!

Souv-love. 5-stars because this place is consistently excellent.

Some debate the presentation of a dish is of utmost importance because one "eats" with his/her eyes first. When I order a Chicken Pita with extra meat and Greek Fries - I eat with my hands and off my lap.

Yes, the colors are great: the citrusy navel orange and pickled onion give a pop of color & burst of bright flavor that compliment the mizithra cheese and glorious "granch" (Greek Yogurt Ranch). There's a great balance of flavors in each heavy gyro. I admit, some of my friends think the sandwiches are on the greasy side, but the pita performs a superb and sinful role of saving the precious meaty juices.

The Greek Fries are, hands-down, get-in-my-mouth-right-now good. Ask for them inside the pita sandwich and drool at the sight of the holy harmony.

This food is ok. People over hype this place. I got a wrap with lamb and a side of fries and it is just like any other Mediterranean wrap I have had. For the price and the hype, I expected more. This place is just another Greek spot, nothing more than people make it out to be. I would rate this a 2.5 stars but that's not allowed.
My new fav lunch spot when I visit SF. The sandwich was out of the world w tangerine. A good cold beer w it, and I did not want to go back to work :)

Salad or Sandwich.  Salad or Sandwich.  *lines moving...must decide*

Seriously stresses me out EVERYtime.  I love the lamb - it's super tender, lots of flavor. 

The veggie salad is better than in the sandwich.

And definitely get the Greek fries.  

Love Souvla, it's so cute, food is always so good. Sure, it gets busy - but it's worth it!

Coming from Toronto which is famous for Mediterranean cuisine and its "Taste of the Danforth" Greek festival, I've always been disappointed in SF's greek food game. That said I was pretty excited to try this place but each time I've been here was a less than mediocre experience.

The toppings for the chicken wrap is a creative combination of flavors. The orange is a nice touch; however, they are pretty conservative with the toppings. And I can't say I'm impressed with the rotisserie chicken. I've had it a few times and it's consistently bland and dry which is really atypical for rotisserie chicken so I don't know what their problem is.

The fries are a scam. Avoid it. They're $4 and the description paints this picture of these fancy fries with olive oil, lemon juice, cheese, and parsley on it. BUT IT'S A LIE. You don't taste ANY of that because they only put on a microscopic amount (same deal with the wrap). It might as well be plain fries. So I ask a server about sauce and apparently it's an extra dollar. So then you have to wait in a big line again just for some sauce while your food gets cold. Then the $1 sauce is hella tiny, only good for like 3/4 of the fries even if you're a conservative dipper. If you're liberal dipper you'll probably need 3. And no, they don't have ketchup.

As for portions, they don't work for me. The wrap is too small and the fries are too big. I can't finish both but I'll feel unsatisfied after just the wrap. For $12 "fast food" I think that's unacceptable. And I'm definitely not the only yelper who feels the same way.

Another annoying thing about this place: it seems to always be busy and people are always hella gunner when getting a seat. I always see people sitting down without order numbers and I'm just standing around holding a number in a super congested area like an idiot, servers constantly trying to get around me. Look, if a place is full, you don't get to sit down before ordering. We've ordered. We need a place to eat. Wait your freaking turn.

On the other hand, the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is really great and that's really all I come here for.
My daughter brought me here this evening for dinner. The service was fast and the food, great. We each had the lamb/ hers in a sandwich, mine in a salad. I love lamb and the meat was yummy.

So happy to finally try Souvla today! 

The space itself is bright and clean, slightly giving a Santorini-esque vibe. 

My boyfriend and I tried the chicken salad, lamb sandwich, and a side of fries. Everything was delicious and tasted extremely fresh! 

Overall, great spot for a quick, casual lunch! I will definitely be back - next time to try their Baklava frozen yogurt!

Shout out to the super nice girl at the register!

Bomb.com lamb salad. The meat is moist and delicious; I have also had the wrap but the pita is a bit to much chewing- maybe lavash would be better than pita. Make sure you get it "Greek style" which means fries- yum
Dude at the counter probably is having a bad day but that doesn't mean he should be giving a sour attitude to paying customers.

How did I not know about this place until 2016?!? Souvla is one of my favorite new restaurants, and it's partly because of their greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and syrup. The yogurt is the perfect amount of tartness and baklava is just plain delicious so this combination made my tastebuds happy!

My first time going was a Friday night, and it was obviously pretty busy but my friend and I were able to get seats at the bar. Is it even a bar or just a serving station? Either way we got to see glistening meat rotate and cook only 5 feet away from us, which only made me even hungrier! I got the lamb wrap, and it was very tender and juicy. After eating the yogurt first, I couldn't finish my lamb so I had half to take home, and it still tastes good the next day! 

I was creeping a bit and seeing what other people got, and I have to say the salads at Souvla actually looked pretty good too. Definitely come here if you're in Hayes Valley, but try to come with just 1-2 friends or you'll have a hard time getting seats!
Great food ! I have lunch here all the time. The salads are really flavorful and they can put dressing on the side. The food is on the pricier side but it is very fresh and definitely worth it

I've tried both their sandwiches and salad bowls and have been impressed with their short menu but really great flavors. It's my healthy choice when I don't want to eat fried dishes. Their sandwich bread is really soft and flavorful. I've usually had the chicken option but I've tasted all and they are great! It's a small restaurant. Very busy most of the time. They have a small outdoor seating.

Souvla is so good, it put the other Greek spot down the road out of business. 

The are many reasons why this cafe/restaurant rocks, but it mainly boils down to:

1) THE DECOR: In typical Hayes Valley fashion, the space is adorably chic, minimalist and modern. It bears little resemblance to other more traditional Greek restaurants -- ornate carpets have been replaced with hardwood floors, clunky wooden furniture with industrial metal stools. 

2) THE FOOD: I've had the Greek fries (incredibly crispy and seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, oregano and mizithra cheese), avgolemono soup (basically egg-lemon soup with rice and chicken -- one of my favorite soups in the world -- though I will say Kokkari's version is better) and a lamb gyro (complete with yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onion and feta). The meat came right off the rotating metal spits on display and was so damn tender and flavorful. I've still got my eye on their brunch menu, Greek salads and Greek yogurt though ... next time!

Sadly, seating is limited. There's really only one large table which in my experience is usually occupied; the others are all tables for four, unless you opt for the bar seating in the back (but then as everyone knows you can't face your friends while eating which is a major bummer). Ah well. Think of Souvla when you want to catch up with 1-2 friends max and you'll be fine.

At 2:30 on a Saturday, Souvla was just short of jam-packed. I was lucky to arrive right before a fresh rush and to find a place to stand at a table outside to wait for my to-go order. 

My high expectations for the food were not met. Both the pork and the chicken were surprisingly bland - I agree with the nyt article where they had to add more feta to the brine. Additionally, there were some chunks of fat (not nicely rendered and tasty, just globby) & connective tissue in both the chicken and pork - a little of this is not a big deal, but it was excessive to me. 

The rest of the components of both sandwiches were quite good and interesting, although there wasn't enough of them to make up for the bland meat.

But, the fries were excellent, and the salad was pretty good.

I guess the restaurant's name, "Souvla," is a meat dish. It might seem silly that vegetarian me loves going here, but their veggie salad is really good.
It comes with roasted potatoes, this amazing yogurt sauce, and tasty salad things.

The first time I went there was for lunch on the weekend. The line was short, and I was impressed with how fast I got my food. 
I've also gone while it was really crowded, and sitting inside was no fun. It's seat yourself, and so folks are looming over your table, waiting for you to finish your food. Too stressful.
Luckily, there are some seats outside. Or, even better, you can grab your food to go and eat in the park nearby.

The owner here is so unfriendly, we have been there many times and he never gives us the time of day.The food is way overpriced and not all that.
Sit on the sidewalk and enjoy the view of the  ugly tree well full of garbage. Git rid of that thing, it blocks the sidewalk as well.

Can't get enough of this place! 100 stars if it were possible. Parking is easy in this area which is a huge benefit. Ordering online is extremely easy and everything is ready within a few minutes. Lots of yummy drink options with adds a nice touch to the food.

Naming something the "best Greek restaurant" in SF doesn't go lightly, but I would say that. 
Their gyro is simply un-reproducible. Their meats are brilliantly seasoned and the bread is crunchy but also warm - I need to go back soon.

We've been getting dessert to-go here for awhile now (sometimes coming cross-town specifically for it), and finally tried dinner as well. The key here is to swoop swoop swoop another table as soon as someone's leaving. With a line out the door and a small footprint, you gotta be fast.

-Veg Sandwich (4/5): sweet potato is the star here, and I'd eat this any day. The garlic in the yogurt is the strongest flavor; the other ingredients (myzithra, walnuts, pickled onions, kalamata onions, pea shoots) are pretty subtle but together make for a satisfying entree.
-Fries (3/5): the fries themselves are solid but the lemon is undetectable and the myzithra (which I love) nearly nonexistent. There's an herby flavor from the parsley. Nothing to write home about. Sadly the potato side is not vegetarian.
-Soulva Greek Red Wine (2/5): I'm not a wine connoisseur but it was pretty disappointing. The 500ml mug makes for two very generous glasses.
-Baklava Crumbles & Honey Greek Froyo (5/5): THIS IS WHY YOU COME HERE. Mmmmm soo good. The froyo is thick and tart, which helps balance the very sweet baklava and honey. If you ask nicely they'll give you extra baklava for free. Get it to-go and eat it in the park.

Honestly, if I were to rate Souvla based just on their salads, I would've just given 3 stars, but their Greek yogurt really bumped them up to a 4. 

The salads are a reasonable portion, but I still think they're a little pricey. It's like $13-15 for one? I had the chicken and my friend had the pork. They were SOLID, but for that price and the popularity, I kinda expected something that would knock my socks off. I ordered the chicken knowing that it was from their own rotisserie, but it had this dry texture even though it wasn't necessarily dry. Maybe it was the (excessive) dressing that made it seem like it wasn't dry. Aside from it not being anything spectacular, I got quite a few bits of bone in my chicken.. I didn't make any complaints or return it but thought I'd just mention that. Also, the chicken could be shredded in smaller pieces? I know knives are provided but I personally just don't like using knives in a bowl LOL. 
The pork in my friend's salad was a little on the salty side but I guess the flavor was there. Had that dryishness also. 

Now for the greek yogurt! It was the perfect dessert!! It was so delicious, you'll definitely like it if you like greek yogurt. The yogurt itself was super creamy and perfectly tart but still sweet! I had the baklava crumbs on mine and I honestly was worried I would run out of topping befoe I finished my yogurt, but there was the perfect amount to have it dispersed all the way! If you like nuts&cinnamon I definitely recommend this one. My friend got the wildflower honey and that was so aromatic! I recommend that one if you like floral flavors (: 

Overall, Souvla is super cool. I love the decor, it's super bright and clean and the workers are nice (they have cool aprons too). I could skip their entree items, but definitely recommend their greek yogurt. It's something worth coming for. Prices may be a little up there for what you get but it's SF so eh. Oh yeah, just a tip, the lunch rush is crazy. Everybody's there LOL. 4 stars.
Great  place for quick Greek food. The wraps are amazing, but the secret weapon is the frozen yogurt. It's all awesome.

Bottom line at the top: amazing!!
--
Came here with a buddy and had the chicken salad, lamb salad, and Greek froyo.

Everything was so light and yummy. I'm usually a beef/lamb fanatic but the chicken here is so, so good (must be the feta brine) and I liked it better than the lamb. 

Top it off with baklava and olive oil froyo. :)

The food here is good but I'm giving it only 3 stars because of a bad customer service experience I had when visiting the restaurant yesterday. After the woman rang up my order and I paid, I then went back to kindly ask her to put my dressing on the side for my salad as I had forgot to request this when I first ordered. Her response to me was "No I can't do that." At first I was shocked at her response so I stood waiting to speak to her again, and only when someone from the kitchen came out, luckily, did she then tell him I wanted the dressing on the side. I just can't believe how rude she was and how it left me a bad impression of this place. Too bad, because the food was good, but this woman's customer service was just terrible!

I've lived in Turkey and Greece for two years. This is not authentic mediterranean food. It's overpriced american fusion garbage. The meat is oily, the dressing is excessive, the pricing is completely out of proportion to the actual quality of the food. You can do much better with your money elsewhere.

Awesome French fries! Love the wine list also. Not a huge fan of the sandwich but the salad is great and the French fries and wine are more than enough to have me come back when I'm in the area for lunch..

Souvla is awesome. There's almost always a line out the door, and for a good reason. Even so, they don't keep you waiting for too long.

On different occasions, I got the pork, lamb, and chicken salads. I loved the pork and lamb salads. They have all the flavors a dish needs, the meat is juicy, and I definitely felt good with the food in my stomach. I normally don't like feta cheese but it was perfect with the salads. The fries are great, too.

The chicken was a bit dry, so when I come back I'll just come for pork and lamb.

I have to say I'm not a fan nothing is bad but nothing is real Greek to me. I love Greek food which we are clearly missing in this city. But this is Americanized Greek food with a fast food twist. It's like a Panera of "Greek food" while the baklava yogurt is great nothing here oozes that traditional Greek/mediterranean itch I so badly need scratched

I've walked through Hayes Valley a couple of times but this place has never stood out to me until a co-worker mentioned that they have very good food; I was not disappointed! I ordered the chicken gyro and we got greek fries to share with greek ranch. The combination of the chicken, orange and onions was great and I could tell the chicken was of good quality. The fries were amazing and I could've eaten the whole basket by myself! 

This is a small place where you order at the counter and it's seat-yourself. I would recommend take-out if you don't want to wait for a table but if you get lucky, it's a really cute place to sit and eat.

I'll definitely be back to try their greek yogurt that is so famous! After an entire gyro, you're too full to try that as well :(

Amazing salads! I've tried the chicken and the vegetarian, and both are healthy and delicious. I think they use Greek yogurt as a base for their dressings so it's healthier than a normal dressing. Their salads have the perfect ratio of kale to iceberg, and of each veggie/meat/dressing or other ingredient. My mouth is watering just thinking about their salads! I routinely walk one mile round trip from my office to eat their salads for lunch, because they are that good even though it's out of the way.

I've been here twice and I love it! I heard about it because my moms boss brings her food and raves about this place so I had to check it out. First off they have a clean hipster lookin vibe to it. The vibe is great. They amazing chicken salads here that you have to try as well as their Greek yogurt and Greek fries! What I love is that the salad is so filling I got fully satisfied both times! I recommend it to anyone. The parking sucks really bad and the meters are expensive but it is so worth it. The workers are really nice. 5 stars all around!

Tried Souvla for the first time the other night...  I was looking forward to it because I had heard good things from a few of my friends.  I was not disappointed...

I loved the look and feel of the place.  It so reminded me of the smaller little restaurants in Greece.  Bare floors...  Greek homey decor...  and not overly lit.  And although the music wasn't Greek, I did like the selection that was somewhat underground and hip.  In Greece, they would be playing music like that if they weren't spinning Greek tunes.  Of course being "hit" with the sight and smell of the delicious rotisseried meats was a big plus!

The food was delicious, and honestly, that was the most "home cooked" meal I've had at a restaurant in a long time.  The food is honest...  everything tasted fresh and natural and the choice of seasonings were perfect.  I had a lamb pita sandwich...  the generous portion of lamb was succulent.  It was complimented by a slight twist on tradition, which I believe worked really well.  Usually, Greeks will just throw on some tomato, onion and a big blob of tzatziki, but this sandwich featured cucumber, pickled onion (which I love), and feta, which was all held together by yogurt which was spiked with harissa (red pepper sauce).  The flavors were all complimentary without any one being overpowering...  just the way it should be!  Also, this was served on what appeared to be a homemade pita!

For my side, I chose the Juicy Potatoes, which were roasted and coated with the meat drippings!  A little herbaceous spices gave the dish even more character.  I thought this was a great alternative to fries, as it reminded me of my yiayia's potatoes, (yes, I am Greek).  However, the fries that I saw looked amazing, and I will try those next time.

I topped that off with a cold Greek beer, which with the food and the atmosphere, brought me back to Greece.

And as if I wasn't full enough...  I'm just a glutton for punishment, I had to try the frozen Greek Yogurt...  which I topped with Visino, the Greek cherry syrup...  yep...  my journey back to Greece was complete!  Cold, tangy yogurt topped with that deliciously intense and sweet syrup just completed the experience.

Kudos to the staff who are all very friendly and helpful!

Once again, I will stress the quality of the food here, both of the food and in its preparation.  I walked out feeling satisfied that I had a nourishing and gastronomically fantastic meal.  I will be back...  I haven't gone through the whole menu yet!

Souvla is located in a great part of town; the food is great, and the ingredients are all so fresh-however the portions are small. A must try, but beware it is incredibly hard to find parking, but then again it is SF.

Ordered the lamb sandwich ($13 before tax). Pretty generous serving of lamb, tasty & flavorful too. The sandwich comes in a pita wrap with feta cheese sprinkled on top, and it was pretty filling - no sides needed. One star off because it was way too greasy, it came in a pool of oil which I had to soak up using napkins... :(

I love Souvla!! The storefront is adorable and food is amazing! I always get the lamb salad, I need to branch out but it's so good I don't want anything else! One day I'll get a sandwich, but I just love how much food you get with the salad! Just try not visit during their busy times. It's crowded AF and they don't put as much love into your food when it's busy.

A must try! (if you like Greek food)
I have to admit I only tried the Veggi Sandwich to go, but I'm looking forward at going back and trying out the Lamb.  The sandwich I had was well made, full of flavor and the service SUPER quick.  I took mine to go and from odering to being on my way was less than 5 minutes, and this was at lunch time.
Great place to hang out for lunch with friends . The fries and the chicken wrap was delicious with the garlic sauce on the side . The lamb gyro bowl was amazing too

I found an unexpectedly healthy, fresh meal at Souvla- I eat paleo, and it was the rotisserie chicken that beckoned me in the door. We ordered the chicken and lamb over salad, requested dairy free and got no sideways looks from the friendly gal ringing us up. No problem. What came out was salad with kale, lettuce, some fixings and a pure olive oil dressing with herbs. Completely dairy, and grain free. The meat was exceptionally juicy and flavorful.

Love Souvla!

A great salad is hard to find. Especially great salads that are fresh, healthy, filling and SO delicious not to mention cheap. I go there at least once every other week and sometimes twice in one week. I'm a creature of habit going for either the chicken or the sweet potato salad and Greek style! Love their rose, too.

They get crowded and because it's open seating, it's hard to find a seat so go early or get it to go!

Mmmm! Are you in the mood for something casual, straightforward, fresh and healthy? 

Souvla has a simple menu (do you want that in a sandwich or in a salad?) and flavors that are just about perfect.

Their veg salad, served in a big, white enamel dish with a navy blue rim, is hard to beat (try it even if you're not a vegetarian.) 

Their frozen yogurt with simple toppings is worth it: I like the one with olive oil and salt but have also been known to devour the one with baklava.

Final note: the servers and people who work in the kitchen are so incredibly nice and go out of their way to accommodate you.

I did enjoy my food but agree with everyone else that it is overpriced for what it is....

We got there around 7PM on a weeknight and was able to snag a table. Our food came out quickly (Shared a chicken salad, lamb sandwich, greek fries and greek yogurt). 

Everything tasted great but I couldn't help but feel robbed that I spent $60 to seat myself in a corner and have food come in 10 minutes. 

I would go back for the greek yogurt, though! Such a tasty treat.

Amazingggg food!!! So fresh. Great flavors. Pretty healthy. I had the veggie salad and added chicken, the lemon soup and the Greek yogurt. Big portions. Great spot to come with friends or family. Great ambiance.

Great quality! Stopped in from dc with some friends and came here for a quick bite and it's surprised me with more. Great atmosphere, lighting (I'm huge on lighting lol) and AMAZING food. Had the lamb salad and my friends all agreed their dishes were great. Along with the wine

Stopped by here with some friends after a volunteer event. My friend was raving about how much she loved the yogurt with baklava crumbles so I definitely had to try that. 
One cup will cost you $5, but it was actually really good! 
I usually am not a fan of tarty food, but this was really palatable and went really well with the baklava and syrup. Really wish I had another to munch on!
Will definitely be back to try the food!

Really appreciated the interior design of the place. The outdoor seating, while minimal was really nice and would be a great place to talk with a few friends or a date. Inside reminded me of a really decked out homely kitchen.

The yummiest salads, Greek fries and Greek yogurt. The staff is always really friendly and happy.
Filipe is the man ! The manager is always really out going as well but I've forgotten his name. 
Best service available with quick, yummy and inexpensive bites. 6 Stars if I could.

If you haven't been to Souvla, you definitely should. At least if you're into Mediterranean cuisine!

They have a straightforward menu: salad if you're watching your waistline or gyro (sandwich) with either pork, lamb, chicken, or sweet potatoes (for you veggies out there!). You can't go wrong with any of the above.

Our party of three each got something different: I had the chicken, my friends had the pork and lamb. We all really enjoyed our sandwiches, though mine was a bit greasy at the end. My friends also split a side of Greek fries, which they enjoyed, but I thought could use a little more olive oil. The Greek fries I've had at other restaurants are usually drizzled in a good amount of olive oil (it helps the cheese and herbs stick!), but if you're not into that they taste perfectly okay, with a sprinkling of parsley and mizithra cheese.

All in all, you can't go wrong here!

This place was good. You can tell everything is made with fresh ingredients. I had the lamb gyro but they call it a sandwich. The fries were decent. All in all, for not being a traditional Greek place it was a good clean Greek restaurant when trying to be healthy.

I'm not sure why there are so many high ratings.  The food is ok, but definitely not worth the price.  I had a lamb wrap, fries and a beer and the total was $25.  Holy crap.  

The plus - the lamb wrap wasn't the pressed gyro meat you normally see on the spit.  It was actual lamb, so that's a plus.  

Be prepared for sticker shock.
Love Souvla. Fast service, great, healthy food. If your not into healthy they have soft serve, fries, baklava. Haven't had anything here I didn't like.
This is typically my pre-Rickstop Shop/Davies bite to eat. Tasty all around, nice portions, cool interior vibes, and cheap.

It's good for Greek fast food in San Francisco, but it's really disappointing compared to food in Greece.

I ordered the lamb sandwich. While they were generous with the lamb, it felt like my sandwich was mostly pita and meat. The feta was good, as were the cucumbers and pickled red onions. The only thing is that there wasn't enough of any of it to make the sandwich more evenly balanced and interesting. 

My husband got the pork sandwich which did have more evenly dispersed cucumber and even tomato(!!), but the pork itself was lacking.

We got a side order of fries which were good. The honey Greek frozen yogurt dessert was delicious!

Overall, it's worth trying, but I'll be continuing my search for good Greek food in the city. 

TIP: If you get there by 6:30 pm, it's easy to get a table. After that you're likely to wait in line.

This place is always packed. Every time I walk by it. Of course I decided to try it out on a Saturday. The one nice thing is that the guy at the register warned us that the food comes out quickly so we might want to find a seat before ordering so that we weren't standing around holding our food waiting for a seat. I really appreciated that! The veg salad and the lamb salad were great! 

This place is small, but the service was good and the good came out quickly. 

I am looking forward to returning and trying one of their frozen yogurts.
This review is so meh based on take-out not the actual dining-in experience I ordered the chicken salad. Definitely plentiful and tasteful

Amazing spit-fired meats that you can get in a salad or sandwich (gyro)! I had the chicken sandwich and my girlfriend had the lamb. Mine was amazing!! So juicy and amazing flavor. It tasted so fresh and the pea sprouts and citrus gave it a unique artisanal flavor. The lamb was great too with its own unique toppings. Can't go wrong with the Greek fries either... mmm garlic. I have yet to try the frozen yogurt but am excited to give it a taste! It also looks a bit unique.

Not only was the food amazing but so was the decor! A sweet industrial chic interior and I couldn't stop looking around as I was eating. It was the small touches that got me pumped--the plates, small carafes of water you can bring to your table. Next time I go I'm definitely taking a pic. I'm a sucker for cool interior design. All around quality! I would def recommend this place!

This place is legit. Fast food w/great service and fresh ingredients. I had the chicken salad and it was big and yummy. The place is small or "intimate."  There is bar seating outside for about four people total. Back to the salad--- a little different on a Greek take, actually not sure that it was really a Greek salad but it was good. The chicken taste like rotisserie; it had romaine lettuce and kale; there prices of mandarins in the salad; and it had a type of yogurt dress along w/ some olive oil and what tasted like cijota cheese. Again, it was like Greek w/ a twist. Oh! And the frozen yogurt was a nice, creamy, and smooth!!
Can't get an order right. Messed up the food And drink order. Food is whatever. Way too busy and in friendly staff.

My friend Jimena recommended me to try this Greek restaurent so we ordered a delivery to home. I ordered a Superior Farms Lamb Leg wrap that comes with Harissa-spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onion, feta cheese and lamb. It was goos except that the whole wrap was very oily. The type of bread used reminded me of Manaeesh from back home, which was delicious. Along the wrap, i got side of fries that were really good as well (wish the quantity was more though) and the Greek Sour Cherry yogurt which is the best yogurt i have yet to try. That yogurt is the bomb and super delicious! Definitely recommend to  get it. Total price was around $22 which is not too bad. I was impressed by this restaurent and would definitely order more next time.
The chicken in my wrap was way overcooked.  Given the price, the line and the tiny room, not worth it.  Won't be back.
Their vegetarian wrap is so beautifully planned and assembled. It feels like such a treat to eat. Their greek yogurt with anything is to die for. This is my go to spot in Hayes Valley.

Goegeous decor, wonderful portion size and a fresh new take on Greek. The sheer amount of take out should say something about this amazing little gem! The simple walk up ordering was perfect...I highly recommend!

Souvla is a high quality modern twist on your typical Gyro places in the city. I've been going to this place and have been meaning to review it. 

Here is a concise list of pros and cons for an easy read:

Pros:

Clean and Modern Decor
Easy Menu and Ordering Process
Very Tasty Lamb
Very Tasty Chicken
Fresh Veggies
Salads are a good portion.
Olive Oil Yogurt is excellent 

Cons:

Expensive 
No Free Sauces to go. 

Overall the place is very beautifully designed and makes a very tasty wrap/salad. The staff is friendly but the food is on the expensive side. The frozen yogurt is very high quality and the food comes out quickly. This place gets a 5 star rating because the food is that perfectly seasoned and tasty. If it weren't for that the place would be 4 stars.

Hands down one of my top three favorite places to eat in the city. It's so unique, healthy and fresh - there's nothing else like it. The chicken then rotisserie in-house is amazing. I always go for their Vegetarian Salad (add chicken) cause the sweet potatoes are so good. Plus a side of Greek fries. And no way will you be able to leave without the Greek frozen yogurt and sour cherry sauce!

met with a friend i hadnt seen in quite some time at this place, so i guess souvla will always hold a bit of a warmer place in my heart :')

hoo-whee this place is poppin. and for reason too. i would love to spend my evening staring at the spits of chicken and lamb slow-roasting in the coaxing, relaxing heat, in such a warm and charming restaurant painted with beautiful grecco white and blues. the fact that they also have alcohol definitely makes it a place for lovely ambience.

to the food! doesn't take too long to prepare a sandwich or a salad, thankfully, despite the long wait ahead. that's a definite plus. 

i ordered the chicken salad which, by name, seems so incredibly plain. but by golly having those slices of orange atop the wonderful mizithra cheese? quite good. they dress a bit heavily, but the "granch" was pretty tasty! i was disappointed by the chicken tho. dry, no permeating taste. i wonder if they brined or marinated the chicken at all before roasting them. if so, none of that imparted on the chicken, unfortunately.

but O K A Y that greek yogurt is from the shining fields of elysium themselves. a huge serving in that all-too-familiar, always-so-endearing anthora cup. and gee whiz the baklava crumble? bury me in it. i am happy.

im so sad i didnt get to try more of the toppings for the greek yogurt. geez id wait on line for just that greek yogurt alone. i'll miss u souvla.

Oh My GAWWWWD!!! I wish I can give this place more stars!! Best chicken mediterranean salad I've ever had hands down!!! The dressing they use is Greek yogurt which was perfect!! The Greek fries were amazing alongside Greek yogurt dip! I completely understand why the long line everyday! If you are trying to dine in during the week for lunch try to be there by 11:45 am the latest and you should be able to grab a table. Too bad the line was too long for us to order a frozen Greek yogurt but that gives me a great reason to come back!!

A little overpriced but the food hit the spot when we needed it the most! Sad I missed out on the frozen yogurt, but will definitely get it next time. Made a pleasant discovery as well with the Greek soda!
We stopped in for a late lunch and ended up fighting over every bite, the lamb sandwich, greek fries and greek tea were all exactly what you want them to be.
I love Souvla. It's simply amazing. The only thing I would change is that I would make their lamb a little more lean. I always get their lamb salad and I love it!!

Yogorino used to have the same yogurt!!! I was heartbroken when they closed in SF, but now I can be happy again that Souvla has the same yogurt. And they top it with baklava and olive oil! A better topping simply doesn't exist. You have to like plain greek yogurt to appreciate this place though. I will be back for a shwarma soon!
Super bustling and busy. Great food that came out quick with a cute atmosphere and great interior finishout.

I love Hayes Valley and this cute little place. 

It's a very small restaurant but you can get seated fairly quickly. I've been here dozens of times but have only ever ordered the salad. The salads are filling and very large. My friends have ordered the lamb and chicken wraps and rave about them. 

You can't leave without trying the frozen yogurt; my favorite is sea salt and olive oil. I know it sounds weird, but promise it's absolutely delicious. My brother was hesitant, but ended up trying the sour cherry syrup and really liked it. Surprisingly, it doesn't taste like cough syrup.

Good spot.

This place is pretty good all around - the food is pretty darn tasty, the place is cool and slick inside, the wait staff are friendly and hip. We got the baklava yogurt, which was delicious and chicken salads, also yummy. 

One down side is that wait for a table during high time. We waited for a table before ordering, which worked for us - most people got food and stood there eating it for a while first - we weren't into that.

This is a cute little spot in the mission. I read so much about the Greek Fries, that I finally headed over to try them and wasn't disappointed! 

For $5 you get a decent quantity of french fries, that are uniquely seasoned. For an additional $1 you can get any of the three dipping sauces- I got the "granch" which was refreshing and went well with the fries.

More like 3.5 stars - 4 stars for food and shaving a little off for price. The chicken salad is really good and fresh. The chicken is juicy and the sauce is a really nice lemony yogurt. However, I feel like you can definitely make this yourself at home and save yourself $15 on a small bowl of salad. That said, the Greek yogurt is amazing and something I crave often. Both the baklava and sea salt flavors are drool-worthy. And unless you know how to make yourself a fancy homemade Greek yogurt, this is worth getting. I'd come back often for the yogurt, but the salad will be an indulgence when I'm too lazy to put my own together. 

The vibe is great at night. It's a dark dining room, kind of a bar vibe. Fun to meet up here.

So yummy!!! BAKLAVA GREEK YOGURT! 
Will be my must have every time I'm in San Francisco! 
Sweet, tarty, crunchy, salty, creamy
Lamb salad, hot sauce, sweet potatoes, pita.  My #1 order on Caviar.  Work or home, half an hour or so. The chicken salad is also fantastic. What a time to be alive.

growing by leaps and bounds (good fast casual), sandwich is ok, pork was a little dry, maybe rotisserie chicken is better but large portion.  many come for the fro-yo, a throw back to the first days of pinkberry, with the nice tartness, and good combo with baklava and honey.
I love it! I tried the lamb salad~ Best salad I've ever had! The outdoor seating is also lovely at night!

I've had both their Greek frozen yogurt and their vegetarian "sandwich", which are great. The sandwich includes sweet potatoes and olives wrapped in a pita. I will try the Greek fries they're known for next for sure.

Not that Souvla really needs more reviews to prove to you it is worthy of a visit.  It's always busy, so be prepared to wait in line or call ahead for takeout. 

The lamb salad is my favourite, tender meat and leafy greens! Large portion - I was able to save about half of it for lunch the next day and it was still delicious and not soggy. The fries are also amazing!

The best part may be the frozen yogurt! Generous portion, rich flavor but not heavy. I get mine with honey and my husband swears by the baklava.
Veggie salad and baklava frozen yogurt IS TO DIE FOR. Honestly everything is amazing and staff is so nice. I bring all my visitors here!

I'm dreamy for this place! Whenever I pass through Hayes Valley I try to plan a stop here. The chicken is juicy and roasted to perfection. This is what I recommend:

Chicken pita sandwich. My favorite! Savory and sweet with citrus, herbs, pickled onion and "granch". Make sure to keep a napkin handy the chicken is a touch greasy. Put the homemade got sauce on it, it's Soooooo good! 

If you want the salad version of the chicken get the dressing on the side or it'll be a lot (at least for me).

The side salad is solid. 

The Greek frozen yogurt with black cherry syrup is ridiculously delicious. 

Potatoes sometimes amazing sometimes okay.

The sweet potato pita sandwich is really great. 

Pork is alright and cooked to perfection with a hint of mint but not my style. 

The lemon chicken rice soup is quite tasty but could use more chicken.

I love the food here!

I was surprised there was a line out the door here, but it smelled so good I decided to wait. Glad I did! The chicken salad was huge and fresh and delicious, the juicy potatoes really lived up to their name, and the frozen Greek yogurt with honey was tangy and the perfect texture. If it hasn't been so dark out, it would've been great to eat in the park on the corner. I'll be back.

I've stayed in Greece for 3 months and been to quite a few Greek festivals and this place captured what the Greeks have perfected Lamb on a spit. Little bit pricey but if you are hankering Greek eat here.
This review is for the Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt exclusively because I am obsessed! Perfect flavor combination. It's worth going for this alone.

Came here with high expectations, but left dissatisfied..

Maybe it's because I actually real Greek food as in Greece..

Anyways :
-pita was cold and tough 
-chicken and lamb was dry and not well seasoned

Overall, did not like the Greek food here, only thing I enjoyed was the fries.. 

It's on the pricier end too ;p bleh

CHECK YOUR BOX CONTENTS BEFORE YOU LEAVE SOUVLA !!! ....  Souvla takes your order, money, then gives you a box. Be sure to open your box before you leave the premises. ....   Just got home with a box that turns out to be a salad, not the sandwich I paid for. So we won't be adding our shadows their line again.
Their salads hit the spot. They are so fresh with great roasted meats and the perfect crunch. Don't forget to order the frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles.

This place used to be awesome. We order from there a few days a week and lately the quality is just declining. Feels like they don't really care anymore and it's just sloppy. I ordered a salad today and it was just so poorly made. I ate three bites and threw it away. Hoping they put that original care back into the product. Otherwise, we're going to have to find a new go-to.

I heard a lot about this place from my friend who lives in Hayes valley and we went there for lunch in a day when I was starving! Ordered chicken sandwich for me and a chicken salad for my friend with a garlic fries. The sandwich was okay, it was not as delicious as I heard about it. But the portion is really big and generous! The fries could have more garlic and the salad was okay too. The environment is cozy but crowded, but the good thing is you don't feel uncomfortable although it's so crowded. The only thing I didn't like about this place was they charge you to refill the tiny sauce for fries!!! In general it was a good place for having lunch and the price was affordable!

Finally made it here today. Saw them on Infatuation. I got the chicken sandwich and the navel orange in there blew my mind.  I guess I skimmed it when it was listed on the menu. A couple of bites in i got to the orange bits and it was great! I also got the greek fries which were also awesome thick cut fried well season with cheese and some herbs. Do not leave without getting the fray with baklava on it! probably my favorite froyo I've ever gotten. Also tried greek beer for the first time here. Definitely coming back every chance I get.

Pros: delicious everything, and huge portions (even the salads). The meat is juicy and good amount is given. It's hard to finish! The greek yogurt sauce is a must. 

Cons: no space to sit so if it is cold outside, good luck. And given it is a place that is a healthy, upscale fast food place, people should not come here and linger around 30 mins after their food is done as others just stand around waiting for a table.

Meh, salad was good but the dressing wasn't , the lamb isn't your traditional lamb you want at a Greek place, was expecting a "shawarma" style, and it was more like a stew lamb. So overall I wasn't impressed.

Very very good chicken gyro & fries.Ask for (pay$) for greek dipping sauce,one fry is enough for 2 to share. Food is very unique, different than others, very small, location, may have to wait for table or share table. frozen greek yogurt is very good.

The vegetable sandwich is the perfect balance of sweet and savory! Service was quick, and seats tend to churn quickly even if they're full when you arrive. They also are kind enough to give you dessert later so your Greek yogurt doesn't melt.
Absolutely LOOOOVE this place!! Go greek style - you won't regret it! ;)

Hayes and Kebab is under renovation until 2016. The Hayes Valley go-to Mediterranean fix is no longer! Thank goodness Souvla popped up in time to fill our hungry mouths.

The line seems intimidating but it moves fast. Even during a quick lunch break I can order take out and not have to scarf it all down. Noshing on the yogurt helps pass time too. Yogurt toppings are tad on the sweet side.

There is not a single item on this simple menu I would not recommend. Honestly it is hard to not love roasted meats no matter chicken, pork or lamb. Soulva wins at making an interesting salad. It is not simply tossed together with some "mixed greens" but also includes fruit, pickled flavors and nuts. The best part of all is that you can walk away feeling great after eating!
Very yummy food, super cute place! We had the chicken sandwich, lamb salad and fries. All of them were exceptionally tasty! I will definitely be back next time I visit San Fran!
A great salad! Its simple but oh so good. Don't even get me started on the fries. YUM. Super good take out option for sitting in the park :)

I got the Greek fries with garlic sauce on the side and wish I'd had a bath tub full of them. They were perfectly crispy and well seasoned. I wish the cheese was melted on instead of just sprinkled on after, because it ended up just falling to the bottom. I want to come back to try their food and Greek yogurt. Loved the decor and vibe too!

Delicious, fresh and speedy food complete with friendly, fast casual service. No complaints from my end. In addition to all of that, the interior is cute and beer and wine options are limited but good. 

Menu hack: there are four different salads (lamb, chicken, veggie and pork) and you can add any meat to any salad. My go to is the veggie salad with lamb. It has white sweet potatoes that are nothing short of spectacular.

Delicious everything - sandwiches, salads, soup, and frozen Greek yogurt - and friendly service. Order your food "Greek style" if you want fries in it! Small seating area inside (always warm from the rotisserie ovens) and a few counters outside are cozy. 

Tip: Order online if you want it b/w 11:30 and 1 - there's always a (well-deserved) line.

2 star for service. It should be 1 but the food is good. Late night 11/8/19. All we wanted was a quick frozen yogurt to go. Light are on, door is wide open and welcoming, we go to order and extremely rude employee filled with attitude says they are closed making us feel like idiots when your door is open! Incredibly inhospitable and makes me want to make sure I wait in line at salt in straw instead of give my money to you. Your employees are terrible. They're not great during the day and they are worse and have horrible attitude and service at night.

Souvla is the combination of so many things I love about food. Greek cuisine paired with fresh ingredients, unique flavor combinations, and quality meat makes for an amazing meal. I had the chicken sandwich, which is essentially a pita wrap, and it was one of the best Greek wraps I've ever had. The pita was toasted perfectly for a slight crunch on the edges, while still chewy and thick. The chicken was taken right off the rotisserie, and the grill flavor paired really well with the fennel and pickled onions. The mizithra cheese and the navel orange slices really pulled it all together, and it added an unexpected twist to the wrap that brought California flavors to traditional Greek food. Their Greek fries were also great, with a good portion of crispy, fat fries that were seasoned and drizzled with a little cheese. Without a doubt, Souvla has become one of my favorite spots in the city!

I particularly like the atmosphere, decoration and location of the place - and this new brunch offering in addition to its famous roast meats only makes it more perfect! Even though the choice is not huge (four meals and four beverages) everything they do is nicely presented, freshly made and simply delicious.

We chose the lamb sandwich and the greek toast. 

The lamb wrap comes with scrambled eggs, radish, tomato, onion, avogolemono, garlic yogurt and feta cheese. I looked around in the restaurants - the majority of people ordered this dish and everyone was quite obviously very happy about it. 

The greek toast (pieces of crispy sugar and cinnamon dusted pita bread) is served with sour cherry syrup and frozen Greek yogurt - I promise it is the best! Overall, I saw only empty plates going back to the kitchen - and that is always a good sign!

In comparison to other brunch places in California, the portions served here are relatively small so you can easily pick two dishes if you are very hungry or share three between two people. Prices rank between $9 and $13 and these are totally reasonable.

Also great about this place is that we only waited for 5 minutes to order and be seated at Souvla on a Saturday morning at 11am, which is really unique in San Francisco. Make sure to check it soon before the crowds hear about it!

I used to dine here weekly... sometimes twice a week.

Came here after a three week break to find a 20 percent price increase on the pork salad. Plus about 30 percent less pork in my salad.

I am not motivated to return.
This place was soooo delicious!!! I enjoyed every morsel of each thing that we ordered. The lemon soup is absolutely velvety cooked to perfection.

Only been here for the Greek yogurt (which is amazing with the baklava) and wine but I'm sure the food is just as great! Finding a table is sometimes a challenge because it's usually always busy but I find this place to be a perfect stop to pick up something sweet while you're walking in Hayes Valley.

So good I went three times in one week.

There's usually a line, but totally worth it. Get the french friends! They're on point.

Souvla is a restaurant that makes me love living in San Francisco!!! I've been in maybe five or six times and had all three meats off the rotisserie.  Each better than the next.  
The potatoes in the drippings are so good. 
Fast simple food that tastes great. Tip... Sit at the bar and watch the meat spin... There needs to be a tv station of this rotisserie spinning.  
Bravo!

Good food, nice service, and quick too, but the seating area is really small and cramped and the portions are small. Because of that, I'd treat it as more of an appetizer spot than actual meal.

If I wasn't as hungry afterwards, I'd give this more stars.

I love this place. I visited this cute little spot while at a conference, and wish they had one in Philly! You must order the chicken sandwich, and the frozen yogurt with baklava and honey. They are to die for! I also really enjoyed the greek iced tea.

Came by on a gorgeous Sunday - brunch time.  Good looking place.  Bright, clean and inviting.  Lots of good looking roasting animals but unfortunately, I didn't care for my selection.

2 stars - AMERICAN HOMESTEAD PORK SHOULDER salad - good portion size but I felt pork was not very interesting.

3 stars - SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG - this flavor I felt was definitely better than the pork.

4 stars - GREEK FRIES - yum!

4 stars - STRAUSS ORGANIC GREEK YOGURT (which is only served at brunch)

I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but if friends wanted to dine here, I wouldn't refuse.

I stopped at our lunch break at this place with my friend, place is med size, limited menu, food tastes good, little crowd but I guess it's normal for SF during weekday, my friend ordered bowl lamb with potato and bottled tea, his bio was almost 23$ he was upset kinda lol other then that good place for quick lunch/dinner :)

The veggie salad is really good if you're okay with a lot of olives.  The yogurt they top it with is really great and not overpowering.

The fries are pretty good too.  Not a lot of seating so we went home and took it to go.

Thanks!
Only tried the Chicken Wrap. It was made with fresh ingredients but just overall super bland.

Lamb pita, hot sauce...
ex Thomas Keller alum.
Olive oil yogurt!

Wow - this place really nails it! The menu is simple (essentially chicken pork or lamb salads or sandwiches, along with fries and frozen yogurt for dessert) but they have their flavors absolutely dialed then. When dining in and ordering from the counter, food comes within mere minutes. And I can't even count how many times I have ordered delivery from this place--I have yet to get tired of their salads. The space can be a bit noisy, and it's not really the type of environment that invites you to linger over your meal, but it can't be beat for a quick meal or carry out.
Dope. Totes delish. Frequent stop for high quality fast eats. Highly recommend. Can't say it enough

I LOVE the food here! The salads are fantastic. Be warned, the place is tiny. If you want to sit down you probably will have to scramble a bit, definitely couldn't sit down with more than 4 people. More of a takeout situation.

Got the lamb sandwich and was kinda disappointed, honestly.  The flavors were fine, but the lamb was a bit on the dry side - not what i expected from lamb leg.  Tried a few bites of my girlfriend's chicken salad, and that was really good.  Gonna have to try the pork next time.

Tried the pork shoulder salad and it was very good. The meat was a little fatty, but flavorful. The portion was huge! I had tried their chicken salad from Forage, which was also really good. I haven't tried the frozen yogurt but will do next time. Will definitely be back!
Wish it wasn't around $15 but damn the lamb salad was so good! Loved the service too, the man at the counter who may have been the manager was very friendly. Was very cute inside as well.

Best thing here has got to be the frozen greek yogurt! I got the one with baklava on top and it was so delicious, probably my favorite frozen yogurt I've ever had. Definitely worth more than $5! Also, very good with olive oil and seas salt.

On the other hand, food is good, but not
Great. I had the pork pita wrap sandwich and it was really bland. I was excited for the mint yogurt, but the mint taste was not detectable. Some sauce on the side would really take this up a notch. Also, the pita bread they use isn't anything special. Using a fresher/fluffier/softer bread would make this much better as well. Pickled onions were a nice touch though!

I recently tried the salads and think they are much better than the wraps, especially the veggie salad!

The line goes by really fast, so don't be discouraged by a line out the door. Indoor seating is limited, so I recommend getting food to go!

As many other Yelpers have explained, I also dont think this is truly Greek food, it uses similar flavors and ingredients and does a great job at it but i can see how someone would be disappointed if they were expecting Greek food. 

I had the chicken sandwhich and it was quite tasty, I went after the rush so I enjoyed my meal inside. The place is cute and the staff was very friendly. I will def try their greek yogurt with Sea Salt next time, as it was reccomended by a friend. Also their fries look yummy!!

I will def be back :)

Very good Greek food. Quick and friendly service. 
Recommended - pork shoulder sandwich, lamb salad, fries, yogurt
The creamiest one!  Delicious! We ordered 2, honey and olive oil drizzle. The olive oil one is certainly interesting, and the one with honey is sinfully good.

Ordered pork salad. Incredible, a great amount of pork with the salad. One of the best salads I've had in a long time. Big portions so worth the extra money. Had rose wine as well which was a great. Staff were super friendly. Accidentally brought me out a salad for sit in and I ordered to go, was corrected very quickly. 10/10 recommend

Fantastic place for a relaxed, delicious dinner in Hayes Valley. Beautiful decor, lovely staff and super good. Very impressed!

We had the renowned Sweet Potato Salad but added pork for me and lamb for my friend. Just perfect :) 

Right balance between good ambience but not too loud to talk. Perfect for one on ones and groups. Great location. 

Couldn't have asked for a better experience, will definitely be going back to try other things!!!
Amazingly delicious!! Great atmosphere too! I had the pork pita sandwich, Greek fries and their to die for frozen Greek yogurt with cherry sauce.

The costumer service here is awful!!! I made a mistake of ordering online to the Divisadero location as I was in a rush during my lunch time. But I needed the Hayes location. I showed up at Hayes and told them I would just pay here and do a new order. But they took forever to let me do that and after the manager came and finally agreed I was able to order and get food. I called the Divisadero location asking if I could get a refund for my order that I had tried to cancel and they told me it wasn't possible. This is extremely disappointing as I don't think it would cost them a lot to just cancel my order and refund my money. This shows very poor judgment in management. I like the food but I doubt I would go back here again. Such a shame.

Ever heard about Greek fast food? Yeah,I had Greek fries,veg sandwich and Harissa Yogurt all served in quick 5 min.And Dont walk outside their door without trying the yogurt.They also serve garlic,"Granch" and mint yogurt. Yogurt varieties aren't mentioned in menu so ask the server.

Seating is family style so just grab an open seat,even if it is on the same table.

Sandwich isn't that filling.Greek fries ok too.Service is super fast.I got mine in 5 min.

Despite its steep prices, I appreciate that Souvla is a hipster casual spot with fresh ingredients. The high bar stool tables, natural lighting, and rotating racks of roasting meat create a bright, soothingly clean atmosphere. You order at the counter and take your number to your table (no waiter service).

- Pork Shoulder "Sandwich" ($10): Sandwich = wrap. Also, literally everyone else here ordered a salad and I felt the judgment as my unnecessary carbs arrived, but no regrets! The ingredients are incredibly fresh, and the standouts are actually the vegetable pairings (pickled onions, tomato, cucumber). The wrap itself was fluffy and seemed to be house-made.

- Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Flakes & Syrup ($5): I haven't had much baklava in my life, but the stuff here is delicious! There was just the right amount of syrup to top it off. The yogurt itself was unremarkable. It comes in the iconic "We are happy to serve you" Greek paper cup!

Souvla is a trendy spot for lunch in Hayes Valley and definitely worth a try even if you aren't a fan of Greek Food.

Great salads ! Must try the french fries w. yogurt. 
Make sure to order a cold glass of white wine.

This place was surprisingly packed on a Tuesday night around 8pm and surprisingly trendy. I was not expecting that type of ambiance for a Greek restaurant, but I guess it is Hayes Valley after all. The restaurant is small so it's a little difficult to find a table; it's also pretty loud and dimly lit.

I liked that they have a simple menu consisting of 3 different meats (chicken, pork shoulder, lamb) and a veggie option in the form of a "sandwich" or salad and sides that include fries with olive oil, lemon juice and cheese, roasted potatoes, and Greek salad. They even have froyo - I really wanted to try the one with baklava crumbles! But I already planned to go to Smitten that night for my ice cream fix haha. I ordered the pork shoulder sandwich, which was delicious! I mean I was STARVING from the gym so that might have been part of the reason I was practically inhaling my food, but I still think it would have been really good. The meat was tender, the sauce was good, it had a perfect amount of cheese, and the bread was so soft. I'd definitely order it again! We also ordered the fries and salad, which were okay. The fries would've been better if the cheese was melted instead of just loose because most of it doesn't stick and ends up falling to the bottom. The salad was good, but had a bit too much olive oil. They also serve wine and beer here!
Aw... the Sweet Potato Salad is now $2 more. Sigh, Hayes Valley.

Don't call your self Mediterranean please!!!! You are insulting me as a middle eastern and so as others . Trying to be different ???? Doesn't work . Yes menu was simple but not appealing at all . Way overpriced for salad that has a lot of lettuce and a couple of pieces of meat. The rest forget about it. Would I come back ? No.......
.

Oh my goodness. We randomly picked this place when the bar we were planning on going to had a large line and we weren't patient enough. They were about to close but had no problem taking our order. We all ordered a gyro. I had the lamb, my fiancé had the pork. I've never been overly fond of lamb but this was the best lamb I have ever had, period. I could not get enough of it and wished they were still taking orders because I would have gotten a second one in a heartbeat. I also tried the pork and chicken gyro that we had at our table and they were all delicious. That tzatziki sauce they made was awesome and went really well with the fries and gyro. 

My only regret is this place isn't in Seattle.
Very large menu. Salads bar are tasty. Pork may be a little tastier. Very friendly and attentive service.
Amazing Chicken Salad Definitely Coming Back!!! The greens were fresh and the chicken juicy!! I got it with hot sauce on the side but wow great work
So far our favorite place to eat in our San Francisco adventure.  My wife loved her salad and the pita wrap with real cubes of not-ground lamb was heavenly.  Not to mention Greek froyo!

I really enjoyed this place! I really loved the chicken gyro as it was so good, and I also loved the frozen yogurt desert at the end! My parents and my brother also tried the other gyros of the different meats, and they seemed to enjoy the different varieties of meats of the different ones! I think that maybe I should try the lamb gyro ext time as I tested that one out from my mother, and it tastes so good and delicious! This place definitely deserves 5 stars for its good quality!
With four options that can be easily transformed from a pita wrapped sandwich to a salad bowl (for the gluten free crowd) everything is tasty

We have been back several times since and the salads have gotten a WHOLE  LOT better. Game stepped up! I'm super glad for this. There were a couple of times they were either a bit too wet/soggy from tasty warm meat juice or the kale was dry/not massaged. There is substantially more stuff in the bowl as well, which is very nice. 

I am still a little nervous to try the  lamb, however, the chicken salad is amazing deliciousness. I think I am going to give the lamb another shot on our next visit. 

If you are in the area and want a filling, delicious, satisfying meal I would totally recommend coming here. 

Also, use the hot sauce and get the sparkling water. :)
Good, not great. Relatively inexpensive, good portions but pretty bland and unoriginal- which isn't a bad thing. I've been 10-15 times and have no problem going back, but I don't go out of my way

If I could give this place 6 or 7 stars, I totally would!!! I'm from Chicago so we have our fair share of Greek/Mediterranean places too but OMG! This place jumped straight to my number 1 spot! So I had the Greek chicken sandwich with their Greek fries. The sandwich was better than anything I've had here; the chicken was cooked perfectly and their "granch" dressing is out of this world.
