It's make for an amazing dipping sauce for your fries! Make sure to get your own cause you're not going to want to share as far as I'm concerned. This place will be on my "must go to" list anytime I'm in San Francisco. I can't even imagine what some of the other items on their menu taste like!!!

I can't say enough good things about this place. Vilerx the cashier who's almost always there is always so sweet and kind. The service is so fast and efficient, not to mention the food is so amazing!!! If I could give this location 10 stars I would. My coworkers and I come here at least once a week and we never get tired of it.
One time I was eating on the table outside and someone bumped into my plate and spilled it everywhere. Very narrow tables outside but the chicken salad is a party in your mouth.

Absolutely delicious food. I got the lamb salad and the meat was cooked to perfection. The dressing was delicious and they give a very generous portion. The atmosphere is really cute. Great for a date night or dinner with friends and family. The wraps look delicious too. Will definitely come back.
I had lamb over salad. Meat was very tender and delicious. Portions are hearty. Overall everything was just great. Little pricey but definitely worth it. I will try chicken next time.

The best med food I've had in the Bay Area. Lamb da which was juicy and flavorful. Fries are thick and of varied crunchiness. Granch dip is top notch.

I'll be making this a regular.

My favorite neighborhood spot! Mix and match the salad set ups/meats. Get Greek style (fries on top) for an extra 50 cents. Get the Greek yogurt. The veggie setup is a teeny bit salty for me (maybe better without olives) but the various other setups are all tasty AF.

Was not too keen on the idea of having Greek yogurt as a dessert but my friends were stoked so I decided to give it a try and I'm so glad I did!  The yogurt was sweet, creamy, and slightly tart--so simple yet so delicious.  We got the version with crumbled Baklava sprinkled over the top but I could've enjoyed it even without the extra toppings.  

I also tried the lamb gyro but was not too impressed by it.  It wasn't bad but the lamb was missing the charbroiled flavor I'm used to.

By FAR my go-to restaurant in SF. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Personal fave is the veggie salad. The decor is top notch as are the people working there. You absolutely must get dessert too. I really love the greek yogurt with olive oil & sea salt but I hear they are all amazing. Seriously if you go to SF and don't go to one of their 3 locations (hayes valley, the mission or divisidero) it is your MAJOR loss!!!

Returned to Souvla, but this time to try a dessert! Today, I got the Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup. It was so so good!! The yogurt is plain, creamy, smooth, neither bitter nor sour nor sweet. Almost like milk in that way, I suppose. It's delicious. And then that topping. Wow! So amazing. The baklava and honey syrup is very sweet, as you'd expect, but if you can control yourself enough to take little pieces of the topping on your spoon to pair with the yogurt, you'll enjoy a beautifully balanced dessert. I'm curious to try out their other flavors!
I can only recommend the gyros from my experience. The meat is always tender and the fixings on point. My only disappointment is lack of seating, otherwise solid lunch spot.

Fresh, fresh, fresh ...tender spitfire roasted meats, cute nicely decorated cozy warm atmosphere ..so delicious! Outstanding flavors. I love this spot we needed an amazing Greek food place like this in SF. I hope they stay in business for years to come.
One minute reviews: It's about as overhyped as a stag do in Mykonos and just about as bland.

I am obsessed with their Lamb Salad! Best lamb I ever had in a period of 30 years hands down. Love yogurt dressing too. I now crave this salad all the time so we try to come in every week to demolish it. Mr usually gets Chicken salad with side of roasted potatoes (huge yum!)- and claims they are identical to what his Yiayia used to make for him back when he was cute Greek baby. 
There is always two guys working, I assume they are owners and may be siblings?- kiiinda  friendly but could come across a bit snobbish:) not exactly your loud Greek diner owner type of guy. 
Lovely interior too. Very trendy with cute rustic elements.
Great pork shoulder salad! The friendly girl at the counter gave me a sample of the frozen Greek yogurt, which I can't wait to try with the crumbled baklava the next time I return!

If restaurants were like dates, Souvla would be the whole package.  Attractive, tasty, and charming to boot.

The superior farms lamb leg pita was by far my favorite -- such incredibly tender, flavorful morsels of perfectly sliced meat completely stole the show.  But also strong in my mind is the way the flavors of Rocky Jr. free-range chicken, navel orange, pea shoots, fennel, pickled red onion, and mizithra cheese came together to elevate the humble gyro to a new level.

Don't forget to try the wine.  If you've ever had Greek wine and perhaps been disappointed, now is the time to try again!  The selected rose and white offerings are delicious.

And yes, there is a dessert worth trying too:  frozen Greek yogurt.  The crazy thing was all of us each liked a different flavor.  I went for the indulgent Greek olive oil with flaky sea salt, while my companions swooned over the sour cherry syrup or baklava crumbles.  For once, something for everyone.

So I mentioned taste, but what makes Souvla the whole package is that it's also also got a great vibe and attentive, down-to-earth service.  In fact, I think this is the first time I've ever been comfortably seated in a place with artistic decor while eating a gyro.

In short - Souvla, this is just the beginning of a long relationship!

Ever since I discovered Avgelomeno Soup in my first San Francisco neighborhood years ago, Ive been OBSESSED. So I was more than excited to try it here on my first visit. it did NOT disappoint. IMO soups like these are every antidote to a chilly or stressful city day. Not that this day was that, beautiful warm and sunny and lunch with my BFF since high school. Just sayin. The salad was ok, I didn't like the meat actually. I think I ordered pork. It was kinda tough and chewy. The juicy potatoes were addictive and the greek bottle of white wine we ordered was fantastic!! and a good white is always a challenge to obtain in my experience. Yay for another great dining option on Hayes. oh and Good service too! Love the little patio out back.

Ok I have to say I was skeptical at first but I really like this place. I am a sucker for lamb. I mean the cuter the animal, the more I want to cook it and serve it in a sandwich. And they do a good lamb shoulder. Tender cuts, deboned and well spiced. All the seasonings are great, nothing over the top (like it's not just covered in mayo or yogurt). I actually enjoyed my meal. Now the part that is sort of my weak spot ... the frozen greek yogurt. So far I have only had the baklava and the olive oil & sea salt. I have to see they are both great combos and depending on the mood decides which I get. Sadly I have been sick so I have been avoiding it. But it's tart and fatty and even though it's cold out I don't give a crap I am gonna have it. I think it's well priced for the area, and it's relatively quick for what it is. 

The people running it are really friendly. Like everyone has a smile on their face and it's like one of those places where you actually see that the people involved actually like working there. Like not just a forced fake smile.

Layout of the place is awesome too. Like the communal table, is a great idea. The outside & inside bar is awesome and nice looking. The only thing that's weird about the layout is ... where to wait to order or for your order. There are two places to order and people walk in and get confused because they are located at the entrance (where the indoor/outdoor bar is) and the other at the other end by the display of rotisserie chickens. I think I know what they are trying to go for, but I think people are not going to figure it out so they all sort of stutter by the entrance trying to figure out what to do.  I know it's new and I am sure they are figuring it out, but I mean so far that's it's only flaw. I am a fan.

Souvla!!!  How can one little restaurant transport me instantly back to my vacation in Santorini, even in cold/foggy San Francisco?!??  

I can't stop eating here, it's so easy and yummy!  My absolute favorite is the vegetarian option as a salad, I literally crave that white sweet potato.  It's amazing.  Top that off with a Greek fro yo with some baklava toppings and you literally can't go wrong.

Rumor has it that Souvla is a concept restaurant looking to open in additional markets.  Can you PRETTY PLEASE come to Burlingame??  Efharistó!
LOVE SOUVLA. The chicken pita with hot sauce is so good. The food is quick and the people are friendly. Definitely a must try!

Drip drip drip.

One of the funniest things ever: youtube.com/watch?v=h5sX…

One of the most disappointing things ever: Finding a huge and repulsive puddle of oil or grease or fat or whatever it was forming on my plate below my chicken wrap.

Trying not to be too picky or unreasonable asked my dining companion if she discovered the same thing and what her reaction was. Answer was yes and gross.

It's too bad. Rotisserie chicken had such promise and the wrap with orange accents was quite good. However no meal should leave you with regret. Especially an $11 lunch.

Returned to see if other things were better. "Rotisserie dripping" coated potatoes and the Strauss froyo with sour cherry syrup topping were good but guilty pleasures.

Irritating on the latter was the indifferent staff member made it well before my takeout order was ready which meant it melt quite a bit before leaving. Slight but important miss.

On a positive note the former Sebo is unrecognizable. Clean and airy redesign with the rotisserie focus was impressive.

Unfortunately the food was as much of a mess as R. Kelly.

Love the concept as greek staples like roasted chicken and lamb, in their traditional Mediterranean preparations, have been been under-represented in the fast casual segment.  Unfortunately, I think the execution at Souvla misses the mark and under-exploits the potential of these foods.  

On the positive side, the ingredients are high quality, the service is fast (a line extending to the street moved very quickly), and the environment in the restaurant is pleasant.   My wife and collective had the chicken sandwich (essentially, a souvlaki), the "juicy" potatoes (prepared under the chicken drippings), and a lamb salad.   The meat was a little dry.  Dry meat and bread is a bad combination in any sandwich.  More critical, I think, was that -- across both the potatoes and the sandwich -- was a missing "herb-iness" that is essential to Greek cooking.  The potatoes should have been bursting with oregano and lemon flavor, when in reality it lacked both save for a insubstantial scattering of oregano.  Same with the sandwich.  The chicken should have been rich with a garlicky, lemony, oregano-ized marinade, but it tasted fairly plain.  It's a real lost opportunity as both the meat and potatoes should have been rich in flavor.  Instead, everything was kind of bland.

Overall, the place is a little disappointing and I probably wouldn't return here.

Great Brunch! 
The YIANNI'S LOUKANIKO  was so good, going back soon!
Great food, I love this place. But please switch to a different delivery service! Caviar is terrible - the food never comes, when it does it's cold or they screw up the order.
very cute place to eat! it looks really good! i only came for the greek yogurt with baklava and it was really good! i reccomend!
A little too trendy and hipster for me, but the food was okay.   For the price, offer a little more food.

OK I'll proudly take "1st to Review" because I attended the Opening Preview Party! 
We have known Charles Bililies, sole proprietor of this bomb establishment for years and he has always talked about his dream of opening his own place. That day has finally arrived. For those that don't know, Charles has worked side by side with some of the world's most famous culinary talents, including Thomas Keller himself and he's worked at Bouchon, RN74, Michael Mina and most recently at Kokkari (one of the highest rated restaurants in SF for years). In short, the man is ambitious, knows food and is now bringing it to you in his own concept. 
Souvla is a hip, unpretentious establishment. It's design is simple with a large community table and tables for smaller groups. It is tastefully done and beautiful to look at. It definitely makes you feel like you are in Greece, which is a welcome addition to the many cultural motifs throughout the city. With the exception of Kokkari there aren't many Greek places. As you walk in you'll see the Souvla oven by the front counter. Here is where the magic happens. Chicken, lamb, pork and sweet potatoes make their rounds over an open flame, slowly searing in juices and flavors. All of them are to die for. You get your pick and they are stuffed into a Gyro with amazing sauces and condiments that you won't find anywhere else. 
The menu is fairly simple but there is beauty in simplicity here. You won't agonize over choices and do not forget to get the Greek fries. They are utterly fantastic.
Souvla is perfect for the casual diner and even those looking for serious food without the fuss of a more formal restaurant. It's a perfect place to pick up a Gyro for the park close by or a night at home or a fun time in the restaurant. I'll see you there!
Hands-down the worst Greek food I ate in over 10 years: overcooked meat, no spices, luke warm. No thank you.

Really tasty, well priced souvlaki and chips. I always have the chicken salad and it's very tasty. As someone who has eaten a lot of Greek food, it's dumbed down a little and it's not the best I have eaten- but it's great when you want something quick and easy. 

Could really do with some Greek classic starters, where are the dips and pita? Olives?

Try the yoghurt, delicious.

Ambiance: five stars. It's dark and bustling at souvla, with a wall of revolving roasting meats dripping their delicious nectar of melted fats as you watch and wish you were one among them in that rotisserie kingdom. Except alive and not a dead hunk of lamb.

Honestly I thought my lamb wrap was kind of dry. It was large, yes, but lamb was mainly too tough, and the rest were fairly standard Greek ingredients. The supposedly famous potatoes were disappointing. Generally just oily, they lacked both unique seasoning and any sort of desired texture beyond fluffy carbohydrates.

Maybe I'll try the Greek yogurt. Good casual place though.

Just left from a delicious lunch here. I had the chicken salad and it was so tasty and the ingredients were so fresh.  My friend got the pork gyro - and while it was a bit messy, she ate every bite.  We also got the fries and got one of the dips. My only wish was that I still had room to try the greek frozen yogurt.

I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
I like their chicken bowl salad, refreshing, delicious, satisfying stomach. The outdoor space is great for lunch

For hours after I ate a chicken bowl at soulva " that was so good, I feel really good" I would kill to learn the what herbs are in the oil dressing, I have eaten at many Greek restaurants this was by far the very best herbs and oil. The chicken also easy the tastiest I have had. LOVE THIS PLACE FIVE BIG FAT STARS

You know how it is when you have a taste for something specific, but you've tried just about every restaurant and haven't yet been satisfied? Well, today was my lucky day. As usual, I was scanning the screen looking for a place for the perfect gyro. What to you know? Up popped the name Souvla, a brand new Greek restaurant in S.F. Was this meant to be? 

Not quite understanding whether or not it had opened yet, I headed over. The Gods of food pointed me in the direction of Hayes Valley. Oh, no. not my lucky day. CLOSED for pre-opening party. Standing at the door, with my tongue hanging out, the owner Charles, welcomed me in to enjoy lunch on him. 

I was definitely not disappointed. I tried the lamb gyro. The meat was delicious...succulent and well seasoned, with a mix of crunchy veggies and sauce. The gyro was thick and toasted. A side of the Greek fries and I was hooked. Unfortunately,  it was lunchtime, so I didn't indulge in any of the great wines on the list. However, it would have been the perfect accompaniment. 

Yes, all the stars were perfectly aligned. All in all, everything about this place is great. Simple and to the point. Hopefully, there will be take out. The perfect grab and go if you don't have time to relax and enjoy.

4 Stars for food/2 stars for extremely incompetent service

Their food is relatively good.  The potatoes are to die for - if nothing else, go here for this.  The pork salad is decent - I didn't eat much because my order wasn't accurate.  I'll amend this review when I'm dragged to this place again.

I placed a to-go order.  My food wasn't ready for a while - acceptable.  It came out as a dine in order, was taken back to a to go.  Came home, found my salad doused in onions after I specifically and repeatedly asked for no onions (which my server confirmed when reading back my order).  Called to speak to someone about it - their phone number is completely automated. 

Definitely left a poor taste in my mouth (the onions didn't help).  Let's hope the next time is better.

The meat is extraordinarily tender. I got the lamb salad and it kept well in my fridge for several days after. The salad almost had too much dressing, but it was very tasty. Will definitely eat this hear again.

The food is great. I've been here several times and planned to come back. However, the service proved itself awful today. I was hanging out with a friend. We both good full meals. After finishing our meals, we kept sitting and hanging out and working on our laptops. One of the waiters came up and told us we have to leave if we won't be ordering any more food. The place wasn't even full. I understand it's not a cafe for hanging out, but this attitude left a bitter taste in my mouth. My friend and I both will not be coming back and we were regulars.

I've had every salad and this place is consistently amaaaazing. Ideal for my lunch break. Filling, great quality, always on point. Friendly, effective service. Outdoor seating is great on a nice day, and there usually is a free and cleaned space to sit for a late lunch. THE LAMB IS SO GOOD. Highly, highly recommend.

After trying this place 3 times, I can confidently say it is a 5 stars lunch spot! Delicious pork and chicken salads. Prices are reasonable considering the location and quality of food. It is now in my rotation of regular lunch spots!

What a wonderful little spot. Haven't had a lamb gyro this good in years. Tons of meat. Seasonings were perfect. And the potatoes......like my grandmother's.
Friendly service, great food, and not too expensive. For those of you who complained about the price, I suggest you price a good leg of lamb someday, and then go buy another $15 hamburger.
Last...It's really immaculate. I'm no prude, and have had some great food in real greasy spoons, but eating in a nice clean place is still really enjoyable.
Gonna be a regular at this place.

I have been here about 10 times. The first 8 times were great, even though the food is expensive, it was worth it because the quality was great. 
The past 2 times I've gone the service is still good, but the meat was dry and the pita was too! Those are the two things that really set it apart to begin with. I won't be going back until I hear they've gone back to their old ways.

This place is AMAZING! I've had almost everything on the menu and it is always good. 

Best thing to happen to Hayes Valley in awhile.

It is very clean and cozy inside! The food is delicious and healthy! The location is perfect is in the center of Hayes Valley! You will like to continue exploring this area! Staff is also very friendly and positive!

My sandwich was bathing in oil. It had so much oil that it dripped on the table. I realized too late that half of my sleeve was drenched into kebab oil. I do not recommend this place: the food was also almost cold when it arrived.

On the picture, you can see the oil that dripped from the sandwich on the right of the basket, on the table. The other half was in my sleeve...

Charles, the owner, took the time on both the food and the design when he opened Souvla. All of the salads and pita wraps are juicy and delicious. I am personally a fan of the lamb with pita and the chicken as a salad. Greek yogurt is tangy and tasty as well. I had it with the cherry syrup. 

This is a wonderful addition to Hayes Valley.

and a half.

Can not deny the strength in the concept and can not deny the intelligence in not having servers to drain your coffers however the food quality does not seem to be there....Id guess this is low end lamb and I am annoyed by the fact that the yogurt is from a cow when greek yogurt would never be from a cow. Its as though the authenticity bit is just gimmck whereas if it  was carried out in the food, it would be much better. Plus if you get the lamb salad without the fake yogurt they put nothing on it and its like dry old lamb with chard and lettuce and radish without any flavor or anything to bind them. In a city where many dont consume cow dairy(scary stuff!) to not offer another topping seems aggressively not giving a poop.

So delicious and so much food.  There's always a line out the door but they moved quick and our food came out fast and hot and oh so so good. Definitely need to try the Greek yogurt with baklava topping
I like Souvla a lot! Food is delicious and prices are reasonable. Perfect for a quick dinner date. It's always packed, so you better plan ahead!

Souvla is a great value for the neighborhood, everything was made fresh, the pork sandwich was perfectly seasoned, as were the garlic fries. Location has indoor and outdoor seating, with dog friendly seating by the sidewalk.
Got the lamb and chicken sandwiches. A little bit on the pricier side (vs. other greek gyros places), but quality was definitely up there. Would love to come back and try their fries.

Excellent food -- both the sandwiches and salads. Don't miss the hot sauce or tangy Greek frozen yogurt. There can sometimes be a line so if you are getting the food to-go I recommend ordering it online which is surprisingly fast.

The waiter was just horrible. Served me with a plate I didn't order and refused to give me what I did order. The chicken in the salad could have been anything else. Just disgusting. This is absolutely a place I'll avoid. Mainly for the messed up service.

Dropped by on a Sunday afternoon for some take out. Service was great, although I only ordered one thing, it was excellent. I can be very indecisive so upon the recommendation of the cashier, I ordered the vegetarian salad with lamb, greek style. Greek style = salad with fries on top. When I got home 30mins later, the fries were still crispy (success!!), and they were quite delicious. The salad was huge, and I saved more than half for lunch the next day. Love the sweetness of the sweet potato and the saltiness of the olives in the salad. Definitely a good balance. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!
Wonderful and generous lamb salad with greek cheese and interesting dark greens.  Really friendly staff and gorgeous ambience.  Thanks.

I was really bouncing back between giving this place four stars or three stars. But In the end, I always give my ratings based on whether I would come back. Sadly Soulva doesn't succeed with this form of evaluation.

Let's start with the good: the meats that this place cooks are exceptional. I haven't had such tender lamb or pork in a long time. They have a rotisserie in the back so you can see them roasting their chicken which is just as good. This place is also in the hear of Hayes Valley amongst a lot of restaurants and shops so it's one of the better parts of town.

However... if you are going to be a place that has a limited menu (w/ high prices!), you really need to make sure said items are exceptional. I got a sandwich and a salad. I am not a big fan of pita to begin with, so maybe this was the issue, but I seriously felt that pita was the only thing I could taste with each bite. I don't why it was so overpowering. Like I said, the meat is delicious so I actually found myself pulling out the meat to enjoy it rather than sacrifice the taste with the pita. The salad was not that much better. The harissa dressing wasn't bad but it wasn't exceptional either. I think the thing that bothered me was the fact that it wasn't really Greek, it was a kale salad with the dressing and then the meat. Granted, this place is more Greek fusion (first place of its kind that I have tried), but still it wasn't too spectacular. The fries also... It seemed like the only thing different than regular fries was the additional of some grated Greek cheese, I mean come on, really? I also tried the soup, which actually wasn't bad, probably the best part of the meal...

Maybe I am just super picky because I have been to some amazing Greek places (see my past reviews) and also this place is more Greek fusion as I said earlier. Unfortunately, this concept needs to be more refined by Soulva, especially if they intend to keep a limited menu... Part of the reason I docked this review down to three stars is because I am already bored.

Chicken sandwich: orange and chicken is a great combo! Dry though.

Lamb sandwich: overall pretty good. Had better. 

Pretty pricey for food that didn't blow my mind

Another example of taking ethnic street food beyond it's humble roots to match the the demands of high rents and hipster trendiness. The result in this case is delicious, with the Lamb souvlaki and avgolemono soup both winners, albeit at a high Hayes Valley price point, with the lamentable trend towards long lines, counter ordering, after which one must scramble for a seat, elbow to elbow with the luck of the draw. As an ethnic Greek, the real way to enjoy this food is with leisurely stretches camped out at tables for hours while while waiters ply you with inexpensive dish after dish, not cued up and rushed out like at Starbucks, so that's why I've taken off a star, and why I won't be a regular,  but it's still worth a visit for the quality of the food.

Overpriced but great-tasting food with excellent service. The place is very Hayes Valley. I recommend getting the "sandwich" version of any of the meals as the "salad" option is not filling. 

The yogurt with crumbled baklava and honey syrup is a delicious $5 treat.

Good portions but $$$. 

Other reviewers were right, poor crowd control staff and absent minded patrons sitting, chatting, sans food,  taking up space in a place that can not regulate their own 'system'. Because you have to wait for a table before you order, they up-sell you on a glass of wine, when may be you didn't even want one. Go either early 6 pm or 9 pm. Otherwise, forget it. 

Get TO GO and don't bother with the chaos. Although, there is another Mediterranean place just around the corner.

PS there is also NO protein on the only veggie salad.

One of my favorite places in the city! The food is absolutely delicious! I haven't tried anything I didn't like. My only complaint is that there is barely any seating for how crowded the restaurant is. However, it's a small inconvenience for some delicious Mediterranean food!
The lamb quality is so disappointing. The only redeeming thing is the Greek potatoes and the frozen yogurts! The olive oil flakey sea salt is my favorite

So far, everything I have had here had been AMAZING. And given that they pretty much have only three things: a gyro sandwich, a salad, and yogurt, that's saying A LOT!

With the slightly higher price tag ($10 for salad, $12 for sandwich) that may at first intimidate usual lunch grabbers, the quality of the meat and accessories is totally worth it. For the salad, they give you a HUGE BOWL of lightly dressed kale, lettuce, and assorted fresh vegetables with loads of your choice of meat. I have yet to finish the salad bowl in my past two visits. The sandwich may be on the more moderate side in terms of portion, so if quantity per price is what you are looking for, you could be disappointed.

I was especially pleasantly surprised by their frozen Greek yogurt. Even the most tart frozen yogurt at places like Easy Breezy and Yogurtland are TOO SUGARY for my taste. Not this place! Their frozen yogurt is softer, more watery, much less sugary, and tasted great with my choice topping of sour cherry syrup. 

Overall, I am super happy to have discovered Souvla. The salad + yogurt combo is going to have me keep coming back for more!

Good:
--- juicy, high-quality delicious meat (chicken, pork, lamb) and veggie
--- HUGE and healthy salad bowl portion
--- good fries
--- amazing frozen greek yogurt

Possible bad:
--- slightly higher $$
--- sandwich portion not big
--- line can sometimes be long and confusing
They switched to frozen fries and it just isn't as good as it once was. Nothing feels fresh. Not worth the hype or wait anymore with plenty of other options on Hayes.

In town for a conference I stumbled across this place with a friend. We were drawn in by the line out the door, and by what seemed a nice atmosphere. It's a nice space and the menu is simple and appealing. Unfortunately the food we had was just so-so. My friend had the white sweet potato sandwich and I had the pork sandwich. Both were a bit dry and too bready; while tasty they were not that special.
Live the salads and wraps. The new to go window is a brilliant addition. I also live the Greek yogurt. Try all the options in one order

On a random, lazy Sunday afternoon in Hayes Valley, my car decided to not start, so luckily one of my good friends lives around the area. After walking about 1 mile there and back  to O ' Reillys to purchase jumper cables, my car was revived. 

After that road block, my friends and I decided to eat around area. 

It's a pretty small restaurant with some seating area outside. I got the pork shoulder and it was delish. The portions are huge so luckily my salad was fine for the next days lunch. The pork was chewy and flavorful. The greens were fresh and the feta cheese was on point. 

The service was OK. 

Will definitely come back if I'm around that area

So good. Every time. Never disappoints. It's basically what a fast food chain should be - healthy, sustainable, quick, friendly, efficient, reliable. Plus, they have the best fro yo! Just wish they would expand out to the West side!

Nice, but overpriced. The lamb sandwich was $13. Nice little chunks of lamb and a decent balance of all the condiment w the meat, but I prefer my Greek food down and dirty NY style. A smaller wrap and cheaper price would suit me better. And much more rosemary on the lamb. That brings out the flavor. And this was a bit bland.

Decent but price point was kind of high for what you got. Interesting sandwich combos. 

Meal has a street food / food truck vibe -- not a bad thing. Interior was nice in an upscale burger joint kind of way -- not a bad thing either.  Essentially casual aesthetic.

But again, for $12/$14+ you could sit down at another restaurant in the area with table service and other amenities. 

This place would rock if the menu were $5 cheaper. Just my opinion.

This place is pure magic.  I can never leave without getting the frozen Greek yogurt with olive oil and sea salt (even though I'm always too full for it).  The lamb salad is my go-to, it's the perfect combo of flavors and texture.  I also recently discovered their hot sauce which makes it even better, if that's even possible.  I also really love their red wine.  Only downside is the line, but just goes to show how yummy this place is.

Ingredients always taste super fresh every time I am in here.  No matter whether you go for the salad or sandwich for any meat option it's always delicious!  I had the breakfast sandwich for brunch recently which was also fantastic.  Quick counter pick up if you want it to be but lovely small ambiance if you want to sit down and eat with a decent little selection of wines and a passable greek lager.

Certainly no cheap compared to your standard gyro but you are paying up for much higher quality.  Not to miss when you are in Hayes Valley!

It's still a great fresh food menu , was one of their first customer when they just opened , as I'm a professionnel driver , love to stop by , but I got lately disappointed about the customer service , the desk people as they are a new team group , who you take  order ,  aren't so generous  when it comes to be a regular customer.. really sad last time I got a glass of wine ,as $12  , served me so lightly full. I asked to serve me a bit more and the person refused it . I don't think so I'll be able to come again .. I feel like not welcoming there anymore ...too bad !!

Delightful add to the neighborhood!  Does what it is suppose to with simply wonderful food in a well thought out space. I had fries, lamb bowl, Greek Red and the baklava yogurt. I live up the street and will be back often:-)
This place is superb. I would recommend one of their salads as they are well proportioned, have good amount of proteins, and are very tasty. You can easily make it into two meals.

I went here to get a gyro. They don't have them, but they do have a very good lamb peta. It had a very refreshing taste, but I think it was a little expensive for the size of the meal. The feta roasted chicken looked delicious though. I definitely would go back and try that the next time. The service was very quick though and it is great if you want something to go.
Soooo delicious. I'm a veggie, so I ordered the sweet potato salad. It was stunning, delicious. Great service, adorable little space. Will totally be back.

Always a long line, so I was excited to go with a Greek friend to check what the rave is about. Food taste is good, if you imagine the food is not Greek. The gyro wrap was far too modified to a hipster Californian style taste and lacked the authenticity of Greek food. Salad-based bowl was kale...Greece does not use kale...they won't even know what kale is! Maybe I'm just too purist...

I live in the neighborhood and am obsessed with this place. Their vegetarian salad is delicious, hearty, and healthy. I already have plans to bring friends there twice this week. Their greek frozen yogurt is also tasty. 
I visited athens last summer and ate plenty of greek salads and greek frozen yogurt -- this place surpassed my expectations. Love Souvla!
Pretty good food. I got the chicken sandwich which was decent.  Their fries are A+. A little too expensive for what you're getting though

Souvla makes really good Greek Mediterranean food, order at the counter and sit yourself kind of restaurant that won't break the bank. I enjoyed the salad, sandwich and French fries. My husband loves the frozen yogurt with the baklava but I honestly could do it without the baklava, cuz I'm not a big fan. Overall good place if you are looking for something quick, healthy, not too expensive, clean cute atmosphere.

I had the lamb sandwich; my companion ordered the pork sandwich with Greek fries. The portions were satisfying; the service was quick (within about 5 minutes of ordering).  The lamb was on the plain side, with several bits of fat or tendons. The Pork, on the other hand, was moist and tender. I would come back again and try the chicken sandwich or salad next time. We did try the yogurt with baklava topping. It was good, but don't expect it to be like baklava. It's worth giving this place a try.

I was so excited to try this spot & get my Greek fix. I was disappointed in the end, but it wasn't all bad. 

The restaurant is small and has a very clean minimal look on the inside. You can see the meats roasting right when you walk in. Great lighting, simple menu. & yes they have retsina!!

Although this spot has a cool vibe and casual atmosphere, the food is mediocre. By no means is the food bad, it's just not up to standards flavor wise. I ordered the lamb leg sandwich, the lamb was dry and bland. All of the other ingredients in the sandwich came together to create a good sandwich, but the lamb itself was just ehhh. My friend ordered the greek fries, they were crispy & pretty tasty. 

I wasn't impressed with my first visit, but I'll be back to try the salad.

As first, this may look like a hipster gyro place (and it sort of is) but it's quite a bit more.  They do offer glasses of Greek wine and exotic desserts but their focus is succulent spit-fired meats like pork shoulder, free range chicken, and lamb leg.  You can get any of those savory fillings in a pita wrap or salad bowl.  It's kind of like a Greek Chipotle.  But Chipotle doesn't have floor to ceiling glass-walled rotisserie cranking in front of you.  

I went with the Lamb Wrap, accompanied with Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onion, & Feta Cheese.  It was pretty good but the only reason this place fell from 4 to 3 stars is there was a giant puddle of oil gathering underneath as I ate.  It was so rich that I could only eat half in fact, I feared a coronary.  My wife, who had the Veggie Wrap with Garlic Yogurt, Chopped Kalamata Olive, Toasted Walnuts, Pickled Red Onion, Pea Shoots, & Mizithra Cheese, really enjoyed hers however.

Souvla is a great concept, I love places like that work with a few key elements and focus on quality and subtle elements to differentiate themselves.  Worth checking out if you don't mind the oiliness, I just don't think we will return.

Superb!  Be sure to save room for the frozen yogurt with baklava bits and syrup! 

Also small,dark space, with open seating but people are usually in and out pretty quick so it's not too hard to find a spot

I live right down the street, and this is my new go-to easy & delicious dinner spot. I'm actually there a little embarrassingly too often, but it's sooo yummy. 

You can tell the ingredients are really fresh, the pita homemade, all for a great price considering we're in Hayes Valley. So if you're hungry and craving meat the lamb and pork wraps are wonderful, if you're feeling like you need more greens in your life, go for the veggie salad. Seriously, it's hard to find a healthy, casual, and very yumtown dinner in these woods. This is exactly what Hayes Valley needed. THANK YOU!

Cool spot in Hayes Valley. We had the gyro and fries. Both were very good - excellent rotisserie lamb, fresh veggies, and house made sauces. The fries were good too. A little pricey for a gyro and fries, but it's SF so we expected that! :)

Such a cool neighborhood, ambiance, and concept.  I walked here from my hotel in Japantown during a work trip.  While parts of the walk were a little sketchy being by myself, I never felt unsafe and was so excited to arrive to such an adorable neighborhood! 

Souvla was delish - I got the lamb salad (would probably get it in sandwich version if I go back) and also the roasted potatoes.  It was quite filling, slightly expensive, but definitely worth it!

My husband and I are Kokkari addicts (with Evvia as a back-up) so it's no surprise that Souvla's a hit! We've been to their Hayes Valley and NOPA locations, and though I'd like to say they were both equally consistent, the latter (NOPA) was better, e.g. the actual wrap was softer and not as rigidly thick as Hayes location. The Avgolemono was fantastic at both, and the salad sparkling. We've had the pork shoulder and lamb, and though we love both, prefer the lamb. I love the mix and match options, e.g. you can get any meat as a wrap or on salad--and their salad isn't just a bed of wimpy greens, it's a true greek salad with plump, juicy tasty bursing with flavor red tomatoes, juicy fresh cucumbers and kalamata olives, with feta, and a dressing with miles and miles of will not quit flavor. Their fries come in a charming cup and are perfectly crunchy with just the right amount of soft give, and excellently salted. But the ultimate is their yogurt, which I love with sea salt and honey (my husband loves their baklava crumble). We sat outside in the patio and had such a phenomenal time . . . no wait and quiet. But the Hayes was deafeningly loud, zero acoustics, a a line forever, zero seats, aghh . . . but the food is as solid as anything, with freshly roasted meats--there's no better and fresh 'quick bite' around :-)

This is one of my favorite healthy lunch destinations. Delicious, filling salad and salt/olive oil yogurt is to die for. I wish the sidewalk near the restaurant was kept in a better condition making outside eating slightly more enjoyable.

The frozen greek yogurt here is so delicious. I have tried three of the four flavors, and the baklava is by far my fave - they are all yummy though! The rest of the menu is good too, limited, but tasty.

I came here with a friend and was greeted by a bright, airy, cozy Hayes Valley cafe, that was crowded but didn't feel that way.
Super nice, helpful, good natured staff serving Greek wraps and salads as if it was haute cuisine (at least, fast casual lunch time haute cuisine) with a nod to the Greek Jersey diners of my past.
The wrap was great and so was my bottle of greek Iced Tea.

I will now be a regular here.
Recommended by the Timbuk2 store across the road, this turned out to be really good. If this would be near work, I'd be here one day out of two. Recommended: the Leg of Lamb salad.

easily one of my favorite spots in hayes valley!  the chicken salad is consistently good, and once you get past the *sometimes daunting* line to order, the food comes out quickly.  highly recommend taking one of the outdoor seats if they're open, so you can get the full people-watching experience while you eat :)
Literally a little cup of frozen greek yogurt with baclava ray of sunshine heaven in the massively overpriced consumer hell-pit that is Hayes Valley.
The baklava yogurt is amazing! Make sure to get there before meal rush because it gets packed.

Such simple food, but so delicious.  I've had Greek food before, but they really take it up a level.  They have a few unique dishes as well.  Everything I've had here has been pretty amazing.  The sauces are the kind that you want to lick up every bit.

One of my very favs in the city to get a quick and delicious bite. The food is always fresh, delicious and satisfying. Great customer service and Tony Corvine is a master at cooking. If you like Greek food you gotta check this place out. Great ambiance too!

Yes, seating is limited. Yes, there will likely be a line. That being said, the food here is so worth it. While I can't personally vouch for the lamb or pork, their chicken is amazing. Especially in the salad. My dining comrade gave their veggie salad an enthusiastic thumbs up and we both fought over the fries. My final tip is this: do not leave without trying the frozen yogurt. For full disclosure, I'll admit to having a serious love affair with plain tart frozen yogurt, which means I'm practically an expert on the treat. Souvla's does not disappoint. Moreover, their toppings pack an extra punch. Personally, I prefer the honey the best, although the cherry was a close second. Skip the baklava toppings unless you have a massive sweet tooth.

I came back here recently and it was the first time I experienced a decline in their execution.  At dinnertime on a Thursday evening I was served a lukewarm wrap and the pita bread was thinner and tougher than before.  I used to love the fresh fluffy pita!  What happened?!  Are they overwhelmed due to the opening of their Divis location?  It's frustrating to be served lukewarm food when you are dining in a restaurant - the pork was less tender due to temperature.  Luckily everything else was still as good as before - the ingredients still very fresh and the flavors all solid.  Because my pork shoulder sandwich was still good, just not amazing, I'm not docking any stars this time.  But if I return again and have a similar experience I may sadly have to cross Souvla off my list of favorite eats in SF...
Excellent chicken salad and potatoes. Also liked the yogurt. Had to wait in line for a little, but worth it!! Next time I want to try the pork salad.
Pretty good lamb souvlaki.   Fries are fine.  Small menu.  Want to try yogurt next time.

Ordered take-out and sat at the local park. We ordered the pita sandwiches - one lamb and one pork with hot sauce. They were extremely tasty with a medley if great flavors.  We liked it so much we ordered take-out and delivery another day. We ordered the same only in a Salad instead of in a pita. I personally enjoyed the Salad better and ate the pita on the side. The veggies were very fresh, and flavorful.

The food was delicious! I love that they have a small menu which makes it a lot easier for indecisive people like me. Were ordered almost everything; the chicken salad, soup, lamb and pork sandwich, potatoes and fries and the best of all the Greek frozen yogurt w/ baklava and the one with olive oil and salt. The wait wasn't that bad but it was difficult to find seating. Definitely going there again when I visit SF!

You can get your dish in a wrap or a bowl. Sauces on the side are amazing!! 

I really like the place and the concept, but I wish you got a bit more food for the prices. Everything there was amazing- flavors were spot on. 

Family style seating and not great for large groups, but you can order togo and eat your wrap in the park :)

A date took me to this place for dessert so I only had the frozen yogurt here. He recommended the olive oil and sea salt and I thought was really strange combo... but it was SO GOOD. The yogurt was smooth (not like Chobani which was what I expected). The drizzle of the olive oil and sprinkle of sea salt complemented each other quite well. I liked how it tasted very light yet flavorful. I tried a bit of my date's yogurt with baklava and syrup and it was good but maybe a bit too sweet for me. Good place for dessert! I'll have to try the gyros next time.

i've never had a wrap taste so fresh and awesome. the ingredients used are top notch and their meats are super flavorful. my one qualm about the pork and the lamb i have is that they sure are greasy. when placed in a wrap, it's alright because the pita helps to soak it up some of the oil but when i've had it in a salad, the amount of oil slicking off of the lamb is just too much. it makes the greens soggy, heavy, and takes away from the lightness of the salad. 

the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is on a couple of "what to eat in SF" lists. i think it's pretty good but don't find it to be anything other than you would imagine.

Very excited that a souvlaki place was opening up. Boyfriend and I have traveled to Athens and had them for dinner half the time we were there and really miss it!

We split the lamb wrap, which was very good, but definitely not worth $13+. It wasn't similar at all to the souvlaki we had in Greece, but this was to be expected - we're in SF and this restaurant is way fancier than any of the late night cafes in Athens. The space is airy, light with stylish accents like dried olive branches. Staff was well groomed but a little haughty. 

Probably won't be back, there are plenty of other places that would've fed us both for $13+.

I've been wanting to try Souvla for awhile now and finally did this past Monday. Phew! It was PACKED in there! Came at 7pm with a friend and I hated how the line was so long and you pretty much have to fight for a seat to eat your food at. Although, the staff was definitely friendly and both they and the food move fast. 

The food was 4-star. We both had chicken sandwiches, and fries (although would have liked to be told we had to request/pay extra for dipping sauce). I did wish hummus was on the sandwich, or maybe a yougurt sauce. 

I felt that the price (28pp with one sandwich and one wine each) was a bit silly for somewhere that I have to fight to sit down and wait to order at a bar. 

Want to try the greek froyo next time!

I was visiting my friend in Hayes Valley and heard from a few people that this place was "amazing". I went with my girlfriend and we shared the pork salad and the lamb wrap. Wasn't very impressed with either- was actually very disappointed. The wrap was super greasy and I felt sick after eating it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE
reviews.reviewerLocation: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

reviews.text:
I eat here at least once a week and always get my modified Lamb salad.
this is some of the cleanest, most wonderful food in the city.
Love the frozen yogurt! A bit tight on space if you dine in, but the food was delicious!
Cute place. The chicken salad was yummy. The fries are good. I will need to try the yogurt next time. I didn't give it a 5 star because the salad is costly for what it is.
Went for a froyo run. Ordered the Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. Was delicious! Very generous portion! Be prepared to wait in line in the evenings. Highly recommend!
I got the worst food poisoning of my life here from the chicken. It's too bad because I've been to the other locations with no problem. Now I can't bring myself to go back
Probably the best greek frozen yogurt i've ever had. I definitely recommend trying the baklava!
Love this place for delicious grab and go salads. I haven't been in awhile but I miss it

I had the veggie salad, which has white potatoes, and surprisingly, it was really really good. I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food and I thought eating it without the lamb/pork wouldn't be as good, but Souvla proved me wrong! I decided to try the lamb my second time around, and I was surprised that it wasn't served hot/fresh, the way I had expected, but since I got it on a salad bed, it was still just as flavorful. I love how they give you a huge bowl for the salad and don't skimp out, and I left feeling full! The ambiance is also nice, with white tables. There are 4-6 seaters on the left side, and individual "bar" like seats around the right side and the back (the back seats you can directly see the meat being cut/cooked - kinda cool). The seats in the middle you share, which at first, I thought was cramped, but for dinner, the bustle of the restaurant added to the good experience. Can't help but love this place!

Have been here many times. Do Not order a gyro. For some reason the picture bread they use is dry and chewy. I've tried it 3 times. Still, everything else is great. The lamb salad is what i usually order, and the avgolemono soup is perfect. The frozen yogurt with sea syalr and olive oil is great. Now that they've opened up the outdoor seating, it's much easier to get a table.

Souvla is proof that if you offer good food at a price that will not lead to bankruptcy every else falls by the wayside.   The restaurant itself is not much to speak of.  The silverware is basic.  The seating is basic.  The napkins are paper, albeit high-end paper.  But the food seems well-sourced.  And whoever puts their plates together knows a thing or two about tastes, textures, and food.  I would dare say that a chef is in house.  

Not knowing the size of their offerings I over ordered.  I started with free range chicken salad that came with fennel, orange segments, pea shoots, and cheese.  First the warm chicken was really good.  Next, the salad was not overdressed and the dressing was good.  A first class salad.

The leg of lamb wrap came with onion, feta cheese, radish, cucumber and harissa spiked yogurt.  The lamb was the real thing: lamb that tasted like lamb.  Everything else in the wrap was fresh and in balance.  

All in all a good meal at a good price in a good place.
AMAZING frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumble. The Baklava is already sweet enough so I would skip the honey. Probably the best frozen yogurt I've had.

Sooo the people claiming that this place will transport you to Greece obviously haven't been. That said, Souvla's a trendy yet casual spot with Californian "Greek" food that will satisfy your cravings.

Great atmosphere and friendly service, but the food is hit or miss. I've loved the vegetarian and chicken salads and the lamb sandwich, and then I've had super bland chicken sandwiches with greasy pita. 

Avoid peak hours-- it's a narrow place with limited seating.

Got the lamb sandwich.

Above-average presentation; very mediocre, bland, boring taste.

Cubed meat not even gyro meat wtf.

Fries were OK.

Not worth $32 for two sandwiches and fries.

One of my favorite restaurants in Hayes Valley.  A great place for fast and delicious (if a bit greasy) food right in the heart of one of San Francisco's coolest neighborhoods.  The chicken souvlaki is my favorite, and the frozen yogurt is really good too.  I also like the way they do ordering right at the door - very efficient.  Seating is a bit tight sometimes, but turnover is generally pretty quick.

It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing. It was just ok, a bit flavor-less, actually. I got the pork sandwich, and was expecting just a bit more of a flavor. The ice-cream though is top-notch, will definitely be back for more of that sour-honey goodness.

I love the idea behind this place, but the quality just doesn't justify the $13 (after tax) I spent on a lamb salad.

The salad was over-dressed and soaked in lamb grease. Much of the lettuce and kale at the bottom of my salad was completely soaked in fat juice. Might sound delicious to you, but afternoon diarrhea isn't fun. I'd expect higher quality and greater attention to detail for something this expensive.

I'll only be back to try the Greek frozen yogurt, which I just couldn't bring myself to order on this visit for another $4.

Since it's opened, I've literally walked down the the street twice trying to find it, looking up from my Yelp map to compare it to my surroundings. Yesterday we struck gold. Nestled between Patxi's Pizza and... some random store, is the clean and refreshing white tiled Souvla. Maybe I missed it because of the small sign right above the door, or the crowd of people waiting to get in that obscured my view, but I am glad we did.

FOOD:

Delicious. The menus is small and focused, you essentially pick your protein (or the veg option) and get it as a wrap or salad. I had the pork shoulder, she had the lamb. We both got salads. They were varied and delicious, just the right amount of dressing. The kale to lettuce ratio was a little high, but that's probably a personal preference. The price is a little high when you think about it as a $12 wrap instead though. It's funny how I imagine salads should cost more than sandwiches, but that's the world we live in I guess. 

SERVICE: 

Pretty minimal, you order at the counter and find a seat. Everyone was polite, young, hip. They had really nice aprons? Not much to say one way or another. 

ENVIRONMENT:

They've only been open a short time, but it's pretty typical Neu SF: Hip, line out the door, tech elite, fancy casual. Not bad, not good, just how it is. We sat in the indoor window seats, which is pretty nice, but the outdoor window seats face directly in towards you (Sort of like.. sitting on the inside of an "L" shaped table, and someone is sitting at the bottom side of the "L"). It made it feel a little bit like they were watching us eat, because, they were. A little weird when you have tzatziki sauce running down your chin, but not the worst in the world. 

Go, try it. It's a step up (and a $ up) from Hayes & Kebab anyway.

I really liked their froyo with baklava crumbs. It was amazing. Their fries are also good. However, I found their chicken sandwich to be ok and not worth the cost. The line was also absurd. Go for the froyo!

This was so good. I'm constantly on the search for a good salad. I love that the menu is simple and the service quick. I got a chicken salad, no mandarins, cucumbers instead, and it was so good. The dressing was light and I was delited by the kale in the salad. The people are friendly and the service quick.

I got the lamb salad, greek fries, and the fro yo with sour cherry. I enjoyed the fries and fro yo but was quite disappointed with the lamb salad. I didn't really feel that the lamb tasted very good. The portion size was pretty good, but I was expecting more of the gyro lamb meat. I wish that the lamb was more grilled.The fro yo is made from fresh greek yogurt and was the best fro yo ever. The greek fries tasted delicious with the yogurt sauce. I probably would just come here for those two things in the future.

Substantial portions, reasonable price. Cool that they have sandwich and salad options for each of the four main dishes. The frozen yogurt looked amazing but we were too full. Only downside is very cramped seating. Will be back for that yogurt :)
Food is ok nothing special. Their yogurt is worth coming back for. However the line can be insane but moves relatively fast.

I was walking around the area and saw practically everyone carrying a Souvla bag to the park. Of course the foodie in me told me to check it out. I ordered the lamb sandwich, fries and my sister ordered the chicken sandwich. Both meats were so soft and tender. I was surprised at how big they were, definitely something my sister and I should have shared but I'm not complaining about yummy leftovers. What blew us away were the fries!!!! Crispy outside but soft and silky inside. I wished their sandwich came with a side of fries instead of ordering it separately. Overall my sister and I were both happy campers, will definitely be back for more fries and to try their famous yogurt.
What a great little Greek restaurant.stop by to have a salad. It was great. The frozen yogurt with baklava was to die for. The staff is super friendly! Loved it!

Oh my Theotokos. The avgolemono soup crushes game.. there's really not enough of it that I can find in the Bay Area . Everything else  I've tried so far is  pretty amazing as well. I am Greek and there's not a lot of options so you can only imagine how hard it is to get my fix. I've only had take out from my roommate so I'll be visiting the restaurant asap to try the menu in person.. I'm not going to cry about them not having something on the menu but I really really really need to find another place with actual dolmades. My cravings would then be ultimately complete. I've only found one spot in the city (kokkari) that actually makes them the authentic Greek way. I might be the only person in SF completely obsessed with dolmades tho

This place was really good.  Now I know what the lines are about.  I had the lemon soup which was really nice - good, filling, just the right mix of soupy and thick.  I also had the house salad which was good.
There was a line but it wasn't too long of a wait. Salad with veg was really good. I was able to substitute the cheese for cherry tomatoes (+1)!
Responsible meat at a very fair price. Everything I tried was amazing - wishing there was a location in Portland!
Loved their veggie bowl. Great food, nice location and reasonable prices. Will definitely return and highly recommend.

I don't understand how there was a line out the door at this place. It was so bad that we threw out everything inside the pita sandwich and just ate the bread. The fries were good. We were so excited for the baklava froyo.....it tasted spoiled.

I can't see this playing staying open considering the value is not there and that the lamb sandwich we had was fairly dry and didn't have the right balance of flavors or textures.

The fries we had were also super underwhelming - but my preference is always thin crispy fries and not steak cut fries.

It's hard to justify paying almost $20 (after tax and tip) for a mediocre gyro and fries.

The only redeeming thing about this place is the greek yogurt with sea salt or balkava bits.

Fresh and flavorful. Friendly, efficient service. The veggie salad option (kale, sweet potato, kalamata olives, pickled onions, walnuts, & Greek cheese) is excellent--you can come here with your meat-eating friends and still get a delicious, filling lunch.

Soulva is one of the new additions to Hayes in thé last year that isn't totally worthles!! The last thing Hayes needed was another expensive lingerie store or another plaxe for rich people to buy ugly ass luggage. Soulva os a welcome friend!  The food is great and the staff is friendly. I got an amazing chicken salad with their house made take on ranch and it was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of dressing. 
The place can get loud in the evenings as the space is small and gets busy fast. It can be hard to find a seat and it's the kind of place where you order and then wait for your food. The interior is fine, nothing special or stand outish, but thé food is good quality. Hopefully it will last!

Love the interior and design. The food is surprisingly good. Must try their baklava yogurt and pork shoulder sandwich. Sandwich is on the large size. It would be a good idea split in half and order a fires for two ppl

I oft rate places on yelp, and I am the biggest critic of people giving bad ratings because of the "service" until today.

Was the food good? Yes.  Could any other Greek restaurant make it? absolutely. Could the staff have been any more rude? Definitely not!

Save your money for another venue with similar food and WAY better service.

Grubbed: Lamb shoulder salad + drippings potatoes. 

A bit pricey as others have mentioned, but local lamb isn't an especially cheap protein. I was slightly disappointed there wasn't actually any meat on the spit when I popped in, but the lamb was tender and seasoned if lacking a bit of char. The potatoes were what you'd expect- a salty, fatty and creamy side dish. An altogether satisfying meal- I just don't know if I'll be rushing back for another $12 bowl of greens with a few cubes of lamb.

We ordered a side of potatoes, the veggie salad, and the chicken sandwich. The veggie salad was good but I felt like it lacked protein. The chicken sandwich was way better according to my husband. Our favorite was the potatoes! We will be back here for the famous Greek yogurt.

Does anyone but me think this place is over rated? Food is ok, up to normal SF standards for freshness, but the place is really uncomfortable--deafeningly loud, the metal stools are really uncomfortable, and the quarters are uncomfortably tight. And they avoid having to have a waitstaff by shoving food across the counter and leaving people to find seating and take care of themselves. If we had a really good, everyday Greek/Mediterranean restaurant in town, no one would remark on this one.

Fresh food, Simple choices, high quality. Seems like there is always going to be a long line, but it moves pretty quick. The vegetarian option is a roasted sweet potato sandwich or salad. It was good but the meat options looked to be better.

The line was daunting, but the cause was great. While waiting, I polled my fellow supplicants about my choices: pork, lamb or chicken. Winner, winner was the chicken dinner. Number 2 was a split decision between pork and lamb. I bought all three. You have the choice between sandwich and salad. I got sandwich. The chicken was good, the orange slices were unexpected. Veggies were crisp. Chicken was shwarma-y. Awesome ? More "just good". The lamb was tasty. Fat was well rendered, the spicing was good. But frankly ? A little over cooked. I am saving the pork for the morning. I got a side of fries, and they were nice and crispy, with a sprinkle of feta. Good. Not great. I don't get what the fuss is about. The food did not live up to the line. It seemed more like a neighborhood joint, and I wouldn't make the trip if there was a shwarma shack nearby. Makes me wonder why SF is so ga-ga over this place. Meh.

Tried the veg sandwich...way too dry and lacked flavor. The sweet potato in the pita bread was a carb overload and it needed some fresh produce maybe tomatoes, avocado and lettuce. If you're a vegetarian go for the veg salad instead. Those are pretty much your only options.

10 12 years ago we stayed here with a friend on Grove St. We return every year, but to another location. The hotel we usually stay in on Market street has gone up to almost $300 a night forget that. Our friend found us a place to stay on Grove, not $300 a night. 
Holy cow what has happened to the neighborhood. Now filled with many shops and restaurants, and has become quite fashionable. He suggested Souvla.
First, it reminded me of our fave Greek restaurant in paris 60 years ago. Long table with strangers seated next and in front of you, side tables, small seating outside, and everyone having a good time. 
After a 10 minute wait, I ordered a lamb sandwich, lamb yoghurt and the fixings, it was very good and enough for two.
The 2nd night I ordered a pork sandwich. Back to the hotel, discovered it was a pork salad instead. It had kale in it, not my favorite super popular green, BUT, it turned out to be  the most interesting salad I have ever had. Many chopped greens, and pork, and I simply cannot describe the dressing. Don't know what those tastes were, sweet, tart, not heavy with oil.
I highly recommend it, but you might ask first what the dressing is. I will tomorrow night when I return.

Food was tasty but a $13 lamb sandwich still left me hungry. Not a great value ... a few dollars too expensive to be a regular takeout or lunch option. Better for a casual dinner with friends. 

Though good to have new take out in the neighborhood. 

Restauranteurs: I'd sacrifice an arbitrary 5 restaurants on Hayes for a serviceable ramen shop.

Well, I just ate too much.  We ordered it for delivery though caviar.  I've been wanting to try in forever, but for reasons I'm not getting into, I was not having dairy-until now. I see what the big deal is.  Even considering it was delivery, it was nicely presented and packaged, the lamb was juicy, and the yogurt sauce on the spot.  The Greek yogurt soft serve with olive oil and sea salt was amazing; with olive oil not just on top, but also halfway through the cup.  I'm glad I don't live close by, because I'd be in big trouble.

Have been here twice. First time was great. 

Chicken sandwich is a unique combination of savory and sweet: the mandarin oranges add zest to the sandwich, the chicken was soft and tender (mostly good meat - I'm picky about skin and tendons), and the fries are a nice compliment. 

The second time I ordered take out.  Fast and easy order and pickup. Unfortunately there were random pieces of skin, giblets, and bones in the sandwich. 

We'll probably still try it again at some point since it's such a tasty sandwich...we might just let them know to hold off on those unsavory parts of the chicken.

I don't have words to describe how happy this place makes me. I drive an hour just to eat here twice a week (and dream about it the other five nights). Yeah - it's not what you would imagine as "traditional greek food", but you can get that at a gazillion other places in San Francisco. It's innovative and exciting! I always get the white sweet potato salad, but have tried almost everything on the menu and it's all incredible. The employees are always super duper friendly, and the food generally takes less than 5 mins to prepare (perks of having a simple menu!) Whenever I have guests come to visit, this is generally the first stop after the airport. Love,love love love love Souvla.

The Lamb sandwich is delicious.  Knocking off a star for a combination of three minor gripes; a little expensive, the sandwich portion is a little small and the seating is very limited and somewhat oddly configured.

Overall; a great lunch option.

Came here for lunch and got the vegetarian salad. I've never had such a satisfying, meat free SALAD in my life.  The main feature is the white sweet potatoes, which are absolutely amazing in this salad.  My only regret is that I didn't get a Greek yogurt for the road.  If you're in need of a quick and casual lunch spot (you order at the counter and your food is delivered to the table via a number) this should be at the top of your list!

Nice casual GREEK! spot in hayes valley after grabbing some drinks and the line is biergarten is outrageous and chez maman's wait isn't quite worth it (my situation)..

The place is small and you order, then first come first serve with seating.  It was definitely uncomfortable - people hovering over your table trying to figure out if you are going to be done by the time their food arrives.  

We were lucky and nabbed a spot at the counter (back of the place) just after ordering.  We both got a lamb gyro and were excited for some extra carbs with the fries. 

Tasty, BUT neither of us liked that the lamb was served in the pita in cubes/large chunks.  Made it pretty difficult to eat to be honest and did not enjoy it was much as a gyro you'd pick up from a dive spot that's thinly sliced.  Maybe personal preference?

Appreciate the option, would definitely go back to try the chicken (assuming not cubed?).. but should read up first.
OPA! Very authentic. Avgolemono is delicious--be brave! Just as good as anything Yia Yia used to make.

We had a quick lunch here and was very impressed by the food, atmosphere and service.  The Lamb Souvalki was juicy and flavorful as well as very big.  The fries were top notch and I only wish we could have tried a few more items on the small but smart menu.
We'll be back to try a salad.

The lamb wrap is phenomenal. The meat is tender the toppings are fresh and add a really nice crunch. Everything is tied together with this amazing Harissa yogurt dressing. The whole thing was a bit oily though. Also there was a HUGE line, so we ordered togo. It is a small space and I went at 7p, so I would suggest maybe going during the day.
Yummy yummy food. The chicken was absolutely delish, potatoes in rotisserie drippings major yum and lastly, dessert- frozen Greek yogurt with honey !! I will certainly be coming back.

Amazing! Seriously. I am from NYC (and pretty food-snobby TBH) and until Souvla, I wasn't blown away with the SF food scene. But! I came here on Tuesday and sat in the most amazing seat with an open window and was given this delicious and picturesque vegetable salad. The man who helped me was SO kind and after lunch, he brought me a free greek yogurt to welcome me to the city. I am just so thrilled to have discovered this place.

How did I not know about this place??? Lord jesus!!!!! This place is amazing. I love the lamb sandwich! The beer is good, the wine is good! The yogurt is delicious. I live two blocks Away and I didn't know that this place was here. I am so happy I found it. Super good! I would recommend it to anyone who likes Greek food!

Not sure why anyone comes here for food. Tried both the chicken and lamb sandwiches. I was grossed out by the watery boiled meat in both. 

The Greek yogurt is pretty good though, the baklava crumbles are fragrant and soaked in honey.
Great yogurt. Creamy fat interesting . Honey, olive oil like nada you've had. Chicken is succulent and juicy. Fries are fabulous.

Came by on a Monday around 12:30, and the line was out the door. It moved quickly though! I ordered the pork salad with dressing and cheese on the side. The food was served within ten minutes of us sitting down, and it was so good! Huge chunks of juicy pork mixed with kale, romaine, tomatoes, and pickled onions. The salad portion itself was big enough to satisfy my hunger and to justify the $12 we spent on it. The garlic yogurt dressing was creamy, but acidic enough to cut the fat of the pork. I would recommend getting the dressing on the side, since I used about 1/4 of it and it was definitely enough. 

I definitely plan on visiting Souvla again to try the rest of the dishes, especially the lamb and the frozen greek yogurt!
Love love love the chicken salad. Have also had the baklava yogurt and fries. They are super yummy and fresh!
The Greek yogurt with baklava was amazing.  Went for a late night treat and it was fantastic.  Great service and great value. Friendly staff

Looking for yummy food, outdoor seating and dog friendly -- this is the place. Super friendly staff and perfect elegant yet simple food. Chicken salad, pork gyro, fries and some extra pita to the side, which was off-menu, but happily given by the staff. This is great Greek food, in a city that doesn't have a lot of it. SUPPORT THIS PLACE! Oh, and get a Greek sour cherry soda for kicks, it's fantastic!

Don't believe the rave reviews!  They enticed me to try it for the first time so $14 later the gyro I ordered arrived with dry, over-cooked, over-salted lamb in a thick, cold pita with at most a half-teaspoon of sauce.  It was like eating sawdust with sliced cucumbers which were the only moisture in the sandwich.  I would never go back.

A little underwhelming for all of the hype I've been hearing but it must be about the meat. We got two different sandos and Greek fries. The lamb and pork were cooked and seasoned perfectly and they give you a ton of meat but as for everything else inside I was a little disappointed. I got 4 little radish pieces and barely any sauce or other crunchy goodies inside. Not sure what I was expecting but something amazing I guess. They definitely know how to cook some great meat though so maybe next time I'll get something besides a sandwich
The food is good but not remarkable. Felt the salad lacked any brightness... A twist of lemon would have helped immensely. Feels expensive for what you get.
Obsessed with their salad with chicken. They do not skimp on the chicken, the salad is really fresh and crisp, and the flavors are amazing. Highly recommend!
New favorite Hayes Valley lunch spot. Cute, intimate and the menu is short, straight to the point and delicious. Cant wait to bring friends here with me very soon!!

Delicious food with decent portions. The place is upscale cheap eats at upscale prices: 

Lamb souvla wrap
Chicken salad
1 cheap glass of Greek wine
$40

*You order at the counter and they bring your food out. They automatically added an 18% tip when you pay using their iPad. 

I felt guilty ordering fries since it broke my budget for the night. It wouldn't kill them to throw in a free frozen yogurt with your purchase.

I had their American homestead pork shoulder sandwich wrap which can be ordered as a salad. I also had their Greek fries which tasted exactly the same I used to eat in Greece. Loved the food, everything about the place. I'm definitely going back.

The food was great, but the place is small so there was not much space to sit and eat. The chicken sandwich and garlic French fries are a must! It is a little pricey but pretty authentic which makes up for it.
Really good lamb sandwich, juicy and good flavor. Will definitely come back for more.

I love the food and the service here, but I just ordered a sandwich to go and it was less than half the size of every other sandwich I've gotten there.  Well, the bread was the same size but overall it was, for a $13 sandwich, pretty miserly.

I'm really hoping today was just a bad day to order a sando from this place and that they haven't decided to permanently skimp on their portions, because the food is incredible.  And expensive.

I echo the recs for the free range chicken salad and the Greek fries.  Seating is probably easier during the afternoon - I can see how seating can be challenging at peak times.  Also, yeah, parking is terrible as everyone here says but it's Hayes Valley...

I don't usually like Greek food that much but I have only wonderful things to say about Souvla's fare. They boast a delicious, fresh, and expertly simple menu. My partner and I were also delighted to discover that their meat options were pasture-raised. My only regret is that we didn't make it back for a second meal before leaving town.
The  lamb salad was good, but was extremely greasy to the point I couldn't finish it!!! Next time I'll try the Chicken or the Wrap!!

$15 for a chicken salad that was pretty good, but still $15. I guess that's San Francisco for ya. The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles is to die for. I would go back just for that. Again and again and again.

Charles (owner) has done an amazing job in creating a destination spot in SF. Everything on the menu is outstanding, the service makes you feel at home and decor is on point. I could actually eat the chicken salad everyday.
It's very simple. I'm Greek, my grandfather made souvla and souvlaki every Sunday and the hole family of 20 was there ... This place takes me right back, its that delicious :)

Consistent, great food and chill environment. The staff here is so friendly with no "new" Hayes Valley attitude (and I live on the block). I love the chicken sandwich it's so fresh and good flavors. Ordering on their website is a dream!!! Literally always ready in 10 mins or less and same quality. Get the granch w your order you won't be disappointed!
I thought about ordering the salad, but am glad I went with the sandwich. Not too bready and the meat was tender and not too dry. Perfect balance of all the ingredients.

Best chicken, pork and veggie salads at an affordable price!!! And their Greek yogurt is quite delicious. Hayes location is my favorite since they were the first store. Secret pro tip: order online and pick up in 5 mins to beat the lines. Walk right up to the left side of the counter and say your name. Seating is a little hard, but so is everywhere else is SF. Go early and beat the lines and get seating.

Very solid spot. Fresh home cooking. Awesome fries (get it with the yogurt). The frozen yogurt with sour cherries was awesome.

Solid wine selection.

Airy, clean, and cute ambience.

Expensive and mediocre food. I ordered at a cramped counter on my way in and got lamb wrap and fries for over $20 after tax and tip.  Free seating, so I grabbed my own water and took my number to a free seat.

Lamb wrap had big cubes of lamb. Maybe diced lamb leg? The pita bread was tough, but the sauce inside was tasty. A few veggies to round out the wrap...radish and onion I think.  Fries were under salted and under seasoned. Barely tasted the lemon. The cheese didn't add much, but they were decently crunchy.

The lamb wrap from Whole Beast destroys this one. Solidly MEH overall for Souvla.

The Greek yogurt with baklava and syrup is God send! I wish they can add more baklava to the yogurt instead of just the top but either way, I was satisfied with my dessert. Must have when you're in the area!

One of the best restaurants in all of San Francisco, in my opinion.  Tasty, healthy, nice ambiance & easy to add dessert or wine.  I've had many a good meal and conversation here.  It gets full quickly but is worth the wait!

So good! Came highly recommended and did not disappoint. 
Told the cashier it was our first time and he was very patient and nice. 
Ordered Chicken Wrap Greek Style (with fries inside!) & Lamb Salad. 

Both were great. 

He also gave us a free frozen greek yogurt on our way out which was amazing :)

My favorite place for Greek food, second to my yiayia. Being half Greek, that means a lot! The food is authentic, great quality, and reasonably priced!
