Not the best menu for the vegetarians unless you're opting for brunch (in which case I dream about the Greek Toast)! They also have a great selection of wines from Greece. Sometimes I come just for a drink and the Greek Fries. It's a casual and pleasant place, great if you want to eat there or just for take out. Stop reading this review and try it now!

Souvla delighted our taste buds today with a salad and wrap featuring rotisserie chicken and lamb respectively. The lamb and chicken were tender and very flavorful. I dare write that this is the best lamb I've tasted since leaving London and my beloved Ranoush where lamb is taken to a level of food perfection seldom achieved.. We will return, oh, we will return.

Good lord!!! They say keep it simple, and do whatever you do well. This place hits the nail on the head. I Love the lamb sandwich and salad. 

Pro tip: Call in your order. It gets really busy for lunch and dinner.

Rating strictly on the lamb salad since that's the only thing I ever order from Souvla. It's delicious! Quite a big salad done just right. Souvla has become my go to spot for my craving salad fixes. Don't be surprised if you see a line in the evenings and weekends.
Best Salads and Greek Frozen Yogurt in San Francisco. The lines can be long at times but the wait is worth it.

First time here at the recommendation of my boo-thang prosecutie. OMG! I had the pork sandwich with fries. My friends had the chicken and land salads. OMG! That pork sando was so flavorful. On soft pita with fresh veggies (no cheese bc I was trying, key word "trying" to be healthful) and it was damn good. I had the yogurt sauce on the side and used it sparingly. This was flavorful by itself but add that sauce and Lawd, especially with their hot sauce sitting on the table - great, almost guilt-free lunch. And I say almost bc of course I had the fries - delish! And did I tell you we had dessert - I threw the whole healthy bag out the window with the fro-yo topped with honey and baklava and my friend got the fro-yo topped with OO and sea salt. Talk about a GG (greedy girl) heaven! So yummy in my tummy. I mean, it was exceptional! The contrasting flavors, the tartness of the Greek fro-yo, Lawd! It as amazing! Loved loved loved it! I'll be back!!!

Average lamb sandwich. Little to no flavor, found myself dousing it in the hot sauce they have on the table to add flavor. Lamb itself was pretty tough. Every aspect of the sandwich was pretty disappointing considering the $14 cost. Would not return.
Both Lamb and Pork are good. Definitely do the olive oil sea salt yogurt. Not good for dates, is more like fast food in and out type place.
Seriously! How awesome can Greek casual get? Really good! Love pork on salad. So amaze. Simple super menu w best rotisserie & divine design in this cool affordable spot. Go go go. Greek!

Very proud that I ate here the day they opened! Souvla is a go to for me. The salads and wraps are always killer. Healthy, but rich enough to be filling and satiating. Go for the pork or lamb, and make it Greek style! (For either.)

Souvla is an excellent lunch, snack, or casual dinner spot that has an open, airy vibe, in a great location in Hayes Valley. It is one of my favorite fast casual places anywhere. 

Souvla has a small storefront on one of the most popular streets in Hayes, yet it always seems that everyone can find a spot, and I always get my food within a few minutes of ordering! 

My Greek friend says the Avgolemono soup is just right, and I usually split the sweet potato and the lamb sandwich with my partner. The frozen Greek yogurt with sea salt, honey, and olive oil is also simple and perfect. 

Would like to see more wine options, but otherwise and all-together fantastic.
Really incredible chef and owner! I had a special order I needed and they came to my rescue. The food was fresh and delicious, we will definitely be back.

Consistently delicious - have tried most things on the menu at this point and Souvla doesn't disappoint.  I also love how straightforward and simple their options are...no agonizing over pages of variations here! Recently introduced to the Greek frozen yogurt - yummy treat!

Delicious lamb salad with pickled red onion, feta, radish and a yogurt dressing. Choose that over the chicken (husband had it, good but not as good). Greek rose a perfect accompaniment.
Great spot to pop into on the go or for a quick sit down.

We picked up a to go order from here - I ordered a lamb salad, a Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles, and some Greek fries to share. The salad was very good, with generous amounts of lamb and was mixed well, highly recommended. The Greek fries were just okay; nothing really stood out to me even though it sounded quite good on the menu - with olive oil and parsley sprinkled on it. The Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles definitely stood out to all of us though - the yogurt was just tart enough to balance with the sweetness of the baklava and syrup to make for an extremely delicious dessert to cap off the meal. It was so good that we came back a couple of weeks later just to order some of the Greek yogurt with baklava after eating dinner at another place. Definitely come here to try one of the their entrees, but also make room for some yogurt!

This was one of the first places I tried upon first moving into the neighborhood.

Pork shoulder salad. Amazing. The pork is super tender and flavorful, and the salad is crisp and fresh. Beware: the salad portions are huge. They split portions for you upon request, so come with a friend, share a salad, and order the Greek Fries! The fries come out piping hot, and make sure you order some greek yogurt sauce for dipping. The fries are pretty plain otherwise without the dipping sauce.

There is typically a line during the dinner and lunch rush hours, but I've been pretty lucky where I don't have to wait super long for my order.

The frozen greek yogurt with cherry was a little too sweet for me, so next time I'll try a different flavor.

Super cute interior, but the place is small and seating is first come first serve.

Neighborhood favorite for sure!
Really excellent fast fresh and tasty. I love the veg salad with sweet potatoes, and the lamb if I'm feeling like meat.

This is one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite in all of San Francisco. The food is unique and amazing. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Hayes Valley. The dining experience is great, although seating is a bit sparse. The food comes out so quickly (almost always under 5 mins), even though it's a little expensive. Really, at the end of the day, I highly recommend this place.
My wife and I ate here and loved it. Extremely friendly service, quick, great healthy food. Cool ambiance and plating.

Absolutely love this place. Modern, clean and great natural light coming in during the day. I came for lunch and had the chicken salad. Wow! It was the best salad I have had. The servings were just right and it filled me up perfectly. Can't wait to return to try more of what is on their menu!

So happy I came across this place!! It's always packed and for a good reason. 
Souvla makes some of the best salads in the city. They have quite a variety of dishes both meet, poultry and vegetarian.  I especially like their rich and flavorful salads. My favorites are the vegetarian salad that comes with warm sweet potato pieces and the chicken salad. You can really feel the Mediterranean quality of cuisine. They are generous with their portions and with the dressing. This place is quite different from other restaurants in the city and it's refreshing.

Nice place very hip. Sandwiches are delightful. Came here during a nice windy afternoon and my order was out quickly.

Only drawback was the musky flavor in
my chicken sandwich (ten dollars). Arguably I am foolish to try to avoid lamb in a Greek shop but I was hoping they would be cooked apart.

Ridiculously tasty! Lamb and chicken souvlaki are both amazing and potatoes dripping in rotisserie drippings.... Taste even better than they sound.

Casual dining, grab a seat quick service.

2xsouvlaki, 2xbeers 1xbeer =$50 including tip, worth every cent!
5 star food. Chicken salad with sweet potatoes !!!  Get it .. Now!!! Lamb and pork salads are awesome too!  I eat here All the time !! So worth it.

Cool ambience if you eat in, and for takeout you can only order online and pick up. If you order online, you can cut to the front of the line to pick up. When picking up realize that parking can be a nightmare. The quality of the food was as advertised. Souvlaki that hits the app for a Greek food craving but doesn't necessarily rock your athenaeum.

Souvla is a good find. I've been there once but already know that I can always go back to this place for good food. I went here to have lunch with a friend and we were lucky to find "outdoor seating" (high-top seats on the storefront right on the sidewalk) for us to devour our orders. I ordered the veggie wrap which I wasn't very excited about because typically a veggie wrap at a Greek place means too much feta and undesirably moist eggplant but this wrap actually tasted good and wasn't too soft / falling apart. My friend also got an order of the (truffle?) fries which were delicioussss!
Lovely place to get delicious, fresh, healthy Greek food. Great Greek beers and wine. Lively atmosphere. Top notch all around

We stopped by and had a pork shoulder sandwich, fries, and a Greek yogurt with baklava.  All were very delicious and fresh.  Staff were friendly and courteous.  There is actually barstool / counter type seating in the back of the restaurant so it has more capacity than initially meets the eye.

In love with the Greek frozen yogurt! I got the baklava crumbles, and my friend tried the olive oil and sea salt -- both amazing! Definitely will be back for that. We got it to-go and spent the afternoon eating it at the park across the street.

Even though the restaurant is made to be casual, by ordering at the counter and picking up your food/drinks, it doesn't feel too casual. The atmosphere is dim-light, lively and tasteful.

The food is limited to 3 things, either as a wrap or as a bowl, a few apps and then desserts.

As vegetarians, we got the sweet potato falafel as both a kale salad bowl and wrap. The bowl was by far better, with a great dressing and less heavy than the wrap. We also got the garlic fries which were incredible and finally the baklava fro-yo which to our surprise, was not good! We had heard great things but it was very disappointing bc the sweetness of the baklava did not pair well with the tartness of the greek yogurt. It could have if they did something to better integrate ingredients but they just cut up baklava (too sweet) and stick it in the froyo (too tart).
Such an experience. The whole interior designer to let you relax and enjoy awesome greek cuisine. I really like this store as it is located on Hayes st.

On and off place to go to. 

I've definitely had fries here that were BOMB and delicious but I took my friend here to get fries and wraps and the fries tasted old and not fresh and the wrap tasted so bland! 

Their salads are definitely filling with REAL chicken pieces! Not the nasty fake processed chicken! I would definitely go for that next time I stop by instead of the wraps.

The yogurt here is definitely tart but good with their toppings! 

I would say only go here during peak hours if you want fresh and not gross food.

I've actually been here a couple of times and the food is decent but experience with the staff today put me off for good. It is an awful feeling when you're made to feel like a second rate customer because of your race.
The sweet potato salad and juicy potatoes were incredible! The frozen yogurt was great too. Quick service, cute spot, and we can't wait to go back.

Great food and great service!   I emailed Souvla the day before my visit asking about dairy free options and I received a response in minutes.  This never happens.  Pita doesn't have dairy (yay and it's delicious) and fries are the best...hot, crispy and fluffy inside.  This restaurant is amazing!

I was disappointed in the lamb sandwich. It tasted like it was low fat. I think the lamb was too lean and it is possible that they are using very low fat yoghurt. In any case, the mouthfeel I expect to get with nice juicy lamb and the fat in the cream sauce was not there.  

I guess that's what you get when low rent ethnic food is upped in price and  sold to diet conscious yuppies.
Souvla is legit! And this is coming from a Greek American. Salad and sandwiches are delish. The frozen yogurt is to die for. I would come back solely for this. A must try!

I loved about of half of the lamb pita with those wonderful pickled cucumbers and onions.  The sauce was amazing.  The lamb was generous and delicious.  Family ate the other half.  Next time I want the same with some extra sauce.  Wish there was one in the Richmond.

This place is always packed, and now I see why.  I had the chicken sandwich "Greek style" (with fries inside), and it was delicious.  Cute place, great neighborhood, fast and easy.  I'll definitely be back to try the frozen yogurt!
Amazing.  Can't wait to make a return trip next time I'm in SF.  I had the lamb sandwich and will have to try the frozen Greek yogurt soon.  Super impressed.
Love coming to this place. They have the best fries and honey Greek yogurt. I usually order online and pick up. It's convenient, fast and the staff is friendly.

This is one of our go-tos in San Francisco.  The food is always excellent, and the service is as well.  I love that you can get the the entrees as a salad or sandwich.  My favorites are the lamb and veg.  The baklava greek yogurt is heaven!
This place gave my boyfriend and I the worst food poisoning I've ever had in my life. I knew the chicken tasted a little funny but I didn't think too much of it. We were both sick for 1.5 weeks :(

What is the big deal about Souvla?? Went there for lunch today after all the hype and I am deeply disappointed. The food was underwhelming, the seasoning was lacking. Very bland food for Greek food which has so much flavor. Will not come back.

Had their Chicken Wrap and Greek Yogurt with crumbled baklava...Yummy!  The wrap was super oily which is odd considering it is made with Rotisserie chicken but the flavor was great!  I especially liked the tiny pieces of mandarin that provide a nice little touch of sweet into an otherwise tangy dish.

It an get really crowded at lunch making it next to impossible to eat there but grab it to go and cop a squat at the nearby park.

Really clean and simple menu items here. we ordered the pork salad and the chicken salad and they were both delicious. The pork was especially tender and juicy. You must try the baklava greek yogurt. It is perfection!

Yummy salad bowl with lambchops. I will head back there for chicken and the third time, for pork. Shhh, don't tell my wife. ;)

Cherry sparkling soda could use a little more oomph. 

Nice interior, very cool ambient.

I've been here 4 times and the food is really good.  I recommend the pork gyro -  meat is tender and flavorful (spiced with oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, lemon, and some other spices I can't quite place), Greek potatoes which have been roasted all day and flavored with the drippings from the meat on the spit or fries which are sprinkled with cheese.  If you get the fries order the side of dip.  
I did have the lamb gyro once and it was only ok.  The meat was cut up into chunks which is difficult to chew.  Lamb should be sliced for sandwiches.  

The place is small.  Restaurant is very airy, high ceilings and colors are muted grays and browns.  Beautiful space.

I gave a 4 star because the food really is good and the portion size is good however I give a 3 for price.  Everything is a la carte so except to have a $20 lunch if you get a sandwich, fries and a drink.  .

Meh. Food wasn't bad, but wasn't memorable. I've had far better souvlaki/gyros elsewhere. There was a decent-sized line to order, but it moved quickly. The location and decor are both nice...kind of hipster casual.
Only thing I hate is the smell of the copper tables. If u hate that smell you will hate to dine in here. Lol
Not as tasty as the other options in Hayes Valley, but fast. Eat there or to go. Pita was were hard, flavors not assertive. Maybe it was an off night.

Hayes Valley has some good spots to eat. This is a good option for a lower budget ($30 for a salad, a sandwich, and a side of potatoes). I had the pork shoulder sandwich--it was pretty good though the pork and pita a bit dry. Sauces were good. Roasted potatoes were good too but a bit soft and not very crispy. Overall this place gets 4 stars since it's good for the money, otherwise would've been 3.

I heard it was a good place. I am trying to find anything good about this place. I got it, the fries.! to sum it up: blend. and I don't smoke.
be ready to wait.
3 is a crowd. very hard to seat. 
oh and make sure you get a couple glasses of wine when you order or you need to stand in line again. 
good for Americans.

Walked in right at 6pm to order one of their 6pm rotisserie chickens.  $20 is a lot to pay for 1 chicken but it was very delicious.  We also got two generous side salads, a lamb wrap (great meat!), potatoes with drippings and fries with aoli.  Great weeknight takeout.

I don't get the hype.  Lamb sandwich: dry, flavourless lamb.  French fries: undercooked, flavourless.  Harissa sauce ($1 extra): no taste harissa.  Any street souvlaki joint does better for 1/4 the price.
Very good gyros, but pretty pricey for street food. $17 for a lamb gyros!  Greek fries were good, too. I'd go back if it weren't so expensive.

Solid greek froyo with baklava crumbles. Not enough crunch but nice nutty taste. Good to tide you over during the wait for your food. Super crowded area with lots of small benches and stuff with dim lighting. 

Solid pork salad with kale! I loved the acidity of the tangy yogurt dressing.

Ordered the pork sandwich/gyro. Meh.

Pork was dry and not very flavorful. Gyro was horribly assembled with all the veggies at the top and then just a giant packed clump of meat for the remainder. Ingredients were fresh at least.

Cost $11+ tax, should have been ~$7 based on the quality.

Upshot: I've had far, far, far better gyros from food trucks and equivalent stalls. It's nice to have some variety in food options in the area, but this is not worth a second try IMO. Maybe their salads are better?
I'd skip the food which is just okay and just get the yogurt which tastes like frozen Greek yogurt.

OMG suuuuuchhh good food! The garlic fries are amazing! Has such a cute Greek vibe and beautiful aesthetics. I got the Veggie sandwich and ate it before I ever got a picture!! Definitely a place worth stopping at Thank You Souvla Chefs

This tasty restaurant opened up about a block from my office.  I love the place, the food is simple, perfectly prepared and delicious.  The ambiance is terrific.  They did a terrific build out of their space.

Came here based on a recommendation while visiting San Francisco and was not at all disappointed!  I got the free-range chicken salad and it was so flavorful, crisp and fresh.  The ambiance was relaxed and intimate, perfect for a date or meeting with friends.  The Greek frozen yogurt was also amazing!
Excellent flavors, food was amazing. Had the lamb salad and the juicy potatoes with rotisserie drippings!
Totally lives up to the hype.  Long line went quickly as well.  Can't wait to go back.

Souvla is the best! I've been a fan since the day it opened. Highly recommend it if you're looking to get a casual lunch or dinner, even for a date. Very good lamb sandwiches, chicken salads, and Greek yogurt with baklava. My favorite sides are the French fries and potatoes. The orange Greek soda is very good too. Try it all! Very simple menu and awesome food. Excited for the new Souvla in Nopa. The city needs more Souvla!
Excellent and reasonably priced Greek food. Plus they have a pork salad... amazing.

First off, I enjoyed my meal and the experience but still it was average. Food was Hayes Valley priced (over $16 for the lamb sandwich after tax and tip), no sides included. The lamb had a stronger flavor for those of you who are sensitive to it so it might have been better with a little more yogurt sauce. Chilli sauce at the table was not spicy. Bread was okay, between risen pita and the completely flat wrap kind. I understand that part of its value is free range meat and fresh ingredient which I liked (radish and cucumber in the lamb sandwich). But overall feel it is overhyped.
Delicious, fast and easy ambiance! I like the Greek Style with fries in it...just as they do it in Greece!

Seriously good Greek food. And at an awesome price point. Cool and modern ambiance, with mostly communal seating. I had the Chicken sandwich. High quality ingredients and a tasty combination: Mary's free range chicken over the rotisserie, fennel, fresh mango...so good! Will be back more. Likely to become a habit!
The lamb salad and the frozen yogurt at the end were amazing! Very recommended.
love sandwich and salad, lamb and pork. we're happy & satisfied :) will come back often & order online next time too!!
Didn't live up to the hype. Their clientele can give you an idea of how authentic their food is. It's a gyro. Not a sandwich.
Had the pork sandy. Enjoyed it. I will return. Was told the pita was made locally. Cool spot.

hmmm long lines too expensive. Ayola near financial district is much tastier better hot sauce better service shorter lines. not sure what happened here or how the reviews are so amazing. I let the manager know about my discontent and they refunded $5 on bill of $43 for one person.

I love the chicken salad here! It's $13 but worth it for the freshness, huge quantity of meat and health value. I get it almost every week and always tell them no dressing and no cheese but that's just me.

This is one of my favorite places to go to lunch. Although quite pricey for a everyday lunch location, it's impossible to fight the urge to come back. The best salad is the chicken, best sandwich is the lamb and best frozen yogurt is definitely the Baklava. The only suggestion is to decrease the prices so all students can afford to come here!
I can only speak to the Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles, which was heavenly. Perfect combination of tart and sweetness, and an extremely generous serving! Will be back for dinner and dessert!
I love that the menu offers the option for patrons to get any main dish as a pita or a salad! The frozen yogurt was exceptional, and the feta cheese fries are heaven in a cone.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while, but always got put off by the long lines. Don't know what the fuss is all about, since I was severely underwhelmed.  No flavor in the lamb wrap or the chicken wrap, heavy on the wrap and veggies and little meat, 3 wraps came to $42 which is okay if it was both satisfying and delicious. This place fell flat with both. Not even interested In going back for another try. If I only had enough money and will to open my own Greek place in the hood, I would, seeing the long lines this place gets for mediocrity, I could retire. Hey people go about a half a mile to truly Mediterranean for some real food and taste the difference. Night and day .
Everything is tasty and delicious. Since l went to there weekend, waited so much on the line but that was OK. However, the price was expensive l think.

Delicious sweet potato salad and Greek frozen yogurt. Pleasant service. First time I was there during the weekend your typical, new to SF douche tech yuck customers were filling the place to the brim but that's the new SF, not Souvla's fault. My weekday experience was more pleasant.

Wanted to love this Greek sandwich/salad spot in Hayes Valley, but I only wound up liking it (in a "can we just be friends?" kind of way).
Don't get me wrong, it's a cool space in a fun neighborhood, with plenty of attractive hipster clientele. But something just seemed off to me.

My friend and I both ordered the Lamb Leg Sandwich (Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onion, Feta Cheese), and split an order of the Greek Fries (Olive Oil, Lemon Juice, Oregano, Mizithra Cheese). The sandwich was certainly generous in its portion size. However, it was surprisingly dry and bland. I guess I was expecting a little more burst of exotic flavors and juices (something more along the lines of a shwarma). But all that you could really taste with each bite was the dry lamb and the feta cheese. I kept pouring on the hot sauce just to mix up the flavor pattern. Maybe a few tomatoes and some spicy yogurt sauce would have added to the mix. As for the Greek Fries, they were a bit undercooked and under-seasoned for my taste. Next time, I think I'll order some extra yogurt sauce to dip them in. That being said, for $4 you'd think that they could throw in some sort of dipping sauce at no extra charge. It's like charging a diner for ketchup or aioli. 

For dessert, my friend indulged in the frozen Greek Yogurt (which she loved). 
Over all, the place was fine. The service was friendly, the atmosphere was cozy, the prices are affordable - so I'd definitely give it another shot. Though next time, I think I'll explore the rotisserie chicken and pork shoulder options.
Love the salad, fresh fixings with flavorful dressing. I was too full to try their frozen yogurt - but it looked great... I'll be back to try it!

i honestly can't think of anything bad to say. because frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles is probably my favorite dessert of all time, i think i am a little biased. but objectively, it is still amazing. seriously, go try it.

what really attracts me to this place is the ambiance and the decor. it's a very classy, modern, breezy take on a traditional greek restaurant and i find it really appealing. i love the atmosphere and the feeling of being at an upscale greek restaurant without having to make a reservation and still being able to order similarly to how you would at a standard greek restaurant. 

however, these gyros are not standard. i love, love, love the flavors and the added ingredients. the gyros are filling but also have a lightness and a freshness to them. i love citrus in anything and i can get than in a gyro here! 

highly recommended. especially the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. go try it right now.

Atmosphere was lovely, and the food was AMAZING!  Best french fries ever.  The pork shoulder gyro was big, incredibly flavorful, and the hot sauce on the table was perfect.  I ordered the greek iced tea, which is lightly sweetened and comes in a bottle.  SO GOOD!

Honestly, Souvla's shwarmas are terrible, and I don't understand the hype. The pita is too thick and dense, and the meat is unflavorful and tough. There is much better Mediterranean at other places in the city.
Solid food. The lamb sandwich is perfect all the way around.  From bread to fixins. Yummy!

The good: Terrific fries, pretty quick service after ordering, interesting flavors and ingredient combinations.

The okay: Chicken wrap was decent, but the meat was dry and a bit tasteless.

The bad: Limited seating, extremely busy (waited 30+ min. in line just to reach the counter - this was after 7 p.m. on a Tuesday night, mind you), a bit pricy (I know it's Hayes Valley, but $13 for a single, normal-sized wrap?).

Nice servers and very busy there. Lots of to go orders were stacked up and many more were being prepared for delivery which is likely why the wait ended up being long. Ordered the veggie sandwich and veggie salad to go. Found both to be very bland and the potatoes were too thick/sweet tasting so I removed them. Overall taste was not exciting or memorable. I think this is best for meat eaters.
Absolutely delicious food. Friendly service and great vibe. Can't wait to try the desserts.

This place has the BEST salads, so filling, flavorful, and healthy. They're all tasty, but my favorite is the lamb. One of the best entrees you can get for less than $15.  

If you're looking for something more artery clogging, try the sandwiches Greek Style. They put fries on them and they're delicious.
The quality of the food is good but $16 for a lamb sandwich with no sides is absolutely ridiculous.

This was a great place to stop after exploring the city all afternoon. I loved the veg salad and the fries. Also recommend the frozen Greek yogurt with the baklava topping. It was wonderful. We lucked out with a table opening up right after we ordered but be prepared to wait. Alternatively, there is a park down the street that seemed like an okay spot to eat a to-go order.

This might be the best food in SF!! Never a bad meal here. It's filling, soul nourishing, grounding, and scrumptious! Fast and friendly service. Must must must try the homemade Greek frozen yogurt desserts w toppings!

Whenever I recommend this place to people I always add, "I'm not a salad person" so they understand that we're dealing with a totally new breed of healthy eating here. Souvla is as fresh as it is filling. I've tried everything on their menu and enjoyed it, but the pork is my favorite.

Great portions and taste! The Pork Salad was amazing, right combination of pork(delicious), dressing and greens. Baklava and honey on Frozen Greek yogurt was mouth watering!Friendly customer service and clean, light environment.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING for a quick lunch break or dinner if you're on the go in the neighborhood. They serve super quickly (like REALLY quickly) and the simple menu is so tasty. (They are on Postmates now too so my dream to have one of their sandwich at home on a hangover came true!)

I am thoroughly disappointed with Souvla. I'm hoping that it was the timing of my dining experience, around 9:30pm, but the food was barely mediocre. I tried both the lamb and pork, as a friend told me the chicken was really dry. The lamb was also dry, not to mention bland, and the pork was fatty and had a huge chunk of cartilage in the midst of it greasy goodlessness. I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone.

Ordered a vegetarian salad to go for lunch . It was super efficient and the staff was really nice about getting me my food ASAP, even though they were busy. The salad itself wasn't the best and was definitely overpriced for what it was. Definitely willing to go back though, but I'll definitely be having something else.

I admit it, I'm in a small food rut and I'm super happy about it. I work in the neighborhood and there is no cheap lunch/dinner option (dragon eats is the best bet there) but in the Hayes Valley land of $14 dollar salads... Souvla for me reigns supreme. I've had all of their salads, the soup, and the fries and I love them all. They're known for their roasted meats, which are usually fantastic, but not the salad I'm obsessed with. For some reason their vegetarian salad is just the perfect balance for me. Tons of hearty sweet potato, briny olive, tart pickled onion, and crunchy earthy walnut perfectly dressed. At least once a week I come here and order this salad Greek style (the perfect amount of fries for me) and a side of granch to dip my fries into . It's perfect amount for two meals for me. So there it is, at the land of roasted meats I'm obsessed with their veggie salad! Also my wonderful excuse to shamelessly eat some of the best fries ever. Sidenote, I love to put some of their hot sauce in the granch for my fries. Yum.
I only tried the frozen yogurt with baklava on it. It was pretty nasty and baklava was gross . I would like to try other menu items for which probably this place is more known for

Been here twice and I've only had the pork shoulder (once as a sandwich, once as a salad) and both times they were delicious. My husband got the lamb sandwich once and it was very dry. I also got the frozen Greek yogurt with honey once which was good, nothing amazing, but a big portion (I should hope so for $4). Overall, a nice stop for lunch when in neighborhood.

LOVED IT! Had the lamb salad and it was so delicous. The flavors were great, it was healthy and filling. Also great prices and nice ambiance that makes you feel like you're at a fancier restaurant. Also had the greek fro-yo - I go the olive oil and sea salt but it was just too much - It's literally drizzled olive oil and sea salt and the combo was just too bold and overpowering so they very nicely took it back and gave me the baklava one which was sooo goood!!! def coming back!

I can see why this place is popular - it's quick, it's easy, and you can almost believe it's reasonable. But I don't know what people are talking about in their reviews when they mention satisfying portions. I ordered the chicken salad and it arrived barely meeting the halfway point of the bowl.  It definitely did not look like any of the pictures on Yelp. For an item with the word chicken prominently featured, there was very little. What was there was shredded bits scattered around the salad, and even worse was it was super dry and stringy.  Did not seem like a $15 salad and was not filling enough to be a meal. The pork sandwich was also dry and lacked some flavor and sauce.  If this is indicative of other items, I think the meats are being way over cooked. Fries were good.

This place is the most disappointing restaurant outing I have had in San Francisco to date.
The food - Sub par
The Price - WTF crazy!
The people - hipster heaven.

I am tired on this San Francisco trend on expensive food meaning good food.
Very good Lamb sandwich. Not a formal restaurant. Your order at the register and sit. They bring you good food. Not loud. Great for chatting.

Came here on a weeknight with a party of 3 around 7PM. We had to hover a little to grab some seats at the bar, but it didn't take more than a few minutes. There are several 4-person high tables, a large communal table, and some bar seating throughout the space. I would suggest not coming with a large party unless you go early or are prepared to wait. 

The ambience was dim, with holiday lighting and decorations. It reminded me of a bar in lower East side of NYC. Definitely a nice spot for a date.

Onto the food: The menu is pretty straightforward - your choice of meat (chicken, lamb, pork) or veggie in the form of a bowl or wrap, plus some sides. We opted for two lamb wraps and a veggie wrap, plus a side of the fries with garlic yogurt dipping sauce, for around $15 per person total. I thought the lab wrap was great - lots of big pieces of lamb, some cheese, and some pickled onions and cucumbers. We did notice, though, that the lamb sandwich was very oily on the outside: it's wrapped once in foil and then in paper, but you still end up getting some oil on your hands when you eat it. My dinnermate also noted that the wrap was a little light on the veggies for his preference. We ended up skipping dessert (though the Greek froyo looked amazing) - will try it next time. 

Overall, a yummy spot for lunch when you're shopping in Hayes Valley or for a casual dinner date. I would definitely come back!

This place is my jam!! I always order the Veg salad. The sweet potato is so delicious and it really compliments the pickled onions. Literally could eat this every day. So happy this place moved in the neighborhood. Can't wait to have more items on the menu.

I foolishly forgot to read my own review, so I had to frozen yogurt with sea salt and olive oil again. It was again overpowering.  next time I'm going to have that frozen yogurt with something sensible like cherry syrup.

this place is great- good food and laid back ambiance. I got the chicken wrap (thought it was really good but would like more sauce on it) and a side of fries- the fries were good but wish there was more cheese/other toppings on it- there was only a tiny bit. Finished the meal with the baklava greek yogurt...wow that is a must have! Will definitely go back (already craving another baklava yogurt) but will request more sauce on my wrap or on the side and won't get the fries again.
$10 for a meh veggie sandwich? Please. And the squash/olive combo, while an interesting concept, just isn't that good.

It's hard to rate after two years of gyros in NYC...I'm a bit spoiled. The Lamb was good but greasy. The Baklava froyo was enough to go back for in my opinion. If you want the full experience of fries (yum), gyro, and dessert, it gets expensive.

The salads and wraps here are fair. Fresh and quality ingredients. Very filling. I've tried it a few times and it's good, but something is lacking in the flavors. I always feel like I need another sauce to add it my salad or wrap, even when I get the side of sauce. It helps but I always feel a little disappointed. I do like the option for the area, but it definitely is like a "healthy fast food" choice- the Greek version chipotle.

We came here for the frozen yogurt! I ordered the frozen yogurt with baklava and syrup, and it was the perfect sunny day treat. The frozen yogurt cup is big enough to share (or eat alone, of course) and there was just enough topping for the yogurt to be tart and not too sweet. I really enjoyed the real yogurt taste with honey and some crunch! This treat sets you back about $5.50, but it is well worth it.

What a cute spot in Hayes Valley...my favorite neighborhood to dine in. This place is literally right next to Patxi's...it's new so I hadn't noticed before, it's adorable and chic. The environment is friendly and the walls are decorated with cool, Greek memories almost as if it were your own friends and family on the walls. 
The chicken salad was SO good! We also ordered a lamb sandwich but I found the salad and chicken so refreshing and delicious. Totally a place I would go back to and between 3 of us we split two dishes and felt totally satisfied. I even had a to-go bag for leftovers. Good for casual, dining and something that isn't too heavy!
Practically prefect in every way. I live and work in the neighborhood, and this place is crucial. Highly suggest the chicken sandwich.

I love this place! If you like kale you'll love their salads. But if you're like me and prefer other types of greens they will easily swap it out. I love the lamb salad but all the others are also excellent.
Lamb gyro was insanely delicious. My wife's Chicken salad was as she said "off the hook".

A handful of menu items, but what they do, they do very well. The avgolemono soup was soul warming, with clean flavors and had nice chunks of chicken, a meal in itself. The "juicy potatoes" aka lemon potatoes in most places, were spot on, creamy and flavorful. The french fries were crispy and hot.  I had the lamb sandwich and it delivered, tasty and meaty, a tad high on the salt, even for a sodium aficionado. The salads are generous. The white wine by the glass could be better, but overall it was nice meal and all in our party seemed to enjoy it. Order at the counter and have a seat. The service was quick and attentive. A solid spot for Greek fare though pricey for sure.
I literally had dreams about the chicken sandwich (with lots of hot sauce). The sides were meh, but the chicken was so good it's still a 5 for me.

Lamb salad  was tender and had perfect seasoning.
Mary's  chicken salad is the best you can't go wrong.  The potatoes were
delicious. I will be back to try there sandwiches. 
Seating is limited so go early you won't regret it. 
Enjoy !!!!!!!!!!!

Clean, casual, awesome, hip spot.  Use Square Order app to skip line for either dine in or take out.  Epic chicken sandwich 'Greek style' with French fries inside... Reminded me of Santorini only fresher ingredients.
Spent 21$ on a beer and sandwich and left hungry. Sandwich was good tho beer was ehhh.

Went here for lunch. Verdict: Good place for quick relatively inexpensive (by SF standards) lunch. Good for your lunch break. Not a place to linger.

It's super crowded but I was able to find a seat quickly. Had the lamb salad and side of Greek potatoes. Salad very good, lettuce, kale, red onions, generous portion meat (but one big piece gristle, ugh), cheese, dressing. Potatoes OTOH were limp, greasy, and lukewarm. Not sure why others recommended them so highly! Sadly, they do not sell hot tea. I quite simply do not consider it a meal without my tea! Greek iced tea was too sweet and iced tea just does not taste like "real" tea to me. As addictions go, tea is pretty wimpy but I may have an addiction since I just can't do a meal without it.

Staff very friendly and considering how fast paced quite efficient.

Had frozen yogurt with honey. The cold turned the honey into something the consistency of fudge sauce. Interesting concept I may try at home. 

However, I went afterwards to Arlequin Cafe for a pot of tea!
The food is not really Greek. More like Greek-ish. Nevertheless, it does taste pretty good.

Fresh, bright atmosphere. I had a tasty pork wrap and hubby had the chicken that was bursting with citrus. We both were quite happy and satisfied. Loved the Greek fries and their homemade spicy pepper sauce.

Awesome greek style sandwiches!!!( ok wraps to some of you).

Don't expect table service since you order at  the counter but that's what I call city living!!!

Will be back!!!

It's like Chipotle for Greek food! Minimalistic interior design, quick service, and the food is fantastic. We tried the lamb, the pork, and the chicken salads. All different, all great. The juicy potatoes are also a good pick.
We came here without looking for any reviews and were blown away by the quality of the salad ingredients. Our favorite part was the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava. So good!!!
Yum! Great chicken and lamb salad. Had it delivered by Postmates on a cold night. Excellent dinner!

Great place for a quick, great bite. The lamb sandwich and fries were delicious. Order a "Greek Cherry Soda". It's a delicious little 8oz sour cherry soda. Lots of natural light, clean, open dining room made it feel very convivial. Will definitely hit Souvla again while in Hayes Valley.

Ordered fries and side salad for lunch from Souvlasf. It was ready promptly in 15 minutes.The fries were perfect. Not too greasy, tangy with lemon and cheese and herbs, perfectly seasoned and CRISP. Salad was kale with feta, tomato, kalamata olives, red onions and lemon vinaigrette. Everything was seasoned just right. This place is a new mainstay. Best fries in the universe. Best small lunch in Civic Center. I am full in a good way.

Souvla is a high quality modern twist on your typical Gyro places in the city. I've been going to this place and have been meaning to review it. 

Here is a concise list of pros and cons for an easy read:

Pros:

Clean and Modern Decor
Easy Menu and Ordering Process
Very Tasty Lamb
Very Tasty Chicken
Fresh Veggies
Salads are a good portion.
Olive Oil Yogurt is excellent 

Cons:

Expensive 
No Free Sauces to go. 

Overall the place is very beautifully designed and makes a very tasty wrap/salad. The staff is friendly but the food is on the expensive side. The frozen yogurt is very high quality and the food comes out quickly. This place gets a 5 star rating because the food is that perfectly seasoned and tasty. If it weren't for that the place would be 4 stars.
People love this local chain because it looks hip/trendy, but it is not worth it for the lines & prices. $13 lamb wrap- lamb was SO dry...not a good sign for a Greek place.

Great addition to the neighborhood with fantastic food. I've had both the lamb sandwich and pork salad, both were awesome! Good portion size with incredibly fresh ingredients! Also, we ordered a side of potatoes (don't remember what they were called), but they were absolutely fantastic. Super friendly staff - way more engaging and attentive than you would expect for an order at the counter type spot.

A couple areas for improvement, and not enough to knock  them down any stars but here they go.
1) place is hot, like I wanted to leave right when I was done with my meal hot.
2) the spot is too popular! I've tried to go there four times, only two successful attempts. It's a beautiful buildout, but unfortunately there just aren't that many tables. 
3) they use those tiny 4 oz water glasses. It's hot and I'm thirsty guys, larger glasses please!

Love this place, just what Hayes Valley needed.  I usually go for the chicken salad, decent portion size and the flavors are excellent.  The pork belly Gyro is also delicious, get it Greek style with french fries inside.
Lamb Salad is delicious - get an extra Garlic Yogurt for dressing.
Very cool trendy little spot with yummy greek wines on tap. The rotisserie chicken looked scrumptious. Nice servers too. We needed more Greek food in SF -- thank you!
Loved this place! Reasonably priced and great salads. We bought a bottle of rose and salads, sat outside and enjoyed the great San Francisco outdoors.

Souvla was recommended to me as the neighborhood favorite. I am not sure why. Inside, the menu says Greek this and Greek that, but having been raised on traditional Greek food, the food here was a mystery to me. Not that it wasn't good; it was, especially the moist chicken in the salad. Speaking of, where's the traditional Greek salad? I had the fries, which reminded me of French fries, except with add ons that I couldn't really taste. Basically, the food didn't wow me. And the prices were way too much, especially the salad. Also, the man across from me got pita with his salad. Had I known that was a possibility, I would have ordered that, instead of the fries. I wish the staff had told me about it when I ordered or put it on the menu. If I returned, I might be tempted to get the yogurt, but that's a big if, since I'm lactose intolerant.
Oh dear god save me. This is the only place I ever want to go. The most perfect and addictive salads ever created in the history of the world. That's all.

I came here one evening while hanging out with a group of friends in SF. I ordered a lamb sandwich and split an order of Greek fries with a friend. They have glass bottles of water and cups behind where you order, which I really appreciated after walking around in the city.

They brought all of our food out surprisingly quickly. The order of fries was pretty big, and I was definitely satisfied with just half of it. The fries themselves were also very large, but a bit bland.

The "sandwich" itself was a pita folded in half, filled with meat, onions, goat cheese, and spices, and wrapped in aluminum foil. There was a lot of greasy liquid inside, much of which dripped out through the side that wasn't wrapped shut and made the sandwich a bit difficult to eat. But despite this, the sandwich was excellent overall - the lamb was very tender and filled with flavor, and the other ingredients were mixed throughout the meat nicely.

Easy to miss if you're walking on the wrong side of Hayes but I guess it makes this place that much more of a hidden gem. Great service and food with a fresh spin on traditional Greek wraps and salads. Try the Greek fries and baclava, honey, and Greek yogurt.

A tasty meal consisting of simply cooked protein and vegetables can be surprisingly hard to find.  This place is pretty paleo friendly.  At least it was until I dove into my transformative Greek frozen yogurt dessert!  Hayes Valley is strangely light on healthy options so Souvla should clean up.
Delicious, filling salads! It's always busy, so be prepared to wait in line or call ahead for takeout. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. Lovely ambiance.

I liked this but I feel I need to go again. I split a chicken gyro and the veggie salad (which is enormous and delicious) with two friends, as well as the fries. We could not even come close to finishing the salad among three. We also got some Greek beer, which is pretty much the equivalent of a budweiser, in my opinion. I was eyeing that frozen Greek yogurt with the baklava topping, however, and will be back for that.
Great staff, great food, HUGE upgrade from what was there before. Good greek food fast! Gotta love it!

I came after showing up too late for one last dinner-before-closedown at my beloved Hayes and Kebob. I was too hungry to leave the neighborhood without eating, so I stopped in to Souvla. Now, IT'S MY NEW FAVORITE PLACE!  Mmmm. The menu is basic- lamb, chicken,  pork, veg- and you choose one as a salad or a sandwich.  I chose the veg as a salad: white sweet potato,  pickled red onion, walnuts, rasins, pea shoots, lacinato kale (as opposed to lettuce? Yes, please!!), Mitizrah cheese and a yogurt dressing. There wasn't anything I would have changed. It was fantastic. Unreal. My husband had the chicken as a gyro,  which I tasted.  The chicken, which is done on a rotisserie,  was moist and tender. We shared some garlic fries with harrissa yogurt and minted yogurt,  and ended with Greek Frozen Yogurt with crumbled baklava (holy moly!!!). Satisfying,  fredh, delicious.  I will be back!!!

Holy cow.  YUM. ME.   Enjoyed the chicken wrap, greek fries, a glass of greek rosé, and a taste of my friend's frozen yogurt.    I hate to share how delicious it is but let's face it, word will get out regardless.   FRESH, FRESH, FRESH is the word here in every regard - the space, the personnel, the food - remarkably fresh, flavorful and delicious.  They've got it all down right:  friendly and personable staff, clean, stylish and well organized interior, simple uncomplicated menu.  Can't say enough about this wonderful new addition to HV.  Thank you Souvla, you have raised the bar for a quick bite to eat in HV!

i've been in the neighborhood for a couple of years now, and it's been interesting to see how things have changed. recently, the businesses/restaurants have become more on the upscale side--we've always been lacking quick, affordable take-out options, and i feared that with all these new changes, any possibilities for that would quickly diminish. however, now that souvla has arrived, i couldn't be happier.

souvla offers a simple menu of gyros, bowls, greek yogurt, and a few other appetizers/drinks. i had the chicken gyro, which was ready in about 5 minutes; it was simple, fresh, and most importantly, delicious. the space and food fit perfectly within the transitioning "upscale" neighborhood of hayes valley, but at affordable prices. staff was also friendly.

actually looking forward to the next time when i'm low on groceries and need to do take-out, so i can try more of the menu items.

I've eaten here over two dozen times since they opened. My girlfriend and I have tried everything on the menu. I've enjoyed every meal I've had here. It's ideal for a quick healthy and delicious dinner. The fact that they have frozen yogurt is a nice treat. I'm glad to have them in the neighborhood.

This place was not good! I had a salad and the Greek potatoes. The potatoes had no flavor and were very hard like they had not been cooked enough. The salad was ok but not great... The restaurant is very tiny and crowded so make sure to get there before rush times or plan on waiting for a bit. The plus side is they have outdoor seating which is nice and the location is convenient to many shops.

I like the way this little joint create delicate and tasty Greek food. I have had their chicken salad ones, their vegetarian sandwich several times and they frozen Greek yogurt as well. Usually you have to wait 10 minutes which isn't bad. Service is quick and normally you can easily get a spot where you can sit and eat if you wait for it. It's cheap for a restaurant and slightly expensive if you just want a sandwich. However, this is so delicious and I can highly recommend this place if you like or wanna try Greek food in San Francisco.

Not exactly traditional greek food. The greek salad has kale, and the pork sandwich was definitely not gyro (though in their defense they didn't say "gyro" anywhere on the menu, they just say "spit-fired"), it was more like unseasoned pulled pork, very lean and kinda flavorless.

Just tried this place last week and I can't believe that I haven't been here before! I got the chicken wrap and was in heaven. Perfectly moist and seasoned and really hit the spot. As I'm writing this review I'm getting ready to go back and try something new!!
The veggie salad is super yummy and filling.  Customer service has always been great.

We were passing by the place and there was a line, so we stood in it. Staff cool, service great. Food? Nehhh... The chicken and lamb were too dry and the gyros are too slippery! Ok, just kidding. I'm clumsy and dropped it in my boyfriend's lap. But I'm not lying about the dry meat, I swear!
Move over Smitten. Never will I wait in line for my sugar high. Souvla's Greek style frozen yogurt is so light and refreshing!

I come here two to three times per week. The chicken salad is my reliable go-to but if I'm feeling bold I'll do chicken or pork or lamb in a sandwich. It's all so good!!! And the french fries, yummmm. The Greek yoghurt dessert are also super good, as is the Rosé or the Greek beer.

Very friendly staff..really felt like dinner at a neighborhood joint, where I felt very comfortable with good service (and I don't live in the area). Food was enjoyable, perhaps just a step below memorable. I might not seek out going back but definitely wouldn't object and might try something different (I had the veggie bowl). Nice experience and good food.

I had the chicken gyro and it was delicious. The pita was fresh and the chicken top-notch. It's so good that I plan on going for a second time this week! Service was friendly. Decor is clean, simple and elegant without being pretentious. 

Great lunch or after work spot for a high quality, low cost meal

Of all the little joints on Hayes, this is where we keep on going back to. Line can be intimidating, but don't worry it moves quickly. Never waited more that 5 min. Top items: Fries, though a bit inconsistent can be soggy at times; Chicken Wrap, delicious on occasion, but too wet or salty on others; Strauss frozen yoghurt with sour cherry-the bomb every time.

Get the garlic yogurt and Harissa sauce for your fries!! My lamb meat came out a bit cold but if it was hot, it's def on the mark. not salty or overseasoned. just right! the salad has lots of greens in it. def a healthy fulfilling salad.

I've been here three times and am writing this mid-sandwich with oily fingers because I was compelled to review this place. The wraps are absolutely incredible. The meat quality is super high, and the lamb is some of the best I've tasted. The yogurt they add gives it a great  and the cheese just tops it off (literally and figuratively). I got the side of "juicy potatoes", and they were served in a bowl, dripping with the the juices from the rotisserie meats, and yes they're as good as they sound.  Price is a bit high maybe, especially with extra meat and sauce (because why not?), but for the quality you get, it's totally worth it.

Every time I went by, it was a long line onto the street, so when I walked in without a line, I thought I scored! Yes, the food was excellent! Service was superb for a little place like this. The guy at the counter explained to us in details and the kitchen people are so friendly and talked to us while waiting for a restroom to open. I wish we had this place back in Providence! Greek ice tea was so tasty! I highly recommend this place.

Went here for dinner on a Saturday night. Great food. Very simple menu. Very chill environment. Got our food very quickly. They don't have a huge selection of drinks but their Greek red wine was pretty good. Their Greek yogurt for dessert was amazing! Will definitely be back.
Best frozen yogurt you will ever have! I always stick with the classic of honey topping and love it every time.
This is a great casual place in the heart of Hayes Valley.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone interested in Mediterranean and Greek food.  Great food and service.

The salads are refreshing and include everything you expect from a Mediterranean salad. However they could add more meat to the normal portions, so I'd definitely recommend to pay that little more for some extra meat. The pork was incredibly tender and perfectly seasoned, delicious. Don't leave without tasting the greek yochurt with baklava. In comparison to the meat, the portion of baklava is huge. Overall, the food is good but it is way overpriced for Greek fast food.
Being someone who doesn't like lamb, they have a really tasty lamb sandwich.  Workers were nice and service was fast.

I work in Hayes Valley and it's now a regular hang for me on lunch breaks. Very well prepared food across the menu. And... Reasonably priced. Good ingredients don't come cheap (I know, I had a restaurant!), good staff doesn't come cheap, (see above), and as for Hayes Valley rents...? I'm actually impressed with how reasonable it actually is. This is food that has been prepared with care and attention to little details. I appreciate it! And as for the "drip, drip" comment in an earlier review? Please...it's meat!!!

Wow, I haven't written a Yelp review in quite some time, but Souvla inspired me to do so!  We were walking by today at lunchtime and decided to stop in.  We don't just "drop in" to many restaurants, because I'm on Weight Watchers and my 7 year old son is a picky eater. It's hard to find a place that satisfies both of us, plus my husband.  Souvla to the rescue!  My picky kid had a chicken sandwich that had just bread, chicken and ketchup (phew!).  I had an AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS chicken salad.  The rotisserie chicken is to die for. OMG, it is so incredibly flavorful. My husband is a pretty big critic when it comes to how food is cooked, and he loved it too.  Rich, juicy, delicious.  The salad (mine sans cheese) was crisp, flavorful, and light, but very filling.  The service was excellent.  The food came out at lightening speed.  And they have four separate seating areas:  outside on the sidewalk, inside the front, along the side wall, and an outdoor rear patio section.  I'm already looking forward to my next visit.  One day after I hit my goals, I'll get that awesome looking baklava!

Steller vegetarian wraps and bowls. 

Beautiful (busy, lively) space as well.

They are still figuring everything out and seem to be iterating quickly - becoming a standby already.

There's something unassuming about this place from the outside. But once you've tasted your first bite and sipped a chilled mug of ice cold white wine, you realize you've discovered something unique and special. They've taken the beautiful blue and white of typical Greek decor and removed the kitsch allowing you to experience a delicious and savory Greek meal...one unlike any other. You've never tasted a Greek salad like this before!
The service, the food like the juicy potatoes, lamb wrap, chicken salad were all just too mouth watering.  Ambiance, beer cups, lighting all make the place very welcoming

This place is incredible. The Greek style sandwiches are really great and the roasted chicken salad is perfect. Get there early before the lunch rush. It gets busy. My favorite is the olive oil and salt frozen Greek yogurt served in a Greek coffee cup like you get in New York.

First day open. FANTASTIC!  Delicious, clean, open and airy.  Friendly owner was there.  I am just visiting SF for a few days.  Looking for an early lunch, I almost walked right by, but luckily noticed it.  I had the chicken gyro, which had pieces of orange in it, among many other tasty ingredients.  I finished with the frozen Greek yogurt to take with me, with cherry syrup (the other two choices for toppings were both enticing).  I don't write many reviews, but had to for this great place.

baklava frozen greek yogurt!!
the yogurt was a bit too sweet....i was really hoping the yogurt would be like that one at pike place market but alas, i was let down to see it was just frozen yogurt.
nonetheless, baklava on yogurt is a genius idea!
One of the BEST salads i've ever eaten-- highly recommend the sweet potato salad.  My boyfriend also enjoyed his pork sandwich (gyro), but I don't think it was quite as special/unique.

This place has a refreshing take on Greek fast food and I am a big fan. We had the lamb and pork sandwiches and both were good, but the lamb was definitely the winner. Pork was a little salty. We also tried the chicken salad, which was de-lish. Get the greek yogurt with baklava for deseert and call it a night!
I really like this place. The is great and this space is really well done. I'm a fan of the lamb both as a sandwich or as a salad. Reasonable prices and great food- I keep going back.

Neat little place in Hayes Valley with a unique atmosphere. The people who work there are nice enough and the food comes in a pretty good amount of time. The place is fairly small, so it gets packed in there, but luckily Patricia's Green is right there, so you can head there to chow down.

The food itself wasn't that inspiring though. My girlfriend, mother, and I got what was recommended: the pork salad, pork gyro thing, and chicken salad. None of our meals were above average to any of us. Pretty bland, to be honest.
Aside from the line (because too many people feel like I do), one of my staples in SF.  Never disappointed.

I have been there 4 times.  Interesting place for quick  and affordable Greek food.  I would prefer the pork sandwich to crispier, less oily and spicy.  It is not the typical Greek gyros but a different version of homemade-style cooked pork in a sandwich.  The frozen yogurt with baklava is a pleasant way to finish your meal.

Delicious. Ordered the lamb gyro to go along with the Greek fries. Sat in the park and ---gulp.  What happened to my sandwich?  Menu seems limited and pricey, but shoot that lamb was good.  Place is super cute!  Looking forward to going back.
Although super busy and cramped, the food is delicious and the frozen yogurt is to die for!
reviews.reviewerLocation: West San Jose, San Jose, CA

reviews.text: I don't know why but I was pretty skeptical of this place when I walked in the door. I think I was just in a weird mood. The decor is very modern and clean. There is a pleasant aroma of rotisserie chicken with a hint of lemon and thyme. The menu ranges from pork, lamb to chicken or vegetarian. I opted for the sweet potato salad which was the bomb! It came with olives, baby kale, and an amazing dressing... I was so happy with my choice. I even tried a bit of the lamb sandwich (the sauce had a nice kick to it). Overall I had a good experience so I would not hesitate to come back here again.

I'm in the neighborhood and my husband voted me down because he feels like something else, but I'm going to recreate my experience here-calorie free! This was quite seriously the best salad (lamb) I've ever consumed. It would have been perfection even vegetarian.                                         The kale was perfectly massaged, (yes that is a thing), the lamb was tender and melty. The feta was super-tangy and properly Greek-tasting; none of that wimpy mild feta, this stuff is sharp! Raw tomatoes are gross, but the ones that came in my friends' salad almost looked edible. The frozen yogurt is great; the $4 imported sodas? Meh. But totally understandable and on-par for the 'hood. But it's the only meh there at all. I can't wait to go back.
Super crowded, but worth it. The ambiance and decor is great and the food is so delicious and fresh. Love the chicken salad and the fries are so yummy!
Fast Casual.  Simple menu, nice portion size; great flavors. A welcome addition to the Hayes neighborhood!

Two stars is for clean and pleasant decor, and nice people. 

But food is really cause for disappointment. We tried Chicken, Lamb, and Pork sandwiches, and all three were mediocre. Lamb was over-cooked, dry, and tough. Chicken was bland, tasteless, and chewy, and pork was not much better.
Sandwiches are not too big, but we couldn't even finish half the food.

Fantastic. Excellent lunch option. Fast, attentive, service and good for eating in or taking out. Salads and wraps were equally tasty. Had the chicken salad, pork wrap and Greek side salad but would be willing to try anything on the menu.

Greek fast food made fancy.

I was hesitant to try this place since Greek dishes like the ones they offer are usually really good at a lower price point but since they have meat from specialized farms I thought I would check it out.

I tried the lamb sandwich. All the ingredients that came with the sandwich were really fresh but the main event, the lamb, lacked flavor and tasted more boiled compared to the lamb glistening on the spit at the back of the restaurant. My bf had a breakfast lamb sandwich and it barely had any meat in it with the same flavor. The fries were well fried but I'd prefer them plain instead of the flavor they added.

I haven't tried the salads or the other meats but I wouldn't recommend the lamb unless it was just an off day.
Their pork salad is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the food comes out quick. A great new addition to Hayes Valley. Also, the frozen greek yogurt is quite tasty!

This places runs so smooth. Food is quick, atmosphere is amazing and portions are large. It's a little expensive for what you're getting but the food is very fresh and you won't be disappointed. I recommend getting the salad with fries on it (Greek Style) and make sure to try the hot sauce it's incredible.

They also have some greek wine and beer that's worth a taste. Haven't tried their yogurt yet.

Their Square Order service is OUTSTANDING. You'll be in and out in a sec. While going to the restaurant is nice these guys do an incredible job with takeout so I'd recommend starting there.

Maybe a little pricey for what you get and the long lines can be daunting but OMG they are doing something with their food that makes it absolutely irresistible. Moved into Hayes Valley 5 days ago and I think I have eaten there 3 times already.

Disappointed! Had a $70 meal with 2 kids and wife and most all things ordered were sub par . Looking at those chickens in the rotisserie I expected tasty high quality white meat but got brown chicken scraps I'd throw to dogs to eat. The lettuce on the salads was browning and not dressed properly. Pita bread should be a great at a place like this but ours was bland and flavorless. I'd also expect some interesting yogurt dressings but none appeared. Lots of other great options in sf I'll pass on this next time
Yum! The veggie salad is delicious and the service is so fast! They had my online order for dinner ready in 5 minutes! Super impressed.

An absolute gem in San Francisco. Seriously, the best deal meal that you can have in San Francisco. $14 for a chicken salad and on top of that, top it off with greek fries for 50 cents! It's a portion large enough to share among 2 people. Best place in town when you're like "wtf do I eat tonight??!!" Souvla is the answer!

I got the sweet  potato wrap being the only veggie  option, and it was disgusting! I couldn't eat past one bite. Maybe it's a flavor people can love or hate. The one star is for the frozen greek  yogurt with  baklava, which is pretty good. Never returning again!

Really yummy food, especially the fries. I got the white sweet potato salad and Greek fries with garlic yogurt sauce and both were delicious. Definitely order the fries -- they were the best I've had in a long time. I also had my eye on the frozen Greek yogurt, but the weather was a little too cold for it. They have a nice looking outdoor patio area in the back that would be great for warmer weather. I'll definitely be back again. Also did I mention the fries?

Came here for lunch and had their vegetarian pita sandwich (sweet potatoes with some tzaziki sauce in a warm pita) and yummmmmmyyy. Very filling and everything tasted very fresh. I'll have to try one of their salads next time (I've heard great things!).
This review is strictly for the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava it was scrumptious! If you're into frozen yogurt and Greek yogurt I think you'll be pleasantly surprised :)

You know, it was good. A nice alternative to pizza or a burger for that quick, casual dinner, but it didn't take me to the dizzying heights that I guess it takes others to. And, it's kind of expensive for what it is. Maybe I got spoiled on a trip to Greece last month where a $3 street souvlaki would leave you speechless with yumminess. I know this is very un-San Francisco, but Souvla's souvlaki had too many veggies, not enough meat and not enough grease.

Fresh. Tasty. Healthy. Lamb salad was huge. Juicy potatoes were fine. Great clean decor. A nice add to the street. Only complaint is that you must grab the flatware from a basket on each table that holds them tines-side up. Ensuring that other diners' dirty hands have touched your flatware.

I had the chicken wrap and my friend got the chicken salad. The flavor was amazing, although my wrap seemed to have been extra extra oily, I usually don't mind but it started softening my pita which weirds me out lol. The food  came out QUICK! Not too costly! They also have beer & wine, which I didn't try but all looked appetizing. I will definitely be back , maybe try some gyro next time :)

This place is awesome! Seriously, I get cravings for their chicken salad on the regular. 
Prices are a little high, but you get a ton of food, and I'm never left starving. Try the frozen yoghurt with olive oil!!!

The food here is awesome but the takeout is rather limited square order is really difficult to use and there are no options to find this restaurant off of square order therefore ordering takeout is next to impossible

About as good as it's going to get in San Francisco I would say. Gyros, despite being a relatively simple food, is notoriously bad outside Greece and I'm not sure why. This attempt is unconventional but very good. A bit pricey but to be expected given the location. Do not overlook the very nicely thought out Greek wine list, even rarer than gyros itself.
Yummy affordable Greek food- simple and delicious and hits the spot. The froyo is fun too. The chicken soup is lemony and warms the soul!

Great casual lunch/dinner spot in the hayes valley and i think that was sort of an untapped area in the  'hood. I've been there for lunch and i am sure they have the lamb for dinner as well - it was delish & tender.
Salads are delicious, especially when you add hot sauce, but sandwiches need a little more.

Souvla is as good as it gets! I adore Greek food and the fact that they're conveniently located in Hayes Valley and keep their menu simple and consistent makes it all the better. The atmosphere is trendy and great for a date or quick bite to eat - really enjoy everything about this restaurant and am so happy they are in the neighborhood! You can't go wrong with the sandwich or salad selection and I love that you can find a flavor you love and have it either in a salad or a gyro. The salads aren't your average salad, they're a huge portion and are so delicious. I always get the lamb or chicken and if it's a sandwich, I'll add extra kalamata and alwayssss extra feta, on everything, always, because feta is the best thing on earth. The Greek fries are a must and if you have room for dessert, or even if you don't, try a frozen Greek yogurt. The Greek olive oil & flaky sea salt is divine and the baklava crumbles with honey isn't too sweet - definitely worth trying! My review might be a bit biased since I could eat Greek food and feta everyday!

A great little restaurant, with a wonderful atmosphere.  You order first, then sit, and in about five minutes, they bring your food.  Great wine, fair pours and not breaking the bank.  The salads are very tasty - we had one of each (total of three) and fed the four of us.  The fries are great, and do not miss the yogurt with honey at the end!
Excellent sandwiches here. Order "geek style" to get fries inside!
This place is fun and modern. A little pricey but you're paying for the atmosphere and  ingredients. Not the best Mediterranean food but it was good and I would return.
Great food and interesting neighborhood! Just a little pricey for the amount of food. Service was great though.

I frequented neighborhood Greek delis back in my Boston and New York days, so I'm bummed they're not easy to find in the SF Bay Area. A gyro sandwich or souvlaki is comfort food to me. When I heard about Souvla I said to myself I have to go there. The place is really nice, modern and clean, and the service is great. Except that I wasn't really crazy about the food. Yelpers who give this place 5 Stars owe it to themselves and to Yelp viewers, especially, to go visit a real Greek deli. To be fair, what I found satisfying was the wine list. Love the Greek rose and the white. I'll probably come back to this place if I'm in the neighborhood, nibble on some fries and enjoy some more of their Greek wines.
I liked all their offerings but the lamb is great! I am not that fond of the space but even the Greek frozen yogurt is tasty.
This review is only for the party in your mouth that is the frozen Greek yogurt. Olive oil and sea salt was perfection!

I ordered the lamb sandwich and the chicken sandwich. Good thing too because for $13/wrap that is one small wrap. I ate both and was still hungry. Both meats were on the dry side and tasted gamey. Very few of any other ingredients and the pita itself had the most flavor. Do yourself a favor and try a falafel wrap deluxe, with tabouli at places like Truly med. (in the mission). After the first bite there is a rush of flavor and after eating the wrap you will be full.

After seeing many of my friends post pics of their food from here on Instagram, I've def been dying to try cause the pics always looked good. For the lamb sandwich and the roasted potatoes made with the drippings. Also the frozen yoghurt. The sandwich was a pretty decent size and it was heavy. The problem was the lamb in mine was so chalky dry. Like large dried cubes of lamb. Hard to take bites out of cause the meat was tough to chew through. Offered my friend a bite, who has been there a few time, and she said that it was so dry. Disappointed :(. Maybe it was just that day, but it still made me sad. The potatoes were cooked well and a little greasy from the drippings, but that's to be expected and I was good with it. The yoghurt was good. Not a fan of the baklava one. It has this fake cinnamon taste(kinda like hot tamale candy) and turned me off. But the yogurt itself was good! I may not try it again but at least I did.

This place is CRAZY good! The only complaint I have is that if you don't get there early enough, you will NEVER get in! The Greek soft serve yogurt with Baklava topping is insanely good. Can't wait to go back!

Love the food, location, and people working there. I go there often because I like their chicken wrap. They also have great ice tea. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to eat healthy delicious food on a budget.

Greasy. Extremely greasy. Heatlamp flavor. Both the salad and the sandwich were dripping with grease. The meat was dry and bland (and greasy--how??), the salad had way too much going on and mostly just tasted like salt and lemon juice. The place looks beautiful, but don't get your hopes up about the food.

Unless you are a cow or a goat, you might have trouble eating as much tough, not finely chopped kale as is in these salads. I like kale, but not like this. Also, the meat seemed greasy, as some others have said. I went with great hope of a wonderful, affordable restaurant in our neighborhood but my experience was less than good. Perhaps they will make some adjustments. I hope so.  It's a nice clean place with excellent intentions.

The sandwiches were mediocre, the service was snippy.  The redeeming part of this experience was the yogurt.  The yogurt with cherry syrup was fantastic.  The yogurt with olive oil and salt would have been amazing if the salt had been about 1/4 of what it was.  I would definitely go back for the yogurt only, and make sure to ask for salt on the side in the future.
I love this place. Their food is delicious, their wine is reasonably priced, the service is excellent, they have wifi, and it's adorable inside. I come here every time I'm in Hayes Valley.

This little Greek place is a nice addition to an increasingly eclectic (or maybe gentrified) Hayes Valley. The food is very fresh, the veggies taste very farm to table, the service is quick and the staff is friendly. I've had chicken wrap and salad, the mixed veggie salad and the sweet potato fries (I wish I could remember the exact menu names, but you get the idea). The chicken is rotisserie and very flavorful and the salads come in fairly large portions. Oh and the frozen Greek yogurt with a choice of add ins (honey, tart/sweet cherry and, um one other) is a nice touch. This place has gotten crowded quickly and there's often a line at the door. I'm not sure that the table lay out is most efficient for a small place. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the menu is really small.
Inauthentic and overhyped. A living example of how you can't judge a place by the line out the door.
My lamb sandwich was bone dry.  Not enough sauce.  But the lamb was tasty itself.  Service was pretty good and the place is well designed and run.  Chef just needs to learn about moisture.

The pork salad and juicy potatoes were delicious. I will definitely be ordering them again. The Greek yogurt with the Greek sour cherry syrup also hit the spot. I ordered on-line for pick-up. It was easy, and the food was ready on-time.
The bread is amazing but the chicken and lamb are both very dry. The wrap is also super greasy.

I had the free range rotisserie chicken salad to-go.  It was busy and I only had to wait 5 min at most.  Great service and food for a fairly good price - definitely will be back.  A lot of the other customers recommended trying their frozen Greek yogurt as a side for next time.

This place has an amazing ambiance, decor, great staff, and delicious food. I had the lamb sandwich, greek fries with minted Greek yogurt, and honey greek frozen yogurt for dessert. The greek frozen yogurt was out of this world. The lamb sandwich was great, admittedly not the best in my life (I usually like traditional gyro sliced meat, and this was in chunks, but it still was amazingly delicious) but still delicious! Everything at this place is fresh. Ingredients taste AMAZING. The staff was beyond friendly, felt like I was in the Mediterranean. Love this place and will be back!

I tried their pork sandwich and the Greek fries - both were very good, but it's hard to see where the high prices are coming from. I wish that the pita they used to wrap the sandwiches had a little more flavor and puffiness, but it was altogether pretty good. A sandwich will leave you more or less full, and it's a great cozy spot for a date.
Excellent and healthy food options. Loved my chicken salad and greek fries! I plan to go back often.

First thing I noticed about Souvla was the very long line extending from their entry way.  On a positive note, the long line means their food is very popular with the locals! This restaurant is really small so be prepared to just grab-n-go rather than dine-in. There is a park right across the street though so you can sit on the benches or tables there and enjoy your meal. I had the pork wrap which was essentially a gyro but was made burrito-style. I thought it was very flavorful and filling but the price was pretty steep, $11 ($13 for the salad version, wtf?!).
