I also tried the greek frozen yogurt with baklava topping and that was almost life changing. One cup was $3-4 so I had them split one order in half between two cups (for my sister and I). This ended up being a better idea than we had originally thought because they ended up being very generous with the "half" they put in each cup! The baklava topping was very tasty and I was surprised that I liked the yogurt part because I am not generally a fan of greek yogurt. So if you're okay with a 3/4 portion and go with a friend ask them to split an order in half ;) Great way to save money and get more than the usual single order. Another tip is for foodies going just for the yogurt. If you don't plan on ordering anything else, ask someone toward the front of the line if they don't mind ordering for you and give them the $3-4 to cover the cost. Unlike the other items on their menu the yogurt is served right away, whereas you get a number placard and have to wait for your hot food items or salad to be brought out. So if you only want yogurt, save yourself some time by avoiding the long line and see if one of the friendly patrons is willing to help you out! I would probably eat here again if I were in the area, but don't be mistaken, I am still unhappy about how high the prices are.

Got some take out items here today for lunch.  I ordered the lamb salad, vegetarian salad and the Greek fries.  My co-worker, who wanted the vegetarian salad, let me try a bite of this rather unusual dish with sweet potato as the star.  But it works!  Its sweetness is undercut by the Kalamata olives and their juice, creating a distinctive and complex flavor.  The lamb salad contains big cubes of very tender, moist meat.  The yogurt dressing works very well with the whole ensemble.  The salads are made up of more interesting greens, including kale and pea sprouts, than the tired old packaged-style mixed greens one ordinarily gets in a restaurant.  The fries are very crunchy, very likely twice-fried.  At $10, I think the vegetarian salad is overpriced.  Otherwise, I did like what I had and look forward to coming back!
The food is FRESH. not that many opptions and the place isnt that big but its very clean and the crew is really nice. also their frozen greek yogurt there is EVERYTHING.
Veggie salad is the best salad I have ever had with a great price point! Highly recommended!

We're at Souvla for lunch or brunch every other week or so, generally to carry out.  The menu is limited, but what they do, they do extremely well.  I adore the lamb salad with added pita and a side of hot sauce.  (Whatever you get at Souvla, spice it up with the delicious hot sauce.)  The food is absolutely fresh and healthy and you won't fall into a food coma after you eat it.  And try the frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherry sauce for dessert or a snack -- totally craveable and not your usual froyo.
Delicious salads.  We had the pork and the chicken and couldn't say which was better.  Very satisfying, especially with the frozen Greek yogurt with sour cherry syrup.  New favorite find.
love all the staples, kale salad, chicken (best in the city!), lamb, greek fro-yo

Great food, quick service. We ended up with one of each salad + fries + potatoes and liked everything. Skip the Greek beer, it's blah lager.  Downside is that the place is packed and not great for kids (no high chairs, no kids portions).
I absolutely loved this place. The food was fresh and flavorful. The atmosphere was friendly and social. This is definitely my new go-to Greek euro/sandwich place in the area. I highly recommend it!
Choose the salad over the sandwich. The Greek French fries are fantastic and serve 2-3. The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was okay but wouldn't get again. All in all decent experience.
Your receptionist is a paradigm of white privilege and lack of communicative skills.  And we're not taking other languages.  She fails as a representative of your aim and product.
Awesome grab and go Greek food, including wine and frozen Greek yogurt. I got a rotisserie chick Greek salad with fries and rosé, one of the best grab and go meals I've had in the city. Gotta try it!

Love love love this place. It's healthy. It's fast and it has classic elements of the Greek cuisine. Most authentic Greek restaurants are sit down and pricey. So this is refreshing.  Love the salads just as much as their sandwiches. Their Greek frozen yogurt is delicious too. Happy this place opened

Sorry completely mediocre! I ordered the lamb pita. The pita was drenched in oil but the real disappointment was most definitely the lamb. It was devoid of any flavor! Just cubes of lamb that tasted as thought it was simply boiled in water. Maybe other items are good here but I won't be ordering again.

The Chipoltle of "greek" food. The chicken soup was tasteless, the salad was nothing special - the typical romaine raw kale combo that I had yesterday at another overpriced blah joint. What is up with SF? People flock to bad food. My friend had the lamb which he thought was tasteless and tough. He thought it might have sat overnight in the fridge, but I asked the worker who said they cook it fresh everyday. Totally bummed I didn't spend my dollars at Ikaros in Grand Lake. That place rocks without the hipster chef bullshit.

I think in 2016, it is important for restaurants to have a good, viable, proper vegetarian lunch option.  I don't need 3 choices; I don't even need 2.  But, I need one.  And the sweet potato wrap -- for $12! -- was just so meh.  No protein, just starch.  And a big, thick pita.  I was so sad, because I loved the fries at this place, and the delicious yogurt.  Thus, three stars.  Would love to see something better for lunch, like a chickpea/falafel type thing, or a veggie meat, something with beans . . . protein!  People need protein.  Thanks, Souvla!
Great chicken sandwich. The line moves quickly. Frozen yogurt is amazing and unique. Staff quite friendly. Vibrant space well appointed.

This is a sweet little gem of a place in charming Hayes Valley with wonderfully authentic Greek flavors albeit in slightly more modern food stylings. I ordered the lamb salad, with all of the traditional flavors you'd expect from Greek food but in a lighter meal. This salad was excellent. Filled with lots of lamb over not just lettuce but kale. Very healthy and filling, this salad had great balance. Adding to the charm of Souvla is the fact they serve Greek wines. After visiting Rhodes 7 years ago, I was delighted to be poured a glass of Retsina, a yummy pine wine that is a traditional Greek drink. While the line can run out the door, don't be discouraged. There is limited seating here and yet somehow a fairly quick turnaround to find a seat. The only reason this wasn't 5 starts for me? It was really loud inside, and I was hoping to have an easier time chatting with my dinner company. All in all, a great meal and environment. Efgharisto, Souvla!
I have a slight obsession and get cravings for the Greek yogurt with Baklava crumbles from Souvla!!! So so good!

Tastey chicken gyro with interesting toppings but was dripping with  grease.  Also,  not as filling as I would have liked for the price.  So tried the potatoes too -  I'm not a fan; they were flavorless and soggy. 

Good restaurant set-up,  especially the open air bar.   

I would definitely give it another try.
Good food, fast service, nice people. I love this place. So does everyone else in the neighborhood, because there is always line out the door.

I had dinner here last night.  I ordered the vegetable salad with a side of lamb and garlic yoghurt (about $15 inc t&t).  

The food was pretty tasty.  The salad was generously portioned and had a good mix of kale, romaine lettuce, olives, walnuts and greek hard cheese.  The slices of white sweet potato on top were very nice.  I'm not sure whether this is a 'true vegetarian' option because it would not surprise me if the sweet potato was basted in the rotisserie juices to make it so delicious.  

The side of lamb was ok - the flavour was fine but as numerous people have commented, the lamb comes in little bites that are quite chewy. I'd prefer shredded lamb shoulder. 

Overall - a pretty good, healthy-ish option in the Hayes Valley.  I like the choice between a wrap or a salad.  I'll definitely return when in the area.

This place is, despite the reviews, pretty bland. It's fresh and not bad but the food should have more flavor. I ate the vegetarian sandwich which is fairly salty, in spite of the few olives in it, and lacked much to it other than some mushy sweet potato. I wound up taking out the sweet potato and that improved it vastly but then made the sandwich about half the size. The Greek fries taste like regular fries, and lack the richness Greek fries normally do. This would be a good lunch place for half the price. It's okay food at a highish price.

One of my favorites on Hayes. The 15 minute online ordering is easy and super efficient. I like the chicken salad and white sweet potato salad. The frozen yogurt with sour cherry is a simple and delicious dessert.

I read about this restaurant in San Francisco Magazine and thought I'd try the lamb souvlaki.

For $13.05 (including sales tax), you get a pita bread filled with cubes of yogurt-drenched lamb, some sliced radishes and cucumbers, pickled onions, and a generous sprinkling of feta cheese.

The pita bread was rather dry and rest of the "sandwich" (the guy who took my order called it a sandwich but it's more like a wrap) just didn't do it for me. A few of the chunks of meat were cartilage. Who wants to eat chunks of cartilage? "Not I," said this eater. Overall the souvlaki was okay, but it was definitely not worth $13. There are more delicious sandwiches in this city and I most likely will not eat here again.

I LOVE SOUVLA!!!!! Their chicken salad is to die for! It is delicious and tastes bette than any old salad you've ever had. Their wraps are delicious as well! They have a great selection of sides, such as their fries, which I order every time I go. Lastly, they have Greek yogurt as a dessert. And the best part about is that they put delicious baklava filling on top of your yogurt and it's basically my favorite dessert in Hayes Valley !

simple but darling interior. had the chicken sandwich and the Greek fries, both were delicious. I'd probably ask for extra sauce in the sandwich next time; it was a little dry. Adored how they served their frozen Greek yogurt in paper Greek coffee cups and the food in white and blue enamelware. long line out the door at lunch, but food was derived quickly! friendly staff!
The lamb sandwich is best thing on menu.  Delicious and hearty.

I stopped by Souvla this afternoon to grab a bite to eat before attending the Nutcracker SF ballet matinee. My plan was to enjoy a chicken sandwich but instead I tried the breakfast sandwich (scrambled eggs, lamb, feta cheese, and other tasty ingredients). It was delicious so I will definitely return again for the weekend brunch. My taste buds thank you for the expanded menu!

I tried the chicken sandwich which was very tender and so filling, I couldn't make room for the yogurt. So, I'll be back again. 

It's clear that the restaurant uses the freshest, highest quality ingredients. For that and being located in Hayes Valley, I think the price is fair and reasonable. 

As the place gets more popular, the place may not be able to accommodate many more people. So, in the future, it may be easier to do take-out.

I wish Souvla best of luck for a long and prosperous business!

This is a nice little place that has good flavors. I had the SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG Sandwich and it was a good Sandwich. You can feel that they have high quality and fresh ingredients. I think it's a bit expensive and could be a bit bigger.
Very nice ambiance and friendly staff. Chicken was overly dry and hard to eat in the sandwich. Likely will not be returning.

i haven't tried the sandwiches yet (altho they look really good), but the froyo here is amazing.  it's a pretty big portion, and we got it topped w/ baklava and syrup.  it was just the right amount of tang and sweetness.  i want to try it w/ the olive oil and sea salt next time.

YUM! Located in a small, hipster, artsy neighborhood is this Greek joint. I ordered the chicken wrap and Greek fries with 2 sauces on the side and it was more than enough to share between 2 hungry people. Everything was super flavorful and the staff is very friendly!

Food is delicious. But a gyro and fries costs $20 and there is no dipping sauce for the fries. You can buy a really good garlic yogurt sauce, but that's a dollar extra. Guess rent in Hayes Valley must be expensive. Hope they can find a sustainable solution

As European I really miss good Mediterranean food. My juicy potatos were sitting on the counter for quite a while so the waitress offered me new ones and a free frozen yogurt on top. Amazing customer service.

So impressed.  This place looks simple and the menu is limited but it is perfect.  The food - especially the lamb salad is excellent.  I love this salad and could eat here everyday.   PLEASE OPEN ANOTHER LOCATION IN THE MISSION!!!!   We need you there.
oh dear finally a good greek//med place in the city where you can sit and chill. Grubbin, really good food. tasty and delish.

We live in the neighborhood and tried this place tonight for the first time.  The salmon kebab was AMAZING.  Even the kids wolfed it down.  The chicken was good too -- flavorful but a bit less tender.  The portions are good, the price is reasonable.  I think they're going to do well.
My girlfriends and i tried something new yesterday, this place was amazing. I had the Greek salad. It was super light and very refreshing. I also had the Greek fries. Best fries ever. A must try.

I went to Souvla for the first time yesterday.  There were only four choices on the menu.  Only four.  The lamb salad was pretty good, but I didn't think I would crave it every week.  And with only four  choices on the menu, it didn't inspire me to think "I can't wait to try the chicken next time." And with only four choices, there isn't much variation to try next time anyhow.

 It doesn't seem to have a clear identity:  On the one hand, you look in, and it looks like a nice restaurant.  But then when you go in, it seems like a takeout place with wine and a nicer seating area.  You order at the check stand, and then go to your seat.  There are only a few tables, and the prices are under $15, so I am guessing that they will not be able to make enough money to last long in that high rent district.

Unless they reconsider and get some more choices I think that I will give it a "Meh".
We are from NYC and came to Souvla after receiving glowing recommendations from friends. Our lunch certainly did not disappoint. Loved the Greek fries and the white sweet potato sandwich!

Amazing - the salads and wraps are great. Fries are killer and go really well with the garlic yogurt. Great option for delivery as it holds up really well (even the fries). A favorite that I could eat every weekend!

Pretty poor. Loooong wait online even @ 2 in PM, since checkin guy wanted to try to score with a couple of girls. Ah, well. The food SEEMS like it should be good, meat roasting and spinning ahead, nice ideas. But, the lamb was uninteresting, overcooked and flavorless. What flavor it might have had was negated by the vinegar in the salad. Perhaps the wraps might have been better, but I wouldn't return. Fresh Choice level. Real disappointment. "Juicy potatoes" underdone and flavorless. Nice Rose, though.
The food is fantastic. Try the roasted white sweet potato!

Okay so four stars for the quality of the food as well as the taste but I would say 2-3 stars for the value.  Everything in the bowl was super tasty and innovative but the portion size for the food is not there.  I could have easily eaten two bowls and I can't say I have a massive appetite.  I usually always have leftovers at restaurants but I cleaned out my chicken bowl and found myself longing for more food.  I will say the white wine was really good so I didn't mind the $10.  All in all I would maybe go back if they upped their portions.  Other people in my group got the fries which was somewhere around $4 and the portion size was ridiculously small.  If fries are $4 you're thinking its a heaping bowl for a table to share.  Also everything was so a la carte I felt nickeled and dimed.  Out the door with tax and tip for ordering at the register I spent around $30 for a chicken salad bowl and white wine.  I felt kinda hosed.  It's new though so hopefully this feedback helps.  I am not turned off enough to give it another try.
Great wraps and must have frozen yogurt! Great competitor of smittens :)

Very tasty. Portions are good, prices are ok. Tempted to give four stars, but they loose one for the stupid ipad tip gimmick. When I stop by for a $5 froyo, don't put my order up on the ipad screen with big "Add a giant tip" or "Be a penny-pinching %&#$" buttons. I bet it works on a lot of people, but it also makes me hate you.

Great spot! We had the lamb and pork dishes, with the Greek fries. All were tasty... Service was fast. Was also tried the Restina wine - very good choice. Especially if you like dry whites! All in all, a great neighborhood find for casual/quick dining.

Awesome find for a lunch stop between meetings.  I had no idea I was walking in to a place less than 3 weeks old.  It felt much more established in Hayes Valley.  Busy, but not mobbed and people besides me seemed to know what they were doing (two ordering stations - one at the rotisserie and a second at the bar).  They have it down pat for being so new.  The chicken salad was absolutely delicious - fresh greens, perfectly cooked chicken, and the right amount of dressing.  It was so good I couldn't leave without also getting the greek yogurt with salt and olive oil.  Awesome.  All around a great restaurant.  I'll be back for dinner for sure.

Delicious chicken pita wrap! Good portions, fresh ingredients, delicious food! Also had the potatoes which were great! Definitely recommend this spot for a casual, quick dinner. The Greek frozen yogurt with baklava was also amazing!

Having grown up with Greek food back in the Northeast this place is both homey and familiar while also being exciting and new.  All done elegantly and tastefully but without any of what seems like growing self-congratulatory look at me posturing so many new places seem to bathe themselves in, like a pimpled teen with too much Axe Body Spray.  Loved the pork salad.

I wasn't too impressed by the food. I would have given it 2 stars if not for the very sweet staff and the fries. I got a a pork sandwich and my mother got a chicken salad. The salad would have been better without the chicken. The chicken was a bit dry and especially shredded up, the texture was not great. The pork sandwich was ok. The pita bread or wrap bread was dry and rather tough to bite off. The pork itself was alright, a bit on the dryer side and towards the end of my sandwich, I found myself picking out bits of meat and only eating the veggies and dry bread.
Now the fries were great. If I go again, the only thing I would order were the fries. Then I would walk out and eat the main course elsewhere. Anyway. Fries. Amazing. Yes. Crispy outside, fluffy inside, and nicely salted and seasoned.
Service was lovely. Very helpful in recommending food and very lively conversationalist. They're lovely people. This subpar rating does not reflect them.

This resturant is awesome: tasty food and incredible service. We had 2 spit roasted  lamb salad dinners, lamb is organic, sustainably raised by northern California farmers, no hormones. Salad was crisp with a wonderful dressing including feta chese. Desert of Greek yogurt with bakalava and honey was an awesome bonus. The simple straightforward menu and excellent service made this a perfect evening. We will definitely be regular customers.
Solid chicken salad.  Fun atmosphere.  It's both casual and nice.  Perfect for a summer evening.

I come to this place only when I need a quick bite, not because how delicious things are here. Recently, it took longer and longer to get your walk-in orders (because it listed itself in so many apps for preorders) , and the waitress has such an attitude! When I asked why I have to wait so long when the store was not full. She was like it's ONLY 10-15 minutes, what's the big deal. She then explained they have many online orders, although the store doesn't look full. Aren't you supposed to fulfill whoever is at door and waiting first? Ppl order online means they're not in a hurry! Besides, they haven't showed up yet! Plus, there are literally 4 things on the menu. How complicated it could be?

Holy crap - how did we not discover this place earlier. The sandwiches (particularly the lamb) and the fries are the best. We usually get our sandwiches with extra cheese. The frozen yogurt is also divine. Try honey with sea salt (not on menu).
yummy food, crazy crowded, very fast - bring it across the street to eat at Place Pigalle if no tables!

This is one of my new favorite spots in the city. The food is exceptional iv tried there wraps and salads and they are so good. But, what really hits it on the is their roasted greek chicken brined with feta cheese. Yeah, and make sure you satisfy you sweet tooth by trying their Greek yogurt topped with baklava, not only it made it to (the 2015 7x7 big list) , but because its heavenly.
Delicious! Loved the vegie salad, huge and well dressed.  I'm a big fan.

not a mind blowing Greek food experience , but the place is really clean and pretty , you just expect a little more flavor when you see such nice place , simple menu always a plus and faster for you to choose from .

Nice place with alright food. I took the pork sandwich which was good but very oily. I liked how they roasted the meat in the oven in the restaurant, it was a nice feature. Also I liked the greek theme. The food might hit four stars if they would season it more and the meat needs to be a bit more "burnt" or grilled to taste authentic.
From the delicious veg bowl, to the greek sparkling water, to the fresh greek frozen yogurt, to the beautiful aesthetics, this place is top notch and well priced. Will definitely be a regular.
Delicious food and great service. I love the chicken wrap and the chicken/rice soup.

If you are on a quest to find the holy grail of lamb gyro, the lamb sandwich at Souvla isn't it.  Chunks of lamb were bland--some pieces chewy and some tender.  Restaurant is very nice looking though--makes me feel like one of the beautiful people.
crumbled baklava topping should be provided everywhere and anytime. loved it with the honey on top of the frozen greek yogurt!

Super happy to have a high quality 'fast casual' restaurant in the neighborhood. Love that I was able to order pick-up using Square Market too. Only bummer is the price... but my guess is that's b/c rent in Hayes isn't cheap.

Besides being juvenile, abundantly self-pitying, poorly-written and belying the writer's ignorance about how either any business or a restaurant functions, the interaction depicted in the review preceding mine is a malicious distortion of what actually transpired directly in front of me last night. The server was nothing but gracious, and the observably irascible customer's food took possibly 12-minutes to arrive. If that's too long to wait for healthy and delicious food -- if you need to be first in every line, every time -- perhaps choose less popular establishments to eat in.
simple menu...great items..brilliant yogurt..minus one star for not having a lot of veggie variety i guess..decently prized..sweet potato wrap was excellent..

Wanted to love this place. Most gyro spots here for some reason use lavash instead of pita so I decided to give this place a try when I saw that they used pita. $16 later (got extra minted yogurt sauce), I'm not impressed. Super salty and lamb texture was weird. The decor is nice but everything is self-service and doesn't warrant the price tag. Frankly, I prefer the delicious $7 gyro (in pita) from Locali in FiDi.

This is the first time, in my fifteen years of visiting SF that I have gone to a restaurant where the food was not just good but was seriously, out of this world delicious. I swear every time, I have eaten at a restaurant in SF I leave disappointed. The food was so good, that as a joke I said to my husband mid bite, I wanted to come back the following day. The following day, we were out on a excursion and on the way back to our room he says, "so we are having dinner at Souvla right?" Hell yes! The first time, he had the chicken sandwich and I had the roasted vegetable salad and for dessert we had the frozen Greek yogurt and baklava; all absolutely delicious. I tried avgolemono for the first time *sigh* looove!! Oh my, seriously, just thinking about this place makes my mouth happy! Service is fast, and efficient, dining area is clean. Overall, the entire eating experience was fantastic. I would fly into SF just to have some soup and baklava and fly back home. Outstanding!!!

the avgolemono soup was great - the lamb sandwich and salad were both very good as well. next time would love to try the frozen yogurt. the staff was very nice. I just wish the woman at the register was a tad bit friendlier.

I had the lamb and it was delicious! Tender, juicy, and tasty are the three words that come to mind first.  It's a very small shop though so seating can be tricky. Other than that it is extremely quaint and a great option for lunch.

Really happy about this quick & delightful lunch or dinner option in the 'hood. Friendly & helpful staff, quality ingredients & we really enjoyed everything we had: not cheap, but definitely worth it. Lamb & chicken gyros very tasty & the veggie daughter enjoyed the sweet potato & kalmata olive sandwich we brought home for her - her carnivore mother may get that one next time; LOVED the decadent roasted potatoes w/drippings; got turned on to some tasty Greek wine; and the coup de gras was the froyo w/baklava. Sat outside on a warm evening & had a great time.
Delicioso el de pollo y el té... atienden rápido y la comida  no se tarda, buen servicio!
Los sándwich y ensaladas son riquísimos! Se llena bastante el lugar entonces traten de llegar temprano. Pero todo muy bueno y lugar súper agradable. Muy recomendable
Super lecker und frische Salate. Service top und schnell. Man kann zwischen Salat oder Pita wrap wählen und Hähnchen/Lamm/Schwein/vegetarisch.

Really good salad. Loved the chicken and lamb salad. 
Reasonable price for huge portions. 
Some staff wasn't too friendly and seemed indifferent.

Souvla has been on my bucket list for a while and we finally got a chance to try it when we visited family in Bay Area this year. 

I am a fan of Greek food and there are lots of great reviews about Souvla so I had high expectations. However, we were kind of disappointed with both of the taste and portion. 

We got a Chicken Sandwich and Lamb Salad to share. The lamb was okay and flavorful but the chicken was extremely dry and hard to chew. We ended up getting a chicken sandwich from The Bird and were curious why people recommended Souvla.

After realizing i'm not a fan of the lamb here, I decided to give Souvla another shot because the first time I tried the chicken salad at a different location I loved it...

It's just TOO GOOD! Make it Greek style if you want some more carbs+fat to fill you up... can't go wrong. For $17 it's a steal! 

This particular location isn't nearly as busy as the others so it's our new-go to. Hidden gem. Have already ordered pickup twice this week could totally go for it again! Both times the salads were excellent, TONS of chicken and super fresh.

Now the question is, Souvla again for dinner tonight?

Souvla is an SF classic. This location is the one that has been delivered to me via DoorDash, but they are all great. 

Best filling, flavorful, and high protein salads. Also delicious fries!

My favorites are the lamb and pork salad as well as the frozen yogurts. They have a little bit of everything here. Noticed they have small bites/mezze not featured at other locations. (haven't tried yet)

Love that they are able to accommodate "no cheese" and other preferences.

I don't wanna give overpriced salad any compliments but I really did enjoy my bowl of Souvla.

Fresh tasteful ingredients combined with a unique aesthetic. Food is simple and I can't see this ever getting old.

Fries were fresh and the frozen yogurt was also not too sweet. 

Mendocino farms watch out!!

Souvla is a SF classic, and this location definitely lives up to it! There is a special menu here with a couple unique items, but otherwise everything else is the same. The dining area is beautiful and the service was great! Definitely an amazing dining experience :--)

I really really wanted to love Souvla. I first tried it last summer and decided to try to give it another chance today but again, it just missed the spot for me. I ordered the lamb sandwich and it wasn't bad but it wasn't WOW either. I thought the radishes were a bit too bitter in the sandwich and ended up taking them out. I recall wishing I had another sauce on the side to add a bit more flavor to the sandwich. It was packed with lamb and cheese but felt like it was just missing something.

I love the chicken salad Greek style (with fries) at Souvla. The nice thing about the Dogpatch location is their cold and hot meze menu. They had a nice selection that you can just nosh on with a good glass of Greek wine. We had the roasted beet salad, manouri cheese topped with honey, thyme and black pepper, and an extra side of pita bread. This location has a wine bar and plenty of seating, both low and high top tables.  The service was great for a fast casual place. Food came out quickly. We were pretty full and didn't have a chance to order dessert. Will have to come back to try the loukoumades.

This is in *Dogpatch not Potrero Hill but is right next door. It's new, high ceilings and a bar (high top) and plenty of tables inside. It can get busy. We came in around 6 pm before the crowd. But near 7 pm people were waiting in line. They seemed to be low staffed but the staff on site was so nice and made sure to help us even though it got busy. 

One thing I've noticed not just at this location, is the lessening of our ingredients with the years. The green fries now have sparingly cheese. I think the sauce is an add in, they used to be more generous. 

Otherwise can't complain with this location. Not a lot at Dogpatch so another restaurant added is appreciated !

Very yummy! A great meal to eat after climbing at dog patch! I got the lamb wrap (as recommended by the cashier), garlic fries with a side of yogurt, and after my meal i got the Greek yogurt + baklava. Def would go here again! Feels like a healthy choice after climbing and working out hahaha. The lamb tastes great, the fries were alright, the greek yogurt dessert was so good!!! Nice and tangy, with a touch of sweetness from the baklava. I forgot to get a picture of my meal, just the yogurt/baklava. 

Also the interior is super cute! Nice vibe :)

I was really looking forward to trying the new Souvla but it was honestly pretty disappointing. First off it's quite far from downtown but it's easy to get to using muni. 

They have their original menu available that's at the other locations and then they have a meze menu that's specific to the dog patch location. 

The Saganaki was really good. The three dips and octopus had a very fishy after taste which was off putting. Spanakopita was OK but needed more flavor. The three dips were also quite salty. 

Souvla had also promoted this new spot being a wine bar with natural wines. No natural wines available and the wine list was very limited. 

If I were to go back, I'd stick with the original menu.
Always love the food and ambience at Souvla, its your classic "fast food" mediterranean place- no complaints. Good spot to hangout with friends and the sit down area is never too busy :)

Visited Souvla on a weekday evening for dinner for two, which we ordered to go onsite at the restaurant. Their was a line out of the restaurant when we arrived that took about 10 min to go through. Once you arrive at the counter, you place your order and then you have the option to 1) dine inside; but you have to wait for a table to open up or 2) order to go, which must be taken out of the restaurant. Ordering was efficient and quick, which you place with someone else, and took about 10 min before our food was ready

-  lamb sandwich
- frozen Greek yogurt - baklava crumbles and honey syrup

The sandwich/gyro itself was good; the lamb was well cooked and flavorful. It also came topped with cucumber, radish, pickled onion, and feta. We also enjoyed our frozen Greek yogurt a lot but one thing to note is that the flavor we selected is very sweet; definitely from the combination of baklava and honey. We did have to eat this one a bit slowly so we didn't over power our mouth with sweetness.

 Definitely a cute restaurant and cool for a hang out or date but def be prairies for possible lines too!

Definitely not as good as I expected. We got a lamb and pork sandwich and i thought it was too dry. The meat isnt soft and juicy for my liking. Maybe the salad wouldve been the better option?

The frozen yogurt was probably my favorite. The toppings added some sweetness to the frozen yogurt. We actually got it for free, the staff were friendly and nice :)

I would only come back for the frozen yogurt.

I asked the person behind the counter which salad was the best, and he said the chicken, hands down, and it was! The chicken was so juicy and flavorful, and it went super well with the hearty mix of greens. Loved the balance of flavors. As for the froyo, it's kinda pricey at $8, but my husband fell in love with the sour tangy sweetness. I asked them to combine the baklava and sour cherry flavors and it was super tasty. 

Great addition to Dogpatch/Potrero Hill, perfect healthy meal to grab after climbing!

Beautiful, spacious and modern restaurant. 
Order and pay at counter. Place number at open seatings. Friendly staffs. 
Perfect meal after cross fit session. 
Chicken Salad is refreshing and delicious. 
Juicy and flavorful chicken pieces with fresh salad mixed with Greek dressing. 
Healthy and yummy meal. Egg lemon chicken and rice soup is hearty and tasty. 
Greek French fries is crispy outside and soft inside. Greek yogurt is creamy and tart. 
Parking is terrible so prepare to walk a few blocks.

It's really great to see dogpatch turn into a hotspot for cool new food and drink options. 
We stopped by Souvla a couple of weeks after it's opening and were interested to try some of the options that are only available in the dogpatch location.
We got the black sheep salad, the black sheep meatballs, the hot mezze cheese, Greek fries with harissa, and sour cherry froyo. 
The Black sheep option - which is plant-based lamb - was excellent in the salad and tasted almost exactly like spit roasted lamb. However it was underwhelming in the meatballs as it didn't taste of anything in that dish.
The cheese on the hot mezze menu (forget the name) was served on a sizzling plate. It looked like halloumi but didn't taste like it (it was probably a 3/5).
The Greek fries were crispy and flavorful as they are at other locations. And the sour cherry froyo was a perfect balance of sweet and sour. 

Overall we're glad to have this open close to us and we'll be back to try more soon!

This place just opened up near my place so I had to go! I liked the Hayes valley location so I wanted to try out this one.

Good:
Super healthy food always - makes you feel healthy after you eat it. I got the chicken wrap and loved how much it had inside - I feel like I'm always surprised by how full I am after just the one order.

Bad:
- super crowded! We barely got a seat and the staff even warned us that we wouldn't get a seat probably.

Overall had a good time and it's so close that I'll likely give it another try. Food is good but not something out of the world.

Good job Souvla. Loved the little but more upscale concept of this locale. The food here is basically the same as the other locations which is a great thing because I'm a fan. Add wine and beer and now you've literally created my perfect Souvla. All I need is for it to be in San Jose and also include some Greek dancing. Lol 
All in all to say I love it. Thank you for continuing to offer the Black Sheep veg lamb!!!

More like a 3.8
They have additional menu with some mezze.
Most of the food I got was very salty. Maybe it was just yesterday that the food was off.
Their greek yogurt was always great. I came here for that

Food here is on par with the food from the Hayes Valley location. Once you place your order, you're given a number and you can sit wherever you'd like. Food comes out from the kitchen really quickly ! I think I only waited 5 minutes before my food arrived at my table.

The chicken in the chicken salad I ordered was super dry. Definitely would recommend another protein. The fries were crunchy and delicious when dipped in the Greek yogurt sauce. If you're not hungry enough for a full meal, the fries are a great snack.

For $32 excluding tip, this is pretty typical pricing for a meal in San Francisco.

Reading previous reviews, looks like the yogurt is what people come here for.  I was just hungry for lunch.

Stopped by for an early lunch on a weekday around 11:30.  They do NOT allow pets, heads up (and I totally understand).  We had a dog with us so we ended up getting take out to go to Crane Cove nearby.

Ordered the Pork Snake River Farms Salad.  I'm usually not a very big fan on just ordering a salad for a meal, but Souvla changed my mind.  The salad was a decent portion for the price.  It tasted very fresh.  The side of Greek Fries definitely helped with filling my stomach.  Although, the garlic sauce on the side barely tasted of garlic and was more like sour cream if anything.  Then again, I hardly eat Greek cuisine so I don't know much.

Since it was take out, there wasn't much to say about service.  Prompt and courteous, what I would expect normally from an establishment.  Glad this place opened up on 3rd!
Good atmosphere. Fast and friendly service. Our group of five thought the dishes were just "ok". Porky was really tough; way too many olives in another dish. Try the juicy potatoes.

The atmosphere and decor is so nice that I did not know it was an order at the counter kind of place.  The food was really good and came out really quickly.  Definitely a no fuss week day lunch spot.  I had the plant based lamb salad bowl and it was really good.  My friend had the vegetarian wrap and enjoyed it as well.  Would definitely go back.

Not sure if I ordered on a bad day, but all the savory food we got was super salty, including the salad. The fries were good as expected, and the flavor of everything would've been really good if not for the saltiness. The avgolemono soup was filling and unique, and the baklava frozen greek yogurt was perfect as always. They gave us the yogurt in a coffee cup with lid and spoon, which was very convenient for takeout. I'm not really sure how the octopus in olive oil is meant to be eaten because it was also salty, but after I took it home and ate it with rice it was good. I like how the pork salad had a large variety of veggies and toppings. I'd still try this place again in the future to see if it's better, but for now I'll just stick to the yogurt.
It was nice that someone called me to address my concerns. I haven't been back but I appreciate their effort in making it right.

I had an awesome time at Souvla for a nice weekend lunch today! We got the chicken salad, fries, and (of course) the baklava yogurt.

Chicken salad was fresh and delicious, with a nice light sauce, and the juiciest and most flavorful chicken I've had in a salad. They really do not skimp out on chicken, and it definitely made the meal feel worth the price! 

Fries were thick cut and crispy, and eating fries as a side to a salad is always a guilt free and fun pairing.

Yogurt was also so good! The yogurt is tart on it's on it's own, so the balance with the sweet baklava was really nice. I've heard good things about the cherry one too, but generally that is more for palates that enjoy tart and sour tastes.

Will definitely be back!

There Baklava yogurt were amazing! 
cute interior and friendly staff. Came here for a post work treat! There's were other entrees and side items on other's table that looks very delicious too. Will come back to try those!

So happy Souvla is now in this part of town! I've been a huge fan of their salads and Greek yogurt for years. When it comes to parking, this location is definitely the most accessible. It's also the largest of them all and they have a full bar, as well as small dishes (mezes) that the other locations don't have. I just returned from Greece and already miss the simple yet flavorful Mediterranean dishes so I'll definitely be here often. I did a takeout order last night and it was typical great Souvla quality, plus the staff seem genuinely happy to be here.

My first thought is the interior of this location is gorgeous. People were there just to hang out because there's a bar too!

I was really excited because I've heard a lot about Souvla, but I was a bit disappointed with my pork sandwich. The pork was def the highlight, they didn't shy on portions and it was so juicy. But the flavors of the greek yogurt, pickled onion, tomato, etc just weren't jiving. I wish there was more seasoning and freshness. The sandwich was pretty small too, I've paid much less for a bigger sandwich. 

3/5: it's healthy, easy, and a nice place to hang out but I wouldn't come back for a meal considering the prices. Maybe I'll come back for dessert.

Ordered as a group lunch via doordash and everything was so well packed and well labeled. I was very pleasant, despite the fact that I was worried as they don't pick up their calls. People liked the food, nothing was missing, though I thought the chicken was a bit dry. Their extra crunchy fries are not extra crunchy, but maybe it could be due to the food being soggy while it is getting deliverer. But the ingredients used were fresh and we will probably order again.

Fries were fresh and crisp, nicely seasoned with feta. Really, you come here for the soft serve greek yogo, tho. I enjoy it most with just olive oil and sea salt, but any flavour is tasty. My only issue was that the front end staff didn't understand we wanted the food to stay and we ended up waiting a lot longer for our food as they had packed it to go and didn't let us know. 

-a healthy 4.5

As a new San Franciscan, this was our first visit to a Souvla and it didn't disappoint! We have been eyeing this spot while it has been under construction and were very excited to visit for its grand opening this week! This Souvla took over a former brewery and has ample space for seating and noshing with friends. Unlike other Souvlas, this location has an unique mezze menu with cold and warm dishes. 
We tried the three spreads, plant based "lamb" meatballs, fries, spanokopita, pork salad, lamb pita and baclava frozen green yogurt.
The highlights- beautiful & friendly ambiance, many vegan options for our dinner mate, the baclava frozen greek yogurt, spreads, pork salad,
The complaints- the lamb in my pita was a little on the dry side, smallish portions for some of the mezze dishes. Also call me basic but I really wished that 2 of the spreads could have been hummus and baba ganoush as only one of the spread was vegan so my friend couldn't enjoy it much. 
Definitely will be coming back for more, as I'm still dreaming about the Greek yogurt!

Is this the best salad in the world? Nope. Is it affordable? Maybe for SF's standards. Do I get swept away to Greece every time I eat here? Not really. Then what makes Souvla so good? It's consistent, it's tasty, and the service is lightning fast. I also was pretty excited to try their exclusive meze menu at this location! This time around my party order the octopus salad and the saganaki. The octopus salad was really tasty! The octopus was super tender and had the right amount of acidity with the dressing. The saganaki was really tasty as well! My suggestion is that you eat the cheese right away since it gets hard once you've left it sit for a while. Overall, you know what you get when you come here (if you've been to the other Souvla locations)!

I'm a big fan of Souvla, so I was thrilled to see a new location open up. The food has been consistent (Mission and NoPa are better), however, the service at this location has been disappointing compared to other Souvlas I've been to. I've visited this location several times and each time, I've encountered some sort of issue. For example, today they forget salad dressing in my to go order, and by the time I realized, it was too late to do anything about it since I was already home. Every salad should come with dressing as default and I don't understand how they forgot to include it. 

On another occasion, I pre-ordered soft serve and was asked to pick it up later, but when I picked it up 1.5 hours later, I was met with resistance and told they would only allow it this one time since it was too late. I don't understand why they allow pre order if we already paid for it and it was well below closing time (3 p.m.).

Large salads and I love that they have a tasty vegetarian option. But the last couple times I've ordered from this location the food has been too salty. I wish that it could be a more healthy option but I'm afraid that it's really high in sodium.
Chicken sandwich so yummy so good Im still sitting in here it's beautiful I feel blessed and shocked

Very cool atmosphere. Food was good but the gyros were not very big. The other dishes were fun to try but not worth getting again. I also liked the Greek yogurt dessert. Not sure if I'll be back anytime soon.

Food right on!
Ambiance groovy!
Service... meh. Their menu layout is just a bit confusing. I worked through it though and had a delicious meal. No diet drinks though except water.
Lovely new spot in my neighborhood. Always love the salads and baklava yogurt is just amazing. Definitely coming back.

The food is good, consistent with the other Souvla but every time I order for pick-up and get notified the food is ready, we always end up waiting for another 5-10 mins. Parking is tough around here so quick pick-ups are essential. Otherwise I would give the place a solid 4 star. Hopefully they work the kinks out for pick-ups soon.

Woohoo another Souvla location that opened up in SF and in my neighborhood too! I've previously ordered delivery or take out from their other locations. Ordered at the counter at 6:38pm and my food started to come out at 6:45pm! That is speedy service! Ordered the lamb salad, fries and yogurt to share with my partner. It was a filling meal. The fries were crispy and starchy. The salad had so many things in it! It had lettuce, baby kale, radish, both small and big pieces of lamb, micro greens, cheese, dressing, pickled red onions, and mini cucumbers. It was delicious! The lamb was not dry and it had great flavor. The sour cherry Greek yogurt was a nice treat to finish off the meal. Make sure you dig all the way to the bottom where most of the sour cherry syrup is. The employees were hard at work. They were willing to take your order, were fast to sweep the floor and clear tables and even thanked us for coming. It's rare these days to receive this kind of service when it's not a fine dining restaurant.

Wildly disappointing. Let me preface this by saying that I've long been a fan of the Divisadero location and was looking forward to the opening of the Dogpatch spot. They don't even feel like the same establishment. Whenever I've gone to the Divis location I've felt like I paid a reasonable amount for what I was being served. At this location I felt like I was getting greasy fast food under the guise of sit down service, along with overpriced mediocre wine. What made the wine part even more of a joke is that all of the marketing for the new location suggested a focus on greek wines and that it would be more similar to a wine bar -- the woman behind the bar couldn't even understand what wine I was asking for much less answer any of my questions about it. 

As far as the food goes, skip the rotisserie chicken. I don't understand how something could be simultaneously so dry and so greasy? Also the new menu items aren't at all worth it and they would have done better to focus on executing very few menu items well using high quality ingredients (like how they used to do before opening a ghost kitchen for delivery orders and making airplane food). 

The location was the only thing about the experience that felt nice, but not so much that the cost felt remotely justified. We wound up feeling so ripped off by the experience that we now use it as a measure of whether or not a place is worth the money.  Don't waste your money here.

Happy to see this location near my hood. The new space is spacious with high ceiling and looks very inviting! Went here during the heatwave and it needed some fans. The food is excellent as always. The lamb salad was succulent and was enough to share among 2. We got an order of fries to share and it was enough for a light dinner.  The Kennebec fried were crunchy outside and creamy inside. The best fries sound! Gender neutral bathroom was clean and well maintained. Service was prompt and courteous. Oh and the yogurt is still delectable! Def coming back here again!
I love this location for the feta brined chicken and fried cheese. I dream of them offering a sandwich of both!

Service while ordering at the front counter was great, but I was disappointed with my first visit to this new location. I know my experience could have been much better based on my previous experiences at the other locations and expect better in future visits.

My two grievances: 
1) the soup was mostly broth and didn't contain much rice or chicken 
2) the french fries were stale and not fresh or crispy and did not come with ketchup

These opportunities to improve could be attributed to the restaurant closing within an hour and the logistics in the kitchen. I will continue to patronize Souvla when the craving arises.
Terrible service for overpriced food. The sassy lady working the counter on 3/6/23 should find a job she'll be happier at.
I love the vibe but the food is a little disappointing. The ingredients are fresh but not very flavorful. The only dish that stood out is the green fries.

I have to say I love sea food and I heard wonderful things about this place called Souvla and I went to the one on 3rd st and I was mesmerized by the place and the environment but then I was attended by this wonderful and also beautiful girl from Mexico called Veronica and she recommended me the chilled octopus salad and I must say I have tried octopus dishes in sf but this one was the best yet ever made in a salad 10out of 10 for the service and the salad also with this wonderful wine called Syria if I remember well recommend by the vero thank you vero and thank you Souvla .
New menu! Loved the donuts with honey and walnuts! Great pairing with the classic froyo w/ honey!

After years of loving the Souvla on Divisadero when I lived & worked nearby and wishing they had a veggie protein option I was happy to hear the new Dogpatch location had veggie lamb. I got the salad, which was yummy, but I am disappointed & dismayed that they use a racist term for it, "black sheep", really?!! If your slogan is "Make it Nice and be Nice" you are NOT living up it Souvla.

I had the chicken sandwich & avgolemono soup with pita bread... let me just say that the sandwich was horrible. If you look at the bottom it's drenched with oil (not sure if it's olive oil) but it's an exaggeration amount to say the least. My hand was as if I dipped it in a barrel of oil. I lost my appetite after I took the first bite, tasted a ton of oil and saw my hand drenched in it. I've never had food like this. I will say that the soup was delicious along with the pita bread. I returned the sandwich and just went with the soup. Never again will I eat here unless I want just a soup and pita.

I am obsessed with this place. Everytime I go to the city , I will make it a point to swing by here. I highly recommend the salad (I switch between the pork and chicken) and the sandwich wraps (also switch between the pork and chicken). The Greek fries are also a must that I like to add on as a side dish with the main meal. After the meal , I usually like to get the Greek yogurt with honey (which I highly recommend!!!).

The menu is confusing and frustratingly limited. Food is slightly healthier than average Greek food, but not as tasty as a standard strip mall gyro place. The woman at the counter was aggressively rude.

I love Souvla! I get it all the time, this location to be specific. Their food is amazing! I always get the chicken salad greek style. 10/10.
Unfortunately today I went to pick up my online order and the lady working the register was extremely rude. Every time I come the employees are amazing but this specific employee was really rude. First, I waited at the counter for awhile for her to acknowledge me and when she did, she gave me my order which I responded with thank you and she didn't care at all. She didn't even look at me or nothing, just tossed the bag on the counter. I then asked if I could get forks because they always give me them without asking so I had no idea there was a charge for it. She tossed them in my bag and rudely said "for future references you have to pay" which I respect but she just had the most nasty attitude towards me. I would've paid as well at that moment, that wasn't the problem. I felt so uncomfortable I took the utensils out of my bag and gave it back to her. I understand people have bad days but I literally barely even talked nor was I rude AT ALL and she was giving me the worse customer service. I let her know she was being very rude once I left. I never do negative yelp reviews but I was really upset with the way she was towards me.

We ordered from Souvla lunch for attendees for a meeting at work.  The process was super easy and seamless and I was able to order for delivery on a future date so timing was perfect ! We mainly ordered salads and each one was very enjoyed. I personally had the chicken salad which was so flavorful. This was my first time eating there but definitely not the last!
You haven't been to the city if you hadn't tried Soulva's juicy potatoes! We love coming here and filling our tummy's up with the fresh chicken and ending the meal with frozen Greek yogurt!

We waited with anticipation for months for Souvla to open (delayed) and finally went last night. The space is lovely. Vibe is good. But why is ordinary Greek food so expensive? $10 for a skinny piece of spanakopita which wasn't that good. The dolmas were just OK. And, OK, so all the wine and beer is from Greece, but a 12 oz. IPA for $15? C'mon. I did like the 250ml pour on the wine for $15. Sadly, I will probably not go back (and I'm half Greek).

French fries were completely amazing and maybe the best in SF.  I don't usually like 'flavored' fries (I eat them plain - just extra salt, no ketchup).  These have some lemon and maybe some kind of cheese - so I was super skeptical - but they were sooooooooo good

It's soft opening at the moment. Previously, opened to private events & to-go orders.

The space has been renovated and refreshed from its previous tenant, Magnolia Brewery. 

You can never go wrong w/ the baklava soft serve!!!

This is a copycat Nick the Greek but twice as expensive and not as flavorful. We tried their Greek fries, Chicken salad, chicken sandwich, and the frozen yogurt. Their fries taste like they're from a concession stand, their chicken tastes like the dried up rotisserie chicken from Costco, and the overall flavor of everything was bland. No amount of sauces could fix this. Their salads are ok, but anything else on the menu is a waste of money. If you want Greek, I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND this place.

Souvla is it!!! I really enjoyed my experience here last night. I got to try to chicken salad, the fries, the soup, and even the greek yogurt with baklava crumbles!! The service is fast and the employees are super kind and accommodating! The inside was a little small but it was not an issue and I was able to find a table easily. I love the bowls and cups they use it just really works with the whole energy and ambiance of the restaurant.

I wish they had more locations outside of SF because I'd be there for that chicken salad weekly!!

Been wanting to try Souvla for a while but never got around to it. Thankfully I was in the neighborhood and it was late in the day where I knew there wouldn't be much of a lunch crowd. 

Ordered the lamb salad, greek fries, and honey Greek yogurt. You can order for dine in or to go and it's self seating. There's also a really nice outdoor seating area if you prefer to sit outside. 

Service was pretty quick. Got my food 5-10 minutes after I ordered. And if you order the greek yogurt you can get it after your meal. 

Lamb Salad - definitely hearty, I think the dressing could have been a little more watery to balance out the dryness of the lamb; the greens were refreshing (especially since it was a warm day)

Greek fries - came out piping hot with a side of ketchup. You could also upgrade it with other sauces but the fries were good enough on its own. 

Greek Yogurt - the MVP of the meal; super refreshing and light, exactly how I imagined frozen yogurt to taste like and the honey drizzle lent a nice sweetness to the tart yogurt 

Definitely will consider trying the sandwich/wrap next time and maybe the chicken or pork.

always an easy decision to go to souvla. it's one of the healthier options on chestnut and has both indoor and outdoor seating. 

chicken wrap: looks small but is actually super filling because once you think you're almost done with the wrap, there's still a bunch more chicken at the bottom of the wrap 

fries: solid flavor but i wish i got sauce to go with them because they were a little dry 

baklava crumbles and honey syrup greek yogurt: SO good sometimes i randomly think about it from time to time. the sweet part of the baklava perfectly balances with the sour greek yogurt 

also have gotten white wine and rose wine here before and they are both pretty normal

I can only speak on the frozen Greek yogurt from here. But what I can say about it, is that it is delicious! The olive oil and flaky salt is my go-to and it might sound a bit weird but don't question it. I wouldn't say it's for everyone but i think they really compliment each other. It's also a pretty light dessert even though it's all dairy and is super refreshing even after a heavy dinner. I also recommend any of the other toppings or even plain. I've been to a few locations and they all have cute but small interiors with limited seating. Service is good and fast.

I am obsessed with Souvla's frozen greek yogurt. It isn't like traditional frozen yogurt, as it's more tangy, but not overwhelmingly so. It's the perfect dessert, and it's light enough that you can still feel good after devouring it all. I meant to take a picture before I started eating it, but couldn't hold myself back. The baklava crumbles and honey are a perfect complement to the greek yogurt. One day I'll branch out and try another topping, but for now the baklava is too delicious to not to get it every time.

This review is purely based on their Greek yogurt! 

I'm a Greek yogurt type of girl and when I saw that they had frozen Greek yogurt, I knew I had to try it.  When I first ordered it, I ordered the one with honey and baklava crumbles, but I was afraid that it would be too sweet with the honey so I asked them to omit that.  To my surprise, I realized that the yogurt itself is super tart and not sweet at all.  If you don't like Greek yogurt, you probably won't like this plain as it has that strong greek yogurt flavor, but I didn't mind it at all.  They also don't skimp out on the toppings.  They really hook you up.

It's Greek fast-food. Typical menu and a bit bland. 

The service is good. The fries are good and so is the Greek red wine. Wine is reminiscent of Greece, but better. 

Last, the frozen yogurt is great and definitely worth the visit if you like greek yogurt. Add on the cherry, honey, and baklava.

This Mediterranean restaurant and was blown away by the delicious Greek food on offer. The menu was filled with a variety ofGreek dishes such as pitas, salads and Greek yogurt all of which were cooked to perfection and full of flavor. The portions were also generous, which was much appreciated.

The decor of the restaurant was also lovely and fun, with bright colors and traditional Greek artwork adorning the walls. The ambiance was lively and upbeat, and it made for a great dining experience.

The staff were also incredibly friendly and attentive, they were happy to make recommendations based on your preferences, and they were patient in explaining the different dishes available. They were also keen to know my opinion about the food I tried.

Overall, I highly recommend this Mediterranean restaurant for anyone looking for delicious Greek food and a fun dining experience. The menu is diverse, the quality of the food is consistently high, and the prices are very reasonable. The decor and atmosphere is also lovely, making it

Bright, bustling Souvla location in the Marina. Came in for a quick to go bite and their service was fast.

Hate to give this three stars, but I just didn't love it. I'm pretty particular about my mediterranean sandwiches. I wish that they had a falafel sandwich option, but they only had the roasted white sweet potato. It isn't wrapped super well since it all manages to fall apart as you eat it. Sandwich also is rather dry since there's no hummus or sauce. Not my fave unfortunately, but I did like the frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles! Very refreshing, tarte, and light -- complimentary to the pistachio baklava and the sweetness of the honey syrup.

Again, I'm not a huge fan, but maybe I need to try their other protein options? Not sure.

Came in for lunch and got the pork sandwich, lamb sandwich, and greek fries. 

Our food came out super super quick and the cashier was very nice and answered all our questions!!

The fries were yummy and the sandwiches were a decent portion size. We both agreed the lamb was better than the pork; I personally thought the lamb had a more richer flavor between the two. They also both came with loads of veggies, so it had a nice bite. Would probably get extra dressing on the side to dip with next time though. 

We saw others get the salad and they looked like pretty huge, so will need to try that + the frozen greek yogurt next time!

This place is awesome for a quick lunch! I love how fresh and colorful their ingredients are. 

The menu is really small, which makes for an easy decision. I ordered a Chicken Salad Bowl with fries on the side. Everything tasted great, but it would've been perfect if the fries had been served hot! They came out lukewarm and quickly got cold. Hot fries are a must. 

Overall, this is a great, bright space to grab a quick bite. All of the options seem filling and healthy! Would love to try the Lamb Bowl next time.

Souvla for the soul

Great quality and fresh ingredients in the lamb sandwich. 
Crunchy, fresh and hot greek fries

Friendly service, goofy portraits
Would go back

I have come to this location before, so I decided to bring my friends here. I was a little disappointed honestly. We were able to find seating outdoors. It was nice to sit in the sun for about 10 minutes until I started turning red. The food came fast but it did not live up to my expectations like it had before. 

Items ordered: 

~Chicken Sandwich: The Sandwich in general was dry. It could use less chicken and more Greek salad including tomatoes and cucumbers. All I could taste in a bite was the dry chicken. I wish it had more sauce or yogurt. 

~Lamb Sandwich: This had too much meat and little salad. It had way too much radish. The lamb was dry and unseasoned to our liking. 

~Pork Sandwich: Pork was a little dry, but the salad to meat ratio was good. It could've used a little more sauce. This was the best one out of the three! 

~The stars of the show were the sides including juicy potatoes, side salad, and Greek fries. We were a group of three and easily finished the sided before our sandwiches. 

Disappointed ngl as I was bringing my friends here to a place I had once liked a lot.
Cute spot (although a bit small and communal seating is a bit tough for more than a couple people) with fresh Greek food. The roast chicken special with yogurt and lamb sandwich was yummy.

I had an appointment in the Marina and we were a little early, so we decided to stop by Souvla for an afternoon snack. Amongst the three of us, we shared two frozen Greek yogurts- one Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt and one Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup. I love Greek yogurt so I had pretty high expectations, but Souvla definitely met it! 

The yogurt has a really great texture and is just the right amount of tart. I personally liked the Baklava Crumble & Honey Syrup one since the baklava gave it a crunchy texture (like granola). My mom loved the Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt flavor though and thought it was really unique and different. 

Looking forward to coming back to try their salads and savory foods!

The lamb was very gamy.
The fries were meh...how can you ruin fries. Won't be back.

My first impression of the food was how fresh everything tasted. The veggies were so crisp and tasty. The meat was very tender. I wish the meat was a tad saltier, but honestly, it tasted great and tasted healthy (no guilt here ).

The garlic sauce was good and not too overpowering. The fries were good and had a good texture. Not soggy, but not dried out or burned as many restaurants do.

The frozen Greek yogurt was good! I tried the tart cherry and it was satisfying, but not too sweet. I'll definitely come back for more healthy food!

This place has indoor and outside seating. I went on a Monday night & it was packed. I've had the chicken salad a few times but got the veggie salad this time. It was good. I'd recommend both. The frozen Greek yogurt w/sour cherry is to die for. I could've eaten 2! It's a good size.  Most everything is tasty. I highly recommend!

Five stars for the Greek fries and baklava greek yogurt!
The chicken was tender and flavorful, however, I did find the wrap difficult to eat while holding since there are so many contents inside. I would opt for the salad next time for ease of consumption! The portion size is generous. 

The Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup Frozen Yogurt was my favorite. Semi-sweet frozen yogurt, it has the zesty flavor of Greek yogurt but the consistency and texture of frozen yogurt. The baklava crumbles are sweet and jam-packed with flavor, and complement the Greek yogurt well. Pairs nicely with Greek fries to satiate a sweet and salty craving.

Souvla exceeded expectations! The food deserves all of the acclaim it receives. We ordered chicken and lamb salads. Both were incredibly fresh and bursting with flavor. The dressing was so unique and tasty. The Greek fries were perfectly cook, hot and delicious. The Greek yogurt should not be missed. We tried the Greek olive oil & flaky salt and the Baklava crumbles and honey syrup. The yogurt would have been good on it's own as it's THE BEST Greek yogurt I've ever had. Prices are a wee bit high for fast, casual food but it's so good it's worth it. We ate at the Hayes street location and were lucky to snag a table. I can't wait for Souvla to open in Marin in 2023!

Lovely light lunch on a hot day.  A refreshing wrap with pork & veg. And a perfect way to cool down with the Baklava crumble & honey with Greek yogurt ice cream.... Sooo good $8.  Simple menu, easy ordering with wine & beer menu too.

A client stopped in and she got carryout from Souvla. Smelled so good!

Ordered the sandwich (wrap) of Pork +Greek toppings, pita bread with cherry tomatoes, romaine salad, feta, and Greek yogurt. A few Greek French fries tossed in too!

F'n fabulous!

Souvla was recommended to me by numerous friends and I was quite happy with my experience. First, the staff is super friendly and makes you feel at home! The ambiance of the restaurant is also great and it's quite busy. We got the gyros which were juicy bout a bit too oily. We also got the fries with garlic tzatziki. My friend who is Greek said the food was not that authentic but still pretty yummy. The pita was okay

A new favourite in the city when it comes to fresh, delicious salads and wraps. Souvlas menu is simple but at the same time offers great variety of options from lamb, pork or chicken ... you can either have a salad or make it into a wrap. And the best part is the chicken is a rotisserie chicken. Their yogurts are pretty good too, so you can have your dessert too!

Tried two kinds of their frozen Greek yogurt:

First, let's talk about the yogurt itself: unlike traditional Greek yogurt which tends to be incredibly sour and thick in its original form, their plain yogurt is a bit more thin and weak in taste - which makes them easier to eat in my opinion. Their yogurt has the smell of lactic acid bacteria fermentation, but the flavor of the milk itself is barely noticeable. In other words, it is a little bit "boring " when we were only tasting the yogurt without adding other things to it. If you are someone who is looking for your "traditional" Greek yogurt experience, there is a chance that you'll be disappointed.

Wildflower honey Greek yogurt: at the first few tried, the combination tasted pretty good because the honey adds a special taste to the yogurt. The honey has the right level of sweetness which my friend and I both like, but we both think the scent of wildflowers couldn't be tasted. Something that we don't appreciate about the honey is it quickly sticks together into pieces (probably because the yogurt was too cold) and can't be mixed with the yogurt anymore. So if you get the wildflower one, make sure you stir them up quickly!

baklava crumbles with honey Greek yogurt : the server forgot to gave us honey that day, but we didn't mind and just went with it. The crumbles is surprisingly a better combination with the yogurt because it adds more layers to the yogurt and makes it flavorful. The scrambles has a cinnamon flavor so it's a good news to those who like cinnamon. I personally am not a fan of cinnamon but I actually like it.

Overall, a healthy option for breakfast and light afternoon snack.

FOOD: Highly recommend the wraps. I haven't tried the salads yet bc I keep going back to the wraps. My favorite is the Mary's Free Range Chicken or the Pork Shoulder ones. For the chicken wrap, there's bits of orange in there to help change up the flavors. Also, def get fries!!!! TIP: Pour the fries out onto the tray right away so every fry stays crunchy! 

DESSERT: Save room in your tummy for the froyo! Or just make room for froyo, it's worth it. My favorite is the baklava + honey or the cherry syrup. 

SERVICE: Employees are quick. Order at the counter and they'll give you a number. Sit anywhere you like indoors/outdoors.

PARKING: difficult to find depending on time of day. There's a lot near by but mostly just street parking. Best if you walk/Uber.

The first couple of times I had souvla, I was pretty blown away. So good so fresh and so delicious! I love the salads and the wraps are great too. Recently though, and maybe due to just this location, I haven't been as satisfied. It's still good food, but I often get fatty pieces of pork or don't get enough dressing. The last time I ordered, the sandwich was pretty oily. I'll definitely be back, just want to find the right location.

We stopped by here after seeing it on a tik-tok, haha! So glad we did! 

Visiting this shop is like a little trip over seas to Greece. Outside the shop are various signs with Greek and English inscriptions, all with the classic blue and white color scheme. There is both indoor and outside patio dining available with high and low top tables (Note you must have your vaccination card to sit indoors at restaurants in SF). As well as a to-go window for pick up from the outside. I loved the water spicket and bowls they had out front for our doggies! So sweet! 

The staff are so friendly and kind, and the service is really fast!

I had the pork souvlaki sandwich was good, I think the pork was a little more of a tough texture than I was expecting, but it was still delicious! I might try the chicken next time. The sandwich itself was amazing. A large portion filled with meat, tomatoes, cucumber, feta, and their mint sauce. SO GOOD!

The mint yogurt sauce they have is their own made in house version of tzaziki sauce. I thought it was super yummy! 

My friend got the baklava yogurt and loved it. The Greek fries were amazing as well! We put some in our pita sandwich :) 

Definitely a great shop and we will be back again!

I will not be returning to Souvla establishments as my last experience was absolutely grotesque and they do not take food safety and cleanliness seriously!! I did not want to bring it to yelp, but the poor customer service and follow up was also disappointing. I ordered my usual chicken salad here the other week Togo via DoorDash and picked it up. When I got home to enjoy my salad, I  was not pleasantly surprised to find a bug in the lettuce and a piece of BROKEN PLASTIC mixed in. when I initially encountered the bug, I tried to contact the restaurant and called 3x but no one answered. Then I found the plastic and was disgusted so I tried to call them again with no response. I ended up going down to the restaurant and showed them the object in the food and asked for a refund. They said to email them and took my info and that someone would contact me. NO ONE FROM SOUVLA EVER contacted me about this. Thankfully, I ordered my food via door dash and contacted them. They were awesome and promptly apologized and said they would investigate this further. They also refunded me. 

Too bad I really liked this place, but sadly will never eat there again because I am absolutely disgusted at the lack of health, safety, and cleanliness of this place. Not to mention the lack of follow up regarding a matter of food safety.

I stopped in for a quick snack and left excited to visit again for a full meal. I had the side salad and pita.. both simple, but exceptional. The salad was fresh, flavorful, a tasty. The pita was soft, spongy, and tender; it was cooked to perfection by my standards. The restaurant was packed at 3pm on a Saturday, but my group was able to get a table outside immediately after ordering. I'm looking forward to going back to try an entree!

This is a place that definitely lives up to the hype!!! We came on a Friday evening, and there was no crowd/rush at all. They also had plenty of outdoor seating at peak dinner time. I really enjoyed the fast-fine dining experience here. As vegetarians, we shared the VEG sandwich + fries + baklava greek yogurt. (A perk was that they were able to cleanly cut the sandwich in half for us!) We also each got what we thought would be a glass of wine, but ended up being 1/3 of a bottle, served in a really cute copper mug. All of the food was super good. I loved that the veg option was sweet potato, as opposed to the standard falafel. I also loved the harissa-yogurt dip we got for the fries. Of course, the star of the show was the frozen greek yogurt, topped with honey and a huge hunk of baklava. We are definitely going to return here just for that!

We did have a little sticker shock (our meal came to $55 before tip) but it made sense considering how much wine we got. The portion sizes were also pretty big for the city-- a single sandwich fed me and my fiancee, and we had leftover fries-- so we do feel like it was a pretty good bang for your buck, relative to SF prices. This particular location is super convenient to Marin also. It took us less than 20 minutes to get there from Tiburon!

I was excited to try Souvla, as I have heard amazing things and have a newer Mediterranean food itch. My boyfriend and I were pretty disappointed with the chicken and lamb sandwiches. Both lacked flavor, to the extent that we wondered if they forgot to add sauce to our meals! I was expecting the pita to be fluffier, and both sandwiches were very oily. Not sure if ordering takeout affected our experience..

Lots of my friends hyped this place up as the go-to lunch spot, for something healthy and delicious; that's exactly what it turned out to be. Fresh ingredients, perfectly cooked juicy meat, and great seasoning brings their food together. 

We got the lamb salad (meat was super juicy) and there was plenty of feta and the perfect amount of dressing - it was a very refreshing meal for lunch and perfectly filling. We also got some greek fries which were wonderfully crispy with lots of oregano and parsley - a little hot sauce made them perfect.

Overall would say Souvla lives up to the hype as a go-to lunch spot. Can't wait to try the frozen yogurt next time!

What I love the most about this restaurant was it great service of everyone in here! 

The salad was so delicious and I like that the wine was affordable and tasty. 

They have seating areas inside and outside and even the one inside was so I'm ample and  comfortable.
This has been my favorite food in SF. Quick service, good meal portion size. The Greek fries were perfection and the chicken wrap was DIVINE!!! Must try!

Fast casual spot!! I used to come here when I lived in SF all the time. I have to come every time I visit for lunch. I like the chicken on the lamb set up as a gyro or salad. The Greek fries are amazing with the harissa or granch Greek yogurt dips. Also, the Greek yogurt with wildflower honey or the baklava crumbles and honey are both great it's not super sweet. This location is my go to. They have a neighborhood discount. I wish they would open in LA I really think LA is missing out on souvla and we don't have anything like this!!
If you haven't tried the Greek yogurt with baklava you truly have not lived!! This is top tier yogurt and the perfect consistency of baklava. Souvla will forever have my heart because of this

Outdoor dining on Chestnut St as the Covid thing is still prevalent...I'm sure it feels safe if you're not vaccinated
Great lamb with Greek salad and a beer for a cheap (for SF) price

I know it's a chain, but it's a good one and well worth it

I have a love affair with Mediterranean food. I also love a salad. This is where Souvla comes in. They have an interesting take on mediterranean salad, not just your standard tomatoes and cucumbers ( which I love and could eat daily, but not enough to call it a meal). The Souvla salads are a meal. They have a mix of kale and lettuce, meat, a bit a citrus, herbs and a lovely dressing perfect to sop up with the fries. The flavors are perfectly balanced. 

The food is fast, fresh and feels like it's healthy. 

Whenever I am looking for a fast, healthy meal after the gym I love to stop by here and grab a chicken salad. Sometimes add fries, which are delicious.
