Also the frozen greek yogurt with baklava is fantastic and I crave it often.

There are no bad choices here.  You have two choices:  sandwich or salad.  For the salads, you can mix and match the protein with any of their 4 salad combinations.  My daughter ordered the chicken salad but replaced the chicken with the veggie option (sweet potatoes). 

But wait!  Do not eat your entire entree!  Save some room for their delicious yogurt with one of 4 different topping options.   That way, you can have your leftovers the following day for lunch!

FIND HAIR IN MY ORDER!  
Oh my God, I found hair in my mouth when I ate salad from this "restaurant".  How do you allow things like this when you are called a restaurant?  
Disgusting and Disgusting how you were allowed to open a restaurant with such omissions!  
Do you work in lingerie or in uniform?!
I threw money and time for your worthless lunch!

Stopped by and just got the greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles. The cashier was able to put it all together while I was paying. So I liked that my order was quick and I didn't have to wait. It's a bit of a pricey dessert - $6+.  But the froyo tasted tart and fresh. I liked the baklava crumbles too - great flavor. But could've used a bit more and they were all on the top so I ran out quick. I would try maybe layering them. I have been to other Souvla's  and have tried their lamb and chicken -both were delicious.

GREEK ON THE GO
Overall pretty good experience here. Had the lamb salad, fries, and the baklava Greek yogurt which was excellent. If you want a quick Greek bite this is a no frills place to get your fix

COVID-19 Review:

There is one line to place your order, and a second line to pick up your food. They will call your name when your take out is ready.

I ordered the pork shoulder salad, and it was extremely oily. Very hard to eat. The salad on the bottom of the pork was soaked in the oil and was soggy after 10 minutes. I really liked the pickled onions that they added, and the flavor of the pork shoulder. 

Street metered parking only, unless you park a little further and walk over.

While I got the Side Salad & Greek Fries, my friends got the Chicken Salad (which I cannot attest to, however, they said it was good!) I don't have the biggest appetite but I felt like the Side Salad was a good portion (despite how much smaller it looks in comparison to the Chicken Salad) and the Greek Fries were crispy and delicious. Both of my friends had leftovers of their salad because the portions are so good. I didn't use any of the "Granch" but my friends also said it was delicious! My total came up to be $11 which is pretty good, in my opinion.

Tasty, quick and filling! The free range chicken sandwich is fantastic.  There aren't many vegetarian options. Only the roasted white sweet potato  which makes for a filling salad but doesn't have much else. 
The fries are a hit or miss, depending how long they've been out there. 

Get the Baklava Froyo ! It is to die for, worth the indulgence.

Enjoyed every bite of the lamb leg salad and then topped it off with a frozen Greek yogurt with a drizzle of olive oil! Now I'm stuffed.
Great food with friendly staff too, this place is a gem.

I. Love. Their. Ice cream!!! 
I'm from out of town and every time I visit San Francisco, I have to stop by Souvla.
Couldn't find anything like that anywhere!
Can't wait to have another one soon!
I basically come to sf for souvla

I order souvla once a week. I get the vegetarian sweet potato sandwich or salad. I could keep talking about how good it is but I recommend everyone should try for themselves. The frozen yogurt is to die for too with the baklava crumbles.
We are still waiting for you to make it to SoCal. When one is in the mood to get Greek flavors on the quick, you can never go wrong with Souvla.

Thinking I'd save some time and money, I ordered for pick up directly from website. I get it, with inflation, yada yada yada, I'm still all about supporting local businesses but at $20 a salad, how are you trying to charge me an extra $2 for each fork and a napkin, then treat me as if I'm a beggar because I refused to pay the extra fee. With additional SF fees and tip added to that $20 salad, I just don't understand how the price of a plastic fork isn't already included in your ridonculous fees? Genuinely curious.

Service was amazing but food was not authentic and I feel like my dog eats better than what was served to me. Honestly, paying $50 for the most below average food is not it and I suggest you save your money and go elsewhere.

I have only had the frozen yogurt but it is so super delicious. Flavor is perfect. A little tart, not too sweet, creamy and simple. I had the baklava crumbles and honey. I need to go back and try all the other flavors too.

I don't have anything negative to say about this location except for the bar chairs in the outside seating. Everything else is perfection! I love everything about souvla. My go to is always the lamb salad, Greek fries, and the yogurt with baklava. Everyone has to try their yogurt with baklava it's really something out of this world! The quality of food is just wonderful, always fresh and light. Meat is always juicy and everything is full of flavor. Whenever I'm feeling like a salad i either go to souvla or to blue barn.
Best spot for frozen yogurt. Your order comes out immediately, there's outdoor seating, and the employees are extremely kind. Souvla doesn't need you, you need Souvla. Don't miss out :)

My husband and I were walking around in the Marina and decided to try this place out. And boy am I glad that we did. We shared a lamb salad and a chicken wrap. You could tell that all of the ingredients were fresh and sourced locally. This is some of the best Mediterranean food that I have been able to find in the Bay. I thought this place couldn't get any better until I tried their greek yogurt. Their greek yogurt with baklava crumbles is to DIE FOR. This food definitely added to my hubby and I's city day!

Big fan of Souvla!!! 

My go-to order is Chicken Salad Greek Style!! (Greek style is with some of there delish green fries for +$1) there salads come with half romaine and half kale but you can also do all kale or all romaine! The meal always tastes fresh and is both tangy and creamy! 

Also there Greek yogurt is a great treat!

I've passed this shop a few times & checked it out on Yelp & placed an order online. Super easy to order & customize as needed. I ordered a chicken wrap (no onions), Greek fries & a frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumble. The sandwich was perfectly filling & the mild flavored sandwich had tender chicken pieces & a nice surprise of citrus. The garlic fries were good & I reheated them in my oven for a bit more crispness since I was a little late to pick up my order since I was running another errand. The frozen Greek yogurt with honey & baklava was sooo yummy. I will definitely return when I'm in the mood for a quick, easy meal.

Always come here because the "sandwiches" are delicious and their froyo cannot be beat! Friends and family usually are happy. 

Only issue is sometimes the quality can be inconsistent (at the end of a Friday, I find the bread for the sandwiches will be much drier and the ingredients a bit stale). Prices could also be perceived as a little high, but it is at parity with the rest of Chestnut St

I'm always looking for fast casual greek establishments for my I-dont-feel-like-cooking weekday rotation, but Souvla did not make the band. Overall the FroYo was a 5/5 but my meal was a 3/5. Prices are  high - salad is close to $20 - but quantity is also generous  so might be a wash.

The FroYo deserves a spot on every SF dessert bucket list - hands down the crown jewel of Souvla. It is unlike any "natural" flavor I have tasted -  very fresh, creamy, and what I imagine to eat while strolling through a Turkish village. It is filled to the brim in a large cup. I got the wildflower syrup which is so sweet that it foils nicely against yogurts pungent tang. 

The salad has visual appeal  -- a gram worthy preparation - greens topped with juicy radishes, micro green, and cheese. My issue fell to taste. The dressing had no salt or acidity to cut through a dense bed of  bitter kale. I was able to resuscitate it with a heavy hand of Tapatio and salt. The "greek" fries were nothing special, thick cut and crispy, but non descript flavor. 

My rec is that the chefs go back to test kitchen to reinvent a more yummy salad/dressing combo. Souvla already has a solid base - stronger flavor profiles would make it SO much better!

One of my favorite spots for some fresh and healthy Mediterranean food. My go-to is the chicken salad which has shredded chicken onto of a variety of greens, orange, red onions and mizithra cheese. Their "Granch" dressing  is amazing and ties it all together. The salads are pricey but filling. 

Whenever I come here I always tell my friends they have to get the frozen Greek yogurt Baklava! It is so tasty and not too sweet or too heavy. The baklava and honey make a sweet crumble and balance the smooth and tangy yogurt.

Definitely the worst Greek restaurant experience ever. From service to food. Very slow, not tasty, not healthy food. This place is definitely bad and not worth the money spent. Old cooking oil, are you serious? I just threw out everything I ordered. This is absolutely not what you want to spend your money on. I recommend trying other restaurants in our wonderful city, your experience will definitely be better. Never again spend a penny in Souvla.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Presidio of San Francisco, San Francisco, CA

reviews.text: For a quick lunch place, you can't beat it. Delicious lamb with spicy yogurt sauce and the salad was very fresh. What really blew me away was my dessert. Greek yogurt with Greek olive oil and sea salt flakes. Outrageous combination of three delicious ingredients that made the whole experience a party for my taste buds.

I know they serve food and bottles to go , but I have only ever come here for a cup of their Tangy Frozen Yogurt. This time I got the Baklava Crumble with my Yogurt the 2 elements balance each other so it's not to sweet , I have had the Sour Cherry before but I tend to prefer the texture clash of the smooth tangy yogurt , and the sweet crumble.
Like most parts of the city parking is not bad if you come in the evening due to the current SIP.
Food is really good. We went back for more, but left because it was freezing cold inside and the music was way too loud to talk. Too bad. Great value for the price.

First timer!! 
Everything was super delicious.
I ordered the Greek yogurt with baklava on top, 100% recommend.

Souvla how are you so delicious AND healthy?? IM CONFUSED. Guys their chicken salad is amazing and only 516 calories! I love this location because after you go for a run in the Marina, you can stop by Souvla for some delicious salad AND froyo all for a whopping 700 calories! CRAZY RIGHT. The line goes by fast and they have outdoor seating as well! Highly recommend. I know Souvla is a chain but it's the BEST chain!!

Review is solely on their frozen Greek yogurt which is to DIE for!!! Any time I want something sweet and not too heavy, this is the one thing I seriously crave. I've tried two versions - sour cherry syrup and baklava/honey - and they're both crazy delicious. Also it's a decently sized portion - enough to fill you up but just shy of a brain freeze. 

Ordering is simple - you can order online and wait outside in a socially distanced manner until your order is ready. We ordered our froyos as soon as we got there and they were ready in 5-10min. Can't wait to come back sometime to finally try their food

Great place for a quick bite, we usually get the chicken salads, what we have noticed is that is not always consistent 
Sometimes there is very little amount of protein 
But other then that no complaints
Indoor and outdoor seating available. Quick service. They serve you on your table and pick up your plates. Kind staff. Delicious food and I enjoyed the hot sauce.

3.5 stars. We ordered the lamb gyro and the Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles. The gyro was pretty disappointing--the meat was dry and the pita was thick and tasteless. I did like the veggies and feta that came with the gyro but that's about it.

The Greek yogurt was a different story and I would come back just for this alone. The sweetness and consistency reminded me of Beijing yogurt, which is one of my fav things ever! The base was soft and creamy without being too tart (far less tart than say Fage but not as sweet as most froyo options). The baklava crumbles topped the treat along with honey and were a very special take on granola. I found the chunks of baklava to be super sweet but they nonetheless complemented the yogurt. I can't wait to come back and try the other flavors!

First experience with this place. My entire office had been raving about them and so my amazing boss ordered for me. I had the chicken sandwich Greek style. It was epic!  Pretty darn amazing I must say. I am definitely going to be craving this. Will totally order again.

I am obsessed with Souvla's veg salad. It is really delicious and fresh, and the sweet potato is cooked perfectly. Their fries are really tasty as well. This is a good go to spot to order takeout from during the pandemic! You now have to go to the store to order since they are so busy though. Also their vegan options aren't great so this wouldn't be my first choice for a vegan!

I always crave this place. Something about the perfect mesh of ingredients and toppings, sauces and meats. It's always satisfying and juicy. Always fresh and great quality. Whether lamb or chicken or veg, it won't disappoint. 

Don't forget to end your meal with a Greek yogurt with baklava! 

Soulva feeds our soul every time!!!
Delicious food and great outdoor parklet. The pork was delicious and flavorful with lots of complex The chicken salad was good as well.

I'm not sure why there's always line here when the food is so inconsistent with quality. I've given this place a couple tries as Greek fast food, and I've only had one good meal.  
The Greek fries have a couple specks of feta, the meat in the wraps has a lot of gristle and really grossed me out. I ended up picking the majority of meat out of the wrap because every bite was chewing on a piece of seared rubber. The wrap itself was also very dry and stale. I did have one really great wrap that lives in my memory and kept me coming back, but it's been 1/5 tries that have been good. Fool me twice Souvla, shame on me, fool me 4x... I'm still a fool :(

Souvla has four locations. This one is on Chestnut St. in the Marina. It's a newer Souvla. I decided to not have a wrap today. I decided on the potatoes and the avgolemono soup. The potatoes are average and actually too greasy. The avgolemono soup was new to me and I have never had it. It was a smaller serving. It had chicken, rice, egg stock, chicken broth..and it was good, but completely new to me. These were sides at Souvla. It's a small space, but not too crowded.

Then I had some time at Crunch on Chestnut and it was a nice San Francisco day. I walked around the street and took the bus all the way home.

Have heard great things about this spot, finally got around to trying it. They don't have any COVID seating so we had to take it to go. 

I got the veggie wrap and it just didn't compare to other Greek veggie wraps I've gotten. Typically I love falafel in mine so maybe that was the disappointment. I'm also not crazy about the olives on it, they were very salty. We were dying of thirst after eating it. The fries were good though! Maybe the veggie wrap isn't as good as the meat ones! 

Good & quick service though!

Loved their grilled chicken salad.  I have also had their lamb salad.  It feels never ending- it's quite filling.  My kids liked their veggie sandwich but would have preferred without olives.   
Had their plain fries which were amazing.  Their tea was gross - don't recommend.

I have grown to become that guy who always has to take pics of his food for Yelp reviews and Instagram (I know, my family is so ashamed), but this review is coming without them because I was starving and the smells had me unable to resist diving in. Lamb gyros might be my desert island food,I could easily eat them daily, and Souvla's are right up there. Though let me stray from the main event to drool over the memory of the baklava topped Greek frozen yogurt. Even if you never come by for a meal, if you're nearby you NEED the frozen yogurt. NEED it. You'll thank me later.

I got their firemen yogurt last night but it turned out to be just milk that you can drink and not eat and enjoy. it didn't even taste like yogurt, but rather like water diluted with milk powder. does not taste good

Not going to lie, not my favorite location but honestly what is there not to love. $14 dollar for my favorite chicken salad. Loaded with roasted chicken and mandarins. The dressing is perfect, never too light or heavy. I can eat Souvla everyday of the week. 

The fries are amazing too. One of my very favorites in the city. Don't forget to make your salad "greek style". They add fries to your order for a dollar. You don't get as much as the order itself, but it does the trick. This way I won't get too fat. 

And the "GREEK YOGURT" is amazing. Tart and smooth, the way I like it. I prefer it with bakala crumbles, YUM! Can you open one in Russian Hill/Cow Hollow. I need more of you in my life.

4 star instead of 5 is because, they messed up my togo orders. But it's okay. Mistakes happen.

crack on the lid of my soup.  
I bought some soup and on the way home it spilled on the seat of my car. the whole seat of my car was drenched in white soup. I had to order a cleaning for my car for $ 150. I do not recommend visiting the cafe

Opening Day today! Being very familiar with the Souvla brand, I had to step inside and grab a bite.  Souvla is a super popular Greek eatery with locations on Valencia, Hayes, Diviz, and now on Chestnut, in the heart of the beautiful Marina neighborhood. 

I've been to all their locations, and the most appealing aspect is the nice modern interior.  This spot in the Marina is a comfortable and pleasant place to grab a quick and casual bite.   No table service, just order at the counter, and they'll bring the food to your table.  Although this branch is very small, it is cozy, with a nice Marina neighborhood clientele. 

I wish I could say that the food is their most appealing aspect, but it's just average.  The price, though is higher than you'd expect for what you actually get.  

This time, I got the Lamb Wrap ($14.00 pretax, $15.00+ with tax).  It's served with chunks of spit roasted lamb, but the pieces in my wrap were either overly fatty or super dry.  The good news is that if you eat inside, you can douse your wrap with the delicious hot sauce on the table.  Personally, I'd rather just have moist meat with plenty of yogurt sauce.  It came with some yogurt sauce, but it was very sparse.  The highlight, though, was the fresh and warm pita bread, with a lightly browned bottom.  

Their spit roasted meats are a nice change, but they always seem to veer on the drier side.  The dryness of their meats is especially noticeable when you order their salads.  In addition to the dry chunks of meat, the portion of meat served on their salads are very skimpy, given the prices they charge.  The salad ingredients, though, are very fresh.  That said, I have no doubt that folks in the Marina would easily pay $18.00 for these wraps, without question.  

All said, it's still a great addition to the Marina, and it's a neighborhood where Souvla should thrive.
I love their chicken salad! Juicy chicken & I love the Greek ranch dressing! I usually order to go because it gets super busy in the evening.

My go to meal here is the chicken or lamb salad. Super fresh and crunchy veggies. Also love the frozen yogurt from here. Usually get the one without the toppings because the other stuff can get super sweet.

The lamb salad was great and the frozen greek yogurts are a must try! Our group tried the baklava crumbles and wildflower honey and both were amazing. I loved the combination of warm baklava with cold greek yogurt. Would definitely come back just for the yogurt.

Their Greek yogurt is honestly divine. The baklava is very dense and gives a good sweet and chewy ratio to the creamy frozen dessert. Their price point is fair as well  ($5-$7) for where it resides in the city. 

I'll gladly come back again when I'm in the area!
Its fast food greek but at the prices of a nice sit down restaurant... I don't get it. The food is definitely just in the ok category. Why am I paying $20 for a mediocre pita sandwich?

Souvla is an example of a great concept let down by poor execution.   Greek/mediterranean food is fresh, floral and flavorful.    It's food rich in oregano, lemon, and briny-ness.    Sadly, those aren't the notes delivered in its dishes.

On the encouraging side, Souvla does a very good job cooking the various meats.  The lamb I had was high quality and it was cooked.  This is Step 1 in serving a great product, but Souvla's problems start immediately thereafter. 

My lamb sandwich was absolutely drenched in the yogurt-based sauce.  The sauce should be there to add creaminess and flavor notes to the protein, but at Souvla it's almost as prevalent as the meat itself.

Similar problem w the roast potatoes, which ought to be infused by the roast chicken drippings but instead are drenched by them.   The dish should be called potatoes in broth, b/c that's essentially what it is.

What's missing is the spring-time flavors that are the hallmark of Greek food.  Again, where's the Oregano?  where's the lemon?   Even the "greek fries" -- which are literally sprinkled with oregano -- failed to deliver those flavors.  The fries were further dusted with something akin to cheese, but which -- if later revealed to be asbestos flakes from the ceiling -- I wouldn't have disbelieved it.   It was a very strange flavor.

Lastly, the prices aren't inexpensive.   For a $15 lamb sandwich (and everything else on the menu is similarly pricey), I'd like to see better attention to the details of execution.  

The concept of fast-casual greek food is a good one.  The execution at Souvla falls very far short of the mark, which is a shame.

I ordered the chicken wrap and salad, greek fries, along with sour cherry and honey yogurts. The salad comes with a yogurt sauce and olive oil. Chicken was very light and well seasoned in both.  Also paired very well with the kale and lettuce. And the slices of Mandarin oranges included were such a treat too! I also enjoyed the Greek fries, and found them to be fried to a perfect crisp. The Greek yogurts were also very delicious, although very small in portion. I wish either they came in more sizes, or filled the cup a bit more. I never feel like I get quite enough lol. Also keep in mind that anything "extra" you ask for will incur a small fee, such as utensils, sauces, etc. They also will not give you extra napkins here. But the food is so good, that I'll continue to come back anyway and support.

When I was inside, I saw a cockroach crawling along the wall. I can't even imagine what happens in the kitchen if a cockroach crawls around guests. I wouldn't be surprised if the kitchen is completely unsanitary. I have not seen such an irresponsible business conduct for a long time.

LOVED Souvla! I came here because I'd heard great things about the Baklava soft serve and it did not disappoint. Also loved that they gave me a lid for easy transportation and even though they put a lid on they gave me a very full serving. The baklava is really really good and compliments the sour soft serve well! Highly recommend

So sad the food has gone downhill and salads are much smaller than they used to be. Orders for delivery twice and both times salads were half as much and they were pre-pandemic. Also, for the vegetarian salad and it was like 1/3 olives which normally I love but it was way too much and took over the entire taste of the salad.
I had the pork pita and the lamb pita. They are both bomb. Also I had the Baklava and your hurt for dessert which was amazing as well.
Service was so fast and food was fresh and tasty! Recommend the veggie wrap (or the new black sheep (fake lamb)) and of course the Greek fries!!
Souvla is so delicious and fresh! I highly recommend any of the salads, and you must get the greek yogurt dessert. I always have great service here.

This place without fail was the best decision of the night. Wasn't too hungry and when I entered I was treated really kindly. I got the baklava ice cream they had and as soon as I took a bite I stopped what I was looking at on my phone and was blown away! Sooooo good!! Please get it the people are amazing and the flavor was something else. As a big ice cream eater this might have been my fav one :)

Really liked it here! I had the vegetarian salad bowl and it was delicious! So many yummy things inside and super filling. All the ingredients were super fresh! 
PS - their greek frozen yogurt with baklava was great!

Souvla in the Marina is delicious, the employees are friendly, and the food is (mostly) consistent between orders. 

January 2020 update: they were still only taking orders via DoorDash and another delivery/pickup app (maybe Postmates? I don't 100% remember). They are not taking orders at the window right now. Just a heads up, as the last few times I've gone quite a few people walk up to the window and are surprised by it! If you place an order for pickup it is usually ready a lot sooner before the app estimates. 

Pros:
-food is ready super quick! 
-their fries are to die for (order them extra crispy)
-always friendly customer service
-most delicious salad I've had dining in Chestnut

Cons:
-expensive for what you get. $1 for a tiny amount of sauce (to accompany fries). Something like $16+ for some salads. 
-meat can be inconsistent. Sometimes it is spot on, sometimes I get a lot of fat or gristle or it is dry

A one-time loyal patron of their Divisadero location, so, was excited to take a visiting friend to the Marina Location. 
Appalling food quality.
Hot Lamb salad was barely lukewarm and miserable amount of actual lamb in it.
Potatoes were soggy, over-salted and must have been 2 or 3 hours old.
Service was non-existent for a business that presumably wants to survive the Covid nightmare.
For the $$$ charged, not worth an additional visit to see if they were 'having an off-day'

Been sitting on this review for a while now... noticed a change back in 2019 so nothing to do with covid. So, wow there has been sooooo much oil on all of the sandwiches and salads at this location. To the point where I would advise swim trunks. But seriously, do not take this meal anywhere but to your own home or someplace with a judgement free bathroom. You will need to go, hard between 20-60 minutes after eating. I'm running errands in the city and just paid for 60 mins of parking in fort mason because they have bathrooms there. Pooping your pants is not fun. But this food is the cause of that recently. 
Outside of the oil and the poo pants issue, really good food and the fro yo is

the feeling that the souvla began to offer haircut services in a restaurant. I came to complain to the manager and waited a very long time to meet him, when he came out he was not in the mood and said that their staff could not allow any hairs in the potatoes. the manager refused my request for a refund and behaved inappropriately saying that I had thrown my hair myself. the question: how can you trust people to cook your food if the manager cannot enter into a dialogue and does not want to solve the problem that their staff has made? lack of any adequate service

Oh Souvla, how I love thee, let me count the ways. 

If you've read my reviews for the other locations you'll understand why I'm such a fan of this place. Perfection in a concept, great service and quality eats make this an easy 5 star experience every time. 

My go to order is the chicken salad Greek style because who the heck doesn't want fries on their salad!? It's delicious and you can taste the quality of produce and proteins. I love the shaved fennel and bits of citrus in this salad because they brighten up the overall experience. 

Do yourself a favor and TREAT YOSELF a frozen Greek yogurt and take it to go. Personally I love the baklava but, the olive oil and salt is legit too! 

Thanks for being in the neighborhood Souvla, you're a most welcomed addition to the scene.

Souvla.. the best salad Ive had in SF. Prolly the only spot where I opt for the veg option over any meat. But it is quite pricey. Also pro tip is to get the dessert.

During covid you have to pre-order for pick up on the app. They use SQuare and theres no option to tip the workers in cash

Stopped by for dessert with a friend who said we HAD to get the baklava Greek frozen yogurt and when I say my life was changed after that first bite, I'm not being dramatic! I really had never experienced anything like it in my life and will be going back just for this dessert!

Souvla is one of my favorite fast casual restaurants and I'm so happy this location opened in the marina. This location's on the smaller side then the other ones of been to but just as good. My go to is the chicken salad and baklava Greek yogurt. I also discovered you can order the salads "Greek style" meaning it comes with fries on top so this is a great option if you don't want to get a full side. But I would recommend getting the full side of fries with the dipping saucers because they're amazing. 

The frozen Greek yogurt tastes like Greek yogurt's supposed to taste- meaning don't expect something sweet because it's pretty tart. If you want it sweeter I'd recommend getting it with the baklava or honey topping! I'll definitely keep returning to souvla and it still remains one of my favorites in the city for a fresh and filling meal.

I brought my family to SF to enjoy the day. We ordered takeout (salads) from Souvla via online and planned on having a picnic on the Presidio lawn. 
Picked up our food. Headed out. When we finally settled and started to eat, we noticed there weren't any utensils. We ended up eating our salads with our hands. 
I emailed Souvla about this. Their response was utensils need to be requested and there is an extra charge. 
I guess that was something that was on their site when ordering but it wasn't very obvious when placing the order. And the extra charge for a plastic fork and some napkins IMO is ridiculous. 
But their chicken salad was good albeit eating with our hands.

The lamb leg gyro was pretty average- mildly seasoned meat with very little sauce, untoasted pita, and sparse vegetables thrown on top.
The Baklava Greek Yogurt ice cream was essentially a soft-serve with a bitter greek yogurt aftertaste and some smushed baklava on the side. It's just not worth a $20 meal or more than 3 stars.

The interior was also cramped, and nothing left me with an impression that implied better than average quality.

This review is just for the dessert! We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon to grab frozen Greek yogurts to go. I opted for the one with baklava crumbles & honey syrup. 

For the $5 price, this was a very generous portion. The baklava added a nice texture and sweetness, though I do wish there was more of it - perhaps layered thorughout the yogurt, rather than one pile on the top. The honey added sweetness as well, though it wasn't my favorite because it got really hard/sticky from the temperature of the yogurt.

The yogurt itself was pretty light (dare I say healthy-ish tasting) but definitely satisfies the craving for soft serve. I'm excited to go back to Souvla in the future to try the food.

Souvla is one of my favorite places in the city for a salad! The vegetarian option is delicious and I also love the fries, although I do wish they offered a few more vegetarian options. There's a lot of of outdoor seating at this location and never feels too busy. The staff is also very friendly!

Came just for the frozen greek yogurt! I knew of their location in the mission district, but didn't know there was one on chestnut street. I was in the area for Soul Cycle, and googled Souvla, and it popped up! I was so excited, and ended up walking there.

The service was mighty fast; before I paid, my greek yogurt was ready! 

Frozen Greek Yogurt with Baklava & Honey ($5): GET THIS ONE! There wasn't much honey, but I didn't mind. I literally eat greek yogurt everyday for breakfast, so it's about time I tried its frozen counterpart. It had that slight tartness to it, and the baklava was chewy and sticky which went well with the smooth yogurt-opposites attract! They give you a good amount of baklava, and I made sure to distribute it while eating the yogurt (taking a small piece of it and then scooping some yogurt onto the spoon), so I could savor both as long as possible. NGL, the consistency of the baklava reminded me of pecan pie, and it was missing the flaky phyllo dough aspect.

This is perfect for a hot day, or a healthier dessert/snack alternative to ice cream! 

Next time I have to try their food because Mediterranean is one of my favorite cuisines.

What I love about a four item menu is there is no room for filler or compromise. I had the lamb leg in salad form. Maybe I still chose badly despite having almost no choice. Maybe the other three Souvla mains are great, and I got the one bad, poorly cooked one. If so, I will be missing out forever on whatever it is City-dwellers love about this chain, because I am not returning. 

The most crucial flaw was the lamb itself. It was well done. Actually, it was overly done to the point of a dozen or so bites being tough and jerky-like. But, even the fact that lamb would be well-done AT ALL when I did not ask for it, caught me by surprise. Who prefers lamb this way, and who expects it by default? Not I. It barely tastes like lamb. All the scary, raunchy, borderline-funky meat smells were absent, and at that point I don't understand what I'm creating such a huge carbon footprint for when I could be eating any other protein. Perhaps drying out the lamb makes sense for Souvla's gyro, but it spoiled my salad from the first bite.

But, at least this made what might be a hard review easier.

There were so many missteps in this dish - I'll name them below - but even so, this could have been a difficult and nuanced review in light of the lamb bowl's good price. The price is good because you receive two meal's worth of (for lack of a less-cliched word) fresh food: decent quality but not highly flavorful veggies, presumably made-in-shop-dressing, and supposedly choice bits of lamb - though, what the condition of this cute hunk of meat was before it was cooked into a near-jerky state is only a guess, now - at not much more than it would cost to enjoy two "power bowls" of highly processed and preserved (but really delicious) food from Taco Bell.

But then, it's worth questioning why Souvla forces
her patrons to buy two meal's worth of food in the first place. This portion is just too big. I came at 4pm, following: 8 hours of sleep, a 9am wake-up, a workout, a small brunch, and nothing else - yet, this was twice the food that I needed. Souvla should offer a half-bowl.

But setting aside the nuanced price/portion question, this bowl was a disaster. There were no powerful flavors. The sour notes (from the pickled onion; there are no olives) and pungent notes were all toned down to offensively inoffensive levels. This was Greek, neutered and Americanized, then retroactively dressed up with a halo of fine-food sourcing, to arrive at a California-immigrant cuisine that wouldn't make sense to any actual immigrant. Don't strap a helmet on my lamb. Don't put a seat belt on my cheese. I want to be smothered in funk and fat and dead animal. I want my food to be hideous and make me worry I'm going to die, even if it's a salad. Souvla's salad was rife with "health food"-ish compromises. The dish is JUST NOT FAT ENOUGH.

Note especially the heavy greens at the bottom: doused with yogurt to mask their fiber (at first
glance, I thought the greens were cooked within some sort of sour cream, for pungency - but no, they are fresh and bland), thus neutralizing the delicious yogurt, AND squandering the opportunity to put something from the veggie kingdom with actual flavor in that place. Then the feta: when dispersed over a base of lettuce, it goes from being a bold note of tang accenting fat to a sober replacement (in the logic of a health-food-bowl) for more dangerous alternate fats. The feta becomes utilitarian. It should be raunchy and wild.

The only element on which Souvla's lamb salad succeeded, was the delight I felt in combining the protein and tiny available streaks of fat with the crispy texture of lettuce. This is what one looks for in a protein-based bowl, as opposed to a wrap, and the lamb salad occasionally hit that craving. But, I can get the same bite-pleasure from a Taco Bell bowl, with stronger, far more diverse flavors. That's... really sad.

Souvla is a Mediterranean restaurant, specializing in salads, wraps, and frozen yogurts. I Came here on a Tuesday night 7:00pm and it was quite busy... but the table turnaround time is pretty quick. 

I ordered the chicken salad and thought it was pretty good! I liked the ingredients inside the salad: oranges, onions, kale, lettuce, and a few other things. The sauce which is a mixture of their take on a yogurt ranch dressing with an olive oil dressing. I wish I had gotten the dressings on the side and mixed it in myself because they put so much dressing that my salad was pretty much drenched in it and the flavor of the dressing was overpowering the fresh taste of the salad. 

The frozen yogurt here is amazing. I was struggling to decide between two flavors so the server let me combine two flavors in one. So I got the Baklava and cherry flavors. The two went really well together in my opinion... and I will probably be back for more! The frozen yogurt itself is really light and slightly tart, making it the perfect post dessert snack. 

Interior: this new location is pretty small with very limited seating. So if you are coming for a special location, I recommend checking out their other locations for a more intimate setting. 

Service: fits order, then sit down. The workers were very friendly!

Finally , some solid food options on Chestnut!

I've been to Souvla a few times since they opened. I've gotten the chicken salad which is delicious! I just wish I got the fries to go with it (definitely next time... though I'm hoping they're worth the $5 they're charging).

What keeps me coming back is the frozen yogurt! Because I'm gluten free, I haven't gotten the baklava one.... it looks amazing though! However, I've gotten the frozen yogurt with olive oil and salt and loved it.  The only thing is I wish they would layer the olive oil and salt so I have more opportunities to get both flavors through out my yogurt.

Also, there is seating, but not a ton so just beware if you come here during lunch on the weekends.
My favorite salad in SF, but parkings just really hard in this area :(

I love Souvla! They have the BEST salads and offer a great dessert of Greek yogurt with various toppings. Whenever I come into the city I try to grab a bite there! Stopped there today to eat some delicious Greek yogurt topped with honey and baklava.

Love the salads!!! my boyfriend always hates when i want to eat a nice healthy salad for dinner but he loved this place! he got a chicken salad and i got lamb and the meat is just so juicy and amazing!! you forget your eating something healthy. However it is a bit pricy but it's worth it!

I have been very disappointed with the food here lately. The chicken sandwich is very dry. They don't give you any sauce for it. The serving size of the fries has gotten really small and they don't give you enough sauce. It is really too bad!
Souvla never disappoints, it's amazing and don't forget to get it Greek style (with fried on top) that is a total game changer. The lamb bowl is hands down my favorite on the menu!

Welcome to the hood Souvla!

Wonderfully, fresh and tasty food!

Official opening tomorrow, Jan 8th. A must try when you're in the Marina!

Great new addition to chestnut street. Not cheap for a place that is essentially serving to go orders. But great food and nice interior. The menu is very limited, basically just souvlakia(Soulvakia is the plural of Soulvakia; just looked that up!), ... if you couldn't tell already!  We'll be coming back. 

Wish they'd take down the photo K man smoking. Almost gave 1 star just bc of that.

I like foods here in Souvla. For me especially veggie salad w/ potatoes is  delicious. Dressings yummy. Concept is nice and fresh looking. Team very polite. Limited sitting area but conveniant. In this segment their whole package deserves 5 star‼

It Was Better When They Used to Care....
It has been 6+ months since Souvla opened in the Marina and I can see the quality slipping on all fronts, but most of all, the food.  

I ordered the Lamb gyro, which was dry and completely vapid of flavor due to the completely overcooked lamb, lack of harissa yogurt sauce and bland pita.  I have had so much better in the past, but the past two visits have been pretty much the same.  

My girlfriend also complained that the sweet potato was completely undercooked and the salad was also very dry...she had to get two orders of dressing in order to try and remedy the situation.  

The french fries were once again cold...this has happened many times.  Additionally, when a server brings you fries, you would expect them to bring ketchup or some type of dipping sauce...especially when you are paying $5 for what is a medium-sized order of fries.  

Finally, the white wine at $12 a glass is worse than the $3 buck Chuck at Trader Joes....overly sweet and no balance.  I don't expect much at that price, but you expect something palatable.  

All in all, I would expect more from a San Francisco-based chain restaurant and with all of the options in the neighborhood, I am no longer going to risk going back to Souvla for yet again another sub-par meal.  

I long for the days when more care was put into the meal....

Normally LOVE Souvla frozen yogurt! But this place definitely tasted worse or not as good as the one on Valencia / divisidero. The baklava was dry, it missed honey and overall the yogurt was watery instead of creamy. There seems to be difference in the souvla places. Glad that this was not the first place I tried. If you want to check out souvla for the first time, go and check out another spot! :)

I'm going to be brutally honest here. I come here exclusively for the Greek frozen yogurt. That's it. I literally have never ordered anything else from this restaurant except the various Greek frozen yogurt flavors. They are divine. I like Baclava the most. The wildflower honey is good, but it's cheaper to buy it plain and just take it home with you and add your own honey (which also prevents the honey from freezing and getting firm on the walk home).

The servers are really fast and polite. There's a doggy bowl of water right out front. The establishment is great all things considered. But if you're looking for a review of the food, I unfortunately can't help you. But if you're looking for a review of the Greek frozen yogurt. I can tell you after several dozen experiences, that has never disappointed

NOMZZZZ I LOVE IT HERE!!!! 

I am so happy that SF finally has a really quality, fast-casual Greek spot. Their gyros are so delicious and taste quite authentic. I would definitely recommend getting the lamb! I would also definitely recommend getting one of the salads. I was hesitant at first because sometimes salads can be disappointing. But the lamb salad was HUGE and TASTY. I ended up going back for the salad a few days later because it was just that good. If you want to elevate your experience even further, I would recommend getting a side of their Greek fries (and put them in the salad. Mind blown, I know).

Souvla has a really good business going and I am so happy that there is one a few blocks away from me.

I always love Souvla and haven't been for so long since the shut down  I went and wonderful Victor was so kind to us. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was spectacular as always !! 10/10 the best Souvla here

Love coming to Souvla. My go-to is definitely the chicken salad. Tried the wraps but just wasn't my favorite and I prefer the salads. Usually when I have salads I'm hungry again in about 15 minutes no matter what is added. However, with one order of the chicken salad it always fills me up! The lamb salad was pretty good too but its a bit greasy but not terrible. The Baklava yogurt is also delicious and I would definitely recommend!

Fast, easy, delicious! I eat here pretty often and it's an easy healthy choice in the neighborhood. The frozen yogurt is very good, and worth stopping by for on its own.

I have a tip - go earlier in the day for chicken sandwich. When I've eaten here at lunch time, or before 4, it's been better than when I've gone later. I have officially eaten here enough to notice that their chicken is much saltier later in the day. It probably has to do with how they prepare it. It also seems juicier later too. Maybe the juice from the cooking process soaks in more? Some people might really like that though. I know broth is a thing. 

Another tip - side of sweet potato is so delicious! It's literally just a few slices of sweet potato, but it is very good.

Everyone that works there is amazing. Super professional and patient!

i 10/10 highly recommend this place! souvla was on my list of places to eat when visiting san francisco and i'm so glad i got to try it. you order at the counter and get a number to take to a table, but this is a popular spot and there's not a lot of tables so expect some wait to find seating! 

i ordered the lamb gyro wrap which was bigger than i had expected but also so, so delicious :) my friend and i both thought we weren't going to be able to finish our wraps but we each ended up eating the whole thing. it was that good! the wrap has the right amount of flavor with lots of meat and the pita itself is nice and chewy - not too soft or hard. i read some reviews that the chestnut st. location isn't as good as the other locations, and i can't really compare because i haven't been to any of the others, but i thought the food tasted amazing!

So excited that they opened after 4 month. I placed an order through their new app and it said a 30minute wait time, As soon As I got the "your order is ready" text i walked out to pick up, only to find a line of over 50 ppl waiting for their pickup order as well. I couldn't believe this to I went to the window and there was only one person attending the line and yes these were all people who placed orders online. This line barely moved I waited in line in the cold for 20 minutes and gave up. By the time I would have gotten to the front of the line my meal would have been cold. Terrible comeback for Souvla.

I mean, seriously. What can I add that hasn't already been said? The chicken salad is amazing. The granch is made of dreams. Even their fries are crispy on the outside and soft and steam on the inside. Did I mention the granch? Pre-covid ritual was going to CPY and then either picking up to go (the app is so easy now!) or meeting friends to sit outside and have a glass of wine while enjoying the salad. I feel so sad I'm in LA for the next couple months and moving to the UK - I will MISS THIS SALAD!

I have been to Souvla many times, but I must be honest. I have only ever come for the frozen Greek yogurt, which is extremely delicious, creamy and tart (and the toppings are on point) and is my favorite frozen yogurt EVER. Maybe I will try the food someday. I have heard it is very good. But for now I can only review the yog. It kicks ass. That is all.

I'm sorry to say that Souvla has not made a very good comeback after being closed for almost four months during the pandemic. I was really excited to try their lamb pita sandwich again and my all time favorite the Avgolemono soup! I was disappointed for two reasons: the shoddy, poor quality of the lamb pita and they have increased their prices by $1... including an extra charge for eating utensils! The lamb pita sandwich is now $15! It was cold and thrown together in the takeout box with absolutely NO harissa-spiked yoghurt and a very stingy sprinkling of olive oil and feta cheese. I absolutely won't be going back to Souvla ever again!

Great spot. Good food. Relatively healthy options. 

My only negative here is that, due to the size, it can be quite crowded and it can be difficult to find a seat. When I went there, I was just standing and eating. 

Granted, I wouldn't really consider this a sit down restaurant that you hang out for a while. This is more for a lower cost food option before you head out for the evening.

I visited during the day on august 9th and both of the people working the front were extremely rude. The lady was friendly momentarily until she was unsatisfied with my tip for a to go order. I guess she felt she was "owed" 20% for entering my one item to go onto an iPad.. She became extremely snappy after and even handed me the salad with no bag, napkin or even utensils just literally the box.  They also give off a really cheap vibe charging a dollar for hot sauce when they are already charging damn near $20 for a salad. The three stars are for the food but they def need to switch up a few things before I can ever go back.

Much better than the Hayes or Mission location. They've got a lot more space and it's the same Souvla you come for. I love the sandwiches a lot! Their drinks are not the best, but you're not coming here for that.

This place is super popular so beware during peak hours. However I LOVE their Greek yogurt ice cream more than anything with honey and baklava on top. 

I went through a phase where I would get it multiple times a week. 

But, they also have a really awesome Greek vegetarian salad with potatoes as the meat replacement. It seems like an odd thing but I discovered I really like it and the potato makes the salad hearty enough for me to feel full.

We ordered the pork sandwich, lamb sandwich, 2 chicken salads and frozen yogurt. 

The sandwiches were fine, didn't expect the bread to be as thick as it was, but overall they were tasty. The salads were way overdressed to where the corners of the boxes were leaking, orange segments were dry and bitter, and the chicken was very dry, almost shiny looking. I was disappointed because we did place the order in person so it had not been sitting around too long, not sure how they got so soggy. 

The frozen yogurt was delicious.

I am always blown away my Souvla and crave it on a weekly basis! 

From their chicken salads, homemade hot sauce, fries, sandwiches and I can't leave out the famous frozen yogurt, everything is a 15/10 here. 

I need a membership here or something just so I can get souvla every day for the rest of my life!

Souvla is a local chain of Greek - Mediterranean casual restaurants in San Francisco. We tried the recently open location in the SF Marina District.

High quality ingredients and good cooking = popular.  They could use some portion control.

 Picks:
Snake River Farms Pork Shoulder Salad ($13) was huge, almost too big.  Lots of fresh veggies and nice pork.  They should reduce the size of this by 25% and lower the price.

Mary's Free-range chicken wrap ($13) was also pretty big and had a ton of nice chicken.  You can see the chickens being roasted in the back of the shop.

Just OK:
None

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Good
Food - Good
Decor - Very Good
Service - Good
Value - Very Good

Would we come back - Maybe

Delicious food. I love their chicken salad with dressing on the side. It is light yet filling. You can tell that they put a lot of thought into the ingredients and how it all comes together. I have also had their wraps and they good but the salads are what keep me coming back for more.

The Yogurt was great. The food was so-so. Nothing to complain about just nothing too special. Also the service was a mess! We were given the wrong order 3 times and the number they gave us for our order and the food we actually ordered never corresponded with one another.

Souvla what happened?? You were one of my favorite spots in the city. Today my order arrived completely wrong..maybe the fault of the caviar driver, but we just accepted the food and ate it anyways (not picky eaters). The chicken was so dry, the pork tasted funky and the soup tasted completely different than I remember and also did not have any rice. Pita was also stale. I am sure it is not easy operating during a pandemic, especially after a long hiatus so one bad experience won't deter me but I do hope you can get back to your original glorious self soon!!

Something has changed since they re-opened post covid.  The quality of the food has gone down and they continue to leave hot sauce/utensils out of the bag even when ordered. This used to be my go to place but I don't see myself paying $15 to get mediocre salads going forward.

First time here , try the chicken sand my buddy got the lamb, it's was okay I think the pitta should be toasted a little longer as you can tell on the picture still white also it was breaking down, we will get another try later. Service was great

Not on par with souvla on Hayes street!
Smaller portions
Drier meat
Less meat
Ordered veg salad online asked for no yogurt dressing,ended up getting no olive oil dressing either which made it even drier and flavorless and the walnuts were also missing!
I absolutely love souvla and go there at least once a week and was so excited that another location was opening in the marina!
Have eaten from here twice and both times were unfortunately a fail!
I'll be sticking with Hayse!

I was delighted with my lamb salad although a few pieces had gristle I did not expect to bite into. a few black calamita olives would be a nice touch. There was more kale than romaine which might be healthier but I don't know how authentic this is, or just added for its health benefits.  Salad is definitely fresh and meal sized, large enough for two to share.  The avelemono was the best I have ever had. True rich chicken flavor and delightful texture with lemon ringing through every spoonful.  Stools are a bit uncomfortable hard metal. Wood would be nicer. Loved smelling and watching the lamb on the rotisserie.  Nice design and friendly & attentive staff. Manager came over to ask how everything was and heated up my soup with a smile.

The chicken salad at Souvla is my favorite salad in SF with Mary's free-range chicken, "Granch"dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots and mizithra cheese. I tried the gyro version but I prefer the salad, and I'm not even a "salad person." I've had cravings for it and generally don't ever do food delivery but I've had the chicken salad delivered more than a few times. The salad is $14 and throw in some french fries on top for a $1 and it's perfection. All about balance, am I right? The frozen greek yogurt is also so good!

Within this trendy and cute restaurant you will find delicious and flavorful food! My favorite is the lamb salad and the frozen greek yogurt with tart cherry for dessert! So good!! The smells in the restaurant are aromatic and delicious, they add an authenticity and charm of the modernized place! A great lunch spot!

Came back in to get the same soup and potatoes and a side salad and to update the last Review the staff was quick efficient and this time asked me if I wanted a spoon to go with my soup. They charged me accordingly for the spoon and I waited for my order which they said would be out shortly. I picked up two orders one to drop off to a relative. I tried the soup before leaving in the car and immediately noticed that it didn't taste of any lemon as it usually does it's as if the lemon was missing. I return to the counter to ask if there was any extra lemons, they said no we don't have lemons I thought that is odd because how do you even make anything in a Greek restaurant without having lemons?! Especially Avgolemono soup!!! It's supposed to have a lot of lemon juice. Maybe they were out because it was so busy but to not have any sliced or preserved lemons or put enough lemon in the soup - just NO. The cashier then tried to offer me some sort of oil dressing that he claimed had lemon in it and after tasting it it was not it was purely like olive oil and herbs it had even less of a taste of lemon than the soup. He acted like I was claiming something false at first and then as if to shoo me away (girl bye) said I'll make a note of it. I've had the soup on multiple occasions at multiple locations. Even the last time I was there for the review I wrote previous the soup tasted completely different and was on point actually the way it should be full of lemon and rice which is another point I'd like to make is that there was zero rice in the soup it was mostly a bland oily broth with some chicken. 

I don't know maybe I'm just having bad luck with this location and should just keep going to the Hayes Valley one where I always used to frequent I just started going to the marina one because I thought it would be less crowded and easier to find parking. At least they offered me to "purchase" the spoon before leaving. 

Moral of the story is AVGOLEMONO Soup must have lotsa LEMON juice.  Get it together Marina Souvla!

Make sure you go to the Hayes Valley location. This place doesn't live up to the name. I'm a big fan of Souvla, but at this location the pita is dry and stale, the pork is too salty and has hard bits, and the Greek yogurt had a clump of baklava in it so hard I couldn't eat it.

So, still love Souvla, but I advise you skip the Marina location. Clearly not as good as expected.

Best salad in the marina!

I love Veggie salad with kale only, add chicken, olive oil Dressing, and sub harissa yogurt dressing. It's pricy but big enough for 2 meals for me. 

I also love the fro yo with olive oil and sea salt. Might sound odd but try it!! The "baklava crumbles" are overly sweet mush so wouldn't recommend. 

There isn't much seating so definitely get it to go. 

I usually order on their site for pickup and it's ready in just a few minutes!

Friendly staff too!

Stopped by to try their Frozen Greek Yogurt on a warm Sunday afternoon! My peanut allergy prevented me from getting the Baklava Crumbles on my yogurt, but based on the reactions of my two friends I feel like that flavor is definitely the one worth getting. I ordered the Cretan Wildflower Honey, which was their greek yogurt with a fresh honey drizzle on top. I wish they added the toppings in layers, because once I ate the honey layer off the top, there was only plain greek yogurt at the bottom. Still, their greek yogurt is rich and delicious, and you get tons of ice cream for the price ($5).

I love Souvla! Just started going here after my workouts in the Marina. It's much smaller than the Divisadero location but still has a similar vibe. I usually get the chicken salad which is just as good at this location as the divis one. The soup is really good too. Huge salads, so recommend getting to go if you aren't super hungry.

SO DELICIOUS!!! I got baklava frozen yogurt & was mind blown because I have only ever tried baklava. The frozen yogurt was mixed in so well with the baklava. Definitely a place to go to in the summer & I recommend trying the other items!!

Doesn't look like much when you are passing by. But we were super hungry and decided to try. 
We were in their place in another location. 
 I got their chicken salad. I should admit that portion is pretty decent size, however it was super salty,  lots of oil at the bottom,  while salad was on the dry side. 
But what completely killed me,  they have absolutely no sense of safety and seem absolutely heartless.  
I've asked for plastic utensils,  simply because it's a VIRUS season and now when we have quite a few COVID-19 in San Francisco,  I didn't want to take a chance.  
For those of you who is standing,  I suggest you seat. 
For 1 PLASTIC fork, I was charged  27 cents . I was speechless. I paid, as my health is more important. 
 but how cruel can you be?? Before virus, those were free.

Complete COVID disaster.  Order online to pick up at a set time.  Arrive at that time, but instead of getting your food, get in line.  A short line?  Nope - down the street to the corner, around the corner all the way to the end of the block.  Over 100 people long.  Bye bye Souvla - during COVID and after.

I pass by this place after the gym, around 9:45ish. They were about to close, but I was super hungry. The guy that took my order didn't look like he was itching to go home, he was nice and even recommend me his favorite. I wasn't really expecting a lot cause I just ordered a salad. Which I don't really like eating, I don't want to eat heavy ass meal that late. But I was surprised when I took my first bite. The best salad I tried so far. Yum.
Literally best chicken salad you'll ever have. 100% eat here at least once or twice a month! French fries with four different sauces is really good too. Love love love the chicken!
We had the chicken and pork pita sandwiches- both were excellent and portions were huge. You won't go away hungry. Restaurant was small, but had a cool vibe. Bathroom was clean. Friendly staff.

Had been wanting to try this place for several months, and finally had a chance this week and am I ever glad I did. In a fantastic neighborhood although hard to park totally worth getting there.
First of all, the place is small but very well designed. The order desk was very friendly and efficient. We asked for a couple of suggestions and were well directed.
The stars of the show are the succulent meats turning on the rotisserie. We chose the lamb and the chicken both in perfectly toasted pita and the toppings made the whole thing very delicious. It has the right proportion of soft and comforting and crisp and tart. I totally recommend a few dashes of the house hot sauce. Our favorite was the chicken with the orange segments, great combination.
We also loved the Greek fries with "granch" dressing. The house rose topped it all off.
We felt the quality and preparation of the food along with the friendly service made the whole experience a great value. Next time you feel like the best Greek pita, this is the place.

Completely unimpressed with our meals. The chicken sandwich was really dry and, although the roasted whole chickens on display, the only meat inside was dark meat. The sweet potato salad was an entire (unflavored) sweet potato with a very salty salad of mashed olives and cheese. The only redeeming quality here was the yogurt dressing. I normally love salads, but I left half of this salad behind and have been disgusted by this meal for the past several hours. Can not believe all the positive reviews - there are so many better places in this area around the same price point.

I know weekends are usually over-crowded but we managed to order our meal. We had to wait about over an hour. Food was outstanding, ordered salad and wrap but pit wasn't tasted good (quite dry and tasteless) will try their frozen yogurt.
Food was okay... service was terrible waited 20 mins for a dry lamb wrap. They kept saying "2 more mins" the staff was completely unhelpful. Disappointed.

Do you like food? This place has amazing fresh and delicious salad bowls and wraps.  Fairly priced and huge portions.  Great ambiance, music, and attention to detail. It's a hole in the wall and seating comes at a premium, but not necessarily the place to hang out for a while and seats will open up.  If you're in the neighborhood and want a quick hearty and healthy bite- Souvlas is a can't-miss place

Loved the super flavorful Veg salad w/ roasted sweet potato. Large serving and well dressed. I think this is my fav salad spot now! The roasted pork and chicken looked amazing on the spit. Check out this spot for lunch or dinner

The salad bowl was not filling and a little overpriced for what it was. It's a bunch of semi good ingredients maybe some of which are prepared, maybe some are premade? I thought the feta fries were bland as well. My cherry soft serve was good. I'd come.back just for dessert.

Sooooooo good. My partner and I have been ordering takeout here pretty regularly since the start of the pandemic. Super fresh and tasty!! Highly recommend. Their pita sandwiches are a lot of food though, so if you're considering splitting with someone -- it's not a bad idea!

I love Souvla, however for whatever reason every time I order it and have it delivered it's not the same quality as when I receive/eat it in person. It's super disappointing and shouldn't be the case but this has happened enough times for me to know it's a problem/true.

Atmosphere: 4/5 super packed with all the Marina folks coming in and out to get their to-go orders, order in, and checking out the place. It didn't really have too much seating (I believe they designed this location with a take-out focus in mind) but we didn't feel too cramped once we sat down. We sat on the "patio" (which was more like a couple high top copper tables out on the sidewalk with doors opened to the main seating area) with our number and waited about 15 minutes for our food. If you order the greek fro-yo they give you a ticket so you can pick it up after your meal. The rotisserie can be seen from the dining area so you have a quick peek of what's to come.

Food: We wanted to sample a little of everything so we got:

Pork wrap - 4/5 according to the starving boyfriend. Nice little bit of everything in there and a huge portion. Pork was on point.
Chicken salad - 5/5 Now, I'm not a huge salad fan, but I wanted to see for myself what everyone was raving about. I get it now. Massive serving, not overly doused with dressing, good balance of veggies and protein, flavor was there. What put this one over the top for me was the humongous layer of pulled chicken in the middle of the bowl. No dainty cubes of sad boiled chicken breast here. Texture of the chicken varied from nice and soft to slightly crispy for the outer layer. Not too salty, not too oddly textured, just right.
Greek fries - 5/5 If nothing else, get this. Perfectly crispy fries that stayed crispy, good bit of cheese without being greasy, and slightly seasoned enough to make you come back for more.
Greek yogurt with baklava and honey - 3/5 Perhaps it was because we weren't huge greek yogurt fans to begin with, but the baklava mixture was overly sweet and the yogurt too tart for our liking. 

Overall: 4/5 - nice ambience, hit or miss food items, no insane wait times.
Omg the Baklava is the best thing I have ever ever had!! The frozen yogurt was so so fluffy and it reminds me of yo mama in HK
Good dependable meals to go though sometimes pita sandwiches are heavy on the olive oil. Frozen yogurt is refreshing on a warm day. Lemon soup is delicious!

Souvla (Marina location) has great food however, we waited and waited as the to-go and online orders we're prioritized over the in-house. We lost track of the customer complaints wondering where their food was. Not sure if the manager called in sick or the rush was too much to handle but Souvla needs to rethink how they prioritize their orders and focus more on customer service.

Great chicken sandwich and good salads.  Moderately priced, but the portion size and quality of ingredients is very good.  It's something different than just another sandwich.

My only complaint about Souvla is the overuse of packaging, everything comes in a box and paper bag.  It's wasteful.  If you order a wrap for takeout, please request they only wrap it in paper, it works fine and you will feel better about not throwing away a barely used box.

Can't understand what all the fuss is about. How does this place stay so busy? It's an extremely limited menu and the food is bland, bland, bland. I have tried this place multiple times and each time have ordered more and more of the extra sauces in the hopes that I could liven up the food. Even the sauces are kind of thick and creamy and bland. 

The main problem is when you order a pita, whether with chicken or lamb, the pita is basically a giant thick "shoe" of a pita. They don't even bother to split the pita open and stuff and like most Mediterranean places. They just dump a bunch of meat on top of a whole pita and curl it up like a super thick taco.  

The lamb is definitely the more bland of the choices so you're better off ordering the chicken which is fairly moist but still needs more. They should offer hummus and tabouli and baba ganoush and things like that that you can at least stick into the sandwich to give it some more flavor.  

On the plus side, the fries are very good but you do need some dipping sauces to go with them. I get that this is a concept place with a limited menu on purpose but I think they can offer more and do better.

My first time at this location. Usually go to Divisadero. Never had any issues before. Ordered the chicken salad Greek style to go. When I got it home there were 5 fries on my salad. That was it, just 5 fries! I have ordered this salad many times and always had an abundance of great fries. Needless to say it was very disappointing. Think I'll stick to the Divisadero location. Chestnut needs work. Chicken salad was good as ever.

I love souvla so much. It's so delicious. I always get the chicken salad and add fries for $0.50, but I've had the lamb salad before too and it's also really flavorful. The portions are huge, you could definitely save half if you wanted to. They also have drinks and frozen yogurt.

Souvla is one of my favorites for a quick pickup order. They have delicious salads, and I love frozen Greek yogurt with baklava. While you can grab a glass of wine and enjoy your meal inside the restaurant, seating is always extremely limited and people often circle like hawks waiting for your table--not the first place  I would suggest if you are looking for a place to stay for a while and dine/catch up with with a friend.
Some of the best salads I've ever had. I get the chicken salad SET UP with sweet potatoes. It's heavenly. Don't miss it.

Love this place.  The salad with lamb always hits the spot.  I also tried the pork, but it's a bit salty for my taste.  The frozen greek yogurt with olive oil is... wow! I never thought that combo would be so delicious.  Space is somewhat limited and can get very crowded during busy hours.  Great place to get some food that somehow leaves me refreshed.

Best souvla location! Everyone is so friendly. I've had some past experiences at Souvla with their staff being impatient or a bit rude. Marina location is clean, small and has the best staff! Great job Marina Souvla!
I ordered my favorite Greek soup that I always get and found a black hair in it half way through eating it. I totally lost my appetite. Don't they have hair nets in the kitchen?
Friendly staff, fresh food, and the selection is simple yet varied. I love the decor and the ambience is extremely well put together!
Pretty good chicken salad and loved the baklava crumble froyo. Pretty expensive for a salad/ wrap but is delicious
Heavy food. Rude service-and there was a bone in my sandwich. Disappointing-so much buzz about this new place-i wouldn't go back.

One of the best restaurants in sf! I love their lamb wrap and their salads. The fries and frozen yogurt are also delicious. I brought 2 guests to this restaurant and after trying, they wanted to eat there all 3 days of their trip HHa! Definitely delicious!
The food is really good, but don't order to delivery. The restaurant uses only the Caviar app and is expensive and I had to wait almost 2 hours for my food. Terrible.

NOT COVID-19 SAFE. I love this restaurant and have been coming here for years, but there line system does not follow COVID-19 Guidelines. There was no structure, with around 30 people waiting to pick up food. I initially waited in a supposed "line" more like a hodgepodge of people not knowing where to go for about 10 minutes, then everyone kept cutting in front to pick up their order from the window, so I inched closer to do so and by the end of it was surrounded by people, a foot away from me, and a person even pushing into me at one point. I arrived when my order was ready and could not pick up the meal until 45 minutes later because of this system. This is not acceptable. I don't care about waiting for a meal, I get they are busy, but by being this irresponsible with COVID-19 they should not be open. If you can't make your customers feels safe while picking up salad you should not be open. They are risking people's lives by exposing them to other people in an unsafe way.
Excellent food! The wait also was unexpectedly short even though it was crowded when I visited. Service was great as well.

I live 2 blocks from here and have eaten regularly at all of the takeout spots in the area over the years. I eat out multiple times a week and I've eaten here just twice since it opened. I don't eat salads as a meal. If that's your thing, maybe this place is great. I had the pita and it was good, but not $17 good. I've had the pita a couple of other times at other Souvlas and it almost always seems to be drowning in and dripping oil all over the place which I don't love. Again, pretty good for what it is, but I never crave it.

Closest thing to Greece you will get. There's a reason there's usually a line during peak hours. Can't go wrong with the lamb or pork sandwich. I could eat these all day. Add fries in the sandwich just like they do overseas!   The vegetarian salad isn't bad either and I'm a meat eater.

Adorable shop, beautifully designed, very clean, staff wonderful, and best of all the food is delicious! The meat is ethically sourced, which is one of the most important things, and the avgolemono soup is souper-authentic! A wonderful addition to our neighbourhood.

I'm so stoked Souvla opened a store in convenient for me! This place is so unique and amazing--the salads and sandwiches are super flavorful, and if you haven't had one of their greek frozen yogurts, it's an awesome dessert!
excellent service, attention and disposition of the perfect staff and delicious food and ice cream a crazy thing
Good one. The yogurt tasted rich and creamy. Love it and maybe I will try again if I back to sf.

Souvla will forever be my go to greek restaurant! I just love how simple the menu is and you really can't go wrong with anything. I will say you MUST try their frozen greek yogurt because it's absolutely the best and I'll take it over ice cream any day!! The service is quite quick and seating is first come first serve. I really enjoy the ambiance of all the locations I've been to as they all have ample seating for everyone. My favorite dish is the chicken salad, it tastes so fresh and definitely fills me up and satisfied my salad craving. 

IG: @girlseatbayarea

Souvla on Divisadero Street is a welcoming restaurant that looks small from the outside, but it is decently sized with a good amount of seating inside the restaurant (4-6 tables), as well as in the back patio (5-7 tables). The patio is a perfect place to enjoy your meal and there are also light and heaters outside, so that you can enjoy your meal. When you arrive to Souvla, you first order and then find a seat. I wouldn't recommend large groups at this location because there are many tables, however, many of them only seat 4 people and I feel as if it would be quite difficult to find tables to eat together as a group of more than 4. The staff at this location is friendly and knowledgeable about their menu.

Souvla is a fresh and healthy greek restaurant. There menu consists of mainly salads and gyros, but they also sell sides such as fries, soup, and vegetables. A unique part of their menu is their fresh greek yogurt. 

I love Souvla and I would even consider it one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I personally love the chicken salad. It has a wide variety of greens (kale and fennel), oranges, pickled red onions, cheese, and rotisserie chicken with their homemade "granch" dressing all on top. While it is a large amount of food and a delicious meal, it is priced at $17. The same meal but in the gyro form (wrapped in pita bread) is priced at $16. Although I would never spend that much money on a salad anywhere else, I would recommend this salad to a friend because it is simple and delicious, while being fresh and bursting with flavor. Souvla has a "greek style" that you can get on any meal with french fries on top for an additional $1. Although I have never tried this, I am aware that it is very popular here.

Another item you cannot skip out on is the Baklava Greek Yogurt. This dessert is simply greek yogurt with honey and baklava. I had never tried baklava prior to Souvla, but it is similar to a granola, however a bit sweeter. It is such a refreshing dessert without being too sugary.

This review is just for their froyo which I think is the redeeming factor. Cause first time I tried souvla and hayes valley and was not a fan....but always wanted to try the froyo. 

Weird to say that this is the first time I've had froyo that tastes like actual yogurt. Its one of those things you don't realize til you have the real deal. 

Highly recommend with baklava crumbles, the sweetness balances the tartness. Although its kinda steep...$8....I think I'd still prefer boba if ima pay that kind money yaknow?

Yogurt with Baklava crumbles. It was too sweet for my taste, but I can see how others would like it. Good thing I got my Sour Cherry yogurt!
It was a cold night, so the soup with lemon and chicken schmaltz sounded perfect! Wished it had more rice! But the richness of it was perfect!

It feels like establishments that have made SF into what it is are clearly not the same anymore-case in point, Souvla. We ordered their:

Veg Salad
Lamb Sandwich
Greek Fries

The Veg Salad thankfully tasted the same as how I ordered it before, but the Lamb Sandwich seemed less filling and fulfilling in comparison to their salad version. The big disappointment of the night was probably the fries, they looked like Burger King's fries but with garnishes! The real kicker was that it's a $1 up charge for a side of ketchup, which doesn't make sense because when you order online the $1 up charge is nowhere to be found? Even Burger King doesn't charge for their ketchup packets, but nickel and diming like this isn't right.

There needs to be more cohesiveness between their online ordering versus IRL.

Was this $19 salad delicious? YES!!!

Should a salad cost $19? NO!

Will I be eating this $19 salad again? OF COURSE!

Highly recommend: pork shoulder + Greek style (with fries) + hot sauce

Minus one star because you can't substitute a yogurt dressing for an olive oil (both come with it on the side) without a surcharge. I really HOPE their olive oil isn't cheaper than yogurt, but it seems to be!

Excellent. I'm absolutely coming back. I was genuinely impressed at how good everything was.
