Not only was the food ready pretty quickly, it tasted incredible. The chicken wrap was delicious. It had oranges inside and it was the perfect combination of flavors. The fries were so good, I think I would've loved a dipping sauce to go with it, but otherwise they were stellar. 

Let's not forget the dessert. Wow wow wow. The yogurt was tart but it really grew on me and the baklava crumbles were to die for. Incredible vibes! 

Considering moving to SF after this... haha

An SF Staple! I love bringing my friends who visit the city here, as a quick bite that's a little elevated. Of course, it's pricier than typical fast food, but the quality is pretty good IMO and the service is quick!

Get the BAKLAVA FROYO - sooooooo good. it costs a pretty penny at $8 for a cup, but the froyo is so tart and the baklava is sweet and chewy, making it the perfect snack on a hot summer day. Their wraps and fries are all pretty good too! 

This location in particular also has the cutest back patio! Its nice and shaded and has plenty of seating. You can also take it to-go and munch in Alamo, since it's so close!

TLDR: good but not great. A lil overhyped imo but still would get again.

My friend and I got takeout and went to Alamo Square Park which is super close to this location. I got the veggie salad with sweet potato. I LOVE white sweet potato so this was delicious. Enjoy the addition of olives and the dressing. Just didn't feel full after and needed to eat more. Also it was good but not...exceptional.

i always love souvla cause it's all fresh ingredients and you can opt towards healthy (salad) or yummy (wrap) always with fries! the other things are just extra but the quality is consistent every time. great fast casual restaurant where you don't feel rushed to finish eating either.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA

reviews.text:
Solid fast-casual lunch/dinner spot serving Greek inspired sandwiches & salads. Overall, like the food here but it is a bit expensive for what you get.

Have been here several times and recommend the salads over the sandwich. In particular, I like the Chicken & Black Sheep Plant-Based Lamb

Their crown jewel, in my opinion, is their frozen greek yogurt. It's not too sweet, has a great texture, and has a lot of great toppings. The sour cherry syrup is AMAZING - Perfect mix of sweet & tart. I also really enjoy their Greek Fries - it's topped with cheese & is great with their "Granch".

Souvla is super reliable and has a bunch of locations across the city. Would recommend if you want to go to a nicer fast-casual spot!
Food was great! The ingredients were really fresh and well put together. The price was a little much for a gyro and salad. The inside was super clean and had a wonderful aesthetic.

Salad is great. The staff is super friendly, I highly recommend the fries if you are not on a diet. 
However, the beer is so bad. I think the bottle for the beer is pretty, but the content itself is quite undrinkable. I would rather drink water.

You know those wraps are $20 for me so I tried the cherry frozen yogurt ..it says Straus greek yogurt ..treat to keep things sweet and if u want a "cater" you'll have to ask the great alligator itself ..u know in the sea of caspian ..tales of the old times ..here's to the new times ...yummy Greek and meek

Starting with the most impressive--the Greek yogurt with sour cherry was amazing, tart and refreshing! I would come back here just for this. Vegan lamb was also very impressive, tasted almost like the real deal. Was a bit disappointed by the chicken, it was a bit dry. Salad itself was great (picture is one salad split into 2 portions). They have indoor seating and a nice little backyard patio that's shaded.

Souvla is a great spot for a casual lunch or dinner. I love this location private esc outdoor patio. It's a great space to catch up with a friend, especially on a warm day or afternoon. Plus, Souvla is great to grab to go as Alma Square is a short walk away.

As for the food, I highly recommend their roasted potatoes and any of their wraps. Salads are great too!
This was my first visit but certainly not my last! Lovely outdoors seating with heat lamps! The food delicious! Service excellent! The frozen yogurt was a treat with a variety of syrups!

Nothing special, maybe because I'm from the DC area where I'm used to Cava and an abundance of great fast casual Mediterranean restaurants. I wanted a quick bite one afternoon, so I got a chicken sandwich to go. I only sat for a short while before someone brought out my neatly packaged food, so props on the quick service. As for the sandwich itself, it was pretty bland and small for the price. I'm honestly a bit surprised with how popular this place is because I definitely felt disappointed based off others' rave reviews.  Oh well, maybe I'll just have to wait for Cava to come to SF. I do want to try the froyo here sometime when it's warmer!

Absolutely amazing! I have yet to try any yogurt like it has the honey inside as well as the sweetener. Not too sweet and the Baklava never got soggy or to hard to eat! I went back for seconds lol 

A must have in San Francisco if you love Baklava

This was a great option for a quick dinner before a concert at The Independent (1 block away). We dined in but you could've easily taken it to go. The service was fast and the entire dining experience went very smoothly. The sandwich wasn't the most filling and I also spilled a lot (probably more because I'm a messy eater though) but overall it was still a good experience.

Never would I ever..believe how well navel orange complements chicken. Wow. The only bad critique about the chicken sandwich would be that it's very messy to eat because of the olive oil. Anyways- what goes better with a sandwich than with some fries, amirite? Unfortunately, I got this to go so the Greek fries were a bit soggy and cold, still yum, but I'm sure the fries are really good if I ate it there. Overall, pretty solid and super filling. 
I've heard good things about their Greek yogurt so I'll definitely come back to try that the next time.

Souvla Ratings: 4.1/5

Food: 4.25/5 - My boyfriend and I live really close to Souvla, so we went there to grab a quick lunch. I heard a lot of good things about this place, especially  their Greek yogurt, so I definitely wanted to try it out. The Greek yogurt met my expectations, but the sandwiches not so much. See the description below for more detailed descriptions. 

- Mary's Free-Range Chicken [GET]: The chicken sandwich comes with chunks of rotisserie chicken, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoot, and cheese. The chicken meat was very juicy, tender, and well-marinated. Love all the ingredients, especially the orange pieces. I think it compliments well with the chicken, and it gave the sandwich a touch of freshness. The downfall was that the pita bread; it was very hard to chew and bite into and pretty stale, definitely not a warm toasted pita bread. It tasted like it's been sitting out from the oven for a while. Ask for hot sauce on the side, it's pretty good with the sandwich. The flavors are quite mild and on the bland side as well, so do not expect in kick in the face with strong and bold unique Greek flavors, but I kind wished they had with their sandwiches.

- Frozen Greek Yogurt [GET]: I am a huge fan of FAGE yogurt, so I was very excited. I got the baklava crumbles and honey syrup frozen Greek yogurt, because it is the most popular one. The consistency is like soft serve with a strong Greek and tangy flavor to it. I really like it. The crumbles were a lot soggy and softer than I expected, wished it was more crumbly and flaky for the texture. The light touch of the honey syrup was great, definitely helps balancing out the sourness from the Greek yogurt. This is a great snack and a healthy treat, super light and refreshing, yet rich in flavor. 

Ambiance: 4.75/5 - I love the atmosphere here. Interior is very cute with tables in the long hallway that leads you directly to the patio. The backyard patio is a great place on a sunny day to enjoy some Greek yogurt and fries, quite intimate and cozy with lights at night. A hidden neighborhood gem. They also got a cute take-out windows for pick-up orders. A great spot for a casual meal or a date.

Price: 3.5/5 - My boyfriend got the Pork Shoulder sandwich for $14.50, the free-range chicken sandwich was $15.50, and the frozen Greek yogurt was $6. The total came up to be around $40 after tax. I think for the taste of the sandwiches, I'd say it was only okay in terms of worthiness, and they are on the pricey side. 

Service: 4/5 - The service was good and fast. We order at the front with a staff, and she was nice and friendly. She explained to me the difference between the dressing and asked if we needed any extra sauces or utensils. The menu is easy to understand and interpret. The take-out packaging was clean and simple, so we had a smooth experience.  

BLUF: This is the perfect spot for a quick bite of Mediterranean food such as pita wraps and salad bowls. Although the food was decent and the frozen Greek yogurt was delicious, but slightly overpriced, so I think it will take me a while to make a second visit, but will return anytime when I'm craving the yogurt. Honestly, I recommend just go for the frozen Greek yogurt and skip the entrees.

Stopped by after hearing the hype about their Greek yogurt and I gotta say- YUM! Then again, I don't know how hard it is to make Greek yogurt incorrectly but their consistency is like SOFT SERVE. Cant go wrong with the baklava crumble and honey Greek yogurt which is apparently the most popular option, but if you're adventurous they are also known for their olive oil and sea salt yogurt. 

I got it to-go and the yogurt melts quickly, but is very filling. Perfect for a midday snack that is also on the healthier end. Will be back to try their other flavors soon!

Always reliable, I'm really happy more Souvla locations are opening up in a shuttering economy this should speak for itself! They clearly have consistency down to their product and service which is refreshing! I always know what I'm going to get and they operate very smoothly whether I'm dining at the location or ordering in from DoorDash. Everything always shows up just right!

The ambiance of the restaurant is really nice, and I liked how their menu didn't have an overload of options. 

I got the lamb sandwich, and the portion size was just right, if not on the larger side. I enjoyed the pita bread. I just wish it wasn't doused in oil. My sandwich was dripping oil the entire time I was eating it, and a puddle of oil started accumulating on the tray. I also wish the yogurt was more evenly spread.

My friends got the chicken sandwich. Apparently, they thought the orange slices were a strange addition. It didn't complement the chicken very well.

Souvla is on the pricey side, and though the food was decent, it would probably be a while before I make a second visit.

It's hard these days to find options that aren't too heavy, but also aren't salad! The perfect alternative was the chicken sandwich (which is really a pita wrap) - the feta and orange slices balanced out the chicken with some nice richness and brightness. It looks unassuming but it actually made me so full. Meanwhile, the greek yogurt tasted just like literal frozen Greek yogurt (although it lacked the thickness/creaminess I was expecting, and was rather like an icier soft serve) which means I shall store Souvla in my internal roster of lighter dessert options as well. Loved the sour cherry syrup as a fruity accent, but considering Greek yogurt is tangy already, I will likely try the honey or olive oil next time!
The side greek salad is delicious  . I tried the greek yogurt w/ olive oil & salt,  its not for me.

Quasi fast casual .. 
Zero seating to enjoy the food 
They boot you out of the place before you realize how poorly made it is .. 
Plus it's expensive for a retired granny from Gramercy ..  

This place dropped the ice cream cone on the sidewalk 
and has my knickers in a knot ..

I got the chicken wrap and it was SO good. It was juicy and flavorful would 10/10 recommend. The frozen Greek yogurt took me by surprise and was a great treat to wrap up the day. We got the cherry sauce on top and it was the perfect balance between sweet and sour. We split it between two people and it was plenty for us. We sat outside in the patio, which was clean and cute.  

Thanks for a great experience!
Oh my god the fake lamb is the best thing I've ever eaten. The service is always great!

I'm done ordering from this Souvla. The last 3 times they've messed something up:

Jul 6, 2022 | Order # c082cfdd: Actually gave us completely the wrong order, because I had the same name & last initial as someone else

Oct 2, 2022 | Order # 54fc763d: Forgot the pita bread, which we paid extra for

Oct 19, 2022 | Order # 8bb7cae7: Forgot the hot sauce, which we paid extra for (... also, the fries were super dried out)

Additionally, their meats have gotten much dryer than when they first launched (hence why I ordered the hot sauce). And they've stopped using compostable containers -- hello, Sysco products! (Same as cafeterias!)

Done, done, done !! good while it lasted

Been seeing this place all over Instagram. Lots of hype. Everything was okay, nothing spectacular.  

The baklava with yogurt- baklava was soft and chewy, thought it be crunchy. The yogurt was tart and creamy. Combo not the greatest in texture.

The salad was mostly kale. Not much chicken, if there is, there was cartilage. Dressing was underwhelming, not much taste. Very bland, felt like it needed some salt and garlic.

Beer- like any other beer, nothing different from a Heineken.

Ordered fries but didn't take a pic because it arrived last. Ordered the garlic sauce. Sauce didn't have much garlic profile. Kinda sad the sauce is extra and so bland. The fries were cooked well.

While looking for a place to eat, off Fulton in SF, daughter and I saw the person walking ahead of us turn into this building. Above the door she entered was Greek writing. Further inspection in the window, I could see a rotisserie...mmm..Greek food! 
We were just in Athens Greece this summer. We loved the Greek food. I can attest that the food at Souvla is authentic, with a SF influence. The meat was perfectly cooked, the greens fresh, and combination of flavors soo delicious. My daughters chicken wrap had slices of oranges in it, that added bright flavor point to the rest of the ingredients. My salad with lamb had tender kale that was perfectly dressed. (I hate it when chefs put too much or too little dressing on a salad.) Highly recommend  this little hole in the wall place.

Healthy but overpriced and incredibly bland salads. Their chicken salads are decent, however their lamb is very dry and lacking in flavor. I have tried their lamb twice and I couldn't finish it either time. 

At nearly $20, my standards are a bit higher than what Souvla is able to deliver when it comes to a salad.

My friend and I chose to takeout from Souvla for a picnic dinner. When we ordered online our estimated wait time was 15 minutes but our food was ready within five minutes! They have a cute and convenient pick up window on the outside which is where we got our food.

My friend and I shared their Greek Fries. The fries were hot and crispy. Although we both noted that we couldn't taste the lemon juice on the fries--which was disappointing. To eat we both ordered the Pork Sandwich, which to me tasted like a healthier carnitas burrito! My friend got all of the fixings while I opted for no cheese and sauce on the side. When we looked at my friend's sandwich there wasn't any sauce in hers so I gave her some of mine. The Minted Yogurt sauce was tangy. The sandwich itself was loaded with pork and veggies--to the point where everything was spilling out! The veggies were refreshing with the meat. Without them, in my opinion, the sandwich would be too heavy. One downside was how greasy both of our sandwiches and wrappers were. Not sure if it was because we took out or waited a bit to eat it but it made things a little messy.

Overall, the food is fresh and filling. I'm glad I got to try and check Souvla off my list.

I recently ordered the Chicken Salad and Greek fries. 

The salad was super colorful with ton of flavors. Especially liked the orange slices and their "Granch" dressing. 

The Greek fries were okay. They weren't as crispy as I'd liked them to. 

I've also tried their frozen yogurt before, which they're known for. I had tried the Greek olive oil and flaky salt flavor which was delicious. 

My friend had gotten the lamb sandwich but found it a bit dry. 

Overall food is good but I don't think I've found something that is really great/stand out delicious yet. I'll return to try other dishes.

Several years have passed since I've been here. Sadly, quality has suffered.

We both ordered a lamb salad. The portion was a little smaller. The vegetables were ok. The lamb was over done. 

The flavor was lacking, too. The Greek fries were not as good as before. I prefer hot and crispy ones. It used to be we couldn't stop eating then. Not this time. 

Service was pleasant. That's what got this visit to Souvla a 3-star rating. The food was a 2.

An expensive lunch not to be repeated. I really liked this place, years ago.

I love the lamb and I absolutely have to order it at least once a month. 
I don't know many Greek restaurants but whether it's a platter or a sandwich, I highly recommend. The location on Valencia was my 1st try and this is the 2nd location I tried and it's the same solid quality.

Well, this was disappointing for the second time. For years souvla was a go-to-spot for myself and friends and family. Recently, however, it's really fallen off in taste and texture. 

Perhaps souvla have over extended their chefs in training with all the expansion. Perhaps it has to do with no longer rotating rotisserie with fresh chicken nonstop. I can't tell, but yesterday I brought my parents and boyfriend here as they always loved this spot when in town in the past.

However, the previously juicy with the perfect texture and moisture and fat balanced chicken on the chicken salad was dry and chewy and barely flavorful. The pork in the pork sandwich seemed flavorless and dry. Worst of all was the lamb in the lamb sandwich which was chewy without juices or flavor. If you lose the art of the meat, souvla just becomes overpriced sandwiches and salads on the go.

Let's get the quality back to the good old days, Souvla!

Tried Souvla for the first time and enjoyed it! Went for the veg wrap with sweet potato and order of the fries, and it was well packed in to go containers-- perfect for eating across the street at the Alamo square park! Service was good and it was easy to order, would definitely return if in the area!

I don't get the hype for this place. Food is bland and overpriced. If anything the chicken salad (3.5/5) and fries (5/5) are the best things on the menu. Everything else is just okay (below a 3/5) and not worth the price.  The lamb is pretty embarrassing (dry, no flavor... not good at all). SF just doesn't do Greek food well. 

Head over to RT nearby for a similar but much better executed fast casual menu.
The wrap was flavorful and loaded with meat and fresh veggies. The soft serve was so refreshing and the perfect ending to the meal!

Very impressed with the caliber of food that this local chain is putting out. 

Very flavorful and appreciate the presentation - the frozen Greek yogurt was better than the bowl!

Came here after dinner with some friends to grab dessert! I had always wanted to try the frozen yogurt and I was not disappointed. I would love to come back to try the food as well.

Food:
- Frozen Yogurt--$5
I couldn't decide between two flavors, but luckily since I had read some Yelp reviews beforehand, I knew that I could get two flavors! I asked the worker helping me which flavors would go well together and they suggested the Greek Sour Cherry Syrup and the Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup. It was a great recommendation as the tartness of the cherry syrup paired so well with the sweetness of the honey and baklava. The contrast in texture was also nice with the plump cherry bits with the crumbly, crunchy yet soft baklava. The frozen yogurt itself was smooth and velvety but still light and refreshing and not too rich and dense.

Tips:
- You can get two flavors for the frozen yogurt!
- Must-Try Items: Greek Sour Cherry Syrup and Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup Frozen Yogurt

Lovely quick spot for a nice wrap/salad. I had the chicken salad bowl and it was great. Very flavorful and filling! 

I've seen the frozen Greek yogurt around, and just had to have it. This was the lowest part of my meal, although to be fair I don't like yogurt in general LOL. I just thought it would be a little sweeter :') it is very pretty though!

Wow. Never saw the quality of this place be this inferior and I've eaten at this location many times. This was a takeout this past Monday side salad with all the romaine brown...c'mon Souvla, keep up your standards!

I've heard really good things about Souvla but I'm not sure it lived up to the hype for me. Definitely don't get the greek yogurt with olive oil and flakey salt. There's a lot of olive oil, it's all I could taste sometimes. The yogurt was also way too sour for my liking.

Honestly I've passed this place a million times & finally pulled the trigger & went in. Nice simple menu that doesn't complicate things. I think the salad I had contained kale which typically is way over the top chewy & hard to break down. Not here thankfully. They also do not soak the item with dressing. I washed it down with a decent white wine and they let me try to the Rose before I settled on the white.

Next time I will try the fries which many people have told me are really great. Staff at front were helpful & friendly too. Yep I was happy to stagger in after getting acupuncture near there and the premises provided cool relief from the nasty heat SF has been swamped in recently.
Love Souvla! Been coming here for years, great food and atmosphere, friendly staff. Love the outdoor seating.

Since SF introduced me to this Greek restaurant three years ago, I've been hooked! I love how simple their menu is with their proteins and whether it's a gyro or salad. I personally like concise menus so I'm not standing there wondering what to order. Their salad option is so delicious! Even though it's more pricier than a gyro, I would opt for the salad for two reasons. First, it's just healthier, and secondly I love the mixture of salad they use! I believe it's kale with romaine lettuce and they add radish and pickled onions. So delicious. With COVID precautions, it's only takeout but TIP! Ask for the salad dressing on the side. It was a bit too much for me and ended up drowning my salad. 

Also, a must order is their frozen Greek yogurt, specifically the Baklava crumbs and honey. My god, I crave that. It's a good enough portion for two people. Highly recommend since it's not too sweet and it's creamy.

Souvla used to be IT. Seriously, newcomers don't realize how it's changed in the past 3 years. TLDR: Higher prices with reduced quality is not cute. Souvla has crossed the value-to-quality threshold that lives in consumer minds. I'm not trying to spend $25+ for a lunch unless it's a special occasion. They should test a lunch special: Half salad / soup for $12 to bring folks back... or even making half an entree salad portion a menu option. As they chase relentless expansion this would be wise to remember. These suggestions and refocusing on food execution would cure what ails them.

COVID-19 Status: they have a to go window open.

I got the frozen yogurt with baklava and loved it. If you want to add a little more sweet/tart flavor, get the cherry syrup too. 

$5 for the whole cup is a great price- the portion size is definitely shareable.

My friend got the fries and they were really good as well.

Definitely would love to try other items on the menu here.
Had lunch here - quick, good service for wonderful lamb wrap and Greek French fries- finished with the best dessert - Frozen Greek yogurt with cherry sauce wow! It is affordable , too.

Loved this place food was fresh and delicious! 
Service was great  and atmosphere was pleasant

I did take out the other day, and it was pretty seemless. They have a platform you can order from online - word to the wise, order from any restaurant's actual website rather than one of those apps. The apps take a huge chunk of the profit for the "convenience."  Alternatively, if you use an app to order, maybe consider tipping like 40% to make up for the fact that the business is making less from the app? Be a decent human being.

I grabbed one of their sandwiches - which is really a wrap. It was giant, extremely filling and delicious. I also couldn't decide between soft potatoes or french fries - and went with both. And both were delicious. Then...added a salad for good measure. 

Their website quoted me 15 minutes, but my food was ready in 7 minutes. Perfect timing. They also have one window for pick ups and another for ordering, which helps people keep distance.
This is the best spot for a quick salad or wrap. They have something for everyone here. You cannot go wrong with the chicken salad or wrap. I also recommend the frozen yogurt with baklava.

The cutest Souvla location!! Loved the interior but the back patio really stole the show--a perfect spot to enjoy my fries and the baklava Greek yogurt! I would consider myself a fry connoisseur and Souvla's are so hard to beat--always perfectly seasoned and crisp! Pretty perfect pair with their Greek yogurts. 

Great spot for lunch or a post-work happy hour since they have a beer/wine selection too! Enjoy it out on the patio under the heaters.

Came for lunch last weekend with a few friends and had high expectations since it's on every list of "must have fast casual" in sf. I got the lamb sandwich, and my friends got a chicken sandwich and chicken bowl.

The portions are nice and big. I hadn't eaten all day and still couldn't finish the sandwich. But the taste was pretty mediocre. They had hot sauce on the table which was very necessary as the lamb was kinda bland and there wasn't too much else with flavor in the pita. It wasn't horrible. But it felt like I was eating generic pita filler. I think they are trying to be healthy and light rather than flavorful. 

We also got the yogurt which was pretty good. It's different than regular frozen yogurt since it's greek so very strong and tangy. I'd come back to grab some frozen yogurt to go, but probably won't come back here again. Especially for the price.

Great service, great food, great ambiance. I came here with my friends today; we ordered every sandwich on the menu and thought each one was really good.

I had the frozen yogurt with olive oil and sea salt - honestly, it tastes really strange while you're eating it, but the aftertaste is amazing. It's definitely an acquired taste; from what my friends said, the baklava is great if you have a sweet tooth and the one with just honey is perfect.

I'll definitely be back! Especially for the froyo.

LOVED the greek fries (ugh, such good sauce!!!) and the juicy potatoes. The chicken salad was alright, probably bc I don't really like kale that much.  I tried my friend's Pork wrap and it was AMAZEBALLS. Wish I ordered that instead.

Finally got to check this place out and loved their lamb salad and Greek fries! The salad is very filling but still feels healthy. They don't skimp on the lamb! This location has a cute interior and back patio area.

This location is really nice because it's so close to Alamo Square Park! Got the lamb salad and ate it on a park bench. It was nice to get some fresh air and sunshine and the views from this park are great! 

The lamb salad is pretty filling - I ate it for lunch and the next day for a snack. It is rather pricey for a salad so it's not the best value and the wait was a little long since it's a popular spot. I think it is definitely worth trying though!
Very good service here, quiet and peaceful environment. My sister liked the vegan salad and I liked the chicken salad. You went out of your way to please me.

Have heard of souvla for a while a finally tried it. Got the chicken salad and it was nothing special. No flavor. Chicken was sort of dry. I also got the juicy potatoes on the side and nothing about it was juicy. It was literally just steamed potatoes in oil. Also nothing special. Sorry but I can't recommend!

Soulva is the restaurant for you if you're craving fast casual Greek food. Easy online ordering from their website and pick up through their takeout window. Their lamb sandwich is wrapped like a gyro, packed with lots of lamb leg slices. Well seasoned and tender. Wrap was also not too dry. I loved their greek fries. Their greek fries are mixed with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley and mizithra cheese. They came out freshly hot, crispy, and perfectly seasoned. I could not stop eating their fries! Overall pricing is not too big as the portions are quite large. I was satisfied and full. Will definitely be back for more!

Souvla might just be my favorite dessert spot in the city. Nothing beats their frozen greek yogurt with baklava crumbles! The froyo is perfectly tart and the baklava is just the best topping ever. Can't really comment on their actual food because I only ever come for the froyo.

I've only tried their yogurt. Can't comment on the food. They tend to have a line on the weekends. I think most people in line are trying to get their yogurt? Not sure.

Anyway, their yogurt is good. Bitter. Which is what we like.
reviews.reviewerLocation: South of Market, San Francisco, CA

reviews.text:
The food was tasty. However what ended up in my kids' mouth was a 4" long piece of plastic wrap from his soup. :/

On telling this to the front desk personnel, they just said "oh yeah, that's what is used to wrap the food. Do you want a refund?". Really? That's what you have to say? Most food is wrapped in plastic, it doesn't mean you cook with it. 

Had high hopes, but I think I'll stick to my regulars.

Since I moved here, all different types of people told me I needed to go to Souvla and get their chicken salad and the baklava frozen yogurt. Tried to come here on a Friday night, it had a decent long line so we left and came back the next morning for lunch. It's essentially counter surface and they'll give you your food with a number. 

I think the price is definitely worth it for how fresh the salad is, and how tender the rotisserie chicken is. Unless you're really hungry, you might be able to split the salad into two meals. That's always worth it for me! 

The guy told me I need to try the lamb sandwich next time. Hopefully the frozen yogurt is just as good too!

My star rating:
5  - you have to go!!! 
4 - you won't be disappointed 
3  - it was okay 
2  - I probably won't go back 
1  - turnaround and run

Souvla is an amazing place :) I am so happy to have tried this location (which I like better than the one in Hayes Valley) because of the restaurant layout. Particularly I love the back patio area, it's so nice to sit outside on a nice sunny day and enjoy my Soulva! 

I've tried the lamb and chicken (pita sandwich + salad) and both protein and variation are bomb-tastic. I highly recommend either, and next time I'm going to try the pork shoulder! 

Fries are absolute must-get. Be sure to get a dip too (my fav is the yogurt one). For some extra flavor, try dipping some into the hot sauce.

Last but not least, please be sure to get yourself (and one for each of your guests/friends/family/loved ones) a greek yogurt and you can never go wrong with baklava crumbles topping. Delicious :) I am so happy as I write this review because every day with Souvla is an amazing day. 

Thank you, Souvla!
Came here for a Greek yogurt after having dinner and it was good. Tangy, creamy, perfectly sweetened by the crumbled baclava and honey. I would come back to try the other flavors.

Their free range chicken salad is the BEST! I'm not to pay $$ for a salad I can make at home but this one is worth every penny. Wish I could replicate it at home but would rather enjoy Souvla's Chicken Salad.

Friends recommended we come here while visiting San Francisco and it was a great recommendation. 

We stopped by on a Friday for lunch and there was no line. It was fairly crowded inside, but we found a place to sit. It's fast casual and the food is ready very quickly. 

We ordered a chicken pita which was delicious. I loved the oranges that came on it as well as the sauce. They also had a house hot sauce that went well with it. 

Of course we also had to get the Greek frozen yogurt with baklava crumbles. That was amazing. The yogurt itself was not sweet, it was tart which paired perfectly with the baklava. 

This is definitely a great stop for lunch!

Souvla is a fast-casual Greek restaurant inspired by the souvlaki joints found throughout Greece. The food is lightweight yet flavorful. The service is exceptionally fast for the quality. I would recommend it to anyone looking to grab lunch in San Fransisco.

My wife and I shared the chicken wrap and the baklava froyo. Both were delicious.

It is very rare to find a modern twist on Greek food, but here it is! When I order a Greek salad, I don't plan on finding pickled onions, orange and pea shoots. Honestly I think my yia yia would hit me with a wooden spoon if she saw me order this salad. But it was really good! They call the dressing "Granch" but it just tasted like liquidy tzatziki (not a bad thing). I also got a side of the Greek Fries. Crunchy and perfectly seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley and cheese. The perfect side. I guess the funky take isn't for everyone because my boyfriend got the chicken sandwich and wasn't a fan. To each their own! 

I'm so happy to have found this place when I was craving something healthy but still hearty after a long week of overindulging in food. Mediterranean is always a safe bet. We weren't quite sure how it worked when we walked in but it's simple. Order at the counter and take your number to your table where they will bring you your food. They have a really cute outdoor section in the back with heat lamps but it was a little too chilly for me still. You can grab a bottle of water from the wall near the counter and as many glasses as you need. The space is so beautiful and classy while still feeling casual. I loved it. I felt like I was almost in my own restaurant - choosing my own table, getting glasses and a bottle as I need it. 

Menu is pretty straight forward! Just pick your meat- pork, chicken, lamb or veggies, and how you want it- salad or sandwich. Easy peasy delicious. Enjoy!

I would give Souvla a 3.5 stars rating if it were possible. Let me just say the ambiance of Souvla is great - I highly recommend eating in the back outside area if the weather permits, it's beautiful! Overall, pricing isn't too bad and you generally get pretty large portions. 

[FOOD]
- Chicken Salad Bowl: I didn't really like this much, but I think that's just my personal opinion. I wasn't the biggest fan of the salad dressing. The chicken was a tad on the dry side. But a fun option is that you can add fries to all the salad bowls for an extra cost.
- Juicy Potatoes: I thought these were good, but I probably wouldn't order them again. They are juicy, and flavored sweetly.
- Greek Fries: YUM definitely get the fries. They come out freshly hot and seasoned really nicely. I want more already!
- Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup Greek Yogurt: ugh I love me some frozen Greek yogurt. These toppings were also pretty good. You can count me to come back for the Greek yogurt.

I was visiting a family member at the hospital in SF. The nurse recommended this restaurant and figured why not give it a try. HIGHLY IMPRESSED! Menu is short & to the point which was great. Food was delish!! Staff was friendly & warm! Absolutely highly recommend!!
I love Souvla! The chicken salad is my favorite thing on the menu. I love going here for lunch with friends or for a glass of wine on my own!

Excellent chicken salad. We didn't accept the ranch and asked for the olive oil dressing instead. Woman at register was sweet. Not her fault but to charge 50cents for a to go utensil was petty, shitty, a lot of hutzpa especially considering it's a $19 small but excellent salad. The .50 cent utensil prevents this from being a 5 star review.

we stopped in for the frozen yogurt it was probably the best frozen yogurt I've ever had in my life. the staff was super friendly it was very busy but I got my treat very quickly. we will be coming back to try the food and sit in the cute little area in the back

I've only had the pork bowl and pork sandwich here because why order anything else? They are both delicious, juicy and fresh. So glad there are several of these around the city. This is a must try for lunch!!

My favorite spot in the city to get a delicious salad.  I've pretty much tried everything here from the salads to pitas to fries to desserts.  

You have the choice between 3 meats:  Chicken, pork, or lamb.  For me, it depends on what I order.  The chicken salad is my overall fave.  Coming in close at second though is the lamb pita.  Don't forget to add fries to everything.

Order at the register, grab a number, find a table, and magic will be coming your way.  I love the Greek wine they offer.  And...you can't leave without a baklava froyo with honey.  YUM.  

Parking is pretty scarce in the area although I do find a space every time if I'm driving.  The lines can get long and the turnover amongst the tables and chairs is usually very quick.  Tons of to go orders.  Love it.

Great little spot for a brunch or a quick bite 
The portions are perfect !
Their house lager is really y  good too - like full body but little bitterness to it 
And ya - they got 3 more locations!!!
I got the veggie falafel sandwich and the frozen yogurt with baklava and honey. I highly recommend both. Super flavorful and filling.

I've had food here before and loved it, but this time tried the frozen Greek yogurt. My friend recommended the olive oil and sea salt, and believe me I was as hesitant as you probably are, but let me tell you, WOW. The greek yogurt itself is the perfect balance of sweet and tangy, but the olive oil and sea salt compliment it in all the right ways. I went on a Saturday at 3pm and no line. Very quick and friendly staff. Pro tip for those counting macros: they have their nutrition online!

Some friends and I were looking for a place to eat in SF, and someone suggested Souvla. They had heard that Michelle Obama loves this place, so we figured it must be good! Long story short, Michelle knows great food!

The restaurant itself is long and narrow, with seating at the front of the restaurant, outside, and down the hall. Order at the counter located in the middle of the restaurant and then you are free to sit where you'd like. Just place your number on the table, and someone will bring your food out to you.

We ordered the Mary's Free-Range Chicken Sandwich. This came with "Granch" dressing, fennel, navel orange, pickled red onion, pea shoots, and mizithra cheese in a pita bread. After my first bite, I was literally speechless. It was SO SO good! I couldn't put it down! The chicken was shredded, tender, and they gave a LOT! The dressing was super tasty, and the many ingredients were so well-balanced in flavor and quantity! We also had the Lamb Salad. This had harissa-spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onion, and feta cheese. Don't get me wrong, this salad was amazing, but the Chicken Sandwich won my heart! I cannot wait to come back! Please open a location in the South Bay!

We have been waiting to go back to Souvla on Divisadero. We placed our order on their Mobil app. We ordered 2 salads with dressing on the side, Greek fries and dipping sauces, and Greek yogurt. The receipt on the bag showed everything I ordered. Upon getting home we had NO salad dressing at all for both salads. Needless to say this was disappointing. Not wanting to drive back we just improvised with what we had. Since they are only doing pick up and take out they need to be diligent in checking their orders. Kinda ruined our salads. 

Greek yogurt was just delicious!

Mediterranean souvlaki serve as a sandwich or a salad,  Just did a takeout Pork and a Lamb sandwich along with Greek Fries.  I had the lamb and it was real tender.  My only problem with each was that in both cases there were small shards of bone.  in my case it was really sharp and cut my gums.  

Food came out pretty quickly and I was in and out in less than 10 minutes.  The fries were good.  I had the granche yogurt which was like having a nice mayo aioli in my fries.

I will be back again

I'm visiting SF and was told by a friend to check this place out for the froyo. It was one of the best decisions I made on this trip! I got the froyo with baklava pieces on top which was absolutely divine! It was some of the tastiest froyo I've probably ever had. They had other things on the menu as well and other flavors of froyo but I specifically was craving this one. Would highly recommend! Service was fast too, which is definitely a plus.

This place really hits the spot! We got the sandwiches (lamb and veggie) , fries, and baklava honey greek yogurt. I really recommend trying the yogurt since it's the perfect combination of tartness and sweet cinnamon flavor of the baklava-can't go wrong!
Their salads are delicious, but my favorite is the dessert! I could eat here everyday $$$

The food is just okay; room was packed when I went. Maybe for the frozen greek yogurt? It was probably the best item of what I tried. 

The frozen greek yogurt with baklava was not bad, it had a great tangy taste and creamy texture. The baklava on top was a nice addition and sweet, creating a tasty balance for the yogurt. 

I sadly did not enjoy the fries or wrap. The fries were cold when they arrived and they weren't tasty. Really bland and dry inside, cheese crumbles were not good either. Chicken wrap- the chicken was dry, yet drowned in oil which kept leaking out. It was messy. Pita bread was good (soft and fluffy, crisp on the outside). Meh, maybe in a bowl is better, maybe a different protein option is better if you decide to dine here.
Big fan of Souvla's frozen yogurt!!! Perfect tartness and also sweetness, I've only tried the olive oil sea salt and baklava crumbles and my fav is the olive oil sea salt, very unique taste!

Second time at a Souvla location.  Not sure exactly why I went again.  Wasn't very inspiring the first time.  Don't get me wrong, it's okay, but okay isn't good enough.    The vegetarian sandwich option makes absolutely no sense.  Seems like it's a bunch of ingredients wrapped together.   No harmony. 

All in all, an average experience at best  from start to finish.

Came here on the weekend.

Only tried the Chicken Salad and Lamb Sandwich. 

The meat melt in your mouth with a soft bread, and the sandwich, overall, much bigger than classic sandwiches. The salad looked fresh and the ingredients were all good quality.

 

Just a good place with tasty meals!

Souvla is a great fast-casual Greek spot with a few locations throughout the city. The food is delicious, but I'm here today to talk about the NEXT LEVEL frozen Greek yogurt. 

Seriously - I've been the past two nights in a row just for the frozen yogurt. It's the best $5.50 you will spend all month! There's only one flavor, but the topping selections are unique and totally authentic.

My favorite flavor is the baklava and honey, followed by the sour cherry. Even the olive oil & sea salt is amazing if you're looking for a more savory option.

Souvla makes a nice dinner spot but boy oh boy do I love their frozen Greek yogurt.

Huge fan of fast casual / counter service in San Francisco and the Souvla chain ranks among my top favorites.  The menu is narrowly focused on 3 types of spit roasted meats (and 1 veggie option I never bothered trying) offered in two forms: salad or pita sandwich.  Much more unique than regular soup/salad joints because the rotisserie meat is simply amazing.  Plus the ambiance almost feels like a full service restaurant.

Chicken Salad: I'm not a salad kinda guy, but I'm totally into Souvla's chicken salad.  They're really generous with the chicken, cheese and creamy sauce.  The fruit and veggies work very well to complement all the aforementioned umami and richness.  It's like you're getting your vegetables, but you're not sacrificing taste.

Chicken Sandwich: I am in utter disbelief that I prefer the chicken salad to the chicken sandwich.  Same central ingredients, but wrapped in a chewy pita.  The chicken is delicious of course and it's really packed in.  The pita is delicious too.  The sandwich just feels really heavy.  I noticed myself missing all that kale from the salad, which does a great job cutting the fattiness of the filling.  Also, the breast meat chunks felt particularly dry against the starchy pita.
Great place for an afternoon snack. Got the frozen yogurt and fries, really hit the spot!

I've been wanting to try Souvla for the longest time since it's been popping up on ig and tiktok, and I must say it did NOT disappoint!! My friend placed an order online and it was ready in 15 mins! With Covid and the transition to take-out orders only, it's understandable that many businesses have a longer wait time so a quick and easy way to order and pick up is always appreciated.

We ordered the lamb and chicken salads which were delicious! I'm usually not a fan of fruits in my salads, however, the addition of mandarins in the salads were very tasty. The highlight of the order was definitely the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava & honey! It's been a few days since I've had Souvla and I've caught myself thinking about the frozen Greek yogurt on multiple occasions.

It looks like they also have a really cute back patio that would be great for outdoor seating so I surely have to come back and enjoy that, Post-COVID!

Souvla is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I always go for their chicken salad and fries. What's in their fries?!! Why is it so good? They're crack fries!! Even tho I get stuffed I have to eat the fries with harissa sauce! 
    This location is a bit bigger than other locations and there is additional outdoor seating in the back of the restaurant. I don't recommend sitting in front of the rotisserie when they're cooking chicken bc it's blazing hot!!

I definitely think Souvla is more for the people who enjoy salads and healthy foods. I came here on a Saturday and it was pretty crowded. We waited about 10 minutes in line to order. You have to order first and then sit down. I ordered the pork salad bowl. There was a looot of kale in it! We also got their greek fries. I think you can live without the fries as they mostly tasted like regular fries. I couldn't really taste the seasoning on top. My pork salad bowl was huuge. I'm not sure if it's because I didn't really enjoy that type of food or because there was too much kale or maybe of both? I thought it was nothing special. I did feel like they gave you a huge portion so you could have this for lunch and then enjoy leftovers for dinner. 

If I come back again, I will definitely try their greek yogurt!

I'm conflicted between giving Souvla a 3/5 or a 4/5, and I'll explain why. I had this place on my radar for a while and I was excited to finally swing by and grab dinner but also see what the hype for this frozen Greek yogurt was about.
The way Souvla works (or at least this location) is that you stand on line, order, take a number, and then sit wherever you want. They don't have too many options so I ended up choosing the Superior Farms Lamb Leg Gyro (~$14) along with a side of Greek Fries (~$5) to share.
The Lamb Gyro comes with harissa-spiked yogurt, cucumber, radish, pickled red onions, and feta cheese. The Greek Fries are mixed with olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, and cheese.
What I didn't enjoy was that the lamb pieces were chunks. They were tough and chewy. The gyro wrap wasn't warm so it felt pretty hard. There was also an overwhelming amount of feta cheese compared to everything else. I ended up opening it up to eat everything but the feta and gyro wrap. It was just disappointing. The Greek fries were solid and made up for the wrap, but only so much.
After dinner, I hopped back on line to finally try the Frozen Greek Yogurt (~$5)! I got the one with Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup. I love the cup design. It has an old time New York coffee cup vibe to it. The frozen Greek yogurt was light and tasted exactly like you'd imagine. The real winner is the baklava and honey. It was super tasty and although it was a bit difficult to separate the pieces out, once the frozen yogurt melted a bit, that was no longer an issue.
Overall, lamb gyro - 3/5, Greek fries - 4/5, and frozen Greek yogurt - 4/5. I wouldn't get the gyro again and definitely don't recommend it. It wasn't an authentic take on the gyro and the flavors were pretty lackluster. I'm willing to give Souvla another try but also not excited to come back here.

I went to Souvla today and was surprised when there was no line out the door as their usually is. We came here on Labor Day at noon and waited no more than 5 minutes for our order to be taken. 

FOOD: I ordered the lamb sandwich and my friend ordered the pork sandwich. While I actually preferred his pork sandwich to mine, he said that the lamb undoubtedly surpassed the pork sandwich and he would have ordered the lamb if he had known. We also got their fries which were okay, nothing too special. And of course, we had to have our baklava and Greek yogurt (we actually went to the Valencia location after the Divisadero location since this ice cream machine was broken). I'm not a big fan of Greek yogurt, but I would eat Souvla's any day of the week. It was absolutely amazing and I couldn't get enough even though I was so full from lunch. 

SERVICE: good. Nothing extraordinary, but kind hosts and waiters who brought our food. 

If you're in SF, Souvla is a must visit. Their sandwiches are comparable to other Mediterranean restaurants, but their Greek yogurt is unbeatable!

Great Salads, great sandwiches although the chicken sandwich tends to be dry because all of the salad was at the beginning and no salads inside. The decoration of the restaurant is simple, authentic makes you travel to Greece ! The place was empty when we went ( Thursday afternoon) they serve wine and frozen Greek yogurts with baklava (my favorite) I tried the salt and olive oil one which was too different and very salty for a dessert! 
Overall a great place to eat!

Souvla is a great go to place for a healthy meal out, delivery, or a sweet treat. I love their chicken wrap and recommend getting fries inside or on the side because they're so delicious.
The frozen Greek yogurt is one of my favorite parts about Souvla. I prefer the Greek olive oil and flaky sea salt flavor. The first time I had it it was way too salty. I now ask for light on the salt and it is the perfect amount.

Went here for a $6 Greek frozen yogurt with backlava and it was  AMAZING. I am generally a froyo lover and this place just nailed it. Super creamy, tasty, not too sweet but flavorful with the very nice chewy sweet baklava... ohhhh amazing!

Souvla has come up a few times as an office lunch choice. I finally decided to see what they were all about on Friday, October 6th. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar around 12:15pm.

*Pork Sandwich: American homestead pork shoulder with minted Greek yogurt, cherry tomato, pickled red onion, cucumber, and feta cheese wrapped in fresh and warm pita bread, Yogurt on the Side ($11)
*Greek Fries: Crispy fries tossed in olive oil, lemon juice, herbs, and mizithra cheese ($4)
*Greek Frozen Yogurt ($5): Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup (+$2)

First off, the sandwich is huge! Especially with the huge pita bread. I'm not much of a pita person, so I mostly just ate the insides. Flavor wise, I thought the whole sandwich was a little bland. It needed more than just the yogurt sauce to add flavor. The fries were great! Arrived crispy which is hard when it comes to delivery. I actually used the yogurt from my sandwich as a dipping sauce for the fries. I liked the froyo as it was nice and tart. The baklava was a little hard to eat as it came in a giant clump on top of my dessert. It was hard to break apart and eat with the fro-yo. Not sure if this was due to the transit time, but I could have done without baklava. Glad I tried it though.

In the end, I wasn't wowed by their sandwich, but I enjoyed the rest of the items. Too bad as the sandwich was the main item. Overall, 3 stars.

They were closed for a while due to covid but they are back and judging from the lines when I went to pick up a pork salad, it wasn't just me that missed their salad or sandwich selections. I always think there's too much and I'll save some for another meal but I end up eating it all since it's so good.

Solid food. There are only a handful of items on the menu but enough variety between items that you'll find something for you. If you arnt a fan of heavy vegetables based foods this place isn't for you. They do have fries with variety of toppings and Greek style sauces which are pretty good. I tend to get fries only and go to the back garden under the heat lamps. There is very limited parking so don't expect not to walk a ways. Also, this place tends to be crowded but in the very back there is a long table and bar with a couple seats open. People do tend to stay and enjoy the scene. The ice cream is solid stuff although if you don't like the sour Greek Mediterranean taste you'll hate it. The backlava ice cream is the best I ask for extra honey.
The kindest staff -- Leah you, rock -- thank you for great dinning experience. The salads are phenomenal, the is wine delicious.

One word potatoes. Wow they are off the hook good! Cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly. For $5 the portion is very generous, they looked so good in the picture I had to order them. I pick up delivery from here often and I see why they're so popular, maybe one day I'll try other items to give the 5*s

To be fair, the only thing I've tried here is a salad missing dressing (had asked for it on the side but there was no dressing at all when I opened the box). But I wasn't super impressed by the undressed lamb salad - I did not particularly love the cubed nature of the lamb chunks and the salad is pretty expensive given that it's a takeout gig. Although part of it is on me in that I probably messed up and should have just ordered a wrap. Tentative 3* for now but maybe the wraps will change my opinion.

Only came here to try the frozen Greek yogurt and wow was I impressed. I hate regular Greek yogurt but the frozen/soft serve style version they serve here was amazing. I got mine with baklava and honey and it was so damn good. The frozen yogurt had a hint of that Greek tang but paired with the honey it was heaven. Definitely recommend this place for the frozen Greek yogurt. 
The service here was friendly. Hey have a cool outdoor seating section in the back. They have a huge chicken roaster up front that smelled amazing. Will definitely be back to check out their regular food

I've wanted to try Souvla for a while, and now that they have 3 locations throughout SF, it's easier than ever to grab a bite of delicious Mediterranean food. 

I stopped by the NoPa restaurant on a Saturday night and it was crowded, but I was still able to grab a seat. This place is classy, yet casual -- you order your food at the counter, receive a number, sit down, and wait for your food to be served. Despite the casualness, the restaurant is chic, bright, and airy and the NoPa patio is oh so dreamy! 

The prices are super reasonable by SF standards -- $11-13 for an entree. I ordered the pork shoulder pita sandwich and my dining companion ordered the lamb pita sandwich. Both meats were tender and seasoned to perfection. The pita sandwich is quite substantial and I couldn't even finish mine (probably because I couldn't stop snacking on the Greek fries!!). The frozen Greek yogurt looked tempting, but I was too full after eating dinner here to order any. So of course I had to came back the next day for frozen Greek yogurt topped with olive oil and sea salt. It was delightful and I'm convinced it's the perfect snack!

Everything I tried at Souvla was incredible. I definitely think this restaurant is worth the hype.

Was sooo hyped about this place the first time I tried it because everything tasted so delicious. Came back two more times though and it just wasn't as good?? I got the salad the other two times and the chicken was pretty dry. 

The first time we were there though we got the olive oil frozen yogurt which was great (I love any ice cream or frozen dessert with olive oil in it). The olive oil is flavorful and comes across strongly. Also got the wrap with chicken - it was pretty good, I think because the sauces in it make it tasty. The chicken itself I'm not that impressed with. 

I particularly really like this location because of their cute outdoor area. Came here in the late afternoon and the vibes in the outdoor area when the sun is setting is so chill. There's a bunch of plants all around you and I like how the seating is raised up. Cute and friendly date spot or good for catching up with friends!!

I almost always get the same thing at Souvla: pork shoulder sandwich with garlic yogurt instead of mint yogurt. It's tasty and fresh, however at this point I think I'm going to move on from Souvla because I think it's overpriced. Value is important to me and, personally, I don't think it's reasonable to charge $15+ (tax included, without tip) for a sandwich alone.
Small portions, I remember being stuffed when I used to come here but the salads are now smaller and I leave hungry.

After a morning of walking around SF, this was exactly what I needed to refuel. I got the lamb salad bowl and it was amazing. The lamb was tender and flavorful. The pickled red onion and feta cheese also packed a big flavor punch! I was full after I ate, otherwise I would have loved to try the baklava frozen Greek yogurt! 

The restaurant itself is really cute, there's lots of light and seating inside, out front, and outback. The only drawback is that there's one bathroom. 

Bottom line: Try the lamb bowl. If you're extra hungry, get the fries on top or save room for dessert!

This place gets a big negative 1 star in my book. Me and my family order two salads, fries, yogurts and a whole chicken. The weird thing about this place is that they have a big rotisserie display but the only sell their chicken in a to go box. When i get my order of salad and fries, i had to go back to get my order of chicken. They don't chop it up for you, so i tear out a drum stick. Then one of the workers tells me that i can't do that here. Wait did i not pay for this chicken that came from here? Well yes i did pay. Was there a sign to not eat chicken here? No there wasn't. Do after we are it salad we left. 

So that left a bad taste in my mouth. 

Now on to the food. The salad it self was okay. Chicken what i was able to eat was dry and bland.

My recommendation is to go to RT Rotisserie. 10 times better in favor and value.

Two words: baklava froyo. It never fails to remind me of an old high school classmate who told our economics teacher in all seriousness that proximity to a froyo place was critical in helping her narrow down her college search. I'm not sure where she is these days, but I hope she finds her way to Souvla soon.

But the rest of Souvla's food is so good that it makes it incredibly difficult to still have room for dessert. I am a creature of habit, so I always go with either the chicken sandwich or salad. The "granch" dressing (I think it's supposed to be a Greek yogurt-based ranch), pickled red onion, mizithra cheese, incredibly juicy chicken, and naval orange combination is beyond flavorful. In fact, the chicken is so juicy that it can make the sandwich fairly messy to eat, so bear that in mind.

I've eaten at both the Hayes Valley and NoPa locations, but I definitely prefer this one on Divisadero. The atmosphere of both locations is pretty consistent with the same kind of Instagrammable decor found at every trendy spot in San Francisco these days, but it's more spacious here (brownie points for the heated patio in the back!), something for which you'll be thankful when it inevitably gets crowded.

Let's get down to business now: the baklava froyo. It's frozen Greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbles and honey syrup. Don't forget to mix the baklava while you eat to maintain a good baklava-to-yogurt ratio. The sweetness of the baklava and the tartness of the Greek yogurt is a match made in heaven.

The ingredients were very fresh. The garlic fries were crispy but the garlic flavor was not strong. The salad was very healthy and pretty. Our sandwiches unfortunately came cold. Too much yogurt sauce and the pita bread wrap was soggy. I was surprised that the sandwiches were cold even though we ate at the restaurant. It didn't taste that good in a cold day. Maybe a warm day would be better for their food.

Cubed lamb in the pita sandwich was so dry. No tomatoes. Only came across some sauce towards the last third of the sandwich.

The pork sandwich was juicier and saucier. Wow, it had the equivalent of 2.5 grape tomatoes.

Maybe it was my fault that the sandwiches were dry because I asked for no cucumbers on both sandwiches.

The baklava on the frozen yogurt was so incredibly hard. It made trying to eat it difficult.

Also, the air freshener was horribly smelly in the bathroom. Why can't most restaurants vent their restrooms better without the use of strong fragrances.

Hot damn this place is good! Seriously, everything on the menu is epically delicious and made with such high quality ingredients. 

I'm familiar with the menu as I've been eating at the Souvla location in Hayes Valley since it opened and love the fact that there's one on Divisadero St. too! Yesterday I opted for the chicken salad which is so damn delicious. I usually opt for the lamb because it's a tough protein to do well at home but, chicken sounded good. Oh, also went "Greek style" which is a topping of fries and it's just legendary. 

Look. Moral of the story is that you can't loose with your order. It's all perfection in a wrap, bowl. Boom.

I remember trying Souvla and liking it. Came to this location, ordered the chicken sandwich, and the flavors were just not right to me. The chicken was so dry, felt like there was no sauce, and there was too much cheese. Every bite was just dry and just did not taste good. I wanted to stop eating after one bite. And to add to that, it's not a cheap sandwich.

Driving down Fulton St., I was thinking about something sweet to nibble on, specifically Chocolate Cake from Whole Foods.  Since I missed the turn to Whole Foods, Souvla came to mind so I made a quick right turn and headed to Divisadero towards Soula's new home.  

I remember a fellow IGer mentioning this place for their fries but since I was all french fried out for the day, I opted for their yogurt.  

-Baklava Crumbles & Syrup - When you think baklava, you think layers of filo and honey and everything sticky but this was everything but.  The sourness, but very subtle, from the yogurt was well balanced with the baklava crumble.  I love me some crumble and this reminds me of those pies topped with a mountain of crumble...the only part of the pie i eat, and the crust.  At first, I didn't think one scoop would be enough for the huge cup of yogurt but it was, phew!

Lots of seating, friendly service, yummy yogurt

I've seen so many aerial shots of Souvla, and I've always thought of it as just another gentrified place with colorful salads and enticing-looking swirls of frozen Greek yogurt. Although I still do feel like it's quite gentrification-y, I found myself quite satisfied with the food (and enticed by the Greek yogurt P:)

TL;DR - Tasty California-Greek fast-casual, but so expensive! Wraps are $10 veggie, $11 pork, $12 chicken, $13 lamb. +$1 for the salad. I probably subconsciously gulped with each extra dollar I noticed as I scanned the menu. We ended up spending $30 for a quick lunch for two o.O

The CHICKEN SALAD turned out to be hearty and surprisingly filling. I liked the kale base, though the random pieces of romaine seemed out of place. Overall, the citrusy navel orange, sweet pea shoots, mildly pickled red onion, and decadent mizithra cheese shavings created a delicious, well-rounded salad. I wish I asked for less dressing (it's "Granch", tasted identical to ranch; would have much preferred a healthier yogurt based sauce like all the other choices). I appreciated the generous portions of roast chicken, but it was too salty and dry in my opinion. I had trouble finishing it towards the end because it was so salty! But I guess the healthiness from the kale and free-range chicken balances out the negative health effects of all the salt :3

I also took a bite of the boo's PORK SANDWICH. As you are greeted by rows of rotisserie pork shoulder with salivation-inducing aroma at Souvla, I was excited to try this slow-roasted pork. It had good flavor, but like the chicken, I found it way too salty. 

Despite my complaints of the saltiness, the famous frozen Greek yogurt comes to the rescue for a dessert of redemption. We got the CRETAN WILDFLOWER HONEY YOGURT (because I'm too cheap to pay an extra dollar for the baklava crumbles :) and it was magical. The tart yogurt paired excellently with the sweet, floral honey. It reminded me of Shake Shack's frozen custard, only healthier and lighter. The consistency was also perfect, not too frozen and not too melty while we devoured it. 

One thing about their food that was unexpected is the lack of hummus. Seeing that it's such a big health food trend, I think their menu would benefit from some hummus spreads and sauces. (They could even use Costco/mass-produced hummus, and no one would really know!)

The space is picture-perfect--olive wreaths on the walls, wooden tables, metal stools. Service is also very fast; the food arrives in no time after you order. 

The verdict? Kale salads, free-range chicken, Greek yogurt, hefty prices, Pinterest-like decor, and inclination for aerial Instagrams scream gentrification, but the frozen greek yogurt... I'm sold.

I can't wait to go back! I had several places bookmarked before my weekend in the Bay and Souvla was first on my list! Hubs wasn't hip on the idea of Mediterranean since he goes on business trips there and has had his share of it. 

I dragged him here anyway and he was just as pleased as I was! We ordered the pork shoulder sandwich, fries and salad. The sandwich was huge, we shared it and still couldn't finish it! The fries were mediocre, I think I'll order the juicy potatoes next time. The salad was delicious. With feta, olives, cucumber, romaine, tomatoes, and kale. Both the sandwich and salad was on point! 

The cashier was friendly and the service was fast! We dined outside in their urban landscaped patio. I'll definitely make a return trip if I'm in the area! Delicious, fast, fresh and healthy food!

With New Year's having just passed, I'm sure we're all still keeping with our resolutions to eat healthier and to lose those extra pounds we've been lugging around.  To be sure, it's not easy to stay disciplined with hitting the gym and eating healthy, but it's definitely a lot easier when you can eat salads as delicious as Souvla's!  Yes, they may not be the healthiest ones out there, but HEY...it's better than not eating a salad at all!

Since I've never been to their spot in Hayes Valley, it may (or may not) be better than this Souvla, but I still think this one is pretty damn awesome!  While it initially looks small, there's actually a good amount of seating (they have a nice back patio area).  Most  importantly though, the food is terrific!  The menu isn't extensive (choice of pork, chicken, lamb, or vegetarian as a salad or sandwich/wrap, sides, soup, and frozen Greek yogurt), but I've enjoyed just about everything I've tried.

-- GREEK FRIES - Olive OIl, Lemon Juice, Parsley, Mizithra Cheese (with Harissa-Spiked Yogurt)...$4 (+$1)
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
The Harissa-spiked yogurt (which is the same as the one in the lamb salad, I believe) made for a terrific dip, but honestly, it was kind of unnecessary as the fries were PERFECT!  I loved the mizithra cheese and lemon juice, but I was most impressed with how crispy the fries were!

-- SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG - Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onions, Feta Cheese...$14 (Salad)
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
Despite really wanting to try their pork, I felt compelled to get the lamb the first time I came here (Greek restaurant and all).  Thankfully, it didn't disappoint!  The lamb tasted great, was really tender, and wasn't the least bit gamy.  What's more, the harissa-spiked yogurt and feta complemented the lamb really well.

-- MARY'S FREE-RANGE CHICKEN - "Granch" Dressing, Fennel, Navel Orange, Pickled Red Onions, Pea Shoots, Mizithra Cheese...$13 (Salad)
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
I was hopeful, given how good the chickens looked spinning inside the rotisserie oven, but it was underwhelming.  While decently flavorful, the chicken's consistency was uneven; some pieces were fine, others were hard and dry.  Still, the rest of the salad was pretty tasty, especially the dressing and the brightness the oranges added.

-- AMERICAN HOMESTEAD PORK SHOULDER - Minted Greek Yogurt, Cherry Tomato, Pickled Red Onion, Cucumber, Feta Cheese...$12 (Salad)
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
My favorite of the three.  Not only was the pork cooked perfectly (crisp on the outside, juicy and moist on the inside), but it tasted AWESOME!  The seasoning on the pork was great and mixed really well with the minted yogurt, feta cheese, and pickled red onions.  Delicious!

-- CRETAN WILDFLOWER HONEY Frozen Greek Yogurt...$4
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
Unlike what I expected, the yogurt was really creamy and not quite as tart as I thought it'd be (which is a good thing).  Of course, the honey definitely helped with the latter.  I'm not sure how to describe it, but the honey felt lighter and sweeter than regular honey (though not abrasively sweet).  Thankfully, it didn't have a strong floral tinge to it either.

-- BAKLAVA CRUMBLES & HONEY SYRUP Frozen Greek Yogurt...$5
(yelp.com/biz_photos/souv…)
As much as I liked the Cretan Wildflower on the frozen yogurt, the Baklava was so much better!  Not only was there a good amount of it, but the baklava added a nice textural contrast and had just the right sweetness to offset the tartness of the yogurt.  YUM!

Beyond simply how good all of the food was, Souvla is a fantastic value for the money.  I haven't had their sandwiches/wraps yet, but $12-14 for a salad this tasty and filling?  I paid the same for a salad at Squat & Gobble and it wasn't nearly this god!  Plus, the workers here are all so friendly, which makes just that much better in my book.

Souvla, you probably aren't as healthy for me as I'd like to think you are, but I sincerely hope that I'm wrong...because your salads (and frozen Greek yogurt) are definitely something I can build a diet around!

Wow these meats are delicious. It's expensive, but affordable for SF if that makes sense? A great meal option if you don't want something too casual or too dressy. I love the lamb salad, fries, white wine (good and strong!) and the baklava crumbled yogurt for dessert. 

Order first, get a number and wait at a table if you can find one, or grab a ledge like we did and stand. 

Love that you can go with a salad or a sandwich. Sometimes we split both so we get the best of both worlds. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It comes out quickly as well. Love!

My friend recommended this place for lunch so we decided to try it. She's come here many times before but this was my first time! There are two Souvla locations in SF - this one is a bit bigger but not the original. 

If you like gyros this place has such tasty flavors and a great variety! You can choose between a sandwich or salad - both pretty big portions. I ordered the lamb sandwich with a side of fries. Unfortunately, I think I was given the chicken sandwich instead of the lamb because the toppings were totally different than my friend who ordered the same thing. Regardless of that, I thought the flavors were amazing (although it would've been better if I got the lamb). 

My favorite part of Souvla is their Greek yogurt soft serve which my friend raved about. We actually ended up visiting both locations because the machine at this one was broken. This is a MUST if you're at Souvla. The Greek yogurt with baklava crumble and honey syrup was so good. The yogurt itself is pretty good but the baklava crumble takes it over the top! I would highly recommend.

I love the Hayes Valley location a little more but giving love there as well. I love SOUVLA! Can you open one in the Marina or FIDI? 

Food is always good, never disappoints. My favorite is still their Chicken Salad and Greek Fries. Soup option does change. Must try if they have the lemon chicken soup. Perfect when your sick, with a refreshing feeling. NEVER leave without their frozen Greek yogurt with Baklava. Dangerously delicious! Services is friendly. Place is clean and this location does have more seating than Hayes Valley.

A review for the NOPA Location: I've been a fan of Souvla for a while, and everyone that works there has always seemed very friendly, and the food is excellent, but today's customer service seemed exceptional. The woman who was working the front of the house & register, Leah, was so warm and friendly. My friend and I each ordered a Greek white wine, and afterward, while ringing us up, Leah asked us if we had ever tried the Retsina wine. We hadn't, and she asked us if we'd like to try it. She described it perfectly as being earthy & an interesting flavor palette. The wine itself was good, but her kindness and genuine personality are what left an impression. It was a lovely interaction and way of showcasing another product without coming across as trying to sell someone something. Later on, as my friend and I were still chatting away, she came by to clear our plates, and we chatted with her a bit and discovered she had only been working there a couple of weeks. I just wanted to thank her for the excellent customer service and let her employers know what a great employee she is. You're lucky to have her!

In the mood for Mediterranean? Head to Souvla.
This location is less crowded than Hayes Valley, and as an added bonus seems to be staffed entirely with extremely attractive men. The food is also generously portioned and comes out fast, so you can actually be in and out pretty quick for lunch. If you sit in the private patio area though, you won't want to leave.

Chose the lamb salad and Greek fries- salad was super fresh and more than I could finish. Ask to add on tomatoes, and use the house hot sauce. I hear their chicken salad is even better, so I'll probably switch to that next time. The fries with garlic dipping sauce were just okay, wouldn't get them again.

Souvla 2.0 is a hip jaunt which like 1.0 serves the most mouth watering spit fired meats made with Greek love!

The casual eatery lures you in with a warm bar area and a mesmerizing 6 foot tall rotisserie, showcasing the finest MMMeats slowly turning in front of you. The hot blue blaze hypnotizes as the fat droplets pull away from the protein bundle and hit the fires below. Hissssss.

* hey babe, can we have one of those things in our living room?! who needs a fireplace?! *

Ok, FOCUS. 

When you come here, you'll know to order at the counter, pay, take your number and sit down at the copper topped community table. Or if the sun is shining in its full glory, head to the back and enjoy their two-tiered patio. It's peaceful, personal and feels like discovering your own secret garden! (except other people know this secret too and will be sharing the space with you)

Thankfully, the food menu is short and sweet. You can't go wrong with getting the chicken or lamb salad. I almost always get lamb when I see it on the menu because it's one of those MMMeats that I don't prepare at home. Here, the salad is a deep bowl filled with nutritious greens, cucumber, radish, pickled red onions, feta cheese and drizzled with a harissa spiked yogurt dressing. It's an explosion of flavors! :0  and having a mound of shredded lamb leg meat will fill you up fast. 

Don't skip the crunchy Greek fries with a sprinkling of Mizithra cheese nor their delicious dessert. Since we were true yelpers (aka: fatties) we tried all 4 flavors of their Greek yogurt: sour cherry, classic EVOO & sea salt, wildflower honey and the baklava crumbles. Which is the winner? ALL of them! (told ya, we are fatties!) 

I'm enamored with Souvla and now I have more reasons to go to the DivCo corridor aside from Nopa up the street. Welcome to the neighborhood!

Pretty perfect though about $1-2 too expensive. I hope their staff are paid very well with the markup.

I prefer this location to the Hayes Valley one. Food at both is stellar and comes out fast but the real luxury at this location is a beautiful back patio. I love the sandwiches here but the salads are flavorful and come in generous portions. I've tried the chicken, lamb, and pork and all have been great.

Also, get.the.fries.

Gentrification Notes for the Owner:

As with all gentrifying businesses, please hire and train black and Latino people for the front of the house not just the back, give back to the neighborhood (donate food, charity of the month, etc.) and be humble about the people from the nabe who can't afford to eat here but would appreciate the opportunity to work here.

We had the lamb gyro meal with the Greek soup. Everything was fresh, hot, filling, super tasty and yes of course I'll be back. The soup reminds of of a lemony chicken soup. So good!!! Creamy and buttery.

The food is pretty good, but it's too expensive for what you're getting.

I got the lamb sandwich for 14 bucks and thought it was good: the lamb was extremely tender, the pickled veggies were a great bright contrast, and the pita was soft and squishy. But the size of the sandwich leaves a lot to be desired - this is barely a snack, let alone a full meal. 

The quality of the food here is pretty solid, but the really high prices keep it from being that great of a value.
I'm sold. Very fresh take on Greek food. Delicious, and also fast and inexpensive. Highly recommend!
You can barely find this spot, but don't miss it! Cute inside, but the food is SO good. Fresh and high quality ingredients. Will be back

Wasn't too hungry so I opted for something light. Had their lemon soup and potatoes. The lemon soup was quite interesting as this was my first time having any sort of lemon soup but overall, pretty good. I highly recommend the potatoes, which were seasoned extremely well!

Been coming here for years, and judging by the lines no need to Yelp this exceedingly popular, casual Greek spot, but I cannot resist talking up their sour yogurt with cherries, in case you haven't ventured there yet.
