Everything here is delicious, although I find their items prepared with lamb tend towards the salty, including their sandwiches and salad options.  Some may consider them well seasoned, but I'm reaching for the water, even with a crunchy, healthy salad.  

But the thing I really can't get enough of here is the frozen yogurt.  It's going to work for those who like the sour variety.  The frozen greek yogurt is delicious topped with the so-called sour cherries in syrup (which are actually quite sweet.)  If you tend towards the sweet side of life, you might chose to go the baklava and honey topped yogurt route, which is also very delicious, although far more sweet. If you are here with a small appetite and know you couldn't possibly eat both a salad (or sandwich) and dessert, then its an easy choice.  Get the fro yo!

Delicious Greek frozen yogurt (get it with the baklava crumble!!!)

Also, I do enjoy their white sweet potato salad... it sounds odd but the salad has a great combination of flavors. I like it better than the chicken salad. 

Fries are solid as well, and I may try them on top of a lamb salad next time I'm in.

Finally, there's not too much space here but I've been able to find a spot on the back patio each time.

Wait, this place is so good... I wouldn't call it authentic, but I don't care because everything here is SOOOO good! Loved their chicken salad and their chicken sandwich. I actually already ate before coming here, but still ate EVERYTHING because it was so good. I usually don't like fruits in my savory dishes, but the oranges worked so well in the sandwich and salad! The lemon soup was so perfect for my mild hangover, too.

The hot sauce was so good I actually bought two bottles :) 

Perfect casual lunch spot. 10/10 would recommend.

Souvla was an amazing gastronomic adventure in flavors. I ordered the weekend special breakfast wrap with lamb, and the dish was savory. They certainly know how to blend the flavors well between the feta, scrambled eggs, lamb and wrap. Be advised, it is a bit messy to eat, but the primary reason it's so messy is that the wrap is fresh and soft to the touch, so it isn't the best at staying together, but the staff here have certainly planned for this, and the wrap is served on a tray to catch every morsel to be scooped up a fork when done with the main portion.

I ordered Greek fries with my wrap, and the fries are unlike any I've tasted before. They are seasoned with what are obviously fresh ingredients and not synthetic flavors. For an extra charge, the fries come with a Greek yogurt dipping sauce, which is perfectly paired to the fries. These servings of dipping sauce are only big enough for one set of fries as I learned the hard way because my friend I was with decided to eat most of my dipping sauce before I could get to my fries. 

The space is a bit cramped, and I'd been here a few times prior but only to order off the dessert menu. This place is also great for a gourmet treat to walk and eat. The Greek yogurt with sour cherry sauce is delectable and not easily passed up. This dessert dish is also easy to walk and carry on night that this restaurant is too packed to enjoy dinner there. 

As far as pricing goes, it's NOPA, so the prices seem reasonably matched to the neighborhood if not slightly on the lower side of what I would expect from a NOPA eatery. All in all, a hearty-sized breakfast wrap and a side of Greek fries with dipping sauce came out less than $21, so I have no complaint regarding the pricing and what I have come to expect from this type of establishment.
I picked up food to go. It was very good, nicely packaged. Very quick. Close to coffee and golden gate park,

I've been a fan of the Hayes Valley location for some time now, I'd nearly always stop-in when I find myself in the area.  This new location on Divisadero is nearly identical in food quality and interior design to the first, and offers the same streamlined menu.  The seating layout in this location is about the only change with various sized tables throughout and patio seating in the back.  

I'm a massive fan of their chicken salad / wrap as well as the Greek frozen yogurt (all variations).  The fact that you can get a glass, carafe, or bottle of wine relatively inexpensively is only icing on the proverbial cake (mmmmmm, cake!)

Overall, Soulva is the bomb - a fast casual greek restaurant that serves consistently good food (plus you can watch the meat cook before your eyes).  My friends sometimes wish Soulva would add a few more vegetarian options, though I prefer a streamlined menu.

The meat is really chewy, dry, and not flavourful - i've tried this place twice thinking they might just be having an off day.  It was a miss for me. I do love their frozen yogurt and their service was good even thought it was super busy. I will give them another shot again and update.

Yummy but EXPENSIVE.

$14 for a souvlaki? You gotta be kidding me! The cheapest souvlaki is $11 and it costs a dollar more to make it into a salad bowl. Was it tasty? Yes but I mean ... I think the souvlaki I got in Greece was half the price, greasier, and tastier. I got the chicken souvlaki. I wished the chicken wasn't shredded though it was very moist and tasty. I did love the touch of sweet oranges that added a tang that balanced the umami meaty flavors well. Portion size = rather large! Couldn't finish the pita.

But I mean, this is the yuppy version of the classic Greek street food... served in SF. So it's healthier and you get to eat it in a nice, sit-down environment. Don't forget the fries.

This place has been on my to go places for awhile so I was so happy to check it out!  Order at the counter and they'll bring it to your table.  They're really fast!  Officially one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  Everything from the pita wrap, fries, & frozen yogurt were amazing!  So amazing that I went TWICE in one week which says a lot.  Highly recommend! 
Ordered: pork pita wrap ($12), lamb pita wrap ($14), greek fries w/granch ($5), frozen greek yogurt w/baklava crumbles + honey syrup ($5)
Just came for the frozen yogurt and yum!!! Great balance of tart and sweet. So refreshing!

The Souvla baklava froyo is a passion of mine. I'm at the Independent for shows fairly frequently, and I make it a point to stop by for some Greek froyo and fries before hitting up the venue.

I've very rarely seen the Souvla on Divisadero not be busy, but the crew is very efficient and the line moves quickly. I've found that my food generally comes out pretty speedily as well. Sometimes you have to camp out a bit to get a table, but I've never had an issue finding a spot to sit down.

The pork and lamb salads are my favorites for main dishes, but be warned - they're big meals. If sharing a meal with friends, a salad + a side or two are definitely more than filling. Half of the time, I just opt for the aforementioned froyo+fry combo and call that dinner.

While all of the food is excellent, my undying love for Souvla stems purely from the baklava froyo. The froyo itself is perfectly thick, creamy, and tart - a unique experience that is only enhanced by the addition of baklava. Each bite is a delicious moment of joy. I'm a loyalist to the baklava and haven't tried the other flavors, but my boyfriend got the olive oil + sea salt flavor on a whim and didn't seem to be as enthused as I was about mine.

My only complaint is that I got a brief bout of food poisoning (or something of the ilk) from eating the juicy potatoes once, which was a huge bummer because they used to be my favorites. I can't think about them without feeling sick now, so I recommend that if they ever taste off to you, trust your gut (literally). That being said, I've been here many many times and never had a single issue, and there are so many other items on the menu that I still have plenty to choose from. I've been here many times since, and will definitely continue to come back.

The food is average, nothing great. I prefer literally any other authentic gyro or Mediterranean restaurant in the city over this. Souvla is overpriced and the meat is subpar in comparison to other spots in SF. 

I gave it a second try. I ordered online and have decided to never come back. After ordering to the wrong location, I tried to cancel immediately and even called the store so they didn't waste their time making it. No one answered so I emailed thinking they would refund me like any business would, or at the very least allow me pick up my food that i paid for. 
Instead, they prefer to lose a customer over their "clearly stated policy" that all sales are final, which is only stated in the confirmation email after you order. Don't bother with your time or money here. Any restaurant owner knows that the benefit of keeping one customer is higher than any cost of food waste. Their policy screams money hungry.

We decided to try this place on our trip to sf and I would seriously come back just for this yogurt. We ordered the honey yogurt and the olive oil and sea salt but would recommend the honey the most. So creamy and just a touch of tartness. There's a beautiful park across the street to sit and enjoy too.

The line goes out the door almost every time I've been here, but it moves quickly and waiting for tables isn't too bad. The bussers are always on top of it and super quick to clear dishes to move tables quickly.

We ordered -

Pork salad - always my go-to. Tons of fresh, quality ingredients that contrast with each other so well. Juicy, fatty pork, crunchy cucumbers and onions, creamy dressing on hearty kale and romaine. One thing I don't like about the salad is that it comes with TOO MUCH feta. #firstworldproblem. A+

Lamb wrap - The creamy, spicy harissa sauce and well-seasoned lamb are the stars of this. The pita bread is soft, warm, and chewy. However, the distribution of ingredients was a bit off. The pita was so large that you had to eat it in two sections - the top & bottom of the pita. Top was all veggies while the bottom was the meat and sauce. It would have been nice for the ingredients to be mixed within the wrap or even just sauce ontop of the veggies. B

Fries - the fries were overcooked and too crunchy. The perfect fries should be crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, which these fries were not. Some fries felt like we were just biting through crust to get to the oily center. C

Very affordable for the quality and quantity of food. Dinner for two after tax and tip was $40.

I had some time to kill before an appointment and wanted to grab some lunch. It was a little after 1:30pm and they were still fairly busy, but the line went by fast. 

I decided on getting a chicken sandwich and fries. My total came out to around $20. 

I sat outside on the patio because all the tables were taken inside. My food came out quicker than I thought. 

I really wanted to love the chicken sandwich, but I couldn't even enjoy it because there were some pieces of chicken that were pink. But, everything else was fresh. The garlic fries were just ok. 

I would probably not come back for the food. However, I would totally come back to try the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup!

Souvla is quickly becoming my new favorite spot in the city for fresh, wholesome food - without a long wait.

I had some friends in town who had brought their dog with them. We were trying to find a spot in the city that had quality organic food with an outdoor seating area. Souvla was the perfect place. 

There was no wait and we easily found an outdoor table. They even brought out some water for my friends' dog.  The ambiance inside this particular location is lovely for any and all occasions. In addition to some front outdoor seating, they also have a back outdoor patio with heat lamps, which I saw a number of families enjoying.

At this particular Soulva, you order at the counter (their menu is simple and easy to order from.) and they have a swift team of staff that brings you out your dishes. Everything came out quickly and correctly.

My husband couldn't stop eating the fries and potatoes - lavishly drizzled in authentic Greek olive oil. My friends couldn't stop gushing about the quality of the meat and salad ingredients. And everyone's eyes beamed in delight as they enjoyed Souvla's decadent Greek Yogurt.

For superb - quick food - made with love and outstanding ingredients - Souvla is beyond what's up.

Trust.

Soulva has great salads with some tasty proteins. I prefer their delicious chicken, but all of their salads are equally good as well. While you wait for your meal it is highly recommended to try out their wines, all of them are great but their Rosè is something you definitely will not regret trying! 
The aesthetic to the place is super cute as well, and their live plant wall on the back patio is great for photos or a mini photo shoot!

A friend brought me here for the frozen Greek yogurt. Wow! Olive oil, sea salt, and a drizzle of honey was so simple and unique. 

I cannot wait to return to try the full dinner experience!

to be honest it was good - like i ate all my food - but i was not blown away at all compared to the hype. the veg sweet potato sandwich was under spiced compared to all mediterranean food i've had before - the potato, for example, was completely plain as an ingredient; there's no spices aside from what's in the yogurt. could also use more greens for sure! the greek yogurt with baklava was pretty good and quite an interesting item, although i'm not certain i'd go back for it. overall - glad i tried, would point people to a different greek/med spot

VEGETARIAN REVIEW
 
2 stars for food and 4 for their froyos.

Veggie options are bleak, the salads and wraps have no source of protein. Add falafel maybe? The fries are decent. 

Love their froyo, I mix baklava and cherry topping. Refreshing.

Last night we got the lamb salad and lamb sandwich and we didn't like either of them. The quality of the food in the Hayes valley location has changed. The meat smells gamey I had to remove all the meat from my salad. The rest of the salad was not impressive as well.

Souvla is amazing, every time.

Their menu is small but perfect as-is. Great for lunch or dinner. 

I love all of the salads. My favorites are the chicken and the pork. All of the ingredients are high quality and always fresh. I've only had the sandwiches a few time but they've never disappointed either. 

The Greek fries are also delicious. I especially love them with the "granch" (Greek yogurt ranch) dressing. 

Lastly, the frozen Greek yogurt is soooo good. Sometimes I come here just for that. It's creamy and tart but not too tart. The baklava topping is a great addition to bring in some sweetness. However, sometimes I just have it plain and it's still amazing. 

During my most recent visit I saw they have a breakfast sandwich which I can't wait to try!

As far as the setting, the restaurant doesn't have a ton of seating but you can usually find a seat if you wait a bit. They have a really cute outdoor patio as well. 

Don't let the lines scare you off, they move quickly and the food is 100% worth the wait.

Yeah- Open closer to my neighborhood on Divisidero.  There is a LOVELY outdoor patio (that I'm sure the neighboring residents with back porches HATE, but was beautiful, nice lights - a pretty wooden counter a large communal table and about 3-4 high tables for 2.

I got the Lamb sandwich - it was  a teeny bit dry (wish I had gotten the pork!), but overall, huge and yummy. My REAL complaint is with the size of the water glassed. It is about 2 sips of water, and no ice avail unless you ask..just put out BIGGER glasses, or bigger cups - really silly choice with all the other great choices they made about décor.

I was too full to get my favorite thing their magical frozen yogurt (It might have crack in it, is is soooooo creamy!!) with baklava crumbles. So I will be back and just get that and be happy!!

I'm a big fan of Souvla's chicken salad. It's refreshing and feels 'healthier' than many casual dining options. The citrus adds the right acidity without too much sweetness and it's really well balanced. 
Pre-COVID, the back patio was a great place to grab a quick lunch. But for now, I'm grabbing my chicken salad (and the occasional frozen yogurt with honey) to go.

I'm impressed with Souvla on Divis for two reasons:

First - we waited only 2 minutes for our order (Lamb Salad, Potatoes) to be prepared. Sure, they only need to toss the salad in a box, but even during prime time and probably 20 orders at the same time, this was pretty slick.

Second - while the space might be tight and finding seating is a challenge, the Divis location makes the most of its restraints by offering patrons a nice backyard (typical SF style!) with heat lamps in the winter.

I find the food okay - a bit of a hefty price tag for mostly a kale salad with some lamb ($14) so I wouldn't be a regular here, but it's a great alternative if you're not in the mood to wait for your NOPA table and instead want a quick bite.

MY FAVORITE! I loved this fast casual joint. It was fast, delicious, and so fresh! I got the chicken salad bowl and the greek fries with the greek-ranch dipping sauce but I preferred the garlic sauce my friend got with her fries. 
My only regret was not getting the dessert.

Heart Souvla! Since it is close to work, I stop by a couple times a week to have their vegetarian salad with chicken added on top. I've had their side order of soup and salad - both were yum! The other times I'm there, I'm getting their Greek yogurt with the sour cherries (that is my favorite so far of the ones I've tried). Service is friendly and quick.

Meh. Lamb was just ok and salad was average. For a $20 salad though, I do expect my order to be accurate (it was not) and it would have been nice if they would have provided even a napkin with takeout. As it was I got no napkin and they wanted 25 cents for a fork. Gee, thanks.

I've decided that Mediterranean food is my absolute favorite and for good reason. The location was full but there was still seating outside. I got the Greek fries and the Greek yogurt, both of which were good. I ordered both at the same time, but the employee asked if I wanted my yogurt later. I came back to the counter with my receipt and got the yogurt with cherry syrup. I will assume the rest of their food is amazing because it looked delicious and they did have meat on a spit.
Soooooooo good. Get it with baklava. wish they Are in other cities. Sucks I don't live in sf and can't find it anywhere else

Wonderful, so far the best place for pork salad! 

I am really amazed with taste, price and quantity + quality!
Recommended for sure.

Am I missing something here? My friend who got here first told me to skip the chicken because it was a little dry. I got the lamb salad *greek style* so it comes with fries. It was ok. None of the flavors really stood out and I thought it was pretty expensive. 

I wanted to try the greek yogurt but the frequent line when we were done deterred me. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but was really underwhelmed.

I went to Souvla for lunch a couple of times with my coworkers.  And both times the place was super busy!  And that is a great thing because it shows that they've got good stuff!

Despite being busy, getting a table was still pretty easy for my group since they have a huge patio in the back of the restaurant.

I had their chicken sandwich and avgelemono soup.  Both were delicious!

Mary's Free Range Chicken Sandwich & Avgolemono Soup -- bit.ly/2qRqgi0
The sandwich was amazing!  I was pretty surprised how it was stuffed with a good amount of their rotisserie chicken.  And I liked how the mandarins added some sweetness to the sandwich.  It all worked together.  The soup was really good!  I liked the lemony taste of the broth and it also had good chunks of chicken as well.  I enjoyed both so much, that when I came back again I couldn't resist ordering them again.

I definitely plan on visiting Souvla again in the near future.  Although I thought it was a little pricey for lunch, the portion size and flavorful taste justified the price.  I wouldn't mind getting another chicken sandwich or their chicken salad bowl topped with fries which is what I always see my Instagram buddies always get.

This is definitely one of the best Greek foods I've ever had, and that's coming from someone who's not a fan of it. Their portions are huge but it makes sense with the high price that comes with it. I wish they serve smaller portions so it doesn't get as messy, or some lunch combo so I could try everything without it costing over $20. I'm 50/50 on the frozen yogurt. It is good and addicting but I don't think it's anything to rave about, and I certainly have second thoughts about spending $7 for one.

I eat here at least once a week. A little expensive but at least it's got me eating salads. The salads have better value than the sandwiches in my opinion. I love the avgolemono soup and the frozen yogurt with baklava, salt and olive oil. The backyard makes this the best souvla location.
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. You can never go wrong with the pork salad (ask for Greek style if you're a craving fries!) and the baklava Greek yogurtt

To be upfront, I'm not a huge fan of Greek food (and by that, I mean the Americanized Greek that is ubiquitous in towns large and small across the country), but my friends and I came to Souvla after a day of biking and it was the perfect lunch. The lamb sandwich was good! It had a decent portion of meat, with a refreshing complement of crisp veggies. I also ordered the baklava froyo which was tart and delicious. 

The ambience and decor of the shop itself is also great, but it's a bit small. I would not recommend Souvla for large groups. Prices are exactly what you'd expect for a San Francisco eatery, which is to say higher than I'd like but totally in-line with other spots in the area. I would definitely come back!

We originally tried to go to the Souvla in Hayes but it was packed, literally a line doors down from the actual restaurant. This souvla in Divis was perfect because they had a big enough spot for guests to find a table to sit and the line wasn't ridiculously long 

My cousin & I have been craving an authentic gyro but souvla is more that that - the pork is tender and perfectly cooked, melts like butter in your mouth. I may even dare to say it's better than a gyro in Greece. The gyro is HUGE, I'm honestly surprised I finished the whole thing. March it with some Greek fries and you're all set. If you're going to get the ice cream, go big or go home - get baklava and vissino or you're missing out!

The only negative thing that I noticed is the staff seemed pretty grumpy being there.

Totally messed up my order at the Divisadero location.  Sandwich was missing the yogurt sauce, salad was missing the salad dressing and the soup was missing the rice, fries were over done none of this was up to the standards I was use to but decided to try this location out.  Definitely going back to Hayes St!

A few friends and I each had a chicken salad and shared 2 orders of the Greek fries. Delicious and fresh! And the food came out so quickly after ordering! 

Not only was it tasty, but aesthetically pleasing to the eye...rich, vibrant, robust colors! 

There are both indoor and outdoor seating. Indoor was bright, open, and clean. Outdoor patio looked cute, but I didn't actually go check it out. Next time! 

Will come again!

These folks were so wonderful and lovely to me. I was having a bad day and needed something comforting so I got the soup and a gyro. They were both fantastic. The soup really warmed me and was so delicious. The lamb gyro was tasty and tender.
They were so sweet, I told the nice man taking my order that my bank (Chase BTW) had screwed me over and he was such a sweetheart and threw in a French fries for me. 
Also said to let him know if I needed a yogurt, that he didn't want me feeling so down.
Well it helped and I recommend the food and customer service.  Good people still exist in San Francisco this was a great reminder of that.
Thank Souvla

Ok food but pricey. Guess everything is pricey in the city. We got lemongrass soup with chicken and rice.  It was delicious and flavorful. Soup was refreshing n burst of citrus flavors. 
We also got chicken sandwich which was delicious. Nice ambience and may stop by but there are always so many options on d city to try

A pictures worth 1000 words. I was starving and in a hurry, or I would have stopped after the first bite. 
Later..... perhaps TMI but 3 hours later I purged that terrible dinner. So one star.

Salads are definitely basic, but Souvla has managed to put the right touches to theirs so that it is anything but that.

Filled with cheese, crunchy greens, super tender meat and other goodies, you will come hungry and realize that you can't even finish the whole thing...but mainly because you're trying to save room for some of their frozen greek yogurt. Or because you decided to have another glass of wine instead (It was a sunny day in SF and you couldn't help yourself).

Souvla is a 5 star joint because it has all of the necessities - creative twist on a common dish, high quality, outdoor seating with the perfect ambiance, fast service, dessert and wine. What more could you ask for?

This Greek chainlet is just wonderful. 
It's quick, inexpensive, healthy, and unique! 

They cover all the important things in a meal- they've got vegetarian options, low carb, gluten free, beer & wine, and of course, dessert. 

You have the option of choosing one of their spit-fired meats- Chicken, Pork, or Lamb- as a wrap or salad bowl. These are generous portions so you won't leave hungry.

On foggy rainy days or when I've got a bad cold, I love their Avgolemono soup- a traditional egg-lemon soup with chunks of pulled chicken and rice. It's creamy and puckery and warms you right up! 

The Greek fries and potatoes are nice if you're still hungry. 
And yes, even the wine and beer are Greek! 

For dessert, you guessed it, it's Greek Yogurt! But it's not your basic store bought stuff- it comes freshly made out of a soft serve machine and you have the option to add Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt or Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup. I know... I can never make up my mind. 

So whether it's a cold rainy day or during a rare heat wave, this place has got you covered with good food and yummy treats. So go ahead and GREEK out for Souvla!

Always a great quick stop for Greek Frozen Yogurt.  Tried the Baklava and my friend got the Sour Cherry Greek! Loved both but more partial to Baklava because it adds some much needed texture. Love the flavor of the Greek Yogurt, sweet but tangy, refreshing yet satisfying. 

Wish we could combine the two flavors, that would warrant a 5th star for sure!

Food has no comparison, great salad and AMAZING greek yogurt. Been here a couple of times when visiting SF. Unfortunately, last night picked up food, ordered a 1 vegetarian salad and 1 chicken salad. Boxes were labeled incorrectly. First bite of the "vegetarian" salad was unfortunately chicken...

I SO LOUV SOUVLA. Get it? I tried.
but really, I do love Souvla. 

It has consistently satisfied my daily nutritional needs and filled my empty soul with joy. I've tried most of the items on the menu, and think I like the vegetarian salad the best. There are sweet potatoes in them! The soup I got last time was a bit salty, but forgivable because it is souvla. Everything is great or above great, so you can't really go wrong. Large portions, good flavor.

I would definitely recommend the greek frozen yogurt. The baklava one t is really good, and so is the sea salt and olive oil one - despite the description. The other ones are just OK.

I would go for the sea salt! Somehow the salt balances out the sweetness of the yogurt and makes it easier to devour barbarically like a gluttonous savage that I occasionally transform into during dessert time.

I love souvla- and so does all of my friends and family. I am glad I was able to take advantage of it before I moved to NYC, and also make sure I go there when I'm in San Francisco. 

This location is my favorite, it's slightly bigger than the one in Hayes Valley. Cute outdoor patio with heat lamps, so pretty good year round. 

I always get their chicken salad- the citrus, and kale mix is delicious. Also I've had their gyro before, and it's pretty good too. Their fries and potatoes are to die for. To top it off- don't forget to get their frozen yogurt with baklava. Pro tip- split everything with a friend, because I always have leftovers!

We need Souvla in NYC!
Omg give me this every day and I will eat it. Any of the salads, I get two lemon soups every time, and soft serve is delivered frozen. I want this now!

I'd heard about this place from a friend and that's why I wanted to check it out.

You order and pay first, then sit down. This works for their menu as it's mostly wraps or salads. There's quite a bit of seating, including outdoors with some lights if you're coming with a few friends.

I ordered the chicken salad and split some fries with garlic dipping sauce. Unfortunately, I forgot to ask to remove onions so I didn't really enjoy it. Otherwise it's a very colorful, flavorful salad with a bit of citrus. The texture of the chicken reminds me of carnitas, different than what I was expecting.

The fries were the best part! Highly recommend the sauce to go along.

Overall I think the place is great but I'll definitely want to try a wrap next time instead.

Came with friends after dinner and tried out 3 different flavors of the Greek yogurt: the baklava, the sour cherry, and the olive oil and sea salt!

Got to sit in the patio with the heater. 

Oh and the meat from the grill smells really really good- probably the lamb- would love to come back and try it out!

Came here on a Saturday around 11:30AM and getting a seat was no problem at all. This location seems to be much less busy than the Hayes and Mission locations, which is a plus! They have a front patio and a really cute back patio so you can enjoy the nice weather, as well as normal indoor seating. It seems to be fast casual, so you order at the counter, get a number, and someone will bring the food out to you. 

I got to try the lamb salad Greek style (fries on top), roasted potatoes with rotisserie drippings, and a bit of the lamb sandwich. The prices may seem a bit steep but trust me, the portions are huge and they don't skimp on the meat. I felt like half of my salad was lamb! 

Standouts of the meal were the Greek fries (especially with the tangy hot sauce) and lamb sandwich. The fries are so crisp and flavorful, and the soft pita bread really compliments the lamb/veggie filling well. 

I felt like my salad had a little too much dressing, and while there was a lot of lamb, not every piece of lamb was that good. Some were rather dry so it was a little hit or miss. As for the roasted potatoes, we were really excited to try them but they didn't really seem to have much flavor of their own and were instead just swimming in rotisserie drippings, which made them a little too oily. I think it needed some more salt/spice. 

I'll probably be back if I'm in the area!

Out of numerous bookmarked food spots to try in the bay, I was especially excited for this one - namely their Greek froyo. However, being an avid froyo/ice cream lover, my expectations weren't too high. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich which was heavily drenched with olive oil. It was kind of a struggle to eat my wrap since it got oily, but I guess that was the point? I also felt like the chicken thigh meat could have been juicier. But my boyfriend enjoyed his lamb sandwich. We also got the roasted potatoes, which was swimming in a pool of olive oil as well. Wasn't bad with their house-made hot sauce though. Although in all honesty, we probably should've gotten the fries instead.

THUMBS UP for the cute outside patio! Minimalistic design with a cozy feel, while the mini heaters kept us nice and warm amidst the windy SF weather. 

Last but not least, that yogurt ... man. Exceeded my expectations without a doubt. Originally I wanted to try the sea salt and olive oil one, but I was kind of sick of olive oil by the end of the meal so I'm glad we went with baklava. The honey crumbs paired PERFECTLY with the tartness of the Greek yogurt. Oh that's money.
it's a good salad. get it greek style (fries on top). i don't understand why there are oranges in it though. the oranges are a problem.

Souvla is my go-to for a quick, feel-good, refreshing meal.

The Souvla on Divisadero is my favorite because it has a cute (but small) back patio, and it's super accessible for residents of Lower Haight/Alamo Square/NoPa. I love both the white sweet potato salad and the chicken salad, though as a meat-eater, I tend to pick the latter more often since I find it slightly more filling. 

My real favorite dishes at Souvla, though, are of course the Greek fries (+a side of Greek yogurt dipping sauce--worth the extra cost) and their baklava-topped Greek froyo. The super sweet baklava pairs so perfectly with the tart froyo base. While Souvla offers other solid variations of their froyo (that I have tried), when given the choice, why would you ever choose an option that DIDN'T come topped with baklava?

I love Souvla! The chicken pita or salad is the best! The veggie option is a close second. Even the lamb is good and I don't really like lamb. 

The menu is very tight, I wish they would loosen up on that a little. Hot tea would be a great addition to the menu. They have iced tea in a bottle, which for SF, is wildly optimistic. Maybe a special now and then? Work with me guys. 

The decor is cute, the meats are juicy (like lean over your tray juicy because I've stained some pants with drippings while I scarfed down my pita.)
One day I hope to try the fries and/or frozen yogurt. I've had a bad Retsina experience, so that one is not high on my list.

First timer here and I instantly became a fan of this place! My friend, who's a San Francisco native, took me here so I didn't know what to expect. But I loved almost everything about this place!

Definitely a hole in the wall! I guess it's normal, but restaurant is located right underneath a home! AMAZING. This place is definitely aesthetically cute from the inside seating area where you can look out the window to people watch while you eat, to the seating in the backyard looking area. We went when it was sunny weather so sitting outside was AWESOME. 

Downsides: Definitely the price. But hey, it's SF right? For just myself I spent around $23 - salad and fries! Not the most cheapest but I loved my salad. The portion was actually really large! Which I surprised about. I even had leftovers. The place is very tight. But that's a given. If you're in a large group, not the funnest place to walk through. But if it's just yourself or a date or something, PERFECT place. It's just such a relaxing place to be at for some reason. 

Overall a great experience for me. I don't often go to places like this but this was such a cute hole in the wall kinda place. Very clean, friendly staff, and relaxing place to be at. If you have room in your belly for some yogurt, don't forget to try it with Baklava. I don't like Baklava much, but theirs is frikkin delicious! Their meat - I got lamb - was so tasty and I felt so healthy and good eating it in a salad form (: Their garlic fries are also really good, but I think I could've lived without them lol. BUT their ranch was actually the topper. I don't know what ranch I got, but it's definitely not normal ranch lol. SO GOOD!

I was having a super bad day and just wanted a glass of wine with some decent food. Popped by around 4pm on a Thursday and it wasn't busy at all. I've been to all of the Souvla locations and love this one the best as it has the outside patio and is so much bigger than the others. 

Service - awesome. The guy behind the counter was super nice and talkative. 

Food - I got their chicken wrap with fries inside (yes, you can do this) and I got a glass of wine. Also added a harissa yoghurt dip as it's the bomb. Their food is always super good! If it's your first time, try their fries and a frozen yoghurt. My fav is the cherry as the baklava is kinda heavy.

I really like this location!

I had visited the Hayes valley location in the past and honestly find this one a bit nicer. It's in a more touristy spot so lots of foot traffic is going through, but seating is plentiful as is the serving side. 

The lamb is the bomb! I am partial to the lamb salad and would highly recommend it. 

They have some interesting beers and wines if you are interested in trying something new!

Parking can be tough in this area so I would recommend other transportation plans.

My friend and I came for lunch on a Tuesday.  Found street parking near Alamo Square and walked over to the restaurant.

Ordering process - paper menu at the counter.  Peruse it and then place your order.  Pay and find a seat with your order #.  Your food is brought to your table.

We both ordered the grilled lamb salad and one order of fries.  The salad portion size was humongous. Fresh greens.  Could have fed two people easily.     And the fries were very generous.  Nice and crispy.

Indoor and outdoor patio seating. It was a nice sunny day so I said lets sit outdoors.  Within a couple of minutes at the table, I'm attacked by two ants.  Yes, I'm always an insect target.  With that, we moved inside.

Plenty of self served tap water.

Souvla is sooo good. The best comfort food with great tasting and fresh ingredients! The employees are all super kind and helpful. Everything is just hands down delicious, and if you want you can order online and pick it up, so you don't have to wait in line. I also love that there's a handful of locations so there'll have to be one close by to you! My favorites are the lamb wrap with fries and baklava greek yogurt!

Booo. What happened ??!!  This used to be one of the greatest places in the hood?  Ya.  It's COVID, but there is never any excuse for dry  schwarma...(ever!!!! Even if it's 47 minutes before closing).  Come on!)?

I decided to try this place after lots of good word of mouth. The interior is really nice, with a pleasant back patio. I got the pork salad. The salad itself was excellent; crisp greens, tangy and delicious dressing, feta cheese, well balanced flavors... but the pork. The pork was dry and tough as leather. It's shredded too so I really don't know how this happened, pork in my experience is so easy to keep moist. It was such a disappointment as the salad it self was supreme, but the main ingredient was just awful.

I think Souvla is overrated for what it is at the end of the day. It's a love-hate relationship. I usually go here because it is so close to my university. However, they are VERY inconsistent with their salads. The chicken is almost always dry and cold. Even though I usually opt for  the Granch sauce, I'm given the garlic sauce every time.  Their yogurts are good though.  If you want a consistent Souvla salad, go to the one on Valencia street.

Quick, casual, and healthy. I've tried the wraps, but I think I prefer the salads. 

I got the chicken salad, which came with just the right amount of dressing. Very large, and they put quite a bit of kale. Takes me forever to eat it. I also got a side of fries which they cook just perfectly. Get the yogurt dip.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's great if you're nearby and want a casual & quick meal.

Souvla is such a talked about San Francisco institution that I'm a bit embarrassed to say that I hadn't tried it out until now. My friend and I hit this location up on a weekday for lunch and were pleasantly surprised to find that it has a gorgeous back patio! The weather was a mix of chilly and sunny so we opted to sit outside and enjoy the greenery and sunshine. So in terms of leaf eater options, there's only really the sweet potato or other sides. I went with a roasted sweet potato sandwich and opted to grab some Greek fries on the side as well. So full disclosure, I actually do not like sweet potato very much. However, I always feel like I should give it a chance because you can prepare it so many different ways and maybe one way will click with my palate. Unfortunately, the sweet potato at Souvla was more on the sweet side than I'd like. I found it hard to finish my sandwich because I couldn't get past how sweet the overall taste was. If you like sweet potato, you will most likely love this sandwich and appreciate it wholeheartedly. If you're a sweet potato avoider like me, you may want to skip it. 

You may be wondering at this point how I could rate this place a 4.0 when I didn't even like the sandwich. Well you see, there's nothing I love more in this world than french fries, especially if they are done amazingly well. Souvla KILLED it in terms of having some of the best fries I have ever had. They were crispy, flavorful, and delicious without being too oily. They're also served with a dip (you can choose from a list) and my friend and I chose the garlic one which was an amazing decision.  

My friend ordered the lamb sandwich and juicy potatoes. If you a strict vegetarian, keep in mind that these potatoes sit under the meat and are covered in the rotisserie drippings. Because of this, I didn't eat the potatoes. However, my friend did tell me that they were good, but not as good as the fries.

Service was great when we ordered and my overall experience was great, minus the sweet potato. I am definitely going back for those fries and will most likely grab some yogurt on my next trip.

A really casual spot for greek foodies. Love the way they organize their restaurant as well everything seems in place from the counter service to the tabling. I got the pork shoulder sandwich and a side of greek fries, simple but delicious! A recommended place to try greek food for sure!

I love Souvla! This is the third location I have visited in the city (first in Hayes Valley, then on Valencia), and I can say this one is just as fabulous as the rest. 

OLIVE OIL AND SEA SALT FROZEN GREEK YOGURT. You can't go wrong with any of their creative frozen Greek yogurt selections, but this one happens to be my favorite! The richness and subtle sweetness of the olive oil really compliments the contrasting salt and creaminess of the yogurt. The Baklava and Honey Syrup flavor is my second favorite.  Must try!

Also, this location is so close to Alamo Square Park, so it is the perfect stop to grab a treat to enjoy when viewing the Painted Ladies!

Souvla nails fast casual Greek food and the new location on Divis is dangerously convenient for me. All the spit fired meats are tender plus the combinations of citrus fruits and pickled vegetables balance out so nicely. I actually wish they added more pickled vegetables into their sandwiches. The lamb is amazing and if they ask how you want your fries, have them directly in the sandwich itself. I like baklava and the yogurt version is refreshingly indulgent. My husband doesn't care for Greek yogurt normally but can't stop eating Souvla's tart frozen yogurt.

Such a cool place,  good vibes. Delicious food. Defiantly recommend it. Very simple menu, straight forward. 

Had the chicken Sandwich and fries.

Are you going to see a show at the Independent? Stop by Souvla for a bite before!

Saturday night and we found a table immediately. It was a rainy night, which may be why we lucked out.

Perfect for a delicious quick and, potentially, healthy meal. Hubby and I got veg salads, fries, and white wine. The salad was filling with sweet potato slices and a mix of butter lettuce/kale. Yum. We couldn't resist ordering the fries, which were effing delicious. One order is great for 2 to share. 

We were too full for dessert so we went to the concert down the street. Luckily, the band was running late so we agreed on going back to Souvla for fro-yo. I got the baklava crumble. Hubby got the olive oil and sea salt. Tasty, big portions.

No reservations, easy communal seating. Friendly, fast service.

Souvla has a lot going for it, but just doesn't quite reach five stars for me.  After reading the menu, I thought, "Ooooooo, what could be better than a giant Greek frozen yogurt toped with a huge, gooey chunk of honey drenched Baklava?"  Well, the frozen yogurt was good enough but it isn't something that would call my name each time I walked by.  The salads are big, with plenty of meat.  My lamb salad had more flavor than my cousin's rotisserie chicken salad, which lacked zing.  He requested lemon juice from the kitchen and found that did the trick.  We had the Greek Fries, with lemon and Mizithra Cheese, and again, they were good, just not great.  The concept is fun, with modern, uncluttered decor and an impressive floor-to-ceiling rotisserie turning rows of Mary's Free Range chickens.  The service was good, welcoming and attentive.  I just wish I found the food flavors five-star crave-worthy.

Love this spot. Everything is amazing. The soup is one of my favorites. I've tried most of the menu and it's all been great. The space is clean, service good, prices good. 

Requests would be larger glasses for water and bigger pitchers of water and cold water. Also, fry flavor and dips included with the fries.

Souvla is a casual, modern, counter-service Greek restaurant with a simple menu centered around sandwiches and salads with spit-fired meats. They also offer a couple sides, a surprising selection of Greek wines, and of course, frozen Greek yogurt!

I came here for lunch on a Sunday, and the one issue we had when entering the small restaurant was the noise--it was fairly difficult to find a good place to sit that made it easy to talk, and the tall chairs weren't very comfortable. The food, however, was definitely quality and on-point. I got to try the lamb sandwich, which was cubes of lamb leg wrapped in pita with a yogurt sauce, feta cheese, and pickled vegetables. The lamb reminded me of gyro and was tasty, and the meat-to-everything-else ratio was definitely generous. The avgolemono soup, made with rice, chicken, egg, and lemon was nice as well--definitely strong on the lemony flavor, but a little expensive for what it was. Finally, I got to try the chicken salad, which was my favorite. The chicken was so juicy and succulent, and the salad (which included fennel, kale, onion, orange) was simple and tasty--it went perfectly with the olive oil and the yogurt-based dressings.

Finally, we had to get the frozen Greek yogurt--we tried the sour cherry syrup, the greek olive oil & sea salt, and the baklava crumble, and each of these was delicious. The yogurt itself was light yet creamy and balanced between sweet/sour, and each of the different toppings played together very nicely with the yogurt. Overall, this is a great restaurant for a casual, light lunch, but all of the items are definitely expensive for what you get, and the atmosphere could definitely be improved and made more comfortable.

Can't wait to go back to Souvla again soon! I had such a great dinner with some girlfriends this week. I love that they source their meat from providers who care about animal welfare and sustainable farming practices. It might mean things are slightly more expensive, but the quality is so high and the flavor is incredible. 

I ordered the chicken salad---I almost NEVER order a salad because...salad. But after seeing pictures of this one on Yelp I felt it could be worth it as long as I got a side of fries with it. Both were amazing. The salad was bright, flavorful, and the chicken was so tender and juicy. I loved the fennel with orange as well. I have a hard time envisioning this one in gyro form, but for a salad it was awesome. Same for the fries, they were really flavorful and perfectly crispy. 

Couldn't leave without getting a frozen greek yogurt. I asked the server what his favorite was and he recommended cherry with sea salt. Such a good pro tip! The salt really cuts the richness as does the tart cherry sauce. I loved it!

The atmosphere was warm, casual and comfortable. We sat in the front by the rotisseries and it was perfect to catch up with friends. Next time I'll be more patient and wait for the patio in the back because that looked really nice!

Souvla is :fire: :fire: :fire: - this goes for all locations but specifically the Divis location as it's my local spot. Order online. Leave my house. Skip the line and pick up my food.

The convenience alone makes this place amazing before even getting to the food since I hate waiting in line. 

The FOOD THOUGH? Perfect for all occasions, breakfast/lunch/dinner/snack/etc. Nothing better than chomping into a lamb salad with fries on an empty stomach, fills me all the way up. Going for the sandwich is just as good because that pita is DELICIOUS.

Only thing not getting it to a 5 is occasional inconsistency of the meal, sometimes overdressed / underdressed but really who can complain that much. A little on the $$ side also but cheap enough to keep me coming back. Also not a huge fan of the Souvla beer but maybe that's just my taste.

Obsessed with their spitfire meats, especially the chicken salad with granch.
Very simple menu which I like, makes it easy.
Their Greek soft serve with olive oil and sea salt is also soooo good. Pretty much a weekly staple when I'm home in SF.

Souvla is hands down one of the best fast casual restaurants I've ever been to! The quality of food is always consistent and the cashiers are top notch friendly people.

I had finished a late workout and my body was craving some protein. I straight up went to their website and ordered a side of chicken and a side of pita. I have yet to try their chicken as is without the tasty sauces they make and WOW, they know how to season their chicken!

Pro tip, order online in advance so you skip the line! You can still eat there with your to-go bag!

This location is bigger than their Hayes Valley location so there is plenty of seating if you're looking to enjoy a meal with some company.

My only nitpick is that the brass tables have a really strong brassy smell, ha! But you'll get over it!

Ordered take out. Got back to work to enjoy lunch and no fries in the bag. I called the location 5 times each time went to voicemail. Too far to drive back now. Guess no refund for me. Thanks to whoever packed my lunch you are doing a fantastic job.

I don't know what Souvla does that makes it my go to meal EVERY time!! Maybe it's the warm soft pitas, the great quality of the different meats, or even the addictive Greek frozen yogurt? The wraps are all A+, but my current go to is the pork kale salad- it's full of fresh & filling veggies, just enough dressing, juicy pork, and a sprinkle of cheese. The portions are huge, and they are FAST. Like order online and get a text update 5 minutes later that your food is ready fast. Love you 4ever & always Souvla

My go to restaurant in San Francisco. I probably order food from here at least once a week. If you haven't eaten here, you've definitely heard how good the food is. Its true, its very addicting. Its simplified greek food, they have indoor and outdoor seating. Moderately priced, fresh food, comes out fast. Always get the fries with garlic sauce!

What can I say, this place crushes it from a quality, taste, atmosphere and service perspective. It's a little on the pricey side but it's SF after all...

I like to sit in front of the rotisserie over when I dine in...outside it nice too.

Don't forget the baklava frozen yogurt!

Stopped by Souvla on a date night with my girlfriend, and it was stellar. The back seating area is outdoors, but even on a cooler night in San Francisco (the kind that Mark Twain raved about) it was toasty, cozy, and well-lit due to the heat lamps and well-placed light fixtures. We sat at the bar seating on the upper level. Seating there is a little tight, but not uncomfortable.

As to the food, you won't be disappointed. We both had the lamb wrap, which had remarkably tender, juicy meat while not making a gigantic mess of the wrap. Admittedly quite the feat. Afterward we had the Greek yogurt with the baklava and honey on top. Would _highly_ recommend getting this. Recently went by on an afternoon stroll to get the yogurt again, and the cold, slightly sour yogurt combined with the sweet, light crunch of the baklava was as fantastic as I had remembered it.

On top of that, reasonable prices all around! Keep in mind, this place gets pretty busy on the weekends, but there are also three locations, so you can perhaps check around if you're so inclined. More importantly, if you're meeting someone make sure you specify which address!

Souvla isn't bad. But it's a little overrated and a little too pricy for the quality/portions of what you're getting. Like the total mix of flavors and sauces in the chicken gyro are solid, but the chicken itself is a bit dry and grainy and at $13 you should be getting some moister chicken. I'm not a fan of white meat generally but you can give it a little more moisture by throwing some drippings back in there. For the old heads, there's an SNL sketch about "the juice" which fits this well.

If you're in the mood for a fresh and bright salad or a perfectly cook gyro...you've found the best spot!!! With four locations around SF you can always find a spot to chill.  And get the frozen yogurt with baklava and honey...and the cherry soda. Also the lamb salad....

If you want to add a little twist to either a sandwich or a salad get it greek style and they will throw some fries on top.

Five stars for flavor of the lamb alone! As a tourist in the city, I wasn't scared away by the price tag for a sandwich but know that if I was local, I might not be indulging nightly as I would like. Fries are good, served with choice of sauce - my pick: Greek yogurt ranch. The line can get out of the door but passed quickly based on my Sunday night visit. On that note, food was served quickly as well. I know I'll come back by the next time I'm in town!

This place is really cute. They have a few seats in the front and a pretty spacious back patio. Souvla is fine-casual so you order at the register, you're given a number, you seat yourself, and the food is brought out to you. 

Speaking of food, the Greek fries are delicious! They are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I love the tang and brightness from the cheese and lemon. The fries come with a dipping sauce of your choice, extra sauce costs extra. 

The sandwiches are delicious...and huge. My husband and I couldn't finish our own sandwiches; we could have split one. He really liked his chicken sandwich and I thought the lamb was tender and flavorful. The avgolemono could have been more lemony, IMHO. 

Their greek frozen yogurt is good, too. Not too sweet, has a bit of tang. If you get the olive oil & sea salt, which I liked, make sure to stir it up to avoid getting a mouthful of salt all at once. 

Overall, yummy food, chill atmosphere, good service. I'll be back.

Live a few blocks from this location and I love that it's never too busy. Food is delicious and  highly recommend. The chicken in wrap or salad form is always a great bet and as a treat definitely have the frozen yogurt with the cherry tart topping. I always go for the french fries which are always perfectly cooked (crunchy on the outside and mushy on the inside); others like the juicy potatoes but i'm not a huge fan. 

Only downside is they charge for dipping sauces... none included with an order.

Love coming to Souvla when in a crunch, need decent, filling food fast or when just chillin with the homies. The line is usually long, seats are packed, but the wait time from order to first bite isn't that long. 

Typically order the Chicken Sandwich or Veggie with Chicken or really any meat added in. I know, weird, but the Sweet Potatoes in the Veggie Sandwich are really good so why not. Standard flavor, decent price, good eats. 
 
Try Veggie with meat. Won't be disappointed. ;)

PURE DELICIOUSNESS. The food here is unforgettable. I ordered the veg salad without cheese and yogurt with a side of Greek fries without cheese. In the veg salad there were sweet white potatoes, pickled red onions, kale, lettuce, a bomb olive oil dressing and some sort of crumbled nut. Each bite was packed with flavor-- I couldn't get enough. 

My friend ordered the lamb sandwich which she described as decent. The lamb was a bit tough; however, she and I agree that the fries were PHENOMENAL. Not too soft, not too crunchy, these babies were the perfect fry. 

As for the ambient: super trendy and modern. The outdoor seating is awesome. Service is fast and friendly. DEFINITELY coming back again.

Great location and environment. Quick service and good food. This is probably the restaurant I frequent most for a more casual meal with friends. I love getting the lamb sandwich, but it is also good as a salad. I can also usually make two meals out of one entree.

The frozen yogurt with baklava is the best thing on the menu though!

This place is bomb! I love their soup. Today I wasn't feeling well and had zero energy so for lunch decided to get there delicious soup. It eased my tummy right up. It's a creamy lemony chicken and rice soup! I'll be back again just for the soup!

Love the chicken or lamb salad from Souvla. Also can't go wrong with the wraps. One pro tip is to go with the veg salad and add chicken. White potatoes also a great addition.

Their hot sauce is also super good.

PORK SHOULDER SANDWICH! Messy but the best thing you'll put in your mouth! 

The Greek red wine too. Get a bottle! Why not! (wine not)

The outdoor seating is really cute and with heating lamps, always a plus.

The french fries are on fleek.

I'll be back for you, froyo!

Souvia looks small. lengthy, patio too? didn't check..

offerings: "spit-fired meats", sides, greek yogurt, beverages (greek). etc.

eats: Mary's Free range chicken sammie(12)
-actually a gyro/wrap would be more accurate.
-"granch" dressing, fennel, naval orange , pickled red onion, pea shoot, mizithra cheese"
very tasty, addiictive, didn't taste the chicken much, just the various ingredients
-menu just sandwich or salad and fries, etc.
-loved it except for the dripping olive oil which was listed.
wrap very leaky, wasn't prepared. leaked all over my clothing.....

drips:
-olive oil slight aftertaste.
-service fab, courteous. upsell on fries, declined, not a fries fan.
-maybe lamb or yogurt next time? or a salad....
-street parking.

Very quick service, and yummy food. I got the chicken salad, it came in around 5 minutes and it was very fresh tasting. The man who rang up my order was not particularly friendly and hardy said two words. Good food, but definitely overpriced as you can often find yummy Mediterranean food for half the price of this salad (nearly $15)

***DISCLAIMER: I did not get to eat here.***

I have had Souvla bookmarked for months, if not over a year at this point. We thought it would be elimination diet-friendly (something I'm going through right now), but we learned otherwise as we were ordering.

Souvla marinates their chicken with feta, so if you're dairy-free, eating here is a no-go.

This review is a placeholder - I'm sure I'll come back for a proper meal soon. Everything else looked amazing; the interior is adorable, there's even seating outside, and the visible rotisserie chickens grilling are reminiscent of Europe (my other home).

Souvla is one of my go-to spots in San Francisco and I am ecstatic that they opened a location on Divis. The restaurant is beautiful with a lovely outdoor patio and much more spacious than their spot in Hayes Valley. I frequently visit the neighborhood and new location is a perfect addition to the area. 

I've had the chance to try every salad on the menu and they are all incredible. My current favorite is the roast chicken without cheese and dressing on the side. I usually toss in the olive oil and forgo the yogurt, and the result is absolutely perfect! Although this is my favorite, you cannot go wrong with any salad. The fries are pretty tasty and I have not yet tried the roasted potatoes. If you're interested in the frozen greek yogurt, the olive oil and sea salt is a delicious combination. I'll be back very soon!

Our friends who live in San Francisco rave about this place, and two of them were even invited to an opening event for being top 10 customers. When we visited last year, we had Souvla for the first time - sandwiches and fro yo - and my wife loved it. We had to wait a bit for a table, and the atmosphere inside was pretty bustling, but it was still enjoyable. 

As we were planning for our upcoming trip to SF, she listed going back to Souvla as a top priority for our trip. We got to-go orders of salads this time and ate at a friend's place. The food was delicious again. The price is a tad high, but we aren't used to SF pricing.

Pro-tip: order ahead online (via Caviar or their website) to avoid the long lines!

This new place is a couple blocks away from my BF's place who is obsessed with Souvla so naturally, we come here at least once a week... But for good reason the food (and frozen yogurt) is soooooo good! 

The menu is incredibly simple - choose your meat and then salad or wrap version. We love the chicken wrap and even the salad is super good for when you wanna be "healthy" lol. It is a bit pricey I will say, $13-15 for your entree and then $4-$5 for frozen yogurt but you can definitely taste the quality so in my opinion, worth! Also, grab some of their hot sauces it adds that extra kick!

And lastly, omg... their frozen yogurt is amazing!!! I always get it topped with wildflower honey or Baklava crumbles. You've gotta try it for yourself :)

Came here with a girlfriend since it's pretty new and less crowded than the other location. We weren't as hungry so we split a lamb and had an order of fries. So basically I came here for the frozen yogurt but to my luck, the machine wasn't working ;(

The service was great. It's the typical walk in, order, take a number, find a seat and the food will come to you type of deal. The food came out in a decent amount of time and the workers there were attentive and will come by every now and then and ask if we needed anything.

Next time I come back Souvla you better have my frozen yogurt waiting for me!!!!!

Came here last night for a friend's birthday dinner. My observations and impressions are as follows:

Patio:

The patio set up is nice and can accommodate a group of up to 8 or 9. There are two high top tables with three to four chairs each. There is also a little bar with some stools that can fit up to three. 

Food: 

The veg salad is amazing. I added lamb to it and it was a show stopper. The lettuce remained crisp despite the warm sweet potato and toasty lamb pieces (I hope your mouth is watering).  There were so many fun surprises in the salad including walnuts, olives and feta cheese. 

Libations:

I guzzled up my house red wine - it was delectable.  My friends greatly enjoyed the rosé.  You can either get a large 250 mL, 500 mL or a bottle. 

Dessert:

'Cause let's be honest, this is what we have all been waiting for- the greek yogurt with house baklava is phenomenal. My mouth was overwhelmed by this level of pure deliciousness. A solid mix of slightly tart greek frozen yogurt (consistency of soft serve) and a warm sticky muddled blend of baklava. My heart is content...for now.

Stop by if you haven't yet and get your Greek on!

Oh yes! I didn't know about this place until our friends asked us to meet up there. Our dinner was delicious and the dessert was so yummy. The only downside was the seating. We were a group of 4 so I wouldn't expect to have issues, but it was too cold outside and the only availability inside was a bar style seating in a line so that we couldn't really catch up and talk very easily. Other than that, it was a great meal!

Went there to get a gyro because most other places were closed at the time. 
I got a pork salad ( they don't do platter ). 
The salad was a good size. The pork was ok. Not the best. 
My sister go the chicken gyro pita. She wasn't very Impressed with it. It was that good and it was on the small size. 
The fries as a side, that I got. Were ok, not thing special. 
I would recommend this place if you have nowhere else to go. A fast food place. Don't go out of your way to get one there.

I love this location and restaurant (can only speak for this location).

The atmosphere is medium sized with a cozy front porch seating area, a few options inside on the more crowded side, and to highlight there is a lovely home-style back seating area with large and small group options, heating apparatus for when needed, cute strung lighting and a nice little view if you're one to find almost anything fascinating. 

The food I typically get the lamb sandwich (pita wrap) which is stuffed with veggies and just freaking stupid delicious 

But don't forget to request (and prolly pay for) a little side of the magic sauce, also ok without it. 

The sides are great quality and size for typical SF pricing, slightly on the lower end of the astronomical scale around town, but very worth it.

They boast a $20 take home rotisserie chicken that I've been drooling to eat entirely by myself sometime!!

I do not understand the hype around this place at. all.  The food preparation is below decent Greek for a much hyped gyro. We tried both the lamb and chicken (tasteless) gyros. It is incredibly dry, all meat and the pita is not particularly fresh.  Both were difficult to eat. A gyro is supposed to have the food wrapped by soft, fresh pita. These were overstuffed with just dry meat in a stiff unfresh pita. It was $13-15 for a below decent gyro. I'm wondering if I caught them at an off time or day because my experience was nothing like the other reviews.

I did enjoy the Greek lager, which is a not overly light lager with strong honey flavor. I also found the service to be great.

I don't know why but almost all the Greek food I have had in the Bay has been very disappointing!

We're fans!

I always get the chicken salad and like the variety of textures, the size, the sweet tangerine slices...

The red wine is also nice and the pours are generous.

The retsina was fun to try, but pretty strong on the pine! I think it would be good in some kind of mixed drink to temper it. Alas--they're model is simple, minimal variety so no retsina sangria I bet.

The frozen yogurt is tangy and refreshing but the sour cherry syrup isn't sour cherry---it's regular cherry flavor. If you grew up with sour cherry and can tell the difference you'll care, if you didn't you probably won't mind.

The back patio of the Divis location is really lovely, especially when it's not crowded.

Does anyone know if there's gluten in the lamb salad (or somewhere else in the salads or proteins)? Maybe soy in the marinade?

It's such a nice place to hang out and chill! Love their yard!!! This type of places represents the true spirit of San Francisco: fun, lively, hip, and free. 

And their chicken or pork shoulder bowl/pita is a must order! The meat is more moist than how it appears. Oh don't forget the greek frozen yogurt with sea salt and olive oil! Doesn't it tickle your fancy :)

With the increasing prices and smaller food portions, I have to bump Souvla down, or at least this location. The Divis location definitely skimped out on portion size compared to the Hayes Valley location, and with the amount of time spent waiting for a salad and the increasing prices, it's come to my realization that Souvla is now being put on my "if someone else is paying" list.

Don't get me wrong. The food is still good, but I just can't bring it to myself to recommend Souvla to friends if the bang-for-buck value isn't there. At the end of the day, it's a very simple recipe (chicken salad is just strips of chicken + greens + red onion + some fruit in greek yogurt/olive oil dressing) that you can recreate for a fraction of the cost.

If I have to eat greens then I'll go here! The chicken salad is by far my favorite salad in the city. You can add pita. You can add potatoes. You should always have a lil hot sauce. However you like it--both the salads and wraps are filling, not overly dressed, and are tasty clean eats! 

Service is usually quick and their take-out is especially efficient! 

Must. Get. Frozen. Greek. Yogurt! Silky smooth, tart, and not too sweet!

It's hard to get a good salad west of Divisadero, but Souvla exceeds expectations. My favorite is the pork salad--the fattiness of the pork works well with pickled red onion, cucumber and feta. And service here is quick; I rarely wait more than 5 minutes for my food.

The main star here is obviously the frozen yogurt. All the flavors are great, but the baklava is definitely the best. I mean, you get an entire piece of baklava on top of your froyo :)

It was quite good. This place was recommended by a friend, and did not disappoint. We had the pork and lamb sandwiches, the Greek fries, and the baklava crumble with honey syrup frozen yogurt. We took it to go at Almo square and had a little picnic in front of the painted ladies. We definitely will be coming back whenever we are back in San Francisco!

Found this place on yelp since we were in the area.
Lamb and chicken sandwich gyro amazing! Ingredients are fresh and come out hot.

Greek fries are crisp and come out warm. Not greasy. We ordered one and needed another one!!

The second order we made of the side of fries the consistency was not the same! The also messed up our order.

They weren't as crisp and the seasoning over the fries were not the same? 

We found it a bit odd since we literally ordered the fries right after we got our order...so why was it not consistent? Not to mention the guy who brought us our order literally brought us plain fries with no salt. Our order was Greek fries and no salt on the fries itself, keep everything else. Not sure how they managed to mess that up when on the receipt all it said was "no salt" lol.

He was not happy about it when we said what happened to the fries as they're suppose to have everything on it except for the salt. He said "the cheese has salt". Well obviously? But I never said I didn't want cheese?! Anyways so he brought it back to us after he seasoned it with the cheese, olive oil, lemon juice and parsley. Still wasn't the same.

Seems like the overall mix of the seasoning was missing this time around and not as good as the first one we got which is silly, they need to fix their consistency!

They don't have ketchup at the tables and don't offer that as well, only hot sauce. Sauce with the fries are an extra $1. We got the "granch" Greek yoghurt ranch sauce. The sauce was great! Perfect balance of spices to the Greek yogurt. 

Sauce was overpriced for a little spoonful of sauce, should be included with the meal or $0.50 instead. 

Overall I would come back for the sandwich gyros and the fries, even though there was a consistency issue on the fries, I would try this again if I'm in the area!

Healthy greek. Kale and lamb and light on dressing  but good olive oil.  Do it yourself.  Order find a seat, salad in a tin bowl (less breakage in dishes) or wrap.  Very simple . Order yogurt and they give you a receipt for later pick up.  I had the Greek yogurt with the best honey.  If i was winnie the pooh, i would be very satisfied.  Staff are very friendly and fast.  Whole chicken for 24.00.  They are not skimppy  with the chicken in chicken salad.  Get tour own water and glass cup.

I have had a lot of friends rave about Soulva before and now that I've had it, I'm one of the ravers.  

I had the lamb sandwich which did not disappoint.  The fries were really tasty too.  I was impressed and completely downed them.  We were torn about potentially getting dessert but I'm so glad we did as it was the highlight of the meal.  We had the yogurt with baklava crumbles and it was so so good.

A cool atmosphere with friendly service, a limited but great menu and out of this world dessert makes Soulva a must to try out.

I know I'll be making a trip just for the frozen yogurt again.
The lamb and pork shoulder wraps were simple, clean, smart, and tasty. Such a place requires no further elaboration or celebration so...

Souvla is a modern, clean, trendy restaurant. The food is incredibly fresh, and the menu has great selection of healthy salads with different kinds of well seasoned protein. (you can add fries to your salad for an extra dollar, its called Greek style). They are also famous for their baklava Greek yogurt, and I reassure everyone here that it does not disappoint. Would come back again if I crave something healthy.

Came here around noonish yesterday for the yogurt and baklava and oh so delicious! Gotta come back and try the other stuff cuz I heard good things. 

On another note the cashier was not very friendly. She didn't use her good manners and customer service. I don't care if you having a bad day cuz that's your job to be courteous to your customers. Besides bad customer service I would still come back for their yogurt.

This place has delicious fresh food and amazing Greek yogurt soft serve. I have tried the chicken salad and it was super good and filling. I almost couldn't eat the whole thing, almost. I also like to stop in here for a quick fro-yo treat. They have Greek frozen yogurt that you can get with olive oil and sea salt, baklava crumbles, or honey. I highly recommend this treat. The restaurant itself is hip and clean. You order and pay up at the front and the take a number for your food. When I have been here the service is fast but I have also seen a line out the door.
This is my 2nd or 3rd time at souvla and it still does not disappoint! I usually get a salad but this time I wasn't too hungry, so I just got the fries and they were delicious as usual!

Wow I love this place. I've tried all the salads, the chicken sandwich, Greek fries, and baklava frozen yogurt. All amazing. Souvla gets really crowded on the weekends and in the evenings. Somewhat pricy, but worth it.

Delicious, consistent, addictive! Highly recommend!

I've been to the Hayes & Mission locations and they never disappoint. 

The pork salad, house red, fries, and Greek yoghurt with honey are a must.

May I dare say this is more 3.5 star rounded to 4. 

I came here on a new year's afternoon at about 2.30pm after attempts to visit Brenda's Soul Food & Brenda's Meat and Three did not work out (huge queues outside both restaurants scared me off). 

There was a long line to order at Souvla's but the line moved quickly. It was also easy to get a table after ordering. Food came really quickly, which was a plus. 

Unfortunately, with my expectations bolstered by the overall 4.5 yelp rating, I thought that the food was just average. 

Lamb sandwich - Hmm more of a burrito. Lamb was tougher and dryer than I would have liked. Again with the rating I expected a melt in your mouth, more-ish sort of dish but it fell abit short. 

Lamb salad - quite pricey at $14 but it was a huge bowl. Not authentic Greek but I guess it's modified to suit San Franciscan tastes (they promise to use local produce after all). For kale lovers.

Greek fries - crisp thick-cut fries which are above average but not the best I've had in the city. 

Although the food was a tad disappointing, the place was furnished tastefully, lots of white and wood, like how I would want my home to look like. So 4 stars it is.

I. Miss. Souvla.

I recently moved from SF and I miss it every single day. This place is fast/ casual... but the food is amazing. The salads fresh as they come. My personal recommendation: the chicken salad. The chicken is SO juicy. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

If you have a sweet tooth, get the frozen yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. Whoever came up with that combo is a genius.

My only request: move this chain to NY!!!!!!

The meat here is just not good. No matter what meat I've tried its always salty and incredibly dry. 
The fries are yummy and the fro-yo with baklava is addicting. But everything is SO overpriced. $4 for a side of fries. $1 for a tiny side of flavored sauce. After paying $13 for a sandwich that has the flavor profile of chalk? No thanks.
I'll splurge on the fro-yo because I'm a self-hating San Franciscan that yearns to complain about overpriced food. But really, don't pay for anything but the fro-yo here.

Ordered the soup and it was so sour it made my stomach clench. I really wonder if it's supposed to be like that because as someone who likes sour foods, I couldn't even finish the bowl as my stomach started hurting.

I stopped into Souvla for a quick lunch after my exhausting adventure at the DMV. I got the pork shoulder sandwich and while I was waiting for it, I had my dessert of Greek frozen yogurt with honey.

I like the welcoming décor of Souvla and the fast-casual environment. I had only been to the one in Hayes Valley before and I think I might like this location more. 

As I was finishing up the Greek frozen yogurt, the sandwich came. I devoured it quickly. It was so satisfying.

I wasn't super impressed with Souvla Hayes when it opened but chalked it up to ordering the wrong dishes. They've since expanded and Souvla has become one of my go-to staples for a casual meal when I'm feeling too lazy to make my own. The Divisadero location is less crowded than Hayes or Mission. There's a spacious outdoor patio area in the back as well if you like dine outside.

While the chicken is on the dry side, the lamb items are on point! My lamb salad was very flavorful and tender. For fast food, the ingredients are fresh, the flavor profile has depth. The cucumber, radish, and sprouts bring out a freshness that outbalances the heaviness of the lamb. I also enjoyed the harissa spiked yogurt dressing which brought an element of tang to round it out.

For dessert, the olive oil salted frozen greek yogurt is an interesting sweet and savory treat!

You can't go wrong with any decision here. Comes down to three simple choices:
1. What meat (or veggie) you're feeling that day?
2. Trying to be healthy? Get the salad. Otherwise dig into a sandwich.
3. What flavor of frozen yogurt you want because it's some of the best in the city.

I love Souvla so much I could have it for every meal. Lamb salad is currently my go-to and of course the olive oil + sea salt yogurt for dessert (I've honestly craved this yogurt quite a few times and had to drive there just to get myself one - sorry, not sorry!). Their locations are also super sweet, they always have an outside area for sitting on nice SF days. Love love love!

The frozen yogurt at Souvla is something special! I don't have a lot of comparative experience in Greek frozen yogurt so take it for what it's worth. My review may just be the right nudge for somebody that is on the hunt for a delightful frozen treat. I just can't articulate how good this stuff is.

If you're in the area, Divis or any other location, and looking for a spectacular refreshment, try it.

+ the chicken sandwiches and fries are great too!
