I am frequently in SF for training, just a couple of blocks away from Souvla and this is my go to place for lunch.  They have convenient on-line ordering, I just click away to order a wrap or salad, make some customization and by the time a walk to their location my food is ready to go!  I really like their chicken salad Greek style.  The chicken is well flavored and usually not overcooked.  The salad serving size is pretty big, I never seem to finish the whole thing.   The line to order and pick up food is usually not too long.  Prices are reasonable.
Delicious vegetarian salad !!! Ask to have the dressing on the side - ate on their backyard patio ! Will come back when I am on the neighborhood
I absolutely loveeeeee the food here!! I could eat the chicken salad every day if I had to :)

I have been to all of the Souvla locations in SF and Divisadero street is by far my favorite. The heated back patio is great for chilly SF nights. I always order the veggie salad and the greek yogurt froyo with crunbled baklava. Can't go wrong with any of the salads or wraps though. One of my favorite go-to spots.

My favorite not-upscale restaurant in San Francisco. I could eat here everyday for the rest of my life. I try to bring all of my visitors here - all have loved it as much as I do.

Must Try: The Lamb Salad
This is my favorite salad in the entire world. It's the only salad I crave drunkenly - I usually want to drunk eat pizza, tacos, etc., but this is just that good. If you eat meat, even if you're not usually a lamb person, you need to try this salad. The dressing (just the right level of creamy), kale, pickled onions, cheese and perfect sized slices of perfectly grilled lamb combine to create the most incredible taste experience. I also think that for $14, while not cheap, you're getting a great deal for San Francisco. This salad, which is super generous with the lamb and depending on how hungry you are could be 1 or 2 meals, would be like $25 at Blue Barn. 

Other awesome food:
*The fries are GREAT. Recommend sharing with a friend.
*The frozen greek yogurt is delicious, especially with the baklava and honey. I always lament the fact that I don't have the appetite to get one after finishing my salad. Worth a trip just for this as a snack.
*The breakfast sandwich, offered until 2pm on weekends, is SO GOOD. I tried it with the lamb that I love so much and was so excited about how good it tasted. 

Things to note:
*The Divis location has a lovely patio with heat lamps.
*The line moves pretty quickly.
*You can order wine here in several different sizes - the 500mL is perfect for when you're sharing with a friend but don't quite want an entire bottle.
*If you're with more than like 4 people, it might be tough to find seating.
*Sometimes they offer a brined whole chicken that serves ~4 people. I really want to try this if I can ever peel myself away from the lamb salad for just an evening.
*Have I mentioned that I'm obsessed with this place?

Loved the food here. Had the lamb salad. The salad was super hearty and not dressed to heavy. I think there was something pickled in it and cheese that gave it a lot of flavor. I frequently feel like I don't get served enough meat, but with all the fixings it was hard finishing it and I felt super satisfied. The lamb was delicious, well seasoned. I tried a few of the fries. They had some light seasoning and light cheese which was nice. Sometimes dressed fries are just too over the top. They were crispy but still soft inside. My favorite was probably the frozen yogurt. Soo good. I would go back just for that. Very rich and tart. Reminds me of froyo from my hometown in Mexico. I wasn't crazy about the baklava topping. It was very soft and sweet, I'll try other options next time!

This place could absolutely be 5 stars with a few little changes. The food was great and the restaurant was clean, and well decorated. There is a nice outdoor patio in the back with seating. I was even surprised that we were able to get seats after waiting in line to order for 15 minutes. This is a counter service restaurant where you order and pay up front, then wait for available seats while they bring your food.

The two things that keep this from a 5 star review are the service, and the counter service checkout tipping options. I am not a fan of tipping with options of 15%, 20% and 25% before I receive any service. I will happily tip well when I get great service, but I didn't get to judge that before tipping. Also, the service was barely ok. We had to ask for several things and we were quickly served and then discarded. When we asked for hot sauce, a server came over, then snatched a bottle of an adjacent table without a word, then walked away. We had to apologize to the other table on behalf of the rude server. 

On to the good. The food was excellent. The small greek salad was a very tasty appetizer, the fries were crisp and fluffy on the inside. I recommend the garlic dipping sauce for the fries. They offer 4 options if I remember correctly. Also, save room for their greek frozen yogurt. It was a wonderful combination of sweet and tangy. I ordered the option with baklava crumbles, but found it to be a little on the sweet side. I would try a different option next time, but I absolutely wouldn't miss out on this treat.

I love this place. Their chicken salad is amazing. The frozen yogurt is amazing. It's all amazing. 

Great food. Place is casual, no need to dress up. Just come for some amazing food. It's amazing!!!

I love Souvla. I crave it. I no longer live in the Bay Area and I just HAVE to get Souvla at some point while visiting. The lamb pita and lemon soup are amazing. The pita is soft and tasty, delicious tender lamb, feta cheese for some added richness. Its excellent. I'm pretty particular about greek lemon soup and this one is just really lovely. Great for a cozy comfort meal in SF that isn't too heavy.

Amazing Souvlaki, be sure to try their Greek Fries ! 

As someone who often goes to Greece I can easily say that this place gets it right, especially if you're looking for something fast and delicious.

This was a really nice restaurant for lunch.  Looks small from the outside but don't be deceived, besides the long counter, there are also seats, way in the back in the open air yard.  We had a group of 8 and managed to get a table in the front. Food is ordered at the counter, after you pay, you bring a number to your table and then the staff brings your food.  I ordered the lamb salad and it was so refreshing, with the pickled red onions and the ample lamb hiding under the salad.  The fries were crispy and the sandwiches were really substantial and reminded me of kebabs.  Everything was served on matching white and blue trimmed metal dishes. And the staff were really friendly.  Overall, a great place for lunch.  Will definitely return to try their yogurt desserts and other menu items.

They need to change up the vegetarian sandwich option.  Big slice of sweet potato just doesn't go well with a thick hard pita bread.  This place is usually great with the baklava greek yogurt being the finisher that will make your day.

The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. As it is my first time here the gentleman in the front guided me through the process. I ordered the salad with lamb and a bottle of water. Total = $25. 

The vegetables in the salad were fresh, crispy and quite tasty. The lamb on the other hand was an abomination. It was WAAAAAYYYYY over cooked. The provider of this meat was probably the oldest "lamb" in mutton history. The taste and texture reminded me of trying to eat a spoonful of carrot pulp from a juicer. (You've had to have tried it to understand the analogy). 

I would have given a lower rating but for the staff.
Souvla is so good! Not only suitable for a group of friends, but solo to dine. The pork salad was huge and delicious, while the baklava yogurt was surprisingly good. Will definitely come back again!

3.5 stars.

In terms of portions and pricing, if you consider Souvla more of a fast-food place, then it's impressive. But for fast casual, it's quite on the pricier side. Not sure if that made any sense but that's how I perceived my experience. The line moves efficiently and the food rolls out with barely any wait time. Fresh food and flavor, definitely recommend the pork. I just wanted more.

I love this spot. Been here a couple times while visiting SF and the lamb gyro never disappoints. The fries with garlic yogurt are also delicious. 

The Divisadero location has good vibes. I dig the outdoor section out back.

We looked on yelp for a place to eat by the painted ladies house.  This place was delicious!  Loved the fries with garlic sauce and the chicken sandwich!  Got to remember this place next time we visit!

The chicken salad is quite good.  I ordered it with fries on top, just to balance out the healthiness of the kale with the fried carbs.

Highly recommend the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava topping.
Their frozen greek yogurt is the BEST!!! A must try. I am lactose intolerant but I have to get this...I crave it so much.

This post is mostly for their Greek yogurt as we've probably only eaten their actual food 1 time (lamb wrap and fries which was pretty darned awesome). The Greek yogurt here is the best I've ever had, thick, creamy, and a bit tart. I love that you can add your sour cherry (my favorite) or baklava. If I lived closer, I'd probably come here weekly for the frozen yogurt! Parking is difficult here, but it's a nice place to walk around

Very impressed by this restaurant. I stopped by before a concert because my friend and I were looking for a quick bite to eat and this place just so happened to be down the block from the venue.

I tried the pork shoulder wrap and I wasn't disappointed. All the ingredients were very complimentary and it was decently priced for the amount of food you receive. Very filling, I couldn't finish my meal! Also, the service was great because I got my food in a short amount of time despite how packed it was. The woman taking my order was very patient and willing to answer any questions I had about the menu which was highly appreciated.

The restaurant has a lot of seating. They even have a cute patio area in the back of the restaurant if the indoor seating is full. There is no parking lot so be prepared to park on the street. It was definitely worth coming here and I am looking forward to going back!

We love and have been eating the salads here forever- they're the best. However, their quality in meat has become disappointing. I ordered the lamb salad today and the pieces of meat were all solid, dry blocks. The Hayes location seems to keep the best quality... but if I'm paying $20 for a salad I expect better.

Such great Greek food! The lamb tasted fresher than you've ever had before.. because it is! All their meats are spinning in a rotisserie in front of your eyes. The prices are a little high but that's SF for ya.  I like the ambiance inside and LOVE the lit outdoor seating area but it's a tight squeeze for the line and I was looking for a place to put my dirty plate for 5 mins. This is actually my second time here. I went to the other location last time. I never go to the same place twice so you know this place has to be good!

Hits the spot without breaking the bank. 

I always get the salads when I go to Souvla and I love how the portions are huge and the price is very fair! I can't speak for the pita sandwiches or other things on the menu, but I've gotten these two salads: 

Pork shoulder salad (5/5): the pork was cooked perfectly and nicely tender. I loved the sweetness of the red onions and the creaminess of the cheese in this salad- all the flavors blended really well and if I go back to Souvla, this would be my go-to salad pick

Lamb salad (4/5): this salad was up there but compared to the pork, I think the lamb was a bit tougher and not as tender/juicy. I got a bit tired of chewing after a while and some bits of the lamb were dryer and less flavorful. Overall still a yummy salad that really fills you up though.

I have the had the lamb salad twice and both times I was really happy.  The salad feels never ending. No one finished their bowls.  Their fries are good but you need a dipping sauce.  I added their hot sauce to their Harrisa yogurt.  Didn't like the potatoes - but my friends did. I have tried two yogurts- their honey and baklava. Prefer the honey but I might be alone on that one.

Perhaps a good place for people who don't know what Greek food is, nor that there are still affordable restaurants in this neighborhood where you can get a delicious meal for a reasonable price. (Granted, none of them are on Divisadero.) I'm guessing these people account for most of the positive reviews.

The food was fine, but has nothing to do with Greek or Mediterranean cuisine. Tzatziki sauce? This "Greek" restaurant called "Souvla" has apparently never heard of it. This is typical California "fusion", novel but I wouldn't call it delicious, especially to those of us familiar with actual Greek cuisine. And certainly not worth anything like what they charge for it. Everything on the menu is about priced about 40% higher than it should be. If the prices weren't exorbitant it could be a 4-star place, but at $13 for a salad, no way. 

I had heard the fries were great. It's not true. They're nothing special.

The food isn't awful, but considering the prices, I see no reason to ever come back here.

My first real experience with Greek food. This place does NOT skimp on servings with their food nor their wine. Messy to eat but quite tasty. Everything is so fresh. I feel like my chicken was a liiiiiiiiiittle but on the dry side but not remarkably so. I wish they put more mandarin oranges in there! It's really cute inside with lots of good seating as well. A very simple and cool place.

My boyfriend heard about this place from his uber driver. He suggested the baklava crumble and honey syrup frozen yogurt. Ever since that day, we never leave without our baklava and honey froyo fix. Honestly, this is the best combination! The baklava is sticky and chewy while the honey syrup adds the right amount of sweetness which counterbalances the tartness of the yogurt. Don't just take my hyped-up foodie style description. Try it yourself!

Oh yeah, the other stuff on their menu is great too. The fries are crispy. The salads and sandwiches are large portions. And the decor deserves to be Instagrammed. Seating is limited to long tables so don't pull a Mean Girls (reference: you can't sit here). There's extra seating outside with heat lamps.

Yeah it's just about as good as everyone says. 

But that just means it's pretty good. I'm surprised how dry they could make rotisserie chicken. Super crazy. 

That being said, love the wine there. Tastes like pine trees. No joke it's super good.

Love the pork sandwich. Huge kudos to the kitchen staff who have never, ever messed up my order (no yogurt no feta) even on to-go orders. It's amazing! I've never had such consistently good service. Not a fan of the wine here. I've tried it all and thumbs down all around. Also not a fan of the frozen yogurt. But get me that sandwich and the potatoes any day!

Eating in can be a bit of a cluster as it gets busy during prime time. Love the back patio, though. Sitting out front feels a little like you're in the middle of Divis-- not ideal. 

Prices are pretty outrageous for what you get, but the food is good and take out is quick if you order online.

In SF Sunday afternoon with kids, thought trying something new would be fun.   Soulva felt like just the place.

I had roasted white sweet potato salad bowl: it is surprisingly tasty & perfect balance with fries with mint dip. Others had lamb leg sandwiches & chicken salad bowl.  Sandwiches were very flavored, but the chicken was too salty unfortunately.  Well, we have very little salt in our diet (that might be the reason).

We find the Greek beer there very refreshing, almost like Corona-ish, very light.

We give 4 stars only as it's not really the traditional Greek I'm looking for, just a fun Sunday evening quick bite place in the city we enjoy.

Mediocre gyros at premium price along with a long wait. The highlight was the Greek soda.

If you've ever had a Gyro a dinner in New Jersey just skip this disappointment. Apparently, there are not many good Gyro options in SF.

The vegetarian sandwich/pita just doesn't work. Maybe they wanted to be different and not do falafel but now I know why most Mediterranean restaurants do falafel for their veggie option. The sweet potato comes in a giant slice and it's a strange flavor profile with the salty kalamata olives, sour red onions, salty cheese and random pea shoots. 

My friends liked their lamb sandwich and chicken salad but I didn't even finish my sandwich.

Cute space and love the backyard!

2.5 stars

Location: plenty of tables both inside and outside. street parking is difficult and you'll have to circle around a few times. 

Service: food comes out very quickly and the cashier is nice. 

Food: I was so disappointed. I had heard great things and was so excited- but was really let down. The chicken sandwich was really cold and the chicken was extremely dry. Definitely not what I was expecting. The fries were pretty good but super plain.

Okay, the lamb they use on their sandwich is pretty delicious (amazingly tender, not ground/fatty), and that non-authentic sauce is so yummy. That's what brings me back for more.

Have to knock them a star because they're overpriced and never put enough sauce on the sandwich-- it's dry when you get to the bottom. The second time I went, I asked for them to go heavy on the sauce, so they happily charged me for extra sauce, but it was sadly still dry at the bottom.

Heads up to the parents of little tikes, no highchairs here and mostly bar height seating. There's one communal table in front where you could probably cozy a stroller up to, but the end seats are a hot commodity. We skip this place when we have Baby with us

GET THE DUCK FAT POTATOES OMG. 

Otherwise, the pita is amazing - flavorful meats and dripping with sauce. And that frozen yogurt - yes.

Easy, convenient, consistent. What Souvla is doing isn't revolutionary and it's not going to be the best meal you've ever had. But if you want a reliably good meal, reasonably portioned, and not too complicated this is a great place for a casual dinner solo or with friends 

Lamb salad greek style (with fries) is truly the best thing.

Gluten free friendly !

Ordered the lamb, not what I expected.  Oversauced, lamb was tender but is drenched in sauce and pickled veggies which added nice crunch but I think lamb needed to be crisper and more seasoned to offset the dressing.  Fries were fresh and crisp, $20 is pricey for the two items.  Would not recommend.

Simple menu, healthy & fresh, usually a long queue but fast service, friendly staff, modern & fun ambiance. 
Def recommend getting the bottle of white wine from Santorini - tastes mineral, dry, crisp & buttery

Had the Chicken salad, the fries with "Granch" and the frozen yoghurt with cherry syrup. The food was delicious and big portions. Service was fast and very polite. Would definitely recommend and will eat here again!

I'm completely obsessed with Souvla - such a cozy spot for Mediterranean food that's simple, but refined. I understand the perpetual line out the door. This eatery is ideal for those who prefer limited menu choices - you pick your favorite protein option (which comes with a set selection of gourmet accompaniments) and choose between a salad or wrap. My generous portion of rotisserie chicken lay on a bed of lettuce, kale, orange slices, pickled red onions a crumbly white cheese, and a lemony homemade dressing. 

Cheers to Nico M. for showing me this amazing spot! It's so hard to find healthy food options that are also affordable and tasty. Souvla pleases all palettes, with other options like Greek fries, sweet potato, pork shoulder, and lamb! I would LOVE to see Souvla come to Los Angeles! We ended our dinner by splitting the Greek yogurt soft serve topped with a sour cherry syrup. The froyo is refreshing and not overly sweet - next time I visit I want to try a yogurt topped with crumbled baklava and honey.

This place is so good. The salad and dressing are just out of this world, like beyond delicious. I don't ever really like kale, but they way they make the kale salad is something else. One star off because they are so expensive and charge $1 extra for extras that should be free (hot sauce, extra dressing).

Souvla turned me into a Salad Person.  I spent decades gleefully turning up my nose at "salads as a meal"  and "side salads".  And then on one very hot day a few weeks ago I left my 85 degree top floor apartment in search of a meal that had no warmth... and the freaking Souvla Lamb Salad entered my mouth on a lark and I haven't been the same since... and I'd never been a fan of lamb before either... wonders never cease.  I crave this salad and indulge that craving on the reg now.

Souvla has been on my list for a long time coming - but it didn't live up to my expectations.

Service: 5 stars
Fast casual. Friendly cashiers, extremely fast service. Sat down for 2 minutes and my salad already arrived! Love that you can order your fro-yo as you order your food and then come back to pick it up when you're ready without having to stand in line again.

Overall feel and cleanliness of the restaurant: 5 stars
Bback patio area is so cute - and heated!! V important. Nice and casual place to catch up with a friend, not recommended for big groups. Communal seating, servers constantly busy clearing tables and serving food. Kept very clean!

Food:
Chicken Salad: 3 stars
(*Review is mostly for chicken salad, haven't tried the other salads or any of the sandwiches yet)
Portion was generous. It's fair for the cost and you get A LOT of chicken. I had like a good 1/4 of a chicken thigh leftover in my bowl - and I had a bite of chicken in each forkful! It certainly looked beautiful - but it fell short on flavor for me! The chicken was a bit dry, and I felt like there wasn't enough dressing in the salad - I'm the type that usually goes for light dressing too. So, if you like your salads with more dressing, you should ask for it. The topping to salad green ratio was good, I got a little bit of everything (greens + pickled onions + orange + chicken) for every bite, but overall, I felt like the chicken was... just OK. Not enough flavor for me. Maybe my downfall was just not asking for more dressing, it probably would have saved the salad! Next time. I would certainly return to give it another try!

Froyo: 4 stars
I asked for baklava with a bit of salt. The light syrup drizzle was REALLY good, just lightly sweet and on the watery end - a good complement to the tart froyo. Very smooth and not TOO sour. A nice light and cool dessert to the end of a meal. For baklava, I usually anticipate something more crunchy (hello, phyllo dough!) but this was more on the doughy and heavy side? I think it went well with the froyo though.
SO DELICIOUS!!! I'm so glad I walked pass this spot. Had the vegetarian salad. I love it. The yogurt was off the hook.

Simply put this place is the shizz. 

I've been to the Hayes Valley & NoPa locations - I'm partial to the NoPa location because it's more spacious and parking is much easier to find, but the Hayes location is a great off-peak or take-out spot.

The concept is simple, fresh Greek food. And Souvla delivers every time. Find yourself a table, order a salad, Greek fries + housemade "granch" dressing to share along with a few mugs of the Greek table wine for good measure. On your way out, pick up some fro-yo to go - you can't go wrong with any of the flavors, but the sour cherry is my go to.
Expensive but huge portions. I did not need to eat that entire salad in one sitting, but I couldn't help myself- it was just so darn good. I will definitely be returning!!

This spot was amazing i went and as soon as i stepped in i was greeted by kathy who immediately gave me 100 dollars then dropped kicked me to my table, i was so happy that i did not have to get up and walk and I also got the flying experience 15/10 would recommend and ask for kathy.

Place was packed food was fresh plentiful and tasty. Great service. I loved the vegetable salad with sweet potato. And the olive oil and salt yogurt was amazing t me. My niece had the baclava one and she enjoyed it as well. I'm. It a big meat eater and the lamb was a little to gamey for me I couldn't eat it. All in all a great experience. The roasted potatoes with olive went well with the roasted chicken. I'm craving this place ...... sigh

Just as good as the original Souvla in Hayes Valley + a great outdoor patio. I can't say enough good things about Souvla, the brainchild of the famous Kokkari and Evvia restauranteurs. 

You pick between 4 proteins - lamb, pork shoulder, rotisserie chicken, and sweet potato. You can have them as salads or as a gyro. I'm a huge fan of the lamb gyro and the chicken salad. Their fries and potatoes are delicious, and you can opt to get them in the wrap "Greek-style" for 50c more!

Their frozen yogurt has spoiled me from all other fro-yo places, so make sure you get those as dessert before you leave. This location is not quite as crowded as the Hayes Valley one, so the food comes out really quickly!

We live just a few blocks away so this place has sort of been made into home away from home. We often order to go or eat outside on the back patio, when weather permits.
The Lamb salad's are outstanding and the wraps also. Note also the rose wine is great. My sons really enjoy their frozen yoghurts as well. Five star for sure, price quality and restaurant lay out!

Now onto my second review of Souvla - continuing from my review for Souvla on Hayes, this one is for Divisadero. 

Came here for lunch today.  We ordered the vegetarian salad and the lamb leg salad. 

Our bowls were vibrant with color and generous servings of vegetables and lamb meat. Definitely a step up from the lamb salad experience I had at Souvla on Hayes. The lamb here were in visible cubes rather than shredded dry bits. 

This location is larger with a sweet patio in the back. There is a large family table, some bar setting and high 2 person high tables along the back. Beware if you sit under the tree, there are many ants that occasionally fall from the trees. Great place to sit if you enjoy the extra protein in your salad and your hair. 

Overall: 
Food/ drinks: 5/5 for salad bowls. 

Service: 3/5 - hard to rate service for a place that has no service. Everything is self serve here. The pro about this location is that we didn't feel rushed to leave. 

Environment: 4/5- great decor, free wifi and self seating, self water service, clean the tables yourself, however music is still a little louder than what's comfortable to have a conversation in.

I moved to San Francisco roughly 6 weeks ago and I've eaten here at least 4 times! Mostly I've ordered take out, which is insanely fast. Literally, I've never waited more than 10 minutes from ordering time to pick including nights when the restaurant is completely full. The food is always consistent, the wine and beer is delicious and definitely get the greek yogurt baklava. And if the weather is nice the patio is charming.

This place is SO good. Lamb salad with olive oil no dairy is my go to here and eating healthy has never been better. It's also really really fast and they are almost always busy. And it's really cool to see how fast this place is growing in the city!

Favorite fast casual restaurant in SF! Order at the counter and wait with your number at the table. I tried the lamb salad after a friend raved over it and have not been able to branch out to try anything else because it really is so dang good. Greek fries are a great idea to share because you want to make sure you save room for dessert...order frozen Greek yogurt with honey and sea salt (that combo is not on the menu, but the sweet/salty combo is top notch)!

We LOVE Souvla!  We used to frequent their Hayes Valley location, but it was more of a trek and parking isn't the best.  Ever since the NOPA location opened, we've exclusively been frequenting this location.  It's a little closer to home, and while parking STILL isn't the best, we manage.

My favorite salad is hands down (not just at Soulva, but my favorite salad in general) is their Mary's Free-Range Chicken Salad.  The flavorful chicken and the sweetness of the Navel Orange?  Yum!

I also love their Greek Fries.  We always add the Harissa spiked yogurt dipping sauce.  Adds a little extra kick to the fries.

This location is much bigger than the Hayes Valley one and we always manage to find a seat.  You can order online and pick up.  It's always super quick and everyone working here is really friendly.

YES!  We will definitely be back.

A lot of people I know *really* like this place. I didn't really care for the food. I had the lamb wrap/sandwich/whatever they call it. I expected it to be shaved, gyro-style, which is maybe my fault for making that assumption. In reality the lamb is cubed. Why would I want a wrap filled with cubed meat? Not that easy to eat, and not that delicious. What is good, however, is the baklava frozen yogurt. The yogurt is delightfully tart. I like to get the baklava in a cup on the side. It's like a baklava cobbler, if you can picture that. I like going back just for the yogurt.

Lamb sandwich, Greek style. 
Chicken salad. 
Rose house wine. 
Olive oil and sea salt Greek yogurt. 

These are my faves at Souvla. Yum.

Nice staff and tasty food. 
You can't go wrong with any salad/sandwich. And don't forget to grab a froyo on your way out.
The best lamb salad!! goes well with their house red. they have high table at the back, which was super cozy and nice.

Souvla is one of my favorite go-to places. Honestly, I'm a little glad there isn't one in my neighborhood because I would spend so much money there! It's fast and casual but still delicious and you can order wine and hangout for a while if you feel like it. I usually go for the chicken salad, but I've also had the chicken wrap and the lamb salad (definitely add fries to your salad). The Greek fries are really good too. My favorite froyo is the one with baklava, it's the perfect consistency and the toppings are in the perfect amount. Combined with the reasonable pricing, it's definitely a favorite of mine!

Really don't know what the hype is. I've been to Souvla twice, and both times the meat has been heavily disappointing. The first time I tried the chicken bowl - the chicken was so dry. The rest of the salad was fine. The second time, I tried the lamb. I could barely eat the lamb, tasted terrible. Almost like it was about to go bad, and again, super dry. I barely touched the salad. I only like the French fries. Just get the fries and you'll be fine.

I love me a good gyro but I'm equally super happy when it's a bougied-up version like what they have here. It's good, big, and mmm mmm good.

I always get the lamb with a side of fries. All to share. My dude and I should probably get an extra order of fries though. Apparently our kid isn't dissuaded by the crumbled cheese and fought us for fries.  The lamb is thick, moist, and reminds me of the stewed meats of my youth. Sigh.

Share an entree. That way if you have any room left, you can squeeze in a froyo.
Solid spot for fresh Greek-ish food with a modern twist! The salads are a very hearty portion.

Yum! Was starving and glad I gave this place a try. Clean, nice layout, a little bit above casual but not too fancy. You order at the counter first and then find a seat. There is also outside seating but it was a bit too chilly for us to sit outside. I got the lamb sandwich which was so yummy. You must order it with fries inside- it really gives it that extra punch. Lamb was pretty tender. My only complaint was that the bread was a bit flater than I would have preferred and all the fillings were bunched up and not spread out well.

The avgolemono soup was pretty good! Strong on the lemony side- a greek version of chicken soup. Finally the baklava yogurt was so good! The yogurt is quite tart- as is expected, but the baklava inside was delicious!

Overall- pretty good place and would definitely come back.

Having eaten here ~10 times, I had to finally write a review. Souvla sets the standard by which all of these "fancy fast food" places popping up on Divis or other gentrified SF drags should be judged.

You may have to wait in line for a few minutes to get your order in, but after that the food comes out shockingly quickly. 

The kitchen here is a finely tuned machine, and this is reflected in the core ingredients of Souvla's menu (spit roasted lamb, pork and chicken). The meats are well seasoned, tender from slow roasting and juicy. 

You can't go wrong with any of the salads or wraps, but personal favorites are the pork salad, fries+harissa yogurt, and the dank level infinity "juicy potatoes". Enjoy on one of their two outdoor patios.

Although I'm still bitter about losing Herbivore Souvla is definitely a solid addition to the neighborhood. 

I tried the Lamb Sandwich and side Chicken Salad and was pretty happy with the salad however the lamb was overcooked-- BAHHHhumbug. 

Really love they are sticking to their Greek roots w their all Greek wine/beer selection. I ordered the rose which was tasty and also an great value-- $10 for what seemed like 2+ cups. 

We ordered a Baklava Greek Yogurt w Cherry Sauce to go and it was seriously good and almost guilt free! Will be back fosho.

Decent food, but a bit overpriced. Good service, though I was one of two people in the restaurant at the time.

It's basically an upscale Greek burrito place, but the burritos cost $13.
I don't know if anyone out there cares about my dumb food opinion but goddamn this might be the best chicken salad don't @ me bro

This place is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood. I've tried almost everything on their menu and I can tell you, you can't go wrong. Their menu is simple, straightforward and balanced. 

If you're looking for a casual meal this is definitely a place to go. And don't forget the frozen yogurt!

I ordered Souvla from Caviar today. I was very excited to finally try them. I ordered juicy potatoes, chicken sandwich and lamb salad with pita. Food was fresh and good but after I ate about half of the pitas, I found two very suspicious-half-eaten-looking pita pieces. I was quite surprised about this, didn't want to believe they were little teeth marks on the pitas. My husband and I finished the salad but didn't eat the pitas. I wanted to believe they were just ripped out pieces but still... I don't want half broken pieces :( a bit disappointed. I would go to their restaurant to eat but probably never get their food delivered again.

I asked a local if there were any good and reasonably priced places to eat in the area, and was given Souvla as a recommendation. Upon arriving to the restaurant, I could tell the food must be delicious, as there were people seated at just about every place at every table. The restaurant itself is bright, and airy. It gives off a cozy feeling, with its relaxed colors and cleanliness. The rotisserie near the kitchen lets you know that the meat is freshly and hot, just waiting to be ordered. The cashier was attentive, friendly, and helpful in navigating the menu. I ordered the Chicken salad togo. The box was a chic design, and I didn't even have to ask for utensils. About the salad. The ingredients (what I can remember), fennel, orange sections, kale, romaine, a salty cheese (if you know spaghetti factories pasta and cheese dish-its that cheese), rotisserie chicken, pickled red onions, and dressing. The presentation wasn't the best, be the flavor was a 9/10. I only say this because, the chicken looked a bit, how do I say this nicely?...a bit already chewed. If it were sliced, it would be a lot more appetizing to look at. While eating the salad, I was thinking about how the orange slices sort of look thrown in. I'm sure there is another way to add the oranges (because they did add a sweetness I enjoyed-that I don't usually see in greek savory dishes) to a salad in a more unique way. Oh, and the red onions were a bit tart, as if they had been sitting out for some time. I would definitely like to try this salad again with fresher prepared pickled onions. When done right, they are my fav. Lastly, in my opinion the dressing and cheese should come in separate containers (small enough to fit in the sleek box) for togo orders, for obvious reasons (more time to travel with it before the dressing wilts the lettuce). 

Overall, flavor packed! 

And, Ik some people might disagree with me being so picky about presentation. But other than food being a nutritious meal to keep me energized throughout my day, its also an experience to savor in every aspect there is. So, picky yes, is it warranted? Why not?

Would I recommend this place? Yes. Buon appetito. Was that Greek? Probably not. Lol

Came here on a Tuesday night with friends.

We ordered:
* chicken salad 
* pork salad
* baklava crumbles & honey syrup greek froyo

Price: ~$32 not including tip

The order line moved fast and the food came out in less than 6 minutes. Wow!

The salads come in big bowls--I thought it was well worth the price. I had trouble finishing my bowl.

Chicken Salad -- My friend got this and he gobbled it up in no time.
Pork Salad -- So...it was mostly good, but some of the chunks of pork were way too dry and stringy. The parts that were good were tender, flavorful and delicious. Overall, I thought this was a well proportioned salad with generous portions of meat.

Greek Froyo--it was a bit of a sweetness overload in the end. I wish it came in different sizes because I thought the cup was much too large. I thought it was delicious, but not particularly memorable and very similar to regular froyo places.

Although there's only one vegetarian option, it is very good! The primary flavor is sweet with sweet potato; however there is some balance of salt and sour from the fries ($0.50 additional cost) and pickles onions.

Hands down I have to say the best I've ever had. The salads are so light the frozen yogurt is soo light and tastes absolutely authentic. They are also so generous on portion sizes. Sooo much meat in the salads!! Absolutely amazing. On top of great food customer service was fantastic.

This place has great outdoor seating, fun drinks, and awesome Greek food. The reason for the 4 stars is that I just find it pricey for what it is and the amount that they give you. I ordered the Vegetarian Wrap and really enjoyed the potatoes and Greek  olives combination!

Love your food, but you guys NEVER EVER include utensils in your take out orders. I've ordered take out/delivery from this location about a dozen times and not once have I gotten a fork. It's a running joke at this point. 

Love them fries, though!

The new Souvla on Divis is just as good as the Hayes Valley location, but closer to my house - yahoo!

Their menu is super simple, just choose your protein and either have it as a gyro sandwich or salad. My favorite thing to order is the chicken salad, though I am thinking I want to try the vegetarian sweet potato version next! All of the proteins are thoughtfully sourced, so you can eat them with a good conscience. Also, don't forget their amazing frozen greek yogurt dessert. The go-to is topped with baklava crumbles and honey syrup, though the sour cherry is delicious as well.

The outdoor patio here sets this storefront apart from their other location, as it provides extra seating and would be awesome on a sunny day (yesterday was breezy and cool, so we decided to stay indoors).

Again, I am super stoked to have Souvla (a little) closer to home - you can count me as a regular on Divis soon!
I'm a fan of the Frozen Greek Yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. So strange yet sooooo good. The taste of their frozen yogurt is something I've never had anywhere else.
Favourite fast casual Mediterranean food in the city!  Fries were so good (which is super important) and so was the dessert! I had the yogurt topped with baklava and it was/is to die for!

Writing this review while I'm still dreaming about the frozen Greek yogurt.

If this isn't already your go-to spot for casual dinner with a friend, then don't bother coming - I want to save this place all for myself! We stopped here around 8:30pm on a Tuesday night at had no issues finding a spot to sit. Both ordered the veggie salad with sweet potato and it is the BOMB. The white sweet potato is incredibly creamy and the olive oil dressing is light and tangy.The salad itself is huge so definitely enough to take home for lunch the next day.

The all-star favorite? Greek yogurt. The employees are really chill about mixing and matching flavors, so I'm a huge fan of the olive oil and sea salt w/ a slice of baklava. I need to look into the cost of getting a Souvla Greek yogurt machine installed in my apartment so that I can binge eat this stuff every day.

My new favorite Greek restaurant!  Try the Greek salad with chicken and French fries - amazing.  I love this add French fries to salad tradition.  The rotisserie chicken is better than what you could make at home!  The sour cherry yogurt is a must do - would make that a daily event if calories were not a concern.  Nice seating area in back amongst the trees

Just as good as the Hayes Valley mother ship, which means the food is well-sourced, relatively inexpensive and tasty.

The egg-lemon soup with rice and chicken was wonderful and chock full of chicken.  Not the kind of chicken you get in canned soup but chicken.

The rotisserie chicken salad was enormous and perfect. A side order of potatoes with rotisserie drippings was also very good.

For one person I over ordered but enjoyed my meal.

Souvla is delicious. This was my second time at Souvla, first time at this (new?) location. We got the sweet potato salad, which was hearty and refreshing and had a great balance of flavors and textures, just like the chicken salad I had gotten on a previous visit. Oh, and the sour cherry greek yogurt of course. Solid place for a healthy and filling meal.

Also, this location has a beautiful outdoor seating deck area in the back! I lucked out on the day we visited and the weather was uncharacteristically perfect for sitting outside. 

I would love, love, love to have a go-to salad spot like Souvla in San Jose.

When we arrived, there was a massive line that stretched all the way out the door. To our surprise, we were at the cash register and ordering our food in less than 5 minutes. Service staff provided a tasting samples of unusual sounding wines, and were very friendly. The chicken was SO tender and delicious. The lamb was smoky and amazing. The "Granch" dip was the perfect pairing to our garlic Greek fries! The back patio is a provided a little quieter and cute atmosphere. Would highly recommend!
Everything is bone dry and they charge you for extra sauce to sauce their bone dry food. Good for people who like their mouths to feel like a desert. Also rude staff.

I feel like I should give these guys gold stars in addition to the five stars. It really doesn't get much better than this-

In addition to amazing food, they've also nailed the "everyone is a picky eater" thing. I've only ever ordered online and it's so refreshing that a place cares and pays attention to substitutions for an order. It's nothing major but asking whether you want the dressing on the side and asking whether you want extras on your salad is awesome. 

And the end result? So fresh and flavourful. A favorite of mine is to get the veggie salad and add chicken to it, but the lamb salad is also delicious. 

I'd also recommend the greek fries as well!

I'm lucky to have this place right next to my apartment. The prices can look a little steep but the quality of the food is great and the portions are generous. The salads are nice for someone looking for a healthier option and the wraps are perfect if your trying to grub. Treat yourself to a baklava frozen yogurt for dessert - you won't be disappointed. 

Pro tip! Order online to pickup and you can skip right to the front of the line.

I want to say I love it because the space was so cool and well designed.But, truth be told the food was lackluster. We had the chicken and the lamb sandwich. They were just ok. I have had better for much less. The fries were even just ok and I love fries.
Also, this is not a family establishment. They had no high chairs available. I do not have young children but, my friends do. 
I will not be returning.

Great fries but lamb sandwich (Gyros) is so massive and the lamb is not the typical soft melt in your mouth lamb that you usually expect from a Greek lamb sandwich in a pita. Just make a normal sized sandwich and I might come back one day. Sorry on to the next gyro shop in town.

This place was very simple, a choice of salads or sandwiches and sides. I had the chicken salad which was chocked full of good ingredients. The chicken was also tender and blended well with the salad. All in all a nice place for a quick lunch.

The reviewers aren't lying when they say to get the Greek frozen yogurt with baklava and honey. Probably one of the most satisfying and delicious desserts out there for only $5! The yogurt is creamy and tart and a wonder in and of itself. The baklava just takes it to another delicious level! Be sure to order it and ask to pick it up at the conclusion of your meal. You will not be disappointed! 

I also had the Greek fries with their Granch and added some of their table provided hot sauce. So delicious and such a perfect little afternoon snack and appetizer to the yogurt! 

The back patio is quiet and gorgeous! I highly recommend grabbing a table back there if you can! 

Will absolutely come back! But before 530 as that's when the lines really started.

Listen, I know it's absurd to spend $20 on a salad and potatoes but it's so good! I get the chicken salad and alternate between fries and roasted potatoes. Great portion size. And the froyo...geez...just spend the money and do it.

Nice place but a bit small, so be ready to wait if you want to stay. Not for big group.

Smell is delicious from the meats grilling. The potatoes with garlic and oil are a deadly sin! Oh my!
We took a salad with the lamb, and can only dream of the sandwich version of it. Next time?

A very good greek food place.
Delicious food and simple menu! Great ambience, and great customer service. The best thing on the menu is the baklava yogurt!!

The food here is amazing! Definitely for the amount of food you get the price is worth it. I got the veggie gyro (sandwich) which was OUTSTANDING and the Greek fries which were pretty good, kinda average (most of the cheese had collected to the bottom, we ordered the food for pick-up). The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was incredible, the tang of the yogurt combined perfectly with the baklava. Would totally recommend this place.

All around solid mediterranean spot that is legitimately ALWAYS busy. 

Great for:
-Quick salad, my go to- sandwich, reasonably healthy, good flavor, not dirt cheap, but cheap enough.

I get Souvla probably once every other week. 
Go to - chicken sandwich and fries.
But, the salad is a great option and you know the chicken is fresh considering the roitsseries swingin' right there front and center. 
Tip:
-Get hot sauce and/or the harissa or mint yogurt 
-Soup is good, very intense chicken flavor but that's the good stuff right? 

One gripe, you have to pay for hot sauce which is always kind of annoying.

Place has good ambience. Food was average. I tried Veggie Sweet Potato Salad which was average. 

I noticed that Greek Yogurt was pretty popular. Will try that next time.
Frozen Greek yogurt... Yes please! Menu is not super extensive but the food is really consistent and the staff is kind.

We placed a fairly large to go order for work (4 salads, 8 sandwiches, and 6 frozen yogurts. There was a glitch with the pick-up time online but when we called the restaurant they happily corrected it.

Lamb salad was great and everybody else lived their food (lamb sandwiches and chicken salads). We all thought we would like the yogurt with baklava best but agreed the sour cherry was better! 

Great place for lunch! While $14 may seem expensive for a salad, it was huge with lots of lamb-definitely worth the price. The yogurt was fairly large and reasonably priced at $4/$5.

So glad to have Souvla close to Pac Heights :)
I had the lamb sandwich and it was great. It was packed but service was fast. It's a little crowded inside bu they have seatings outside too. Recommend.

Consistently solid food. Simple menu. I usually get the lamb sandwich for $13. A little pricey for what it is but it Is San Francisco. The wine is also overpriced for a limited if appropriate but uninteresting list.  This place is much bigger than the Hayes valley store so I've never had lines like I see there and there's a lovely back patio. That is a huge plus for me. In fact whenever I go down to 4505 BBQ and the line is too long, I just come here instead

Outstanding food. Get anything that has chicken; its the star of the show. Its on display when you walk in on the big rotisserie machine. The lamb and pork are meh imo, mayb they would taste better if they were too on rotisserie. 

I get the salad its got a pleasing mixture of greens, fruit, cheese, sauce, and meat. I get it 'greek style' which means they add a handful of fries ontop its only 50cents extra. 

Hot sauce is bomb. Food service is quick and prices are fair. It can be packed. I order online and its usually ready for pickup in 5 minutes.

I was excited to try the second location of Souvla in my hood. The space is beautiful and clean, outdoor patio, and especially kind and professional staff. Unfortunately, the food did not hit the mark for us. Our sandwiches were doused in so much olive oil and sauce that it was borderline inedible, and I love yogurt sauce. Our plates were full of oil, and not in the good way. It was WAY too rich. I asked for a replacement of the breakfast sandwich for a chicken salad, and it was slightly better. It was presented beautifully, but kale needs some love before serving in a salad, so the texture was what one would expect with huge chunks of dry kale. 

I'd go back for fries and maybe to try their frozen yogurt. Again, kind people and amazing service. Just not my preferred style of Greek/Mediterranean.

Headline: Not for vegans. 

Summary:
* 2: Very limited vegan & vegetarian options
* 3: Quality of food
* 3: Price
* 4: Staff
* 4: Atmosphere

This is not the place to go if you are a vegan or nondairy vegetarian. There's only one entrée available (their sweet potato bowl, modified to remove the cheese and yogurt) and it's mainly lettuce. It also doesn't have any substantive source of protein. 

Also, I've been going to Mediterranean restaurants for decades. This is the first ever that did not have hummus or falafel. (Note to restaurant owner/manager: please include hummus and falafel as side dishes -- especially for potential vegan and vegetarian customers. Until that happens, I can't orecommend you , and won't be going back.)
Good food, really good wine. Kind of fast casual with salad and sandwich options. Pretty good avolemono soup too!

My lamb salad had pieces of chicken. I ordered dressing on the side and it came fully dressed and my potatoes were missing the white sauce that is supposed to come with. 

I ordered this to go and didn't realize the massive errors until i got home. 
Annoying.

Amazing amazing place! Beautiful back patio with nice heaters. The "sandwiches" (gyros) are delicious. I've had the chicken and pork. Service is great and very accommodating! Yummy wine with generous pours. And don't get me started on the BACLAVA honey Greek fro yo!!! I went last night and I think I'm going back tonight!

Souvla is the best Greek restaurant in San Francisco!!! The best meal is the lamb salad which is soooooo good. The fries are delightful and are a perfect mix of crunch and taste. And the Greek yogurt is to die for. Go!!!! You won't regret it!!!! Yes

Good flavors, but way overpriced in my opinion. The salad didn't seem spectacular enough to justify the cost. The overall atmosphere & vibe of the place is really cool, though. I see it more as paying for location and convenience rather than for the sheer quality of the food itself.
This is a great spot for a quick Greek meal. Bonus points: they offer a great veg option made with white potato (which is often hard to find at Greek restaurants!).

Yeah, I'm addicted to Souvla - so what? 

Their salads are delicious, filling, and their online ordering and takeout system is perfect for someone like me who lives in the neighborhood, but prefers eating at home with roommates. 

My favorite quick restaurant in the neighborhood!

Way overrated. Boring tasteless tzatziki. Under spiced lamb. Hey! You can't make up for this by adding a million slices of mini cucumber and radish. And limp pita is maybe okay for the limp yuppies who frequent the place, but give me real food.
Delish as always. This time hubby and I tried the chicken wrap a little dry but still good. The side Greek is a perfect size to pair with it. Need to try the ice cream next time.

The best frozen yogurt I've ever had with a LARGE amount of baklava. I'm giving it 4 stars because I'm pescatarian and the sweet potatoe salad is nothing compared to the meat entrees.  I will say that if you can't eat meat the fries are unbelievable and you of course have to get the yogurt. It definitely is a costly place so expect to pay around $20 each person. If you eat meat, 1000x better and the hot sauce is to die for
Good lunch spot. I got the lamb salad which was delicious. Atmosphere is casual and plenty of seating for a rotating door lunch crowd. Def would recommend this spot for a quick bite!

A Hayes Valley regular, I was excited to try their new place on Divis. It's a cookie cutter of the smaller location. I was hoping for an expanded Greek menu, how about some homemade hummus? And other truly Greek specialties? Instead, they are serving the exact same limited menu as Hayes, nothing new. 
The dining room is also the same, small cramped tables and communal seating. No intimidate dining experience to be had. The kitchen while overly large, detracts from the dining experience. Just like Hayes, I'd prefer to take away. 
And don't order your wine in metal cups, it adds a metallic taste in your wine. 
Hopeful they'll make necessary changes as their business evolves.

This restaurant is a hidden gem. The aesthetic of the restaurant is homely, hipster, avant-garde, with lots of wood and metal chairs. The eating space is small, but beautiful. It is also very, very clean, and kept immaculate. Ordering is super quick, and the food is served even quicker! The servers are polite and inviting.

Additionally, the food is so good and fresh, and very authentic. I didn't know feta cheese, pickled veggies, oranges and chicken went so well together! My companions ate veggie salads and loved them as well. Water is by the tap and unlimited. The beer was also fresh and light, served under the restaurant's name. 

Would recommend. Slightly pricey but worth every dollar. This is a very good restaurant in every aspect and I would recommend it again and again.

The people were nice and the food was good . Frozen yogurt with honey was haven.
But if to pick up food CHECK to make sure you have everything! I bought 2 fries and got one. The one I got appeared to be reheated.

I was introduced to this place by a friend, and am glad I was! The limited menu makes it easy to decide what to get. I got the pork in salad form, my dining companions each opted for the chicken (one in sandwich, one in salad). The salad was hearty and well dressed, with generous portions of pork. It was pretty tasty, and very filling! We also shared the fries and added a garlic dipping sauce for $1. The fries were also very good--crisp and herby. Parking can be a challenge but otherwise a gem and I will be back.

Have been hearing folks at work talk about this place. I decided to go for lunch today. I see what all of the fuss is about. It was great. I love rotisserie chicken. What's better...rotisserie chicken with Mediterranean seasoning. I got the chicken sandwich. Chicken with tahini, pickled veggies, feta, fennel and then wrapped in warm flat bread. So good!!! The one thing I didn't like were the orange slices...I picked those out. Next time will ask for them to hold those. Great spot for a quick bite.

I understand the fast casual concept is logical, however the food is so fast that the lamb was really quite tough on their sandwich

I had the same sandwich a few weeks prior that was far more tender, in this instance it was chunks of lamb.

Slow down the cooking process please if the quality is to remain along with consistency.

One of my staples in San Francisco. Fresh and clean ingredients, but with a great taste. Though I'm not vegetarian, their sweet potato vegetarian salad with everything on it is one of my favorite things on the menu!

I love to hit Souvla for lunch. I appreciate that you can grab a bite there late (after 2 pm) while other decent restaurants shut down service. I think you technically have to think about their offerings as fast food, but it sure doesn't taste like it. My favorite item, the chicken salad, tastes fresh and is delicious. Plus, it features creative ingredients like mandarin oranges, multiple types of greens including kale, and a lite but tasty dressing that doesn't overwhelm. Excellent.

I'm so disappointed in Souvla right now. I love their food but just wish they were consistent. I eat here all the time because I work directly across the street. I think the evening crew is different. Tonight I ordered the juicy potatoes with a side of pork and the portions were less than half of what they usually are. I said something about it and the guy just took my super small portion and dumped it in a bigger box, making it look even smaller. My business has ordered many large lunches from Souvla. Not anymore I will no longer recommend. Very dis
So bomb! Salads are on point! And I love the baklava frozen yogurt.. the tourist is very tart and the baklava compliments it perfectly. This is a go fo sho!!

Great food, a little annoying to find seating. Wraps can be heavy. Find it weird that they charge for the dipping sauces for the fries. I'm vegetarian and their veggie wrap is heartier and more flavorful than any other I've had. Friends say the chicken is amazing. Overall very good and a place I go to every couple months.

Omg! Sooooooo good! This place is the ultimate bomb! Loved the food, ambiance, and decor. Everything was amazing. Came here on a date night. The food came very quickly after ordering, and it was delicious. I just had to try the chicken sandwich, garlic fries, Yogurt with warm Baklava- what! Oh and the Rose to top it off! Thank you Souvla! Keep on Keeping on!
Tasty Mediterranean food made quick! The salads are so hearty and yummy, his is one of my go to lunch spots.

The food is awesome.

The atmosphere is great. 

Try the lamb it is local and slow roasted.

The chicken is just to die for in this place! If you have the salad or the wrap! I prefer the wrap, it can be a bit fiddly to eat but thats cause it's so big and juicy! But it's so tasty. In can get very busy at times so getting a seat can be hard but if you don't mind squeezing in a family style table it's all good. You can always get it to go
Good spot! Met some friends here and it was a really good time! Good, fresh ingredients, delicious fries, nice drinks, all around great place for a bite!
The Baklava topped yogurt is one of the best tasting treats I've had in a while! Fries on the other hand were just fries, I wish it came with a dipping sauce..

Amazing chicken salad and of course you can't leave without dessert! The baklava and honey frozen Greek yogurt is amazing! The perfect combination of sweet and tart! Me and my coworkers are already planning our next visit!

Very Delightful Brunch, had the soup, split a Lamb Salad, and opted for the Sour Cherry soda, Id highly recommend buying a sparkling water with the soda, your drink will last so much longer, also good if you want to split one drink. Also the garlic greek yogurt is the way to go with the fries. Everything was beyond what was expected, including the amount of meat in the Lamb Salad. Hope you Enjoy

Love this spot. Very yummy.  Lamb salad 'greeked" is off the chain.   Dessert is perfect, healthy and delicious all in one.  Great for a late night sweet tooth dessert and not feel guilty after you've scarfed down the entire thing.
Delicious.  Super duper. Stupendous. I liked it. You will too. Wapakoneta River Valley.

Generally don't each much Greek food but this place was right down from our hotel. The pork sandwich was awesome with a ton of meat, and we shared an order of their Greek fries. A tad pricy for what you get but really good and fast!

I've been to Souvla around 5 times since the location opened and have to say that, until I had the salad, I thought it was a liiiitttle over rated and over priced. Everything was always tasty, but just didn't call to me like it seems to call to everyone else. 

That all changed after I got a lamb salad to go. 

For $1 more (I felt a little silly paying more for a salad than for a sandwich, is that just me?) you get what feels like a lot more meat than comes in the sandwich. And I think that the flavors of the cheese, dressing, radishes, and onions are way stronger and more complementary when they're not disguised by the bread. The salad is just a superior dish all around. 

It's a really hefty portion; enough to split in half and eat for lunch and dinner for me.
I love their frozen yogurt but last time when i ordered a take out and I was shocked... the amount was so small, half the cup.

FROZEN GREEK YOGURT!!!!!! 
And rosè of course. 

The back patio is lovely and food arrives fast. My soup was cold once.. Meh I still ate it.

It's great to have Souvla on Divisadero finally!  I loved going to this place in Hayes valley, and now I can walk to it in a couple minutes.  The food is great just like the original location and I like that the new space has more room.

My only gripe is the layout.  It's really confusing when you enter the restaurant.  A long narrow hallway connects the two parts of the restaurant.  The ordering area is crammed in this hallway so it creates a bottleneck quickly.

Overall, highly recommend this place.

Mehhh. Not really sure how Souvla has received so much acclaim in SF. The fries are decent but sandwiches are really nothing special and overall average. There are definitely much better places in the city than this!!
The portions are big and everything is delicious. I am not a big fan of the pork salad because it get's too oily. The vegetarian one is my favorite. Must try their greek yogurt ice cream as well!
One of my favorite spots in SF. They have great sandwiches and salads. Their yogurt is also amazing! I only wish they had more vegetarian or pescatarian options.

The chicken and lamb are dry and lack flavor. They also charge you $0.92 for any sauce you use, which would be totally fine if they were transparent about it and the sauce was actually good. The back patio is really nice on a sunny day but if you prioritize food over setting then skip Souvla and eat at all the other amazing places on Divisadero instead.
Honestly I was not impressed. Food was average at best. The potatoes were swimming in grease. I had to re-plate them myself and dry them off with paper napkins.

Visiting from Florida and needed a place to eat after the park. Food is delicious! I ordered a chicken sandwich while my family ordered lamb. We got a side of french fries which were equally as delicious. Everything was super fresh and full of flavor. I liked the use of fresh veggies and garnishes, as well as the fresh mandarin oranges on my chicken sandwich. We also got the baklava crumbles with honey syrup on top, which was AMAZING. The sweet baklava combined with the tart frozen greek yogurt was insane. I wish we had restaurants like this in Florida.

quite possibly the driest chicken i've ever eaten - on the most uncomfortable chairs for dining. the french fries were good tho. not sure i'd come back...maybe for the greek frozen yogurt, that looked good. 

ps i told someone (who came to clear our table) that the chicken was very dry, to which he replied, "so you liked it?". OY. 

i should have brought it back. i was hungry. and now i'm home and have a stomach ache; for whatever that's worth. 

souvla, meh and full of hipsters (but what place in sf isn't these days)

This place just did it for me.  Kind of a strange operation, where it feels semi fast food.  We sat outside in the back- the courtyard back there is cool and has a heater.  Grabbed some wine and the lamb salad bowl.  But what really knocked my socks off was the olive oil/salt/yogurt for dessert- very unique taste.  Their location in the Mission is great too
Super good food. It is a really cool spot to eat and chill. Food is delicious and very fresh. I recommend this place.

This is probably one of the best spots in town for a hearty lunch meal. Souvla is solely built on the fact that they provide good, well balanced food that also tastes good, and creates a place where people can also come together. I could easily eat here everyday (if my budget allowed) lol because it is literally just that good. Charles (the CEO and founder of Souvla) has showed throughout all of the locations in SF that he really does care about what he is putting in front of people and how his businesses have contributed to the respected neighborhoods (NoPa, Hayes Valley, Mission) and also cares about the people in them. GO GET THE LAMB SALAD GREEK STYLE!! You won't regret it :)
Great food. The seating is always hit or miss but the food makes it worth it. We either take it to go or eat wherever we can sit. I love the lamb. The frozen Greek yogurt is also delicious!

I am not Greek; therefore, I do not have a Greek grandmother. But if I did, she'd be turning over in her grave at the sandwich I had! I am totally willing to pay for quality food, but I just can't get behind paying $13 dollars for a pita that tasted like chalk and dry lamb.
My favorite spot in the Haight. Best salads ever and the fro yo is unreal. The sour cherry is the move.

I seriously love the salads here. A nice combination of flavors, colors and textures, topped with super yum grilled meats. And the wine generous wine pours, and the cozy patio. A real neighborhood gem.
Souvla is tasty, straightforward food and is very consistent. The wait staff is always friendly, even when there's a lot going on in the restaurant. Great neighborhood spot.
10/10 best fries and sauce I've ever had. Obsessed!! Def always come back when I'm in the city

Be really cautious about ordering online. Two locations (Hayes Valley & NoPa) are very close to each other so it can get confusing when your ordering (this seems to happen to them regularly from what the cashiers said).

Once you order online and pay, there's no way of sorting it out, moving your order, or getting your money back.  Just double check! It doesn't help that they dont have any one answering a phone either.
The frozen greek yogurt with baklava was one of the best things I've ever had. And, the veggie salad was also unreal. Casual and delicious.

as a Greek-American, I really wanted to try this place out when I stumbled upon it. the decor is clean and fresh and welcoming and the food looked good.. however the dark-haired cashier lady was so nasty when I asked about the Greek iced tea, rolling her eyes and struggling to answer my question, that I just walked out without ordering food.
hospitality is a big thing in the Greek culture and this employee did NOT represent that...
I couldn't help but notice that one of the chairs had my last name on the back I even tried asking the same woman what was the meaning behind that, but she seemed really annoyed and said she didn't know, before taking the next customer.

Great food- fresh and tasty - a little overpriced BUT it's is SF after all and I do always feel super full after!
To-go or sit down. Whatever works for you.. options are great for both!

New champ for most over-rated joint on the Diviz corridor.  
I found the food either salty or bland.  and of course heavy.
Why would you ever go here when you can also just go over to Ragazza?
or Crudo
or Nopalito!
or 4505 Meats
or Little Star Pizza 
or ... ad infinitum..
Fantastic flavors and so fresh! Free range chicken salad and greek fries all lived up to all I read!!

i don't know what happened to souvla, with its original location being so successful in hayes valley, it's only exciting to try out the newer location on divisadero. however it was a let down.

there are 2 major things that went wrong with our recent experience. we can in for togo orders for lamb salad and chicken gyro sandwich.

1. food: lamb salad was monotone when it comes to flavor. the only one note was "tangy" from all the pickled onions and dressing without good balance of other flavors in there, it would've been better to have a few sweet elements in there (for example, some pomegranate seeds to balance it out) . the lamb was also dry. chicken gyro was a disaster. albeit having more sweet elements in there, the shredded chicken was really dry. but the interesting part was the disturbingly huge amount of chicken fat that was dripping out from the bottom of the gyro into the box when we're eating it. still couldn't get our heads wrapped around how the chicken could be so dry to taste but massive amount of chicken grease was escaping from the other end. it was unappetizing.

2. safety: the chicken gyro had a thin wish bone left in there. in the midst of eating, my partner pulled out a long, roughly 2 inch long thin chicken bone that was left in the shredded meat. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. can you imagine if he had swallowed the bone and it lodged in his throat? this is purely bad quality control on the restaurant's end and you really NEED TO be more thorough with deboning and shredding your meats. SCARY!

all in all, it was such a let down, would've given a 1 star, but another star goes to the friendly service staff with smiles on their faces. all in all, horrible food and will not return to to location.

10/10 for the baklava greek yogurt every single time! I've eaten this yogurt about fifty times, and loved every one of them!! Perfect dessert after any meal. Really cozy space, and you can even watch the meats turn and cook if you sit in the right spot! Eating out on the back patio is beautiful on a sunny day, but they also have heaters for when it's chilly. Also, they're hot sauce is amazing! Put it on anything. Chicken salad is also a winner. A bit overpriced entrees!

This place is so cute and absolutely delicious. I tried the baklava and honey greek yogurt which was the perfect mix of sweet and tart. I got the pork shoulder pita and boy oh boy. It was life changing.  They are no skimpy on the meat or veggies! You can definitely have two meals with that huge wrap. I highly recommend this place. The salads look absolutely delicious as well!

My first time there. Unfortunately the flavor profiles on the menu short. I had a $11 chicken souvlaki which was dry as well as the pita bread. Very little sauce and two chunks of orange through the whole thing. Staff was very nice!

This new location is so awesome. The back patio is absolutely beautiful with the twinkley lights, and it feels a little more spacious than the other location. Not too fancy, but not too casual-- it's the perfect in between place. I recommend the lamb pita, or the lamb salad. And of course the Greek beer. Oh and the potatoes. Okay never mind just order the whole darn menu.
Love the patio in the back, love the chicken salad, not a huge fan of the recently raised prices.

My mother and I were walking by when the waft of succulent meats drew our attention. We didn't know this place existed but we're sure glad we stumbled upon this place. After just one visit we're eager to come back to try different menu items. This time we tried the chicken gyro sandwich, Greek fries and the white sweet potato salad. We shared our orders and we couldn't be happier. The salad was generously portioned and very fresh, offering a distinct flavor from typical salads found elsewhere in the area. The chicken gyro sandwich was very fresh and delicious, also generously portioned with plenty of tender chicken breast meat in it. The fries were also really good, nice and crispy and seasoned very well. 
We came at a good time, relatively early so tables were readily available, although we noticed the place filled up fast. There's outdoor seating out front and in the back, which was really nice. I enjoyed being able to get my own flask of water without having to bother the staff with it. Overall great atmosphere, friendly staff and our food arrived very quickly. 
We're glad we decided to be adventurous today, it paid off in spades and we will definitely be back.

Souvla on Divis!!!  Gorgeous restaurant with beautiful flower arrangements with outdoor dining area with wonderful people cooking, greeting and serving you good eats.  Lots of green leaves - so beautiful.   On weekends, Souvla makes a breakfast wrap that is just delicious with eggs, cherry tomatoes, avgolemono sauce, with your choice of rotisserie meat or yellow sweet potatoes!  SO HAPPY you're here, welcome to the neighborhood!!

Great place. Would definitely go there again. Selection is a bit limited in both drinks and food but it makes for very simple ordering. Wish they had a bit more seating. Other than that, it's the best Greek food I have had hands down.

Heated patio in the back: 10/10. 

Fries with garlic and harissa dip: 10/10. 

Salad with white sweet potato: 8/10 (a tad too salty for me but there's a generous amount of kale and sweet potato, which I like). 

This is a slightly more casual place since you pay upfront and don't have a specific server. It seems people go just to get fries or one of their frozen Greek yogurts, so you don't need to feel like you have to get a whole meal to stop by!
Go to Hayes location. This one is particular bad. Found the fries to be stale. Lamb was tough. I complained since I knew it should be better.  But just got a shrug.
Simple menu, awesome food. Love the vibe of this place as well it's a tad pricey, so heads up!

So far, I've tried the chicken "sandwich"--it's in a gyro wrap, the parmesan fries and the potato salad. I liked the chicken sandwich and the fries the first time I visited this place. I went back shortly after because I went to a work get together there and I had the potato salad.The potato salad was really good and I'm not even vegetarian. You will have to like sweet potatoes though--if you don't like sweet potato, you will not like the salad. Besides the yummy sweet potatoes, their dressing is soo good, I will have to try to look of the recipe and make it myself because this place is far from where I live. There is also kale and pickled onions and other stuff. Their salad portion is big, you will leave full/ satisfied if you order one. A must try! I'll have to try the other salads next time. My mouth is watering!

I don't understand why this place is so popular. It's decent, but nothing special.  More importantly, it's a chain, and it feels like a chain. Logos on everything. So yeah, it's better than Applebee's but still, come on guys...
Yes. Yes. And more yes. 6 words. Chicken Salad with White Sweet Potato.  Don't forget the soft serve. Baklava for the win.

Twice I went with friends there after work. Both times I ordered garlic fries(to share) and lamb salad. Delicious but of too big a portion for me. The deco and ambiance are quite hipster-ish, though one time when my girl friend pushed a baby stroller in, the staff was very accommodating.

This place never disappoints. Super fast service, delicious food with responsibly sourced meats...can't beat it. I've even had them deliver to an event I hosted and the food was spot on. Great portion sizes too. I'll definitely continue to recommend this place.
Great place with quick and fast service. Ate here twice in my time in sf and enjoyed both very much
I eat here at a couple times a month. Vegetarian salad is bomb. Potatoes are ridiculously delicious. All Greek yogurts rock -- the olive oil one is particularly special.
Just visited few minz ago, I'm impressed, the have really delicious sandwiches. Definitely one of my favorites. I had a lamb sandwich. Well come back with friends for the chicken salad sooon
Great spot on Divisadero for a quick & healthy lunch. Little garden in the back, hidden gem!

Don't get me wrong, Souvla's food is great and the service is quick, friendly and attentive, but $12 for a medium sized gyro sandwich with sides anywhere from $4-6 is just crazy. The food is good, but its still just a gyro. I know its SF and they use premium ingredients but for me I don't see the value. If you're looking for a great meal in a trendy spot and are willing to spend $20+ for lunch this is a great option.
One of the best Greek restaurants in the city and the service is suuupeer fast! Highly recommended!

Love their wraps and salads. Their greek cherry soda drink is a nice small treat. We are repeat customers. They get busy and it can be hard to get a seat. Food is very fresh! The fries with what I think is mizithra cheese and yogurt mint dip is addicting!
Still my favorite place for a salad locally. I cycle between lamb and chicken. So good. Try the baklava frozen yogurt!

I wasn't super enamored with Souvla. I got the lamb gyro and Greek fries, along with the yogurt with baklava. The only thing I would eat again was the Greek yogurt with baklava. It was super yummy. The lamb gyro - was tough, and the lamb was cut into cubes (which I've never seen). Traditionally I thought it was shaved. I was just wishing for more flavor. The Greek fries were burnt, and super crispy. Not a fan. I'd come back for the yogurt with baklava though. Worth a stop if I'm nearby.
Amazing place for lunch. No waiting in line on a Friday early evening and the food came out within 7 mins. Service was great as well, thank you!
Wonderful salads! Superb rotisserie chicken, Nice setting indoors and especially outdoors

Souvla always offers savory, large meals with great Mediterranean flavors. We got lamb salads, chicken sandwiches, and the soup. The soup tasted a little strange - perhaps because the taste is really strong. One of the potato orders had so much oil that it was bit tough to eat. However, the restaurant is beautiful, service is great, and the food is definitely above average and pretty unique!
Incredible lamb and pork salad!! So fresh, so clean, and the same can be said for the design of the restaurant.
Food was great but they laughed in my face when I asked for a high chair for my 1yo.
Nice indoor/ outdoor environment. Good food, but nothing special. A good place to grab a beer and quality fast food.

I've loved Souvla's food since they opened their NOPA branch about a year ago. One of my fave neighborhood lunch spots.
