We decided to cater our summer backyard party over Labor Day with build your own chicken and lamb sandwiches or salads.  Yum, right? Well, the heat wave hit SF on Friday and two of the 3 Souvla walk ins fridges went down on Saturday. They had to close all 3 stores due to power outages and workers' heat exhaustion.  But Charles, Tony & Lauren still made our catering order happen - coming in especially to fulfill our order for 30 people. It was a smash hit! I would recommend using Souvla's catering - they are a great team to work with. Or just stop by and have a fantastic roasted meat salad or sandwich!!

Awesome place in every way! Delicious salads and pita sandwiches (chicken sandwich-yum! And the vegetarian salad is amazing!), cool atmosphere (love the open back patio!), friendly staff and super fast service. And if you're walking by and just want a snack, try their awesome  Greek Fro-Yo. Yum!!

Amazing. 
I went for quick lunch and their lamb sandwich was the best i've ever had. 
Just enough juice on lamb and the whole combination of inside ingredients were well balanced. Perfect for quick food, but not for sit down for a while Mediterranean since they only have salad or sandwich. there is outdoor sitting which i thought was really cute too. In general, restaurant has great and clean interior with amazing food.
I really like this place. It is super small, but the food is great. Not many options, but everything is great. Casual, quick meal.

I SO wanted to like this place.  Alas, while the decor (especially outside) makes for a nice time, the food disappoints and is overpriced.  Not real deal Greek or Mediterranean food.  Even the dessert (frozen yogurt with baklava or other toppings) was underwhelming.

Did you ever think you could actually love eating a salad? The chicken salad here are Souvla is just to die for, I never though a salad could be so satisfying. Everything here is fresh, delicious and unique. The perfect greek restaurant.

Awesome food, friendly staff and fast service! They only have one meatless option (roasted sweet potato) but it's so good that I'm OK with that. Also, you're playing yourself if you don't try the Greek frozen yogurt here.

Taste of Greece in SF. They have the best bowls. My favorite being the roasted chicken bowl with navel oranges, red onions, and mizithra cheese tossed with kale and lettuce. The staff is very welcoming and customer service is amazing. Make sure to also try their Greek yogurt with baklava and honey.

So happy they came to the neighborhood! Simple and good! I'm a vegetarian and I'm obsessed with the salads! (Wraps are worth a try too!) The Greek frozen yogurt is a must! You can order to-go or sit down in the trendy backyard. This location seems bigger than the Hayes valley one so you can eat inside and not fight for a table! Only downside is they are around the block, so I will be eating there way more than I should ;)

So happy this restaurant opened next to my apartment!  They've pretty much kept the same layout as Herbivore but opened up the back to outside patio seating which I absolutely love!  The items on the menu are simple but delicious and come in pretty big portions.  I've tried the lamb and chicken salads so far and man are they on POINT.  Expect a line but it goes by pretty fast and there plenty of seating - inside and out.  Can't wait to try the Greek yogurt!

Good for vegetarians. Went with a non vegetarian and they loved it. Cute seating inside and it is seat and order yourself. Has its own high traffic times but at that point we usually order to go. Sweet potato wrap it so good!
Go to healthy, high quality salad spot. And the froyo with olive and sea salt is the perfect indulgence.
I've been a fan of Souvla since when they first opened Hayes valley location. Fast but delish food, Divis one has a backyard to sit under the sun while stuffing my face with yummy lamb salad!

Yelped this place for lunch on my way home from a memorial service.  Had the lamb salad and is was absolutely delicious.  A little crowded but friendly - a couple let me share counter seating with them outside.  Great food.  Casual.  Inexpensive.  Check it out.
Great lunch spot! The salads are filling and the wine pours are heavy. The outdoor patio is a perfect spot for some fresh air as well.
They don't even have fucking Gyros! I thought this was a Greek restaurant, what the hell is going on?
LOVE the frozen greek yogurt with olive oil and salt

Amazing chicken salad and the potatoes cooked in the rotisserie chicken drippings were delicious. Super fast and quick, and very healthy food. You can order the actual rotisserie chicken to take home after 6pm.
I'll definitely be coming back to try the lamb and the pork - such an amazing find!

I hate to be a hater, but it was time for Herbivore to either have a major make over or move along. I guess the latter happened only to be replaced by this gem. I had their chicken salad and I can't say enough good things about it except the portion size may be a tad to large! j/k on the size, but this could easily be shared and paired with another dish-- the lamb sandwich (on flat bread) would be perfect. The beer in blue bottles is palatable but, after the uber-hoppy stuff you find around town these days, takes some time to get used to. it's tough to find a seat, so be creative and friendly and mosey on up to any available space-- I'm sure they'll understand. Only really bummer is I'm going to gain weight because of this place.

I got their vegetarian salad and it was so yummy and filling (bc of the generous amount of sweet potato they put in)! I loved the outdoor seating area. The only mehhh part about souvla is the price but it's worth it, I think :)

Chicken is so so so dry. Such a disappointment. The lamb looked good though. The frozen Greek yogurt was okay. The olive oil and salt is a cool topping, but the yogurt itself doesn't taste significantly different from tart frozen yogurt from any other froyo joint.

Don't understand the hype about this place and how it ended up on the top 100. Both pork and chicken were very dry and bland -- not sure how anyone can mess that up like that. Not a bargain by any means.  Better options down the street at 4505.  The salad was a slightly better option than the pita wrap which was a mess and really hard to eat. Pork was over-salted to boot. Definitely not going back but glad to check it off my list!
So filling, awesome proportions. Fries were standard. Struggled to finish my bowl. Menu is limited and wait is long
This place is all you have read about and more. My chicken salad was delicious and nourishing. The Greek yogurt was amazing!

I've tried the lamb and chichen dishes at two of their locations.    I really wanted to like the sandwiches,  but unfortunately they really aren't my cup of tea.  They were just ok.

   The pulled chicken sandwich had too much chicken.   I liked the orange and fennel but would like to see even more items inside the sandwich.  I definitely recommend checking them out since so many people like the food. 

 Also I tried their bottled Greek ice tea. Way too sweet for my taste since I prefer unsweetened ice tea.  Convenient locations, street parking.
Was looking for a healthy tasty meal and found it! Mary's free range chicken and lamb freshly roasted! Not a huge menu but if you are craving fresh, this is the place.

I don't understand the great reviews!  The Greek lemon soup was terrible. The rice was hard and the broth had no depth whatsoever. The fries were ok. The salad with chicken was very good. The wrap with chicken was the same chicken salad put in a wrap!  Cmon. Put some effort in your restaurant?  Lame restaurant. Very lazy menu in my opinion. I owned a restaurant for 25 years. This place has lazy owners. It could be so much better.

This place is awesome. Simple but tasty sandwiches with Greek taste. The menu is pretty limited what makes decision making easy. As well they have Mediterranean wines and beers. Also they have rozen Greek yogurt. Sometimes there is line at the entrance. If you want to avoid it I would recommend going during off hours. But this location is new so less crowded than Hayes one. Highly recommend this place. Food is excellent and the atmosphere is lively and casual.
This place rocks!! Love their chicken sandwich and baklava crumble frozen yogurt! Be patient, frequent long lines at peak hours.

So good!!  Love the setup, love the menu, love the food, love the outdoor space.  We went early in the night with our kid and there were lots of young families, though I'm sure the scene changes later.  The food was excellent and I'm looking forward to eating it again.  I had the chicken over salad and my husband had the lamb over salad.  Both great.  Our son had the chicken soup which was also very good.  The drinks are just OK, though the wine pours are generous so that helps!  Can't wait to go back and try the frozen Greek yogurt!

The salads are amazing, I usually get the chicken salad. The french fries are crispy  and also a crowd favorite when I have gone with friends. Decent amount to share between two people. And the best part is you can order your Greek yogurt dessert and bring your ticket back up to the cashier and they will make it for you when your ready.  There is usually a long line so, place your order for pick-up and they text  you when it's ready, you can walk right up to the front!

Quick good Greek food. We had the soup and a lamb sandwich. The soup base was so lemony and savory. So good! The atmosphere is really enjoyable with many seating options. We went outside and enjoyed the warmth of the heaters against the foggy coolness. Very neat and clean. Excellent option when you're touring the area and need a fast but good bite to eat.

Let's be real: the lamb tastes like my fellow Mexixans handled it in the kitchen -- not bad, totally edible, just not what I was expecting at a self-proclaimed Greek spot. Also, why are there no trash cans anywhere. Caters to one-note so-cal palette I think.

I was hungry but couldn't decide what to get and the friendly host recommended the chicken, which I ordered as a salad, along with 500ml of the Souvla Greek red wine. The service and portions were good and it was all delicious. Definitely recommend it and plan to go back to try more items.
So so good. Their chicken salad and juicy potatoes are my favorite. I can never get tired of eating there. The staff is friendly and the service is efficient
So stoked to come back for two days in a row. You can choose in a small but well-done menu. Proteins in the form of spit-fired very healthy chicken is so good! Go-to

I like this place a lot. The food is excellent, and if you suffer from menu option anxiety you will be glad to know that the menu is very limited. I've tried pretty much everything here since I live in the neighborhood, and have enjoyed it all. There is an outdoor area in the back that you can't see from the entryway. I took a star off because there is frequently a bottleneck throughout the entire length of the restaurant. I've had a hard time simply leaving after eating because of the crowd flow. Otherwise, delicious food and nice staff. Save room for soft serve!

After reading reviews order food through caviar. Food came 40 minutes late then expected time extremely cold and were missing 2 items out of 5. Ok let's forget that for a second. Veggie wrap was bland and my wife actually threw it away completely inedible. I had lamb and it was unseasoned and nothing close to what you call Mediterranean food. I had some of the best shawarma's in Bay Area & in NYC and this place falls way way below the expectation.
Fantastic! The chicken salad was absolutely perfect and unique. The chicken pita was juicy with every bite. Clean, friendly and trendy decor. Can't wait to try the Greek yogurt soft serve!

Eat here, its delicious. My boyfriend and I have it for dinner at least once a week. We usually get it delivered and it is always on our dinner table within 45 minutes of ordering. And we live all the way out in the Outer Sunset. The Chicken Salad and Pork Sandwich are my favorite things to get here. The fries are great as well, but its really all about their Granch Dressing. I could put it on everything.

I had the lamb sandwich and the lamb was so juicy and tender. Best cooked lamb I can't wait to try the other meats. The flavor was so good it's no surprise why the place gets crowded in the evenings! I didn't have room for the frozen yogurt because the portions are well worth the price but I will be back to try it!!
This is a great place any night of the week. The food is good and reasonably priced, the staff is incredibly friendly, and the fro-yo is out of this world.

Ate here for the first time. Very clean restaurant, minimal decor, narrow space with different types of seating. Order food at the counter they give you a number and bring food quickly. I had the Greek soup lemony, shredded chicken with rice. Very good, flavors all worked well together. Also ate the vegetarian salad with kale, romaine, walnuts, good dressing. Had a Greek cheese shredded not feta. It was good too. For dessert we had Greek yogurt sundae. The flavor of the yogurt was very tangy, quite nice. It had crumbled baklava, I did not like that. Food was reasonably priced, soup $6, salad $11. If I was in that area again I would like to try other things on the menu.
I LOVE SOUVLA- consistently excellent every time. My favorite location is Divisadero, just due to seating layout and outdoor space.
Probably one of my favorite spots to hit up for lunch. I am super particular about eating out, but this place passes the test.

Lamb is halal with verbal assurance from staff!!!! Salad was very filling, and lamb was tender. Fries with the sauces were good too. Only downside is that it's a little on the pricier side, but definitely would recommend this place!

After eating Souvla Divisadero food twice, I am afraid I cannot think of a single reason not to give them five stars. Great pork; super avgolemono; wonderful sauces and fries...all reasonable! The simple menu and the fact that they are steps from my front door doesn't hurt...love the new location!

This is one of my favorite places in SF. They have an inside room, which is under the sky and surrounded with trees, I would recommend seating there. The menu here is very simple, they have something like 10 choices. Salads are very big, they have also a tasty soup, but I especially like the burritos of lamb here. The prices are a little high, but it worth it.

So excited to have Souvla open up on divis! Everything here is amazing and the staff is always friendly and attentive. It's bigger than the first location and has a beautiful back patio just in time for summer. My favorites are the kale chicken salad, Greek fries and of course the frozen Greek yogurt ! The food is just as good as the first location.

Cute little spot perfect for a yummy lunch date. It was just what my friend and I were looking for as we were exploring the area. The salads were delicious and the fries were great too! We sat in the outside area that was so adorable!!

I'm Greek and it passes my test  They have definitely put a modern twist on souvlaki/gyro which I love and the option to have it in a pita or a salad is brilliant. They also don't short you on wine when you order a glass - it is a generous full glass. The French fries are great and the potatoes are spot on although they could stand to add some lemon. The soft serve yogurt with honey, baklava or sour cherry is BOMB and a light refreshing dessert to end your meal. It's fast too. You order at the counter and get your meal within 5 minutes. I've been twice now and have not been disappointed. Yassou!
Lovely Food! Veg sandwich, Greek Fries, harvest salad, and yogurt with sour cherry sauce we all fantastic!
My favorite location. Not to busy like other locations. Modern Greek food, garlic French fries - must try. Chicken salad bowl very tasty, has bunch of protein. Great for a lunch or dinner.

SO GOOD! My food came out so fast! Cozy and chic place. I got the Pork Sandwich which was really good and had a lot of meat but a little to much feta! You HAVE to get the frozen yogurt! It is super tart and fresh and I got mine with Baklava and I LOVED IT! Good staff and decent pricing! I recommend the divisadero location as well. Lots of parking and I came on a Saturday night!

Holy moly I cannot describe how greasy this food is. My friend ordered the chicken wrap and I got the pork wrap - expecting and wanting healthy eats. The grease and oil POURED out of my wrap - into a puddle on my tray, a puddle on my leg, and a puddle in my hair. My friend ended up with an oil spill on his tray. For this amount of money, I would rather deep fry myself at home for $2.
Great atmosphere. Delicious food. Make sure to get the frozen Greek yogurt. There's usually a small line during peak hours but it goes quickly and the staff are helpful and friendly.
It tastes (and feels) as if I was getting my lamb salad and frozen yoghurt in Greece by the Mediterranean!

We ordered one pork gyro and one lamb, and they were both awesome. Great portion sizes, and those pickled red onions are to die for! The baklava frozen Greek yogurt is not to be missed! The Greek fries with garlic dipping sauce were also super yummy. Definitely coming back soon to enjoy this yummy spread on that cozy, heated back patio.

I don't want to give it 5 stars, because I don't want the line to get longer.

It is really the best, small simple menu, fresh ingredients, quality food. Great go to. Can't go wrong with Chicken, Lamb, or Pork. Salads are the best.

Try it, you won't be disappointed!
I am from DC and was told about this place. Had it delivered.  Wow the chicken sandwich was the best I have EVER had.!!  And the spices on the French fries was the icing on the cake

Souvla makes delicious food and takes care to emphasize local organic ingredients in their dishes.  I love the veggie salad which is made with japanese sweet potatoes, organic romaine and kale, and topped with a creamy garlic-y dressing made with local organic dairy.  Learn more about Souvla's tasty dishes and ingredients at curiouseater.io/restaura…

Inconsistent. I've had amazing food from here, and I've also had very mediocre food. However, lately it's been trending more towards mediocre/poor. Used to always get wraps, and over the past few months started getting the whole rotisserie chickens. The chickens were fantastic for the first five I got. The last four have been either dried out, burned, the last one I had was bloody. As far as the wraps go the meat is so inconsistent, but as of late just dried out, smaller portions. Sometimes you get harissa yogurt, sometimes you don't. Sometimes the meat is moist, sometimes it's just swimming in a boatload of oil. I truly just think they've expanded too rapidly and they don't have enough oversight in the kitchens when they get busy. It's just guys literally throwing things together without any care or consideration for the final product. I normally don't review, but after spending 30+ dollars on two wraps that were skimpy on everything, and the meat was completely dried out, I can't justify returning. Truly disappointing because I used to love the place, however every time I go in now it's a gamble whether you get a good product or not. Never really write reviews and I work in the industry but just had to express my displeasure. I have even mentioned the inconsistency issues with the chef, and he seemed very concerned. However being concerned is one thing, and actually practicing what you preach is another. I'm sure they will continue to be incredibly successful because most people don't really care, but you should save your money and go elsewhere. For the same money you can get amazing food from ragazza or namu stonepot. Also just realized my lamb sandwich didn't even have any of the pickled onions on it last night, there's like five ingredients in the sandwich. The fact that they're missing one of them is a pretty big mistake. I hope they can get their act together and maybe I'll try it again in the future.
Close walk from the park, good atmosphere and food. Small place but cool back eating area outside for a nice day.

I ordered take out for my family and overall we were all very pleased with the food but wouldn't recommend the Veg sandwich. One concern is that I ordered and paid for a side that I didn't receive and there is essentially no way to contact them to notify them of the mistake in order to receive a refund (unless I went all the way back to the location, which isn't ideal for anyone). Otherwise I highly recommend the lamb sandwich!
This place has a nice patio in the front and back which is perfect on a sunny day. Everything is good but the lamb salad is a standout!

Overrated.  The food is dry.  We ordered 3 meals, no drinks, including extra sauces on Caviar. The bill was $95.  We got a follow up email indicating that they would have to charge us an additional $1 plus fees because there was a special request for "extra sauce" on a sandwich.
I've had the chicken and lamb sandwiches.  Meat is well seasoned and cooked, not over done.  The fries are good too.
The gyros are the best ever!  Love the back patio.  This is one of my favorite spots in San Francisco!
Amazing salads. The vegetarian salad with sweet potato maybe one of the best salads I have ever had. The olives gave it the right amount of zest, better than vinegar. Awesome!
Delicious and healthy! The chicken and potatoes are super flavorful and the fries are awesome too!

This is delicious simple Greek food. It has an easy menu (e.g. salad or pita with meat or veg options) and is incredibly affordable! The ambience is lovely with tables in the back outside too - it's especially nice considering it's an inexpensive place but there is always a long line so it can be hard to get a table. Of course, tart yogurt soft serve is also delicious there
Souvla is one of my go tos in the city. I love the simple menu and freshness of the food. Their chicken is my favorite.
I go for the salt and olive oil yogurt, delicious!

Souvla is hot fire. Come here and eat away the calories you just burned at soul cycle. Only here can you feel trendy and shove a fat chicken/veggie/lamb pita in your mouth with hot sauce dropping down your face but your loving every minute of it. The fries are scrumcious and the wine is on point.

My husband and I are obsessed with Souvla - the food, simple menu and atmosphere! We drive an hour from the East Bay just to satisfy our cravings! We love the chicken salad and lamb sandwich. We usually order a side of the roasted sweet potato to share. Wish there was a location in the East Bay! We'd be there all the time.

Nice atmosphere along with a cute patio area in the back. I got a chicken pita for lunch and overall was not impressed. The chicken was very tough, almost impossible to chew. My sandwich was dry after just the second bite. I felt they probably used yesterday's meat in my sandwich. Vegetables in the sandwich were of good quality but was mainly disappointed in the quality of the meat.
Souvla always does a great job, they've mastered their limited menu; so everything tastes great.

Oh Souvla, I really want to love you.  I absolutely love Greek cuisine and healthy food to boot so this should be my dream match .  However after several visits, I am still not thrilled.  I tried the veggie salad and pork salad 2 times AND the lamb sandwich. I chalk this up to the fact that I really do not like overwhelming amounts of fat in my meat, which I think some people do.  This isn't a sarcastic comment - I know people do.  I even read another comment which talked about how they LOVE the fattiness of the pork.  I, however, prefer actual meat. Further, the prices are a bit steep.  Tonight I ordered a salad for me, sandwich for my husband and side of fries and it was $35.  Yikes.  That said, because I really want to love it....I think I will give it one more try and try the chicken.  I do love the frozen yogurt and they give you a big portion with yummmmmy olive oil and salt.
Yummy lamb sandwich and frozen yogurt with backlava crumbs!  Backyard patio is great.

YASS Souvla- I praise their delicious salads and frozen yogurt. Even though I am a meat lover, their vegetarian salad is my absolutely favorite. It's a great bang for your buck because the left overs can serve as a snack or an extra meal. All fresh ingredients, all served consistently. Also, the frozen yogurt with wildflower honey is a delight.

the salads here are always good but the quality of the meat is really hit or miss ... for what they charge they need to improve their consistency and pay more attention to the spit fired meat that is their claim to fame.
Everything was delicious, we had the pork and the lamb sandwich (real Gyros), with fries and for dessert the yogurt with baklava soooo yummy

I came here for the first time and it was just the perfect spot for an easy, hearty, and wholesome meal. The menu is simple which makes it super easy to decide. I loved the vegetarian option in a salad. It was so good and filling! I will definitely return.
The best salad in SF. The meats are delicious and fresh off the rotisserie. Juicy potatoes are super flavorful. Amazing French fries and soup. Highly recommend Souvla!

Bummed. I've always loved this place. I used to always go to the one in Hayes Valley when it first opened up a few years ago. I've moved closer to the Nopa location, so I walked over and ordered the Chicken Salad (my favorite!) to go. 
They brought me my order promptly... they were about to close, so I'm guessing he kitchen was working hard to get orders out quick. I do appreciate the speedy turnaround, and said so to the guy who delivered my food. But when I looked down at the box, and it was marked "lamb sandwich"... so I stopped the guy who gave it to me and told him I thought it was the wrong order. He told me, "no, that's a chicken salad, we just reused the box." Um, okay? The box honestly looked a little dinged up, and in hindsight, I wish I'd asked for a fresh one. But, I took out my reuse-able bag and charged onward. 
I think they've changed their recipe for the yogurt dressing to be less yogurt and more olive oil. By the time I got to eat my salad, it tasted far more bland than I remember... of course, that may be because by the time I'd walked the few blocks back home, the gently used box had come apart at the seams and my dinner was pouring out of the box into a pool of olive oil in my bag. 
The whole experience was disappointing. I used to really like that place. Please don't cut corners on that delicious yogurt dressing. Please only use boxes once. 
I'm still giving 2 stars bc I like that they use organic chicken. (They still do, right?)

Awesome food but please tell us up front, literally up front, when the entire back patio is reserved on a Friday night. It's a bit uncool to let your customers wait in a long line to order to then learn that there is no seating out back. Or inside for that matter.

Bam! So spot on. Pork sandwich, salad with chicken, french fries--everything was hot, fast, and flawless. New space is beautiful. Grab a seat on the outdoor patio in the back if you can! Don't forget to save room for some greek fro yo.

A girlfriend took me here for the first time and I have gone back several times since. They have some of the best salads I've eaten in a while. Their chicken is so flavorful!  The menu is pretty simple and straight forward-I really appreciate that. A great space and clean atmosphere. 

One of their best asset is Joe I must say!! I was in a rush to pick up a whole chicken (can pick up after 6pm only!) I ordered that morning and had parked illegally. After walking in and seeing a line of people waiting to order, I cringed.  As I passed the line to the pick up area, I spotted Joe and he helped me right away. The chicken was not quite ready but Joe offered to call me when it was ready, cared that I can get a parking ticket, and eventually just brought it out to my car. Even asked if I needed help getting out of the tight parking job I was in! Now I don't expect this above and beyond service from anywhere but when you get it and in times when it counts, man it feels great-I just have to give him a shout out!! Thanks JOE!!! You made my day with your wonderful service and just being an awesome person! Management-you need to keep this guy and give him a raise! This type of staff is what sets you guys apart from other good spots in town.

Lamb was either over cooked or served with big chunks of fat....neither being very desirable. This was not the case when this location first opened. The yogurt however is amazing but not sure I'd try the lamb again. Last time I had the chicken sandwich which was good but a little bland for my taste.

Both here and the Hayes valley location offer a simple and delicious take on Mediterranean sandwiches and salads. It tastes like every ingredient and sauce has been home made and apportioned just right. They have a simple menu, reas I've had the chicken salad and pork knuckle sandwich and loved them both.

dropped in for a snack -- yogurt with olive oil and sea salt, recommended by family member. So interesting. I plan to go back for a meal next time I'm in San Fran.  Also really liked the airy uncluttered and bright interior.
Incredible food! Healthy and light but very satisfying. One of my new favorite spots. Recommend getting there a bit early before the lunch crowd.

So glad they have opened on Divisadero. Half the distance as the Hayes spot. The menu is the same but the dining and ordering space is much improved. There are many table options including both front and back patios. Will be here weekly. They occupy the space formerly of Herbivore, but won't mention what closed then down, since this place looks so clean and new :).

Happy that the new location opened up on Divis. Went to check it out recently and was struck by how much roomier it is than the Hayes location. Nice outdoor seating area both in front on the sidewalk as well as in the back patio (although it was closed when we went because they were installing heat lamps). The inside has some large communal tables in the front and some 4-person high tops along a narrow hallway towards the back. Menu is more or less the same as the Hayes place. Try the lamb wrap, fries and garlicky Greek yogurt dressing. And don't forget the Greek froyo for dessert! My only complaint is that we (a group of 4) had to stand around for 10-15 minutes waiting for a table after placing our order, and there were several groups of 2 lingering at the 4-person tables long after their plates had been cleared. On the flip side, service is fast - our orders were ready while we were still standing and waiting for a table! In short, I'd definitely come back here for a date night or get-together with friends, although I might come at an off-hour to avoid the dinner rush.
Sin dudas, el mejor sandwich de cordero ! Una muy grata sorpresa el frozen yogurt con miel de sauco!
